B_2_C_1_0
BEGIN_
गच्छता मातुलकुलं भरतेन तदाऽनघः |
शत्रुघ्नो नित्यशत्रुघ्नो नीतः प्रीतिपुरस्कृतः || २-१-१_END
BEGIN_
Bharatha, while going to his maternal uncle's house, has taken his brother Satrughna
(he who has no sins and who annihilates his enemies) along with him with love._END

B_2_C_1_1
BEGIN_
स तत्र न्यवसद्भ्रात्रा सह सत्कारसत्कृतः |
मातुलेनाश्वपतिना पुत्रस्नेहेन लालितः || २-१-२_END
BEGIN_
Treated with good hospitality and paternal love by his maternal uncle, Yudhajit, who
was a lord of cavalry, Bharatha stayed with his brother there._END

B_2_C_1_2
BEGIN_
तत्रापि निवसन्तौ तौ तर्प्यमाणौ च कामतः |
भ्रातरौ स्मरतां वीरौ वृद्धं दशरथं नृपम् || २-१-३_END
BEGIN_
Those heroes of valour Bharatha and Satrughna, though staying there enjoying all the
comforts, were remembering their age old father._END

B_2_C_1_3
BEGIN_
राजापि तौ महातेजाः सस्मार प्रोषितौ सुतौ |
उभौ भरतशत्रुघ्नौ महेन्द्रवरुणोपमौ || २-१-४_END
BEGIN_
The mighty Dasaratha was also often remembering his sons Bharatha and Satrughna who
were out of his state and who were equivalent to Indra and Varuna._END

B_2_C_1_4
BEGIN_
सर्व एव तु तस्येष्टाश्चत्वारः पुरुषर्षभाः |
स्वशरीराद्विनिर्वृत्ताश्चत्वार इव बाहवः || २-१-५_END
BEGIN_
Dasaratha was bestowing his equal love to all his four sons who were best among men,
as though they were his four hands emerging out of his own body._END

B_2_C_1_5
BEGIN_
तेषामपि महातेजा रामो रतिकरः पितुः |
स्वयम्भूरिव भूतानां बभूव गुणवत्तरः || २-१-६_END
BEGIN_
Rama, like the Brahma among all the living beings, the most virtuous among those
brothers and the mightiest was a great source of joy for his father._END

B_2_C_2_0
BEGIN_
ततः परिषदं सर्वामामन्त्र्य वसुधाधिपः |
हितमुद्धर्षणं चैवमुवाच प्रथितं वचः || २-२-१_END
BEGIN_
Addressing invited gathering in the court, Dasaratha spoke in friendly, pleasing and
clear terms._END

B_2_C_1_6
BEGIN_
स हि देवैरुदीर्णस्य रावणस्य वधार्थिभिः |
अर्थितो मानुषे लोके जज्ञे विष्णुः सनातनः || २-१-७_END
BEGIN_
That Rama - was He not the eternal Vishnu who was born on earth as prayed by
celestials to kill the egoistic Ravana?_END

B_2_C_2_1
BEGIN_
दुन्धुभिस्वनकल्पेन गम्भीरेणानुनादिना |
स्वरेण महता राजा जीमूत इव नादयन् || २-२-२
राजलक्षणयुक्तेन कान्तेनानुपमेन च |
उवाच रसयुक्तेन स्वरेण नृपतिर्नृपान् || २-२-३_END
BEGIN_
In a loud voice resembling that of a kettle-drum, resounding the air like a
thundering cloud and in a sweet splendid and incomparable voice endowed with the characteristics of
a king's voice, King Dasaratha the lord of men spoke to the kings as follows:_END

B_2_C_1_7
BEGIN_
कौसल्या शुशुभे तेन पुत्रेणामिततेजसा |
यथा वरेण देवानामदितिर्वज्रपाणिना || २-१-८_END
BEGIN_
Like Adithi by Indra, best among the celestials, Kausalya shone by her son Rama, the
mighty._END

B_2_C_2_2
BEGIN_
विदितं भवतामेतद्यथा मे राज्यमुत्तमम् |
पूर्वकैर्मम राजेन्द्रैस्सुतवत् परिपालितम् || २-२-४_END
BEGIN_
"It is well known that my excellent kingdom was ruled by my ancestral kings as if it
were their son."_END

B_2_C_1_8
BEGIN_
स हि रूपोपपन्नश्च वीर्यवाननसूयकः |
भूमावनुपमः सूनुर्गुणैर्दशरथोपमः || २-१-९_END
BEGIN_
Rama was beautiful in form, a hero of valor and without envy. By virtues, he was
like Dasaratha. In this way, he was an incomparable son on earth._END

B_2_C_2_3
BEGIN_
सोऽहमिक्ष्ह्वाकुभिः सर्वैर्नरेन्द्रैः परिपालितम् |
श्रेयसा योक्तुकामोऽस्मि सुखार्हमखिलं जगत् || २-२-५_END
BEGIN_
"I have a desire that this entire land which was protected by the descendents of
Ikshvaaku dynasty, be bestowed with goodness and the resultant happiness."_END

B_2_C_1_9
BEGIN_
स च नित्यं प्रशान्तात्मा मृदुपूर्वं तु भाषते |
उच्यमानोऽपि परुषं नोत्तरं प्रतिपद्यते || २-१-१०_END
BEGIN_
That Rama was always peaceful in mind and spoke softly. He did not react even to the hard
words spoken by others._END

B_2_C_2_4
BEGIN_
मयाप्याचरितं पूर्वैः पन्थानमनुगच्छता |
प्रजा नित्यमनिद्रेण यथाशक्त्यभिरक्षिताः || २-२-६_END
BEGIN_
"Following the path established by my ancestors, I have always protected my people
with alertness and to the best of my ability."_END

B_2_C_1_10
BEGIN_
कथञ्चिदुपकारेण कृतेनैकेन तुष्यति |
न स्मरत्यपकाराणां शतमप्यात्मवत्तया || २-१-११_END
BEGIN_
That Rama, because of his good bent of mind, feels glad even by whatever way a good
thing is done to him. He does not remember any number of bad things done to him._END

B_2_C_2_5
BEGIN_
इदं शरीरं कृत्स्नस्य लोकस्य चरता हितम् |
पाण्डुरस्यातपत्रस्य च्छायायां जरितं मया || २-२-७_END
BEGIN_
"In conducting the kingdom for benefit of the entire people, my body became impaired
under shade of the white umbrella."_END

B_2_C_1_11
BEGIN_
शीलवृद्धैर्ज्ञानवृद्धैर्वयोवृद्धैश्च सज्जनैः |
कथयन्नास्त वै नित्यमस्त्रयोग्यान्तरेष्वपि || २-१-१२_END
BEGIN_
Whenever he finds some time even while practising archery, Rama used to converse
with elderly people, elder by way of conduct or wisdom or age or with good- natured people._END

B_2_C_2_6
BEGIN_
प्राप्य वर्षसहस्राणि बहू न्यायूंषि जीवतः |
जीर्णस्यास्य शरीरस्य विश्रान्ति मभिरोचये || २-२-८_END
BEGIN_
"This body has been living for many thousands of years. Hence I desire rest."_END

B_2_C_1_12
BEGIN_
बुद्धिमान्मधुराभाषी पूर्वभाषी प्रियंवदः |
वीर्यवान्न च वीर्येण महता स्वेन विस्मितः || २-१-१३_END
BEGIN_
Rama was a wise man. He used to speak sweetly. He was the first man to initiate a
talk. His speech was compassionate. He was valorous. But he was not arrogant of his mighty
valor._END

B_2_C_2_7
BEGIN_
राजप्रभावजुष्टां हि दुर्वहामजितेन्द्रियैः |
परिश्रान्तोऽस्मि लोकस्य गुर्वीं धर्मधुरं वहन् || २-२-९_END
BEGIN_
"This burden of worldly righteousness is very heavy. This can be sustained only by
royal power with qualities like courage and valor. A person who has no control of senses can not
carry this burden. I have become tired while carrying this burden of righteousness. "_END

B_2_C_1_13
BEGIN_
न चानृतकथो विद्वान् वृद्धानां प्रतिपूजकः |
अनुरक्तः प्रजाभिश्च प्रजाश्चाप्यनुरज्यते || २-१-१४_END
BEGIN_
He did not speak untruth. He was all knowing. He used to be receptive and worshipful
to the elders. People used to love him and he used to love the people._END

B_2_C_2_8
BEGIN_
सोऽहं विश्रममिच्छामि पुत्रं कृत्वा प्रजाहिते |
सन्निकृष्टानिमान् सर्वाननुमान्य द्विजर्षभान् || २-२-१०_END
BEGIN_
"I desire to take rest, entrusting the rule to my son for the benefit of the people,
after obtaining consent from all those best Brahmans who are close to me."_END

B_2_C_3_0
BEGIN_
तेषामञ्जलिपद्मानि प्रगृहीतानि सर्वशः |
प्रतिगृह्याब्रवीद्राजा तेभ्यः प्रियहितं वचः || २-३-१_END
BEGIN_
King Dasaratha, accepted their salutations with folded hands resembling lotus buds
and spoke good and agreeable words to them as follows:-_END

B_2_C_1_14
BEGIN_
सानुक्रोशो जितक्रोधो ब्राह्मणप्रतिपूजकः |
दीनानुकम्पी धर्मज्ञो नित्यं प्रग्रहवाञ्शुचिः || २-१-१५_END
BEGIN_
He had compassion. He conquered anger. He used to be receptive and worshipful to the
wise. He had mercy towards the meek. He knew what was to be done. He had always self-control. He
was clean (in conduct)._END

B_2_C_2_9
BEGIN_
अनुजातो हि मां सर्वैर्गुणैर्ज्येष्ठो ममात्मजः |
पुरन्दरसमो वीर्ये रामः परपुरंजयः || २-२-११_END
BEGIN_
"My eldest son Rama is equal to Devendra in valor. He is the conqueror of cities of
enemies. He is equal to me in all qualities."_END

B_2_C_3_1
BEGIN_
अहोऽस्मि परमप्रीतः प्रभावश्चातुलो मम |
यन्मे ज्येष्ठं प्रियं पुत्रं यौवराज्यस्थ मिच्छथ || २-३-२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh! I am very much pleased and incomparable is my fortune in that you desire my
beloved elder son to be anointed as prince. "_END

B_2_C_1_15
BEGIN_
कुलोचितमतिः क्षात्रं धर्मं स्वं बहुमन्यते |
मन्यते परया कीर्त्या महत्स्वर्गफलं ततः || २-१-१६_END
BEGIN_
That Rama, having an attitude suitable for his social rank, giving due respect to
righteousness of warrior-class, believed that by following the righteousness he would attain great
fame and through it the fruit of heaven._END

B_2_C_2_10
BEGIN_
तं चन्द्रमिव पुष्येण युक्तं धर्मभृतां वरम् |
यौवराज्ये नियोक्तास्मि प्रीतः पुरुषपुंगवम् || २-२-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Joyfully, I shall appoint Rama, who shines like the moon together with Pushya star,
who is the best among the protectors of righteousness and who is an excellent man, to the realm of
prince."_END

B_2_C_3_2
BEGIN_
इति प्रत्यर्च्य तान् राजा ब्राह्मणानिद मब्रवीत् |
वसिष्ठं वामदेवं च तेषामेवोपशृण्वताम् || २-३-३_END
BEGIN_
King Dasaratha, thus duly returning the honor done by them, spoke while they were
listening, to Vasishta, Vamadeva and other Brahmans as follows:_END

B_2_C_1_16
BEGIN_
नाश्रेयसि रतो विद्वान्न विरुद्धकथारुचिः |
उत्तरोत्तरयुक्तीनां वक्ता वाचस्पतिर्यथा || २-१-१७_END
BEGIN_
Rama was not interested in actions, which were not beneficial. He was a scholar. He
had no taste in tales opposing righteousness. Like vachaspathi, his eloquent speech contained a
series of strategies for action._END

B_2_C_2_11
BEGIN_
अनुरूपः स वै नाथो लक्ष्मीवान् लक्ष्मणाग्रजः |
त्रैलोक्यमपि नाथेन येन स्यान्नाथवत्तरम् || २-२-१३_END
BEGIN_
"If Rama becomes the lord, the three worlds also will have the best master. He is a
glorious man. That Rama is the only fittest lord for the kingdom."_END

B_2_C_3_3
BEGIN_
चैत्रः श्रीमानयं मासः पुण्यः पुष्पितकाननः |
यौवराज्याय रामस्य सर्वमेवोपकल्प्यताम् || २-३-४
राज्ञस्तूपरते वाक्ये जनघोषो महानभूत् |_END
BEGIN_
"This is the glorious and auspicious month of Chaitra, in which the forests bloom
with flowers. Let all arrangements be made for the coronation of Rama as prince." While these words
of the king were being completed, there was a great delightful uproar of the people._END

B_2_C_1_17
BEGIN_
अरोगस्तरुणो वाग्मी वपुष्मान्देशकालवित् |
लोके पुरुषसारज्ञस्साधुरेको विनिर्मितः || २-१-१८_END
BEGIN_
Rama was a young man without any disease. He was a good speaker. He had a good body.
He knew both time and place. He could grasp the essence of men. He was the one gentleman born on
earth._END

B_2_C_2_12
BEGIN_
अनेन श्रेयसा सद्यः संयोक्ष्येऽहमिमां महीम् |
गतक्लेशो भविष्यामि सुते तस्मिन्निवेश्य वै || २-२-१४_END
BEGIN_
"By entrusting this kingdom to Rama, I shall be thus doing an immediate good and
shall be devoid of difficulties."_END

B_2_C_3_4
BEGIN_
शनैस्तस्मिन् प्रशान्ते च जनघोषे जनाधिपः || २-३-५
वसिष्ठं मुनिशार्दूलं राजा वचनमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
When their applause gradually subsided, King Dasaratha spoke the following words to
the best of sages, Vasishta._END

B_2_C_1_18
BEGIN_
स तु श्रेष्ठैर्गुणैर्युक्तः प्रजानां पार्थिवात्मजः |
बहिश्चर इव प्राणो बभूव गुणतः प्रियः || २-१-१९_END
BEGIN_
People loved the virtuous prince Rama and treated him as their spirit moving
outside._END

B_2_C_2_13
BEGIN_
यदीदम् मेऽनुरुपार्थं मया साधु सुमन्त्रितम् |
भवन्तो मेऽनुमन्यन्तां कथं वा करवाण्यहम् || २-२-१५_END
BEGIN_
"I am telling this after lot of thinking. Give consent to me if you feel this to be
good and befitting. How else shall I do it?"_END

B_2_C_3_5
BEGIN_
अभिषेकाय रामस्य यत्कर्म सपरिच्छदम् || २-३-६
तदद्य भगवन् सर्वमाज्ञापयितु मर्हसि |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh Divine Vasishta! Be pleased to order now for the traditional ceremonial that is
to be done and various accessories needed for the anointing ceremony of Rama."_END

B_2_C_1_19
BEGIN_
सम्यग्विद्याव्रतस्नातो यथावत्साङ्गवेदवित् |
इष्वस्त्रे च पितुः श्रेष्ठो बभूव भरताग्रजः || २-१-२०_END
BEGIN_
After completing his education properly, Rama, after knowing the veda along with vedanga-s
as prescribed, became better than his father in the use of bow and arrows._END

B_2_C_2_14
BEGIN_
यद्यप्येषा मम प्रीतिर्हितमन्यद्विचिन्त्यताम् |
अन्या मद्यस्थचिन्ता हि विमर्दाभ्यधिकोदया || २-२-१६_END
BEGIN_
"This is my desire. Yet, let there be thinking on any other beneficial way. Thinking
by impartial neutral people will be distinctive and well developed through grinding of opposing
views."_END

B_2_C_3_6
BEGIN_
तच्छ्रुत्वा भूमिपालस्य वसिष्ठो द्विजसत्तमः || २-३-७
आदिदेशाग्रतो राज्ञः स्थितान् युक्तान् कृताञ्जलीन् |_END
BEGIN_
Vasishta, the best of Brahmans, hearing the words of king Dasaratha, ordered the
officers who stood there with folded hands before the king, as follows: -_END

B_2_C_1_20
BEGIN_
कल्याणाभिजनः साधुरदीनः सत्यवागृजुः |
वृद्धैरभिविनीतश्च द्विजैर्धर्मार्थदर्शिभिः || २-१-२१_END
BEGIN_
Rama, having born in a good clan, was gentle minded. He was not feeble. He spoke
truth. He was straightforward. He was properly trained by elderly brahmana-s those who knew
righteousness._END

B_2_C_2_15
BEGIN_
इति ब्रुवन्तं मुदिताः प्रत्यनन्दन् नृपा नृपम् |
वृष्टिमन्तं महामेघं नर्दन्त इव बर्हिणः || २-२-१७_END
BEGIN_
Those delighted kings complimented king Dasaratha so speaking with a loud applause
as the peacocks cry in delight when they see the raining great cloud._END

B_2_C_3_7
BEGIN_
सुवर्णादीनि रत्नानि बलीन् सर्वौषधीरपि || २-३-८
शुक्लमाल्यांश्च लाजांश्च पृथक्च मधुसर्पिषी |
अहतानि च वासांसि रथं सर्वायुधान्यपि || २-३-९
चतुरङ्गबलं चैव गजं च शुभलक्षणम् |
चामरव्यजने श्वेते ध्वजं छत्रं च पाण्डुरम् || २-३-१०
शतं च शातकुम्भानां कुम्भानामग्निवर्चसाम् |
हिरण्यशृङ्गमृषभं समग्रं व्याघ्रचर्म च || २-३-११
उपस्थापयत प्रातरग्न्यगारं महीपतेः |_END
BEGIN_
"Gather the following in the sacred fire house of the king at dawn: gold and the
like, diamonds, things needed to perform worship, various herbs, white floral garlands, corn, honey
and clarified butter in separate vessels, new clothes, chariot, all weapons, the four divisions of
army, an elephant with auspicious signs, white fan, flag staff, white umbrella, one hundred golden
pots with brilliant shine, bull with gilded horns and a complete tiger skin"._END

B_2_C_1_21
BEGIN_
धर्मकामार्थतत्त्वज्ञः स्मृतिमान्प्रतिभानवान् |
लौकिके समयाचारे कृतकल्पो विशारदः || २-१-२२_END
BEGIN_
Rama knew the real form of desire, wealth and righteousness. He had a good memory
power. He had a spontaneous wisdom. He had skills in arranging customs useful to society prevalent
at that time._END

B_2_C_2_16
BEGIN_
स्निग्धोऽनुनादी संजज्ञे तत्र हर्षसमीरितः |
जनौघोद्घुष्टसन्नादो विमानं कम्पयन्निव || २-२-१८_END
BEGIN_
That building appeared trembling by the sweet and reverberating sound made by the
gathering of people there with their fond uproar._END

B_2_C_3_8
BEGIN_
यच्चान्यत्किञ्चिदेष्टव्यं तत्सर्वमुपकल्प्यताम् | २-३-१२
अस्तःपुरस्य द्वाराणि सर्वस्य नगरस्य च |
चन्दनस्रग्भिरर्च्यन्तां धूपैश्च घ्राणहारिभिः || २-३-१३_END
BEGIN_
"If any other small things are required, arrange for all of them. Let the doorways
of the royal palace and those of the entire city be worshipped with sandalwood paste, floral
garlands and good smelling incense."_END

B_2_C_1_22
BEGIN_
निभृतः संवृताकारो गुप्तमन्त्रः सहायवान् |
अमोघक्रोधहर्षश्च त्यागसंयमकालवित् || २-१-२३_END
BEGIN_
Rama was humble. He did not let his feelings appear outwardly. He kept his thoughts
to himself. He helped others. His anger and pleasure were not wasteful. He knew when to give and
when not to give._END

B_2_C_2_17
BEGIN_
तस्य धर्मार्थविदुषो भावमाज्ञाय सर्वशः |
ब्राह्मणा जनमुख्याश्च पौरजानपदैः सह || २-२-१९
समेत्य मन्त्रयित्वा तु समतागतबुद्धयः |
ऊचुश्च मनसा ज्ञात्वा वृद्धं दशरथं नृपम् || २-२-२०_END
BEGIN_
After understanding the opinion of King Dasaratha, who knew the holy and worldly
matters, the Brahmans, important people, urban and rural citizens came to a consensus after
discussing together and told the aged king as follows._END

B_2_C_4_0
BEGIN_
गतेष्वथ नृपो भूयः पौरेषु सह मन्त्रिभिः |
मन्त्रयुत्वा ततश्चक्रे निश्चयज्ञः स निश्चयम् || २-४-१
श्व एव पुष्यो भविता श्वोऽभिषेच्यस्तु मे सुतः |
रामो राजीवताम्राक्षो यौवराज्य इति प्रभुः || २-४-२_END
BEGIN_
After the citizens left, Dasaratha who was efficient in taking decisions pertaining
to place and time of ceremonies, again conferred with the ministers and decided thus: "Tomorrow
will be a day when the constellation of Pushya would be in the ascendant. My son Rama, who has eyes
like red lotus, can be crowned as a prince tomorrow"._END

B_2_C_3_9
BEGIN_
प्रशस्तमन्नं गुणवद्धधिक्षीरोपसेचनम् |
द्विजानां शतसाहस्रे यत्प्रकाममलं भवेत् || २-३-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Let fine rice of good quality with milk and yogurt, fully sufficient for one
hundred thousand Brahmans be arranged."_END

B_2_C_1_23
BEGIN_
दृढभक्तिः स्थिरप्रज्ञो नासद्ग्राही न दुर्वचाः |
निस्तन्द्रिरप्रमत्तश्च स्वदोषपरदोषवित् || २-१-२४_END
BEGIN_
Rama had a firm devotion and steadfast mind. He was not stubborn nor did he speak
evil words. He was free from idleness and was ever alert. He recognized his own errors and those of
others._END

B_2_C_2_18
BEGIN_
अनेकवर्षसाहस्रो वृद्धस्त्त्वमसि पार्थिव |
स रामं युवराजानमभिषिञ्चस्व पार्थिवम् || २-२-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Oh king! You are an elderly person with thousands of years of age. Hence,
inaugurate Rama as the ruling prince."_END

B_2_C_4_1
BEGIN_
अथान्तर्गृहमासाद्य राजा दशरथस्तदा |
सूतमामन्त्रयामास रामं पुनरिहानय || २-४-३_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, king Dasaratha entered the inner palace and then ordered Sumantra thus,
"Bring Rama again here"._END

B_2_C_3_10
BEGIN_
सत्कृत्य द्विजमुख्यानां श्वः प्रभाते प्रदीयताम् |
घृतं दधि च लाजाश्च दक्षिणाश्चापि पुष्कलाः || २-३-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Let that rice be given with due respect to important Brahmans tomorrow at dawn;
along with clarified butter, yogurt, corn, and lot of gifts."_END

B_2_C_1_24
BEGIN_
शास्त्रज्ञश्च कृतज्ञश्च पुरुषान्तरकोविदः |
यः प्रग्रहानुग्रहयोर्यथान्यायं विचक्षणः || २-१-२५_END
BEGIN_
Rama knew the theory and practice of sciences. He understood the differences among
men. He could judiciously discriminate whom to protect and whom to punish._END

B_2_C_2_19
BEGIN_
इच्छामो हि महाबाहुं रघुवीरं महाबलम् |
गजेन महता यान्तं रामं छत्रावृताननम् || २-२-२२_END
BEGIN_
"All of us want to see Rama, with long arms, the hero with great might born in the
clan of Raghu , his face protected by a white umbrella, moving on a great elephant."_END

B_2_C_4_2
BEGIN_
प्रतिगृह्य स तद्वाक्यं सूतः पुनरुपाययौ |
रामस्य भवनं शीघ्रं राममानयितुं पुनः || २-४-४_END
BEGIN_
Obeying the king's words, Sumantra went to Rama's house immediately to bring Rama
once again._END

B_2_C_3_11
BEGIN_
सूर्येऽभ्युदितमात्रे श्वो भविता स्वस्तिवाचनम् |
ब्राह्मणाश्च निमन्त्र्यन्तां कल्प्यन्तामासनानि च || २-३-१६_END
BEGIN_
"There will be an invocation for the well being of all, tomorrow at sun rise. Let
brahmanas be invited and suitable seats be arranged for them."_END

B_2_C_1_25
BEGIN_
सत्संग्रहप्रग्रहणे स्थानविन्निग्रहस्य च |
आयकर्मण्युपायज्ञः संदृष्टव्ययकर्मवित् || २-१-२६_END
BEGIN_
He identified good men and protected them. He knew the people worthy of reprimand.
He knew the ways and means of getting income as well as the system of spending, as perceived by
economic sciences._END

B_2_C_2_20
BEGIN_
इति तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राजा तेषां मनःप्रियम् |
अजानन्निव जिज्ञासुरिदं वचनमब्रवीत् || २-२-२३_END
BEGIN_
King Dasaratha, after hearing their words, spoke as follows as though he did not
know their mind earlier and sought to know their true intention._END

B_2_C_4_3
BEGIN_
द्वाःस्थैरावेदितं तस्य रामायागमनं पुनः |
श्रुत्वैव चापि रामस्तं प्राप्तं शङ्कान्वितोऽभवत् || २-४-५_END
BEGIN_
The doorkeepers informed Rama that Sumantra had come again. Hearing that, Rama was
uncertain as to the reason for Sumantra's arrival again._END

B_2_C_3_12
BEGIN_
आबध्यन्तां पताकाश्च राजमार्गश्च सिच्यताम् |
सर्वे च ताळावचरा गणिकाश्च स्वलंकृताः || २-३-१७
कक्ष्यां द्वितीयामासाद्य तिष्ठन्तु नृपवेश्मनः |_END
BEGIN_
"Let the flags be hung and the royal highways be sprinkled with water. Let well
dressed dancers and musicians wait in second enclosure in the royal compound."_END

B_2_C_1_26
BEGIN_
श्रैष्ठ्यं शास्त्रसमूहेषु प्राप्तो व्यामिश्रकेषु च |
अर्थधर्मौ च संगृह्य सुखतन्त्रो न चालसः || २-१-२७_END
BEGIN_
Rama could obtain great skill in the groups of sciences along with their
subsidiaries. He was interested in enjoying comforts only after understanding the economy
and virtues. He never remained inactive._END

B_2_C_2_21
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वैव वचनं यन्मे राघवं पतिमिच्छथ |
राजानः संशयोऽयं मे तदिदं ब्रूत तत्त्वतः || २-२-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh kings, I have a doubt as to why you want Raghava to be the king immediately
after hearing my words. Inform your real opinion in this matter."_END

B_2_C_4_4
BEGIN_
प्रवेश्य चैनं त्वरितं रामो वचन मब्रवीत् |
यदागमनकृत्यं ते भूयस्तद्भ्रुह्यशेषतः || २-४-६_END
BEGIN_
Rama immediately allowed Sumantra inside and spoke these words to him: "Tell me
completely the purpose of your arrival again."_END

B_2_C_3_13
BEGIN_
देवायतनचैत्येषु सान्नभक्षाः सदक्षिणाः || २-३-१८
उपस्थापयितव्याः स्युर्माल्ययोग्याः पृथक् पृथक् |_END
BEGIN_
"As worshipping is to be done in temples and at road junctions, let some deserving
people gather there with rice, eatables, presents and garlands separately."_END

B_2_C_1_27
BEGIN_
वैहारिकाणां शिल्पानां विज्ञातार्थविभागवित् |
आरोहे विनये चैव युक्तो वारणवाजिनाम् || २-१-२८_END
BEGIN_
Rama was acquainted with the fine arts useful for entertainment. He knew how to
distribute the wealth. He was efficient in riding and also taming of elephants and horses._END

B_2_C_2_22
BEGIN_
कथं नु मयि धर्मेण पृथिवीमनुशासति |
भवन्तो द्रष्टुमिच्छन्ति युवराजं ममात्मजम् || २-२-२५_END
BEGIN_
"Why do you desire to see my son as the prince, when I am ruling this earth with
righteousness?"_END

B_2_C_4_5
BEGIN_
तमुवाच ततः सूतो राजा त्वां द्रष्टु मिच्छति |
श्रुत्वा प्रमाणमत्र त्वं गमनायेतराय वा || २-४-७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words, Sumantra said: "King Dasaratha wants to see you. Decide
yourself in this matter whether to proceed to your father or otherwise"._END

B_2_C_3_14
BEGIN_
दीर्घासिबद्धा योधाश्च सन्नद्धा मृष्टवाससः || २-३-१९
महाराजाङ्गणं सर्वे प्रविशन्तु महोदयम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Let all the warriors enter the well developed front yard of the royal palace with
long swords, armors and clean clothing."_END

B_2_C_1_28
BEGIN_
धनुर्वेदविदां श्रेष्ठो लोकेऽतिरथसम्मतः |
अभियाता प्रहर्ता च सेनानयविशारदः || २-१-२९_END
BEGIN_
Rama was the best of persons knowing the science of archery in the world; and was
well appreciated by the champions of archery. He attained skills in marshalling the army. He faced
and killed the enemies in battle._END

B_2_C_2_23
BEGIN_
ते तमूचुर्महात्मानं पौरजानपदैः सह |
बहवो नृप कल्याणा गुणाः पुत्रस्य सन्ति ते || २-२-२६_END
BEGIN_
Those kings together with urban and rural citizens after hearing those words spoke
to the great soul Dasaratha as follows: "Oh king! Your son Rama has many auspicious virtues"._END

B_2_C_4_6
BEGIN_
इति सूतवचः श्रुत्वा रामोऽथ त्वरयान्वितः |
प्रययौ राजभवनं पुनर्द्रष्टुं नरेश्वरम् || २-४-८_END
BEGIN_
Rama, after hearing Sumantra's words, started immediately and went to the royal
palace to see king Dasaratha, the Lord of people, again._END

B_2_C_3_15
BEGIN_
एवं व्यादिश्य विप्रौ तौ क्रियास्तत्र सुनिष्ठितौ || २-३-२०
चक्रतुश्चैव यच्छेषं पार्थिवाय निवेद्य च |_END
BEGIN_
Those wise men Vasishta and Vamadeva attentively ordered for all those things to be
done there, informed that to king Dasaratha and performed the remaining things also._END

B_2_C_1_29
BEGIN_
अप्रधृष्यश्च संग्रामे क्रुद्धैरपि सुरासुरैः |
अनसूयो जितक्रोधो न दृप्तो न च मत्सरी |
न चावमन्ता भूतानां न च कालवशानुगः || २-१-३०_END
BEGIN_
Even enraged celestials and demons could not defeat Rama in battle. He had no
jealousy. He conquered anger. He had no arrogance and envy. He had not even humiliated any living being.
He had not surrendered to time._END

B_2_C_2_24
BEGIN_
गुणान् गुणवतो देव देवकल्पस्य धीमतः |
प्रियानानन्ददान् कृत्स्नान् प्रवक्ष्यामोऽद्यतान् शृणु || २-२-२७_END
BEGIN_
"Oh king! We shall tell you now the various virtues of your wise son, listen to
them. His qualities are equal to those of celestials. They are liked by all. They give happiness to
all."_END

B_2_C_4_7
BEGIN_
तं श्रुत्वा समनुप्राप्तं रामं दशरथो नृपः |
प्रवेश्यामास गृहं विवक्षुः प्रियमुत्तमम् || २-४-९_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Rama to have arrived, king Dasaratha allowed him to come into the house, to
tell him an excellent and affectionate word._END

B_2_C_3_16
BEGIN_
कृतमित्येव चाब्रूतामभिगम्य जगत्पतिम् || २-३-२१
यथोक्तवचनं प्रीतौ हर्षयुक्तौ द्विजर्षभौ |_END
BEGIN_
Pleased and satisfied with the arrangements made Vasishta and Vamadeva approached
king Dasaratha and told him that all had been done according to his words._END

B_2_C_1_30
BEGIN_
एवं श्रेष्ठगुणैर्युक्तः प्रजानां पार्थिवात्मजः |
सम्मतस्त्रिषु लोकेषु वसुधायाः क्षमागुणैः || २-१-३१
बुद्ध्या बृहस्पतेस्तुल्यो वीर्येणापि शचीपतेः |_END
BEGIN_
That Prince Rama, with these good virtues, was fair to the people. He was agreeable
to the three worlds. By patience and the related virtues, he was equal to earth, by wisdom to
Brihaspathi and by valor to Devendra._END

B_2_C_2_25
BEGIN_
दिव्यैर्गुणैः शक्रसमो रामः सत्यपराक्रमः |
इक्ष्वाकुभ्योऽपि सर्वेभ्यो ह्यतिरिक्तो विशांपते || २-२-२८_END
BEGIN_
"Oh king! Rama is equal to Devendra in heavenly qualities. He has true valor. He is
greater than all the kings born in Ikshvaaku clan."_END

B_2_C_4_8
BEGIN_
प्रविश्न्नेप च श्रीमान् राघवो भवनं पितुः |
ददर्श पितरं दूरात् प्रणिपत्य कृताञ्ज्लिः || २-४-१०_END
BEGIN_
The glorious Rama, soon after entering his father's house, saw his father from a
distance and fell prostrate before him in an act of submission, with his palms joined together._END

B_2_C_3_17
BEGIN_
ततः सुमन्त्रं द्युतिमान् राजा वचनमब्रवीत् || २-३-२२
रामः कृतात्मा भवता शीघ्रमानीयतामिति |_END
BEGIN_
Afterwards, Dasaratha spoke to Sumantra "Let Rama, who has a disciplined intellect,
be brought by you immediately."_END

B_2_C_1_31
BEGIN_
तथा सर्वप्रजाकान्तैः प्रीतिसञ्जननैः पितुः || २-१-३२
गुणैर्विरुरुचे रामो दीप्तः सूर्य इवांशुभिः |_END
BEGIN_
Rama, by his virtues, was a source of happiness to all the people and a spring of
joy to his father. As the sun shines with his rays, Rama was shining, thus, with his virtues._END

B_2_C_5_0
BEGIN_
सन्दिश्य रामं नृपतिः श्वोभाविन्यभिषेचने |
पुरोहितं समाहूय वसिष्ठमिदमब्रवीत् || २-५-१_END
BEGIN_
After Rama left, king Dasaratha called for his family priest Vasishta and spoke to
him as follows about the ensuing anointment ceremony of the next day._END

B_2_C_2_26
BEGIN_
रामः सत्पुरुषो लोके सत्यधर्मपरायणः |
साक्षाद्रामाद्विनिर्वृत्तो धर्मश्चापि श्रिया सह || २-२-२९_END
BEGIN_
"Rama is the world renowned gentleman. He is keenly interested in truth and
righteousness. Only Rama can make both righteousness and wealth combine without separation."_END

B_2_C_4_9
BEGIN_
प्रणमन्तं समुत्थाप्य तं परिष्वज्य भूमिपः |
प्रदिश्य चास्मै रुचिरमासनं पुनरब्रवीत् || २-४-११_END
BEGIN_
Dasaratha lifted Rama up and took him into his embrace. Then, he offered a beautiful
seat to Rama and spoke to him as follows:_END

B_2_C_3_18
BEGIN_
स तथेति प्रतिज्ञाय सुमन्त्रो राजशासनात् || २-३-२३
रामं तत्रानयांचक्रे रथेन रथिनां वरम् |_END
BEGIN_
As commanded by the king, Sumantra brought there, Rama, the best of charioteers, in
a chariot._END

B_2_C_1_32
BEGIN_
तमेवं व्रत्तसंपन्नमप्रधृष्यपराक्रमम् || २-१-३३
लोकपालोपमं नाथमकामयत मेदिनी |_END
BEGIN_
The earth wished Rama to be her Lord as he was adorned with self -control and norms
of behavior bearing undefeatable valor equal to that of universal lords like Indra._END

B_2_C_5_1
BEGIN_
गच्छोपवासं काकुत्थ्सं कारयाद्य तपोधन |
श्रीयशोराज्यलाभाय वध्वा सह यतव्रतम् || २-५-२_END
BEGIN_
"O, great sage Vasishta! Please go to the avowed Rama and Seetha today to make them
perform fasting for obtaining prosperity, glory and sovereignty."_END

B_2_C_2_27
BEGIN_
प्रजासुखत्वे चन्द्रस्य वसुधायाः क्ष्हमागुणैः |
बुध्या बृहस्पतेस्तुल्यो वीर्ये साक्षाच्छचीपतेः || २-२-३०_END
BEGIN_
"He is equal to moon in making the people happy; equal to the earth in the quality
of forgiveness; equal to Brihaspati in wisdom and verily to Devendra in valour."_END

B_2_C_4_10
BEGIN_
राम वृद्धोऽस्मि दीर्घायुर्भुक्ता भोगा मयेप्सिताः |
अन्न्वद्भिः क्रतुश्तैस्तथेष्टं भूरिदक्षिणैः || २-४-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh Rama, I have now become aged after living for a long period. I enjoyed all the
luxuries in life, as I desired. I propitiated Gods by performing hundreds of sacrifices, in which
food and lots of fees were given away to the officiating priests. "_END

B_2_C_3_19
BEGIN_
अथ तत्र समासीनास्तदा दशरथं नृपम् || २-३-२४
प्राच्योदीच्याः प्रतीच्याश्च दाक्षिणात्याश्च भूमिपाः |
म्लेच्छाश्चार्याश्च ये चान्ये वने शैलान्तवासिनः || २-३-२५
उपासाञ्चक्रिरे सर्वे तं देवा इव वासवम् |_END
BEGIN_
Afterwards the kings belonging to east, west, north, south as well as those
belonging to Mlechha kingdom, Aryaa Vartha kingdom and those ruling in hill and forest areas sat
there and attended on King Dasaratha as celestials attended on Devendra._END

B_2_C_1_33
BEGIN_
एतैस्तु बहुभिर्युक्तं गुणैरनुपमैः सुतम् || २-१-३४
दृष्ट्वा दशरथो राजा चक्रे चिन्तां परन्तपः |_END
BEGIN_
Dasaratha, who annihilates enemies, started thinking as follows after observing his
son with his many incomparable virtues._END

B_2_C_5_2
BEGIN_
तथेति च स राजानमुक्त्वा वेदविदां वरः |
स्वयं वसिष्ठो भगवान् ययौ रामनिवेशनम् || २-५-३
उपवासयितुं रामं मन्त्रवन्मन्त्रकोविदः |
ब्राह्मं रथवरं युक्तमास्थाय सुदृधव्रतः || २-५-४_END
BEGIN_
Vasista, who is the best of knowers of Veda, who is expert in mantras, who is firm
in austerities and who is divine, said to Dasaratha : "I agree to it" and personally went to Rama's
house on a chariot which was ready and quite suitable for a Brahman; so as to advise Rama to
undertake a fast (with mantras) performed by Rama, a knower of mantras._END

B_2_C_2_28
BEGIN_
धर्मज्ञः सत्यसन्धश्च शीलवाननसूयकः |
क्षान्तः सान्त्वयिता श्लक्ष्ह्णः कृतज्ञो विजितेन्द्रियः || २-२-३१_END
BEGIN_
"Rama knows all righteousness. He is true to his word and has good character. He has
no envy. He has patience. He consoles those who are in troubles. He speaks good words. He has
gratitude. He keeps senses under control."_END

B_2_C_4_11
BEGIN_
जातमिष्टमपत्यं मे त्वमद्यानुपमं भुवि |
दत्तमिष्टमधीतं च मया पुरुषसत्तम || २-४-१३_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama, the best of men! You are now born to me as without an equal on earth and as
my beloved child. I had given away lots of donations, I had performed holy rites and I have also
studied Vedas and other Holy Scriptures during my life time."_END

B_2_C_3_20
BEGIN_
तेषां मध्ये स राजर्षिर्मरुतामिव वासवः || २-३-२६
प्रासादस्थो रथगतं ददर्शायान्त मात्मजम् |_END
BEGIN_
The sage king Dasaratha, sitting in the midst of those kings like Devendra in the
middle of the celestials, saw from the palace itself, his son Rama arriving in a chariot._END

B_2_C_1_34
BEGIN_
अथ राज्ञो बभूवैवं वृद्धस्य चिरजीविनः || २-१-३५
प्रीतिरेषा कथं रामो राजा स्यान्मयि जीवति |_END
BEGIN_
The long living and aged Dasaratha thought: "Will Rama become king while I am still
alive? Shall I enjoy that happiness?"_END

B_2_C_5_3
BEGIN_
स रामभवनं प्रप्य पाण्डुराभ्रघनप्रभम् |
तिस्रः कक्ष्या र्थेनैव विवेश मुनिसत्तमः || २-५-५_END
BEGIN_
That great sage reached Rama's house, which was radiant like a dense white cloud and
entered the three gateways of the house by the chariot itself._END

B_2_C_2_29
BEGIN_
मृदुश्च स्थिरचित्तश्च सदा भव्योऽनसूयकः |
प्रियवादी च भूतानां सत्यवादी च राघवः || २-२-३२
बहुश्रुतानां वृद्धानां ब्राह्मणानामुपासिता |
तेना स्येहातुला कीर्तिर्यशस्तेजश्च वर्धते || २-२-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Rama is soft natured; has stable mind, always an auspicious man, and has no envy.
He speaks truthful and loving words to all living beings. He worships aged Brahmans endued with the
knowledge of various sciences. By that, his name, glory and splendor are growing in this
world."_END

B_2_C_4_12
BEGIN_
अनुभूतानि चेष्टानि मया वीर सुखान्यपि |
देवर्षिपितृविप्राणामनृणोऽस्मि तथात्मनः || २-४-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh gallant Rama! I also enjoyed all the comforts, as I desired. Thus I am relieved
of all debts to the celestials (by performing holy sacrifices), to the sages (by studying Vedas
etc.), to my ancestors (by begetting you), to the Brahmans (by giving away donations and food) and
to myself (by enjoying all comforts as I desired)."_END

B_2_C_3_21
BEGIN_
गन्धर्वराजप्रतिमं लोके विख्यातपौरुषम् || २-३-२७
दीर्घ बाहुं महसत्त्वं मत्तमातङ्गगामिनम् |
चन्द्रकान्ताननं राममतीव प्रियदर्शनम् || २-३-२८
रूपौदार्यगुणैः पुंसां दृष्टिचित्तापहारिणम् |
घर्माभितप्ताः पर्जन्यं ह्लादयन्तमिव प्रजाः || २-३-२९
न ततर्प समायान्तं पश्यमानो नराधिपः |_END
BEGIN_
Rama was as beautiful as the king of Gandharvas. His valiance was world famous. He
had great strength and walked like a vigorous elephant. He had long arms, and with his enchanting
face, he looked like the moon. He stole the eyes and minds of the people by his looks, generosity
and virtues. King Dasaratha was thus not satiated enough in seeing Rama, coming like a cloud that
gladdens people by relieving them from the scorching summer heat._END

B_2_C_1_35
BEGIN_
एषा ह्यस्य परा प्रीतिर्हृदि सम्परिवर्तते || २-१-३६
कदा नाम सुतं द्रक्ष्याम्यभिषिक्तमहं प्रियम् |_END
BEGIN_
A great loving thought was ringing in his mind that when he would be able to see his
beloved son Rama crowned as a king._END

B_2_C_5_4
BEGIN_
तमागतमृषिं रामस्त्वरन्निव ससंभ्रमः |
मानयिष्यन् स मानार्हं निश्चक्राम निवेशनात् || २-५-६_END
BEGIN_
To respect the honorable sage, who arrived, Rama came quickly and hurriedly out of
the house._END

B_2_C_2_30
BEGIN_
देवासुरमनुष्याणां सर्वास्त्रेषु विशारदः |
सम्यग्विद्याव्रतस्नातो यथावत्साङ्गेवेदवित् || २-२-३४_END
BEGIN_
"He is skilled in the use of various weapons known to celestials, demons and men. He
has duly concluded his vow of studying the various sciences and has systematically learnt all the
Vedas along with its branches. *"_END

B_2_C_4_13
BEGIN_
न किञ्चिन्म कर्तव्यं तवान्यत्राभिषेचनात् |
अतो युत्त्वामहं ब्रूयां तन्मे त्वं कर्तुमर्हसि ||२-४-१५_END
BEGIN_
"I have no duty other than to anoint you for the crown. Hence, do what I tell
you."_END

B_2_C_3_22
BEGIN_
अवतार्य सुमन्त्रस्तं राघवं स्यन्दनोत्तमात् || २-३-३०
पितुः समीपं गच्छन्तं प्राञ्जलिः पृष्ठतोऽन्वगात् |_END
BEGIN_
Sumantra helped Rama to get down from the excellent chariot and with folded hands
followed behind Rama, who approached his father._END

B_2_C_6_0
BEGIN_
गते पुरोहिते रामः स्नातो नियतमानसः |
सह पत्न्या विशालाक्ष्या नारायणमुपागमत् || २-६-१_END
BEGIN_
After Vasistha left, Rama took bath and meditated on Lord Narayana with undistracted
mind along with his wide-eyed wife, Seetha._END

B_2_C_1_36
BEGIN_
वृद्धिकामो हि लोकस्य सर्वभूतानुकम्पनः || २-१-३७
मत्तः प्रियतरो लोके पर्जन्य इव वृष्टिमान् |_END
BEGIN_
"Is not Rama, as a raining cloud to the earth, better liked by people than me, as he
desires the development of the world and has compassion towards all living beings."_END

B_2_C_5_5
BEGIN_
अभ्येत्य त्वरमाणश्च रथाभ्याशं मनीषिणः |
ततोऽवतारयामास परिगृह्य रथात्स्वयम् || २-५-७_END
BEGIN_
Rama quickly got nearer to Vasishta's chariot and personally helped him to alight
from the chariot._END

B_2_C_2_31
BEGIN_
गान्धर्वे च भुवि श्रेष्ठो बभूव भरताग्रजः |
कल्याणाभिजनः साधुरदीनात्मा महामतिः || २-२-३५_END
BEGIN_
"Rama is best in the world in the art of music. He has best relatives. He is gentle.
He is not weak in mind. He has great wisdom."_END

B_2_C_3_23
BEGIN_
स तं कैलासशृङ्गाभं प्रासादं नरपुङ्गवः || २-३-३१
आरुरोह नृपं द्रष्टुं सह सूतेन राघवः |_END
BEGIN_
Rama, the best among men, ascended the steps of the palace, which resembled Mount
Kailaasa, along with Sumantra, to see the king Dasaratha._END

B_2_C_4_14
BEGIN_
अद्य प्रकृतयः सर्वास्त्वामिच्छन्ति नराधिपम् |
अतस्त्वां युवराजानमभिषेक्ष्यामि पुत्रक || २-४-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Now all the people want you to be the king. Hence, I can install you as
prince."_END

B_2_C_6_1
BEGIN_
प्रगृह्य शिरसा पात्रं हविषो विधिवत्तदा |
महते दैवतायाज्यं जुहाव ज्वलितानले || २-६-२_END
BEGIN_
Taking the vessel with clarified butter on his head as per scriptures, he offered to
Lord Vishnu the clarified butter, by dropping it into the blazing fire._END

B_2_C_1_37
BEGIN_
यमशक्रसमो वीर्ये बृहस्पतिसमो मतौ || २-१-३८
महीधरसमो धृत्यां मत्तश्च गुणवत्तरः |_END
BEGIN_
"Rama is equal to Yama and Devendra in valor, to Brihaspati in wisdom and to a
mountain in courage. He is more virtuous also than me."_END

B_2_C_5_6
BEGIN_
सचैनं प्रश्रितं दृष्ट्वा सं भाष्याभिप्रसाद्य च |
प्रियार्हं हर्षयन् राममित्युवाच पुरोहितः || २-५-८_END
BEGIN_
That family priest Vasishta seeing that lovable and humble Rama, spoke the following
words, bringing cheerfulness and happiness to him:_END

B_2_C_2_32
BEGIN_
द्विजैरभिविनीतश्च श्रेष्ठैर्धर्मार्थनैपुणैः |
यदा व्रजति संग्रामं ग्रामार्थे नगरस्य वा || २-२-३६
गत्वा सौमित्रिसहितो नाविजित्य निवर्तते |_END
BEGIN_
"Rama was trained in all matters from the best of Brahmans skilled in the art of
righteousness and in the science of political economy. If it is necessary to go to a battle to
protect a village or a city, Rama goes with Lakshmana and returns home only after obtaining
victory."_END

B_2_C_3_24
BEGIN_
स प्राञ्^जलिरभिप्रेत्य प्रणतः पितुरन्तिके || २-३-३२
नाम स्वं श्रावयन् रामो ववन्धे चरणौ पितुः |_END
BEGIN_
Rama with folded hands approached his father, bowed down mentioning his own name and
offered salutations to his father's feet._END

B_2_C_4_15
BEGIN_
अपि चाद्याशुभान् राम स्वप्ने प्श्यामि दारुणान् |
सनिर्घाता दिवोल्का च परतीह महास्वना || २-४-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! It is not only the people's desire, but also these days I am getting
fearful and inauspicious dreams. Here, thunderous comets are falling with great sound, during day
time."_END

B_2_C_6_2
BEGIN_
शेषं च हविषस्तस्य प्राश्याशास्यात्मनः प्रियम् |
ध्यायन्नारायणं देवं स्वास्तीर्णे कुशसंस्तरे || २-६-३
वाग्यतः सह वैदेह्या भूत्वा नियतमानसः |
श्रीमत्यायतने विष्णोः शिश्ये नरवरात्मजः || २-६-४_END
BEGIN_
Rama ate the remainder of clarified butter after finishing the sacrifice, which he
performed for his own good, silently meditated on Lord Narayana with controlled mind and slept
along with Seetha on a properly laid bed of Kusa grass in a splendid temple of Lord Vishnu. *_END

B_2_C_1_38
BEGIN_
महीमहमिमां कृत्स्नामधितिष्ठन्तमात्मजम् || २-१-३९
अनेन वयसा दृष्ट्वा यथा स्वर्गमवाप्नुयाम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Shall I attain heaven, after seeing in this age, my son ruling the entire
earth?"_END

B_2_C_5_7
BEGIN_
प्रसन्नस्ते पिता राम यौवराज्यमवाप्स्यसि |
उपवासं भवानद्य करोतु सह सीतया || २-५-९_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! Your father is delighted with you. You will be getting the princely
kingdom. Hence, you and Seetha perform fasting today."_END

B_2_C_2_33
BEGIN_
संग्रामात्पुनरागम्य कुञ्जरेण रथेन वा || २-२-३७
पौरान् स्वजनवन्नित्यं कुशलं परिपृच्छति |
पुत्रेष्वग्निषु दारेषु प्रेष्यशिष्यगणेषु च || २-२-३८
निखिलेनानुपूर्व्याच्च पिता पुत्रानिवौरसान् |_END
BEGIN_
"After returning from battle, Rama goes to citizens on an elephant or a chariot and
inquires about their well being as though they were his own kinsmen, like a father does to his
sons. He asks about their wives and children, about the sacred fires, about their servants and
students, always completely as per the due order."_END

B_2_C_3_25
BEGIN_
तं दृष्ट्वा प्रणतं पार्श्वे कृताञ्जलिपुटं नृपः || २-३-३३
गृह्याञ्जलौ समाकृष्य सस्वजे प्रियमात्मजम् |_END
BEGIN_
King Dasaratha took into his embrace that beloved son who was standing humbly beside
him with folded hands._END

B_2_C_4_16
BEGIN_
अवष्टब्धं च मे राम नक्षत्रं दारुणैर्ग्रहैः |
आवेदयन्ति दैवज्ञावः सूर्याङ्गारकराहुभिः || २-४-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! Astrologers are informing me that fearful planets like Sun, Mars and Rahu
are encroaching my birth star."_END

B_2_C_6_3
BEGIN_
एकयामावशिष्टायां रात्र्यां प्रतिविबुध्य सः |
अलञ्कारविधिं कृत्स्नं कारयामास वेश्मनः || २-६-५_END
BEGIN_
Rama woke up three hours before dawn and caused to complete the entire decoration of
the house._END

B_2_C_1_39
BEGIN_
इत्येतैर्विविधैस्तैस्तैरन्यपार्थिवदुर्लभैः || २-१-४०
शिष्टैरपरिमेयैश्च लोके लोकोत्तरैर्गुणैः |
तं समीक्ष्य महाराजो युक्तं समुदितैः शुभैः || २-१-४१
निश्चित्य सचिवैः सार्धं युवराजममन्यत |_END
BEGIN_
Rama had many other virtues beyond hitherto stated virtues not to be seen in other
kings. His virtues cannot be counted and they are the best in the world. Seeing that type of
virtuous Rama, Dasaratha along with his ministers, decided to make Rama the prince._END

B_2_C_5_8
BEGIN_
प्रातस्त्वामभिषेक्ता हि यौवराज्ये नराधिपः |
पिता दशरथः प्रीत्या ययातिं नहुषो यथा || २-५-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Your father; King Dasaratha is anointing you affectionately for the princely
kingdom tomorrow at dawn; even as king Nahusha has done to Yayati"._END

B_2_C_2_34
BEGIN_
शुश्रूषन्ते च वः शिष्याः कच्चित्कर्मसु दंशिताः || २-२-३९
इति नः पुरुषव्याघ्रः सदा रामोऽभिभाषते |_END
BEGIN_
"Rama the best among men always asks us interrogatively thus: 'Are your disciples serving you by keenly
performing their actions?' "_END

B_2_C_3_26
BEGIN_
तस्मै चाभ्युदितं दिव्यं मणिकाञ्चनभूषितं || २-३-३४
दिदेश राजा रुचिरं रामाय परमासनम् |_END
BEGIN_
King Dasaratha gave Rama a great throne, which was high, excellent and beautiful,
decorated with gold and diamonds._END

B_2_C_4_17
BEGIN_
प्रायेण हि निमित्तानामीदृशानां समुद्भवे |
राजा हि मृत्युमाप्नोति घोरं वापदमृच्छति || २-४-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Whenever such inauspicious signs are produced, the king generally will get either
death or a fearful accident."_END

B_2_C_6_4
BEGIN_
तत्र शृण्वन् सुखा वाचः सूतमागधवन्दिनाम् |
पूर्वां सन्ध्यामुपासीनो जजाप यतमानसः || २-६-६_END
BEGIN_
Listening to the pleasing verses of professional reciters, he worshipped the early
sunrise and meditated on Gayatri* with an undistracted mind._END

B_2_C_1_40
BEGIN_
दिव्यन्तरिक्षे भूमौ च घोरमुत्पातजं भयम् || २-१-४२
संचचक्षेऽथ मेधावी शरीरे चात्मनो जराम् |_END
BEGIN_
The wise Dasaratha observed that there was sign of a great alarm being forecast because
of bad omens found in earth heaven and the sky. He also told the ministers that his body
was getting aged._END

B_2_C_5_9
BEGIN_
इत्युक्त्वा स तदा राम मुपवासं यतव्रतम् |
मन्त्रवत् कारयामास वैदेह्या सहितं मुनिः || २-५-११_END
BEGIN_
Vasistha thus spoke to Rama and enjoined him to undertake a vow of fasting together
with Seetha, in the accompaniment of mantras._END

B_2_C_2_35
BEGIN_
व्यसनेषु मनुष्याणां भृशं भवति दुःखितः || २-२-४०
उत्सवेषु च सर्वेषु पितेव परितुष्यति |_END
BEGIN_
"Rama feels very sad towards afflictions of men; and feels delighted in all
functions celebrated by people on the occasions of child birth and the like, just as their own
father does."_END

B_2_C_3_27
BEGIN_
तदासनवरं प्राप्य व्यदीपयत राघवः || २-३-३५
स्वयेव प्रभया मेरुमुदये विमलो रविः |_END
BEGIN_
Rama, occupying that great throne, caused it to shine with his own brightness, just
as the spotless sun in the morning causes Meru mountain to shine with brilliance._END

B_2_C_4_18
BEGIN_
तद्यावदेव मे चेतो न विमुञ्चति राघव |
तावदेवाभिषिञ्चस्व चला हि प्राणिनां मतिः || २-४-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! Hence, before my mind gets changed, get you anointed to the crown. Are
not the minds of men unstable?"_END

B_2_C_6_5
BEGIN_
तुष्टाव प्रणतश्चैव शिरसा मधुसूदनम् |
विमलक्षौमसंवीतो वाचयामास च द्विजान् || २-६-७_END
BEGIN_
He praised Lord Vishnu by bowing his head before Him. By wearing pure silk clothes,
he got valedictory text recited by Brahmans._END

B_2_C_1_41
BEGIN_
पूर्णचन्द्राननस्याथ शोकापनुदमात्मनः || २-१-४३
लोके रामस्य बुबुधे सम्प्रियत्वं महात्मनः |_END
BEGIN_
He recognized that if Rama were crowned as king, he would not have worries as Rama
had beautiful face as a full moon; was a great wise man; and was liked by the people._END

B_2_C_5_10
BEGIN_
ततो यथावद्रामेण स राज्ञो गुरुरर्चितः |
अभ्यनुज्ञाप्य काकुत्थ्सं ययौ रामनिवेशनात् || २-५-१२_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, Rama worshipped the royal priest Vasistha suitably. Vasistha then got
Rama's permission and left his house._END

B_2_C_2_36
BEGIN_
सत्यवादी महेष्वासो वृद्धसेवी जितेन्द्रियः || २-२-४१
स्मितपूर्वाभिभाषी च धर्मं सर्वात्मना श्रितः |_END
BEGIN_
"Rama speaks only truth. He is a great hero. He serves elders. He kept the senses
under control. Rama, who talks smilingly, protects righteousness in all ways."_END

B_2_C_3_28
BEGIN_
तेन विभ्राजता तत्र सा सभाभिव्यरोचत || २-३-३६
विमलग्रहनक्षत्रा शारदी द्यौरिवेन्दुना |_END
BEGIN_
Rama by his brilliance made that assembly to shine, just as the moon shines the
clear autumnal sky, with the dimless stars and planets._END

B_2_C_4_19
BEGIN_
अद्य चन्द्रोभ्युपगतः पुष्यात्पूर्वं पुनर्वसू |
श्वः पुष्ययोगं नियतं वक्ष्यन्ते दैवचिन्तकाः || २-४-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Today, the moon is entering the constellation known as Punarvasu which comes before
Pushyami star. The astrologers inform that the coronation ceremony can be fixed for tomorrow, when
the moon joins Pushyami star."_END

B_2_C_6_6
BEGIN_
तेषां पुण्याहघोषोऽध गम्भीरमधुरस्तदा |
अयोध्यां पूरयामास तूर्यघोषानुनादितः || २-६-८_END
BEGIN_
Their deep and sweet chorus of the valedictory, united with the accompanying musical
instruments, then filled the city of Ayodhya._END

B_2_C_1_42
BEGIN_
	
		
    
_END
BEGIN_
The righteous Dasaratha was hurried with concern in the coronation of Rama as it is
for his own benefit and for the benefit of people. Because it is as per his liking and also as the
appropriate time has come._END

B_2_C_7_0
BEGIN_
ज्ञातिदासी यतो जाता कैकेय्या तु सहोषिता |
प्रासादं चन्द्रसङ्काशमारुरोह यदृच्छया || २-७-१_END
BEGIN_
Manthara, a housemaid who was residing with Kaikeyi since her birth, accidentally
ascended the balcony of Kaikeyi's white palace, which resembled the full moon._END

B_2_C_5_11
BEGIN_
सुहृद्भिस्तत्र रामोऽपि सहासीनः प्रियंवदैः |
सभाजितो विवेशाथ ताननुज्ञाप्य सर्वशः || २-५-१३_END
BEGIN_
Rama spent some time by delightedly talking with friends and having been
congratulated by them in various ways went into his palace after taking leave of them._END

B_2_C_2_37
BEGIN_
सम्यग्योक्ता श्रेयसां च न विगृह्य कथारुचिः || २-२-४२
उत्तरोत्तरयुक्तौ च वक्ता वाचस्पतिर्यथा |_END
BEGIN_
"Rama duly procures beneficent deeds. He is not interested in wrangling talks. He is
an orator like Brihaspati by his replies and rejoinders."_END

B_2_C_3_29
BEGIN_
तं पश्यमानो नृपति स्तुतोओष प्रियमात्मजम् || २-३-३७
अलङ्कृतमिवात्मानमादर्शतलसंस्थितम् |_END
BEGIN_
King Dasaratha was as delighted in seeing his beloved son, as one delights in seeing
oneself adorned, in a mirror._END

B_2_C_4_20
BEGIN_
ततः पुष्येऽभिषिञ्चस्व मनस्त्वरयतीव माम् |
श्वस्त्वाहमभिषेक्ष्यामि यौवराज्ये परंतप || २-४-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Hence, get anointed for the crown on the day of Pushyami star. My mind is urging me
as it were to expedite things. O, annihilator of the enemies! I shall anoint you for the princely
kingdom tomorrow."_END

B_2_C_6_7
BEGIN_
कृतोपवासं तु तदा वैदेह्या सह राघवम् |
अयोध्यानिलयः श्रुत्वा सर्वः प्रमुदितो जनः || २-६-९_END
BEGIN_
All the people residing in Ayodhya were delighted when they heard that Rama and
Seetha had observed fast for the ensuing anointment ceremony._END

B_2_C_1_43
BEGIN_
नानानगरवास्तव्यान् पृथग्जानपदानपि || २-१-४५
समानिनाय मेदिन्याः प्रधानान्पृथिवीपतीन् |_END
BEGIN_
Dasaratha called for other kings and officers staying in various cities and villages
in his kingdom separately._END

B_2_C_7_1
BEGIN_
सिक्तराजपथां कृत्स्नां प्रकीर्णकुसुमोत्कराम् |
अयोध्यां मन्थरा तस्मात्प्रासादादन्ववैक्षत || २-७-२_END
BEGIN_
Manthara, from that balcony, saw the entire city of Ayodhya, with all its principal
roads being sprinkled with water and strewn with heaps of flowers._END

B_2_C_5_12
BEGIN_
हृष्टनारीनरयुतं रामवेश्म तदा बबौ |
यथा मत्तद्विजगणं प्रपुल्लनलिनं सरः || २-५-१४_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama's house was shining, as brilliantly with delighted men and women, as a
lake filled with opened lotuses and visited by innumerable happy birds._END

B_2_C_2_38
BEGIN_
सुभ्रूरायतताम्राक्षः साक्षाद् विष्णुरिव स्वयम् || २-२-४३
रामो लोकाभिरामोऽयं शौर्यवीर्यपराक्रमैः |_END
BEGIN_
"Rama, who enchants the world, has beautiful eyebrows. He has red and broad eyes. He
is absolutely like the God Vishnu himself in strength, heroism and valour."_END

B_2_C_4_21
BEGIN_
तस्मात्त्वयादप्रभृति निशेयं नियतात्मना |
सह वध्वोपवस्तव्या दर्भप्रस्तरशायिना || २-४-२३_END
BEGIN_
"That is why, with self control, you along with your wife should observe fast for
this night from now onwards, and sleep on a couch made of Kusha grass."_END

B_2_C_3_30
BEGIN_
स तं सस्मितमाभाष्य पुत्रं पुत्रवतां वरः || २-३-३८
उवाचेदं वचो राजा देवेन्द्रमिव काश्यपः |_END
BEGIN_
King Dasaratha, the best among those who have sons, smilingly conversed with his
son, and addressed Rama as follows, as Kasyapa does to (his eldest son) Devendra (the ruler of
gods)._END

B_2_C_1_44
BEGIN_
न तु केकयराजानं जनकं वा नराधिपः || २-१-४६
त्वरया चानयामास पश्चात्तौ श्रोष्यतः प्रियम् |_END
BEGIN_
The hurried Dasaratha did not call for the king Kekaya, the maternal uncle of
Bharatha or the King Janaka as he thought they both could hear the good news even afterwards._END

B_2_C_6_8
BEGIN_
ततः पौरजनः सर्वः श्रुत्वा रामाभिषेचनम् |
प्रभातां रजनीं दृष्ट्वा चक्रे शोभयितुं पुरीम् || २-६-१०_END
BEGIN_
All the citizens decorated the town for coronation function of Rama, soon before
sunrise._END

B_2_C_7_2
BEGIN_
पताकाभिर्वरार्हाभिर्ध्वजैश्च समलङ्कृताम् |
वृतां चंदपथैश्चापि शिरःस्नातजनैर्वृताम् || २-७-३
माल्यमोदकहस्तैश्च द्विजेन्द्रैरभिनादिताम् |
शुक्लदेवगृहद्वारां सर्ववादित्रनिस्वनाम्|| २-७-४
संप्रहृष्टजनाकीर्णां ब्रह्मघोषाभिनादिताम् |
प्रहृष्टवरहस्त्यश्वां संप्रणर्धितगोवृशाम् ||२-७-५
प्रहृउष्टमुदितैः पौरैरुच्च्रि तद्वजमालिनीम् |
अयोध्यां वन्थरा तस्मात्प्रासादादन्ववैक्षत|| २-७-६_END
BEGIN_
Manthara further saw from that balcony the city decorated with the best of flags and
banners. The roads were cleared for uninterrupted traffic. All the people took head-bath. Brahmans
with flowers and sweets in their hands were chanting Mantras. The gateways of temples were white
washed. There were sounds of all musical instruments. The city was filled with rejoicing people and
resounding chant of Vedas. The elephants and horses were also merry. The bulls were making roaring
noise. The highly delighted citizens hoisted rows of flags on their housetops._END

B_2_C_5_13
BEGIN_
स राजभवनप्रख्यात्तस्माद्रामनिवेशनात् |
निर्गत्य ददृशे मार्गं वसिष्ठो जनसंवृतम् || २-५-१५_END
BEGIN_
Vasishta, leaving Rama's house, which seemed like the royal palace, saw the way
filled with people._END

B_2_C_2_39
BEGIN_
प्रजापालनतत्त्वज्ञो न रागोपहतेन्द्रियः || २-२-४४
शक्तस्त्रैलोक्यमप्येको भोक्तुं किं नु महीमिमाम् |_END
BEGIN_
"He knew the ins and outs of public administration. His senses are not afflicted by
passion. He is capable of administering not only earth, but also the three worlds."_END

B_2_C_4_22
BEGIN_
सुहृदश्चाप्रमत्तास्त्वां रक्षन्त्वद्य समन्ततः |
भवन्ति बहुविघ्नानि कार्याण्येवंविधानि हि || २-४-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Generally, there are many obstacles for such type of functions. Hence, your friends
should guard you vigilantly from all directions."_END

B_2_C_3_31
BEGIN_
ज्येष्ठायामसि मे पत्न्यां सदृश्यां सदृशः सुतः || २-३-३९
उत्पन्नस्त्वं गुणश्रेष्ठो मम रामात्मजः प्रियः |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh Rama! You are an exemplary son born to my exemplary elder wife. Being excellent
in virtues, you are beloved son to me."_END

B_2_C_1_45
BEGIN_
तान्वेश्मनानाभरणैर्यथार्हं प्रतिपूजितान् || २-१-४७
ददर्शालंकृतो राजा प्रजापतिरिव प्रजाः |_END
BEGIN_
The king Dasaratha presented them suitably with houses and jewelry. Duly adorned
himself, he looked after them in the manner Lord Brahma looks after his children._END

B_2_C_6_9
BEGIN_
सिताभ्रशिखराभेषु देवतायतनेषु च |
ङ्��चतुष्पधेषु रध्यासु चैत्येष्वट्टाल केषु च || २-६-११
नानापण्यसमृद्धेषु वणिजामापणेषु च |
कुटुम्बिनां समृद्धेषु श्रीमत्सु भवनेषु च || २-६-१२
सभासु चैव सर्वासु वृक्षेष्वालक्षितेएशु च |
ध्वजाः समुच्छ्रिताश्चित्राः पताकाश्चाभवंस्तदा || २-६-१३_END
BEGIN_
Banners and colorful flags were hoisted on temples, which looked brilliantly like
the silver lining of cloud, at road junctions, in streets, on big trees situated in temple
compounds, from watching towers at city gates, on shops of wealthy merchants, on buildings of rich
family persons, on all assembly halls and all visible trees._END

B_2_C_7_3
BEGIN_
प्रहर्षोत्फुल्लनयनां पाण्डुरक्षौमवासिनीम् |
अविदूरे स्थितां दृष्ट्वा धात्रीं पप्रच्छ मन्थरा || २-७-७_END
BEGIN_
Manthara asked a house maid with bright pleasing eyes and wearing white silk clothes
standing nearby, as follows: -_END

B_2_C_5_14
BEGIN_
बृन्दबृन्दैरयोध्यायां राजमार्गाः समन्ततः |
बभूवुरभिसंबाधाः कुतूहलजनैर्वृताः || २-५-१६_END
BEGIN_
All the royal highways in the city of Ayodhya were filled with groups and groups of
delighted people and became congested._END

B_2_C_4_23
BEGIN_
विप्रोषितश्च भरतो यावदेव पुरादितः |
तावदेवाभिषेकस्ते प्राप्तकालो मतो मम || २-४-२५_END
BEGIN_
"It is my opinion that your coronation function should occur, while Bharata is away
from the city."_END

B_2_C_2_40
BEGIN_
नाऽस्य क्रोधः प्रसादश्च निरर्थोऽस्ति कदाचन || २-२-४५
हन्त्येव नियमाद्वध्यानवध्ये च न कुप्यति |_END
BEGIN_
"Rama's anger or mercy is not arbitrary at any time. He kills those who are to be
slain as per rules. He is not angered at the innocent."_END

B_2_C_3_32
BEGIN_
यतस्त्वया प्रजाश्चेमाः स्वगुणैरनुरञ्जिताः || २-३-४०
तस्मात्त्वं पुष्ययोगेन यौवराज्यमवाप्नुहि |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! As you with your good qualities cherished these people, you get the
princely kingdom on the day of Pushyami star (when the moon appears in conjunction with the
constellation Pushya).."_END

B_2_C_6_10
BEGIN_
नटनर्तकसंघानां गायकानां च गायताम् |
मनःकर्णसुखा वाचः शुश्रुवुश्च ततस्ततः || २-६-१४_END
BEGIN_
From different sides, actors were showing their talents, dancers were performing
dance. Singers were singing and sweet voices were heard, pleasing the minds and ears._END

B_2_C_1_46
BEGIN_
अथोपविष्टे नृपतौ तस्मिन्परबलार्दने || २-१-४८
ततः प्रविविशुः शेषा राजानो लोकसम्मताः |_END
BEGIN_
All the invited kings, duly liked by their people, entered the assembly after the
king Dasaratha , who annihilates the opponent's army, occupied his seat._END

B_2_C_7_4
BEGIN_
उत्तमेनाभिसंयुक्ता हर्षेणार्थपरा सती |
राममाता धनं किं नु जनेभ्यः संप्रयच्छति | २-७-८_END
BEGIN_
"Why is Kausalya giving away money to people so delightfully today in charity,
eventhough she is badly lured of money?"_END

B_2_C_5_15
BEGIN_
जनबृन्दोर्मिसंघर्षहर्षस्वनवतस्तदा |
बभूव राजमार्गस्य सागरस्येव निस्वनः || २-५-१७_END
BEGIN_
Then, on the royal road, the resonance created by the rush of the people, moving
hither and thither like waves, combined with their rejoicing, resounded like the roar of an
ocean._END

B_2_C_2_41
BEGIN_
युनक्त्यर्थैः प्रहृष्टश्च तमसौ यत्र तुष्यति || २-२-४६
शान्तैः सर्वप्रजाकान्तैः प्रीतिसंजननैर्नृणाम् |
गुणैर्विरुरुचे रामो दीप्तः सूर्य इवांशुभिः || २-२-४७_END
BEGIN_
"He gladly bestows wealth to those with whom he is satisfied. As the sun shines by
his rays, Rama shines by his qualities that are peaceful, which are enchanting and delightful to
men."_END

B_2_C_4_24
BEGIN_
कामं खलु सतां वृत्ते भ्राता ते भरतः स्थितः |
ज्येष्ठनुवर्ती धर्मात्मा सानुक्रोशो जितेन्द्रियः || २-४-२६_END
BEGIN_
" Bharata, your brother, goes according to his eldest brother. He is righteous,
compassionate and has the senses under control. He verily follows the path of good people."_END

B_2_C_3_33
BEGIN_
कामतस्त्वं प्रकृत्यैव विनीतो गुणवानसि || २-३-४१
गुणवत्यपि तु स्नेहात्पुत्र वक्ष्यामि ते हितम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, son! By nature, you are very humble and virtuous. Even then, because of my
friendship with you, I can tell you this for your benefit."_END

B_2_C_6_11
BEGIN_
रामाभिषेकयुक्ताश्च कथाश्चक्रुर्मिथो जनाः |
रामाभिषेके संप्रप्ते चत्वरेषु गृहेषु च || २-६-१५_END
BEGIN_
With Rama's anointment ceremony approaching, people were engaged in mutual
conversations in their houses and at road junctions, about the ceremony._END

B_2_C_1_47
BEGIN_
अथ राजवितीर्णेषु विविधेष्वासनेषु च || २-१-४९
राजानमेवाभिमुखा निषेदुर्नियता नृपाः |_END
BEGIN_
The kings thus entered, occupied their various seats allotted to them by the king,
by facing toward the king as per the prescribed rules._END

B_2_C_7_5
BEGIN_
अतिमात्रप्रहर्षोऽयं किं जनस्य च शंस मे |
कारयिष्यति किं वापि संप्रहृष्टो महीपतिः || २-७-९_END
BEGIN_
"Why are people so happy today? Is the king duly pleased with something, doing any
great act? Tell me."_END

B_2_C_5_16
BEGIN_
सिक्तसंमृष्टरथ्या हि तदहर्वनमालिनी |
आसीदयोध्या नगरी समुच्छ्रितगृहध्वजा || २-५-१८_END
BEGIN_
On that day, in the city of Ayodhya, all the roads were cleaned and sprinkled with
water. There were rows of trees on both sides of the roads and flags hoisted on houses._END

B_2_C_4_25
BEGIN_
किन्तु चित्तं मनुष्याणामनित्यमिति मे मतिः |
सतां च धर्मनित्यानां कृतशोभि च राघव || २-४-२७_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! It is my opinion that minds of men are inconstant. But the ever
righteous, endowed with goodness, sometimes may act unexpectedly on impulse."_END

B_2_C_2_42
BEGIN_
तमेवंगुणसम्पन्नं रामं सत्यपराक्रमम् |
लोकपालोपमं नाथमकामयत मेदिनी || २-२-४८_END
BEGIN_
"All people desire Rama, who is endowed with this wealth of qualities, who has true
valour, who is equal to presiding deities like Devendra, to be their lord."_END

B_2_C_3_34
BEGIN_
भूयो विनयमास्थाय भव नित्यं जितेन्द्रियः || २-३-४२
कामक्रोधसमुत्थानि त्यजेथा व्यसनानि च |_END
BEGIN_
"Be even more humble and always keep the senses under control. Leave the bad habits
born out of desire and wrath."_END

B_2_C_6_12
BEGIN_
बाला अपि क्रीडमाना गृ हद्वारेषु संघशः |
रामाभिषवसंयुक्ताश्चक्रुरेवं मिथः कथाः || २-६-१६_END
BEGIN_
Even children playing together before gateways of houses were telling each other,
narratives of Rama's anointment ceremony._END

B_2_C_1_48
BEGIN_
स लब्धमानैर्विनयान्वितैर्नृपैः |
पुरालयैर्जानपदैश्च मानवैः |
उपोपविष्टैर्नृपतिर्वृतो बभौ |
सहस्रचक्षुर्भगवानिवामरैः || २-१-५०_END
BEGIN_
Surrounded by the respected and humble kings sitting closely to him as well as the
important heads of cities and villages, king Dasaratha shone like lord Devendra surrounded by
celestials._END

B_2_C_7_6
BEGIN_
विदीर्यमाणा हर्षेण धात्री तु परया मुदा |
आचचक्षेऽथ कुब्जायै भूयसीं राघवश्रियम् || २-७-१०_END
BEGIN_
That housemaid, bursting with joy, told Manthara in a great gladdening tone about
the great honor to be conferred upon Rama._END

B_2_C_5_17
BEGIN_
तदा ह्ययोध्यानिलयः सस्त्रीबालाबलो जनः |
रामाभिषेकमाकाञ्क्षन्नाकाण्क्षदुदयं रवेः | २-५-१९_END
BEGIN_
Then, the people of Ayodhya including children, women and the old-aged were waiting
for sunrise, wishing the anointment ceremony of Rama to happen._END

B_2_C_2_43
BEGIN_
वत्सः श्रेयसि जातस्ते दिष्ट्यासौ तव राघव |
दिष्ट्या पुत्रगुणैर्युक्तो मारीच इव काश्यपः || २-२-४९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh king Dasaratha! Rama is born to you as a son, because of your good fortune, for
the welfare of this world. He has all the virtues befitting of a son, like Kasyapa, the son of
Marichi."_END

B_2_C_4_26
BEGIN_
इत्युक्तः सोओऽभ्यनुज्ञातः श्वोभाविन्यभिषेचने |
व्रजेति रामः पितरमभिवाद्याभ्ययाद्गृहम् || २-४-२८_END
BEGIN_
Dasaratha, after telling in this way about the ensuing coronation ceremony scheduled
for the next day, permitted Rama to depart. Rama offered his salutations to his father and went to
his house._END

B_2_C_3_35
BEGIN_
परोक्षया वर्तमानो वृत्त्या प्रत्यक्षया तथा || २-३-४३
अमात्यप्रभृतीः सर्वाः प्रकृतीश्चानुरञ्जय |_END
BEGIN_
"Through direct and indirect means, keep ministers and others happy."_END

B_2_C_6_13
BEGIN_
कृतपुष्पोपहारश्च धूपगन्धाधिवासितः |
राजमार्गः कृतः श्रीमान् पौरै रामाभिषेचने || २-६-१७_END
BEGIN_
The citizens made king's road splendid, by sprinkling flowers on it and by making it
good smelling with burning of incense and perfumes, on the occasion of Rama's anointment
ceremony._END

B_2_C_8_0
BEGIN_
मन्थरा त्वभ्यसूयैनामुत्सृज्याभरणं च तत्|
उवाचेदं ततो वाक्यं कोपदुःखसमन्विता || २-८-१_END
BEGIN_
Manthara, becoming indignant with Kaikeyi, threw down the ornament given to her and
with anger and distress spoke the following words:_END

B_2_C_7_7
BEGIN_
श्वः पुष्येण जितक्रोधं यौवराज्येन राघवम् |
राजा दशरथो राममभिषेचयितानघम् || २-७-११_END
BEGIN_
"Tomorrow on the day of Pushyami star, king Dasaratha is going to anoint the
fault-less Rama for the princely kingdom."_END

B_2_C_5_18
BEGIN_
प्रजालङ्कारभूतं च जनस्यानन्दवर्धनम् |
उत्सुकोऽभूज्जनो द्रष्टुं तमयोध्यामहोत्सवम् || २-५-२०_END
BEGIN_
In Ayodhya, people were enthusiastic to see the great public function, which was
decorative to the community and which would bring forward an increased joy._END

B_2_C_2_44
BEGIN_
बलमारोग्यमायुश्च रामस्य विदितात्मनः |
देवासुरमनुष्येषु सगन्धर्वोरगेषु च || २-२-५०
आशंसते जनः सर्वो राष्ट्रे पुरवरे तथा |
आभ्यन्तरश्च बाह्यश्च पौरजानपदो जनः || २-२-५१_END
BEGIN_
"All people in the state including those in the capital as well as those in the
nearby and in the far off places, pray for long life, health and strength of Rama of reputed
nature."_END

B_2_C_4_27
BEGIN_
प्रविश्य चात्मनो वेश्म राज्ञोद्धिष्टेऽभिषेचने |
तत्क्षणेन च निर्गम्य मातुर्न्तःपुरं ययौ || २-४-२९_END
BEGIN_
After hearing the decision of Dasaratha regarding coronation ceremony, Rama entered
his house and by starting immediately, went to his mother's queenly house._END

B_2_C_3_36
BEGIN_
कोष्ठागारायुधागारैः कृत्वा सन्नि चयान् बहून् || २-३-४४
तुष्टानुरक्तप्रकृतिर्यः पालयति मेदिनीम् |
तस्य नन्दन्ति मित्राणि लब्ध्वाऽमृतमिवाऽमराः || २-३-४५
तस्मात्त्वमपि चात्मानं नियम्यैवं समाचर |_END
BEGIN_
"Like the celestials becoming happy after obtaining the nectar, friends of a king
(ruler of earth) are delighted when he fills the granaries and armories to the brim, making the
common people delightful and happy. Hence, you too act like this."_END

B_2_C_6_14
BEGIN_
प्रकाशकरणार्धं च निशागमनशञ्कया |
दीपवृक्षां स्तथाचक्रु रनुर्थ्यसु सर्वशः || २-६-१८_END
BEGIN_
On a doubt of approach of night on completion of the ceremony, they arranged lamps
in the shape of trees to illuminate all the streets._END

B_2_C_8_1
BEGIN_
हर्षं किमिदमस्थाने कृतवत्यसि बालिशे |
शोकसागरमध्यस्थमात्मानं नावबुध्यसे || २-८-२_END
BEGIN_
"O, foolish one! Not knowing that you are in the midst of an ocean of trouble, what
is it that you are so delighted about, in a matter to be grieved?"_END

B_2_C_7_8
BEGIN_
धात्र्यास्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा कुब्जा क्षिप्रममर्षिता |
कैलासशिखराकारात्प्रासादादवरोहत || २-७-१२_END
BEGIN_
After hearing the words of that maid, Manthara quickly with wrath walked down from
the roof of the palace, which was in the shape of mount Kailasa._END

B_2_C_5_19
BEGIN_
एवं तं जनसंबाधं राजमार्गं पुरोहितः |
व्यूहन्निव जनौघं तं शनैराजकुलं ययौ || २-५-२१_END
BEGIN_
Vasishta, thus seeing the king's way being overcrowded with people, reached the
royal palace slowly by forcing a passage through that crowd._END

B_2_C_2_45
BEGIN_
स्त्रियो वृद्धास्तरुण्यश्च सायं प्रातः समाहिताः |
सर्वान् देवान् नमस्यन्ति रामस्यार्थे यशस्विनः || २-२-५२_END
BEGIN_
"Both young and aged women are praying with a stable mind each morning and evening
to all celestials, for the benefit of renowned Rama."_END

B_2_C_4_28
BEGIN_
तत्र तां प्रवणामेव मातरं क्षौमवासिनीम् |
वाग्यतां देवतागारे ददर्शायाचतीं श्रियम् || २-४-३०_END
BEGIN_
There, in the queen's worshipping place, Rama saw Kausalya silently in meditation,
wearing silk clothes and praying to goddess Lakshmi._END

B_2_C_3_37
BEGIN_
तच्छ्रुत्वा सुहृदस्तस्य रामस्य प्रियकारिणः || २-३-४६
त्वरिताः शीघ्रमभ्येत्य कौसल्यायै न्यवेदयन् |_END
BEGIN_
The well -wishers of Rama, after hearing those words, intending to do good to
Kausalya, immediately came to her and informed the matter to her._END

B_2_C_6_15
BEGIN_
अलङ्कारं पुरस्त्यवं कृत्वा तत्पुरवासिनः |
आकाङ्क्षमाणा रामस्य यौवराज्याभिषेचनम् || २-६-१९
समेत्य संघशः सर्वे चत्वरेषु सभासु च |
कथयन्तो मिथस्तत्र प्रशशंसुर्जनाधिपम् || २-६-२०_END
BEGIN_
All the citizens residing in Ayodhya, having thus decorated the city desiring Rama's
coronation, gathered together in groups at road junctions and in assembly halls, mutually talking
about this matter there and praising king Dasaratha._END

B_2_C_8_2
BEGIN_
मनसा प्रहसामि त्वां देवि दुःखार्धिता सती |
यच्छोचितव्ये हृष्टासि प्राप्येदं व्यसनं महत् || २-८-३_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, queen! Though stricken with grief, I mentally laugh at you in that you are
rejoicing at the time when a great calamity is befalling you."_END

B_2_C_7_9
BEGIN_
सा दह्यमाना कोपेन मनथरा पापदर्शिनी |
शयनामेत्य कैकेयीमिदं वचन मब्रवीत् || २-७-१३_END
BEGIN_
Manthara of sinful thought; burning with anger, approached Kaikeyi who was lying on
a bed and spoke these words:_END

B_2_C_2_46
BEGIN_
तेषामायाचितं देव त्वत्प्रसादा त्समृद्ध्यताम् |
राममिन्दीवरश्यामं सर्वशत्रुनिबर्हणम् || २-२-५३
पश्यामो यौवराज्यस्थं तव राजोत्तमाऽअत्मजम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh best of kings, Dasaratha ! We shall see Rama adorned with princely kingdom. Your
son Rama has the complexion of a black lotus flower and annihilates all his enemies. Let the wish
of the people be fulfilled by your grace."_END

B_2_C_5_20
BEGIN_
सिताभ्रशिखरप्रख्यं प्रासादमधिरुह्य सः |
समीयाय नरेन्द्रेण शक्रेणेव बृहस्पतिः || २-५-२२_END
BEGIN_
He walked up the royal palace, which was akin to the top of a mountain enclosed by a
white cloud and met king Dasaratha in the manner Brihaspati met Devendra._END

B_2_C_4_29
BEGIN_
प्रागेव चागता तत्र सुमित्रा लक्ष्मण स्तदा |
सीता चानायिता श्रुत्वा प्रियं रामाभिषेचनम् || २-४-३१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the good news of the coronation ceremony of Rama, Sumitra and Lakshmana came
there even before Seetha was brought._END

B_2_C_3_38
BEGIN_
सा हिरण्यं च गाश्चैव रत्नानि विविधानि च || २-३-४७
व्यादिदेश प्रियाख्येभ्यः कौसल्या प्रमदोत्तमा |_END
BEGIN_
The best among women, Kausalya gave away gold, cows and different types of diamonds
to those who informed her good news._END

B_2_C_8_3
BEGIN_
शोचामि दुर्मतित्वं ते का हि प्राज्ञा प्रहर्षयेत् |
अरेः सपत्नीपुत्रस्य वृद्धिं मृत्युमिवागताम् || २-८-४_END
BEGIN_
"I am lamenting over your foolish mind. Does any intelligent woman feel happy over
the prosperity of a stepson who is considered an enemy? Does it not amount to praising a befalling
death?"_END

B_2_C_6_16
BEGIN_
अहोओ महात्मा राजायमिक्ष्वाकुकुलनन्दनः |
ज्ञात्वा यो वृद्ध मात्मानं रामं राज्येऽभिषेक्ष्यति || २-६-२१_END
BEGIN_
"O! This king Dasaratha, who delights Ikshvaaku dynasty, having known himself that
he became aged, is going to anoint Rama for the kingdom. What a great man he is!"_END

B_2_C_7_10
BEGIN_
उत्तिष्ठ मूढे किं शेषे भयं त्वामभिवर्तते |
उपप्लुतमघौघेन किमात्मानं न बुध्यसे || २-७-१४_END
BEGIN_
"O, fool! Get up. Why are you sleeping? A dreadful situation is befalling you. A
flood of troubles submerges you. Why are you not knowing this yourself?"_END

B_2_C_2_47
BEGIN_
तं देवदेवोपममात्मजं ते |
सर्वस्य लोकस्य हिते निविष्टम् |
हिताय नः क्ष्हिप्रमुदारजुष्टं |
मुदाभिषेक्तुं वरद त्व मर्हसि || २-२-५४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh fulfiller of people's desires, Dasaratha! For our benefit, you gladly and
immediately inaugurate your son Rama, who is equal to Vishnu, who is interested in the welfare of
the entire world and who is possessing the best of virtues."_END

B_2_C_5_21
BEGIN_
तमागतमभिप्रेक्ष्य हित्वा राजासनं नृपः |
पप्रच्छ स च तस्मै तत्कृतमित्यभ्यवेदयत् || २-५-२३_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Vasistha had returned, King Dasaratha alighted from his throne and asked him
with regard to his mission. Vasistha informed him that it was accomplished._END

B_2_C_4_30
BEGIN_
तस्मिन् काले हि कौसल्या तस्थावामीलितेक्षणा |
सुमित्रयान्वास्यमाना सीतया लक्ष्मणेन च ||२-४-३२_END
BEGIN_
At that time, Kausalya closed her eyes and was in meditation. Along with her,
Sumitra, Lakshmana and Seetha were sitting nearby._END

B_2_C_3_39
BEGIN_
अथाभिवाद्य राजानं रथमारुह्य राघवः || २-३-४८
ययौ स्वं द्युतिमद्वेश्म जनौघैः प्रतिपूजितः |_END
BEGIN_
Rama, after offering salutations to king Dasaratha, ascended the chariot and went to
his splendid house after being worshipped by the crowds on the way._END

B_2_C_8_4
BEGIN_
भरतादेव रामस्य राज्यसाधारणाद्भयम् |
तद्विचिन्त्य विषण्णास्मि भय भीताद्धि जायते || २-८-५_END
BEGIN_
"Rama has a fear about Bharata because Bharata has equal rights over the kingdom. In
thinking about this matter, I am getting anguished. Do we not get disasters from those who are
afraid of us?"_END

B_2_C_6_17
BEGIN_
सर्वेऽप्यनुगृहीताः स्म यन्नो रामो महीपतिः |
चिराय भविता गोप्ता दृष्टलोकपरावरः || २-६-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Rama; who has seen the totality of the world is going to become our protector for
long. We have all been blessed by king Dasaratha."_END

B_2_C_7_11
BEGIN_
अनिष्टे सुभगाकारे सौभग्येन विकत्थसे |
चलं हि तव सौभाग्यं नद्याः स्रोत इवोष्णगे ||२-७-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Kaikeyi ! You appear to be a beloved wife for your husband, but in reality he
does not like you. You boast of your fortune. Like the flow of a stream in summer; your fortune is
unsteady"._END

B_2_C_5_22
BEGIN_
तेन चैव तदा तुल्यं सहासीनाः सभासदः |
आसनेभ्यः समुत्तस्थुः पूजयन्तः पुरोहितम् || २-५-२४_END
BEGIN_
The members of assembly who were sitting along with the king till then, raised in
obeisance to Vasishta from their seats, following the example of the king._END

B_2_C_4_31
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा पुष्येण पुत्रस्य यौवराज्याभिषेचनम् |
प्राणायामेन पुरुषं ध्यायमाना जनार्दनम् || २-४-३३_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that her son will be anointed for the princely kingdom on the day of
Pushyami star, Kausalya with controlled breath, was meditating on lord Vishnu._END

B_2_C_3_40
BEGIN_
ते चापि पौरा नृपतेर्वचस्त |
च्छ्रुत्वा तदा लाभमिवेष्टमाशु |
नरेन्द्रमामन्त्र्य गृहाणि गत्वा |
देवान् समानर्चुरतिप्रहृष्टाः || २-३-४९_END
BEGIN_
Having heard those words of the king, seeing their dearest wish gratified, the
citizens took leave of the King Dasaratha and returned to their homes full of joy, in order to give
thanks and render homage to the Gods._END

B_2_C_6_18
BEGIN_
आनुद्धतमना विद्वान् धर्मात्मा भ्रातृवत्सलः |
यधा च भ्रातृषु स्निग्धस्तथास्मास्वपि राघवः || २-६-२३_END
BEGIN_
"Rama is modest, knowledgeable and righteous. He is as compassionate to us as to his
brothers."_END

B_2_C_8_5
BEGIN_
लक्ष्मणो हि महेष्वासो रामं सर्वात्मना गतः |
शत्रुघ्नश्चापि भरतं काकुत्थ्सं लक्ष्मणो यथा || २-८-६_END
BEGIN_
"Lakshmana, wielding a great bow, joined Rama with all his heart. Shatrughna is as
faithful to Bharata as Lakshmana to Rama"._END

B_2_C_7_12
BEGIN_
एवमुक्ता तु कैकेयी रुष्टया परुषं वचः |
कुब्जया पापदर्शिन्या विषादमगमत्परम् || २-७-१६_END
BEGIN_
Kaikeyi was very much worried after hearing hard words spoken with anger by Manthara
of sinful thoughts._END

B_2_C_5_23
BEGIN_
गुरुणा त्वभ्यनुज्ञातो मनिजौघं विसृज्य तम् |
विवेशान्तःपुरं राजा सिंहो गिरिगुहामिव || २-५-२५_END
BEGIN_
King Dasaratha, after obtaining permission from Vasishta, left that assembly of men
and entered his palace as a lion enters a mountain cave._END

B_2_C_4_32
BEGIN_
तथा सनियमामेव सोऽभिगम्याभिवाद्य च |
उवाच वचनं रामो हर्ष्यंस्तामिदं तदा || २-४-३४_END
BEGIN_
Rama approached his mother, even while she was engaged in pious observance, offered
salutation and spoke the following words making her delighted._END

B_2_C_6_19
BEGIN_
चिरं जीवतु धर्मात्मा राजा दशरथोऽनघः |
यत्प्रसादेनाभिषिक्तं रामं द्रक्ष्यामहे वयम् || २-६-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Let the faultless and righteous king Dasaratha live long! Due to his blessings, we
are going to see Rama as being anointed for the kingdom."_END

B_2_C_8_6
BEGIN_
प्रत्यासन्नक्रमेणापि भरतस्तैव भामिनि |
राज्यक्रमो विप्रकृष्टस्तयोस्तावत्कनीयसोः || २-८-७_END
BEGIN_
"Oh Kaikeyi! In line with even the proximity of birth; the claim to the throne of
Bharata alone can be pressed, that of Lakshmana and Satrughna who are younger is out of
question."_END

B_2_C_7_13
BEGIN_
कैकेयि त्वब्रवीत्कुभां कच्चित्क्षेमं न मनथरे |
विषण्णवदनां हि त्वां लक्षये भृ शदुःखिताम् || २-७-१७_END
BEGIN_
Kaikeyi asked the hunch-backed Manthara as follows; "O, Manthara! Are you not safe?
You appear to be very sorrowful with your worried face"._END

B_2_C_9_0
BEGIN_
एवमुक्ता तु कैकेयी कोपेन ज्वलितानना |
दीर्घमुष्टम् विनिःश्वस्य मन्थरामिदम् अब्रवीत् || ९-२-१_END
BEGIN_
After hearing those words, Kaikeyi with her face burning with anger, had a long and
hot sigh and spoke to Manthara as follows:_END

B_2_C_5_24
BEGIN_
तमग्र्यवेष्प्रमदाजनाकुलं |
महेन्द्रवेश्मप्रतिमं निवेशनम् |
विदीपयंश्चारु विवेश पार्थिवः |
शशीव तारागणसंकुलं नभः || २-५-२६_END
BEGIN_
That palace with women in top dress and form was like the palace of Devendra. By the
entering of King Dasaratha, the palace became more radiant, just as the moon radiates a beautiful
sky with its stars._END

B_2_C_4_33
BEGIN_
अम्ब पित्रा नियुक्तोऽस्मि प्रजापालनकर्मणि |
भविता श्वोऽभिषेको मे यथा मि शासनं पितुः || २-४-३५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, mother! My father ordered that I should rule the people. As per his orders,
there will be anointing ceremony to me tomorrow."_END

B_2_C_6_20
BEGIN_
एवंविधं कथयतां पौराणां शुश्रुवुस्तदा |
दिग्भ्योऽपि श्रुतवृत्तान्ताः प्राप्ताजानपदा नराः || २-६-२५_END
BEGIN_
The villagers, who came from different directions after hearing the news of
coronation ceremony of Rama, listened to the narration of the citizens of Ayodhya._END

B_2_C_8_7
BEGIN_
विदुषः क्षत्रचारित्रे प्राज्ञस्य प्राप्तकारिणः |
भयात्प्रवेपे रामस्य चिन्तयन्ती तवात्मजम् || २-८-८_END
BEGIN_
"Rama is a learned man and a political statesman. His actions are timely and
appropriate. When thinking of your son's calamity to be resulted from Rama, I get shaken with
fear"._END

B_2_C_7_14
BEGIN_
मन्थरा तु वचः श्रुत्वा कैकेय्या मधुराक्षरम् |
उवाच क्रोधसंयुक्ता वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदा || २-७-१८_END
BEGIN_
After hearing Kaikeyi's sweet words, Manthara who was an expert in talking, spoke
with anger._END

B_2_C_9_1
BEGIN_
अद्य राममितः क्षिप्रं वनं प्रस्थापयाम्यहम् |
यौवराज्ये च भरतं क्षिप्रमेवाभिषेचये || ९-२-२_END
BEGIN_
"Now itself, I shall send Rama quickly to forest. I shall get Bharata anointed for
princely kingdom immediately."_END

B_2_C_4_34
BEGIN_
सीतया प्युपवस्तव्या रजनीयं मया सह |
एवमृत्विगुपाध्यायैस्सह मामुक्तवान् पिता || २-४-३६_END
BEGIN_
"Seetha too, along with me should observe fast this whole night. The father together
with preceptors and teachers said this to me."_END

B_2_C_6_21
BEGIN_
ते तु दिग्भ्यः पुरीं प्राप्ता द्रष्टुं रामाभिषेचनम् |
रामस्य पूरयामासुः पुरीं जानपदा जनाः || २-६-२६_END
BEGIN_
The city of Ayodhya was filled with villagers who came from different directions to
see the anointment ceremony of Rama._END

B_2_C_8_8
BEGIN_
सुभगा खलु कौसल्या यस्याः पुत्रोऽभिषेक्ष्यते |
यौवराज्येन महता श्वः पुष्येण द्विजोत्तमैः || २-८-९_END
BEGIN_
"Kausalya is very fortunate. Brahmans are going to anoint her son for the great
princely kingdom tomorrow on the day of Pushyami star"._END

B_2_C_7_15
BEGIN_
सा विषण्णतरा भूत्वा कुब्जा तस्या हितैषिणी |
विषदयन्ती प्रोवाच भेदयन्ती च राघवम् || २-७-१९_END
BEGIN_
That Manthara, who was full of cunning, feigning to be seeking Kaikeyi's welfare,
appeared more worried, and making Kaikeyi sorrowful, spoke the following, to create hostility
between Rama and Kaikeyi._END

B_2_C_9_2
BEGIN_
इदं त्विदानीं संपश्य केनोपायेन मन्थरे |
भरतः प्राप्नुयाद्राज्यं न तु रामः कथंचन|| ९-२-३_END
BEGIN_
"O Manthara! What is the means by which Bharata will get the kingdom but Rama will
not get it by any method. Think about it now."_END

B_2_C_4_35
BEGIN_
यानि यान्यत्र योग्यानि श्वो भाविन्यभिषेचने |
तानि मे मङ्गळान्यद्य वैदेह्याश्चैव कारय || २-४-३७_END
BEGIN_
"Have all the auspicious rites that are required for the ensuing tomorrow's
anointment ceremony, performed to me and to Seetha today."_END

B_2_C_6_22
BEGIN_
जनौघै स्तैर्विसर्पद्भिः शुश्रुवे तत्र निस्वनः |
पर्वसूदीर्णवेगस्य सागरस्येव निस्वनः || २-६-२७_END
BEGIN_
The noise in the city was heard by the groups of those people, while moving here and
there, as the roaring of an impetuous ocean on full moon days._END

B_2_C_8_9
BEGIN_
प्राप्तां सुमहतीं प्रीतिं प्रतीतां तां हतद्विषम् |
उपस्थास्यसि कौसल्यां दासीवत्त्वं कृताञ्जलिः || २-८-१०_END
BEGIN_
"With folded arms, as a maid-servant, you have to serve that Kausalya who having
reached great prosperity, in the height of joy, will dispose of her adversaries (in the person of
Bharata and yourself)"._END

B_2_C_7_16
BEGIN_
अक्षय्यं सुमहद्देवि प्रवृत्तं द्वद्विनाशनम् |
रामं दशरथो राजा यौवराज्येऽभिषेक्ष्यति || २-७-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, queen! An unending great ruin has encircled you. King Dasaratha is going to
anoint Rama for the princely kingdom"._END

B_2_C_9_3
BEGIN_
एवमुक्ता तया देव्या मन्थरा पापदर्शिनी |
रामार्थमुपहिंसन्ती कैकेयीमिदमब्रवीत् || ९-२-४_END
BEGIN_
After hearing her words, the sinful thinking Manthara, spoke thus to Kaikeyi to
destroy Rama's benefit of kingdom._END

B_2_C_4_36
BEGIN_
एतच्छ्रुत्वा तु कौसल्या चिरकालाभिकाङ्क्षितम् |
हर्ष्बाष्पकलं वाक्यमिदं राम मभाषत || २-४-३८_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the news of anointment ceremony, which was being desired by her for a long
time, Kausalya spoke to Rama the following sweet words with tears of joy in her eyes._END

B_2_C_6_23
BEGIN_
ततस्तदिन्द्रक्षयसन्निभं पुरं |
दिदृक्षुभिर्जानपदै रुपागतैः |
समन्ततः सस्वनमाकुलं बभौ |
समुद्रयादोभि रिवार्णवोदकम् || २-६-२८_END
BEGIN_
That city of Ayodhya equal to the residence of the celestial god Indra, disturbed
with the sound being made all over by the villagers who came with the desire to see the ceremony,
shone like a roaring ocean filled with sea animals._END

B_2_C_8_10
BEGIN_
एवम् चेत्त्वं सहास्माभिस्तस्याः प्रेष्य भविष्यसि |
पुत्रश्च तव रामस्य प्रेष्यभावं गमिष्यति || २-८-११_END
BEGIN_
"Thus, if you become Kausalya's servant-maid along with us, your son Bharata will be
Rama's attendant."_END

B_2_C_7_17
BEGIN_
सास्म्यगाधे भये मग्ना दुःखशोकसमन्विता |
दह्यमानाऽ नलेनेव त्वद्धितार्थमिहागता || २-७-२१_END
BEGIN_
"I am immersed in a bottomless pit of fear. I am in distress and my mind is burning
as if by fire. I hastened here to seek you out."_END

B_2_C_9_4
BEGIN_
हन्तेदानीं प्रवक्ष्यामि कैकेयि श्रूयतां च मे |
यथा ते भरतो राज्यं पुत्रः प्राप्स्यति केवलम् || ९-२-५_END
BEGIN_
"O Kaikeyi! I am very glad. I shall tell you the means by which your son Bharata
only will get the kingdom. Listen to it!"_END

B_2_C_4_37
BEGIN_
वत्स राम चिरं जीव हतास्ते परिपन्थिनः |
ज्ञातीन्मे त्वं श्रियायुक्तः सुमित्रायाश्च नन्दय || २-४-३९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, child Rama! You live a long life! Let your enemies be destroyed! Let the
cousins of mine and of Sumitra be made happy by your glory."_END

B_2_C_8_11
BEGIN_
हृष्टाः खलु भविष्यन्ति रामस्य परमाः स्त्रियः |
अप्रहृष्टा भविष्यन्ति स्नुषास्ते भरतक्षये || २-८-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Rama's wives will get delighted. Your daughters-in-law will be unhappy because of
Bharata's waning position."_END

B_2_C_7_18
BEGIN_
तव दुःखेन कैकेयि मम दुःखं महद्भवेत् |
त्वद्वृद्धौ मम वृद्धिश्च भवेदत्र न संशयः || २-७-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Kaikeyi! If Rama becomes king, his son will become king after him. Thus, Bharata's
name itself will be removed from the royal clan."_END

B_2_C_9_5
BEGIN_
किं न स्मरसि कैकेयि स्मरन्ती वा निगूहसे |
यदुच्यमानमात्मार्थं मत्तस्त्वं श्रोतुमिच्छसि || ९-२-६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Kaikeyi! You desire to hear from me the means for your benefit. Have you
forgotten about it or are you hiding, even if you have remembered it?"_END

B_2_C_8_12
BEGIN_
तां दृष्ट्वा परमप्रीतां ब्रुवन्तीं मन्थरां ततः |
रामस्यैव गुणान् देवी कैकेयि प्रशशंस ह || २-८-१३_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Manthara speak thus in many distasteful words, Kaikeyi began to extol Rama's
virtues, saying: -_END

B_2_C_4_38
BEGIN_
कल्याणे बत न्क्षत्रे मयि जातोऽसि पुत्रक |
येन त्वया दशरथो गुणैराराधितः पिता || २-४-४०_END
BEGIN_
"O, my little son! You were born to me on a day of an auspicious star. That is why,
your father king Dasaratha was propitiated by your virtues."_END

B_2_C_7_19
BEGIN_
नराधिपकुले जाता महिषी त्वं महीपतेः |
उग्रत्वं राजधर्माणां कथं देवि न बुध्यसे || २-७-२३_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Kaikeyi! Having born in a royal family and being an emperor's wife, how is it
that you are not knowing about the cruelty in kingly duties?"_END

B_2_C_9_6
BEGIN_
मयोच्यमानं यदि ते श्रोतुं छन्दो विलासिनि |
श्रूयतामभिधास्यामि श्रुत्वा चैतद् विधीयताम् || ९-२-७_END
BEGIN_
"O the lady of charms, Kaikeyi! If you desire to hear this from my mouth, I shall
tell you. Listen to me. Let it be acted upon after listening to me."_END

B_2_C_8_13
BEGIN_
धर्मज्ञो गुरुभिर्दान्तः कृतज्ञ सत्यवाक्चुचि |
रामो राज्ञः सुतो ज्येष्ठो यौवराज्यमतोऽर्हति || २-८-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Rama knows all righteousness. Elders trained him. He has a proper gratitude. He
speaks truth. He has a clean conduct. He is the eldest son of king Dasaratha and hence eligible for
the kingdom."_END

B_2_C_4_39
BEGIN_
अमोघं बत मे क्षान्तं पुरुषे पुष्करेक्षणे |
येयमिक्ष्वाकुराज्यश्रीः पुत्र त्वां संश्रयिष्यति || २-४-४१_END
BEGIN_
"O, son! My worship to the lotus eyed Lord Vishnu with endurance has become
fruitful. Hence, this glorious kingdom of Ikshvaku dynasty is going to embrace you."_END

B_2_C_7_20
BEGIN_
धर्मवादी शठो भर्ता श्लक्ष्णवादी च दारुणः |
शुद्धभावे न जानीषे तेनैवमतिसन्धिता || २-७-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Your husband talks about righteousness, but does harm secretly. He says sweet words
but behaves cruelly. Because of your clean thinking; you are not able to know that he is cheating
you thus."_END

B_2_C_9_7
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वैवं वचनं तस्या मन्थरायास्तु कैकयि |
किंचिदुत्थाय शयनात्स्वास्तीर्णादिदमब्रवीत् || ९-२-८_END
BEGIN_
After hearing Manthara's words, Kaikeyi slightly rose from the well-laid bed and
spoke the following :_END

B_2_C_4_40
BEGIN_
इत्येवमुक्तो मात्रेदं रामो भ्रातरमब्रवीत् |
प्राञ्जलिं प्रह्वमासीनमभिवीख्स्य स्मयन्निव || २-४-४२_END
BEGIN_
Rama, after hearing the words spoken by his mother, saw his brother Lakshmana who
