was sitting humbly nearby with joined palms and spoke to him smilingly as follows:_END

B_2_C_8_14
BEGIN_
भ्रात्ऱ्^ऊन्भृत्यांश्च दीर्घायुः पितृवत्पालयिष्यति |
संतप्यसे कथं कुब्जे श्रुत्वा रामाभिषेचनम् || २-८-१५_END
BEGIN_
"The long living Rama will protect his brothers and servants like a father. O, the
hunch backed one! Why are you so pained on hearing about Rama's coronation?"_END

B_2_C_7_21
BEGIN_
उपस्थितं पयुञ्जानस्त्वयि सान्त्वमनर्थकम् |
अर्थेनैवाद्य ते भर्ता कौसल्यां योजयिष्यति || २-७-२५_END
BEGIN_
"Your husband approaches you and talks good words, which are useless. But he passes
on benefit today to Kausalya only."_END

B_2_C_9_8
BEGIN_
कथय त्वं ममोपायं केनोपायेन मन्थरे |
भरतः प्राप्नुयाद्रज्यं न तु रामः कथंचन || ९-२-९_END
BEGIN_
"O Manthara! Tell me the trick by which Bharata will get the kingdom and Rama will
not get it under any circumstances."_END

B_2_C_4_41
BEGIN_
लक्ष्मणेमां माया सार्धं प्रशाधि त्वं वसुन्धराम् |
द्वितीयं मेऽन्तरात्मानं त्वामियं श्रीरुपस्थिता || २-४-४३_END
BEGIN_
"O, Lakshmana! You rule this earth together with me. This glorious kingdom has
reached you, who are my second conscience."_END

B_2_C_8_15
BEGIN_
भरतश्चापि रामस्य ध्रुवं वर्षशतात्परम् |
पितृपैतामहं राज्यमवाप्ता पुरुषर्षभः || २-८-१६_END
BEGIN_
"After Rama's rule for one hundred years, Bharata the best among men will certainly
replace Rama on his father's throne, which is that of his ancestors."_END

B_2_C_7_22
BEGIN_
अपवाह्य स दुष्टात्मा भरतं तव बन्धुषु |
काल्यं स्थापयिता रामं राज्ये निहतकण्टके || २-७-२६_END
BEGIN_
"The evil minded Dasaratha sent Bharata to the house of his relatives and at dawn,
is going to install Rama on the throne without hindrance."_END

B_2_C_9_9
BEGIN_
एवमुक्ता तया देव्या मन्थरा पापदर्शिनी |
रामार्थमुपहिंसन्ती कुब्जा वचनमब्रवीत् || ९-२-१०_END
BEGIN_
After hearing Kaikeyi's words, the sinful thinking, hunch backed Manthara, spoke
thus, with an intention to destroy Rama's benefit of kingdom._END

B_2_C_8_16
BEGIN_
सा त्वमभ्युदये प्राप्ते वर्तमाने च मन्थरे |
भविष्यति च कल्याणे किमर्थं परितप्यसे || २-८-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Manthara! When we got an occasion for rejoicing as at present and when a
festive occasion is to come off in future (too in the form of Bharata's installation, no matter
even if it comes after a hundred years), why do you feel agonized like this as though burning (with
jealousy)?"_END

B_2_C_4_42
BEGIN_
सौमित्रे भुङ्क्ष्व भोगां स्त्वमिष्टान् राज्यफलानि च |
जीवितं च हि राज्यं च त्वदर्थमभिकामये || २-४-४४_END
BEGIN_
"O, Lakshmana! You enjoy the benefits as desired by you and the fruits of kingdom. I
desire to live and even to rule the kingdom but for you."_END

B_2_C_7_23
BEGIN_
शत्रुः पतिप्रवादेन मात्रेव हितकाम्यया |
आशीविष इवाङ्केन बाले परिधृतस्त्वया || २-७-२७_END
BEGIN_
"O, childish one! Like a mother, you wish for his well being. But he is an enemy,
and is called husband for a namesake. He is like a poisonous serpent in your bosom."_END

B_2_C_9_10
BEGIN_
तव दैवासुरे युद्धे सहराजर्षिभिः पतिः |
अगच्छत्त्वामुपादाय देवराजस्य साह्यकृत् || ९-२-११
दिशमास्थाय वै देवि दक्षिणां दण्डकान् प्रति |
वैजयन्तमिति क्यातं पुरं यत्र तिमिध्वजः || ९-२-१२_END
BEGIN_
"O Queen! Once upon a time, when there was a battle between celestials and demons,
your husband Dasaratha went along with you and other holy kings to help Indra in battle, to a
famous city called Vaijayata in which the demon Timidhvaja lived in a southern direction in the
forest of Dandaka."_END

B_2_C_8_17
BEGIN_
यथा ने भरतो मान्यस्तथा भूयोऽपि राघावः |
कौसल्यातोऽरिक्तं च सो हि शुश्रूषते हि माम् || २-८-१८_END
BEGIN_
"For me, Rama is as lovable as Bharata and even more. Is he not doing more service
to me than to Kausalya?"_END

B_2_C_4_43
BEGIN_
इत्युक्त्वा लक्ष्मणं रामो मातरावभिवाद्य च |
अभ्यनुज्ञाप्य सीतां च जगाम स्वं निवेश्नम् || २-४-४५_END
BEGIN_
Rama, after speaking thus to Lakshmana, offered salutations to both the mothers, got
Seetha to obtain permission from them and went to his house along with Seetha._END

B_2_C_7_24
BEGIN_
यथा हि कुर्यात्सर्पो वा शत्रुर्वा प्रत्युपेक्षितः |
राज्ञा दशरथेनाद्य सपुत्रा त्वं तथा कृता || २-७-२८_END
BEGIN_
"King Dasaratha has acted towards you and your son today in the same way as an enemy
or a serpent would behave if ignored."_END

B_2_C_9_11
BEGIN_
स शम्बर इति ख्यातः शतमायो महासुरः |
ददौ शक्रस्य संग्रामं देवसङिघैरनिर्जितः || ९-२-१३_END
BEGIN_
"That great demon famously called shambara, who had several magic effects, defeated
all the celestials and conferred battle upon Devendra."_END

B_2_C_8_18
BEGIN_
राज्यं यदि हि रामस्य भरतस्यापि तत्तदा |
मन्यते हि यथात्मानं तथा भ्रात्ऱ्^ऊंश्च राघवः || २-८-१९_END
BEGIN_
"If Rama has kingdom then Bharata has it as well. Rama esteems his brothers just as
his own self."_END

B_2_C_7_25
BEGIN_
पापेनानृतसान्त्वेन बाले नित्यं सुखोचिते |
रामं स्थापयता राज्ये सानुबन्धा हता ह्यसि || २-७-२९_END
BEGIN_
"O, stupid one! With his untruthful sweet words to you, who are ever deserving of
ease, the evil minded king is installing Rama on the throne and is thus ruining you along with your
son."_END

B_2_C_9_12
BEGIN_
तस्मिन् महति संग्रामे पुरुषान् क्षतविक्षतान् |
रात्रौ प्रसुप्तान् घ्नन्ति स्म तरसासाद्य राक्षसाः || ९-२-१४_END
BEGIN_
"In that great battle, demons approached and forcefully killed men who were injured
by arrows and also those who were sleeping at night."_END

B_2_C_8_19
BEGIN_
कैकेयीवचनं श्रुत्वा मन्थरा भृशदुःखिता |
दीर्घमुष्णं निःश्वस्य कैकेयीमिदमब्रवीत् || २-८-२०_END
BEGIN_
Manthara, after hearing Kaikeyi's words, felt very sad and after a long and hot
sigh, spoke to her the following words:_END

B_2_C_10_0
BEGIN_
विदर्शिता यदा देवी कुब्जया पापया भृशम् |
तदा शेते स्म सा भूमौ दिग्धविद्धेव किन्नरी || २-१०-१_END
BEGIN_
Having been thus wrongly preached by that sinful Manthara. Kaikeyi lied down on the
floor as a Kinnara woman beaten by a poisoned arrow._END

B_2_C_7_26
BEGIN_
सा प्राप्तकालं कैकेयि क्षिप्रं कुरु हितं तव |
त्रायस्व पुत्रमात्मानं मां च विस्मयदर्शने || २-७-३०_END
BEGIN_
"O, Kaikeyi, of amazing beauty! You have to take timely action immediately, so as to
save yourself, your son and me too."_END

B_2_C_9_13
BEGIN_
तत्राकरोन्महायुद्धं राजा दशरथ स्तदा |
असुरैश्च महाबाहुः शस्त्रैश्च शकलीकृतः || ९-२-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Then, king Dasaratha fought a great battle there. With their weapons, demons made
into pieces the long armed Dasaratha."_END

B_2_C_10_1
BEGIN_
निश्चित्य मनसा कृत्यम् सा सम्यगिति भामिनी |
मन्थरायै श्नः सर्वमाच्चक्षे विचक्षणा || २-१०-२_END
BEGIN_
The skilful Kaikeyi, after deciding in mind what ought to be done told it all slowly
to Manthara._END

B_2_C_8_20
BEGIN_
अनर्थदर्शिनी मौर्ख्यान्नात्मानमवबुध्यसे |
शोकव्यसनविस्तीर्णे मज्जन्ती दुःखसागरे || २-८-२१_END
BEGIN_
"On one side, you are getting immersed in an ocean of sorrow filled with misery and
danger. But due to stupidity, you are not able to perceive the truth and you fail to assess your
real position."_END

B_2_C_7_27
BEGIN_
मन्थराया वचः श्रुत्वा शयनात्स शुभानना |
उत्तस्थौ हर्षसंपूर्णा चन्द्रलेखेव शारदी || २-७-३१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Manthara's words, that Kaikeyi of charming countenance who was lying in bed,
rose from her coach full of delight like unto the crescent moon in autumn._END

B_2_C_9_14
BEGIN_
अपवाह्य त्वया देवि संग्रामान्नष्टचेतनः |
तत्रपि विक्षतः शस्रैः पतिस्ते रक्षितस्त्वया || ९-२-१६_END
BEGIN_
"O Queen! You saved the life of your unconscious husband by taking him away from the
battle field. There also, you again saved him, when beaten by demons with their weapons."_END

B_2_C_10_2
BEGIN_
सा दीना निश्चयं कृत्वा मन्थरावाक्यमोहिता |
नागकन्येव निःस्वस्य दीर्घमुष्णं च भामिनी || २-१०-३
मुहूर्तं चिन्तयामास मार्गमात्मसुखावहम् |_END
BEGIN_
Being stupefied by the words of Manthara, that Kaikeyi became dejected, made firm
resolve, with deep and warm sigh, like a maiden-serpent and thought for that moment about the ways
which can lead to her happiness._END

B_2_C_8_21
BEGIN_
भविता राघवो राजा राघवस्यानु यः सुतः |
राजवंशात्तु कैकेयि भरतः परिहास्यते || २-८-२२_END
BEGIN_
"O,Kaikeyi! If Rama becomes the king, his son will become the king after him in
succession. Thus, Bharata's name itself will be removed from the royal clan."_END

B_2_C_7_28
BEGIN_
अतीव सा तु संहृष्टाअ कैकेयी विस्मयान्विता |
एकमाभरणं तस्यै कुब्जायै प्रददौ शुभम् || २-७-३२_END
BEGIN_
That Kaikeyi in the midst of her astonishment and joy gave a graceful jewel to the
hunch-backed Manthara._END

B_2_C_9_15
BEGIN_
तुष्टेन तेन दत्तौ ते द्वौ वरौ शुभदर्शने |
सत्वयोक्तः पतिर्देवि यदेच्छेयं तदा वरौ || ९-२-१७
गृह्णीयामिति तत्तन तधेत्युक्तं महात्मना |_END
BEGIN_
"O Kaikeyi with auspicious appearance! Getting delighted, he gave two boons to you.
Then, you said, " I shall ask you whenever I require them". He then agreed to it."_END

B_2_C_10_3
BEGIN_
सा सुहृच्चार्थकामा च तं निशम्य सुनिश्चयम् || २-१०-४
बभूव परमप्रीता सिद्धिं प्राप्येव मन्थरा |_END
BEGIN_
Manthara, who is Kaikeyi's companion and who is desirous of getting benefit, heard
of Kaikeyi's firm resolve and became very much pleased as if she achieved success._END

B_2_C_8_22
BEGIN_
न हि राज्ञः सुताः सर्वे राज्ये तिष्ठन्ति भामिनि |
स्थाप्यमानेषु सर्वेषु सुमहाननयो भवेत् || २-८-२३_END
BEGIN_
"O, Kaikeyi! All the sons of a king will not be crowned for a kingdom. If all are
installed, there will be a great lawlessness."_END

B_2_C_7_29
BEGIN_
दत्त्वा त्वाभरणं तस्यै कुब्जायै प्रमदोत्तमा |
कैकेयी मन्थरां हृष्टा पुनरेवाब्रवीदिदम् || २-७-३३_END
BEGIN_
Kaikeyi, the best among women, gave a jewel to Manthara and spoke to her as
follows:_END

B_2_C_10_4
BEGIN_
अथ सा रुषिता देवी सम्यक्कृत्वा विनिश्चयम् || २-१०-५
संविवेशाबला भूमौ निवेश्य भृकुटिं मुखे |_END
BEGIN_
Kaikeyi, being angry and well determined, lied down on the floor with eye brows,
knitted in her face._END

B_2_C_9_16
BEGIN_
अनभिज्ञा ह्यहं देवि त्वयैव कथिता पुरा || ९-२-१८
कथैषा तव तु स्नेहान्मनसा धार्यते मया |
रामाभिषेकसंभारान्निगृह्य विनिवर्तय || ९-२-१९_END
BEGIN_
"O Queen! I do not know what had happened there. You yourself told this story
previously to me. I am keeping this in my mind because of my friendship with you. Hence, you have
to stop, by force, the arrangements being made for Rama's coronation."_END

B_2_C_8_23
BEGIN_
तस्माज्ज्येष्ठे हि कैकेयि राज्यतन्त्राणि पार्थिवाः |
स्थापयन्त्यनवद्याङ्गि गुणवत्स्वतरेष्वपि || २-८-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Therefore, kings, O, Kaikeyi of faultless limbs, install their eldest son,
eventhough others may be full of virtues, as their successor to the throne."_END

B_2_C_7_30
BEGIN_
इदं तु मन्थरे मह्यमाख्यासि परमं प्रियम् |
एतन्मे प्रियमाख्यातुः किं वा भूयः करोमि ते || २-७-३४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Manthara! You informed much gladdening news to me. What else can I do for you,
who informed such a good news?"_END

B_2_C_10_5
BEGIN_
ततश्चित्राणि माल्यानि दिव्यान्याभरणानि च || २-१०-६
अपविद्धानि कैकेय्या तानि भूमिं प्रपेदिरे |_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, she threw away her colourful chaplets and beautiful ornaments on to the
floor._END

B_2_C_9_17
BEGIN_
तौ वरौ याच भर्तारं भरतस्याभिषेचनम् |
प्रव्राजनं तु रामस्य त्वं वर्षाणि चतुर्दश || ९-२-२०_END
BEGIN_
"You ask your husband as two boons, anointing Bharata for princely kingdom and
sending Rama to exile for fourteen years."_END

B_2_C_8_24
BEGIN_
असावत्यन्तनिर्भग्न स्तवपुत्रो भविष्यति |
अनाथवत्सुखेभ्यश्च राजवंशाच्च वत्सले || २-८-२५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Kaikeyi the affectionate one! Your son will be completely distant from comforts
and even from the royal clan; like an orphan."_END

B_2_C_7_31
BEGIN_
रामे वा भरते वाहं विशेषं नोपलक्षये |
तस्मात्तुष्टास्मि यद्राजा रामं राज्येऽभिषेक्ष्यति || २-७-३५_END
BEGIN_
"I do not see any difference between Rama and Bharata. That is why, I am happy that
Rama is being anointed for crown by the king."_END

B_2_C_10_6
BEGIN_
तया तान्यपविद्धानि माल्यान्याभरणानि च || २-१०-७
अशोभयन्त वसुधां नक्षत्राणि यथा नभः |_END
BEGIN_
Those chaplets and ornaments which were thrown away by her were making the earth
shine, as stars to the sky._END

B_2_C_9_18
BEGIN_
चतुर्दश हि वर्षाणिरामे प्रव्राजिते वनम् |
प्रजाभावगतस्नेहः स्थिरः पुत्रो भविष्यति || ९-२-२१_END
BEGIN_
If you send Rama to forest for fourteen years, your son Bharata will get intimate
association in the hearts of the people and will get stabilised in kingdom._END

B_2_C_8_25
BEGIN_
साहं त्वदर्थे संप्राप्ता त्वं तु मां नावबुध्यसे |
सपत्निवृद्दौ या मे त्वं प्रदेयं दातुमिच्चिसि || २-८-२६_END
BEGIN_
"I came here in your interests. But you have not understood me. You think it fit to
give me a present when your step-wife is getting prospered."_END

B_2_C_7_32
BEGIN_
न मे परम् किञ्चि दितस्त्वयापि न |
प्रियं प्रियार्हे सुवचम् वचो परम् |
तथा ह्यवोचस्त्वमतः प्रियोत्तरं |
वरं वरं ते प्रददामि तं वृणु || २-७-३६_END
BEGIN_
"O, Manthara! You do merit every favor. I have no other pleasant news than this.
Hence, you cannot ever again inform a better loving news than this. I shall give you a good boon.
Ask for it!"_END

B_2_C_10_7
BEGIN_
क्रोधागारे निपतिता सा बभौ मलिनाम्बरा || २-१०-८
एकवेणीं दृढं बद्ध्वा गतसत्त्वेव किन्नरी |_END
BEGIN_
Tying her single braid of hair tightly over her head and wearing soiled clothes,
that Kaikeyi lying down in the chamber of wrath was looking like a Kinnara woman lying down
dead._END

B_2_C_9_19
BEGIN_
क्रोधागारं प्रविश्याद्य कृद्द्धेवाश्वपतेः सुते |
शेष्वानन्तर्हितायां त्वं भूमौ मलिनवासिनी || ९-२-२२_END
BEGIN_
Oh, kaikeyi! Now, enter the room of wrath as if angry with him and lie down on floor
without any spread underneath and wearing soiled clothes._END

B_2_C_8_26
BEGIN_
ध्रुवं तु भरतं रामः प्राप्य राज्यमकण्टकम् |
देशान्तरं वासयिता लोकान्तरमथापि व || २-८-२७_END
BEGIN_
"Rama, ascending the throne without hindrance, will either send away Bharata to some
other country or have him put to death. This is certain."_END

B_2_C_11_0
BEGIN_
तं मन्मथशरैर्विद्धं कामवेगवशानुगम् |
उवाच पृथिवीपालं कैकेयी दारुणं वचः || २-११-१_END
BEGIN_
Kaikeyi spoke harsh words to that king, who was struck by cupid's arrows and yielded
to hasty lust._END

B_2_C_10_8
BEGIN_
आज्ञाप्य तु महाराजो राघवस्याभिषेचन्म् || २-१०-९
उपस्थासमनुज्ञाप्य प्रविवेश निवेशन्म् |_END
BEGIN_
King Dasaratha ordered for various arrangements to be made for Rama's coronation,
took permission to leave from the elders who were present there and entered his palace._END

B_2_C_9_20
BEGIN_
मास्मैनं प्रत्युदीक्षेथा माचैन मभिभाषथाः |
रुदन्ती चापि तं दृष्ट्वा जगत्यां शोकलालसा || ९-२-२३_END
BEGIN_
As soon as you see Dasaratha, be sorrowful and keep on weeping, without looking at
him and without talking to him face to face._END

B_2_C_8_27
BEGIN_
बाल एव हि मातुल्यं भरतो नायितस्त्वया |
सन्निकर्षाच्च सौहार्दं जायते स्थावरेष्वपि || २-८-२८_END
BEGIN_
"You sent Bharata to his maternal uncle's house even in his childhood. By being
nearer, love is born even on inanimate objects. By sending Bharata to a distant place, you made
Dasaratha to have no affection towards him."_END

B_2_C_11_1
BEGIN_
नास्मि विप्रकृता देव केन चिन्नावमानिता |
अभिप्रायस्तु मे कश्चित्तमिच्छामि त्वया कृतम् || २-११-२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, King! no body has insulted me, nor despised me. But I have a certain, desire
that needs to be fulfilled by you."_END

B_2_C_10_9
BEGIN_
अद्य रामाभिषेको वै प्रसिद्ध इति जज्ञिवान् || २-१०-१०
प्रियार्हं प्रियमाख्यातुं विवेशान्तःपुरं वशी |_END
BEGIN_
king Dasaratha, who kept all activates under his control entered into the inner
chambers to tell the good news of Rama's coronation to Kaikeyi who was a worthy woman to be told
the good news first (thinking that she has not yet heard the news)._END

B_2_C_9_21
BEGIN_
दयिता त्वं सदा भर्तुरत्र मे नास्ति संशयः |
त्वत्कृते स महाराजो विशेदपि हुताशनम् || ९-२-२४_END
BEGIN_
You are always dear to your husband. I have no doubt about it. King Dasaratha will
even jump into a fire for your sake._END

B_2_C_8_28
BEGIN_
भरतस्यानुवशगः शत्रुघ्नोऽपि समं गतः |
लक्ष्मणो हि यथा रामं तथासौ भरतं गतः || २-८-२९_END
BEGIN_
"Shatrughna was drawn towards Bharata and went along with him. Just as Lakshmana
joined Rama, Shatrughna joined Bharata."_END

B_2_C_11_2
BEGIN_
प्रतिज्ञां प्रतिजानीष्व यदि त्वं कर्तु मिच्छसि |
अथ तद्व्याहरिष्यामि यदभिप्रार्थितं मया || २-११-३_END
BEGIN_
"If you wish to fulfil my desire, you promise to fulfil it. After your promise I
shall inform you that which is desired by me."_END

B_2_C_10_10
BEGIN_
स कैकेय्या गृहं श्रेष्ठं प्रविवेश महायशाः || २-१०-११
पाण्डुराभ्रमिवाकाशं राहुयुक्तं निशाकरः |_END
BEGIN_
That Dasaratha with vast glory entered Kaikeyi's chambers as moon enters the sky
with white clouds._END

B_2_C_9_22
BEGIN_
न त्वां क्रोधयितुं शक्तोन क्रुद्धां प्रत्युदीक्षितुम्|
तव प्रियार्थं राजा हि प्राणानपि परित्यजेत् || ९-२-२५_END
BEGIN_
The king is not capable of making you angry. He is not even able to see you with
anger. He will give up his life for your love._END

B_2_C_8_29
BEGIN_
श्रूयते हि द्रुमः कश्चिच्चेत्तव्यो वनजीविभिः |
सन्निकर्षादिषीकाभिर्मो चितः परमाद्भयात् || २-८-३०_END
BEGIN_
"We hear that a tree marked down for felling by foresters, when covered by thorny
Ishhiika grass, is saved from this great danger of cutting. So also, Dasaratha might have supported
Bharata if he was staying near to him in Ayodhya."_END

B_2_C_11_3
BEGIN_
तामुवाच महातेजाः कैकेयीमीषदुत्स्मैतः |
कामी हस्तेन संगृह्य मूर्धजेषु शुचिस्मिताम् || २-११-४_END
BEGIN_
The most majestic and lustful Dasaratha smiled a little and caressingly kept his
hand into her hair and spoke these words to Kaikeyi who was having white smile in her face._END

B_2_C_10_11
BEGIN_
शुकबर्हिणसंयुक्तं क्रौञ्चहंसरुतायुतम् || २-१०-१२
वादित्ररवसंघुष्टं कुब्जावामनिकायुतम् |
लतागृहैश्चित्रगृहैश्चम्पकाशोकशोभितैः || २-१०-१३
दान्तराजत सौवर्णवेदिकाभिस्समायुतम् |
नित्यपुष्पफलैर्वृक्षैर्वापीभिश्चोपशोभितम् || २-१०-१४
दान्तराजतसौवर्णैः संवृतं परमासनैः |
विविध्यैरन्नपानैश्छ भक्ष्यैश्चवि विधैरपि || २-१०-१५
उपपन्नं महार्हैश्च भूषितैस्त्रिदिवोपमम् |
तत्प्रविश्य महाराजः स्वमन्तःपुरमृद्धिमत् || २-१०-१६
न ददर्श प्रियां राजा कैकेयीं शयनोत्तमे |_END
BEGIN_
King Dasaratha entered his magnificent palace but could not find his beloved kaikeyi
on her best couch there. Peacocks and parrots were being reared in that palace, sounds of birds
like curlews, and swans were heard around. The place was resonant with sounds of musical
instruments. Short and hunch-backed maid-servants were moving here and there. There were bowers
surrounded with creepers and lovely champaka and Ashoka trees. There were painted rooms. There were
altars built with ivory, silver and gold. There were trees yielding flowers and fruits in all
seasons and wells in the middle. There were beautiful seats constructed with ivory, silver and
gold. Various types of food, drinks and snacks were made available. That palace was looking like
heaven with beautifully adorned women._END

B_2_C_9_23
BEGIN_
न ह्यतिक्रमितुं शक्तस्तव वाक्यं महीपतिः |
मन्दस्वभावे बुद्ध्यस्व सौभाग्यबलमात्मनः || ९-२-२६_END
BEGIN_
Oh, foolish one! The king will not be able to transgress your word. You realise your
abundant strength._END

B_2_C_8_30
BEGIN_
गोप्ता हि रामं सौमित्रिर्लक्ष्मणं चापि राघवः |
अश्विनोरिव सौभ्रात्रं तयोर्लोकेषु विश्रुतम् || २-८-३१_END
BEGIN_
"Lakshmana protects Rama. Rama protects Lakshmana. Their brotherly love is as famous
as that of Aswini celestials."_END

B_2_C_11_4
BEGIN_
अवलिप्ते न जानासि त्वत्तः प्रियतरो मम |
मनुजो मनुजव्याघ्राद्रामादन्यो न विद्यते || २-११-५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, proud woman! Don't you know that there is nobody on this earth more dearer to
me than you except Rama, the best among men."_END

B_2_C_10_12
BEGIN_
स कामबलसंयुक्तो रत्यर्थं मनुजाधिपः || २-१०-१७
अपश्यन् दयितां भार्यां पप्रच्छ विषसाद च |_END
BEGIN_
Being possessed of power of lust, that king who came with object of sexual pleasure,
was distressed in not finding his beloved wife and enquired the people there._END

B_2_C_9_24
BEGIN_
मणिमुक्तं सुवर्णानि रत्नानि विविधानि च |
दद्याद्धशरथो राजा मा स्म तेषु मनः कृथाः || ९-२-२७_END
BEGIN_
King Dasaratha may offer you diamonds, pearls, gold and various other precious
stones. Do not care for them._END

B_2_C_8_31
BEGIN_
तस्मान्न लक्ष्मणे रामः पापं किञ्चित्करिष्यति |
रामस्तु भरते पापं कुर्यादिति न संशयः || २-८-३२_END
BEGIN_
"Hence, Rama will not do a sinful act of killing Lakshmana. However there is no
doubt that he will do so in the case of Bharata."_END

B_2_C_11_5
BEGIN_
तेनाजय्येन मुख्येन राघवेण महात्मना |
शपे ते जीवनार्हेण ब्रूहि यन्मनसेच्छसि || २-११-६_END
BEGIN_
"Rama cannot be defeated by enemies. He is a very important person in our family. He
is the supporter of life and a high souled man. I take oath by him. Tell me what is desired by
you"._END

B_2_C_10_13
BEGIN_
न ही तस्य पुरा देवी तां वेळामत्यवर्तत || २-१०-१८
न च राजा गृहं शून्यं प्रविवेश कदाचन |_END
BEGIN_
In former times, Kaikeyi did not keep away herself at that kind of hour, nor the
king enter her chambers at any time without her presence._END

B_2_C_9_25
BEGIN_
यौ तौ दैवासुरे युद्धे वरौ द्शरथोऽददात् |
तौ स्मारय महाभागे सोऽर्थो मात्वामतिक्रमेत् || ९-२-२८_END
BEGIN_
Oh, Kaikeyi, the great fortunate! you remind Dasaratha of those boons given by him
to you in that battle between celestials and demons. See that your benefit does not get
thwarted._END

B_2_C_8_32
BEGIN_
तस्माद्राजगृहादेव वनं गच्छतु ते सुतः |
एतद्धि रोचते मह्यं भृश्ं चापि हितं तव || २-८-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Hence, I feel that it is better for your son to go to forest directly from his
uncle's house. This is good for you too."_END

B_2_C_11_6
BEGIN_
यं मुहूर्तमपश्यंस्तु न जीवेयमहं ध्रुवम् |
तेन रामेण कैकेयि शपे ते वचनक्रियाम् || २-११-७_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Kaikeyi ! I can't live even for a moment without seeing Rama. This is certain.
By that Rama, I am taking my oath and promising to fulfill your word"._END

B_2_C_10_14
BEGIN_
ततो गृहगतो राजा कैकेयीं पर्यपृच्छत || २-१०-१९
यथापुरमविज्ञाय स्वार्थलिप्सुमपण्डिताम् |_END
BEGIN_
After entering the house, king Dasaratha enquired with the aid-servants there as
before, without knowing about foolish Kaikeyi who desired to get her selfish ends._END

B_2_C_9_26
BEGIN_
यदा तु ते वरं दद्यात्स्वयमुत्थाप्य राघवः |
व्यवस्थाप्य महाराजं तमिमं वृणुया वरम् || ९-२-२९_END
BEGIN_
Dasaratha himself will raise you from the floor and offer you the boon. Thus , after
making him steady, you ask for this boon._END

B_2_C_8_33
BEGIN_
एवं ते ज्ञातिपक्षस्य श्रेयश्चैव भविष्यति |
यदि चेद्भरतो धर्मात्पित्र्यं राज्यमवाप्स्यति || २-८-३४_END
BEGIN_
"If Bharata gets his father's kingdom as per law, it will be beneficial to you and
your side of relatives."_END

B_2_C_11_7
BEGIN_
आत्मना वात्मजैश्चान्यैर्वृणे यं मनुजर्षभम् |
तेन रामेण कैकेयि शपे ते वचनक्रियाम् || २-११-८_END
BEGIN_
"I desire the well being of Rama, the best of men, even at the cost of my life or
the lives of my other sons. I take oath by that Rama and tell you that I shall fulfil your
word."_END

B_2_C_10_15
BEGIN_
प्रतीहारी त्वथोवाच संत्रस्ता तु क्ऱ्^ताञ्जलिः || २-१०-२०
देव देवी भृशं कृद्धा क्रोधागारमभिद्रुता |_END
BEGIN_
Then, a female door-keeper fearfully folding her hands in supplication, said: "Oh,
king! The queen ran to her chamber of wrath with much anger"._END

B_2_C_8_34
BEGIN_
स ते सुखोचितो बालो रामस्य सहजो रिपुः |
समृद्धार्थस्य नष्टार्थो जीविष्यति कथं वशे || २-८-३५_END
BEGIN_
"Your youthful son, habituated to comforts, is a natural enemy to Rama. How can
Bharata who failed to achieve his purpose live under control of Rama; whose flourishing object has
been realised?"_END

B_2_C_9_27
BEGIN_
रामं प्रव्राजयारण्ये नव वर्षाणि पञ्च च |
भरतः क्रियतां राजा पृथिव्याः पार्थिवर्षभ || ९-२-३०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, king! send Rama to forest for fourteen years. Let Bharata be made as king of
this earth"._END

B_2_C_11_8
BEGIN_
भद्रे हृदयमप्येतदन्नुमृश्योद्धरस्व मे |
एतत्समीक्ष्य कैकेयि ब्रूहि यत्साधु मन्यसे || २-११-९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, auspicious lady! My heart is sinking. You raise it by your touch. Oh, Kaikeyi!
you observe all this and tell me that which you think as good."_END

B_2_C_10_16
BEGIN_
प्रतीहार्या वचः श्रुत्वा राजा परमदुर्मनाः || २-१०-२१
विषसाद पुनर्भुयो लुलितव्याकुलेन्ध्रियः |_END
BEGIN_
That Dasaratha having much disturbed mind already for the absence of Kaikeyi there,
became more dejected after hearing the words of door-keeper._END

B_2_C_12_0
BEGIN_ततः श्रुत्वा महाराजः कैकेय्या दारुणम् वचः |
चिन्तामभिसमापेदे मुहूर्तम् प्रतताप च || २-१२-१_END
BEGIN_After hearing the cruel words of Kaikeyi; King Dasaratha got disturbed and suffered great 
agony for a while._END

B_2_C_8_35
BEGIN_
अभिद्रुतमिवारण्ये सिंहेन गजयूथपम् |
प्रच्छाद्यमानं रामेण भरतं त्रातुमर्हसि || २-८-३६_END
BEGIN_
"Rama is chasing and bringing down Bharata as a lion chases an elephant-king in
forest. You ought to protect Bharata."_END

B_2_C_9_28
BEGIN_
चतुर्दश हि वर्षाणि रामे प्रव्राजिते वन्म् |
रूढश्च कृतमूलश्च शेषं स्थास्यति ते सुतः || ९-२-३१_END
BEGIN_
Rama having been sent to forest for fourteen years, your son will stand firmly,
having laid his roots and will stay in power for the remaining period._END

B_2_C_11_9
BEGIN_
बलमात्मनि जानन्ती न मां शङ्कितुमर्हसि |
करिष्यामि तव प्रीतिं सुकृतेनापि ते शपे || २-११-१०_END
BEGIN_
"You need not doubt me as you know your authority over me. I am taking oath on my
auspiciousness. I shall do whatever is desired by you."_END

B_2_C_10_17
BEGIN_
तत्रतां पतितां भूमौ शयानामतथोचिताम् || २-१०-२२
प्रतप्त इव दुःखेन सोऽपश्यज्जगतीपतिः |_END
BEGIN_
King Dasaratha, after seeing Kaikeyi lying down on floor in the chamber of wrath,
became tormented with grief._END

B_2_C_12_1
BEGIN_किम् नु मे यदि वा स्वप्नश्चित्तमोहोओऽपि वामम |
अनुभूतोपसर्गो वा मनसो वाप्युपद्रवः || २-१२-२_END
BEGIN_"As it a day-dream or confusion of my mind? Or could it be an eclipse of my experience 
or a disease of the mind?"_END

B_2_C_8_36
BEGIN_
दर्पान्निराकृता पूर्वं त्वया सौभाग्यवत्तया |
राममाता सपत्नी ते कथं वैरं न शातयेत् || २-८-३७_END
BEGIN_
"Previously, you treated Kausalya with disrespect due to arrogance that you were
fortunate. Will not such Kausalya, your rival wife, revenge for that animosity?"_END

B_2_C_9_29
BEGIN_
रामप्रव्राजनं चैव देवि याचस्व तं वरम् |
एवं सिद्ध्यन्ति पुत्रस्य सर्वार्थास्तव भामिनि || ९-२-३२_END
BEGIN_
Oh, Kaikeyi! Ask Dasaratha of sending Rama to forest also as a boon. Thus, your son
will accomplish all the desired benefits._END

B_2_C_11_10
BEGIN_
सा तदर्थमना देवी तमभिप्रायमागतम् |
निर्माध्यस्थ्याच्च हर्षाच्च बभाषे दुर्वचं वचः || २-११-११_END
BEGIN_
That Kaikeyi, who has utmost desire for coronation of Bharata and for sending Rama
to exile, revealing that wish from her mind, uttered unspeakable wordswith bias and delight._END

B_2_C_10_18
BEGIN_
स वृद्धस्तरुणीं भार्यां प्राणेभ्योऽपि गरीयसीम् || २-१०-२३
अपापः पापसङ्कल्पां ददर्श धरणीतले |
लतामिव विनिष्कृत्तां पतितां देव तामिव || २-१०-२४
किन्नरीमिव निर्धूतां च्युतामप्सरसं यथा |
मायामिव परिभ्रष्टां हरिणीमिव संयताम् || २-१०-२५_END
BEGIN_
That Dasaratha, who was sinless, a youthful woman dearer than his life, lying down
on the floor with an intent to do sin. At that time, she was looking like a completely uprooted
creeper, like a fallen angel, like a thrown down Kinnara woman, like an expelled divine dancer
Apsarasa, like a dropped off illusionism and like a female deer tied up in a net._END

B_2_C_12_2
BEGIN_इति संचिन्त्य तद्राजा नाध्यगच्छ त्तदा सुखम् |
प्रतिलभ्य चिरात्सम्ज्ञाम् कैकेयीवाक्यताडितः || २-१२-३
व्यथितो विक्लबशचैव व्याघ्रीम् दृष्ट्वा यथा मृगः |
असम्वृतायामासीनो जगत्याम् दीर्घमुच्छ्वसन् || २-१२-४
मण्ड्ले पन्नगो रुद्धो मन्त्रैरिव महाविषः |
अहोधिगिति सामर्षो वाचमुक्त्वा नराधिपः || २-१२-५
मोहमापेदिवान्भूयः शोकोपहतचेतनः |_END
BEGIN_Thinking over thus, the king could not make out on the spur of the moment what it was. 
Then, regaining consciousness, he felt tormented by Kaikeyi's words. Distressed and disgusted as a deer 
at the sight of a lioness and seated on the bare floor, he gave forth a long sigh like a highly venomous 
serpent fixed to a charmed spot through magic spells. Uttering words "what a pity!" the angry king fell 
into a swoon once more, his mind infatuated with grief._END

B_2_C_8_37
BEGIN_
यदा हि रामः पृथिवीमवाप्स्यति |
प्रभूतरत्नाकरशैलपत्तनाम् |
तदा गमिष्यस्यशुभं पराभवं |
सहैव दीना भरतेन भामिनि || २-८-३८_END
BEGIN_
"O, Kaikeyi! The day Rama becomes lord of this earth with its great oceans,
mountains and towns; that day you and your Bharata will get a bad and pitiable position of
ignominy."_END

B_2_C_9_30
BEGIN_
एवं प्रव्राजितश्चैव रामोऽरामो भविष्यति |
भरतश्च हतामित्रस्तव राजा भविष्यति || ९-२-३३_END
BEGIN_
Thus , by sending Rama to exile, he will not become amiable to people. Your Bharata
will become king, after the enemies having been annihilated._END

B_2_C_11_11
BEGIN_
तेन वाक्येन संहृष्टा तमभिप्रायमागतम् |
व्याजहार महाघोरमभ्यागतमिवान्तकम् || २-११-१२_END
BEGIN_
Kaikeyi, having been delighted with Dasaratha's words, conveyed him of the very
horrible wish in her mind as conveying the news of a suddenly befallen death._END

B_2_C_10_19
BEGIN_
क्रेणुमिव दिग्धेन विद्धां मृगयुना वने |
महागज इन्वारण्ये स्नेहात्परिममर्श ताम् || २-१०-२६_END
BEGIN_
That Dasaratha touched Kaikeyi affectionately, as a great elephant in a forest
touches a female elephant which is wounded by poisoned arrow._END

B_2_C_12_3
BEGIN_चिरेण तु नृपः सम्ज्ञाम् प्रतिलभ्य सुदुःखितः || २-१२-६
कैकेयीमब्रवीत्क्रुद्धः प्रदहन्निव चक्षुषा |_END
BEGIN_Regaining consciousness after a long time and feeling much distressed and angry; the 
King spoke thus to Kaikeyi, as though consuming her with fire in his eyes_END

B_2_C_8_38
BEGIN_
यदा हि रामः पृथिवीमवाप्स्यति |
ध्रुवं प्रणष्टो भरतो भविष्यति |
अतो हि संचिन्तय राज्यमात्मजे |
पर्स्य चैवाद्य विवासकारणम् || २-८-३९_END
BEGIN_
"When Rama gets power of the kingdom Bharata will certainly get ruined. Hence, think
of a solution to get your son Bharata the kingdom and to send Rama, your enemy, to exile."_END

B_2_C_9_31
BEGIN_
येन कालेन रामश्च वनात्प्रत्यागमिष्यति |
तेन कालेन पुत्रस्ते कृतमूलो भविष्यति || ९-२-३४
सुगृहीतमनुष्यश्च सुहृद्भिः सार्धमात्मवान् |_END
BEGIN_
When Rama returns from forest, your wise son will accumulate friends and draw people
to his fold, thus establishing roots himself._END

B_2_C_11_12
BEGIN_
यथा क्रमेण शपसि वरं मम ददासि च |
तच्छृण्वन्तु त्रयस्त्रींशद्देवाः साग्निपुरोगमाः || २-११-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Let thirty three celestials with the god of Fire in the forefront hear your words
giving boons to me, preceded by series of your oaths"_END

B_2_C_10_20
BEGIN_
परिमृश्य च पाणिभ्यामभिसंत्रस्तचेतनः |
कामी कमलपत्राक्षीमुवाच वनितामिदम् || २-१०-२७_END
BEGIN_
That Dasaratha, possessed with infatuation and having fearful mind, touched that
lotus-eyed woman with his hands and spoke the following words._END

B_2_C_12_4
BEGIN_नृशंसे दुष्टचारित्रे कुलस्यास्य विनाशिनि || २-१२-७
किम् कृतम् तव रामेण पापं पापे मयापि वा |_END
BEGIN_"Oh cruel woman of wicked conduct inclined to exterminate this race! What wrong has been 
done to you by Rama or by me?"_END

B_2_C_9_32
BEGIN_
प्राप्तकालं नु मन्येऽहं राजानं वीतसाध्वसा || ९-२-३५
रामाभिषेकसंकल्पान्निगृह्य विनिवर्तय |_END
BEGIN_
This is the appropriate time for you. Be fearless and by your insistence, make the
king turn aside his effort to anoint Rama._END

B_2_C_11_13
BEGIN_
चन्द्रादित्यौ नभशैव ग्रहा रात्र्यहनी दिशः |
जगच्च पृथिवी चेयं सगन्धर्वा सराक्षसा || २-११-१४
निशाचराणि भूतानि गृहेषु गृहदेवताः |
यानि चान्यानि भूतानि जानीयुर्भाषितं तव || २-११-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Let your words be heard by sun, moon, sky, planets, day, night, the directions,
universe, earth, celestial musicians, demons, spirits wandering in nights , house-gods and other
spirits."_END

B_2_C_10_21
BEGIN_
न तेऽहमभिजानामि क्रोधमात्मनि संश्रितम् |
देवि केनाभिशप्तासि केन वासि विमानिता || २-१०-२८
यदिदं ममम् दुःखाय शेशे क्ल्याणि पांसुषु |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh queen, of auspicious qualities! I do not know that you are angry with me. Who
has cursed or disrespected you? I am pained to see you resting in this way on a dirty floor."_END

B_2_C_12_5
BEGIN_यदा ते जननीतुल्याम् वृत्तिम् वहति राघवः || २-१२-८
तस्यैव त्वमनर्थाय किम् निमित्तमिहोद्यता |_END
BEGIN_"When Rama is treating you in the same way as his mother, why are you bent upon harming 
only him?"_END

B_2_C_9_33
BEGIN_
अनर्थमर्थरूपेण ग्राहिता सा ततस्तया || ९-२-३६
हृष्टा प्रतीता कैकेयी मन्थरामिदमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Kaikeyi, being brain-washed an unworthy matter as the most worthy matter by
Manthara, accepted her well and having delighted, spoke to her as follows:-_END

B_2_C_11_14
BEGIN_
सत्य्सन्धो महातेजाधर्मज्ञः सुसमाहितः |
वरं मम ददात्येष तन्मे शृण्वन्तु देवताअः || २-११-१६_END
BEGIN_
"King Dasaratha, who has true promise, who has great valour, who knows righteousness
and who has good equanimity of mind, is giving boon to me. Let the celestials hear it for my
sake."_END

B_2_C_10_22
BEGIN_
भूमौ शेषे किमर्थं त्वं मयि कल्याणचेतसि |
भूतोपहतचित्तेव मम चित्तप्रमाथिनी || २-१०-२९_END
BEGIN_
"when I am here to expend all good to you, why are you hurting my mind by lying down
on the floor like the one who is possessed of a devil."_END

B_2_C_12_6
BEGIN_त्वं ममात्मविनाशार्थम् भवनम् स्वं प्रवेशिता || २-१२-९
अविज्ञानान्नृपसुता व्याळी तीक्ष्णविषा यथा |_END
BEGIN_"By not knowing you as a female snake with fiery poison, you were admitted by me as princess 
in my house for my own self destruction."_END

B_2_C_9_34
BEGIN_
सा हि वाक्येन कुब्जायाः किशोरीवोत्पथं गता |
कैकेयी विस्मयं प्राप्ता परं परमदर्शना || ९-२-३७_END
BEGIN_
Though of right thinking in nature, Kaikeyi was very much surprised to hear
Manthara's words and like a small girl, got into a wrong path._END

B_2_C_11_15
BEGIN_
इति देवी महेष्वासं परिगृह्यभिशस्य च |
ततः परमुवाचेदं वरदं काममोहितम् || २-११-१७_END
BEGIN_
Kaikeyi made Dasaratha to hear these words, praised him too much and thereafter
spoke these words to him who was ready to give boons as he was infatuated by lust._END

B_2_C_10_23
BEGIN_
सन्ति मे कुशला वैद्यास्त्वभितुष्टाश्च सर्वशः |
सुखितां त्वां करिष्यन्ति व्याधिमाचक्ष्व भामिनि || २-१०-३०_END
BEGIN_
"There are so many royal physicians who are skilled and famous on all sides. They
can make you healthy. Tell me your sickness"._END

B_2_C_12_7
BEGIN_जीवलोको यदा सर्वो रामस्याह गुणस्तवम् || २-१२-१०
अपराधम् कमुद्दिश्य त्यक्ष्यामीष्टमहम् सुतम् |_END
BEGIN_"When all living beings extol the virtues of Rama, for what offence shall I forego my 
beloved son?"_END

B_2_C_9_35
BEGIN_
कुब्जे त्वां नाभिजानामि श्रेष्ठां श्रेष्ठभिधायिनीम् |
पृथिव्यामसि कुब्जानामुत्तमा बुद्धिनिर्णये || ९-२-३८_END
BEGIN_
Oh, Manthara! You are telling very good things. Till now, I have not recognised you
as this good. You are the best among the hunch-backed on this earth in making intellectual
decisions._END

B_2_C_11_16
BEGIN_
स्मर राज्न् पुरा वृत्तं तस्मिन् दैवासुरे रणे |
तत्र चाच्यावयच्छत्रुस्तव जीवतमन्तरा || २-११-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, King! Remember what happened in the battle between celestials and demons in the
olden times. There the enemy destroyed almost every thing except your life"._END

B_2_C_10_24
BEGIN_
कस्य वा ते प्रियं कार्यं केन वा विप्रियं कृतम् |
कः प्रियं लभतामद्य को वा सुमहदप्रियम् || २-१०-३१_END
BEGIN_
"To whom do you want a favour to be done? who has offended you? Tell me to whom I
have to extend a favour now and to whom I have to do a great offensive act."_END

B_2_C_12_8
BEGIN_कौसल्याम् वा सुमित्राम् वा त्यजेयमपि वा श्रियम् || २-१२-११
जीवितम् वात्मनो रामम् न त्वेव पितृवत्सलम् |_END
BEGIN_"For what offence shall I forsake my beloved son; when the entire world of living beings 
extol the virtues of Rama?"_END

B_2_C_9_36
BEGIN_
त्वमेव तु ममार्थेषु नित्ययुक्ता हितैषिणी || ९-२-३९
नाहं समवबुद्ध्येयं कुब्जे राज्ञश्चिकीर्षितम् |_END
BEGIN_
Oh, Manthara! you always show interest in my well being and wish for my benefit. But
for you, I would not have been aware of the king's intentions._END

B_2_C_11_17
BEGIN_
तत्र चापि मया देव यत्त्वं समभिरक्षितः |
जाग्रत्या यतमानायास्ततो मे प्राददा वरौ || २-११-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, King! There, I saved you. Hence you gave boon to myself who was attentive in
trying to save you."_END

B_2_C_10_25
BEGIN_
मा रोदीर्मा च कार्षिस्त्वं देवि संपरिशोषणम् || २-१०-३२
अवध्यो वध्यतां को वा को वा वध्यो विमुच्यताम् |
दरिद्रः को भवेदाढ्यो द्रव्यवान्वाप्यकिञ्चनः || २-१०-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Kaikeyi! Do not weep and get your body dried up. If you tell, I shall kill a
person who is exempt from death or shall release a person who is worthy to be killed. I shall make
a poor man prosperous or a rich man, destitute"._END

B_2_C_12_9
BEGIN_परा भवति मे प्रीतिर्धृष्ट्वा तनयमग्रजम् || २-१२-१२
अपश्यतस्तु मे रामम् नष्टा भवति चेतना |_END
BEGIN_"Supreme delight comes to me on seeing my eldest son. My very consciousness is lost, 
if I fail to see Rama."_END

B_2_C_9_37
BEGIN_
सन्ति दुःसंस्थिताः कुब्जा वक्राः परमदारुणाः || ९-२-४०
त्वं पद्ममिव वातेन सन्नता प्रियदर्शना |_END
BEGIN_
There are so many hunch backed persons in the world. Their bodily construction is
very bad. They are crooked and dreadful. But you appear lovely, as a lotus flower bent by
breeze._END

B_2_C_11_18
BEGIN_
तौ तु दत्तौ वरौ देव निक्षेपौ मृगयाम्यहम् |
तथैव पृथिवीपाल सकाशे सत्यसंगर || २-११-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, King! The protection of the Earth, the one who has true promise! I am hunting
for those boons, which were given by you and kept with you for safe custody."_END

B_2_C_10_26
BEGIN_
अहं चैव मदीयाश्च सर्वे तव वशानुगाः |
न ते किंचिदभिप्रायं व्याहन्तुमहमुत्सहे || २-१०-३४_END
BEGIN_
"I and all my people are submissive to you. I do not wish to foil even a little of
your intention"._END

B_2_C_12_10
BEGIN_तिष्ठेल्लोको विना सूर्यम् सस्यम् वा सलिलम् विना || २-१२-१३
न तु रामम् विना देहे तिष्ठेत्तु मम जीवितम् |_END
BEGIN_"The world can exist without the sun, a crop without water. But life cannot continue 
in my body, without Rama."_END

B_2_C_9_38
BEGIN_
उरस्तेऽभिनिविष्टं वै यावत् स्कन्धात्समुन्नतम् || ९-२-४१
अधस्ताच्चोदरं शातं सुनाभमिव लज्जितम् |_END
BEGIN_
Your chest is appearing equally on both sides and is loftily extended unto the
shoulder. Below it is the stomach with an excellent navel, which is lean as though it is shy of
seeing the loftiness of chest._END

B_2_C_11_19
BEGIN_
तत्प्रतिश्रुत्य धर्मेण न चेद्दास्यसि मे वरम् |
अद्यैव हि प्रहास्यामि जीवितं त्वद्विमानिता || २-११-२१_END
BEGIN_
"You have to give that boon, as per right, to me as promised by you. If you despise
me by not giving it, I should abandon my life now itself"._END

B_2_C_10_27
BEGIN_
आत्मनो जीवितेनापि ब्रुहि यन्मनसेच्छसि |
बलमात्मनि जानन्ती न मां शङ्कितुमर्हसि || २-१०-३५
करिष्यामि तव प्रीतिं सुकृतेनापि ते शपे |_END
BEGIN_
"Tell me that which is desired by your mind to be achieved even at the cost of my
life. You need not suspect me, as you very well know your authority over me. I keep my oath on my
righteousness that I shall certainly do whatever is liked by you"._END

B_2_C_12_11
BEGIN_तदलम् त्यज्यतामेष निश्चयः पापनिश्चये || २-१२-१४
अपि ते चरणौ मूर्ध्ना स्पृशाम्येष प्रसीद मे |_END
BEGIN_"Oh, sinful woman! Enough of it. Let this resolution be given up. I even touch your feet 
with my head. Be gracious to me."_END

B_2_C_9_39
BEGIN_
परिपूर्णं तु जघनं सुपीनौ च पयोधरौ || ९-२-४२
विमलेन्दुसमं वक्त्रमहो राजसि मन्थरे |_END
BEGIN_
Oh, Manthara! with perfect hips and well rounded breasts and with your face like an
untainted moon you are shining well._END

B_2_C_11_20
BEGIN_
वाङ्मात्रेण तदा राजा कैकेय्या स्ववशे कृतः |
प्रच्स्कन्द विनाशाय पाशं वृग इवात्मनः || २-११-२२_END
BEGIN_
Dasaratha, after having thus yielded in full measure to kaikeyi's words, fell into
her trap as a deer, for his self destruction._END

B_2_C_10_28
BEGIN_
यावदावर्त ते चक्रं तावती मे वसुन्धरा || २-१०-३६
प्राचीनाः सिन्धुसौवीराः सौराष्ट्रा दक्षिणापथाः |
वङ्गाङ्गमगधा मत्स्याः समृद्धाः काशिकोसलाः || २-१०-३७_END
BEGIN_
My jurisdiction over this earth stretches out as much to the extent as to the extent
a chariot-wheel revolves. Eastern countries, Sindhu, Sauviira and Saurastra countries, as well as
countries in the south, Vanga, Anga, Magadha and Matsya countries, Kasi and Kausala countries are
all full of riches._END

B_2_C_12_12
BEGIN_किमिदम् चिन्तितम् पापे त्वया परमदारुणम् || २-१२-१५
अथ जीज्ञाससे माम् त्वम् भरतस्य प्रियाप्रिये |
अस्तुयत्तत्त्वयाअपूर्वम् व्याहृतम्राघवम्प्रति || २-१२-१६
स मे ज्येष्ठः सुतः श्रीमान् धर्मज्येष्ठ इतीव मे |
तत्त्वया प्रियवादिन्या सेवार्थम् कथितम् भवेत् || २-१२-१७_END
BEGIN_"Oh, sinful woman! Why this most design has been conceived by you? If you wish to ascertain 
my kindly or unkindly feeling towards Bharata, let it be so. But the observation made by you earlier 
that glorious Rama, who is senior in the practice of virtue is my eldest son as it were, must have been 
uttered in order to coax me or to get service from him."_END

B_2_C_9_40
BEGIN_
जघनं तव निर्घुष्टं रशनादामशोभितम् || ९-२-४३
जङघे भ्^इशमुपन्यस्ते पादौ चाप्यायतावुभौ |_END
BEGIN_
Oh, Manthara! your waist decorated with golden belt is making sound. Your
leg-muscles are well rounded and your feet are tall._END

B_2_C_11_21
BEGIN_
ततः परमुवाचेदं वरदं काममोहितम् |
वरौ यौ मे त्वया देव तदा दत्तौ महीपते || २-११-२३
तौ तावदहंद्यैव वक्ष्यामि शृणु मे वचः |_END
BEGIN_
There-afterwards, Kaikeyi spoke these words to Dasaratha who was ready to give boons
and who was infatuated by lust: "Oh, King! the lord of Earth, now only I am asking for those boons
which were given by you then. Listen to my words"._END

B_2_C_10_29
BEGIN_
तत्र जातं बहुद्रव्यं धनधान्य मजाविकम् |
ततो वृणीष्व कैकेयि यद्यत्त्वं मनसेच्छसि || २-१०-३८_END
BEGIN_
In those countries, gold and grain, sheep and goats and all types of goods are
produced. Oh, Kaikeyi! which of the goods do you want to acquire?_END

B_2_C_9_41
BEGIN_
त्वमायताभ्यां सक्थिभ्यां मन्थरे क्षौमवासिनी |
अग्रतो मम गच्छन्ती राजहंसेव भाससे|| ९-२-४४_END
BEGIN_
Oh, Manthara! you are splendid like a royal swan walking before me, with long thighs
are wearing a silk sari._END

B_2_C_12_13
BEGIN_तच्छ्रुत्वा शोकसम्तप्ता सम्तापयसि माम् भृशम् |
आविष्टासि गृहम् शून्यम् सा त्वम् परवशम् गता || २-१२-१८_END
BEGIN_"Afflicted with grief by hearing Rama's proposed installation; you are tormenting me 
too much. Possessed by an evil spirit in a lonely house; you are subject to control of another"_END

B_2_C_11_22
BEGIN_
अभिषेकसमारम्भओ राघवस्योपकल्पितः || २-११-२४
अनेनैवाभिषे केण भरतो मेऽभिषिच्यताम् |_END
BEGIN_
"All arrangements have been made to undertake Rama's coronation. Let my Bharata
instead be coronated on this occasion itself"._END

B_2_C_10_30
BEGIN_
किमायासेन ते भीरु उत्तिष्टोत्तिष्ट शोभने |
तत्वं मे ब्रूहि कैकेयि यतस्ते भयमागतम् || २-१०-३९
तत्ते व्यपनयिष्यामि नीहरमिव र्श्मिवान् |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, fearful one! why are you exerted like this? oh, beautiful lady? Get up get up!
Oh, Kaikeyi1 Tell me the source of your fear. I shall remove that source as sun sets aside the
mist."_END

B_2_C_9_42
BEGIN_
आसन्याः शम्बरे मायाः सहस्रमसुराधिपे || ९-२-४५
सर्वास्त्वयि निविष्टास्ता भूयश्चान्याः सहस्रशः |_END
BEGIN_
In addition to all those thousand magic effects lying in shambara, the lord of
demons, another further thousands of magic effects are lying in you._END

B_2_C_12_14
BEGIN_इक्ष्वाकूणाम् कुले देवि सम्प्राप्तः सुमहानयम् |
अनयो नयसम्पन्ने यत्र ते विकृता मतिः || २-१२-१९_END
BEGIN_"Oh, queen! In this Ikshhvaaku race, which is rich in good conduct, this very great misfortune 
has appeared, due to which your mind has been perverted_END

B_2_C_11_23
BEGIN_
यो द्वितीयो वरो देव दत्तः प्रीतेन मे त्वया || २-११-२५
तदा दैवासुरे युद्धे तस्य कालोऽय मागतः |_END
BEGIN_
"Now, the time has arrived for the second boon given by you affectionately then in
the battle between celestials and demons."_END

B_2_C_10_31
BEGIN_
तथोक्ता सा समास्वस्ता वक्तुकामा तदप्रियम् || २-१०-४०
परिपीडयितुं भूयो भर्तारमुपचक्रमे |_END
BEGIN_
Consoled by hearing the words of Dasaratha, Kaikeyi intending to tell unkindly words
like Rama's exile was beginning to harass her husband further, by her words._END

B_2_C_9_43
BEGIN_
तवेदं स्थगु यद्दीर्घं रथघोणमिवायतम् || ९-२-४६
मतयः क्षत्रविद्याश्च मायाश्चात्र वसन्ति ते |_END
BEGIN_
In your long hunch, which looks like an apex of a chariot, are dwelling your various
thoughts, royal arts and magic effects._END

B_2_C_12_15
BEGIN_न हि किंचिदयुक्तम् वा विप्रियम् वा पुरा मम |
अकरोस्त्वम् विशालाक्षि तेन न श्रद्दधाम्यहम् || २-१२-२०_END
BEGIN_"Oh, large eyed one! Earlier you have not done anything unreasonable or repugnant to 
me. That is why; I do not believe what has been done by you."_END

B_2_C_11_24
BEGIN_
नव पञ्च च वर्षाणि दण्डकारण्यमाश्रितः || २-११-२६
चीराजिनजटाधारी रामो भवतु तापसः |_END
BEGIN_
"Rama has to take refuge in the forest of Dandaka for fourteen years and let him
become an ascetic wearing rags, deer skin and matted hair"._END

B_2_C_9_44
BEGIN_
अत्रते प्रतिमोक्ष्यामि मालां कुब्जे हिरण्मयीम् || ९-२-४७
अभिषिक्ते च भरते राघवे च वनं गते |_END
BEGIN_
Oh Manthara! When Rama goes to forest and Bharata gets kingdom, I shall adore this
hunch back with a golden garland._END

B_2_C_12_16
BEGIN_ननु ते राघवस्तुल्यो भरतेन महात्मना |
बहुशो हि स्म बाले त्वम् कथयसे मम || २-१२-२१_END
BEGIN_"Indeed, Rama is on par with the great souled Bharata to you, for many times you were 
telling me stories illustrating this, Oh, young lady!"_END

B_2_C_11_25
BEGIN_
भरतो भजतामद्य यौवराज्यमकण्टकम् || २-११-२७
एष मे परमः कामो दत्तमेव वरं वृणे |
अद्यचैव हि पश्येयं प्रयान्तं राघवं वन्म् || २-११-२८_END
BEGIN_
"Now itself, Bharata has to get rights of succession to kingdom, which is free of
enemies. This is my greatest desire. Now I am asking for the boon given by you in earlier. "_END

B_2_C_12_17
BEGIN_तस्य धर्मात्मनो देवि वनवासम् यशस्विनः |
कथम् रोचयसे भीरु नव वर्षाणि पञ्च च || २-१२-२२_END
BEGIN_"Oh, timid lady! How do you take delight in banishment for fourteen years of that pious-minded 
and illustrious Rama?"_END

B_2_C_9_45
BEGIN_
जात्येन च सुवर्णेन सुविष्टप्तेन मन्थरे || ९-२-४८
लब्धार्था च प्रतीता च लेपयिष्यामि ते स्थगु |_END
BEGIN_
Oh, Manthara! After accomplishing the benefit desired by me, I shall, with delight,
get your hunch back anointed with well refined gold of good quality._END

B_2_C_11_26
BEGIN_
स राजराजो भव स्त्यसंगरः |
कुलं च शीलं च हि रक्ष जन्म च |
परत्र वासे हि वद्न्त्यनुत्तमं |
तपोधनाः सत्यवचो हितं नृणाम् || २-११-२९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh King of the Kings, Dasaratha ! Be true to your promise and protect your caste,
character and birth. Are not the ascetics tell that for human beings to get happiness in another
world, they have to speak only the truth."_END

B_2_C_12_18
BEGIN_अत्यन्तसुकुमारस्य तस्य धर्मे धृतात्मनः |
कथम् रोचयसे वासमरण्ये भृशदारुणे || २-१२-२३_END
BEGIN_"How do you take delight in the sojourn, in a most dreadful forest; of Rama with very 
delicate body and having his self held in piety?"_END

B_2_C_9_46
BEGIN_
मुखे च तिलकं चित्रं जातरूपमयं शुभम् || ९-२-४९
कारयिष्यामि ते कुब्जे शुभान्यभरणानि च|_END
BEGIN_
Oh, Manthara! I shall get beautiful ornaments made and for your forehead auspicious
dots of variety done of pure gold._END

B_2_C_12_19
BEGIN_रोचयस्यभिरामस्य रामस्य शुभलोचने |
तवशुश्रूषमाणस्य किम्मर्थम् विप्रवासनम् || २-१२-२४_END
BEGIN_"Oh, the fair-eyed one! Why do you take delight in banishment of Rama, who is so pleasing 
to look at and who is so obediently doing service to you?"_END

B_2_C_9_47
BEGIN_
परिधाय शुभे वस्त्रे देवतेव चरिष्यसि || ९-२-५०
चंद्रमाह्वयमानेन मुखेनाप्रतिमानना|
गमिष्यसि गतिं मुख्यांगर्वयन्ती द्विषज्जने || ९-२-५१_END
BEGIN_
You will be moving around like an angel, wearing beautiful clothes. You will achieve
an important position in the eyes of your adversaries with pride and with your face, incomparably
competing with moon._END

B_2_C_12_20
BEGIN_रामो हि भरताद्भूय स्तव शुश्रूषते सदा |
विशेषम् त्वयि तस्मात्तु भरतस्य न लक्षये || २-१२-२५_END
BEGIN_"Rama always is doing service to you more than Bharata does. For that reason also, in 
your case, I do not see any speciality in Bharata."_END

B_2_C_9_48
BEGIN_
तवापि कुब्जायाः सर्वाभरणभूषिताः |
पादौ परिचरिष्यन्ति यथैव त्वं सदा मम || ९-२-५२_END
BEGIN_
The hunch backed women, adorned with all ornaments, will always do service, at your
feet, as how as hunch-backed women, adorned with all ornaments, will always do service at your
feet, as how as hunch-backed you are doing it to me._END

B_2_C_12_21
BEGIN_शुश्रूषाम् गौरवम् चैव प्रमाणम् वचनक्रियाम् |
कस्ते भूयस्तरम् कुर्यादन्यत्र मनुजर्षभात् || २-१२-२६
बहूनाम् स्त्रीसहस्राणाम् बहूनाम् चोपजीविनाम् |_END
BEGIN_In fact, who else other than Rama the best of men could do much more service to you with 
respect, with correct notion and in obedience?"_END

B_2_C_9_49
BEGIN_
इति प्रशस्यमाना सा कैकेयीमिदमब्रवीत् |
शयानां शयने शुभ्रे वेद्यामग्निशिखामिव || ९-२-५३_END
BEGIN_
Manthara in this way being praised spoke these words to Kaikeyi, who was lying in a
clean couch like a flame of fire upon the sacrificial altar._END

B_2_C_12_22
BEGIN_परिवादोऽपवादो वा राघवे नोपपद्यते || २-१२-२७
सान्त्वयन् सर्वभूतानि रामः शुद्धेन चेतसा |
गृह्णाति मनुजव्याग्रः प्रियैर्विषयवासिनः || २-१२-२८_END
BEGIN_"No censure or calumny against Rama can come from the mouth of many of thousands of women 
or from numerous dependents maintained by me. Addressing gently all created beings with clear mind, 
Rama a tiger among men, captivates the people of his kingdom by his kind actions."_END

B_2_C_9_50
BEGIN_
गतोदके सेतुबन्दो न कल्याणि विधीयते |
उत्तिष्ठ कुरु कल्याणं राजानमसुदर्शय|| ९-२-५४_END
BEGIN_
Oh, Kaikeyi the auspicious one! When water has already flown out, there is no use
constructing a dam. Now rise and do this purposeful action. Show your influence to the king._END

B_2_C_12_23
BEGIN_सत्येन लोकान् जयति दीनान् दानेन राघवः |
गुरून् शुश्रूषया वीरो धनुशा युधि शात्रवान् || २-१२-२९_END
BEGIN_"Rama the valiant, conquers men by virtue, the poor through charity, the elders by service, 
the enemies in battle by his bow."_END

B_2_C_9_51
BEGIN_
तथा प्रोत्साहिता देवी गता मन्थरया सह |
क्रोधागारं विशालाक्षी सौभाग्यमदगर्विता || ९-२-५५
अनेकशतसाहस्रं मुक्ताहारं वराङ्गना |
अवमुच्य वराराणि शुभान्याभरणानि च || ९-२-५६
ततो हेमोपमा तत्र कुब्जावाक्यवशंगता |
संविश्य भूमौ कैकेयी मन्थरामिदमब्रवीत् || ९-२-५७_END
BEGIN_
By surrendering to the words of Manthara and having been thus encouraged by her,
Kaikeyi who was of wide eyes, who was proud of her intoxicating beauty, who was a gifted woman and
a queen, removed pearl necklace worth in lacs and other great valuable auspicious ornaments from
her body, entered the chamber of wrath along with Manthara, lied on the floor there like a golden
wire and spoke to Manthara as follows:_END

B_2_C_9_52
BEGIN_
इह वा मां मृतां कुब्जे णृपायावेदयिष्यसि |
वनं तु राघवे प्राप्तेभरतः प्राप्स्यति क्षितिम्|| ९-२-५८_END
BEGIN_
"After Rama's going to the forest, Bharata shall get the kingdom. Or else, you
inform the king that I died here itself"._END

B_2_C_12_24
BEGIN_सत्यम् दानम् तपस्त्यगो वित्रता शौचमार्जवम् |
विद्या च गुरुशुश्रूषा ध्रुवाण्येतानि राघवे || २-१२-३०_END
BEGIN_"Truthfulness, charity, austerity, sacrifice, purity, straight forwardness, learning, 
service to elders-these firmly established in Rama."_END

B_2_C_9_53
BEGIN_
न सुवर्णेन मे ह्यर्थो न रत्नैर्न च भूषणैः |
एष मे जीवितस्यान्तो रामो यद्यभिषिच्यते || ९-२-५९_END
BEGIN_
Neither gold nor diamonds nor ornaments are of any use to me. on which day Rama gets
anointed for the kingdom, the same day it will be the end of my life._END

B_2_C_12_25
BEGIN_तस्मिन्नार्जवसम्पन्ने देवि देवोपमे कथम् |
पापमाशंससे रामे महर्षिसमतेजसि || २-१२-३१_END
BEGIN_"Oh, Queen! How do you wish harm to that Rama who is richly endowed with honesty, who 
is equal to god and who is having splendour as of a great sage?"_END

B_2_C_9_54
BEGIN_
अथो पुनस्तां महिषीं महीक्षितो |
वचोभिरत्यर्थ महापराक्रमैः |
उवाच कुब्जा भरतस्य मातरं |
हितं वचो राममुपेत्य चाहितम् || ९-२-६०_END
BEGIN_
Afterwards, that Manthara again spoke to the seriously talking mother of Bharata
that is Kaikeyi the following words which were beneficial to her and not beneficial in relation to
Rama._END

B_2_C_12_26
BEGIN_न स्मराम्यप्रियम् वाक्यम् लोकस्य प्रियवादिनः |
स कथम् त्वत्कृते रामम् वक्ष्यामि प्रियमप्रियम् || २-१२-३२_END
BEGIN_"I do not remember an unkind word spoken by Rama, who always speaks kindly words to all. 
As such, how can I for your sake, break unpalatable news to Rama the beloved."_END

B_2_C_13_0
BEGIN_
अतदर्हं महाराजं शयानम् सयानमतथोचितम् |
ययातिमिव पुण्यान्ते देवलोकात्परिच्युतम् || २-१३-१
अनर्थरूपा सिद्धार्था ह्यभीता भयदर्शिनी |
पुनराकारयामास तमेव वरमङ्गना || २-१३-२_END
BEGIN_
Dasaratha was not suitable for such an unfortunate condition nor was he habituated
to such a situation. He was lying down on the floor, as king Yayati who fell down on earth fter
exhausting his merit in the region of heaven. Kaikeyi who was a manifestation of worthlessness who
accomplished her desire, who was fearlessly exhibiting her fearful form, asked for those boons
again in a loud voice, to Dasaratha who was in such a bad mood situation._END

B_2_C_9_55
BEGIN_
प्रपत्स्यते राज्यमिदं हि राघवो |
यदि ध्रुवं त्वं स सुता च तप्स्यसे |
अतो हि कल्याणि यतस्व तत्तथा |
यथा सुतस्ते भरतोऽभिषेक्ष्यते || ९-२-६१_END
BEGIN_
If Rama becomes king, you and your son will be destroyed. Oh, Kaikeyi of auspicious
qualities! Hence you try for coronation of your son, Bharata_END

B_2_C_12_27
BEGIN_क्षमा यस्मिन् दमस्त्यागः सत्यम् धर्मः कृतज्ञता |
अप्यहिंसा च भूतानाम् तमृते का गतिर्मम || २-१२-३३_END
BEGIN_"What recourse is there for me other than Rama, in whom forgiveness, asceticism, self-denial, 
truthfulness, piety, gratitude and harmlessness towards living beings exist."_END

B_2_C_13_1
BEGIN_
त्वं कत्थसे महाराज सत्यवादी दृढव्रतः |
मम चेदं वरं कस्माद्विधारयितुमिच्छसि || २-१३-३_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, king! You always boast yourself, saying "I speak truth. I am persisted in my
promise." Now, why are you objecting to my boon?"_END

B_2_C_9_56
BEGIN_
तथातिविद्धा महिषि तु कुब्जया |
समाहता वागिषुभिर्मुहुर्मुहुः |
विधाय हस्तौ हृदयेऽतिविस्मिता |
श्शंस कुब्जां कुपिता पुनः पुनः || ९-२-६२_END
BEGIN_
Having thus hit by arrows of words employed by Manthara again and again, Kaikeyi
felt sad, was angry with the king, by keeping hands on her heart, was surprised with the cleverness
of Manthara and praised her time and again._END

B_2_C_12_28
BEGIN_मम वृद्धस्य कैकेयि गतान्तस्य तपस्विनः |
दीनम् लालप्यमानस्य कारुण्यम् कर्तुमर्हसि || २-१२-३४_END
BEGIN_"Oh, Kaikeyi! You ought to bestow mercy to me, and old and miserable man who reached 
his end and is coaxing painfully to you"_END

B_2_C_13_2
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तस्तु कैकेय्या राजा दशरथस्तदा |
प्रत्युवाच ततः क्रुद्धो मुहूर्तं विह्वलन्निव || २-१३-४_END
BEGIN_
After thus spoken to by Kaikeyi, Dasaratha became angry, turned out delirious for a
moment and again spoke as follows:_END

B_2_C_12_29
BEGIN_पृथिव्याम् सागरान्तायाम् यत्किञ्चैदधिगम्यते |
तत्सर्वम् तव दास्यामि मा च त्वाम् मन्युराविशेत् || २-१२-३५_END
BEGIN_"Whatever can be attained on earth, which has the sea an end, all that I can give you. 
Let not anger take possession of you_END

B_2_C_9_57
BEGIN_
यमस्य वा मां विषयं गतामितो |
निशाम्य कुब्जे प्रतिवेदयिष्यसि |
वनं गते वा सुचिराय राघवे |
समृद्धकामो भरतो भविष्यति || ९-२-६३_END
BEGIN_
If Rama does not go to forest from here, I do not long for any mattresses or
garlands or sandal paste or eye-liner or drink or food or even the loaf here._END

B_2_C_13_3
BEGIN_
मृते मयि गते रामे वनं मनुजपुंगवे |
हन्त अनार्ये मम अमित्रे सकाम सुखिनी भव || २-१३-५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, the vulgar one! You, my enemy! You want to be happy after your desire is
fulfilled when Rama the best among men leaves for the forest and when I die thereafter. Alas!"_END

B_2_C_12_30
BEGIN_अञ्जलिम् कुर्मि कैकेयि पादौ चापि स्पृशामि ते |
शरणम् भव रामस्य माऽधर्मो मामिह स्पृशेत् || २-१२-३६_END
BEGIN_"Oh, Kaikeyi! I fold my hands in salutation to you. I am even touching your feet. Be 
a protector of Rama. Let not unrighteousness lay hold on me in this matter."_END

B_2_C_9_58
BEGIN_
अहं हि वै नास्तरणानि न स्रजो |
न चन्दनं नाञ्जनपानभोजनम् |
न किंचिदिच्छामि न चेह जीवितं |
न चेदितो गच्छति राघवो वनम् || ९-२-६४_END
BEGIN_
If Rama does not go to forest from here, I do not long for any mattresses or
garlands or sandal paste or eye-liner or drink or food or even the life here._END

B_2_C_12_31
BEGIN_इति दुःखाभिसन्तप्तम् विलपन्तमचेतनम् |
घूर्णमानम् महाराजम् शोकेन समभिप्लुतम् || २-१२-३७
पारम् शोकार्णवस्याशु प्रार्थयन्तम् पुनः पुनः |
प्रत्युवाचाथ कैकेयी रौद्रा रौद्रातरम् वचः || २-१२-३८_END
BEGIN_The fierce Kaikeyi again spoke these fiercer words to Dasaratha, who was burning with 
sorrow and was wailing as aforesaid, who had fallen unconscious and was tossing about as he was filled 
with grief, and was praying again and again for being speedily borne across the sea of grief._END

B_2_C_13_4
BEGIN_
स्वर्गेऽपि खलु रामस्य कुशलं दैवतैरहम् |
प्रत्यादेशादभिहितं धारयिष्ये कथं बत || २-१३-६_END
BEGIN_
"When celestials ask for me about Rama's well-being after I reach heaven, how can I
indeed convince them that he is well obscuringly the actual fact?"_END

B_2_C_9_59
BEGIN_
अथैतदुक्त्वा वचनं सुदारुणं |
न्धाय सर्वाभरणानि भामिनी |
असंवृतामास्तरणेन मेदिनीं |
तदाधिशिश्ये पतितेव किन्नरी || ९-२-६५_END
BEGIN_
Kaikeyi, thus uttering cruel words, having removed all ornaments, lied on the floor
without a mattress like a fallen angel._END

B_2_C_12_32
BEGIN_यदि दत्वा वरौ राजन् पुनः प्रत्यनुतप्यसे |
धार्मिकत्वम् कथम् वीर पृथिव्याम् कथयिष्यसि || २-१२-३९_END
BEGIN_"Oh, Valiant king! Having again boons, if you repent again and again how can you proclaim 
piety on this earth?"_END

B_2_C_13_5
BEGIN_
कैकेय्याः प्रियकामेन रामः प्रव्राजितो मया |
यदि सत्यं ब्रवीम्येतत्तस्त्यं भविष्यति || २-१३-७_END
BEGIN_
"If I tell without obscuring the fact that I sent Rama to exile desirous of showing
kindness to Kaikeyi, nobody will believe me."_END

B_2_C_9_60
BEGIN_
उदीर्णसंरम्भतमोवृतानना |
तदावमुक्तोत्तममूल्यभूषणा |
नरेन्द्रपत्नी विमना बभूव सा |
तमोवृता द्यौरिव मग्नतारका || ९-२-६६_END
BEGIN_
Kaikeyi, having removed all adornments, having her face covered by the darkness of
extreme anger and with her depressed mind, looked like a starless sky in a gloomy night._END

B_2_C_12_33
BEGIN_यदा समेता बहवस्त्वया राजर्षयस्सह |
कथयिष्यन्ति धर्मज्ञ तत्र किम् प्रतिवक्ष्यसि || २-१२-४०_END
BEGIN_"Oh, knower of what is right! When many royal saints assemble and converse with you, 
what will be your reply?"_END

B_2_C_13_6
BEGIN_
अपुत्रेण मया पुत्रः श्रमेण महता महान् |
रामो लब्धो महाबाहुः स कथं त्यज्यते मया || २-१३-८_END
BEGIN_
"With much effort I, the childless begot the great and powerful Rama as my son. How
can I abandon such Rama?"_END

B_2_C_12_34
BEGIN_यस्याः प्रसादे जीवामि या च मामभ्यपालयत् |
तस्याः कृतम् मया मिथ्या कैकेय्या इति वक्ष्यसि || २-१२-४१_END
BEGIN_"Can you say" a wrong was done to Kaikeyi, on whose grace I am living now and who protected 
me earlier?"_END

B_2_C_13_7
BEGIN_
शूरश्च कृतविद्यश्च जितक्रोधः क्षमापरः |
कथं कमलपत्राक्षो मया रामो विवास्यते || २-१३-९_END
BEGIN_
"How can I send away Rama who is valiant and knowledgeable, who has subdued anger,
who has forbearance and who has eyes like lotus-petals"._END

B_2_C_12_35
BEGIN_किल्बिषम् नरेन्ध्राणाम् करिष्यसि नराधिप |
यो दत्त्वा वरमद्यैव पुनरन्यानि भाषसे || २-१२-४२_END
BEGIN_"Oh, King! You having granted boons indeed today, now talk in another way, creating blemish 
on other kings"_END

B_2_C_13_8
BEGIN_
कथमिन्दीवरश्यामं दीर्घबाहुं महाबलम् |
अभिराममहं रामं प्रेषयिष्यामि दण्डकान् || २-१३-१०_END
BEGIN_
"How I can I send Rama, who is dark blue in colour like a blue lotus, who is
long-armed , who is very strong and graceful, to Dandaka forest?"_END

B_2_C_13_9
BEGIN_
सुखानामुचितस्यैव दुःखैरनुचितस्य च |
दुःखं नामानुपश्येयं कथं रामस्य धीमतः || २-१३-११_END
BEGIN_
"Rama is accustomed to comforts. He is not accustomed to difficulties. How can I
imagine such sensible Rama in a troublesome situation?"_END

B_2_C_14_0
BEGIN_
पुत्र शोक अर्दितम् पापा विसम्ज्ञम् पतितम् भुवि |
विवेष्टमानम् उदीक्ष्य सा ऐक्ष्वाकम् इदम् अब्रवीत् || २-१४-१_END
BEGIN_
That wicked woman spoke these words to Dasaratha, tormented as he was by the anguish
for his son and who was unconscious, tossing about on the floor._END

B_2_C_12_36
BEGIN_शैब्यः श्येनकपोतीये स्वमांसं पक्षिते ददौ |
अलर्कश्चक्षुषी दत्वा जगाम गतिमुत्तमाम् || २-१२-४३_END
BEGIN_When there was a dispute between a hawk and a pigeon (who were no other than Indra the 
ruler of gods and the god of fire respectively), the ruler of Sibis* gave away his own flesh to the 
bird and king Alarka* by parting with his eyes, attained to the highest destiny._END

B_2_C_13_10
BEGIN_
यदि दुःखमकृत्वाद्य मम संक्रमणं भवेत् |
अदुःखार्हस्य रामस्य ततः सुखमवाप्नुयाम् || २-१३-१२_END


B_2_C_14_1
BEGIN_
पापम् क्ऱ्त्वा इव किम् इदम् मम संश्रुत्य संश्रवम् |
शेषे क्षिति तले सन्नः स्थित्याम् स्थातुम् त्वम् अर्हसि || २-१४-२_END
BEGIN_
"What is this? After hearing the promise given to me, you are lying on the floor
dejected as though you had committed a great sin. You ought to keep yourself within bounds of
ethics"._END

B_2_C_12_37
BEGIN_सागरः समयम् कृत्वान वेलामतिवर्तते |
समयम् माऽनृतम् कार्षीः पुर्ववृत्तमनुस्मरन् || २-१२-४४_END
BEGIN_"The ocean, having given a promise, never crosses its limits. Therefore, bearing in mind 
the previous occurrences do not violate the pledge given by you to me."_END

B_2_C_13_11
BEGIN_
नृशंसे पापसंकल्पे रामं स्त्यपराक्रमम् |
किं विप्रियेण कैकेयि प्रियं योजयसे मम || २-१३-१३
अकीर्तिरतुला लोके ध्रुवः परिभवश्च मे |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, cruel one! One with sinful thoughts! Oh, kaikeyi! why are you planning to do
harm to Rama who is beloved to me and who is truly heroic? I shall certainly get unequalled ill
fame and humiliation in this world"._END

B_2_C_14_2
BEGIN_
आहुः सत्यम् हि परमम् धर्मम् धर्मविदो जनाः |
सत्यम् आश्रित्य हि मया त्वम् च धर्मम् प्रचोदितः ||२-१४-३_END
BEGIN_
"People who know what is right, indeed speak of truthfulness as highest virtue. I
too have taken refuge in truth and made you aware of your duty."_END

B_2_C_12_38
BEGIN_स त्वम् धर्मम् परित्यज्य रामम् राज्येऽभिषिच्यच |
सह कौलस्यया नित्यम् रन्तुमिच्छसि दुर्मते || २-१२-४५_END
BEGIN_"Oh, the evil-minded! By giving up righteousness and by installing Rama in the kingdom, 
you want to enjoy life with Kausalya forever."_END

B_2_C_13_12
BEGIN_
तथा विलपतस्तस्य परिभ्रमित चेतसः || २-१३-१४
अस्तमभ्यगमत्सूर्यो रजनी चाभ्यवर्तत |_END
BEGIN_
While Dasaratha was thus lamenting with his disturbed mind, there was approach of
night with setting of the sun._END

B_2_C_14_3
BEGIN_
संश्रुत्य शैब्यः श्येनाय स्वाम् तनुम् जगती पतिः |
प्रदाय पक्षिणो राजन् जगाम गतिम् उत्तमाम् || २-१४-४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, king! Having made a promise to a hawk and offering his body to the bird , king
Saibya, the ruler of world obtained the greatest destiny"._END

B_2_C_12_39
BEGIN_भवत्वधर्मो धर्मो वा सत्यम् वा यदि वानृतम् |
यत्त्वया संश्रुतम् मह्यम् तस्य नास्ति व्यतिक्रमः || २-१२-४६_END
BEGIN_"Let it be unrighteous or righteous, real or hoax. There should be no change in whatever 
is promised by you for me."_END

B_2_C_13_13
BEGIN_
सा त्रियामा तथार्तस्य चन्द्रमण्डलमण्डिता || २-१३-१५
राज्ञो विलपमानस्य न व्यभासत शर्वरी |_END
BEGIN_
To Dasaratha, who was thus lamenting painfully, the night seemed to be dark even
though it was adorned with charming circular moon._END

B_2_C_14_4
BEGIN_
तथ हि अलर्कः तेजस्वी ब्राह्मणे वेद पारगे |
याचमाने स्वके नेत्रेउद्ध्ऱ्त्य अविमना ददौ || २-१४-५_END
BEGIN_
"In that manner, Alarka the glorious man plucking his own eyes, indeed gave
remorselessly, to a brahmana skilled in the Veda, When asked for them."_END

B_2_C_12_40
BEGIN_अहम् हि विषमद्यैव पीत्वा बहु तवाग्रतः |
पश्यतस्ते मरिष्यामि रामो यद्यभिषिच्यते || २-१२-४७_END
BEGIN_"If Rama is coroneted, I shall indeed die before your eyes by drinking abundant poison 
now itself in front of you."_END

B_2_C_15_0
BEGIN_ते तु ताम् रजनीम् उष्य ब्राह्मणा वेद पारगाः |
उपतस्थुर् उपस्थानम् सह राज पुरोहिताः || २-१५-१_END
BEGIN_Those brahmans skilled in Vedas stayed there all the night and arrived at a nearby place 
along with the royal priest, Vashishta._END

B_2_C_13_14
BEGIN_
तथैवोष्णम् विनिःश्वस्य वृद्धो दसरथो नृपः || २-१३-१६
विललापार्तवद्दुःखं गगनासक्तलोचनः |_END
BEGIN_
The aged Dasaratha was lamenting painfully as though afflicted with a disease, with
lot and hard breaths, having his eyes fixed on the sky._END

B_2_C_14_5
BEGIN_
सरिताम् तु पतिः स्वल्पाम् मर्यादाम् सत्यम् अन्वितः |
सत्य अनुरोधात् समये वेलाम् खाम् न अतिवर्तते || २-१४-६_END
BEGIN_
"Following ruthfulness, ocean the lord of rivers even at the time of flow-tide, does
not transgress even to a small extent its boundary because of its compliance to truth."_END

B_2_C_12_41
BEGIN_एकाहमपि पश्येयम् यद्यहम् राममातरम् |
अञ्जलिम् प्रतिगृह्णन्तीम् श्रेयो ननु मृतिर्मम || २-१२-४८_END
BEGIN_"If I have to see Kausalya, the mother of Rama receiving salutations even for day, death 
is indeed better for me."_END

B_2_C_15_1
BEGIN_अमात्या बल मुख्याः च मुख्या ये निगमस्य च |
राघवस्य अभिषेक अर्थे प्रीयमाणाः तु सम्गताः || २-१५-२_END
BEGIN_Ministers, army chiefs, prominent leaders of the city assembled there, welcoming the 
cause of Rama's coronation._END

B_2_C_13_15
BEGIN_
प्रभातं त्वयेच्छामि निशे नक्षत्रभूषणे || २-१३-१७
क्रियतां मे दया भद्रे मयायं रचितोऽञ्जलिः |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, auspicious night, decorated with stars! do not wish you to do break into a
dawn. Have mercy on me. I pray with folded hands."_END

B_2_C_14_6
BEGIN_
स्त्यमेकपदं ब्रह्मे सत्ये धर्मः प्रतिष्ठतः|
सत्यमेवाक्षया वेदाः सत्येनै वाप्यते परम् || २-१४-७_END
BEGIN_
"Truth is one word and is Brahma. On truth is righteousness established. Truth
indeed is the knowledge imperishable. By truth alone, the supreme being is obtained"._END

B_2_C_12_42
BEGIN_भरतेनात्मना चाहम् शपे ते मनुजाधिप |
यथा नान्येन तुष्येयमृते रामविवासनात् || २-१२-४९_END
BEGIN_"Oh, King! I swear to you an oath by Bharata and by myself that I will not be pleased 
with anything else other than sending Rama to exile."_END

B_2_C_15_2
BEGIN_उदिते विमले सूर्ये पुष्ये च अभ्यागते अहनि |
अभिषेकाय रामस्य द्विज इन्द्रैः उपकल्पितम् || २-१५-३
कान्चना जल कुम्भाः च भद्र पीठम् स्वलम्क्ऱ्तम् |_END
BEGIN_The best of brahmanas were prepared to do Rama's coronation in day-time after the sun 
rises clearly at the arrival of Pushya star and on arrival of Rama's auspicious birth time of Cancer._END

B_2_C_13_16
BEGIN_
अथवा गम्यतां शीघ्रं नाहमिच्छामि निर्घृणाम् || २-१३-१८
नृशंसां कैकेयीं द्रष्टुं यत्कृते व्यसनं महत् |_END
BEGIN_
"Otherwise, Oh, Night! Leave away quickly. I do not went to see Kaikeyi, who is
shameless, cruel and for whose reason this great calamity occurred"_END

B_2_C_14_7
BEGIN_
सत्यं समनुवर्त्स्व यदि धर्मे धृता मतिः |
सफलः स वरो मेऽस्तु वरदो ह्यसि सत्तम || २-१४-८_END
BEGIN_
"O the best among men! firmly adhere to truth, if your mind is fixed on piety. Since
you are a bestower of boons, let my aforesaid prayer be granted._END

B_2_C_12_43
BEGIN_एतावदुक्त्वा वचनम् कैकेयी विरराम ह |
विलपन्तम् च राजानम् न प्रतिव्याजहार सा || २-१२-५०_END
BEGIN_Kaikeyi spoke words of such extent and stopped. She did not further reply to the wailing._END

B_2_C_15_3
BEGIN_काञ्चना जलकुमाभश्च भद्रपीठं स्वलङ्कृतम् || २-१५-४
रथश्च सम्यगा स्तीर्णोभास्वता व्याग्रचर्मणा |_END
BEGIN_Golden water-pots, well-decorated throne and chariot covered well by shining tiger-skin 
were impressive._END

B_2_C_13_17
BEGIN_
एवमुक्त्वा ततो राजा कैकेयीं संयताञ्जलिः || २-१३-१९
प्रसादयामास पुनः कैकेयीं चेदमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
The king spoke like this and beseeched kaikeyi with folded hands. He again spoke
this word to Kaikeyi._END

B_2_C_14_8
BEGIN_
धर्मस्येहाभिकामार्थं मम चैवाचिचोदनात् |
प्रव्राजय सुतं रामम् त्रिः खलु त्वां ब्रवीम्यहम् || २-१४-९_END
BEGIN_
"In the matter, yearning righteousness and to concede to my request, send Rama the
son to exile. I am telling to you three times"._END

B_2_C_12_44
BEGIN_श्रुत्वा तु राजा कैकेय्या वृतम् परमशोभनम् |
रामस्य च वने वासमैश्वर्यम् भरतस्य च || २-१२-५१
नाभ्यभाषत कैकेय्यिम् मुहूर्तम् व्याकुलेन्द्रियः |_END
BEGIN_Hearing Kaikeyi's boons, asking for Rama's exile and Bharata's sovereignty which are 
very much unwelcome, king Dasaratha nevertheless was perturbed for a while and did not move his lips 
towards Kaikeyi._END

B_2_C_15_4
BEGIN_गङ्गायमुनयोः पुण्यात्सङ्गमादाहृतं जलम् || २-१५-५
याश्चान्याः सरितः पुण्या ह्रदाः कूपाः सरांसि च |
प्राग्वाहाश्चोर्ध्ववाहाश्च तिर्यग्वाहा स्समाहिताः || २-१५-६
ताभ्यश्चैवाहृतं तो यं समुद्रेभ्यश्च सर्वशः |_END
BEGIN_Water was brought from auspicious conjunction of rivers ganga and Yamuna, from other 
rivers, lakes, wells, ponds, from streams flowing eastwards, from streams which joined together and 
from oceans in all sides._END

B_2_C_13_18
BEGIN_
साधुवृत्तस्य दीनस्य त्वद्गतस्य गतायुषः | २-१३-२०
प्रसादः क्रियतां देवि भद्रे राज्ञो विशेषतः |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, auspicious queen! I am a well conducted man. I am dejected and seeking refuse
in you. I am an old man and especially a king. Be kind to me."_END

B_2_C_14_9
BEGIN_
समयम् च मम आर्य इमम् यदि त्वम् न करिष्यसि |
अग्रतः ते परित्यक्ता परित्यक्ष्यामि जीवितम् || २-१४-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, the venerable man! If you do not implement our agreement, it means you have
abandoned me. Hence I will give up my life here in front of you"._END

B_2_C_12_45
BEGIN_प्रैक्षतानिमिषो देवीम् प्रियामप्रियवादिनीम् || २-१२-५२
ताम् हि वज्रसमाम् वाचमाकर्ण्य हृदया प्रियाम् |
दुःखशोकमयीम् घोराम् राजा न सुखितोऽभवत् || २-१२-५३_END
BEGIN_He kept gazing with unwinking eyes towards his beloved queen Kaikeyi, who spoke such 
disagreeable words. The king could not become comfortable on hearing that utterance, which was unkindly 
to his heart filling with pain and sorrow and was as terrible as a thunderbolt._END

B_2_C_15_5
BEGIN_सलाजाः क्षीरिभिश्छन्ना घटाः काञ्चनराजताः || २-१५-७
पद्मोत्पलयुता भान्ति पूर्णाः परमवारिणा |_END
BEGIN_Gold and silver pots filled with best water together with popped grain and covered by 
milky sapped leaves, lotuses and water-lilies were shining there._END

B_2_C_13_19
BEGIN_
शून्ये न खलु सुश्रोणि मयेदं समुदाहृतम् || २-१३-२१
कुरु साधु प्रसादं मे बाले सहृदया ह्यसि |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, well-hipped one! I hope that whatever I told, has not merged in the sky. Oh!
young woman, be kind to me . You are good-hearted."_END

B_2_C_14_10
BEGIN_
एवम् प्रचोदितः राजा कैकेय्या निर्विशन्कया |
न अशकत् पाशम् उन्मोक्तुम् बलिर् इन्द्र क्ऱ्तम् यथा || २-१४-११_END
BEGIN_
Thus compelled by Kaikeyi, who had no uneasiness in her mind, king Dasaratha could
not untie the cord of plighted word that fettered him , any more than Bali could unloose the noose
placed (round his body) by Indra(through his younger brother Vamana in order to deprive him of his
sovereignty of the three worlds)._END

B_2_C_12_46
BEGIN_स देव्या व्यवसायम् च घोरम् च शपथम् कृतम् |
ध्यात्वा रामेति निश्श्वस्य छिन्नस्तरुरिवापतत् || २-१२-५४_END
BEGIN_Reflecting over Kaikeyi's resolve and her terrible swearing, Dasaratha heaved a sigh, 
uttering "Rama" and fell like tree which was cut off._END

B_2_C_15_6
BEGIN_क्षौद्रं दधि घृतं लाजा दर्भाः सुमनसः पयः || २-१५-८
वेश्याश्चैव शुभाचाराः सर्वाभरणभूषिताः |_END
BEGIN_Honey, curd, clarified butter popped grain, sacred grass, flowers and milk were kept 
ready. Harlots adorned with all types of ornaments were also glimmering there._END

B_2_C_13_20
BEGIN_
प्रसीद देवि रामो मे त्वद्धत्तं राज्यमव्ययम् || २-१३-२२
लभतामसितापाङ्गे यशः परमवाप्नुहि |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, queen with dark outer corner of eyes be kind. You your self give my kingdom to
Rama. Thus, you will obtain great fame."_END

B_2_C_14_11
BEGIN_
उद्भ्रान्त ह्ऱ्दयः च अपि विवर्ण वनदो अभवत् |
स धुर्यो वै परिस्पन्दन् युग चक्र अन्तरम् यथा|| २-१४-१२_END
BEGIN_
Like a bullock throbbing between yoke and the wheel , Dasaratha got agitated in
heart and became pale in his face._END

B_2_C_12_47
BEGIN_नष्टचित्तो यथोन्मत्तो विपरीतो यथातुरः |
हृततेजा यथा सर्पो बभूव जगतीपतिः || २-१२-५५_END
BEGIN_Then the king become like mental a mad man who lost his equilibrium like an ailing man 
getting upset and like a serpent losing it's fierceness._END

B_2_C_15_7
BEGIN_चन्द्रांशुविकचप्रख्यं काञ्चनं रत्नभुषितम् ||२-१५-९
सज्जं तिष्ठति रामस्य वालव्यजनमुत्तमम् |_END
BEGIN_An excellent fly-flopper which was like spread-out rays of moon, made of gold, adorned 
with diamonds was kept ready for Rama._END

B_2_C_14_12
BEGIN_
विह्वलाभ्याम् च नेत्राभ्याम् अपश्यन्न् इव भूमिपः |
क्ऱ्च्च्रात् धैर्येण संस्तभ्य कैकेयीम् इदम् अब्रवीत् || २-१४-१३_END
BEGIN_
King Dasaratha, with bedimmed eyes, was unable, as it were, to see. But with
difficulty, he controlled himself by recourse to firmness and spoke to Kaikeyi as follows._END

B_2_C_12_48
BEGIN_दीनया तु गिरा राजा इति होवाच कैकयिम् |
अनर्थमिममर्थाभम् केन त्वमुपदर्शिता || २-१२-५६
भूतोपहतचित्तेव ब्रुवन्ती माम् न लज्जसे |_END
BEGIN_The king spoke to Kaikeyi in a distressed tone as follows "By whom have you been taught 
this worthless thing which appears to be worthwhile? Like a woman whose mind has been perverted by an 
evil spirit; you are not ashamed to speak to me."_END

B_2_C_13_21
BEGIN_
मम रामस्य लोकस्य गुरूणां भरतस्य च || २-१३-२३
प्रियमेतद्गुरुश्रोणि कुरु चारुमुखेक्षणे |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, broad hipped, with beautiful face and eyes! do this. It will be pleasing to me,
to Rama, to the world, to priests and to Bharata."_END

B_2_C_15_8
BEGIN_चन्द्रमण्डलसम्काशमातपत्रं च पाण्डुरम् || २-१५-१०
सज्जं द्युतिकरं श्रीमदभिषेकपुरस्कृतम् |_END
BEGIN_A white umbrella like circular moon, which was kept in advance for the occasion of coronation 
was also kept ready._END

B_2_C_16_0
BEGIN_
स तदंतःपुरद्वारं समतीत्य जनाकुलम् |
प्रविविक्तां ततः कक्ष्यामाससाद पुराणवित् || २-१६-१
प्रास कार्मुक बिभ्रद्भिर् युवभिर् मृष्ट कुण्डलैः |
अप्रमादिभिर् एक अग्रैः स्वनुरक्तैः अधिष्ठिताम् || २-१६-२_END
BEGIN_
That Sumantra, who knew the ancient sacred works, passed over the crowded entrance
of the palace and reached the secluded inner apartment. In that area of the inner apartment, some
youths , wearing darts and bows, were on security-duty with due vigilance and attention. They were
all greatly devoted to the king and were wearing polished ear-rings._END

B_2_C_14_13
BEGIN_
यः ते मन्त्र क्ऱ्तः पाणिर् अग्नौ पापे मया ध्ऱ्तः |
तम् त्यजामि स्वजम् चैव तव पुत्रम् सह त्वया || २-१४-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, wicked woman! I abandon your hand, which was clasped by me in presence of
nuptial fire, when it was consecrated by sacred recitations as also your son begotten by me along
with yourself"._END

B_2_C_12_49
BEGIN_शीलव्यसनमेतत्ते नाभिजानाम्यहम् पुरा |
बलायास्तत्त्विदानीम् ते लक्षये विपरीतवत् || २-१२-५७_END
BEGIN_"In the beginning, I was not knowing your wavery conduct in this way. But now, I am seeing 
it in you. It is perverted."_END

B_2_C_13_22
BEGIN_
विशुद्धभावस्य सु ुष्टभावा |
दीनस्य ताम्राश्रुकलस्य राज्ञः |
श्रुत्वा विचित्रं करुणं विलापं |
भर्तुर्नृशंसा न चकार वाक्यम् || २-१३-२४_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the king, who was her pure-hearted husband and who was pitifully lamenting
strangely with red eyes filled with tears, that bad tempered cruel woman did not follow his
words._END

B_2_C_15_9
BEGIN_पाण्डुरश्च वृषः सज्जः पाण्डुरोऽस्वश्च सुस्थितः || २-१५-११
प्रसृतश्च गजः श्रीमानौपवाह्यः प्रतीक्षते |_END
BEGIN_A white bull, a white horse a mighty and beautiful elephant which was fit to be mounted 
by kings were readily waiting._END

B_2_C_16_1
BEGIN_
तत्र काषायिणो वृद्धान् वेत्रपाणीन् स्वमंकृतान् |
ददर्शविष्ठितान् द्वारि स्त्रध्यक्षान् सुसमाहितान् || २-१६-३_END
BEGIN_
There he saw aged palace-supervisors wearing orange coloured clothes, adorning
themselves well, having canes in their hands, well composed and being posted at door-ways._END

B_2_C_14_14
BEGIN_
प्रयाता रजनी देवि सूर्यस्योदयनं प्रति |
अभिषेकं गुरुजन्स्त्वरयीष्यति मां ध्रुवम् || २-१४-१५
रामाभिषेकसम्भारैस्तदर्थमुपकल्पितैः |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Queen! the night has gone by, with the return pf rising sun. Elderly people
will certainly quicken me for installation of Rama with the sacred materials procured for the
purpose"._END

B_2_C_12_50
BEGIN_कुतो वा ते भयम् जातम् या त्वमेवम्विदम् वरम् |
राष्ट्रे भरतमासीनम् वृणीषे राघवम् वने || २-१२-५८_END
BEGIN_"From whom has such fear cropped up in you, so as to seek Bharata to be seated on the 
throne and Rama to stay in the forest?"_END

B_2_C_13_23
BEGIN_
ततः स राजा पुनरेव मूर्छितः |
प्रियामतुष्टां प्रतिकूलभाषिणीम् |
समीक्ष्य पुत्रस्य विवासनम् प्रति |
क्षितौ विसंज्ञो निपपात दुःखितः || २-१३-२५_END
BEGIN_
Seeing his discontented wife talking unpleasantly about sending Rama to forest, that
king was distressed, fainted again and fell down unconscious on the floor._END

B_2_C_15_10
BEGIN_अष्टौ च कन्या माङ्गल्याः सर्वाभरणभूषिताः || २-१५-१२
वादित्राणि च सर्वाणि वन्दिनश्च तथापरे |_END
BEGIN_Eight auspicious virgins adorned all types of ornaments, various types of musical instruments, 
panegyrists and others were also waiting._END

B_2_C_16_2
BEGIN_
ते समीक्ष्य समायान्तं रामप्रियचिकीर्षवः |
सहसोत्पतिताः सर्वे ह्यसनेभ्यः ससम्भ्रमाः || २-१६-४_END
BEGIN_
All of them, the well-wishers of Rama, saw that Sumantra arriving and raised from
their seats hurriedly at once._END

B_2_C_14_15
BEGIN_
रामः कारयितव्यो मे मृतस्य सलिलक्रियाम् || २-१४-१६
त्वया सपुत्त्रया नैव कर्तव्या सलिलक्रिया |
व्याहन्तास्यशुभाचारे यदि रामाभिषेचन्म् || २-१४-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, woman of vicious conduct! If you obstruct Rama's installation, you including
your son cannot offer me water. Rama will be made to do the offering of water to me, after
death._END

B_2_C_12_51
BEGIN_विरमैतेन भावेन त्वमेतेनानृतेन वा || २-१२-५९
यदि भर्तुः प्रियम् कार्यम् लोकस्य भरतस्य च |_END
BEGIN_"If you want to do favour to your husband, to the world at large and to Bharata, you 
give up this sinful intention of sending Rama to exile."_END

B_2_C_13_24
BEGIN_
इतीव राज्ञो व्यथितस्य सा निशा |
जगाम घोरं श्वसतो मनस्विनः |
विबोध्यमानः प्रतिबोधनं तदा |
निवारयामास स राजसत्तमः || २-१३-२६_END
BEGIN_
While the distressed and self-respected king was sighing terribly in the way, that
night came to an end. In the dawn, bards and singers started to awaken him. But the excellent king
prevented them to do._END

B_2_C_15_11
BEGIN_इक्ष्वाकूणां यथा राज्ये संभ्रियेताभिषेचनम् || २-१५-१३
तथाजातीयमादाय राजपुत्राभिषेचन्म् |
ते राजवचनात्तत्र समवेता महीपतिम् || २-१५-१४
अपश्यन्तोऽब्रुवन् को बु राज्ञोनः प्रतिपादयेत् |_END
BEGIN_The people who gathered there after getting the things required as per orders of king 
for coronation ceremony to be held in a kingdom of Ikshhvaaku dynasty, could not sight the king and 
discussed among themselves about how to inform the king regarding their arrival._END

B_2_C_16_3
BEGIN_
तानुवाच विनीतात्मा सूतपुत्रः प्ररक्षिणः |
क्षिप्रमाख्यात रामाय सुमन्त्रे द्वारि तिष्ठति || २-१६-५_END
BEGIN_
That humble-minded Sumantra spoke to them thus, "Tell Rama immediately that Sumantra
is waiting with reverence at the entrance"_END

B_2_C_14_16
BEGIN_
न च शक्नोम्यहं द्रषुं पूर्वं तथा सुखम् |
हतहर्षं निरानन्दं पुनर्जनमवाङ्मुखम् || २-१४-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Having seen people with that joy before, I cannot see them with there happiness
ended, without any merriment and having their faces turned downward in grief"._END

B_2_C_12_52
BEGIN_नृशंसे पापसम्कल्पे क्षुद्रे दुष्कृतकारिणि || २-१२-६०
किम् नु दुःखमळीकम् वा मयि रामे च पश्यसि |_END
BEGIN_"Oh, cruel! Petty minded woman of sinful resolve and wicked deed! Which grievance or 
offence are you finding in me or in Rama?"_END

B_2_C_15_12
BEGIN_न पश्यामश्च राजानमुदितश्च दिवाकरः || २-१५-१५
यौवराज्याभिषेकश्च सज्जो रामस्य धीमतः |_END
BEGIN_" The king is not being seen. The sun has risen. Everything is ready for the coronation 
of Rama, the wise"._END

B_2_C_16_4
BEGIN_
ते राममुपसंगम्य भर्तुः प्रियचिकीर्षवः |
सहभार्याय रामाय क्षिप्रमेवाचचक्षिरे || २-१६-६_END
BEGIN_
They, the well-wishers of their master, approached Rama who was with his wife and
immediately informed him._END

B_2_C_14_17
BEGIN_
तां तथा ब्रुवत्स्तस्य भूमिपन्य महात्मनः |
प्रभाता शर्वरी पुण्या चन्द्रनक्षत्रश्रालिनी || २-१४-१९_END
BEGIN_
While that great souled king was speaking to her as aforesaid, the holy night
endowed with, moon and stars began to become clear into a dawn._END

B_2_C_12_53
BEGIN_न कथंचि दृते रामाद्भरतो राज्यमावसेत् || २-१२-६१
रामादपि हि तम् मन्ये धर्मतो बलवत्तरम् |_END
BEGIN_"With out Rama, Bharata will not in any case take possession of the kingdom of Ayodhya 
as I think him to be stronger in virtue than even Rama."_END

B_2_C_16_5
BEGIN_
प्रतिवेदितमाज्ञाय सूतमभ्यन्तरं पितुः |
तत्रैवानाययामास राघवः पियकाम्यया || २-१६-७_END
BEGIN_
Knowing that Sumantra, who was intimate to his father, came, Rama who desired to
show kindness, called him in there._END

B_2_C_15_13
BEGIN_इति तेषु ब्रुवाणेषु सार्वभौमान् महीपतीन् || २-१५-१६
अब्रवीत्तानिदं सर्वान्सुमन्त्रो राजसत्कृतः |_END
BEGIN_Sumantra, who received good respect from Dasaratha, heard them thus speaking and addressed 
those kings, who came from different countries._END

B_2_C_14_18
BEGIN_
ततः पाप समाचारा कैकेयी पार्थिवम् पुनः |
उवाच परुषम् वाक्यम् वाक्यज्ञा रोष मूर्चिता ||२-१४-२०_END
BEGIN_
Kaikeyi of vicious conduct and of skilful talk, filled with anger again spoke these
