harsh words to the king._END

B_2_C_12_54
BEGIN_कथम् द्रक्ष्यामि रामस्य वनम् गच्छेति भाषिते || २-१२-६२
मुखवर्णम् विवर्णम् तम् यथैवेन्दुमुपप्लुतम् |_END
BEGIN_"Having uttered the words 'proceed to the forest!' How can I behold the pale face of 
Rama resembling an eclipsed moon?"_END

B_2_C_16_6
BEGIN_
तं वैश्रवणसंकाशमुपविष्टुं स्वलंकृतम् |
ददर्श सूतः पर्यङ्गे ससैवर्णे सोत्तरच्छदे || २-१६-८
वराहरुघिराभेण शुचिना च सुगन्धिना |
अनुलिप्तं पराघर्येन चन्दनेन परंतपम् || २-१२-९
स्थितया पार्श्वतश्चापि वालव्यजनहस्तयास्थितया पार्श्वतश्चापि |
उपेतं सीतया भूयः चित्रया शशिनं यथा || २-१६-१०_END
BEGIN_
That Sumantra saw Rama sitting like Kubera on a golden couch with the best
cloth-covering. He adorned himself well and had the body anointed with sandal perfume, purely
smelling like blood of a boar. With Sita, standing on his side with chowrie in her hand, Rama was
shining like moon with chitra star._END

B_2_C_15_14
BEGIN_रामं राज्ञो नियोगेन त्वरया प्रस्थितोऽस्म्यहम् || २-१५-१७
पूज्या राज्ञो भवन्तस्तु रामस्य च विशेषतः |_END
BEGIN_"I am going to Rama quickly as per king's directions. But, you are all worthy of worship 
by Dasaratha and by Rama in particular."_END

B_2_C_14_19
BEGIN_
किम् इदम् भाषसे राजन् वाक्यम् गर रुज उपमम् |
आनाययितुम् अक्लिष्टम् पुत्रम् रामम् इह अर्हसि || २-१४-२१_END
BEGIN_
" Oh, king ! You are uttering words, which cannot be swallowed easily like in a
painful throat disease. You ought to summon your son Rama here without any delay."_END

B_2_C_12_55
BEGIN_ताम् हि मे सुकृताम् बुद्धिम् सुहृद्भिः सह निश्चिताम् || २-१२-६३
कथम् द्रक्ष्याम्यपावृत्ताम् परैरिव हताम् चमूम् |
किम् माम् वक्ष्यन्ति राजानो नानादिग्भ्यः समागताह् || २-१२-६४
बालो बताय मैक्ष्वाकश्चिरम् राज्यमकारयत् |_END
BEGIN_"How can I see that reasonable view of mine, which was well made in consultation with 
friends and decided, being foiled like an army destroyed by enemies? What the kings who came from many 
directions, will speak about me? 'Alas', this king Dasaratha, a fool was ruling this kingdom for such 
a long time!"_END

B_2_C_16_7
BEGIN_
तं तपन्तमिवादित्यम्पपन्नं स्वतेजसा |
ववन्दे वरदम् बन्दी नियमज्ञो विनीतवत् || २-१६-११_END
BEGIN_
Sumantra, who knew polite conduct, offered salutation to Rama, who was refined with
his own brilliance, shining like the sun and the fulfiller of desires._END

B_2_C_15_15
BEGIN_अयं पृच्छामि वचनात् सुखमायुष्मतामहम् || २-१५-१८
राज्ञः संप्रतिबुद्धस्य चानागमनकारणम् |_END
BEGIN_"I shall ask as your word about the well-being of king who is now awake and also about 
the reason of his not coming here."_END

B_2_C_14_20
BEGIN_
स्थाप्य राज्ये मम सुतम् क्ऱ्त्वा रामम् वने चरम् |
निह्सपत्नाम् च माम् क्ऱ्त्वा क्ऱ्त क्ऱ्त्यो भविष्यसि || २-१४-२२_END
BEGIN_
"You will be the one who discharges duty, by installing my son to this kingdom, by
making Rama to wander in woods and rid me of enemies."_END

B_2_C_12_56
BEGIN_यदा तु बहवो वृद्धा गुणवन्तो बहुश्रुताह् || २-१२-६५
परिप्रक्ष्यन्ति काकुत्थ्सम् वक्ष्यामि किम्महाम् तदा |_END
BEGIN_"When many virtuous and learned elders enquire me about Rama, what then shall I tell 
them?"_END

B_2_C_16_8
BEGIN_
प्राञ्जलिः ससुमुखं दृष्ट्वा विहारशयनासने |
राजपुत्रमुवाचेदं सुमन्त्रो राजसत्कृतः || २-१६-१२_END
BEGIN_
Sumantra, who was treated with respect by Rama spoke thus with folded hands to that
prince with beautiful face and who was seated on a swinging sofa._END

B_2_C_15_16
BEGIN_इत्युक्त्वान्तःपुरद्वारमाजगाम पुराणवित् || २-१५-१९
सदासक्तं च तद्वेश्म सुमन्त्रः प्रविवेश ह |_END
BEGIN_That Sumantra, knower of sacred works spoke thus, approached entrance of royal palace 
and entered the inner quarters which is always kept closed._END

B_2_C_14_21
BEGIN_
स नुन्नैव तीक्षेन प्रतोदेन हय उत्तमः |
राजा प्रदोचितः अभीक्ष्णम् कैकेयीम् इदम् अब्रवीत् || २-१४-२३_END
BEGIN_
Impelled again and again by Kaikeyi, like an excellent horse being severely thrashed
with a whip, that king spoke these words to Kaikeyi._END

B_2_C_12_57
BEGIN_कैकेय्या क्लिश्यमानेन रामः प्रव्राजितो मया || २-१२-६६
यदि सत्यम् ब्रवीम्येतत्तदसत्यम् भविष्यति |_END
BEGIN_"Even if I tell the truth that Rama was sent to forest by me, hard-pressed as I was by 
Kaikeyi, nobody will believe it and think as untruth."_END

B_2_C_16_9
BEGIN_
कौसल्या सुप्रभा राम पिता त्वं द्रष्टुमिच्छति |
महिष्यापि हि कैकेय्या गम्यताम् तत्र माचिरम् || २-१६-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Oh Rama, the good offspring of Kausalya! Your father and the Queen Kaikeyi want to
see you. Go there soon."_END

B_2_C_15_17
BEGIN_तुष्टावास्य तदा वंशं प्रविश्य स विशां पतेः || २-१५-२०
शयनीयं नरेन्ध्रस्य तदसाद्य व्यतिष्ठत |_END
BEGIN_He entered the inner quarters and praised the king's dynasty. He approached the royal 
bedroom and stood there at a distance._END

B_2_C_14_22
BEGIN_
धर्म बन्धेन बद्धो अस्मि नष्टा च मम चेतना |
ज्येष्ठम् पुत्रम् प्रियम् रामम् द्रष्टुम् इच्चामि धार्मिकम् || २-१४-२४_END
BEGIN_
"I am bound by the ties of morality. I lost my judgement. I wish to see the pious
Rama, my beloved elder son."_END

B_2_C_12_58
BEGIN_किम् माम् वक्ष्यति कौसल्या राघवे वनमास्थिते || २-१२-६७
किम् चैनाम् प्रतिवक्ष्यामि कृत्वा चाप्रियमीदृशम् |_END
BEGIN_"What will Kausalya say to me if Rama proceeds to forest? What can I, having done an 
unkind act, reply to her?"_END

B_2_C_16_10
BEGIN_
एवमुक्तस्तु संहृष्टो नरसिंहो महाद्युतिः |
ततः सम्मानयाम् सीतामिदमुवाच ह || २-१६-१४_END
BEGIN_
That best of men with great brilliance was pleased to hear those words, then
honoured him and spoke thus to Sita._END

B_2_C_15_18
BEGIN_सोऽत्यासाद्य तु तद्वेश्म तिरस्करिणि मन्त्रा || २-१५-२१
आशीर्भिर्गुणयुक्ताभिरभितुष्टाव राघवम् |_END
BEGIN_He entered the bedroom, approached nearer to the curtain there and praised Dasaratha's 
qualities with blessings._END

B_2_C_14_23
BEGIN_
ततः प्रभातां र्जनीमुदिते च दिवाकरे |
पुण्ये नक्षत्रयोगे चे मुहूर्ते च समाहिते || २-१४-२५
वसिष्ठो गुणसंपन्नः शिष्येः परिवृतस्तदा |
उपगृह्याशु संभारान् [रविवेश पुरोत्तमम् || २-१४-२६_END
BEGIN_
Meanwhile, the night began to become clear, with the rising of sun. While the
auspicious, moment united with lunar mansion approaching, the sage Vashishta who is rich in virtues
surrounded by his disciples entered the capital city of Ayodhya briskly, having procured the
requisite materials for Rama's coronation._END

B_2_C_12_59
BEGIN_यदा यदा ही कौसल्या दासीवच्च सखीव च || २-१२-६८
भार्यावद्भगिनीवच्च मातृवच्चोपतिष्ठति |
सततम् प्रियकामा मे प्रियपुत्रा प्रियम्वदा || २-१२-६९
न मया सत्कृता देवि सत्कारार्हा कृते तव |_END
BEGIN_"Oh, Kaikeyi! Whatever Kausalya, who was always desirous of showing kindness to me, who 
was blessed with a pet son, who speaks kind words and who deserves to be kindly treated, was waiting 
on me like a maid-servant, like a friend, like a wife, like a sister and like a mother. But, for your 
sake, she was never treated kindly by me."_END

B_2_C_15_19
BEGIN_सोमसूर्यौ च काकुत्स्थ शिववैश्रवणावपि || २-१५-२२
वरुणश्चग्निरिन्द्रश्च विजयम् प्रदिशन्तु ते |_END
BEGIN_"Oh, king Dasaratha! Let sun and the moon, guardians of the world like Shiva and Kubera, 
Varuna, Agni and Indra grant victory to you!"_END

B_2_C_16_11
BEGIN_
देवि देवश्च देवी च समागम्य मदंतरे |
मन्त्रेयेते ध्रुवं किंचित् अभिषेचन संहितम् || २-१६-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh Sita! The king and the queen together are thinking of something about me,
relating to coronation. It is certain."_END

B_2_C_14_24
BEGIN_
सिक्तसंमार्जितपथां पताकोत्तमभूषिताम् |
विचित्रकुसुमाकीर्णां नानास्रग्भिर्विराजिताम् || २-१४-२७
संहृष्टमनुजोपेतां समृद्धविपणापणाम् |
महोत्सवसमाकीर्णां राघवार्थे समुस्त्सुकाम् || २-१४-२८
चन्दनागुरुधूपैश्च सर्वतः प्रतिधूपिताम् |
तां पुरीम् समतिक्रम्य पुरन्दरपुरोपमाम् || २-१४-२९
ददर्शान्तः पुरश्रेष्ठं नानाद्विजगणायुतम् |
पौरजानपदाकिर्र्र्णं ब्राह्मणैरुपशोभितम् || २-१४-३०_END
BEGIN_
Passing through that city, whose streets were swept and watered decorated with ,
excellent flags, overspread with colourful flowers , made brilliant with various types of garlands,
filled with people of joy, with shops and markets with abundance, filled with lot of festivities,
anxiously waiting for Rama, fumigated on all sides with perfumes of sandalwood , also resembling
Amaravathy city(capital of Indra); the sage Vashishta beheld the excellent, gynaecium filled with
many a number of brahmanas, crowded with citizens and countrymen, looking splendorous with
brahmanas, knowers of sacrificial assembly filled with excellent brahmanas._END

B_2_C_12_60
BEGIN_इदानीम् तत्तपति माम् यन्मया सुकृतम् त्वयि || २-१२-७०
अवथ्यव्यञ्जनोनोपेतम् भुक्तमन्नमिवातुरम् |_END
BEGIN_"That which was done good be me for you, is hurting me now even as a meal taken with 
forbidden sauces fills an ailing person with repentance."_END

B_2_C_15_20
BEGIN_गता भगवती रात्रिरः शिवमुपस्थितम् || २-१५-२३
बुद्ध्यस्व नृपशार्दूल कुरु कार्यमनन्तरम् |_END
BEGIN_"Oh, the best of kings! The venerable night has gone. The auspicious day has come. Wake 
up and do whatever needs to be done thereafter."_END

B_2_C_16_12
BEGIN_
लक्षयित्वा ह्यभिप्रायं प्रियकामा सुदक्षिणा |
संचोदयति राजानं मदर्थ मसितेक्षणा || २-१६-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Then black-eyed Kaikeyi who is dexterous and friendly disposed, has perceived the
king's opinion and is inciting him for my sake"_END

B_2_C_14_25
BEGIN_
तदन्तः पुरमासाद्य व्यतिचक्राम तम् जनम् || २-१४-३१
वसिष्ठः परमप्रीतः परमर्षिर्विवेश च |_END
BEGIN_
Sage Vashishta, being well pleased of seeing that gynaecium, got past those people
there and , entered it._END

B_2_C_12_61
BEGIN_विप्रकारम् च रामस्य सम्प्रयाणम् वनस्य च || २-१२-७१
सुमित्रा प्रेक्ष्यवै भीता कथम् मे विश्वसिष्यति |_END
BEGIN_Being apprehensive of seeing Rama being treated with contempt and his exile to the forest, 
how will Sumitra put faith in me?"_END

B_2_C_15_21
BEGIN_ब्राह्मणा बलमुख्याश्च नैगमाश्चागता नृप || २-१५-२४
दर्शनम् प्रतिकाङ्क्षन्ते प्रतिबुद्ध्यस्व राघव |_END
BEGIN_"Oh, king Dasaratha ! Brahmanas, chiefs of armed forces and traders are waiting to see 
you. Please wake up."_END

B_2_C_16_13
BEGIN_
सा प्रहृष्टा महाराजं हितकामानुवर्तिनी |
जननी चार्थकामा मे केकयाधिपतेस्सुता || २-१६-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Kaikeyi, my mother is following the king's intentions with great pleasure, desirous
of my benefit and prosperity"_END

B_2_C_14_26
BEGIN_
स त्वपश्यद्विनिष्क्रान्तं सुमन्त्रं नाम सारथिम् |
द्वारे मनुजसिंहस्य सचिवं प्रियदर्शन्म् || २-१४-३२_END
BEGIN_
Meanwhile, Vashishta saw Sumantra by name, who was charioteer-cum-minister of
Dasaratha and who had a pleasing appearance coming out of the royal gate._END

B_2_C_12_62
BEGIN_कृपणम् बत वैदेही श्रोष्यति द्वयमप्रियम् || २-१२-७२
माम् च पञ्चत्वमापन्नम् रामम् च वनमाश्रितम् |_END
BEGIN_"Seetha, alas, will hear woefully two unpleasant, of me having befallen to death and 
of Rama seeking refuge in the forest."_END

B_2_C_15_22
BEGIN_स्तुवन्तं तम् तदा सूतं सुमन्त्रं मन्त्रकोविदम् || २-१५-२५
प्रतिबुद्ध्य ततो राजा इदं वचनमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_Then, Dasaratha woke up and spoke these words to Sumantra, who was eulogising him, who 
was skilled in giving advice and who was his charioteer._END

B_2_C_16_14
BEGIN_
दिष्ट्या खलु महाराजो महिष्या प्रियया सह |
सुमन्त्रं प्रहिणोद् दूतमर्थकामकरं मम || २-१६-१८_END
BEGIN_
"It is certainly our luck that king and queen have sent Sumantra, who fulfils my
desires and wishes, as messenger"._END

B_2_C_14_27
BEGIN_
तमुवाच महातेजाः सूतपुत्रं विशारदम् || २-१४-३३
वसिष्ठः क्षिप्रमाचक्ष्व नृपते र्मामिहागतम् |_END
BEGIN_
That great splendoured Vashishta spoke thus to the learned Sumantra, "Tell the king
quickly, that I have come."_END

B_2_C_12_63
BEGIN_वैदेही बत मे प्राणान् शोचन्ती क्षपयिष्यति || २-१२-७३
हीना हिमवतः पार्श्वए किन्नरेणेन किन्नरा |_END
BEGIN_"Alas! Like a Kinnara girl bereft of her partner at the side of Himalayan hill, Seetha 
with her grief will make me lose my life."_END

B_2_C_15_23
BEGIN_राममानय सूतेति यदस्यभिहितो/अनया || २-१५-२६
किमिदं कारणम् येन ममाज्ञा प्रतिहन्यते |_END
BEGIN_"Why have you not followed my orders even though you were asked by her to bring Rama."_END

B_2_C_16_15
BEGIN_
यादृशी परिषत् तत्र तादृशो दूताअगतः |
ध्रुवमधैव मां राजा यौवराज्येऽभिषेक्ष्यति || २-१६-१९_END
BEGIN_
"A worthy messenger has come who is truly representing the assembly there. It is
certain that today itself the king will anoint me for the right of succession to kingdom"._END

B_2_C_12_64
BEGIN_न हि राममहम् दृष्ट्व प्रवसन्तम् महावने || २-१२-७४
चिरम् जीवितुमाशंसे रुदतीम् चापि मैथिलीम् |_END
BEGIN_"Seeing Rama dwelling in a great forest and Seetha lamenting, I cannot indeed desire 
to line."_END

B_2_C_14_28
BEGIN_
इमे गङ्गोदकघटाः सागरेभ्यश्च काञ्चनाः || २-१४-३४
औदुम्बरं भद्रपीठमभिषेकार्थमागतम् |
सर्वबीजानि गन्धाश्च रत्नानि विविधानि च || २-१४-३५
क्षौद्रम् दधि घृतं लाजा दर्भाः सुमनसः पयः |
अष्टौ च कन्या रुचिरा मत्तश्छ वरवारणः | २-१४-३६
चतुरश्वो रथः श्रीमान् निस्त्रिंशो धनुरुत्तमम् |
वाहनं नरसंयुक्तं चत्रं च शशिपन्निभम् || २-१४-३७
श्वेते च वालव्यजने भृङ्गारुश्छ हिरण्मयः |
हेमदामपिनद्धश्च किकुद्मान् पाण्डुरो वृषः || २-१४-३८
केसरी च चतुर्दंष्ट्रो हि श्रेष्ठो महाबलः |
सिंहानस्नं व्याघ्रतनुः समिद्धश्छ हुताशनः || २-१४-३९
सर्ववादित्रसंघाश्च वेश्याश्छालंकृताः स्त्रियः |
आचार्या ब्राह्मणा गावः पुण्यश्च मृगपक्षिणः || २-१४-४०
पौरजानपदश्रेष्ठा नैगमाश्च गणैः सह |
एते चान्ये च बहवो नीयमानाः प्रियम्वदाः || २-१४-४१
अभिषेकाय रामस्य सह तिष्ठन्ति पार्थिवैः |_END
BEGIN_
"These pitchers filled with holy waters of ganga , gold pitchers with sea water and
an excellent seat with Udambara wood came for the purpose of Rama's installation ceremony. All
types of seeds, fragrant substances and precious stones of various kinds, honey, curd, clarified
butter, parched grains of paddy, blades of Darbha grass, flowers, milk, eight beautiful virgins ,
an elephant in rut, a glorious chariot with four horses, a special kind of sword called Nistrimsa,
an excellent bow , a palanquin with bearers an umbrella resembling the moon , a pair of white
chowries, a golden jug, a white bull with large , humo on its back, an excellent lion with
beautiful mane with large canine teeth, a throne, a tiger skin, fire with ignition , all varieties
of musical instruments,courtesans, women decked with ornaments, teachers, brahmanas, cows, animals
and birds which are sacred, the best of citizens and men of country side, merchants along with
their followers, all these and many other retainers speaking kind words, along with kings stand
waiting for Rama's coronation._END

B_2_C_15_24
BEGIN_न चैव सम्प्रसुप्तोऽहमानयेहाशु राघवम् || २-१५-२७
इति राजा दशरथः सूतं तत्रान्वशात्पुनः |_END
BEGIN_King Dasaratha ordered that charioteer there again thus - " I am not sleeping. Bring 
Rama here soon"._END

B_2_C_16_16
BEGIN_
हन्त शिघ्रमितो जत्वा द्रक्ष्यामि च महिपतिम् |
सह त्वं परिवारेण सुखमास्स्व रमस्व च || २-१६-२०_END
BEGIN_
"I shall go immediately and see the king. You stay happily with the circle of
friends and enjoy yourself."_END

B_2_C_15_25
BEGIN_स राजवचनं श्रुत्वा शिरसा प्रतिपूज्य तम् || २-१५-२८
निर्जगम नृपावासान्मन्यमानः प्रियं महत् |_END
BEGIN_He listened to king's words, bowed his head in salutation to him, thought for goodness 
of king, and came out of the king's palace._END

B_2_C_12_65
BEGIN_सा नूनम् विधवा राज्यम् सपुत्रा कारयिष्यसि ||२-१२-७५
न हि प्रवाजिते रामे देवि जीवितुमुत्सहे |_END
BEGIN_"Oh, Kaikeyi! Deprived of your husband, you can as such rule the kingdom along with your 
son. It is indeed impossible for me to survive, after Rama's exile"_END

B_2_C_14_29
BEGIN_
त्वरयस्व महाराजं यथा समुदितेऽहनि || २-१४-४२
पुण्ये नक्षत्रयोगे च रामो राज्यमवाप्नुयात् |_END
BEGIN_
Hasten the emperor, so that Rama will get the throne when the day gets started at
the auspicious moment of pushya constellation uniting with the moon"_END

B_2_C_16_17
BEGIN_
पतिसम्मानिता सीता भर्तारम्असितक्षणा |
आ द्वारमनुवव्राज मङ्गलान्यभिदध्युषी || २-१६-२१_END
BEGIN_
Sita, treated with respect by her husband and having black eyes, followed her
husband up to the door, thinking of auspicious things in her mind._END

B_2_C_15_26
BEGIN_प्रसन्नो राजमार्गं च पताकाध्वजशोभितम् || २-१५-२९
हृष्टः प्रमुदितः सूतो जगामाशु विलोकयन् |_END
BEGIN_That Sumantra with placid mind, went happily seeing the royal roads adorned with flags 
and banners._END

B_2_C_14_30
BEGIN_
इति तस्य वचः श्रुत्वा सूतपुत्रो महात्मनः || २-१४-४३
स्तुवन्नृपतिशार्धूलं प्रविवेश निवेशनम् |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing these words Vashishta the great souled, Sumantra entered the gynaecium along
with Dasaratha, the tiger among kings._END

B_2_C_12_66
BEGIN_सतीम् त्वामहमत्यन्तम् व्यवस्याम्यसतीम् सतीम् || २-१२-७६
रूपिणीम् विषसम्युक्ताम् पीत्वेव मदिराम् नरह् |_END
BEGIN_"I considered you, a good and virtuous wife as you are, proving to be perpetually bad 
wife, as one, having drunk wine with poison, though possessing an attractive appearance, concludes it 
to be obnoxious."_END

B_2_C_16_18
BEGIN_
राज्यं द्विजतिभीर्जुष्टं राजसूयभिषेचनम् |
कर्तुमर्हति ते राजा वासवस्येव लोककृत् || २-१६-२२_END
BEGIN_
"King Dasaratha will give you kingdom, being served by brahmanas, which will invest
you with eligibility to perform the great sacrifice at the coronation ceremony like Brahma to
Devendra."_END

B_2_C_15_27
BEGIN_स सूतस्तत्र शुश्राव रामाधिकरणाः कथाः || २-१५-३०
अभिषेचनसंयुक्तास्सर्वलोकस्य हृष्टवत् |_END
BEGIN_Sumantra heard the words pertaining to Rama and Rama's coronation spoken together by 
joyful people there._END

B_2_C_12_67
BEGIN_अनृतैर्बहु माम् सान्वैःसा न्त्वयन्ती स्म स्मभाषसे || २-१२-७७
गीतशब्देन सम्रुध्य लुब्धो मृगमिवावधीः |_END
BEGIN_"You used to speak to me very consolingly with untruthful gentle words like a deer being 
killed by a hunter after enticing it with melodious sounds."_END

B_2_C_14_31
BEGIN_
तं तु पूर्वोदितं वृद्धं द्वारस्था राजसम्मतम् || २-१४-४४
न शेकुरभिसंरोद्धुं राज्ञः प्रयचिकीर्ष्वः |_END
BEGIN_
The doormen , who were wishing to do kindness to king, could not obstruct Sumantra,
who came before hand who was senior and who was highly esteemed by the king._END

B_2_C_16_19
BEGIN_
दीक्षितं व्रतसम्पन्नं वराजिनधरं शुचिम् |
कुरङ्गशृङ्गपाणिं च पश्यन्ती त्वां भजाम्यहम् || २-१६-२३_END
BEGIN_
"I shall be delighted to see you, initiated for the perfect religious act of
austerity, wearing excellent antelope-hide, being pure and bearing a deer-horn in hand"._END

B_2_C_12_68
BEGIN_अनार्य इति मामार्याः पुत्रविक्रायिकम् ध्रुवम् || २-१२-७८
धिक्करिष्यन्ति रथ्यासु सुरापम् ब्राह्मणम् यथा |_END
BEGIN_"Venerable people gathered in the streets will reproach me who has sold away my son, 
saying that I am as bad as a brahmana who drinks wine. It is certain."_END

B_2_C_15_28
BEGIN_ततो ददर्श रुचिरं कैलासशिखरप्रभम् || २-१५-३१
रामवेश्म सुमन्त्रस्तु शक्रवेश्मसमप्रभम् |_END
BEGIN_Then, Sumantra saw Rama's palace which was lovely shining like top of a mountain and 
radiant like Indra's palace._END

B_2_C_14_32
BEGIN_
स सवीपस्थितो राज्ञ्स्तामवस्थामजज्ञीवान् || २-१४-४५
वाग्भिः परमतुष्टाभिरभिष्टोतुं प्रचक्रमे |_END
BEGIN_
Standing besides the king and ignorant of that situation, Sumantra started praising
the king with very pleasing words._END

B_2_C_16_20
BEGIN_
पुर्वां दिशं वज्रधरो दक्षिणां पातु ते यमः |
वरुणः पाश्चिमामाशां धनेशस्तुत्तरं दिशम् || २-१६-२४_END
BEGIN_
"May Indra the god of rain in the east, Yama the god of death in the south, Varuna
the regent of the ocean in the west and Kubera the god of riches and treasure in the north, protect
you"._END

B_2_C_15_29
BEGIN_महाकवाटपिहितं वितर्दिशतशोभितम् || २-१५-३२
काञ्चनप्रतिमैकाग्रं मणिविद्रुमतोरणम् |
शारदाभ्रघनप्रख्यं दीप्तं मेरुगुहोपमम् || २-१५-३३
मणिभिर्वरमाल्यानां सुमहद्भिरलंकृतम् |
मुक्तामणिभिराकीर्णं चन्धनागुरुभूषितम् || २-१५-३४
गन्धान्मनोज्ञान् विसृजद्धार्दुरं शिखरं यथा |
सारसैश्च मयूरैश्च विनदद्भिर्विराजितम् || २-१५-३५
सुकृतेहामृगाकीर्णं सुकीर्णं भक्तिभिस्तथा |
मन्श्चक्षुश्च भूतानामाददत्तिग्मतेजसा || २-१५-३६
चन्द्रभास्करसंकाशम् कुबेरभवनोपमम् |
महेन्द्रधामप्रतिमं नानापक्षिसमाकुलम् || २-१५-३७
मेरुशृङ्गसमम् सूतो रामवेश्म ददर्श ह |
उपस्थितैः समाकीर्णम् जनैरञ्जलिकारिभिः || २-१५-३८
उपादाय समाक्रान्तैस्तथा जानपदैर्जनैः |
रामाभिषेकसुमुखैरुन्मुखैः समलम्कृतम् || २-१५-३९
महामेघसमप्रख्यमुदग्रं सुविभूषितम् |
नानारत्नसमाकीर्णं कुब्जकैरातकावृतम् || २-१५-४०_END
BEGIN_Rama's palace was beautiful with large doors and adorned with hundreds of raised quadrangular 
seats. There were festooned decorations over doorways with gems and corals. It was adorned with various 
precious stones and the best of garlands. Pearls were scattered all over abundantly. It was decorated 
with sandal and aloe woods, spreading out beautiful smells like the peak of a Darddura Mountain. Cranes 
and peacocks were singing sweetly. Figures of wolves and other art forms were sculptured here and there. 
It was attracting the eyes and minds of living beings by its brilliance. It was shining like a constellation 
of moon and the sun. It was full of various kinds of birds. It was as high as Meru mountain. Sumantra 
saw such a palace of Rama. People who came from different rural parts to see Rama's coronation were 
waiting with different gifts in their hands. That house decorated with various diamonds, was looking 
high like a great cloud. Hunch backed servants and servants of kirata tribe were moving all over the 
house._END

B_2_C_12_69
BEGIN_अहो दुःखमहो कृच्छ्रम् यत्र वाचः क्षमे तव || २-१२-७९
दुःखमेवम्विधम् प्राप्तम् पुराकृतमिवाशुभम् |_END
BEGIN_"Alas! How was distressing and how painful it is that I have to forbear your words! I 
got this type of trouble as an evil consequence earned in a previous life."_END

B_2_C_14_33
BEGIN_
ततः सूतो यथाकालं पार्थिवस्य निवेशने || २-१४-४६
सुमन्त्रः प्राञ्जलिर्भूत्वा तुष्टाव जगतीपतिम् |_END
BEGIN_
Sumantra, standing with joined palms in the gynaecium of the king, eulogised the
king according to the appropriate moment as follows._END

B_2_C_16_21
BEGIN_
अथ सीतामनुज्ञाप्य कृतकौतुकमगळः |
निश्चक्राम सुमन्त्रेण सह रामो निवेशनात् || २-१६-२५_END
BEGIN_
Rama, adorned as in an auspicious festivity, took permission from Sita and started
from house along with Sumantra._END

B_2_C_15_30
BEGIN_स वाजियुक्तेन रथेन सारथि |
र्नराकुलं राजकुलम् विराजयन् |
वरूथिना रामगृहाभिपातिना |
पुरस्य सर्वस्य मनांसि हर्शयन् || २-१५-४१_END
BEGIN_That Sumantra with chariot fastened with horses and having a top, approached towards 
Rama's palace, beautifying the human and the royal races, gladdened the hearts of all citizens._END

B_2_C_12_70
BEGIN_चिरम् खलु मया पापे त्वम् पापेनाभिरक्षिता || २-१२-८०
अज्ञानादुपसम्पन्ना रज्जुरुद्बंधिनी यथा |_END
BEGIN_"Like a rope used for hanging up one's neck through ignorance; Oh sinful woman; you have 
been lovingly maintained by me, sinful as I am"_END

B_2_C_14_34
BEGIN_
यथा नन्दति तेजस्वी सागरो भास्करोदये |
प्रीतह् प्रीतेन मनसा तथानन्दघनः स्वतः || २-१४-४७_END
BEGIN_
"How the splendid ocean gladdens at the time of sunrise, so do you by nature filled
with delight, gladden us with your delighted mind."_END

B_2_C_16_22
BEGIN_
पर्वतादिव निष्क्रम्य सिंहो गिरिगुहाशयः |
लक्ष्मणंद्वारि सोऽपश्यत् प्रह्वञ्जलिपुटं स्थितम् || २-१६-२६_END
BEGIN_
That Rama who came out, like a lion residing in a mountain cave from out of the
mountain, saw Lakshmana standing at the door, bowing with palms of the hand joined and put to the
forehead as a mark of respect._END

B_2_C_17_0
BEGIN_स रमो रथमास्थाय सम्प्रहृष्टसुहृञनः |
पताकाध्वजसंपन्नं महार्हगुरुधूपितम् || २-१७-१
अपश्यन्नगरं श्रीमान् नानाजनसमाकुलम् |_END
BEGIN_Rama the glorious man, who was with his joyful friends, ascended the chariot and saw 
the city which was decorated with flags and banners, which was perfumed all around by burning excellent 
aloe wood and which was endowed with varied types of people._END

B_2_C_15_31
BEGIN_ततस्समासाद्य महाधनं महत् |
प्रहृष्टरोमा स बभूव सारथिः |
मृगैर्मयूरैश्च समाकुलोल्बणं |
गृहं वरार्हस्य शचीपतेरिव || २-१५-४२_END
BEGIN_That palace of the great souled Rama was like Indra's palace with great wealth. It was 
filled with various deer and peacocks. After approaching that palace, he became quite thrilled._END

B_2_C_12_71
BEGIN_रममाणस्त्वया सार्धम् मृत्युम् त्वा नाभिलक्षये || २-१२-८१
बालो रहसि हस्तेन कृष्णसर्पमिवास्पृशम् |_END
BEGIN_"Enjoying life with you, I could not recognise you as death. I touched you, like cobra 
touched with hand by a child in a deserted place."_END

B_2_C_14_35
BEGIN_
इन्द्रमस्यां तु वेळायामभितुष्टाव मातलिः || २-१४-४८
सोऽजयद्धानवान्सर्वांस्तथा त्वां बोधयाम्यहम् |_END
BEGIN_
"At the very hour of sunrise, Matali (Indra's charioteer)praised Indra and the
latter conquered all the demons. In the same manner, I am awakening you."_END

B_2_C_17_1
BEGIN_स गृहैरभ्रसंकाशैः पांडुरैरुपशोभितम् || २-१७-२
राजमार्गं ययौ रामो मध्येनगरुधूपितम् |_END
BEGIN_That Rama went through the royal passage which was incensed with aloe wood. That royal 
street was splendid with white houses resembling clouds._END

B_2_C_16_23
BEGIN_
अथ मध्यमकक्ष्यायां समागच्छत् सुहृज्जनैः |
स सर्वानर्थिनो दृष्ट्वा समेत्य प्रतिनन्द्य च || २-१६-२७
ततः पावकसंकाशमारुरोह रथोत्तमम् |
वैयाघ्रं पुरुष्व्याघो राजितं राजनंदनः || २-१६-२८_END
BEGIN_
Then, that prince the best of men, met his friends in the middle chamber. He saw all
the people who came there to behold him, approached nearer to them, greeted them and mounted the
excellent chariot, which was resplendent like fire and covered with tiger's skin._END

B_2_C_15_32
BEGIN_स तत्र कैलासनिभाः स्वलंकृताः |
प्रविश्य कक्ष्यास्त्रिदशालयोपमाः |
प्रियान् वरान् राममते स्थितान् बहून् |
व्यपोह्य शुद्धांतमुपस्थितो रथी || २-१५-४३_END
BEGIN_The inner apartments of Rama's palace were well decorated, high as Kailasa mountain and 
like abodes of deities. Sumantra entered there, passed over many of Rama's friends who well wishers 
and approached Rama's inner apartment._END

B_2_C_12_72
BEGIN_मया ह्यपितृकः पुत्रःस महात्मा दुरात्मना || २-१२-८२
तम् तु माम् जीवलोकोऽयम् नूनमाक्रोष्टुमर्हति |_END
BEGIN_"This world of living beings is certainly fit to curse me, such as I am; saying that 
Rama the great souled is deprived of fatherly protection by me, the evil-minded."_END

B_2_C_14_36
BEGIN_
वेदाः सहाङ्गविद्याश्छ यथाह्यात्मभुवम् विभुम् || २-१४-४९
ब्रह्माणम् बोधयन्त्यद्य तथा त्वां बोधयाम्यहम् |_END
BEGIN_
"As Vedas along with the knowledge of the limbs of the body guide Lord Brahma (the
creator) who is self born, so am I awakening you now."_END

B_2_C_17_2
BEGIN_चन्दनानाम् च मुख्यानामगुरूणाम् च संचयैः || २-१७-३
उत्तमानां च गन्धानां क्षौमकौशाम्बरस्य च |
अविद्धाभिश्च मुक्ताभिरुत्तमैः स्फाटिकैरपि || २-१७-४
शोभमानसम्बाधं तं राजपथमुत्तमम् |
संवृतं विविधैः पुष्पैभ्रुक्ष्यैरुच्चावचैरपि || २-१७-५_END
BEGIN_Rama entered that excellent royal route, which was filled with sandal, superior aloe-wood, 
excellent perfumes, silk and linen cloth, heaps of them, unpierced pearls, excellent things made of 
crystal, splendid with various kinds of flowers and eatables and which was not congested._END

B_2_C_16_24
BEGIN_
मेघनादमसम्बाधं मणिहेमविभूशितम् |
मुष्णन्तम् इव चक्षूंषि प्रभया मेरुवर्चसम् || २-१६-२९
करेणुशिशुकल्पैश्च युक्तं परमवाजिभिः |
हरियुक्तं सहस्राक्षो रथमिन्द्र इवाशुगम् || २-१६-३०
प्रययौ तूरमास्थाय राघवो ज्वलितः श्रिया |_END
BEGIN_
That chariot was sounding like thunder. It was not congested. It was decorated with
gold and jewels. Its splendour was like that of Meru mountain, stealing the eyes. Excellent horses
looking like infantine elephants were tied to the chariot, which was moving quickly. That Rama
shining with splendour like Indra, the lord of sky, mounted such a chariot and went forth
quickly._END

B_2_C_15_33
BEGIN_स तत्र शुश्राव च हर्षयुक्ता |
रामाभिषेकार्थकृता जनानां |
नरेंद्रसूनोरभिमंगळार्थाः |
सर्वस्य लोकस्य गिरः प्रहृष्टः || २-१५-४४_END
BEGIN_There, Sumantra heard delightful people talking about Rama's coronation and the rites 
to be performed for the sake of Rama's prosperity._END

B_2_C_12_73
BEGIN_बालिशो बत कामात्मा राजा दशरथो भृशम् || २-१२-८३
यः स्त्रीकृते प्रियम् पुत्रम् वनम् प्रस्थापयिष्यति |_END
BEGIN_Alas! Extremely foolish is king Dasaratha; whose mind is lustful for a woman and sent 
his son to the forest."_END

B_2_C_14_37
BEGIN_
आदित्यः सह चन्द्रेण यथा भूतधरां शुभाम् || २-१४-५०
बोधयत्यद्य पृथिवीं तथा त्वाम् बोधयाम्यहम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Even as the sun along with the moon awaken the beautiful earth which sustains the
beings so, am I awakening you."_END

B_2_C_17_3
BEGIN_ददर्श तं राजपथं दिवि देवपतिर्यथा |
दध्यक्षतहविर्लाजैर्धूपैरगुरुचंदनैः || २-१७-६
नानामाल्योपगंधैश्च सदाभ्यर्चितचत्वरम् |_END
BEGIN_Rama saw that royal route like divine passage in heaven. All the road junctions there 
were regularly worshipped with yoghurt, unbroken rice, clarified butter, fried grain, incense, aloe 
and sandal and all types of garlands and perfumes._END

B_2_C_16_25
BEGIN_
स पर्जन्य इवाकाशे स्वनवानभिनादयन् || २-१६-३१
निकेतान्निर्ययौ श्रिमान् महाभ्रादिव चन्द्रमाः |_END
BEGIN_
That splendid chariot, sounding like rain-cloud in the sky, came out of the house
like moon coming out of a mighty cloud._END

B_2_C_15_34
BEGIN_महेंद्रसद्मप्रतिमं तु वेश्म |
रामस्य रम्यं मृगपक्षिजुष्टं |
ददर्श मेरोरिव शृंगमुच्चं | 
विभ्राजमानं प्रभया सुमम्त्रः || २-१५-४५_END
BEGIN_Rama's palace was as high as top of the Meru mountain, shining with radiance. The mansion 
was filled with birds and antelopes. It was like Indra's mansion. Sumantra saw such a beautiful house 
of Rama._END

B_2_C_12_74
BEGIN_व्रतैश्च ब्रह्मचर्यैश्च गुरुभिश्चपकर्शितः || २-१२-८४
भोगकाले महत्कृच्छ्रम् पुनरेव प्रपत्स्यते |_END
BEGIN_"Emaciated by vow's, by study of Vedas and by service to his preceptors, Rama will indeed 
during the period of enjoyment, again undergo a great hardship."_END

B_2_C_14_38
BEGIN_
उत्तिष्ठाशु महाराज कृतकौतुकमङ्गळः || २-१४-५१
विराजमानो वपुषा मेरोरिव दिवाकरः |_END
BEGIN_
"Having dressed suitably for the auspicious ceremony and shining brightly with you
personality, raise up. Oh, Majesty, like the sun from mount Meru."_END

B_2_C_17_4
BEGIN_आशीर्वादान् बहून् शृण्वन् सुहृद्भिः समुदीरितान्  || २-१७-७
यथार्हं चापि सम्पूज्य सर्वानेव नारान् ययौं |_END
BEGIN_Hearing the various blessing words spoken by his friends, he went acknowledging all those 
people suitably._END

B_2_C_16_26
BEGIN_
चित्रचामरपाणिस्तु लक्ष्मणो राघवानुजः ||२-१६-३२
जुगोप भ्रातरं भ्राता रथमास्थाय पृष्ठतः |_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana, Rama's younger brother mounted the chariot in the back-side and protected
Rama with umbrella and chamara fan._END

B_2_C_15_35
BEGIN_उपस्थितै रञ्जलिकारिभिश्च |
सोपायनैर्जानपदैर्जनैश्च |
कोट्या परार्धैश्च विमुक्तयानैः |
समाकुलं द्वारपदम् ददर्श || २-१५-४६_END
BEGIN_He saw crores and millions of rural folk and other people with folded hands approaching 
the area leaving their respective vehicles._END

B_2_C_14_39
BEGIN_
सोमसूर्यौ च काकुत्थ्स शिववैश्रवणावपि || २-१४-५२
वरुणाश्छग्निरिन्द्रश्च विजयं प्रदिश्न्तु ते |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Dasaratha born in Kakutsa dynasty! May the Gods -Sun and the Moon Shiva and
Kubera, Varuna, Agni and Indra bestow you victory!"_END

B_2_C_12_75
BEGIN_नालम् द्वितीयम् वचनम् पुत्रो माम् प्रति भाषितुम् || २-१२-८५
स वनम् प्रव्रजेत्युक्तो बाढमित्येव वक्ष्यति |_END
BEGIN_"My son Rama is incapable of saying a second word to me to go to forest, he will say 
"Be it so."_END

B_2_C_17_5
BEGIN_पितामहैराचरितं तथैव प्रपितामहैः || २-१७-८
अध्योपादाय तं मार्गमभिषित्तोऽनुपालय |_END
BEGIN_"Get coronated today, take the path followed by your grandfathers and great grandfathers 
and rule the kingdom."_END

B_2_C_16_27
BEGIN_
ततो हलहलाशब्दस्तुमुलह् समजायत ||२-१६-३३
तस्य निष्क्रममाणस्य जनौघस्य समन्ततः |_END
BEGIN_
Then, the crowds started dispersing from all sides generating tumultuous hallowing
sound._END

B_2_C_18_0
BEGIN_
स ददर्श आसने रामः निषण्णम् पितरम् शुभे |
कैकेयी सहितम् दीनम् मुखेन परिशुष्यता || २-१८-१_END
BEGIN_
Rama saw his father sitting on a beautiful seat, but with his face looking
completely parched up and miserable. Kaikeyi was at his side._END

B_2_C_15_36
BEGIN_ततो महामेघमहीधराभं |
प्रभिन्नमत्यङ्कुशमत्यसह्यम् |
रामोपवाह्याम् रुचिरम् ददर्श |
शत्रुम्जयं नागमुदग्रकायम् || २-१५-४७_END
BEGIN_There he saw a beautiful elephant called Satrunjaya with highly elevated body and Rama's 
royal conveyance. It was like a great cloud and a mountain. It was intoxicated, uncontrollable and intolerable._END

B_2_C_14_40
BEGIN_
गता भगवती रात्रिः कृतकृत्य मिदं तव || २-१४-५३
बुद्ध्यस्व सृपशार्दूल कुरु कार्यमनन्तरम् |
उदतिष्ठत रामस्य समग्रमभिषेचन्म् || २-१४-५४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, the best of the kings ! The holy night has gone by. Know what has been done and
do what has to be done. All the requirements for Rama's coronation is kept ready" ._END

B_2_C_12_76
BEGIN_यदि मे राघवः कुर्याद्वनम् गच्चेति चोदितः || २-१२-८६
प्रतिकूलम् प्रियम् मे स्यान्न तु वत्सः करिष्यति |_END
BEGIN_"If Rama does contrary to my command to go to forest, it will be most welcome to me. 
But, Rama the darling would never do so."_END

B_2_C_17_6
BEGIN_यथा स्म पोषिताः पित्रा यथा पूर्वैः पितामहैः ||२-१७-९
ततः सुखतरं सर्वे रामे वत्स्याम राजनि |_END
BEGIN_"If Rama becomes king, we shall be more happy than when his father ruled and also when 
his grandfathers ruled._END

B_2_C_16_28
BEGIN_
ततो हयवरा मुख्या नागाश्च गिरिसन्निभाः || २-१६-३४
अनुजग्मुस्तदा रामं शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः |_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, hundreds and thousands of important people mounted on excellent horses
and soldiers mounted on elephants, then followed Rama._END

B_2_C_18_1
BEGIN_
स पितुः चरणौ पूर्वम् अभिवाद्य विनीतवत् |
ततः ववन्दे चरणौ कैकेय्याः सुसमाहितः || २-१८-२_END
BEGIN_
Rama being humble and well composed, first reverentially saluted his father's feet
and then saluted Kaikeyi's feet._END

B_2_C_15_37
BEGIN_स्वलंकृतान् सास्वरथान् सकुम्जरा |
नमात्यमुखयांश्च ददर्श वल्लभान् |
व्यपोह्य सूतः सहितान्समंततः |
समृद्धमंतःपुर माविवेश ह || २-१५-४८_END
BEGIN_The ministers in chief who were beloved to the king, were well-adorned and came there 
on horse-carriages and elephants. Sumantra passed over the people gathered there on all sides and entered 
the rich inner apartment._END

B_2_C_12_77
BEGIN_शुद्धिभावो हि भावम् मे न तु ज्ञास्यति राघवः || २-१२-८७
स वनम् प्रव्रजे त्युक्तोबाढ वित्येव वक्ष्यति |_END
BEGIN_"Rama, who is pure minded; cannot indeed conjecture my way of thinking. Having been told 
to go to the forest, he will say "Be it so."_END

B_2_C_14_41
BEGIN_
पौरजानपदैश्चापि नैगमैश्च कृताञ्जलिः |
स्वयं वसिष्ठो भगवान् ब्राह्मणैः सह तिष्ठति || २-१४-५५_END
BEGIN_
"The venerable Vashishta himself stands waiting at the gate along with brahmanas,
being saluted saluted with joined palms by citizens, village folk and merchants."_END

B_2_C_17_7
BEGIN_अलमद्य हि भुक्तेन परमार्थैरलं च नः || २-१७-१०
यथा पश्याम निर्यान्तं रामं राज्ये प्रतिष्ठितम् |_END
BEGIN_"If we can see Rama going forth in the city after getting coronated today, it is enough 
of eating or other activities."_END

B_2_C_16_29
BEGIN_
अग्रतश्चास्य सन्नद्धाश्चन्दनागुरुभूषिताः || २-१६-३५
खड्गचापधराः शूरा जग्मुराशंसवो जनाः |_END
BEGIN_
Valiant persons, dressed in armour adorned with sandal and aloe perfumes, wearing
swords and bows, declaring the arrival of Rama, went in front of Rama to receive him._END

B_2_C_18_2
BEGIN_
राम इति उक्त्वा च वचनम् वाष्प पर्याकुल ईक्षणः |
शशाक न्ऱ्पतिर् दीनो न ईक्षितुम् न अभिभाषितुम् || २-१८-३_END
BEGIN_
Dasaratha spoke only one word "Rama!" with his eyes filled with tears and dejected,
being not able to see or to talk any further words._END

B_2_C_15_38
BEGIN_ततोऽद्रिकूटाचलमेघसन्नि भं |
महाविमानोपमवेश्मसंयुतम् |
अवार्यमाणः प्रविवेश सारथिः |
प्रभूतरत्नं मकरो यथार्णवम् || २-१५-४९_END
BEGIN_Then, that Sumantra entered Rama's palace, which was like top of a mountain, like an 
unmoving cloud, which contained houses equal to excellent divine cars, like crocodile entering the ocean 
containing a number of precious stones. Nobody obstructed him._END

B_2_C_12_78
BEGIN_राघवे हि वनम् प्राप्ते सर्वलोकस्य धिक्कृतम् || २-१२-८८
मृत्युरक्षमणीयम् माम् नयिष्यति यमक्षयम् |_END
BEGIN_"On Rama reaching the forest, Death will take me, who is condemned by all men and unpardonable, 
to the abode of Yama the god of punishment."_END

B_2_C_14_42
BEGIN_
क्षिप्रमाज्ञ्प्यतां राजन् राघवस्याभिषेचन्म् |
यथा ह्यपालाः पशवो यथा सेना ह्यानायका || २-१४-५६
यथा च्न्द्रं विना रात्रिर्यथा गावो विना वृषम् |
एवं हि भविता राष्ट्रं यत्र राजा न दृश्यते || २-१४-५७_END
BEGIN_
"Oh king! Give orders quickly for Rama's coronation ceremony. A kingdom without a
king is like cattle without a herdsman, army without a commander, night without the moon and cows
without a bull."_END

B_2_C_16_30
BEGIN_
ततो वादित्रशब्दाश्च स्तुतिशब्दाश्च वन्दिनाम् ||२-१६-३६
सिंहनादाश्च शूराणां तदा शुश्रुविरे पथि |_END
BEGIN_
At that time, sounds of musical instruments, sounds of praising hymns of panagyrists
and lion-like roars of valiant persons were heard on the way._END

B_2_C_17_8
BEGIN_ततो हि न प्रियतरं नान्यत्किंचिद्भविश्यति || २-१७-११
यथाभिषेको रामस्य राज्येनामिततेजसः |_END
BEGIN_"There is no other dearer thing to us than coronation of Rama of unbounded splendour"._END

B_2_C_18_3
BEGIN_
तत् अपूर्वम् नर पतेर् द्ऱ्ष्ट्वा रूपम् भय आवहम् |
रामः अपि भयम् आपन्नः पदा स्प्ऱ्ष्ट्वा इव पन्नगम् || २-१८-४_END
BEGIN_
Having not seen earlier such a fearful form of his father, even Rama was frightened
as though he seized a snake by his foot._END

B_2_C_12_79
BEGIN_मृते मयि गते रामे वनम् मनुजपुङ्गवे || २-१२-८९
इष्टे मम जने शेषे किम् पापम् प्रतिवत्स्यसे |_END
BEGIN_"Rama the foremost among men-having left for the forest and I having been dead, what 
sinful act can you think of the remaining people beloved of me."_END

B_2_C_14_43
BEGIN_
इति तस्य वचः श्रुत्वा सान्त्वपूर्वमिवार्थवत् |
अभ्यकीर्यत शोकेन भूय एव महीपतिः || २-१४-५८_END
BEGIN_
King Dasaratha hearing his words which were soothing and meaningful, was surrounded
with grief once more._END

B_2_C_17_9
BEGIN_एताश्चान्याश्च शुहृदामुदासीनः सुभाः कथाः || २-१७-१२
आत्मसम्पूजनीः शृण्वन् ययौ रामो महापथम् |_END
BEGIN_Rama, though hearing of these good, words spoken by his friends about himself was passive 
and went in royal route._END

B_2_C_16_31
BEGIN_
हर्म्यवातायनस्थाभिर्भूषिताभिः समन्ततः || २-१६-३७
कीर्यमाणः सुपुष्पौघैर्ययौ स्त्रीभिररिंदमः |_END
BEGIN_
While Rama, the annihilator of enemies, was going, well-adorned women standing in
porticoes of palaces, sprinkled flowers on him from all sides._END

B_2_C_18_4
BEGIN_
इन्द्रियैः अप्रह्ऱ्ष्टैअः तम् शोक सम्ताप कर्शितम् |
निह्श्वसन्तम् महा राजम् व्यथित आकुल चेतसम् || २-१८-५
ऊर्मि मालिनम् अक्षोभ्यम् क्षुभ्यन्तम् इव सागरम् |
उपप्लुतम् इव आदित्यम् उक्त अन्ऱ्तम् ऱ्षिम् यथा || २-१८-६_END
BEGIN_
That king Dasaratha was sighing heavily with senses sans pleasure, emaciated with
grief and anguish, with distressed and agitated mind, like ocean which cannot be perturbed,
becoming perturbed with row of waves, like sun which is eclipsed and who lost lustre like by a sage
who spoke untruth._END

B_2_C_12_80
BEGIN_कौसल्या माम् च रामम् च पुत्रौ च यदि हास्यति || २-१२-९०
दुःखान्यसहती देवी मामेवानुमरिष्यति |_END
BEGIN_"The queen Kausalya, after losing me, Rama and sons Lakshmana and satrughna, will be 
enable to endure the woes and will follow me to the abode of Yama."_END

B_2_C_14_44
BEGIN_
ततः स राजा तम् सूतम् सन्न हर्षः सुतम् प्रति |
शोक आरक्त ईक्षणः श्रीमान् उद्वीक्ष्य उवाच धार्मिकः || २-१४ ५९
वाक्यैस्तु खलु मर्माणि मम भूयो निकृन्तसि |_END
BEGIN_
That king who was pious and glorious, having lost joy about his son, looked up with
sorrowful red eyes and spoke those to Sumantra. "You are chopping off my vitals further more, with
your words!."_END

B_2_C_17_10
BEGIN_नहि तस्मान्मनः कश्चिच्चक्षुषी वा नरोत्तमात् || २-१७-१३
नरः रोशवनोत्यपाक्रष्टुमातिक्रान्तोऽपि राघवे |_END
BEGIN_Though Rama became distant, no one could turn back one's eyes and mind from him, the 
best of men._END

B_2_C_16_32
BEGIN_
रामं सर्वानवद्याण्ग्यो रामपिप्रीषया ततः || २-१६-३८
वचोभिरग्र्यैर्हर्म्यस्थाः क्षितिस्थाश्च ववन्दिरे |_END
BEGIN_
Women of exquisitely beautiful form standing in palaces and on ground were offering
salutations to Rama with the best words with a desire to please Rama._END

B_2_C_18_5
BEGIN_
अचिन्त्य कल्पम् हि पितुस् तम् शोकम् उपधारयन् |
बभूव सम्रब्धतरः समुद्रैव पर्वणि || २-१८-७_END
BEGIN_
Contemplating over the unimaginable sorrow of the king, he was very much perturbed
as an ocean does on a full moon day._END

B_2_C_16_33
BEGIN_
नूनं नन्दति ते माता कौसल्या मातृनन्दन || २-१६-३९
पश्यन्ती सिद्धयात्रं त्वं पित्र्यं राज्यमुपस्थितम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama, who creates happiness to mother! Have successful journey! Your mother
Kausalya will be certainly delighted to see you obtaining the paternal kingdom."_END

B_2_C_12_81
BEGIN_कौसल्याम् च सुमित्राम् च माम् च पुत्रैस्त्रिभिः सह ||२-१२-९१
प्रक्षिव्य नरके सा त्वम् कैकेयि सुखिता भव |_END
BEGIN_"Having thrown Kausalya, Sumitra along with three sons and myself into tortures of hell, 
you be happy!."_END

B_2_C_14_45
BEGIN_
सुमन्त्रः करुणम् श्रुत्वा द्ऱ्ष्ट्वा दीनम् च पार्थिवम् || २-१४-६०
प्रग्ऱ्हीत अन्जलिः किंचित् तस्मात् देशात् अपाक्रमन् |_END
BEGIN_
Sumantra, after seeing the depressed king and hearing mournful words, joined palms
with salutation and slipped away to a distance from that place._END

B_2_C_17_11
BEGIN_यश्च रामं न पश्येत्तु यं च रामो न पश्यति || २-१७-१४
निन्दतः सर्वलोकेषु स्वात्माप्येनं विगर्हते |_END
BEGIN_All the people blamed the one who did not see Rama and the one who was not seen by Rama. 
Such a person would blame himself of it._END

B_2_C_18_6
BEGIN_
चिन्तयाम् आस च तदा रामः पित्ऱ् हिते रतः |
किंस्विद् अद्य एव न्ऱ्पतिर् न माम् प्रत्यभिनन्दति || २-१८-८_END
BEGIN_
The ingenious Rama, who is fond of his father's welfare, anxiously thought : " why
indeed the king is not greeting me in return just today?"_END

B_2_C_19_0
BEGIN_
तत् अप्रियम् अमित्रघ्नः वचनम् मरण उपमम् |
श्रुत्वा न विव्यथे रामः कैकेयीम् च इदम् अब्रवीत् || २-१९-१_END
BEGIN_
Rama the annihilator of enemies heard those harsh and deadly words but was
unruffled. He spoke these words to Kaikeyi._END

B_2_C_16_34
BEGIN_
सर्वसीमन्तिनीभ्यश्च सीतां सीमन्तिनीं वराम् || २-१६-४०
अमन्यन्त हि ता नार्यो रामस्य हृदयप्रियाम् |_END
BEGIN_
Those women thought that Sita, who is dear to Rama's heart, is better woman than all
women._END

B_2_C_12_82
BEGIN_मया रामेण च त्यक्तम् शाश्वतम् सत्कृतम् गुणैः || २-१२-९२
इक्ष्वाकुकुलमक्षोभ्यमाकुलम् पालयिष्यसि |_END
BEGIN_"Being abandoned by me and Rama, the Ikshhvaaku dynasty which was eternal, which was 
adorned with qualities, which could not be disturbed, will now be protected by you by bringing disorder."_END

B_2_C_14_46
BEGIN_
यदा वक्तुम् स्वयम् दैन्यान् न शशाक मही पतिः || २-१४-६१
तदा सुमन्त्रम् मन्त्रज्ञा कैकेयी प्रत्युवाच ह |_END
BEGIN_
Dasaratha could not say any thing himself because of depression. Then, Kaikeyi who
is experienced in fore-thoughts, spoke thus to Sumantra._END

B_2_C_17_12
BEGIN_सर्वेषाम् स हि धर्मात्मा वर्णानां कुरुते दयाम् || २-१७-१५
चतुर्णां हि वयह्स्थानाम् तेन ते तमनुव्रता |_END
BEGIN_Rama, the virtuous, had compassion towards all the four classes of men and towards the 
aged people. Hence, they were all devoted to him._END

B_2_C_18_7
BEGIN_
अन्यदा माम् पिता द्ऱ्ष्ट्वा कुपितः अपि प्रसीदति |
तस्य माम् अद्य सम्प्रेक्ष्य किम् आयासः प्रवर्तते || २-१८-९_END
BEGIN_
"At other times, the father, even though angry used to be gracious after seeing me
why today such a father has become weary after seeing me?"_END

B_2_C_19_1
BEGIN_
एवम् अस्तु गमिष्यामि वनम् वस्तुम् अहम् तु अतः |
जटा चीर धरः राज्ञः प्रतिज्ञाम् अनुपालयन् || २-१९-२_END
BEGIN_
"Let it be, as you said it. I shall fulfil the king's promise, go to the forest from
here to reside there, wearing braided hair and covered with a hide."_END

B_2_C_16_35
BEGIN_
तया सुचरितं देव्या पुरा नूनं महत्तपः || २-१६-४१
रोहिणीव शशाङ्केन रामसंयोगमाप या |_END
BEGIN_
"As Rohini star stays together with the moon, Sita having obtained Rama as husband
must have certainly performed a great penance in former times."_END

B_2_C_12_83
BEGIN_प्रियम् चेद्भरतस्यैतद्रामप्रव्राजनम् भवेत् || २-१२-९३
मा स्म मे भरतः कार्षीत् प्रेतकृत्यम् गतायुषः |_END
BEGIN_"If it becomes agreeable to Bharata to send Rama to exile, let not Bharata do funeral 
rite to me, when life has departed."_END

B_2_C_17_13
BEGIN_चत्पुष्पथान् देवपथांश्चैत्यांश्चायतनानि च || २-१७-१६
प्रदक्षिणं परिहरन् जगाम नृपतेस्सुतः |_END
BEGIN_Rama went by crossing road junction, god's paths, sacred trees and temples keeping his 
right side towards them._END

B_2_C_14_47
BEGIN_
सुमन्त्र राजा रजनीं रामहर्षसमुत्सुकः || २-१४-६२
प्रजागरपरिश्रान्तो निद्रावशमुपेयुवान् |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh Sumantra! The king, being smitten by emotional joy in relation to Rama, who
tired of awakening the whole night and got subjected to sleep"_END

B_2_C_18_8
BEGIN_
स दीनैव शोक आर्तः विषण्ण वदन द्युतिः |
कैकेयीम् अभिवाद्य एव रामः वचनम् अब्रवीत् || २-१८-१०_END
BEGIN_
Rama indeed distressed and afflicted with grief, with lustre faded from his face,
offered his salutation to Kaikeyi and spoke these words._END

B_2_C_19_2
BEGIN_
इदम् तु ज्ञातुम् इच्चामि किम् अर्थम् माम् मही पतिः |
न अभिनन्दति दुर्धर्षो यथा पुरम् अरिम् दमः || २-१९-३_END
BEGIN_
"But I want to know why the king, the inviolable and the subduer of enemies, is not
greeting me today as before."_END

B_2_C_16_36
BEGIN_
इति प्रासादशृङ्गेषु प्रमदाभिर्नरोत्तमः || २-१६-४२
शुश्राव राजमार्गस्थः प्रिया वाच उदाहृताः |_END
BEGIN_
While going through the royal road, Rama heard those pleasant words spoken thus by
women standing in turrets._END

B_2_C_12_84
BEGIN_हन्तानार्ये ममामित्रे सकामा भव कैकयि || २-१२-९४
मृते मयि गते रामे वनम् पुरुषपुङ्गवे |
सेदानीम् विधवा राज्यम् सपुत्रा कारयिष्यसि || २-१२-९५_END
BEGIN_"Alas! My adversary! Oh, vulgar lady, Kaikeyi! Become satisfied with your desires! When 
I am dead consequent on Rama, the foremost of men, having proceeded to forest, you a widow along with 
your son will then rule over the kingdom."_END

B_2_C_17_14
BEGIN_स राजकुलमासाद्य मेघसंघोपमैः शुभैः || २-१७-१७
प्रासादशृङ्गैर्विविधैः कैलासशिखरोपमैः |
आवारयद्भिर्गनं विमानैरिव पाण्डुरैः || २-१७-१८
वर्धमानगृहैश्चापि रत्नजालपरिष्कृतैः |
तत्पृथिव्यां गृहवरं महेन्द्रसदनोपमम् || २-१७-१९
राजपुत्रः पितुर्वेश्म प्रविवेश श्रिया ज्वलन् |_END
BEGIN_Rama approached the royal abode and entered his father's palace which was the best palace 
with blazing radiance like the palace of king of celestials on earth. All around the house, there were 
various types turrets looking like Mount Kailasa, as group of clouds, as white heavenly cars touching 
the sky. There were royal houses named vardhamana which were adorned with a net of precious stones._END

B_2_C_14_48
BEGIN_
तद्गच्छ त्वरितं सूत राजपुत्रं यशस्विनम् || २-१४-६३
राममानय भद्रं ते नात्र कार्या विचारणा |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Sumantra! Hence, quickly go and bring the glorious prince Rama. Blessedness to
you! Do not have any hesitation in this matter. "_END

B_2_C_18_9
BEGIN_
कच्चिन् मया न अपराधम् अज्ञानात् येन मे पिता |
कुपितः तन् मम आचक्ष्व त्वम् चैव एनम् प्रसादय || २-१८-११_END
BEGIN_
"I hope that I have not done anything wrong through ignorance. Tell me why father is
angry with me. You alone propitiate him in my favour."_END

B_2_C_19_3
BEGIN_
मन्युर् न च त्वया कार्यो देवि ब्रूहि तव अग्रतः |
यास्यामि भव सुप्रीता वनम् चीर जटा धरः || २-१९-४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, queen! you need not be indignant. I am telling before you that I shall go to
the forest, wearing rags and braided hair. Become delighted well."_END

B_2_C_16_37
BEGIN_
स राघवस्त्रत्र तदा प्रलापान् |
शुश्राव लोकस्य समागतस्य |
आत्माधिकारा विविधाश्च वाचः |
प्रहृष्टरूपस्य पुरे जनस्य || २-१६-४३_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama heard the words of people gathered there and also the words variously
pertaining to himself, by citizens._END

B_2_C_12_85
BEGIN_त्वम् राजपुत्रीवादेन न्यवसो मम वेश्मनि |
अकीर्तिश्चातुला लोके ध्रुवः परिभवश्च मे || २-१२-९६
सर्वभूतेषु चावज्ञा यथा पापकृतस्तथा |_END
BEGIN_"You are residing in my house with the designation of a princess. All fame, which is 
unequalled in this world and lasting insult as well as disrespect of men will fall to my share as to 
a perpetrator of sins._END

B_2_C_17_15
BEGIN_स कक्ष्या धन्विभिर्गुप्तास्तिस्रोऽतिक्रम्य वाजिभिः || २-१७-२०
पदातिरपरे कक्ष्ये द्वे जगाम नरोत्तमः |_END
BEGIN_Rama the best of men crossed with chariot three enclosures protected by men armed with 
bows and moved over the other two enclosures by foot._END

B_2_C_14_49
BEGIN_
स मन्यमानः कल्याणम् हृदयेन नन्नन्ध च || २-१४-६४
निर्जगाम च संप्रीत्या त्वरितो राजशासनात् |_END
BEGIN_
"He was thinking of that auspicious occasion in heart and rejoiced. With pleasure,
he set out, by the orders of the king."_END

B_2_C_18_10
BEGIN_
अप्रसन्नमनाः किम् नु सदा मां प्रति वत्सलः |
विवर्ण वदनो दीनो न हि माम् अभिभाषते || २-१८-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Why my father, who was always affectionate to me, has become displeased? With his
face becoming pale and dejected, he is not talking to me."_END

B_2_C_19_4
BEGIN_
हितेन गुरुणा पित्रा क्ऱ्तज्ञेन न्ऱ्पेण च |
नियुज्यमानो विश्रब्धम् किम् न कुर्यात् अहम् प्रियम् || २-१९-५_END
BEGIN_
"How can I not do faithfully an action dear to my father, as commanded by him as
well-wisher, venerable man, as person with right conduct and as king."_END

B_2_C_16_38
BEGIN_
एष श्रियं गच्छति राघवोऽद्य|
राजप्रसादातद् विपुलं गमिष्यन् |
एते वयम् सर्वसमृद्धकामा|
योषामयं नो भविता प्रशास्ता || २-१६-४४_END
BEGIN_
"By the king's propitiousness, this Rama today is going to obtain this earth and the
wealthy kingdom. All our desires are going to be fulfilled because Rama will become the ruler."_END

B_2_C_12_86
BEGIN_कथम् रथैर्विभुर्गत्वा गजाश्वैश्च मुहुर्मुहुः || २-१२-९७
पद्भ्याम् रामो महारण्ये वत्सो मे विचरिष्यति |_END
BEGIN_"How can my beloved son Rama, who was hitherto travelling as a Lord time again in chariots 
elephants and horses, will move on foot in a great forest?"_END

B_2_C_17_16
BEGIN_स सर्वाः समतिक्रम्य कक्ष्या दशरथात्मजः || २-१७-२१
संनिवर्त्य जनं सर्वं शुद्धान्तःपुरुमत्यगात् |_END
BEGIN_That Rama passed over all the gates, sent all the people back and entered the palace._END

B_2_C_14_50
BEGIN_
सुमन्त्रश्चिन्तयामास त्वरितं चोदितस्तया || २-१४-६५
व्यक्तं रामोऽभिषेकार्थमिहायास्यति धर्मवित् |_END
BEGIN_
Instigated by her, Sumantra thought that the righteous Rama would come there
certainly for coronation._END

B_2_C_18_11
BEGIN_
शारीरः मानसो वा अपि कच्चित् एनम् न बाधते |
सम्तापो वा अभितापो वा दुर्लभम् हि सदा सुखम् || २-१८-१३_END
BEGIN_
"I hope that either bodily affliction or mental distress is not troubling him. The
object of happiness is indeed difficult to be attained always!"_END

B_2_C_19_5
BEGIN_
अलीकम् मानसम् तु एकम् ह्ऱ्दयम् दहति इव मे |
स्वयम् यन् न आह माम् राजा भरतस्य अभिषेचनम् || २-१९-६_END
BEGIN_
"My heart is burning indeed with one sorrowful feeling that king himself has not
informed me about Bharata's coronation."_END

B_2_C_16_39
BEGIN_
लाभो जनस्यास्य यदेष सर्वं|
प्रपत्स्यते राष्ट्रमिदं चिराय |
न ह्यप्रियं किंचन जातु कश्चित् |
पश्येन्न कुःखं मनुजादिपेऽस्मिन् || २-१६-४५_END
BEGIN_
"If Rama rules this state for a long time, it will be a great benefit to the people.
If he becomes a king none can see dislike and sorrow at any time."_END

B_2_C_12_87
BEGIN_यस्य त्वाहारसमये सूदाः कुण्डलधारिणः || २-१२-९८
अहम्पुर्वाः पचन्ति स्म प्रशस्तम् पानभोजनम् |
स कथन्नु कषायाणि तिक्तानि कटुकानि च || २-१२-९९
भक्षयन्वन्यमाहारम् सुतो मे वर्तयिष्यति |_END
BEGIN_How will my sin; in whose dining time; cooks wearing ear-rings used to prepare excellent 
food and drinks trying to finish their work before others actually survive by eating astringent bitter 
and pungent wild foods?"_END

B_2_C_17_17
BEGIN_तस्मिन् प्रविष्टे पितुर्न्तिकं तदा |
जनः स सर्वो मुदितो नृपात्मजे |
प्रतीक्षते तस्य पुनः स्म निर्गमम् |
यथोदयं चन्द्रमसः सरित्पतिः || २-१७-२२_END
BEGIN_When Rama went nearer to his father, all the people there were delighted waiting for 
his return as the ocean waits for raising of the moon._END

B_2_C_20_0
BEGIN_
तस्मिंस्तु पुरुष्व्याघ्रे निष्क्रामति कृताञ्जलौ |
आर्तशच्दो महान् जज्ञे स्त्रीणाम न्तःपुरे तदा || २-२०-१_END
BEGIN_
While Rama, the best of men was leaving, after offering salutation to his father,
women in the palace were weaping loudly._END

B_2_C_14_51
BEGIN_
इति सूतो मतिं कृत्वा हर्षेण महता वृतः || २-१४-६६
निर्जगाम महाबाहो राघवस्य दिदृक्षया |_END
BEGIN_
Sumantra thus thinking and dwelling in a great joy, set out with a desire to see the
long armed Rama_END

B_2_C_18_12
BEGIN_
कच्चिन् न किंचित् भरते कुमारे प्रिय दर्शने |
शत्रुघ्ने वा महा सत्त्वे मात्ऱ्ऱ्णाम् वा मम अशुभम् || २-१८-१४_END
BEGIN_
"I hope that no bad thing occurred to Bharata, the delightful man to look at or to
Shatrughna, the man of great strength or to my mother. "_END

B_2_C_19_6
BEGIN_
अहम् हि सीताम् राज्यम् च प्राणान् इष्टान् धनानि च |
ह्ऱ्ष्टः भ्रात्रे स्वयम् दद्याम् भरताय अप्रचोदितः || २-१९-७_END
BEGIN_
"Without being asked, I myself would have gladly offered even Sita with kingdom,
even my life, loved ones and wealth."_END

B_2_C_16_40
BEGIN_
स घोषवद्भिश्च हयैः सनागैः |
पुरस्सरैः स्वस्तिकसूतमागधैः |
महीयमानः प्रवरैश्च वादकैः |
अभिष्टुतो वैश्रवणो यथा ययौ|| २-१६-४६_END
BEGIN_
While bards and panegyrists were moving in front praising with great respect,
invoking blessings and eulogised by the most excellent instrumentalists, Rama, like Kubera the god
of wealth, went with resounding horses and elephants._END

B_2_C_12_88
BEGIN_महार्हवस्त्रसम्वीतो भूत्वा चिरसुखोषितः || २-१२-१००
काशायपरिधानस्तु कथम् भूमौ निवत्स्यति |_END
BEGIN_"How having worn costly robes, will Rama who is deserving of lasting comforts, be in 
brown-red clothing on this earth?"_END

B_2_C_20_1
BEGIN_
क्ऱ्^त्येष्वचोदितः पित्रा सर्वस्यान्तः पुरस्य च |
गतिर्यः शरणम् चासीत् स रोओमोऽद्य प्रवत्स्यति || २-२०-२_END
BEGIN_
Which Rama, without being told by his father, used to do necessary activities and
protect the entire palace, is about to go to exile now"._END

B_2_C_14_52
BEGIN_
सागरह्रदसंकाशात्सुमन्त्रोऽन्तःपुराच्छुभात् || २-१४-६७
निष्क्रम्य जनसंबाधं ददर्श द्वारमग्रतः |_END
BEGIN_
Sumantra coming out of gynaceumwhich looked like a splendid pool in the sea, saw the
gate being congested with throngs of people._END

B_2_C_18_13
BEGIN_
अतोषयन् महा राजम् अकुर्वन् वा पितुर् वचः |
मुहूर्तम् अपि न इच्चेयम् जीवितुम् कुपिते न्ऱ्पे || २-१८-१५_END
BEGIN_
"If our father becomes angry, I do not desire to live even for a moment without
satisfying him or without fulfilling his command."_END

B_2_C_19_7
BEGIN_
किम् पुनर् मनुज इन्द्रेण स्वयम् पित्रा प्रचोदितः |
तव च प्रिय काम अर्थम् प्रतिज्ञाम् अनुपालयन् || २-१९-८_END
BEGIN_
"Being directed by king, who is my father himself, how much more should I tell that
I can give everything to Bharata, duly obeying father's promise to fulfil your beloved desire."_END

B_2_C_16_41
BEGIN_
करेणुमात्ङ्गरथाश्वसंकुलं |
महाजनौघैः परिपूर्णचत्वरम् |
प्रभूतरत्नं बहुपण्यसंचयं |
ददर्श रामो विमलं महापथम् || २-१६-४७_END
BEGIN_
Rama saw the great royal road which was spotlessly clean, having diamonds and
various vendible commodities. It was full of male and female elephants, horses and chariots. There
was abundance of people gathered at road junctions._END

B_2_C_12_89
BEGIN_कस्यैतद्धारुणम् वाक्यमेवम् विधमचिन्तितम् || २-१२-१०१
रामस्यारण्यगवनम् भरतस्यैव मातरम् |_END
BEGIN_"Whose terrific and thoughtless words are these of one demanding Rama's exile to forest 
and the other of Bharata's consecration as king?"_END

B_2_C_20_2
BEGIN_
कौसल्यायाम् यथा युक्तो जनन्याम् वर्तते सदा |
तथैव वर्ततेऽस्मासु जन्मप्रभृति राघवः || २-२०-३_END
BEGIN_
"Rama, since he was born, was showing the same attention to us, as he was showing to
his mother Kausalya."_END

B_2_C_14_53
BEGIN_
ततः पुरस्तत्सासा विनिर्गतो |
महीपतीन् द्वारगतो विलोकयन् |
ददर्श पौरान् विविधान्महाधना |
नुपस्थितान् द्वारमुपेत्य विष्ठतान् || २-१४-६८_END
BEGIN_
Afterwards, proceeding further on, he saw near the gate some kings stationed there
and very rich citizens having arrived there._END

B_2_C_18_14
BEGIN_
यतः मूलम् नरः पश्येत् प्रादुर्भावम् इह आत्मनः |
कथम् तस्मिन् न वर्तेत प्रत्यक्षे सति दैवते || २-१८-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Man sees father as the visible god who is the root cause of one's own coming into
existence and how else can he behave towards him other than like that?"_END

B_2_C_19_8
BEGIN_
तत् आश्वासय हि इमम् त्वम् किम् न्व् इदम् यन् मही पतिः |
वसुधा आसक्त नयनो मन्दम् अश्रूणि मुन्चति || २-१९-९_END
BEGIN_
"That is why, you console him. Why indeed the king is thus slowly shedding tears,
with eyes gazed upon the floor?"_END

B_2_C_12_90
BEGIN_धिगस्तु योषितो नाम शठाः स्वार्थपरास्सदा || २-१२-१०२
न ब्रवीमि स्त्रियः सर्वा भरतस्यैव मातरम् |_END
BEGIN_"Women of course are deceivers, even occupied with selfishness. Let them be condemned! 
Here, I am not mentioning of all women but of Bharata's mother only."_END

B_2_C_20_3
BEGIN_
न क्रुध्यत्यभिशस्तोऽपि क्रोधनीयानि वर्जयन् |
कृद्धान् प्रसादयन् सर्वान् स इतोऽद्य प्रवत्स्यति || २-२०-४_END
BEGIN_
"He used to avoid actions which created anger and soothed all those who were angry.
Rama was not furious with those who abused him. Such Rama is going today to exile."_END

B_2_C_18_15
BEGIN_
कच्चित् ते परुषम् किंचित् अभिमानात् पिता मम |
उक्तः भवत्या कोपेन यत्र अस्य लुलितम् मनः || २-१८-१७_END
BEGIN_
"I hope you have not spoken anything which hurt my father's conscience with your
pride and anger."_END

B_2_C_19_9
BEGIN_
गच्चन्तु च एव आनयितुम् दूताः शीघ्र जवैः हयैः |
भरतम् मातुल कुलात् अद्य एव न्ऱ्प शासनात् || २-१९-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Let messengers go now itself on fleet horses to bring Bharata from maternal uncle's
house as per orders of the king."_END

B_2_C_12_91
BEGIN_अनर्थभावेऽ र्थपरे नृशंसे |
ममानुतापाय निविष्टभावे |
किमप्रियम् पश्यसि मन्निमित्तम् |
हितानुकारिण्यथवापि रामे || २-१२-१०३_END
BEGIN_"Oh, cruel woman of evil intent; given to pursuit of your selfish ends, you have a settled 
disposition to bring grief to me. What a mischief do you expect through me or through Rama, who is always 
doing benefit to you?"_END

B_2_C_20_4
BEGIN_
अभुद्धिर्बत नो राजा जीवलोकम् चरत्ययम् |
यो गतिम् सर्वभूतानाम् परित्यजति राघवम् || २-२०-५_END
BEGIN_
"Our stupid king by abandoning Rama who was helpful to all beings , is offending all
the beings."_END

B_2_C_18_16
BEGIN_
एतत् आचक्ष्व मे देवि तत्त्वेन परिप्ऱ्च्चतः |
किम् निमित्तम् अपूर्वो अयम् विकारः मनुज अधिपे || २-१८-१८_END
BEGIN_
"I am asking you why my father got this perturbation, which was not there earlier.
Tell me the true position."_END

B_2_C_19_10
BEGIN_
दण्डक अरण्यम् एषो अहम् इतः गच्चामि सत्वरः |
अविचार्य पितुर् वाक्यम् समावस्तुम् चतुर् दश || २-१९-११_END
BEGIN_
"Immediately, I shall go to live in forest of Dandaka for fourteen years, without
reflecting on whether my father's words are right or wrong."_END

B_2_C_12_92
BEGIN_परित्यजेयुः पितरो हि पुत्रान् |
भार्याः वतींश्चापि कृतानुरागाः |
कृत्स्नम् हि सर्वम् कुपितम् जगत्स्या |
द्दृष्ट्वे रानन् व्तसबे बुनग्बन् || २-१२-१०४_END
BEGIN_"On seeing Rama plunged in adversity fathers leave of their sons and wives too their 
husbands. Not, even the entire world gets exasperated."_END

B_2_C_20_5
BEGIN_
इति सर्वा महिष्यस्ता विवत्सा इव धेनवः |
पतिमाचुक्रुशुश्चैव सस्वरम् चापि चुक्रुशुः || २-२०-६_END
BEGIN_
Thus, all the king consorts while weaping loudly, as cows which lost their Calves,
abused their husband ._END

B_2_C_18_17
BEGIN_
एवमुक्ता तु कैकेयी राघवेण महात्मना |
उवाचेदं सुनिर्लज्जा धृष्टमात्महितं वचः || २-१८-१९_END
BEGIN_
Thus questioned by the great souled Rama, Kaikeyi fearlessly spoke these words for
her own benefit, without any shame on her part._END

B_2_C_19_11
BEGIN_
सा ह्ऱ्ष्टा तस्य तत् वाक्यम् श्रुत्वा रामस्य कैकयी |
प्रस्थानम् श्रद्दधाना हि त्वरयाम् आस राघवम् || २-१९-१२_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Rama's words, Kaikeyi felt glad that he would certainly go and urged him to
make haste at once._END

B_2_C_12_93
BEGIN_अहम् पुनर्देवकुमाररूप |
मलकृतम् तम् सुतमाव्रजन्तम् |
नन्दामि पश्यन्नपि दर्शनेन |
भवामि दृष्ट्वा च पुनर्युवेव || २-१२-१०५_END
BEGIN_"I, for one, rejoice by seeing that son Rama in the form of a divine boy, adorned with 
ornaments coming in proximity to me. By seeing him again and again, I get rejuvenated."_END

B_2_C_20_6
BEGIN_
स हि चान्तः पुरे घोरमार्तशब्धम् महीपतिः |
पुत्रशोकाभिसन्तप्तः श्रुत्वा व्यालीयतासने || २-२०-७_END
BEGIN_
After hearing the terrific distressful crying sounds in the palace, Dasaratha clung
to the seat, with extreme anguish for his son._END

B_2_C_18_18
BEGIN_
न राजा कुपितो राम व्यसनम् नास्य किंचन |
किंचिन्मनोगतं त्वस्य त्वद्भयान्नाभिभाषते || २-१८-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! The king is not angry. There is nothing of distress for him. But he has
something in mind which he is not telling from fear."_END

B_2_C_19_12
BEGIN_
एवम् भवतु यास्यन्ति दूताः शीघ्र जवैः हयैः |
भरतम् मातुल कुलात् उपावर्तयितुम् नराः || २-१९-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Let it be so. Messengers can go on horses having rapid speed, to bring back Bharata
from his maternal uncle's house."_END

B_2_C_12_94
BEGIN_विनापि सूर्येण भवेत्प्रवृत्ति |
रवर्ष्ता वज्रधरेण वापि |
रामम् तु गच्छन्तमितः समीक्ष्य |
जीवेन्न कश्चित्त्विति चेतना मे || २-१२-१०६_END
BEGIN_"Active life may not be possible even without sun or even Indra (the wielder of thunder 
bolt) not pouring rain. But, my opinion is that not even one will survive, by seeing Rama departing 
from here."_END

B_2_C_20_7
BEGIN_
रामः तु भ्ऱ्शम् आयस्तः निह्श्वसन्न् इव कुन्जरः |
जगाम सहितः भ्रात्रा मातुर् अन्तः पुरम् वशी || २-२०-८_END
BEGIN_
Rama, who was greatly hurt, sighed like an elephant, subdued his senses and went to
his mother's palace along with Lakshmana_END

B_2_C_21_0
BEGIN_तथा तु विलपन्तीम् ताम् कौसल्याम् राम मातरम् |
उवाच लक्ष्मणो दीनः तत् काल सदृशम् वचः || २-२१-१_END
BEGIN_Lakshmana became dejected and spoke these words, properly befitting for that time, to 
that Rama's mother Kausalya who was thus weeping._END

B_2_C_18_19
BEGIN_
प्रियम् त्वामप्रियम् वक्तुम् वाणी नास्योपपर्तते |
तदवश्यम् त्वया कार्यम् यदनेनाश्रुतम् मम || २-१८-२१_END
BEGIN_
"To him, words are not coming off to tell disagreeable utterance to you, the dear
one. He promised me a word. It is to be certainly done by you."_END

B_2_C_19_13
BEGIN_
तव तु अहम् क्षमम् मन्ये न उत्सुकस्य विलम्बनम् |
राम तस्मात् इतः शीघ्रम् वनम् त्वम् गन्तुम् अर्हसि || २-१९-१४_END
BEGIN_
"But I think it is not quite appropriate for you who are enthusiastic to go to
forest, to delay further."_END

B_2_C_12_95
BEGIN_विनाशकामामहिताममित्रा |
मावासयम् मृत्युमिवात्मनस्त्वम् |
चिरम् बताङ्केन धृतासि सर्पी |
महाविष तेन हतोऽस्मि मोहात् || २-१२-१०७_END
BEGIN_"I lodged in my house, as one would one's own mortal enemy, you, who seek my destruction 
and are unfriendly. Alas, due to ignorance, a highly venomous female serpent has been held on my lap 
so long and therefore I am undone."_END

B_2_C_20_8
BEGIN_
सो अपश्यत् पुरुषम् तत्र व्ऱ्द्धम् परम पूजितम् |
उपविष्टम् ग्ऱ्ह द्वारि तिष्ठतः च अपरान् बहून् || २-२०-९_END
BEGIN_
Rama saw a much worshipped old man sitting at the gateway of the house and many
other standing there._END

B_2_C_21_1
BEGIN_न रोचते मम अपि एतत् आर्ये यद् राघवो वनम् |
त्यक्त्वा राज्य श्रियम् गच्चेत् स्त्रिया वाक्य वशम् गतः || २-२१-२_END
BEGIN_"Oh, the honoured lady ! I also do not like Rama to be influenced by the words of a woman 
and go to the forest, leaving the prosperous kingdom."_END

B_2_C_18_20
BEGIN_
एष मह्यम् वरम् दत्त्वा पुरा मामभिपूज्य च |
स पश्चात्तप्यते राजा यथान्यः प्राकृतस्तथा || २-१८-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Long ago, the king honoured me and gave me a boon. Like a common man, he is
repenting now for having given the boon."_END

B_2_C_19_14
BEGIN_
व्रीडा अन्वितः स्वयम् यच् च न्ऱ्पः त्वाम् न अभिभाषते |
न एतत् किंचिन् नर श्रेष्ठ मन्युर् एषो अपनीयताम् || २-१९-१५_END
BEGIN_
"It is nothing but shyness that the king is not able to speak to you. Oh Rama, the
best of men! Do not worry about it."_END

B_2_C_12_96
BEGIN_मया च रामेण सलक्ष्मणेन |
प्रशास्तु हीनो भरतस्त्वया सह |
पुरम् च राष्ट्रम् च निहत्य बान्धवान् |
ममाहितानाम् च भवाभिहर्षिणी || २-१२-१०८_END
BEGIN_"Bereft of me as also Rama and Lakshmana, let Bharata along with you, rule over the city 
and the state. After killing your relatives, bring delight to my enemies."_END

B_2_C_20_9
BEGIN_
द्ऱ्^ष्ट्वै तु तदा रामं ते सर्वे सहसोत्थिताः |
जयेन जयताम् श्रेष्ठम् वर्धयन्ति स्म राघवम् || २-२०-१०_END
BEGIN_
After seeing Rama, all of them rose quickly and greeted Rama the most triumphant
man, by uttering the words "May you have increased success!"_END

B_2_C_21_2
BEGIN_विपरीतः च वृद्धः च विषयैः च प्रधर्षितः |
नृपः किम् इव न ब्रूयाच् चोद्यमानः समन्मथः || २-२१-३_END
BEGIN_"The king with perverted mind, of old age, one who is outraged by sensual enjoyments 
and possessed of passion can talk any thing, prompted by Kaikeyi."_END

B_2_C_18_21
BEGIN_
अतिसृज्य ददानीति वरम् मम विशाम्पतिः |
स निरर्थं गतजले सेतुम् बन्धितुमिच्छति || २-१८-२३_END
BEGIN_
"This king promised me to give the boon and now he desires to build a dam wastefully
on a place where water has gone away."_END

B_2_C_19_15
BEGIN_
यावत् त्वम् न वनम् यातः पुरात् अस्मात् अभित्वरन् |
पिता तावन् न ते राम स्नास्यते भोक्ष्यते अपि वा || २-१९-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! Your father will neither take his bath nor eat a meal until you leave the
city for the forest immediately._END

B_2_C_12_97
BEGIN_नृशंसवृत्ते व्यसनप्रहारिणि |
प्रसह्य वाक्यम् यदिहाद्य भाषसे |
न नाम ते केन मुखात्पतन्त्यधो |
विशीर्यमाणा दशना स्सहस्रधा || २-१२-१०९_END
BEGIN_"Oh, cruel natured! One who has struck a blow in adversity! When you violently utter 
such words now, why the teeth from your mouth have not fallen down, breaking into thousands of pieces?"_END

B_2_C_20_10
BEGIN_
प्रविश्य प्रथमाम् कक्ष्याम् द्वितीयायाम् ददर्श सः |
ब्राह्मणान् वेद सम्पन्नान् व्ऱ्द्धान् राज्ञा अभिसत्क्ऱ्तान् || २-२०-११_END
BEGIN_
Rama crossed the first gate and saw old Brahmanas who were perfect in Vedas and duly
honoured by the king._END

B_2_C_21_3
BEGIN_न अस्य अपराधम् पश्यामि न अपि दोषम् तथा विधम् |
येन निर्वास्यते राष्ट्रात् वन वासाय राघवः || २-२१-४_END
BEGIN_"I can not see any offence or cause for blame in Rama that can expel him from the state 
to the forest."_END

B_2_C_18_22
BEGIN_
धर्मूलमिदम् राम विदितम् च सतामपि |
तत्सत्यम् न त्यजेद्राजा कुपितस्त्वत्कृते यथा || २-१८-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! It is known by even wise men, that truth is the root of righteousness.
See that the offended king does not abandon such a truth for your sake."_END

B_2_C_19_16
BEGIN_
धिक् कष्टम् इति निह्श्वस्य राजा शोक परिप्लुतः |
मूर्चितः न्यपतत् तस्मिन् पर्यन्के हेम भूषिते || २-१९-१७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing these words, the king saying "what a pity! How much misery!" was overwhelmed
with sorrow, fainted and fell in that couch adorned with gold._END

B_2_C_12_98
BEGIN_न किंचिदाहाहितमप्रियम् वचो |
न वेत्ति रामः परुशाणि Bहाषितुम् |
कथन्नु रामे ह्यभिरामवादिनि |
ब्रवीषि दोषान् गुणनित्यसम्मते || २-१२-११०_END
BEGIN_"Rama does not speak a word which is even a little malevolent or unkindly. He does not 
know how to utter harsh words. How indeed are you recounting the faults of Rama, who talks beautifully 
and who is always admired for his virtues"_END

B_2_C_20_11
BEGIN_
प्रणम्य रामः तान् व्ऱ्द्धांस् त्ऱ्तीयायाम् ददर्श सः |
स्त्रियो व्ऱ्द्धाः च बालाः च द्वार रक्षण तत्पराः || २-२०-१२_END
BEGIN_
Rama offered salutation to those brahmanas and saw old women and girls, guarding the
gate in the third enclosure._END

B_2_C_21_4
BEGIN_न तम् पश्याम्य् अहम् लोके परोक्षम् अपि यो नरः |
स्वमित्रोऽपि निरस्तोऽपि योऽस्यदोषमुदाहरेत् || २-२१-५_END
BEGIN_I have not seen in this world any person, whether an enemy or an expellee, speaking ill 
of Rama indirectly."_END

B_2_C_18_23
BEGIN_
यदि तद्वक्ष्यते राजा शुभम् वा यदि वाऽशुभम् |
करिष्यसि ततः सर्वमाख्यामि पुनस्त्वहम् || २-१८-२५_END
BEGIN_
"The king is about to mention that truth which may look auspicious or inauspicious
to you. Still, I shall tell you all that, if you shall do it afterwards."_END

B_2_C_19_17
BEGIN_
रामः अपि उत्थाप्य राजानम् कैकेय्या अभिप्रचोदितः |
कशया इव आहतः वाजी वनम् गन्तुम् क्ऱ्त त्वरः || २-१९-१८_END
BEGIN_
Rama lifted up the king and soon got hurried up to leave for the forest he was again
instigated by Kaikeyi as a horse was hit by a whip._END

B_2_C_12_99
BEGIN_प्रताम्य वा प्रज्वल वा प्रणश्य वा |
सहस्रशो वा स्फुटिता महीम् व्रज |
न ते करिष्यमि वचः सुदारुणम् |
ममाहितम् केकयराजपांसनि || २-१२-१११_END
BEGIN_"Oh, Kaikeyi, the black guard of Keka dynasty! You may faint away or flare up or perish 
or enter the earth split up into thousands of cracks! I will not act on your word which is very cruel 
and inimical to me."_END

B_2_C_20_12
BEGIN_
वर्धयित्वा प्रह्ऱ्ष्टाः ताः प्रविश्य च ग्ऱ्हम् स्त्रियः |
न्यवेदयन्त त्वरिता राम मातुः प्रियम् तदा || २-२०-१३_END
BEGIN_
Then those women, having been delighted, greeted Rama with good word of success,
quickly entered the house and informed Kausalya about the lovely arrival of Rama ._END

B_2_C_21_5
BEGIN_देव कल्पम् ऋजुम् दान्तम् रिपूणाम् अपि वत्सलम् |
अवेक्षमाणः को धर्मम् त्यजेत् पुत्रम् अकारणात् || २-२१-६_END
BEGIN_"Can anybody observing ethicalness, causelessly get rid of a son who is equal to god 
who is honest, who is self-restrained and who is affectionate even towards adversaries?"_END

B_2_C_18_24
BEGIN_
यदि त्वभिहितं राज्ञा त्वयि तन्न विपत्स्यते |
ततोऽहमभिधास्यामि न ह्येष त्वयि वक्ष्यति || २-१८-२६_END
BEGIN_
"If what is spoken by the king does not create unfavourableness in you, I shall then
tell you. This king will not indeed tell you."_END

B_2_C_19_18
BEGIN_
तत् अप्रियम् अनार्याया वचनम् दारुण उदरम् |
श्रुत्वा गत व्यथो रामः कैकेयीम् वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् || २-१९-१९_END
BEGIN_
Rama after hearing that vulgar woman's words, which were harsh and having
consequence, was unruffled and spoke these words to Kaikeyi._END

B_2_C_22_0
BEGIN_अथ तम् व्यथया दीनम् सविशेषम् अमर्षितम् |
श्वसन्तम् इव नाग इन्द्रम् रोष विस्फारित ईक्षणम् || २-२२-१
आसद्य रामः सौमित्रिम् सुह्ऱ्दम् भ्रातरम् प्रियम् |
उवाच इदम् स धैर्येण धारयन् सत्त्वम् आत्मवान् || २-२२-२_END
BEGIN_Afterwards ,the self composed Rama by controlling his thoughts with courage ,approached 
the kind -hearted and affectionate brother Lakshmana who was distressed with agony who was very much 
angry like a hissing king cobra ,with his eyes dilated with wrath and spoke the following words._END

B_2_C_12_100
BEGIN_क्षुरोपमाम् नित्यमसत्प्रियम्वदाम् |
प्रदुष्टभावाम् स्वकुलोपघातिनीम् |
न जीवितुम् त्वाम् विषहेऽमनोरमाम् |
दिधक्षमाणाम् हृदयम् सबन्धनम् || २-१२-११२_END
BEGIN_"I do not wish the survival of you, who are destructive like a razor, always speaking 
falsely pleasing words, are of evil natured, disastrous to the family, intent upon burning my heart 
along with vitals and repellent to my mind."_END

B_2_C_20_13
BEGIN_
कौसल्या अपि तदा देवी रात्रिम् स्थित्वा समाहिता |
प्रभाते तु अकरोत् पूजाम् विष्णोह् पुत्र हित एषिणी || २-२०-१४_END
BEGIN_
At that time, Kausalya having spent the whole night with steadfastness, who
performing worship to Vishnu,at dawn, for the welfare of her son._END

B_2_C_21_6
BEGIN_तत् इदम् वचनम् राज्ञः पुनर् बाल्यम् उपेयुषः |
पुत्रः को हृदये कुर्यात् राज व्ऱ्त्तम् अनुस्मरन् || २-२१-७_END
BEGIN_"Which son, knowing royal usage, can agree to the words of this king who is behaving 
as though he got childhood again?"_END

B_2_C_18_25
BEGIN_
एतात्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा कैकेय्या समुदाहृतम् |
उवाच व्यथितो रामस्ताम् देवीम् नृपसन्निधौ || २-१८-२७_END
BEGIN_
After hearing the words of Kaikeyi, Rama felt painful and spoke thus to her in the
presence of the king._END

B_2_C_19_19
BEGIN_
न अहम् अर्थ परः देवि लोकम् आवस्तुम् उत्सहे |
विद्धि माम् ऱ्षिभिस् तुल्यम् केवलम् धर्मम् आस्थितम् || २-१९-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh queen! I am not concerned with wealth. I want to receive the world hospitable.
Know me as equal to a sage, abiding in righteousness alone."_END

B_2_C_22_1
BEGIN_निगृह्य रोषं शोकं च खैर्यमाश्रित्य केवलम् |
अवमानम् निरस्येमम् गृहीत्वा हर्षमुत्तमम् || २-२२-३
उपक्लुप्तम् हि यत्किंचिदभिषेकार्थमद्य मे |
स्र्वम् विसर्जय क्षिप्रम् कुरु कार्यम् निरत्ययम् || २-२२-४_END
BEGIN_" Hold back grief and anger. Forget this insult, by taking refuge in courage alone. Obtain 
great joy! Abandon all these arrangements made today for my coronation and immediately take up action 
that is faultless ."_END

B_2_C_12_101
BEGIN_न जीवितम् मेऽस्ति पुनः कुतः सुखम् |
विनात्मजेनात्मवतः कुतो रतिः |
ममाहितम् देवि न क् कर्तुमर्हसि |
स्पृशामि पादावपि ते प्रसीद मे || २-१२-११३_END
BEGIN_"There is no life to me without my son. How can there be happiness moreover? From whom 
else can there be joy, while I survive? Oh, queen! You ought not to do an unfriendly act to me. I even 
touch your feet. Be gracious to me."_END

B_2_C_21_7
BEGIN_यावद् एव न जानाति कश्चित् अर्थम् इमम् नरः |
तावद् एव मया साधम् आत्मस्थम् कुरु शासनम् ||२-२१-८_END
BEGIN_"Even before others get to know about this matter, make this dominion your own, with 
my help."_END

B_2_C_20_14
BEGIN_
सा क्षौम वसना ह्ऱ्ष्टा नित्यम् व्रत परायणा |
अग्निम् जुहोति स्म तदा मन्त्रवत् क्ऱ्त मन्गला || २-२०-१५_END
BEGIN_
Kausalya, who was interested to practise religious vows regularly was appearing
auspiciously by wearing a white silk sari and gladly performing sacrificial ceremony in a sacred
fire, by reciting vedic hymns._END

B_2_C_18_26
BEGIN_
अहो धिङ्नार्हसे देवि पक्तुं मामीदृशं वचः |
अहम् हि वचनात् राज्ञः पतेयम् अपि पावके || २-१८-२८
भक्षयेयम् विषम् तीक्ष्णम् मज्जेयम् अपि च अर्णवे |
नियुक्तः गुरुणा पित्रा न्ऱ्पेण च हितेन च || २-१८-२९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, queen! what a pity! Do not talk like that to me. If father tells me, I shall
jump even in fire. If father, who is a king, who wishes my welfare and who is venerable, commands
me, I shall eat fiery poison and shall sink into an ocean."_END

B_2_C_19_20
BEGIN_
यद् अत्रभवतः किंचित् शक्यम् कर्तुम् प्रियम् मया |
प्राणान् अपि परित्यज्य सर्वथा क्ऱ्तम् एव तत् || २-१९-२१_END
BEGIN_
"If I have to do whatever action is dearer to my revered father, that action is just
done in all respects even by renouncing life."_END

B_2_C_22_2
BEGIN_सौमित्रे यो अभिषेक अर्थे मम सम्भार सम्भ्रमः |
अभिषेक निवृत्ति अर्थे सो अस्तु सम्भार सम्भ्रमः || २-२२-५_END
BEGIN_"Oh, Lakshmana! Show the same zeal now in terminating my coronation as the zeal shown 
earlier in preparations for my coronation."_END

B_2_C_12_102
BEGIN_स भूमिपलो विलपन्ननाथवत् |
स्त्रीया गृहीतो हृदयेऽतिमात्रया |
पपात देव्याश्चरणौ प्रसारिता |
पुभावसम्प्राप्य यथातुरस्तथा || २-१२-११४_END
BEGIN_That king, who has been gripped in the heart his by his wife, who transgressed all bounds 
of decorum, he wailing like a forlorn child and not reaching Kaikeyi's both the feet which were spread 
along, sank down like an ailing man._END

B_2_C_21_8
BEGIN_मया पार्श्वे सधनुषा तव गुप्तस्य राघव |
कः समर्थो अधिकम् कर्तुम् कृत अन्तस्य इव तिष्ठतः || २-२१-९_END
BEGIN_"Oh, Rama! While I am standing by your side along with a bow, protecting you who are 
standing as God of Death, who is capable of doing too much ?"_END

B_2_C_20_15
BEGIN_
प्रविश्य च तदा रामः मातुर् अन्तः पुरम् शुभम् |
ददर्श मातरम् तत्र हावयन्तीम् हुत अशनम् || २-२०-१६_END
BEGIN_
Then Rama entered the auspicious mother's apartment and saw his mother performing
sacrificial ceremony in sacred fire there._END

B_2_C_18_27
BEGIN_
तत् ब्रूहि वचनम् देवि राज्ञो यद् अभिकान्क्षितम् |
करिष्ये प्रतिजाने च रामः द्विर् न अभिभाषते || २-१८-३०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh queen! Tell me the words of the king as desired by him. I even promise to do it.
Rama does not speak two things."_END

B_2_C_22_3
BEGIN_यस्या मद् अभिषेक अर्थम् मानसम् परितप्यते |
माता नः सा यथा न स्यात् सविशन्का तथा कुरु || २-२२-६_END
BEGIN_"My mother Kaikeyi is still agonized about my coronation. Behave in such a way that no 
apprehension comes to her mind on this matter."_END

B_2_C_19_21
BEGIN_
न हि अतः धर्म चरणम् किंचित् अस्ति महत्तरम् |
यथा पितरि शुश्रूषा तस्य वा वचन क्रिया || २-१९-२२_END
BEGIN_
"There is not indeed anything of greater performance of duty than doing service to
father or than doing what he commands."_END

B_2_C_20_16
BEGIN_
देवकार्यनिमित्तम् च तत्रापश्यत् समुद्यतम्|
दध्यक्षतम् घृतम् चैव मोदकान् हविषस्तदा || २-२०-१७
लाजान् माल्यानि शुक्लानि पायसम् कृसरम् तथा |
समिधः पूर्णकुम्भांश्छ ददर्श रघुनंदनः || २-२०-१८_END
BEGIN_
There, Rama saw the articles of worship kept ready for the purpose of the sacred
ceremony like curd, unbroken rice, clarified butter, sweet meats, things fit for oblation, fried
grain, garlands made of white flowers, rice boiled in milk, mixture of rice and peas with a few
spices, sacrificial sticks, vessels full of water etc._END

B_2_C_21_9
BEGIN_निर्मनुष्याम् इमाम् सर्वाम् अयोध्याम् मनुज ऋषभ |
करिष्यामि शरैअः तीक्ष्णैः यदि स्थास्यति विप्रिये || २-२१-१०_END
BEGIN_"Oh, Rama, the best of men! If the city of Ayodhya turns against you, I shall make it 
desolate of men with sharp arrows"_END

B_2_C_18_28
BEGIN_
तम् आर्जव समायुक्तम् अनार्या सत्य वादिनम् |
उवाच रामम् कैकेयी वचनम् भ्ऱ्श दारुणम् || २-१८-३१_END
BEGIN_
That vulgar Kaikeyi uttered very cruel words to that Rama, who was committed to
sincerity and speaking of truth._END

B_2_C_22_4
BEGIN_तस्याः शन्कामयम् दुह्खम् मुहूर्तम् अपि न उत्सहे |
मनसि प्रतिसम्जातम् सौमित्रे अहम् उपेक्षितुम् || २-२२-७_END
BEGIN_"Oh, Lakshmana! I do not wish to disregard the painful doubt in her mind even for a moment"._END

B_2_C_19_22
BEGIN_
अनुक्तः अपि अत्रभवता भवत्या वचनात् अहम् |
वने वत्स्यामि विजने वर्षाणि इह चतुर् दश || २-१९-२३_END
BEGIN_
"Even if our reverent father does not tell me, I shall reside in the forest, devoid
of people, now for fourteen years as per your word."_END

B_2_C_20_17
BEGIN_
ताम् शुक्लक्षौमसम्वीताम् व्रतयोगेन कर्शिताम् |
तर्पयन्तीम् ददर्शाद्भिः देवताम् देववर्णिनीम् || २-२०-१९_END
BEGIN_
Kausalya, who became lean because of observance of vows, was shining like an angel
with her white silk sari and was satiating gods by presenting to them libations by water._END

B_2_C_21_10
BEGIN_भरतस्य अथ पक्ष्यो वा यो वा अस्य हितम् इच्चति |
सर्वान् एतान् वधिष्यामि मृदुर् हि परिभूयते || २-२१-११_END
BEGIN_"I shall kill all those who are siding Bharata ,and are favourable to him. Soft person 
indeed gets disgraced!"_END

B_2_C_18_29
BEGIN_
पुरा देव असुरे युद्धे पित्रा ते मम राघव |
रक्षितेन वरौ दत्तौ सशल्येन महा रणे || २-१८-३२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! During a battle and a great war between celestials and demons long ago, I
protected your father who was pierced by darts. Then, he gave me two boons."_END

B_2_C_22_5
BEGIN_न बुद्धि पूर्वम् न अबुद्धम् स्मरामि इह कदाचन |
मातृणाम् वा पितुर् वाहम् कृतम् अल्पम् च विप्रियम् || २-२२-८_END
BEGIN_"I do not remember to have done even a small disagreeable thing here at any time to my 
mothers or to my father, either intentionally or unintentionally."_END

B_2_C_19_23
BEGIN_
न नूनम् मयि कैकेयि किंचित् आशंससे गुणम् |
यद् राजानम् अवोचः त्वम् मम ईश्वरतरा सती || २-१९-२४_END
BEGIN_
" In the matter of coronation of Bharata, you told Dasaratha and not to me, even
though you had every authority to tell, me directly. By this, it is known that you have not seen
any merit in me. It is certain!"_END

B_2_C_20_18
BEGIN_
सा चिरस्य आत्मजम् द्ऱ्ष्ट्वा मात्ऱ् नन्दनम् आगतम् |
अभिचक्राम सम्ह्ऱ्ष्टा किशोरम् वडवा यथा || २-२०-२०_END
BEGIN_
By seeing her son who came after a long time and who gave delight to mother,
Kausalya was pleased and approached towards him, like a female horse approaching her young
colt._END

B_2_C_21_11
BEGIN_प्रोत्साहितोऽयम् कैकेय्या स दुष्टो यदिः पिता |
अमित्रभूतो निस्सङ्गम् वध्यताम् बध्यतामपि || २-२१-१२_END
BEGIN_"If our father with an evil mind behaves like our enemy with instigation by Kaikeyi. 
I shall keep him imprisoned with out personal attachment or if necessary, kill him."_END

B_2_C_18_30
BEGIN_
तत्र मे याचितः राजा भरतस्य अभिषेचनम् |
गमनम् दण्डक अरण्ये तव च अद्य एव राघव || २-१८-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! According to those boons, I asked the king for coronation of Bharata and
for your going to Dandaka forest today itself."_END

B_2_C_22_6
BEGIN_सत्यः सत्य अभिसंधः च नित्यम् सत्य पराक्रमः |
पर लोक भयात् भीतः निर्भयो अस्तु पिता मम || २-२२-९_END
BEGIN_"Let the promise made by my father ,who is truthful, who is truly mighty and who is afraid 
of the fear of the other world, become true .Let him be fearless."_END

B_2_C_19_24
BEGIN_
यावन् मातरम् आप्ऱ्च्चे सीताम् च अनुनयाम्य् अहम् |
ततः अद्य एव गमिष्यामि दण्डकानाम् महद् वनम् || २-१९-२५_END
BEGIN_
" Today itself, I shall go to the forest of Dandaka after bidding, farewell to my
mother and also after consoling Sita."_END

B_2_C_20_19
BEGIN_
स मातरमभिक्रान्तामुपसम्गृह्य राघवः |
परिष्वक्तश्च बाहुभ्यामुपाग्रातश्च मूर्धनि || २-२०-२१_END
BEGIN_
Rama offered salutation to the approaching mother by touching her feet. Then, she
took him into her arms and smelt his head._END

B_2_C_21_12
BEGIN_गुरोरप्यवलिप्तस्य कार्याकार्यमजानतः |
उत्फथम् प्रतिपन्नस्य कार्यम् भवति शासन्म् || २-२१-१३_END
BEGIN_"Even a venerable person is to be punished, if he becomes arrogant, if he does not know 
good and evil actions and if he takes to a wrong route."_END

B_2_C_18_31
BEGIN_
यदि सत्य प्रतिज्ञम् त्वम् पितरम् कर्तुम् इच्चसि |
आत्मानम् च नर रेष्ठ मम वाक्यम् इदम् श्ऱ्णु || २-१८-३४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! If you want to make yourself and your father faithful to a promise,
listen to these words of mine._END

B_2_C_23_0
BEGIN_
इति ब्रुवति रामे तु लक्ष्मणो अधः शिरा मुहुः |
