श्रुत्वा मध्यम् जगाम इव मनसा दुह्ख हर्षयोह् || २-२३-१_END
BEGIN_
While Rama was thus speeding, Lakshmana heard, bowed down his head and got into the
midst of pain and pleasure effecting his mind again and again._END

B_2_C_22_7
BEGIN_तस्य अपि हि भवेद् अस्मिन् कर्मणि अप्रतिसम्ह्ऱ्ते |
सत्यम् न इति मनः तापः तस्य तापः तपेच् च माम् || २-२२-१०_END
BEGIN_"Our father will feel anguished that his word has not come true ,if this coronation is 
not withdrawn. His distress will cause pain to me."_END

B_2_C_19_25
BEGIN_
भरतः पालयेद् राज्यम् शुश्रूषेच् च पितुर् यथा |
तहा भवत्या कर्तव्यम् स हि धर्मः सनातनः || २-१९-२६_END
BEGIN_
"While ruling the kingdom, see that Bharata serves our father well. It is indeed an
age-old practice."_END

B_2_C_20_20
BEGIN_
तम् उवाच दुराधर्षम् राघवम् सुतम् आत्मनः |
कौसल्या पुत्र वात्सल्यात् इदम् प्रिय हितम् वचः || २-२०-२२_END
BEGIN_
Kausalya spoke these pleasing words affectionately to her son Rama, who was
unassailable by enemies._END

B_2_C_21_13
BEGIN_बलमेष किमाश्रित्य हेतुम् वा पुरुषर्षभ |
दातुमिच्छति कैकेय्य राज्यम् स्थितमिदम् तव || २-२१-१४_END
BEGIN_"Oh, Rama, the best of men! On what strength or season has he taken shelter to give away 
this kingdom belonging to you to Kaikeyi?"_END

B_2_C_18_32
BEGIN_
स निदेशे पितुस् तिष्ठ यथा तेन प्रतिश्रुतम् |
त्वया अरण्यम् प्रवेष्टव्यम् नव वर्षाणि पन्च च || २-१८-३५_END
BEGIN_
"Abide by your father's command. As per his assurance, you have to stay in the
forest for fourteen years."_END

B_2_C_23_1
BEGIN_
तदा तु बद्ध्वा भ्रुकुटीम् भ्रुवोर् मध्ये नर ऋषभ |
निशश्वास महा सर्पो बिलस्यैव रोषितः || २-२३-२_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana then firmed up his eyebrows and sighed with frown, like an angry snake
from its hole._END

B_2_C_22_8
BEGIN_अभिषेक विधानम् तु तस्मात् सम्हृत्य लक्ष्मण |
अन्वग् एव अहम् इच्चामि वनम् गन्तुम् इतः पुनः || २-२२-११_END
BEGIN_"Oh, Lakshmana for that reason, I wish to go to forest immediately from her, by withdrawing, 
coronation arrangement."_END

B_2_C_19_26
BEGIN_
स रामस्य वचः श्रुत्वा भ्ऱ्शम् दुह्ख हतः पिता |
शोकात् अशक्नुवन् बाष्पम् प्ररुरोद महा स्वनम् || २-१९-२७_END
BEGIN_
Dasaratha after hearing Rama's words was hurt very much with grief was unable to
talk and wept loudly._END

B_2_C_20_21
BEGIN_
व्ऱ्द्धानाम् धर्म शीलानाम् राजर्षीणाम् महात्मनाम् |
प्राप्नुहि आयुः च कीर्तिम् च धर्मम् च उपहितम् कुले || २-२०-२३_END
BEGIN_
"Obtain long life and glory, as obtained by the aged , the virtuous, the great
souled and the royal sages .Protect the righteousness engrained in your race"_END

B_2_C_21_14
BEGIN_त्वया चैव मया चैव कृत्वा वैरम् अनुत्तमम् |
कस्य शक्तिः श्रियम् दातुम् भरताय अरि शासन || २-२१-१५_END
BEGIN_"Oh, Rama the chestiser of enemies! Where is the ability for him to give kingdom to Bharata, 
by making great enmity against you and me "_END

B_2_C_18_33
BEGIN_
भरतस्त्वभिषिच्येत यदेतदभिषेचन्म् |
त्वदर्थे विहितम् राज्ञा तेन सर्वेण राघव || २-१८-३६_END
BEGIN_
"Bharata is to be enthroned with the use of complete collection of materials already
arranged by the king for your sake."_END

B_2_C_23_2
BEGIN_
तस्य दुष्प्रतिवीक्ष्यम् तत् भ्रुकुटी सहितम् तदा |
बभौ क्रुद्धस्य सिम्हस्य मुखस्य सदृशम् मुखम् || २-२३-३_END
BEGIN_
His wickedly looking face with eyebrows contracted, then appeared like the face of
an angry lion._END

B_2_C_22_9
BEGIN_मम प्रव्राजनात् अद्य कृत कृत्या नृपात्मजा |
सुतम् भरतम् अव्यग्रम् अभिषेचयिता ततः || २-२२-१२_END
BEGIN_"Soon after my departure to the forest now, Kaikeyi having accomplished her purpose, 
will coolly get her son coronated."_END

B_2_C_19_27
BEGIN_
वन्दित्वा चरणौ रामः विसम्ज्ञस्य पितुस् तदा |
कैकेय्याः च अपि अनार्याया निष्पपात महा द्युतिः || २-१९-२८_END
BEGIN_
That Rama, with great brilliance, came out, after duly offering obeisance to the
feet of his father who was fainted and also to the feet of that vulgar Kaikeyi._END

B_2_C_21_15
BEGIN_अनुरक्तः अस्मि भावेन भ्रातरम् देवि तत्त्वतः |
सत्येन धनुषा चैव दत्तेन इष्टेन ते शपे || २-२१-१६_END
BEGIN_"Oh, queen! Really, I am devotedly attached to my brother Rama. I am swearing an oath 
to you by truth by bow, by the act of giving and by the act of sacrifice."_END

B_2_C_20_22
BEGIN_
सत्य प्रतिज्ञम् पितरम् राजानम् पश्य राघव |
अद्य एव हि त्वाम् धर्म आत्मा यौवराज्ये अभिषेक्ष्यति || २-२०-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh,Rama ! King Dasaratha ,your father is a man of true promise. Today itself, you
will be installed as successor to the kingdom by your virtuous father."_END

B_2_C_18_34
BEGIN_
सप्त सप्त च वर्षाणि दण्डक अरण्यम् आश्रितः |
अभिषेकम् इमम् त्यक्त्वा जटा चीर धरः वस || २-१८-३७_END
BEGIN_
"You have to leave this coronation function and dwell in the forest of Dandaka for
fourteen years, wearing braided hair and covered with a hide."_END

B_2_C_23_3
BEGIN_
अग्रहः तम् विधुन्वंस् तु हस्ती हस्तम् इवात्मनः |
तिर्यग् ऊर्ध्वम् शरीरे च पातयित्वा शिरः धराम् || २-२३-४
अग्र अक्ष्णा वीक्षमाणः तु तिर्यग् भ्रातरम् अब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Rama with the tip of his eyes obliquely, Lakshmana spoke to him moving his
forehand like an elephant moving its trunk and causing his head to fall in oblique and upward
direction._END

B_2_C_22_10
BEGIN_मयि चीर अजिन धरे जटा मण्डल धारिणि |
गते अरण्यम् च कैकेय्या भविष्यति मनः सुखम् || २-२२-१३_END
BEGIN_"If go to forest , wearing deer -skin rags and with my hair twisted together Kaikeyi 
will have mental peace."_END

B_2_C_19_28
BEGIN_
स रामः पितरम् क्ऱ्त्वा कैकेयीम् च प्रदक्षिणम् |
निष्क्रम्य अन्तः पुरात् तस्मात् स्वम् ददर्श सुह्ऱ्ज् जनम् || २-१९-२९_END
BEGIN_
Rama made circumambulatory salutation to his father as well as Kaikeyi, left that
palace and saw his friends._END

B_2_C_20_23
BEGIN_
दत्तमासनमालभ्य भोजनेन निमन्त्रितः |
मातरम् राघवः किंचित् प्रसार्य अन्जलिम् अब्रवीत् || २-२०-२५_END
BEGIN_
Kausalya asked Rama to take food , but Rama just touched the seat offered by her and
after performing salutation to her, spoke thus to his mother._END

B_2_C_21_16
BEGIN_दीप्तम् अग्निम् अरण्यम् वा यदि रामः प्रवेक्ष्यते |
प्रविष्टम् तत्र माम् देवि त्वम् पूर्वम् अवधारय || २-२१-१७_END
BEGIN_"Oh, queen! If Rama can enter blazing fire or forest, you make certain that even before, 
I can enter there"_END

B_2_C_18_35
BEGIN_
भरतः कोसल पुरे प्रशास्तु वसुधाम् इमाम् |
नाना रत्न समाकीर्णम् सवाजि रथ कुन्जराम् || २-१८-३८_END
BEGIN_
"Let Bharata rule this earth, by residing in Ayodhya filled with various types of
precious thing together with horses, chariots and elephants."_END

B_2_C_22_11
BEGIN_बुद्धिः प्रणीता येन इयम् मनः च सुसमाहितम् |
तत् तु न अर्हामि सम्क्लेष्टुम् प्रव्रजिष्यामि माचिरम् || २-२२-१४_END
BEGIN_"I do not want to create trouble to my father, who has taken this hard decision in his 
mind . Hence, I will go to the forest at once_END

B_2_C_23_4
BEGIN_
अस्थाने सम्भ्रमः यस्य जातः वै सुमहान् अयम् || २-२३-५
धर्म दोष प्रसन्गेन लोकस्य अनतिशन्कया |
कथम् हि एतत् असम्भ्रान्तः त्वद् विधो वक्तुम् अर्हति || २-२३-६
यथा दैवम् अशौण्डीरम् शौण्डीरः क्षत्रिय ऋषभः |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, the best of proud military community! This untimely great confusion is born in
you due to your conjecture of quilty righteousness and of non suspicion of the world. Can such a
person like you speak a person like you speak thus doubtlessly of the powerless destiny?"_END

B_2_C_19_29
BEGIN_
तम् बाष्प परिपूर्ण अक्षः प्ऱ्ष्ठतः अनुजगाम ह |
लक्ष्मणः परम क्रुद्धः सुमित्र आनन्द वर्धनः || २-१९-३०_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana, the son of Sumitra, felt very angry with his eyes filled with tears and
accompanied behind Rama._END

B_2_C_20_24
BEGIN_
स स्वभाव विनीतः च गौरवाच् च तदा आनतः |
प्रस्थितो दण्डकारण्यमाप्रष्टुमुपचक्रमे || २-२०-२६_END
BEGIN_
That Rama , being humble in nature , became still modest due to respect for his
mother and was set about to ask her permission before setting forth his journey to Dandaka
forest._END

B_2_C_21_17
BEGIN_हरामि वीर्यात् दुह्खम् ते तमः सूर्यैव उदितः |
देवी पश्यतु मे वीर्यम् राघवः चैव पश्यतु || २-२१-१८_END
BEGIN_"I shall alleviate your grief, by showing my valour like the rising sun alleviating darkness 
.Let Rama and yourself see my valour"_END

B_2_C_18_36
BEGIN_
एतेन त्वां नरेन्द्रोयम् कारुण्येन समाप्लुतः |
शोकसंक्लिष्टवदनो न शक्नोति निरीक्षितुम् || २-१८-३९_END
BEGIN_
"For this reason, king Dasaratha who is overwhelmed with sympathy towards you is not
able to see you with his face, afflicted with grief."_END

B_2_C_22_12
BEGIN_कृत अन्तः तु एव सौमित्रे द्रष्टव्यो मत् प्रवासने |
राज्यस्य च वितीर्णस्य पुनर् एव निवर्तने || २-२२-१५_END
BEGIN_"Oh, Lakshmana! Look at it as destiny which has taken back kingdom given to me and which 
is sending me to exile"_END

B_2_C_23_5
BEGIN_
किम् नाम कृपणम् दैवम् अशक्तम् अभिशंसति |
पापयोस् तु कथम् नाम तयोह् शन्का न विद्यते || २-२३-७_END
BEGIN_
"Why are you speaking about this weak and pitiable destiny? Why are you not doubting
the sinful Kaikeyi and Dasaratha?"_END

B_2_C_19_30
BEGIN_
आभिषेचनिकम् भाण्डम् क्ऱ्त्वा रामः प्रदक्षिणम् |
शनैः जगाम सापेक्षो द्ऱ्ष्टिम् तत्र अविचालयन् || २-१९-३१_END
BEGIN_
Rama did a circumbulatory salutation around the auspicious materials collected for
the propound coronation and having fixed his attention respectfully on them, moved away slowly._END

B_2_C_20_25
BEGIN_
देवि नूनम् न जानीषे महद् भयम् उपस्थितम् |
इदम् तव च दुह्खाय वैदेह्या लक्ष्मणस्य च || २-२०-२७_END
BEGIN_
"Oh,mother! You do not know that a great dismay is approaching now. It brings grief
to you, to Sita and to Lakshmana"_END

B_2_C_21_18
BEGIN_एतत् तु वचनम् श्रुत्वा लक्ष्मणस्य महात्मनः |
उवाच रामम् कौसल्या रुदन्ती शोक लालसा || २-२१-१९_END
BEGIN_Hearing these words of Lakshmana the magnanimous, Kausalya entirely given up to anguish 
and weaping, spoke thus to Rama._END

B_2_C_18_37
BEGIN_
एतत्कुरु नरेन्ध्रस्य वचनं रघुनन्दन |
सत्यन महता राम तारयस्व नरेश्वरम् || २-१८-४०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! Do as per the words of the king and liberate him by giving your father an
opportunity to maintain the truth."_END

B_2_C_24_0
BEGIN_
तम् समीक्ष्य तु अवहितम् पितुर् निर्देश पालने |
कौसल्या बाष्प सम्रुद्धा वचो धर्मिष्ठम् अब्रवीत् || २-२४-१_END
BEGIN_
Seeing him firm minded in protecting the command of his father, Kausalya in a choked
voice spoke these righteous words:_END

B_2_C_23_6
BEGIN_
सन्ति धर्म उपधाः श्लक्ष्णा धर्मात्मन् किम् न बुध्यसे || २-२३-८
तयोस्सुचरितम् स्वार्थम् शाठ्यात् परिजिहीर्षतोः |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, the righteous sould! Both of them are smoothly deceiving in the name of
righteousness with an intent to keep away your good conduct, with selfish away your good conduct,
with selfish motive and by dishonest means. You are not knowing."_END

B_2_C_22_13
BEGIN_कैकेय्याः प्रतिपत्तिर् हि कथम् स्यान् मम पीडने |
यदि भावो न दैवो अयम् कृत अन्त विहितः भवेत् || २-२२-१६_END
BEGIN_-"If not making of destiny to create such a thought in Kaikeyi, how come she resolved 
to harass?"_END

B_2_C_19_31
BEGIN_
न च अस्य महतीम् लक्ष्मीम् राज्य नाशो अपकर्षति |
लोक कान्तस्य कान्तत्वम् शीत रश्मेर् इव क्षपा || २-१९-३२_END
BEGIN_
As Rama was a pleasing personality, he was loved by all the people. The loss of
kingdom could not diminish such a great splendour of Rama as a night cannot diminish the splendour
of the moon._END

B_2_C_20_26
BEGIN_
गमिष्ये दण्डकारण्यम् किमनेनासनेन मे |
विष्टरासनयोग्यो हि कालोऽयम् मामुपस्थितः || २-२०-२८_END
BEGIN_
"I am going to Dandaka forest. Why this seat for me? Time has come for me to sit on
a seat made of Kusha grass."_END

B_2_C_21_19
BEGIN_भ्रातुस् ते वदतः पुत्र लक्ष्मणस्य श्रुतम् त्वया |
यद् अत्र अनन्तरम् तत् त्वम् कुरुष्व यदि रोचते || २-२१-२०_END
BEGIN_"Oh, son !You have heard the words of Lakshmana .If you agree, you do what is to be done, 
immediately."_END

B_2_C_18_38
BEGIN_
इतीव तस्यां परुषम् वदन्त्याम् |
नचैव रामः प्रविवेश शोकम् |
प्रविव्यधे चापि महानुभावो |
राजा तु पुत्रव्यसनाभितप्तः || २-१८-४१_END
BEGIN_
Though she was speaking such harsh words, Rama was not affected with sorrow. But the
mighty Dasaratha became highly disturbed, having been afflicted by the calamity occurred to his
son._END

B_2_C_24_1
BEGIN_
अदृष्ट दुह्खो धर्मात्मा सर्व भूत प्रियम् वदः |
मयि जातः दशरथात् कथम् उन्चेन वर्तयेत् || २-२४-२_END
BEGIN_
�Rama who is born in me and Dasaratha, is a righteous person. He speaks lovingly to
all beings. He has not faced grief at any time. How can such a person live in a forest, by
gathering grains ?'_END

B_2_C_23_7
BEGIN_
यदि नैवम् व्यवसितम् स्याद्धि प्राग्रेव राघव |
तयोः प्रागेव दत्तश्च स्याद्वरः प्रकृतश्च सः || २-२३-९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! If it was not indeed an earlier decision taken long ago by both of them,
the boon must have been given naturally even long ago."_END

B_2_C_22_14
BEGIN_जानासि हि यथा सौम्य न मातृषु मम अन्तरम् |
भूत पूर्वम् विशेषो वा तस्या मयि सुते अपि वा || २-२२-१७_END
BEGIN_"You know that I had no discrimination among mothers and Kaikeyi also in the past had 
no discrimination between me and her son Bharata"_END

B_2_C_19_32
BEGIN_
न वनम् गन्तु कामस्य त्यजतः च वसुंधराम् |
सर्व लोक अतिगस्य इव लक्ष्यते चित्त विक्रिया || २-१९-३३_END
BEGIN_
In that Rama, who was leaving the kingdom after having decided to go to the forest,
there was no perturbation of mind in him like in an ascetic who is beyond worldly pain and
pleasure._END

B_2_C_20_27
BEGIN_
चतुर्दश हि वर्षाणि वत्स्यामि विजने वने |
मधु मूल फलैः जीवन् हित्वा मुनिवद् आमिषम् || २-२०-२९_END
BEGIN_
"I shall live in a solitary forest like a sage for fourteen years, leaving off meat
and living with roots, fruits and honey"._END

B_2_C_21_20
BEGIN_न च अधर्म्यम् वचः श्रुत्वा सपत्न्या मम भाषितम् |
विहाय शोक सम्तप्ताम् गन्तुम् अर्हसि माम् इतः || २-२१-२१_END
BEGIN_"It is not proper for you to go away from here, leaving me afflicted with grief, after 
hearing the un-just words spoken by my co-wife."_END

B_2_C_24_2
BEGIN_
यस्य भृत्याः च दासाः च मृष्टानि अन्नानि भुन्जते |
कथम् स भोक्ष्यते नाथो वने मूल फलानि अयम् || २-२४-३_END
BEGIN_
"While the dependants and the servants of Lord Rama eat pleasant foods all the
while, how can he eat roots and fruits himself in the forest ?"_END

B_2_C_23_8
BEGIN_
लोक विद्विष्टम् आरब्धम् त्वद् अन्यस्य अभिषेचनम् |
नोत्सहे सहितुम् वीर तत्र मे क्षन्तुमर्हसि || २-२३-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Enthroning other than yourself is not to the liking of the people. I cannot
tolerate this act that is started. Excuse me in this matter."_END

B_2_C_22_15
BEGIN_सो अभिषेक निवृत्ति अर्थैः प्रवास अर्थैः च दुर्वचैः |
उग्रैः वाक्यैः अहम् तस्या न अन्यद् दैवात् समर्थये || २-२२-१८_END
BEGIN_"I do not perceive any other reason than an accident that made Kaikeyi to abolish my 
coronation , to send me to exile ,and to speak ferocious words ,not to be talked about."_END

B_2_C_19_33
BEGIN_
प्रतिषिद्ध्य शुभम् छत्रं व्यजने च स्वलंकृते |
विसर्जयित्वा स्वजनं रथम् पौरास्तथा जन्नान् || २-१९-३४
धारयन् मनसा दुह्खम् इन्द्रियाणि निग्ऱ्ह्य च |
प्रविवेश आत्मवान् वेश्म मातुर प्रिय शंसिवान् || २-१९-३५_END
BEGIN_
Rama, the man of great courage, refused fans and umbrella, sent away his friends,
chariot and citizens kept back sorrow in his mind, subdued his senses and entered his mother's
house to inform the unpleasant news._END

B_2_C_20_28
BEGIN_
भरताय महा राजो यौवराज्यम् प्रयच्चति |
माम् पुनर् दण्डक अरण्यम् विवासयति तापसम् || २-२०-३०_END
BEGIN_
"The great king is giving to Bharata the succession to kingdom and to me, however,
he is making me a sage to stay in the forest of Dandaka."_END

B_2_C_21_21
BEGIN_धर्मज्ञ यदि धर्मिष्ठो धर्मम् चरितुम् इच्चसि |
शुश्रूष माम् इहस्थः त्वम् चर धर्मम् अनुत्तमम् || २-२१-२२_END
BEGIN_"Oh, Rama! You are righteous man. If you desire to practice virtue, be a virtuous man 
and stay here serving me thereby practicing the best morality in the form of serving your mother._END

B_2_C_24_3
BEGIN_
क एतत् श्रद्दधेत् श्रुत्वा कस्य वा न भवेद् भयम् |
गुणवान् दयितः राज्ञो राघवो यद् विवास्यते || २-२४-४_END
BEGIN_
"Hearing that Rama the beloved and virtuous is being thus sent to exile by the king
, who will believe these words? Who will not develop fear ?"_END

B_2_C_23_9
BEGIN_
येन इयम् आगता द्वैधम् तव बुद्धिर् मही पते |
स हि धर्मः मम द्वेष्यः प्रसन्गात् यस्य मुह्यसि || २-२३-११_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama the great minded! This righteousness by which your intellect got disunited
and by which indulgence, you are stupefied, is disliked by me."_END

B_2_C_22_16
BEGIN_कथम् प्रकृति सम्पन्ना राज पुत्री तथा अगुणा |
ब्रूयात् सा प्राकृता इव स्त्री मत् पीडाम् भर्तृ सम्निधौ || २-२२-१९_END
BEGIN_"If it is for not an accidental reason, how Kaikeyi who is of a perfect temperament and 
who is born in a royal family can tell like a common woman to her husband to create trouble for me ?"_END

B_2_C_20_29
BEGIN_
स ष्ट्चाअष्टौ च वर्षाणि वत्स्यामि विजने वने |
आसेवमानो वन्यानि फलमूलैश्च चर्तयन् || २-२०-३१_END
BEGIN_
"I have to satisfy with the things existing in the forest and subsist with roots and
fruits in a solitary forest for fourteen years."_END

B_2_C_19_34
BEGIN_
सर्वो ह्यभिजनः श्रीमान् श्रीमतः सत्यवादिनः |
नालक्षयत् रामस्य किंचिदाकारमानने || २-१९-३६_END
BEGIN_
The people adjacent to Rama could not visualise any change in the face of Rama who
was dignified and truthful in his words._END

B_2_C_21_22
BEGIN_शुश्रूषुर् जननीम् पुत्र स्व गृहे नियतः वसन् |
परेण तपसा युक्तः काश्यपः त्रिदिवम् गतः || २-२१-२३_END
BEGIN_"Oh, son! Formerly Kasyapa was staying in his own house itself with self restraint, performed 
great austerity by serving his mother and went to heaven"_END

B_2_C_24_4
BEGIN_
नूनम् तु बलवान् लोके कृतान्तः सर्वमादिशन् |
लोके रामाभिरामस्त्वम् वनम् यत्र गमिष्यसि || २-२४-५_END
BEGIN_
�Oh, Rama ! If you , the charming in the world are to go to exile , then it can be
certainly said that everything is ordered by a strong destiny'_END

B_2_C_23_10
BEGIN_
कथम् त्वम् कर्मणा शक्तः कैकेयीवशवर्तिनः |
करिष्यसि पितुर्वाक्यमधर्मिष्ठम् विगर्हितम् || २-२३-१२_END
BEGIN_
"you are capable of doing retaliatory action. How can you act on the word which is
reprehensible and which is unjustified of your father who is surrendering obediently to the will of
Kaikeyi?"_END

B_2_C_22_17
BEGIN_यद् अचिन्त्यम् तु तत् दैवम् भूतेष्व् अपि न हन्यते |
व्यक्तम् मयि च तस्याम् च पतितः हि विपर्ययः || २-२२-२०_END
BEGIN_"The influence of destiny is un imaginable. No living being can counteract its influence. 
An adverse fate has befallen on me and on her .It is clear now ."_END

B_2_C_19_35
BEGIN_
उचितम् च महाबाहुर्न जहौ हर्षमात्मनः |
शारदः समुदीर्णांशुश्चन्द्रस्तेज इवात्मजम् || २-१९-३७_END
BEGIN_
Rama did not lose his natural joy, as an autumnal moon with lofty rays does not lose
its natural splendour._END

B_2_C_20_30
BEGIN_
सा निकृत्तैव सालस्य यष्टिः परशुना वने |
पपात सहसा देवी देवतेव दिवश्च्युता || २-२०-३२_END
BEGIN_
The queen Kausalya fell on the floor all at once like the branch of a tree, cut down
by an axe and as an angel dropping down from heaven._END

B_2_C_21_23
BEGIN_यथा एव राजा पूज्यः ते गौरवेण तथा हि अहम् |
त्वाम् न अहम् अनुजानामि न गन्तव्यम् इतः वनम् || २-२१-२४_END
BEGIN_"Just as the king, by respectable feeling to you is worthy of worship, so also being 
your mother, I am worthy of worship to you. Hence, do not go to the forest"_END

B_2_C_24_5
BEGIN_
अयम् तु मामात्मभवस्तवादर्शनमारुतः |
विलापदुःखसमिधो रुदिताश्रुहुताहुतिः || २-२४-६
चिन्ताबाष्पमहाधूस्तवागमनचिन्तजः |
कर्शयित्वा भृशम् पुत्र निश्वासायाससम्भवः || २-२४-७
त्वया विहीनाम् इह माम् शोक अग्निर् अतुलो महान् |
प्रधक्ष्यति यथा कक्षम् चित्र भानुर् हिम अत्यये || २-२४-८_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Son! Soon after your departure to a distant forest, a great and incomparable
fire of sorrow will generate in my whole body. The wind which flares it up is your not being seen
here. My lamentation and grief are the fire-sticks. My wailing tears will be the offerings as an
oblation to fire. The choking and anxiety will be a great smoke .The thought that when you would
return, will generate smoke again. Such a fire of grief will make me emaciated completely and will
burn like dry wood by fire in winter.'_END

B_2_C_23_11
BEGIN_
यद्य् अपि प्रतिपत्तिस् ते दैवी च अपि तयोः मतम् |
तथा अपि उपेक्षणीयम् ते न मे तत् अपि रोचते || २-२३-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Though they are doing this treachery with a sinful intent, I regret that you are
not grasping it. Such a conduct is to be censured."_END

B_2_C_22_18
BEGIN_कश्चित् दैवेन सौमित्रे योद्धुम् उत्सहते पुमान् |
यस्य न ग्रहणम् किंचित् कर्मणो अन्यत्र दृश्यते || २-२२-२१_END
BEGIN_"Oh, Lakshmana! There is no means whatsoever to abstain from it otherwise than to follow 
the course of destiny. Who will be able to fight against the destiny. ?"_END

B_2_C_19_36
BEGIN_
वाचा मधुरया रामः स्र्वं सम्मानयन् जनम् |
मातुस्समीपं धीरात्मा प्रविवेश महायशाः || २-१७-३८_END
BEGIN_
Rama with his courageous spirit and of great fame, paying his respects to the people
with his sweet words, went nearer to his mother._END

B_2_C_20_31
BEGIN_
ताम् अदुह्ख उचिताम् द्ऱ्ष्ट्वा पतिताम् कदलीम् इव |
रामः तु उत्थापयाम् आस मातरम् गत चेतसम् || २-२०-३३_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Kausalya who was fit to be free from sorrow, Rama lifted up her, who had
fallen unconsciously on the floor like a plantain tree._END

B_2_C_21_24
BEGIN_त्वद् वियोगान् न मे कार्यम् जीवितेन सुखेन वा |
त्वया सह मम श्रेयः तृणानाम् अपि भक्षणम् || २-२१-२५_END
BEGIN_"After your separation, I shall have no use of this life or comforts for me, it is good 
even to eat grass while staying with you"_END

B_2_C_24_6
BEGIN_
कथम् हि धेनुः स्वम् वत्सम् गच्चन्तम् न अनुगच्चति |
अहम् त्वा अनुगमिष्यामि यत्र पुत्र गमिष्यसि || २-२४-९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Son! A cow follows its calf wherever it goes. So also, I shall come with you
wherever you go."'_END

B_2_C_23_12
BEGIN_
मन्साऽपि कथम् कामम् कुर्यास्त्वम् कामवृत्तयोः |
तयोस्त्वहितयोर्नित्यम् शत्र्वोः पित्रभिधानयोः || २-२३-१४_END
BEGIN_
"But of them, action on their own free will, were never desirous of your welfare.
They are enemies in the name of parents. It is not proper even to think of fulfilling their
desire."_END

B_2_C_22_19
BEGIN_सुख दुह्खे भय क्रोधौ लाभ अलाभौ भव अभवौ |
यस्य किंचित् तथा भूतम् ननु दैवस्य कर्म तत् || २-२२-२२_END
BEGIN_"Pleasure and pain, fear and anger, gain and loss, birth and death and such other things 
are all the acts of destiny"_END

B_2_C_19_37
BEGIN_
तं गुणैस्समतां प्राप्तो भ्राता विपुलविक्रमः |
सौमित्रिरनुवव्राज धारयन् दुःखमात्मजम् || २-१९-३९_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana, who got virtues equal to Rama, who was having great heroic valour and who
was the brother, kept the grief within himself and went along with Rama._END

B_2_C_20_32
BEGIN_
उपाव्ऱ्त्य उत्थिताम् दीनाम् वडवाम् इव वाहिताम् |
पांशु गुण्ठित सर्व अग्नीम् विममर्श च पाणिना || २-२०-३४_END
BEGIN_
Rama touched with his hand that miserable Kausalya,whose limbs were covered with
fragrant powder and who rose like a loaded horse from the floor on which it rolled from side to
side._END

B_2_C_21_25
BEGIN_यदि त्वम् यास्यसि वनम् त्यक्त्वा माम् शोक लालसाम् |
अहम् प्रायम् इह आसिष्ये न हि शक्ष्यामि जीवितुम् || २-२१-२६_END
BEGIN_"I shall not live if you leave for the forest, leaving me who is afflicted with grief. 
I shall seek death through starvation"_END

B_2_C_24_7
BEGIN_
तथा निगदितम् मात्रा तत् वाक्यम् पुरुष ऱ्षभः |
श्रुत्वा रामः अब्रवीद् वाक्यम् मातरम् भृश दुह्खिताम् ||
२-२४-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, son! A cow follows its calf wherever it goes. So also, I shall come with you wherever you go."_END

B_2_C_23_13
BEGIN_
यद्यपि प्रतिपत्तिस्ते दैवी चापि तयोर्मतम् |
तथा प्युपेक्षणीयम् ते न मे तदपि रोचते || २-२३-१५_END
BEGIN_
"It may be your opinion that their action is influenced by mere destiny. Even then,
I do not like you to be indifferent to this also."_END

B_2_C_22_20
BEGIN_ऋषयो प्युग्रतपसो दैवेनाभिप्रपीडिताः |
उत्सृज्य नियमाम् स्तीव्रान् भ्रश्यन्ते काममन्युभिः || २-२२-२३_END
BEGIN_"Even sages, who performed sever penance, having been harassed by destiny leave aside 
restraint and get ruined by lust and anger."_END

B_2_C_19_38
BEGIN_
प्रविश्य वेश्म अतिभ्ऱ्शम् मुदा अन्वितम् |
समीक्ष्य ताम् च अर्थ विपत्तिम् आगताम् |
न चैव रामः अत्र जगाम विक्रियाम् |
सुह्ऱ्ज् जनस्य आत्म विपत्ति शन्कया || २-१९-४०_END
BEGIN_
When Rama entered, Kausalya's palace was filled with great joy. At that time, Rama
did not show any displeasure for the mihlap occurred in truth. He behaved like that because he had
doubted about the possible shock to his friends even of fear of their life, if he showed any
perturabation._END

B_2_C_20_33
BEGIN_
सा राघवम् उपासीनम् असुख आर्ता सुख उचिता |
उवाच पुरुष व्याघ्रम् उपश्ऱ्ण्वति लक्ष्मणे || २-२०-३५_END
BEGIN_
Kausalya, who was fit for happiness but was afflicted with grief, spoke thus to Rama
the best of men who was sitting nearby, while Lakshmana was hearing._END

B_2_C_21_26
BEGIN_ततः स्त्वम् प्राप्स्यसे पुत्र निरयम् लोक विश्रुतम् |
ब्रह्म हत्याम् इव अधर्मात् समुद्रः सरिताम् पतिः || २-२१-२७_END
BEGIN_"Oh, son! If I fast myself to death for your sake, you will attain the universally famous 
hell, like the god of the ocean obtaining trouble because of his un justice behaviour, towards the sage 
called Pippalada, producing the latter's wrath."_END

B_2_C_24_8
BEGIN_
कैकेय्या वन्चितः राजा मयि च अरण्यम् आश्रिते |
भवत्या च परित्यक्तः न नूनम् वर्तयिष्यति || २-२४-११_END
BEGIN_
"Kaikeyi already deceived the king .He will not be alive, when I leave for the
forest and you also leave him .It is certain."_END

B_2_C_23_14
BEGIN_
विक्लवो वीर्य हीनो यः स दैवम् अनुवर्तते |
वीराः सम्भावित आत्मानो न दैवम् पर्युपासते || २-२३-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Only a confused and cowardly person depends upon destiny. Brave men with
self-respect do not honour the destiny."_END

B_2_C_22_21
BEGIN_असम्क्ल्पितमेवेह यदकस्मात् प्रवर्तते |
निवर्त्यारम्भमारब्धम् ननु दैवस्य कर्म तत् || २-२२-२४_END
BEGIN_"It is indeed an act of destiny which suddenly and unimaginably obstructs an action, 
undertaken in the world ,at the starting point itself."_END

B_2_C_25_0
BEGIN_
सा अपनीय तम् आयासम् उपस्पृश्य जलम् शुचि |
चकार माता रामस्य मन्गलानि मनस्विनी || २-२५-१_END
BEGIN_
Kausalya, the magnanimous mother putting away her grief, sipped water from the palm
of the hand, became purified and performed rites conducive to the welfare of Rama._END

B_2_C_20_34
BEGIN_
यदि पुत्र न जायेथा मम शोकाय राघव |
न स्म दुह्खम् अतः भूयः पश्येयम् अहम् अप्रजा || २-२०-३६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! I would not have felt this much grief if I were childless .You are born
only to produce sorrow to me."_END

B_2_C_21_27
BEGIN_विलपन्तीम् तथा दीनाम् कौसल्याम् जननीम् ततः |
उवाच रामः धर्म अत्मा वचनम् धर्म सम्हितम् || २-२१-२८_END
BEGIN_The honest Rama spoke these virtuous words to his mother Kausalya, who was thus weeping 
miserably._END

B_2_C_24_9
BEGIN_
भर्तुः किल परित्यागो नृशंसः केवलम् स्त्रियाः |
स भवत्या न कर्तव्यो मनसा अपि विगर्हितः || २-२४-१२_END
BEGIN_
"To a woman, abandonment of husband is entirely a cruel act. That bad act is not to
be perceived even by mind."_END

B_2_C_23_15
BEGIN_
दैवम् पुरुष कारेण यः समर्थः प्रबाधितुम् |
न दैवेन विपन्न अर्थः पुरुषः सो अवसीदति || २-२३-१७_END
BEGIN_
"That person who is capable of keeping off destiny by human effort, does not have
regret in the sense of not being failed by destiny."_END

B_2_C_22_22
BEGIN_एतया तत्त्वया बुद्ध्या संस्तभ्यात्मानमात्मना |
व्याहते अपि अभिषेके मे परितापो न विद्यते || २-२२-२५_END
BEGIN_"Although my coronation is obstructed, I have no grief since I have restrained the self 
by myself with real consciousness."_END

B_2_C_25_1
BEGIN_
न शक्यसे वारयौइतुम् गच्छेदानीम् रघुत्तम |
श्रीघ्रम् च विनिवर्तस्व वर्तस्व च सताम् क्रमे || २-२५-२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! Your departure cannot be restrained, depart now, return soon. Abide in
the footsteps of the virtuous."_END

B_2_C_20_35
BEGIN_
एकएव हि वन्ध्यायाः शोको भवति मानवः |
अप्रजा अस्मि इति सम्तापो न हि अन्यः पुत्र विद्यते || २-२०-३७_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, son! There is no other grief to a barren woman except the only worry that "I
have no sons"._END

B_2_C_24_10
BEGIN_
यावज् जीवति काकुत्स्थः पिता मे जगती पतिः |
शुश्रूषा क्रियताम् तावत् स हि धर्मः सनातनः || २-२४-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Till Dasaratha, my father and the great king is alive, you should serve him well.
It is eternal justice."_END

B_2_C_21_28
BEGIN_न अस्ति शक्तिः पितुर् वाक्यम् समतिक्रमितुम् मम |
प्रसादये त्वाम् शिरसा गन्तुम् इच्चाम्य् अहम् वनम् || २-२१-२९_END
BEGIN_"I am not able to violate my father's words. I am bowing my head and asking your favour. 
I shall have to go to the forest"_END

B_2_C_22_23
BEGIN_तस्मात् अपरितापः संस् त्वम् अपि अनुविधाय माम् |
प्रतिसम्हारय क्षिप्रम् आभिषेचनिकीम् क्रियाम् || २-२२-२६_END
BEGIN_"Hence ,you also ,like me, get the arrangements for coronation withdrawn immediately 
without any anguish"_END

B_2_C_23_16
BEGIN_
द्रक्ष्यन्ति तु अद्य दैवस्य पौरुषम् पुरुषस्य च |
दैव मानुषयोः अद्य व्यक्ता व्यक्तिर् भविष्यति || २-२३-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Today, all can see how much prowess is there in destiny and in man. This day, the
distinction between man and the destiny will be clearly perceived."_END

B_2_C_25_2
BEGIN_
यम् पालयसि धर्मम् त्वम् धृत्या च नियमेन च |
सवै राघवशार्दुल! धर्मस्त्वामभिरक्षतु || २-२५-३_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! Let that righteousness, which you are fostering with courage and
discipline , protect you"._END

B_2_C_20_36
BEGIN_
न द्ऱ्ष्ट पूर्वम् कल्याणम् सुखम् वा पति पौरुषे |
अपि पुत्रे विपश्येयम् इति राम आस्थितम् मया || २-२०-३८_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! I have not seen any happiness or prosperity earlier, while my husband is
in power. I believed that I could see them at last when my son comes to power."_END

B_2_C_24_11
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्ता तु रामेण कौसल्या शुभ दर्शना |
तथा इति उवाच सुप्रीता रामम् अक्लिष्ट कारिणम् || २-२४-१४_END
BEGIN_
After Rama spoke thus, Kausalya with auspicious appearance, was very much pleased
and spoke to Rama, who performs indefatigable actions, in consent._END

B_2_C_21_29
BEGIN_ऋषिणा च पितुर् वाक्यम् कुर्वता व्रत चारिणा |
गौर् हता जानता धर्मम् कण्डुना अपि विपश्चिता || २-२१-३०_END
BEGIN_"A sage called Kandu, who knew righteousness, who performed religious vows and who was 
a learned man, killed even a cow, acting as per his father's words"_END

B_2_C_22_24
BEGIN_एभिरेव घटैः सर्वैरभिषेचनसम्भृतैः |
मम लक्स्मण तापस्ये व्रतस्नानम् भविष्यति || २-२२-२७_END
BEGIN_Oh, Lakshmana! Let all these very pots of water arranged for coronation be used by me 
for my bath after completing the religious vow of asceticism."_END

B_2_C_23_17
BEGIN_
अद्य मत् पौरुष हतम् दैवम् द्रक्ष्यन्ति वै जनाः |
यद् दैवात् आहतम् ते अद्य द्ऱ्ष्टम् राज्य अभिषेचनम् || २-२३-१९_END
BEGIN_
"By which destiny, your coronation is seen crushed, I shall crush that destiny by my
prowess. Let all people see it!"_END

B_2_C_25_3
BEGIN_
येभ्यः प्रणमसे पुत्र चैत्येष्वायतनेषु च |
ते च त्वामभिरक्षन्तु वने सह महर्षिभिः || २-२५-४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, son! To whom you will be bowing in salutation at cross-roads and in temples,
those along with great saints will protect you in the forest._END

B_2_C_20_37
BEGIN_
सा बहूनि अमनोज्ञानि वाक्यानि ह्ऱ्दयच्चिदाम् |
अहम् श्रोष्ये सपत्नीनाम् अवराणाम् वरा सती || २-२०-३९_END
BEGIN_
"I have to hear so many disagreeable words from my fellow-wives who are inferior to
me and who pierce my heart with their words though I am a better and virtuous wife among them."_END

B_2_C_24_12
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्तः तु वचनम् रामः धर्मभ्ऱ्ताम् वरः |
भूयः ताम् अब्रवीद् वाक्यम् मातरम् भृश दुह्खिताम् || २-२४-१५_END
BEGIN_
That Rama, the best among upholders of righteousness, after hearing the words of his
mother ,spoke again to her who was very much distressed._END

B_2_C_21_30
BEGIN_अस्माकम् च कुले पूर्वम् सगरस्य आज्ञया पितुः |
खनद्भिः सागरैः भूतिम् अवाप्तः सुमहान् वधः || २-२१-३१_END
BEGIN_"Previously, the sons of Sagara belonging to our race, were got bitterly digging up the 
earth, as commanded by their father."_END

B_2_C_22_25
BEGIN_अथवा किम् ममैतेन राजद्रव्यमयेन तु |
उद्धृतम् मे स्वयम् तो यम् व्रतादेशम् करिष्यति || २-२२-२८_END
BEGIN_"Otherwise ,why to me this water in these pots ,which is royal property? The water drawn 
out by myself ,will be used for my bath after completing the religious vow."_END

B_2_C_23_18
BEGIN_
अत्यन्कुशम् इव उद्दामम् गजम् मद बल उद्धतम् |
प्रधावितम् अहम् दैवम् पौरुषेण निवर्तये || २-२३-२०_END
BEGIN_
"By my prowess, I shall turn back this destiny, as framing back an elephant which is
not caring a hook and which is fiercely running with violent force."_END

B_2_C_25_4
BEGIN_
यानि दत्तानि तेऽ स्त्राणि विश्वामित्रेण धीमता |
तानि त्वामभिरक्षन्तु गुणैस्समुदितम् सदा || २-२५-५_END
BEGIN_
"All the arms given by the wise sage Viswamitra to you, will ever protect you who
are rich in good qualities"_END

B_2_C_24_13
BEGIN_
मया चैव भवत्या च कर्तव्यम् वचनम् पितुः |
राजा भर्ता गुरुः श्रेष्ठः सर्वेषाम् ईश्वरः प्रभुः || २-२४-१६_END
BEGIN_
"The words of father are to be followed by you and me. For all, he is the king, the
nourished, a venerable man, the best among men, the lord and the ruler."_END

B_2_C_20_38
BEGIN_
अतः दुह्खतरम् किम् नु प्रमदानाम् भविष्यति |
त्वयि सम्निहिते अपि एवम् अहम् आसम् निराक्ऱ्ता || २-२०-४०_END
BEGIN_
"Which one will be more sorrowful to women than this unending and consuming grief
that occurred to me now?"_END

B_2_C_21_31
BEGIN_जामदग्न्येन रामेण रेणुका जननी स्वयम् |
कृत्ता परशुना अरण्ये पितुर् वचन कारिणा || २-२१-३२_END
BEGIN_"Parasu Rama, the son of Jamadagni personally slayed his mother Renuka in the forest 
with an axe as per his father's words."_END

B_2_C_23_19
BEGIN_
लोक पालाः समस्ताः ते न अद्य राम अभिषेचनम् |
न च क्ऱ्त्स्नाः त्रयो लोका विहन्युः किम् पुनः पिता || २-२३-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Neither all the guardians of the world nor the three worlds put together can
withhold Rama's coronation today. Why to talk about father."_END

B_2_C_22_26
BEGIN_मा च लक्ष्मण सम्तापम् कार्षीर्लक्ष्म्या विपर्यये |
राज्यम् वा वनवासो वा वनवासो महोदयः || २-२२-२९_END
BEGIN_"Oh, Lakshmana! Do not repent about this perverseness of Lakshmi, the goddess of wealth. 
When you talk of kingdom or dwelling in the forest, this is the final beautitude."_END

B_2_C_25_5
BEGIN_
पितृशुश्रुषया पुत्र मातृशु श्रूषया तथा |
सत्येन च महाबाहो चिरम् जीवाभिरक्षितः || २-२५-६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, son with magnificent arms! Protected by your service to father and service to
mother as well as truthfulness, you will belong-lived"_END

B_2_C_20_39
BEGIN_
त्वयि सन्निहितेऽप्येवमहमासं निराकृता |
किम् पुनः प्रोषिते तात ध्रुवम् मरणम् एव मे || २-२०-४१_END
BEGIN_
"Even when you are near by, I am being rejected. What to tell after you leave for
exile? Death indeed is certain to me."_END

B_2_C_24_14
BEGIN_
इमानि तु महा अरण्ये विह्ऱ्त्य नव पन्च च |
वर्षाणि परम प्रीतः स्थास्यामि वचने तव || २-२४-१७_END
BEGIN_
"After roaming in the great forest for fourteen years, I shall come back and very
gladly stand by your command."_END

B_2_C_21_32
BEGIN_एतैरन्यैश्च बहुभिर्देवि देवसमैः कृतम् |
पितुर्वचनमक्लीबम् करिष्यामि पितुर्शितम् || २-२१-३३_END
BEGIN_"Oh, mother! These and many others who were equivalent to gods, did not make their father' 
s words to go waste. I shall also do what is desired by my father"_END

B_2_C_23_20
BEGIN_
यैः विवासः तव अरण्ये मिथो राजन् समर्थितः |
अरण्ये तु विवत्स्यन्ति चतुर् दश समाः तथा || २-२३-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, King! Those who are secritlyadvocating you to live in a forest for fourteen
years, will have to reside in forest for fourteen years in that manner."_END

B_2_C_22_27
BEGIN_न लक्ष्मण अस्मिन् मम राज्य विघ्ने |
माता यवीयस्य् अतिशन्कनीया |
दैव अभिपन्ना हि वदन्ति अनिष्टम् |
जानासि दैवम् च तथा प्रभावम् || २-२२-३०_END
BEGIN_"Oh, Lakshmana! Do not suspect our mother for obstruction of coronation ceremony. She 
is uttering evil words, being overpowered by destiny. You are aware of this destiny, which has such 
influence."_END

B_2_C_25_6
BEGIN_
समित्कुशपवित्राणि वेद्यश्चायतनानि च |
स्थण्ढिलानि विचित्राणि शैला वृक्षाः कुशुफा ह्रदाः || २-२५-७
पतङ्गाः पन्नगाः सिम्हास्त्वाम् रक्षन्तु नरोत्तम |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama, the best among men! May the wooden sticks used for feeding the sacred
fire, blades of the sacred Kusa grass and rings of Kusa grass(worn on the forth finger on
sacrificial occasions)sacrificial altars , temples and various sites selected by Brahmanas for
worship of gods, mountains, trees, bushes, large and deep pools of water, birds, snakes and lions
protect you."_END

B_2_C_26_0
BEGIN_
अभिवाद्य तु कौसल्याम् रामः सम्प्रस्थितः वनम् |
कृत स्वस्त्ययनो मात्रा धर्मिष्ठे वर्त्मनि स्थितः || २-२६-१
विराजयन् राज सुतः राज मार्गम् नरैः वृतम् |
हृदयानि आममन्थ इव जनस्य गुणवत्तया || २-२६-२_END
BEGIN_
The prince Rama, having been invoked blessings by his mother, after having
salutation to Kausalya and remaining firmly in his virtuous path, set out journey to the forest.
Entering to the road filled with people, he made it shine with his splendour and stirred the hearts
of the people because of his excellent qualities._END

B_2_C_20_40
BEGIN_
अत्यन्तनिगृहीतास्मि भर्तुर्नित्य्मतन्त्रिता |
परिवारेण कैकेय्या समा वाप्यथवाऽवरा || २-२०-४२_END
BEGIN_
"My husband always held me down, without giving me any independence and treat me
equal to or even lower than the servants of Kaikeyi"_END

B_2_C_24_15
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्ता प्रियम् पुत्रम् बाष्प पूर्ण आनना तदा |
उवाच परम आर्ता तु कौसल्या पुत्र वत्सला || २-२४-१८_END
BEGIN_
After hearing the words of Rama, Kausalya who was affectionate to her son , was in
great sorrow with her face filled with tears and spoke thus to her beloved son Rama ._END

B_2_C_21_33
BEGIN_न खल्व् एतन् मया एकेन क्रियते पितृ शासनम् |
एतैरपि कृतम् देवि ये मया तव कीर्तिताः || २-२१-३४_END
BEGIN_"Oh, mother! I am not the only person to act according to father's command. Those I have 
mentioned to you hitherto also complied with their father's command."_END

B_2_C_23_21
BEGIN_
अहम् तदा आशाम् चेत्स्यामि पितुस् तस्याः च या तव |
अभिषेक विघातेन पुत्र राज्याय वर्तते || २-२३-२३_END
BEGIN_
"That is why, I shall break down the hope of father and of Kaikeyi, who is trying
for kingdom to her son by creating obstacle to your coronation."_END

B_2_C_25_7
BEGIN_
स्वस्ति साध्याः च विश्वे च मरुतः च महर्षयः || २-२५-८
स्वस्ति धाता विधाता च स्वस्ति पूषा भगो अर्यमा |
ऋतवः चैव पक्षाः च मासाः सम्वत्सराः क्षपाः || २-२५-९_END
BEGIN_
"May the saadhyas and viswadevas (two different kinds of gods) and wind-gods along
with eminent sages ensure your happiness. May the cosmic person and the creator bring happiness to
you. May the Pusha, Bhaga and Aryama (three of the twelve sons of Aditi)and the guardians of the
spheres with Indra as their Head do good to you."_END

B_2_C_26_1
BEGIN_
वैदेही च अपि तत् सर्वम् न शुश्राव तपस्विनी |
तत् एव हृदि तस्याः च यौवराज्य अभिषेचनम् || २-२६-३_END
BEGIN_
Sita, practising for the coronation ceremony, did not hear anything on that matter.
She was thinking of installation of Rama alone as prince Regent in her heart_END

B_2_C_20_41
BEGIN_
यो हि माम् सेवते कश्चित् अथ वा अपि अनुवर्तते |
कैकेय्याः पुत्रम् अन्वीक्ष्य स जनो न अभिभाषते || २-२०-४३_END
BEGIN_
Those who serve me now and those who follow me, will not speak to me, after seeing
Bharata"._END

B_2_C_24_16
BEGIN_
आसाम् राम सपत्नीनाम् वस्तुम् मध्ये न मे क्षमम् |
नय माम् अपि काकुत्स्थ वनम् वन्यम् म्ऱ्गीम् यथा || २-२४-१९
यदि ते गमने बुद्धिः कृता पितुर् अपेक्षया |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! I can not reside in the middle of these step-wives. If you have made up
your mind to go to forest as per your father's wish ,also take me, like taking a female deer of the
forest ,to the woods ''_END

B_2_C_21_34
BEGIN_नाहम् धर्ममपूर्वम् ते प्रतिकूलम् प्रवर्तये |
पूर्वैः अयम् अभिप्रेतः गतः मार्गो अनुगम्यते || २-२१-३५_END
BEGIN_"I am not setting any new contradicting customary conduct for your sake. I am adhering 
to the way agreed and followed by the ancient."_END

B_2_C_23_22
BEGIN_
मद् बलेन विरुद्धाय न स्यात् दैव बलम् तथा |
प्रभविष्यति दुह्खाय यथा उग्रम् पौरुषम् मम || २-२३-२४_END
BEGIN_
"The strength of destiny cannot create that much pain as that which my terrific
prowess will create to those who are opposed to my strength."_END

B_2_C_25_8
BEGIN_
ऋतवश्चैव पक्षाश्च मासास्सम्वत्सराः क्षपाः |
दिनानि च मुहूर्ताः च स्वस्ति कुर्वन्तु ते सदा || २-२५-१०_END
BEGIN_
"May the six seasons, all the fortnights and months, years, nights, days and hours
always do good to you._END

B_2_C_24_17
BEGIN_
ताम् तथा रुदतीम् रामः रुदन् वचनम् अब्रवीत् || २-२४-२०
जीवन्त्या हि स्त्रिया भर्ता दैवतम् प्रभुर् एव च |_END
BEGIN_
"Rama spoke thus these words bemoaningly to her, who was weeping= "as long as a
woman is alive ,her husband is god and master to her"._END

B_2_C_20_42
BEGIN_
नित्यक्रोधतया तस्याः कथं नु खरवादि तत् |
कैकेय्या वदनम् द्रष्टुम् पुत्र शक्ष्यामि दुर्गता || २-२०-४४_END
BEGIN_
Oh, son! How can I, the miserable one, see the face of Kaikeyi who talks hurtingly
because of her continuous anger."_END

B_2_C_26_2
BEGIN_
देव कार्यम् स्म सा कृत्वा कृतज्ञा हृष्ट चेतना |
अभिज्ञा राज धर्मानाम् राज पुत्रम् प्रतीक्षते || २-२६-४_END
BEGIN_
As she knows what is to be done and is aware of rules relating to kings Sita herself
being rejoiced in heart, performed the worship of the gods and was waiting for the prince._END

B_2_C_21_35
BEGIN_तत् एतत् तु मया कार्यम् क्रियते भुवि न अन्यथा |
पितुर् हि वचनम् कुर्वन् न कश्चिन् नाम हीयते || २-२१-३६_END
BEGIN_"I cannot do otherwise than acting in accordance with father's words, the prevalent practice 
on earth. There is no deprivation indeed for anyone who complies with father's commands."_END

B_2_C_23_23
BEGIN_
ऊर्ध्वम् वर्ष सहस्र अन्ते प्रजा पाल्यम् अनन्तरम् |
आर्य पुत्राः करिष्यन्ति वन वासम् गते त्वयि || २-२३-२५_END
BEGIN_
"At the end of a thousand years of your ruling the kingdom, you having gone to the
forest, your sons will govern the kingdom."_END

B_2_C_25_9
BEGIN_
स्मृतिर् धृतिः च धर्मः च पान्तु त्वाम् पुत्र सर्वतः |
स्कन्दः च भगवान् देवः सोमः च सबृहस्पतिः || २-२५-११
सप्त ऋषयो नारदः च ते त्वाम् रक्षन्तु सर्वतः |_END
BEGIN_
"May Veda, the Smriti texts taken as one body, the resolution and the piety protect
you, my son! May lord Skanda (the younger son of Lord Siva)and the moon god along with the sage
Brihaspati(the preceptor of gods), the well known seven sages as well as Sage Narada guard you on
all sides."_END

B_2_C_24_18
BEGIN_
भवत्या मम चैवाद्य राजा प्रभवति प्रभुः ।।२-२४-२१
न ह्यनाथा वयं राज्ज्ञा लोकनाथेन धीम ता ।_END
BEGIN_
"King Dasaratha, supreme commander has authority over you and me also now. when
king, the lord of the earth and the wise man is there , we are not indeed master-less.'_END

B_2_C_20_43
BEGIN_
दश सप्त च वर्षाणि तव जातस्य राघव |
असितानि प्रकान्क्षन्त्या मया दुह्ख परिक्षयम् || २-२०-४५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh,Rama! I have been waiting for seventeen years after your second birth of thread
ceremony, with the hope that my troubles will disappear at one time or the other."_END

B_2_C_26_3
BEGIN_
प्रविवेश अथ रामः तु स्व वेश्म सुविभूषितम् |
प्रहृष्ट जन सम्पूर्णम् ह्रिया किंचित् अवान् मुखः || २-२६-५_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter Rama, slightly turning his face down , entered his own house which is
well decorated and is filled with rejoicing people all around_END

B_2_C_21_36
BEGIN_ताम् एवम् उक्त्वा जननीम् लक्ष्मणम् पुनर् अब्रवीत् |
तव लक्ष्मण जानामि मयि स्नेहम् अनुत्तमम् || २-२१-३७_END
BEGIN_Rama, the best of those who speak skilfully and the best of all those wearing the bow, 
spoke thus to his mother and turned round to Lakshmana to speak._END

B_2_C_23_24
BEGIN_
पूर्व राज ऱ्षि व्ऱ्त्त्या हि वन वासो विधीयते |
प्रजा निक्षिप्य पुत्रेषु पुत्रवत् परिपालने || २-२३-२६_END
BEGIN_
"It is indeed a practice for ancient kings to go to the forest after keeping care of
people, to be nourished as children, into the hands of their sons."_END

B_2_C_25_10
BEGIN_
याश्चापि सर्वतः सिद्दा दिश्श्च सदिगीश्वराः || २-२५-१२
स्तुता मया वने तस्मिन् पान्तुत्वाम् पुत्र नित्यशः |_END
BEGIN_
"May the four quarters along with the glorious guardians of the four quarters which
are enlogised by me may protect you always on all sides in that forest."_END

B_2_C_24_19
BEGIN_
भरतश्चापि धर्मात्मा सर्वभूतप्रियंवदः ।।२-२४-२२
भवतीमनुवर्तेत स हिधर्मरतः सदा ।_END
BEGIN_
"Bharata also, who is a righteous person and who speaks lovingly to all beings will
be obliging to you. He is indeed always devoted to righteousness.'_END

B_2_C_20_44
BEGIN_
तदक्षयम् महाद्दुःखम् नोत्सहे सहितुम् चिरम् |
विप्रकारम् सपत्नीनामेवम् जीर्णापि राघव || २-२०-४६_END
BEGIN_
Oh, Rama! In this old age, I cannot bear insult from co-wives and this unending
sorrow for a long time._END

B_2_C_26_4
BEGIN_
अथ सीता समुत्पत्य वेपमाना च तम् पतिम् |
अपश्यत् शोक सम्तप्तम् चिन्ता व्याकुलिल इन्द्रियम् || २-२६-६_END
BEGIN_
Sita sprang up from her seat and trembled by seeing her husband stricken with
sorrow, his mind perturbed with anxiety._END

B_2_C_21_37
BEGIN_तव लक्ष्मण जानामि मयि स्नेहमनुत्तमम् |
विक्रमम् चैव सत्यम् च तेजश्च सुदुरासदम् || २-२१-३८_END
BEGIN_"Oh, Lakshmana ! I know your highest affection towards me, your heroic valour ,your strength 
and your unassailable splendour ."_END

B_2_C_23_25
BEGIN_
स चेद् राजनि अनेक अग्रे राज्य विभ्रम शन्कया |
न एवम् इच्चसि धर्मात्मन् राज्यम् राम त्वम् आत्मनि || २-२३-२७
प्रतिजाने च ते वीर मा भूवम् वीर लोक भाक् |
राज्यम् च तव रक्षेयम् अहम् वेला इव सागरम् || २-२३-२८_END
BEGIN_
"If you think that you do not want kingdom because of your doubt that the kingdom
will get disturbed due to unstable mind of king Dasaratha, you need not fear. I am promising you. I
shall protect the kingdom as a sea coast protects the sea. If not, I will not obtain the heroic
world of heaven."_END

B_2_C_25_11
BEGIN_
शैलाः सर्वे समुद्राश्च राजा वरुण एव च || २-२५-१३
द्यौरन्तरिक्षम् पृथिवी नद्यस्सर्वास्तथैव च |
नक्षत्राणि च सर्वाणि ग्रहाः च सहदेवताः || २-२५-१४
अहोरात्रे तथा सन्ध्ये पान्तु त्वाम् वनमाश्रितम् |_END
BEGIN_
" Let all mountains , oceans, king(of oceans) Varuna, heaven and earth, the
intermediate space between them , rivers , astrological mansions including gods presiding over
them, day and night, the morning and evening twilights may protect you while you reside in the
forest ."_END

B_2_C_20_45
BEGIN_
अपश्यन्ती तव मुखम् परिपूर्णशशिप्रभम् |
कृपणा वर्तयिष्यामि कथम् कृपणजीविकाम् || २-२०-४७_END
BEGIN_
"How can I the pitiable one, spend this miserable life without seeing your face
radiating like full moon."_END

B_2_C_24_20
BEGIN_
यथा मयि तु निष्क्रान्ते पुत्रशोकेन पार्थिवः || २-२४-२३
श्रमम् न अवाप्नुयात् किंचित् अप्रमत्ता तथा कुरु |_END
BEGIN_
"While I take leave, take care of the king attentively so that he will not get
fatigued even a little with grief over his son."_END

B_2_C_26_5
BEGIN_
ताम् दृष्ट्वा स हि धर्मात्मा न शशाक मनोगतम् |
तम् शोकम् राघवह् सोढुम् ततो विवृतताम् गतः || २-२६-७_END
BEGIN_
By seeing her, Rama the virtuous man could not contain that grief existing in his
mind and hence got unveiled._END

B_2_C_21_38
BEGIN_मम मातुर्महद्दुःखमतुलम् शुभलक्षम्ण |
अभिप्रायम् अविज्ञाय सत्यस्य च शमस्य च || २-२१-३९_END
BEGIN_" Oh, Lakshmana, with good attributes! My mother is feeling a great and unequalled sorrow, 
by not knowing the secret of truth and tranquillity."_END

B_2_C_23_26
BEGIN_
मन्गलैः अभिषिन्चस्व तत्र त्वम् व्याप्ऱ्तः भव |
अहम् एको मही पालान् अलम् वारयितुम् बलात् || २-२३-२९_END
BEGIN_
"You become engaged in getting coronated with auspicious things. I for one is
competent to ward off the kings by force."_END

B_2_C_25_12
BEGIN_
ऋतवश्चैव ष्ट्पुण्या मासाः सम्वत्सरास्तथा || २-२५-१५
कलाश्च काष्ठाश्च तथा तव शर्म दिशन्तु ते |_END
BEGIN_
"The six holy seasons, months, years and the measures of time known as Kala
(equilent to one minute) and Kastha(1/30th of Kala or two seconds)bestow you happiness"_END

B_2_C_20_46
BEGIN_
उपवासैः च योगैः च बहुभिः च परिश्रमैः |
दुह्खम् सम्वर्धितः मोघम् त्वम् हि दुर्गतया मया || २-२०-४८_END
BEGIN_
"You were nourished in vain by me ,the important one by fasts, by meditations, by
various difficult and painful vows ."_END

B_2_C_24_21
BEGIN_
दारुणश्चाप्ययम् शोको यथैनम् न विनाशयेत् || २-२४-२४
राज्ञो वृद्धस्य सततम् हितम् चर समाहिता |_END
BEGIN_
"Act always soothingly for a well-being of the aged king, seeing that his terrible
grief will not destroy him ."_END

B_2_C_21_39
BEGIN_धर्मः हि परमः लोके धर्मे सत्यम् प्रतिष्ठितम् |
धर्म संश्रितम् एतच् च पितुर् वचनम् उत्तमम् || २-२१-४०_END
BEGIN_"Righteousness is the best of all qualities in the world. Truth is established in righteousness. 
Even these best words of father are enjoined with righteousness."_END

B_2_C_26_6
BEGIN_
विवर्ण वदनम् दृष्ट्वा तम् प्रस्विन्नम् अमर्षणम् |
आह दुह्ख अभिसम्तप्ता किम् इदानीम् इदम् प्रभो || २-२६-८_END
BEGIN_
Seeing him pale-faced, perspired and without endurance, Sita (stricken with grief)
spoke thus what is this now , my Lord!_END

B_2_C_27_0
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्ता तु वैदेही प्रिय अर्हा प्रिय वादिनी |
प्रणयात् एव सम्क्रुद्धा भर्तारम् इदम् अब्रवीत् || २-२७-१_END
BEGIN_
Sita, who speaks kindly and deserves kind utterances, after hearing Rama's words,
became angry out of love alone and spoke thus to her husband._END

B_2_C_23_27
BEGIN_
न शोभ अर्थाव् इमौ बाहू न धनुर् भूषणाय मे |
न असिरा बन्धन अर्थाय न शराः स्तम्भ हेतवः || २-२३-३०
अमित्र दमन अर्थम् मे सर्वम् एतच् चतुष्टयम् |_END
BEGIN_
"My arms are not meant for handsomeness alone. Bow is not for decoration. Sword is
not for tying around waist. Arrows are not for staying immobile. All these four are intended for
subduing enemies."_END

B_2_C_25_13
BEGIN_
महा वनानि चरतः मुनि वेषस्य धीमतः || २-२५-१६
तवादित्याश्च दैत्याश्च भवन्तु सुखदाः सदा |_END
BEGIN_
"Let the heavenly deities and the demons too ever grant happiness on you while you
traverse through the large forest, in the guise of a hermit and full of wisdom "_END

B_2_C_20_47
BEGIN_
स्थिरम् तु हृदयम् मन्ये मम इदम् यन् न दीर्यते |
प्रावृषि इव महा नद्याः स्पृष्टम् कूलम् नव अम्भसा || २-२०-४९_END
BEGIN_
"My heart is not breached, as bank of a great river, struck by new water in monsoon,
by hearing this news.That is why, I feel it is strong."_END

B_2_C_24_22
BEGIN_
व्रत उपवास निरता या नारी परम उत्तमा || २-२४-२५
भर्तारम् न अनुवर्तेत सा च पाप गतिर् भवेत् |_END
BEGIN_
�Even if a woman is interested in religious vows and fastings in addition to being
the best of the excellent ;if she does not obey her husband she will become ill-fated !''_END

B_2_C_26_7
BEGIN_
अद्य बार्हस्पतः श्रीमान् युक्तः पुष्यो न राघव |
प्रोच्यते ब्राह्मणैः प्राज्ञैः केन त्वम् असि दुर्मनाः || २-२६-९_END
BEGIN_
Oh , Rama! It is indeed told by learned brahmanas that today's constellation Pushya
(which is presided by sage bR^ihaspati) which is propitions, is suitable (for coronation). Why are
you sadly disposed?_END

B_2_C_21_40
BEGIN_संश्रुत्य च पितुर् वाक्यम् मातुर् वा ब्राह्मणस्य वा |
न कर्तव्यम् वृथा वीर धर्मम् आश्रित्य तिष्ठता || २-२१-४१_END
BEGIN_"One who follows righteousness, does not waste his promise given to one's father or mother 
or Brahmana."_END

B_2_C_27_1
BEGIN_
किमिदम् भाषसे राम वाक्यम् लघुतया ध्रुवम् |
त्वया यदपहास्यम् मे श्रुत्वा नरवरात्मज || २-२७-२_END
BEGIN_
Oh, Rama the prince! What words these are you speaking? These light words certainly
are to be laughed at by you and to me after hearning._END

B_2_C_23_28
BEGIN_
न च अहम् कामये अत्यर्थम् यः स्यात् शत्रुर् मतः मम || २-२३-३१
असिना तीक्ष्ण धारेण विद्युच् चलित वर्चसा |
प्रग्ऱ्हीतेन वै शत्रुम् वज्रिणम् वा न कल्पये || २-२३-३२_END
BEGIN_
"I do not wish to tolerate too much the one who is considered as enemy to me. By
wearing a sword with sharp edge which is mavingly bright like lightening, I do not care any enemy,
even Indra himself. This earth will become impermeable, uninhabited with heads hands and thighs of
elephants horses and men crushed, having been hit by my sword."_END

B_2_C_25_14
BEGIN_
राक्षसानाम् पिशाचानाम् रौद्राणाम् क्रूरकर्मणाम् || २-२५-१७
क्रव्यादानाम् च सर्वेषम् माभूत्पुत्रक ते भयम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, son! Let there not be fear for you of demons the terrible ones performing cruel
deeds, of devilish beings called Pisachas and of all carnivorous animals."_END

B_2_C_20_48
BEGIN_
मम एव नूनम् मरणम् न विद्यते |
न च अवकाशो अस्ति यम क्षये मम |
यद् अन्तको अद्य एव न माम् जिहीर्षति |
प्रसह्य सिम्हो रुदतीम् म्ऱ्गीम् इव || २-२०-५०_END
BEGIN_
"There is no death to me, indeed .I have no place in the abode of god yama who
presides over the spirits of the dead .That is why, Yama is not forcingly carrying me off like a
lion carrying off a wailing antelope."_END

B_2_C_24_23
BEGIN_
भर्तुः शुश्रूषया नारी लभते स्वर्गमु त्तमम् || २-२४-२६
अपि या निर्नमस्कारा निवृत्ता देवपूजनात् |_END
BEGIN_
�Even if a woman does not offer salutation to celestials and does not worship the
gods, she will attain the highest heaven by service to her husband ."_END

B_2_C_26_8
BEGIN_
न ते शत शलाकेन जल फेन निभेन च |
आवृतम् वदनम् वल्गु चत्रेण अभिविराजते || २-२६-१०_END
BEGIN_
Your handsome face does not shine splendidly as it should when covered by an
umbrella white as water-froth and provided with a hundred ribs._END

B_2_C_27_2
BEGIN_
आर्य पुत्र पिता माता भ्राता पुत्रः तथा स्नुषा |
स्वानि पुण्यानि भुन्जानाः स्वम् स्वम् भाग्यम् उपासते || २-२७-३_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, noble prince! Father, mother, brother, son and daughter-in-law accomplish their
own good fortune, as benefitted by their own pious deeds."_END

B_2_C_21_41
BEGIN_सो अहम् न शक्ष्यामि पितुर् नियोगम् अतिवर्तितुम् |
पितुर् हि वचनात् वीर कैकेय्या अहम् प्रचोदितः || २-२१-४२_END
BEGIN_" I cannot transgress my father's command. On the word given by my father only, Kaikeyi 
instigated me to go to the forest."_END

B_2_C_23_29
BEGIN_
खड्ग निष्पेष निष्पिष्टैः गहना दुश्चरा च मे |
हस्ति अश्व नर हस्त ऊरु शिरोभिर् भविता मही || २-२३-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Now, elephants can fall down on earth, being hit by the gush of my sword, like
mountains in blaze, like clouds, savidyutaH = with flashes of lightening._END

B_2_C_25_15
BEGIN_
प्लवगा वृश्चिका दंशा मशकाः चैव कानने || २-२५-१८
सरी सृपाः च कीटाः च मा भूवन् गहने तव |_END
BEGIN_
"In that impenetrable forest occupied by you, let there be no monkeys, scorpions,
gad fies, mosquitoes, snakes or other insects ."_END

B_2_C_20_49
BEGIN_
स्थिरम् हि नूनम् हृदयम् मम आयसम् |
न भिद्यते यद् भुवि न अवदीर्यते |
अनेन दुःखेन च देहम् अर्पितम् |
ध्रुवम् हि अकाले मरणम् न विद्यते || २-२०-५१_END
BEGIN_
"This grief is inserted into my body. Even then, my heart is stable. It has not
broken into pieces and fallen on the floor .It is indeed made of iron. There is no untimely death,
it is certain"_END

B_2_C_24_24
BEGIN_
शुश्रूषम् एव कुर्वीत भर्तुः प्रिय हिते रता || २-२४-२७
एष धर्मः पुरा द्ऱ्ष्टः लोके वेदे श्रुतः स्म्ऱ्तः |_END
BEGIN_
�She has to do service, truly devoted in love and welfare of her husband. This is
seen in the world from the beginning, was heard from ancient texts and mentioned as
righteousness.'_END

B_2_C_27_3
BEGIN_
भर्तुर् भाग्यम् तु भार्या एका प्राप्नोति पुरुष ऋषभ |
अतः चैव अहम् आदिष्टा वने वस्तव्यम् इति अपि || २-२७-४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama the best of men! Wife for one gets fortune of the husband. For that
reason, I am also destined to dwell in the forest."_END

B_2_C_21_42
BEGIN_तत् एनाम् विसृज अनार्याम् क्षत्र धर्म आश्रिताम् मतिम् |
धर्मम् आश्रय मा तैक्ष्ण्यम् मद् बुद्धिर् अनुगम्यताम् || २-२१-४३_END
BEGIN_"Hence, leave this mean mentality of military heroism. Observe righteousness and not 
rudeness. follow my perception."_END

B_2_C_26_9
BEGIN_
व्यजनाभ्याम् च मुख्याभ्याम् शत पत्र निभ ईक्षणम् |
चन्द्र हंस प्रकाशाभ्याम् वीज्यते न तव आननम् || २-२६-११_END
BEGIN_
Nor your lotus -eyed face is not being fanned (as it should ) by superior chowries
shining like a moon and a swan_END

B_2_C_23_30
BEGIN_
खड्ग धारा हता मे अद्य दीप्यमानाइव अद्रयः |
पतिष्यन्ति द्विपा भूमौ मेघाइव सविद्युतः || २-२३-३४_END
BEGIN_
"As I stand holding a bow with fingers wound with shields made of allegator-skin,
how any man will fancy himself a hero among men?"_END

B_2_C_25_16
BEGIN_
महा द्विपाः च सिम्हाः च व्याघ्राऋक्षाः च दम्ष्ट्रिणः || २-२५-१९
महिषाः शृन्गिणो रौद्रा न ते द्रुह्यन्तु पुत्रक |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, son! Let the great elephants , lions with tusks, tigers, bears, terrible
he-buffaloes with horns not to be hostile to you._END

B_2_C_24_25
BEGIN_
अग्निकार्येषु च सदा सुमनोभिश्च देवताः || २-२४-२८
पूज्याः ते मत् क्ऱ्ते देवि ब्राह्मणाः चैव सुव्रताः |_END
BEGIN_
Oh, Mother! You always worship gods by sacrificial fire and by flowers for my sake .
Brahmanas also with right voes are to be worshipped .'_END

B_2_C_20_50
BEGIN_
इदम् तु दुःखम् यद् अनर्थकानि मे|
व्रतानि दानानि च सम्यमाः च हि |
तपः च तप्तम् यद् अपत्य कारणात् |
सुनिष्फलम् बीजम् इव उप्तम् ऊषरे || २-२०-५२_END
BEGIN_
"I feel bad since all my religious vows, charities, restraints have all gone
waste.The austerity I performed for the sake of of -spring has gone in vain, as a seed sown in a
saline soil."_END

B_2_C_27_4
BEGIN_
न पिता न आत्मजो न आत्मा न माता न सखी जनः |
इह प्रेत्य च नारीणाम् पतिर् एको गतिः सदा || २-२७-५_END
BEGIN_
" To a woman, father or son or self or mother or female companion are not the
recourse. Husband alone is forever the best recourse either in this world or after her death"._END

B_2_C_21_43
BEGIN_तम् एवम् उक्त्वा सौहार्दात् भ्रातरम् लक्ष्मण अग्रजः |
उवाच भूयः कौसल्याम् प्रान्जलिः शिरसा आनतः || २-२१-४४_END
BEGIN_Rama spoke thus to his brother affectionately, bowed to his mother and with folded hands, 
spoke again to Kausalya as follows._END

B_2_C_26_10
BEGIN_
वाग्मिनो बन्दिनः च अपि प्रहृष्टाः त्वम् नर ऋषभ |
स्तुवन्तः न अद्य दृश्यन्ते मन्गलैः सूत मागधाः || २-२६-१२_END
BEGIN_
Nor the overjoyed and eloquent bards Sutas and Maagadhas (who sing portions of epic
poems and ancient ballads ) are seen here , praising you with auspicious words ._END

B_2_C_23_31
BEGIN_
बद्ध गोधा अन्गुलि त्राणे प्रगृहीत शर आसने |
कथम् पुरुष मानी स्यात् पुरुषाणाम् मयि स्थिते || २-२३-३५_END
BEGIN_
"While I overpower one with many arrows and many with a single arrow, I discharge my
arrows at vitals of men, horses and elephants."_END

B_2_C_25_17
BEGIN_
नृ मांस भोजना रौद्रा ये च अन्ये सत्त्व जातयः || २-२५-२०
मा च त्वाम् हिंसिषुः पुत्र मया सम्पूजिताः तु इह |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, son! Let the other ferocious man-eaters belonging to animal-species, being
worshipped by me here, not hurt you."_END

B_2_C_20_51
BEGIN_
यदि हि अकाले मरणम् स्वया इच्चया |
लभेत कश्चित् गुरु दुःख कर्शितः |
गता अहम् अद्य एव परेत संसदम् |
विना त्वया धेनुर् इव आत्मजेन वै || २-२०-५३_END
BEGIN_
"If a man in great distress can get premature death out of his own will, I being
separated from you ,would have attain the glory of the dead now itself like cow without the
calf."_END

B_2_C_24_26
BEGIN_
एवम् कालम् प्रतीक्षस्व मम आगमन कान्क्षिणी || २-२४-२९
प्राप्स्यसे परमम् कामम् मयि प्रत्यागते सति |_END
BEGIN_
"Look forward for the time of my return in such a manner with restraint, being
temperate in food and being devoted in the service of your husband."_END

B_2_C_21_44
BEGIN_अनुमन्यस्व माम् देवि गमिष्यन्तम् इतः वनम् |
शापिता असि मम प्राणैः कुरु स्वस्त्ययनानि मे || २-२१-४५_END
BEGIN_"OH, mother! I have decided to go to forest. Please give me permission. I am swearing 
to you on my life. Please invoke blessings on me."_END

B_2_C_27_5
BEGIN_
यदि त्वम् प्रस्थितः दुर्गम् वनम् अद्य एव राघव |
अग्रतः ते गमिष्यामि मृद्नन्ती कुश कण्टकान् || २-२७-६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! If you set forth now itself to the forest, which is difficult to be
travelled, I shall come before you, by trampling down thorns and grass with long pointed
stalks."_END

B_2_C_26_11
BEGIN_
न ते क्षौद्रम् च दधि च ब्राह्मणा वेद पारगाः |
मूर्ध्नि मूर्ध अवसिक्तस्य दधति स्म विधानतः || २-२६-१३_END
BEGIN_
Nor brahmanas who are well-versed in Vedas, have not placed , as per prescribed
Rites , honey and curds on your head after you had taken the head -bath_END

B_2_C_23_32
BEGIN_
बहुभिः च एकम् अत्यस्यन्न् एकेन च बहून् जनान् |
विनियोक्ष्याम्य् अहम् बाणान् नृ वाजि गज मर्मसु || २-२३-३६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Lord! Today, the strength of my excellent arrows is capable of making you
sovereign and making Dasaratha devoid of power."_END

B_2_C_25_18
BEGIN_
आगमाः ते शिवाः सन्तु सिध्यन्तु च पराक्रमाः || २-२५-२१
सर्व सम्पत्तयो राम स्वस्तिमान् गच्च पुत्रक |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama, my son! May your path-ways be propitious ! Let your valour be powerful!
Go well with all accomplishments!._END

B_2_C_20_52
BEGIN_
अथापि किम् जीवित मद्य मे वृथा |
त्वया विना च्न्द्रनिभाननप्रभ |
अनुव्रजिष्यामि वनम् त्वयैव गौः |
सुदुर्बला वत्समिवानुकाङ्क्षया || २-२०-५४_END
BEGIN_
"Moreover, what is the use of life? Oh, Rama! With your brilliant face shining like
moon! My life is useless without you. I shall accompany you to the forest like a weak cow going
behind it's calf"_END

B_2_C_24_27
BEGIN_
प्राप्स्यसे परमम् कामम् मयि प्रत्यागते सति || २-२४-३०
यदि धर्मभ्ऱ्ताम् श्रेष्ठो धारयिष्यति जीवितम् |_END
BEGIN_
"After my return, your best desire will be fulfilled if our father the best among
protectors of righteousness ,is still alive till then."_END

B_2_C_21_45
BEGIN_तीर्ण प्रतिज्ञः च वनात् पुनर् एष्याम्य् अहम् पुरीम् |
ययातिरिव राजर्षिः पुरा हित्वा पुनर्धिवम् || २-२१-४६_END
BEGIN_"As sage king named Yayati in olden times left the heaven and reached back heaven again, 
I shall be back to the city from the forest, after fulfilling my promise."_END

B_2_C_27_6
BEGIN_
ईर्ष्या रोषौ बहिष् कृत्य भुक्त शेषम् इव उदकम् |
नय माम् वीर विश्रब्धः पापम् मयि न विद्यते || २-२७-७_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, brave man! By abandoning, as water left over after drinking, the impatience and
anger and having faith, take me. There is no sin in me."_END

B_2_C_26_12
BEGIN_
न त्वाम् प्रकृतयः सर्वा श्रेणी मुख्याः च भूषिताः |
अनुव्रजितुम् इच्चन्ति पौर जापपदाः तथा || २-२६-१४_END
BEGIN_
All ministers, chiefs of Associations, citizens and country-folk, duly decked with
ornaments, are not inclined to go along with you._END

B_2_C_23_33
BEGIN_
अद्य मे अस्त्र प्रभावस्य प्रभावः प्रभविष्यति |
राज्ञः च अप्रभुताम् कर्तुम् प्रभुत्वम् च तव प्रभो || २-२३-३७_END
BEGIN_
" Oh, Lord Rama! Today the effect of my weapons will remove the power from the king
Dasaratha and give the lordship to you."_END

B_2_C_25_19
BEGIN_
स्वस्ति ते अस्तु आन्तरिक्षेभ्यः पार्थिवेभ्यः पुनः पुनः || २-२५-२२
सर्वेभ्यः चैव देवेभ्यो ये च ते परिपन्थिनः |_END
BEGIN_
"Let there be security to you against those dwelling in the atmosphere and on the
earth as well as against all the celestials as also your enemies."_END

B_2_C_24_28
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्ता तु रामेण बाष्प पर्याकुल ईक्षणा || २-२४-३१
कौसल्या पुत्र शोक आर्ता रामम् वचनम् अब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Kausalya who was afflicted with grief over her son, was with eyes full of tears
after hearing Rama's utterances and spoke thus to Rama._END

B_2_C_20_53
BEGIN_
भृशम् असुखम् अमर्षिता तदा |
बहु विललाप समीक्ष्य राघवम् |
व्यसनम् उपनिशाम्य सा महत् |
सुतम् इव बद्धम् अवेक्ष्य किम्नरी || २-२०-५५_END
BEGIN_
Then, that Kausalya looked at Rama to whom a great calamity has occurred, saw her
son bound by grief and lamented very much in various ways like a kinnara woman._END

B_2_C_21_46
BEGIN_शोकस्संधार्यताम् मातर्हृदये साधु मा शुचः |
वनवासादिहैष्यामि पुनः कृत्वा पितुर्वचः || २-२१-४७_END
BEGIN_"Oh, mother! Please do not grieve, Bear it well in your heart. I shall come back here 
again from the forest after fulfilling the father's command."_END

B_2_C_27_7
BEGIN_
प्रासाद अग्रैः विमानैः वा वैहायस गतेन वा |
सर्व अवस्था गता भर्तुः पादच् चाया विशिष्यते || २-२७-८_END
BEGIN_
"Protection under the feet of the husband is better than being on top of a lofty
building or in aerial cars or in moving through the sky or in attaining all types of
positions."_END

B_2_C_26_13
BEGIN_
चतुर्भिर् वेग सम्पन्नैः हयैः कान्चन भूषणैः |
मुख्यः पुष्य रथो युक्तः किम् न गच्चति ते अग्रतः || २-२६-१५_END
BEGIN_
Why the main carriage used for travelling and pleasure, tied with four horses decked
with gold ornaments and with excellent speed does not go ahead of you ?_END

B_2_C_23_34
BEGIN_
अद्य चन्दन सारस्य केयूरा मोक्षणस्य च |
वसूनाम् च विमोक्षस्य सुह्ऱ्दाम् पालनस्य च || २-२३-३८
अनुरूपाव् इमौ बाहू राम कर्म करिष्यतः |
अभिषेचन विघ्नस्य कर्तृउणाम् ते निवारणे || २-२३-३९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! These arms worthy of wearing sandalwood essence and bracelets; for
bestowing riches and for protection of friends can today do every action to prevent the agents who
want to obstruct your coronation."_END

B_2_C_25_20
BEGIN_
गुरुः सोमश्च सूर्यश्च धनदोऽथ यमस्तथा || २-२५-२३
पान्तु त्वामर्चिता राम! दण्डकारण्यवासिनम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! May Venus and the moon as also the sun and Kubera (the god of wealth) and
Yama (the god of death) who are being worshipped by me, protect you, while you reside in the forest
of Dandaka"_END

B_2_C_24_29
BEGIN_
गमने सुकृताम् बुद्धिम् न ते शक्नोमि पुत्रक || २-२४-३२
विनिवर्तयितुम् वीर नूनम् कालो दुरत्ययः |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Brave son! I am not able to avert your well-made resolution, in the matter of
your going to forest. Time is inscrutable .It is certain."_END

B_2_C_21_47
BEGIN_त्वया मया च वैदेह्या लक्ष्मणेन सुमित्रया |
पितुर्नियोगे स्थातव्यमेष धर्मः सनाअनः || २-२१-४८_END
BEGIN_"You and I, Sita, Lakshmana, Sumintra and all of us should follow father's directions. 
This is an eternal custom."_END

B_2_C_27_8
BEGIN_
अनुशिष्टा अस्मि मात्रा च पित्रा च विविध आश्रयम् |
न अस्मि सम्प्रति वक्तव्या वर्तितव्यम् यथा मया || २-२७-९_END
BEGIN_
"My mother and father taught me of different matters long ago. I need not be told
now, how to deal in any way with anyone."_END

B_2_C_26_14
BEGIN_
न हस्ती च अग्रतः श्रीमांस् तव लक्षण पूजितः |
प्रयाणे लक्ष्यते वीर कृष्ण मेघ गिरि प्रभः || २-२६-१६_END
BEGIN_
Oh, valiant prince! A glorious elephant which is worshipped for its good
characteristics, resembling a mountain crowned with a dark cloud is not seen ahead in your
journey._END

B_2_C_23_35
BEGIN_
ब्रवीहि को अद्य एव मया वियुज्यताम् |
तव असुह्ऱ्द् प्राण यशः सुह्ऱ्ज् जनैः |
यथा तव इयम् वसुधा वशे भवेत् |
तथा एव माम् शाधि तव अस्मि किम्करः || २-२३-४०_END
BEGIN_
"Tell me now itself who your enemy be made deprived of life, honour and friendship,
by me. Command me so that how this earth will become your dominion. I am your servant._END

B_2_C_25_21
BEGIN_
अग्निर्वायुस्तथा धूमोमन्त्राश्चर्षिमुखाच्च्युताः || २-२५-२४
उपस्पर्शनकाले तु पान्तु त्वाम् रघुन्ददन |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! May sacred hymns coming forth from fire, air , vapour, and from the mouth
of singer of sacred hymns protect you at the time of taking bath."_END

B_2_C_24_30
BEGIN_
गच्च पुत्र त्वम् एक अग्रः भद्रम् ते अस्तु सदा विभो || २-२४-३३
पुनस्त्वयि निवृत्ते तु भविष्यामि गतक्लमा |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, son! You go undisturbed. Let there be auspiciousness always to you .I shall
become refreshed, when you return again."_END

B_2_C_21_48
BEGIN_अम्ब सम्हृत्य सम्भारान् दुःखम् हृदि निगृह्य च |
वनवासकृता बुद्धिर्मम धर्म्यानुवर्त्यताम् || २-२१-४९_END
BEGIN_"Oh mother! Please approve my righteous intention of going to the forest, duly withdrawing 
preparations for my coronation and keeping in check the sorrow in your heart."_END

B_2_C_27_9
BEGIN_
अहम् दुर्गम् गमिष्यामि वनम् पुरुषवर्जितम् |
नानामृगगणाकीर्णम् शार्दूलवृकसेवितम् || २-२७-१०_END
BEGIN_
" I can come to forest which is inaccessible, which is devoid of people, filled with
various types of animals and inhaited by tigers and jackals."_END

B_2_C_26_15
BEGIN_
न च कान्चन चित्रम् ते पश्यामि प्रिय दर्शन |
भद्र आसनम् पुरः कृत्य यान्तम् वीर पुरह्सरम् || २-२६-१७_END
BEGIN_
Oh, brave man pleasant with the sight! I do not see marching before you an elephant
having been placed in front with an excellent seat embroidered in gold meant for you_END

B_2_C_23_36
BEGIN_
विम्ऱ्ज्य बाष्पम् परिसान्त्व्य च असकृत् |
स लक्ष्मणम् राघव वंश वर्धनः |
उवाच पित्र्ये वचने व्यवस्थितम् |
निबोध माम् एष हि सौम्य सत् पथः || २-२३-४१_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama spoke thus to Lakshmana after consoling him time and again by weeping off
his tears; "Oh, Lakshmana! I stand by the words of our father. This indeed is a good path."_END

B_2_C_25_22
BEGIN_
सर्व लोक प्रभुर् ब्रह्मा भूत भर्ता तथा ऋषयः || २-२५-२५
ये च शेषाः सुराः ते त्वाम् रक्षन्तु वन वासिनम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Let Siva, the lord of all spheres, Brahma, the lord of creation, Vishnu, the
nourisher of beings, the sages and the rest of the celestials may protect you dwelling in the
forest._END

B_2_C_24_31
BEGIN_
प्रत्यागते महाभागे कृतार्थे चरितव्रते || २-२४-३४
पितुरानृण्यताम् प्राप्तेत्वयि लप्स्ये परम् सुखम् |_END
BEGIN_
"You, the illustrious after accomplishing a purpose, having observed a vow and
having attained freedom from debt to your father, after having come again, I shall get great
happiness"._END

B_2_C_21_49
BEGIN_एतद्वच स्तस्य निशम्य माता |
सुधर्म्यमव्यग्रमविक्लबम् च |
मृतेव सम्ज्ञाम् प्रतिलभ्य देवी |
समीक्ष्य रामम् पुनरित्युवाच || २-२१-५०_END
BEGIN_The mother Kausalya heard the most virtuous, cool and steady words of Rama and rose, 
as though regained consciousness once more after death, looked at Rama and spoke thus again._END

B_2_C_27_10
BEGIN_
सुखम् वने निवत्स्यामि यथा एव भवने पितुः |
अचिन्तयन्ती त्रीम्ल् लोकामः चिन्तयन्ती पति व्रतम् || २-२७-११_END
BEGIN_
"Not thinking of three world, thinking of loyalty to husband, I shall dwell in the
forest happily as though staying in our father's house"._END

B_2_C_26_16
BEGIN_
अभिषेको यदा सज्जः किम् इदानीम् इदम् तव |
अपूर्वो मुख वर्णः च न प्रहर्षः च लक्ष्यते || २-२६-१८_END
BEGIN_
While coronation is getting ready now, the colour of your face is appearing strange.
Even happiness is not being seen (in you). Why is it?_END

B_2_C_25_23
BEGIN_
इति माल्यैः सुर गणान् गन्धैः च अपि यशस्विनी || २-२५-२६
स्तुतिभिः च अनुरूपाभिर् आनर्च आयत लोचना |_END
BEGIN_
Uttering thus, the illustrious Kausalya having large eyes, worshipped troops of
divinities with garlands , sandal paste and befitting hymns of praise._END

B_2_C_24_32
BEGIN_
कृतान्तस्य गतिः पुत्र दुर्विभाव्या सदा भुवि || २-२४-३५
यस्त्वा संचोदयति मे वच आच्चिद्य राघव |_END
BEGIN_
"The path of the destiny, which extinguishes my words and impels you to go to the
forest ,is ever not imaginable on this earth"_END

B_2_C_21_50
BEGIN_यथैव ते पुत्र पिता तथाहम् |
गुरुः स्वधर्मेण सुहृत्तया च |
न त्वानुजानामि न मांविहाय |
सुदुःखितामर्हसि गन्तुमेवम् || २-२१-५१_END
BEGIN_"Oh, son! I am also as respectable a person to you as your father, in my own right and 
due to great affection. I do not give permission to you. You cannot thus go away, leaving me in great 
sorrow."_END

B_2_C_27_11
BEGIN_
शुश्रूषमाणा ते नित्यम् नियता ब्रह्म चारिणी |
सह रंस्ये त्वया वीर वनेषु मधु गन्धिषु || २-२७-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, brave man! performing service to you regularly, having the necessary
discipline, observing chastity, I would like to stay with you in the forests which smell like
honey."_END

B_2_C_26_17
BEGIN_
इति इव विलपन्तीम् ताम् प्रोवाच रघु नन्दनः |
सीते तत्रभवांस् तात प्रव्राजयति माम् वनम् || २-२६-१९_END
BEGIN_
Rama spoke thus to Sita, who is lamenting : Oh, Sita! My venerable father is sending
me to a forest in exile._END

B_2_C_25_24
BEGIN_
ज्वलनम् समुपादाय ब्राह्मणेन महात्मना || २-२५-२७
हावयामास विधिना राममङ्गलकारणात् |_END
BEGIN_
Duly procuring fire, she caused oblation to be poured into it, as per the direction
of a high souled brahmana for the purpose of Rama's well- being ._END

B_2_C_24_33
BEGIN_
गच्छेदानीम् महाबाहो क्षेमेण पुनरागतः || २-२४-३६
नन्दयिष्यसि माम् पुत्रः साम्ना वाक्येन चारुणा |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama the valiant !Go just now and come again safely, when you will rejoice me
with your pleasing and tranquillising words ."_END

B_2_C_21_51
BEGIN_किम् जीवितेनेह विना त्वया मे |
लोकेन वा किम् स्वधयाऽमृतेन |
श्रेयो मुहूर्तम् तव सन्निधानम् |
ममेह कृत्स्नादपि जीवलोकात् || २-२१-५२_END
BEGIN_"What is the use of my living in this world without you? What is the use of the other 
world or the oblation of food offered to the deceased ancestors or the nectar of immortality? Your proximity 
even for a moment is better than that of the entire world of living beings."_END

B_2_C_27_12
BEGIN_
त्वम् हि कर्तुम् वने शक्तः राम सम्परिपालनम् |
अन्यस्य पै जनस्य इह किम् पुनर् मम मानद || २-२७-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama, the bestower of honour! Here in the forest, you are indeed capable of
protecting other people also. Why to tell about my protection?"_END

B_2_C_26_18
BEGIN_
कुले महति सम्भूते धर्मज्ञे धर्म चारिणि |
शृणु जानकि येन इदम् क्रमेण अभ्यागतम् मम || २-२६-२०_END
BEGIN_
Oh, Sita ! You are born in a great family. You know what is Right and practise
virtue . hear me in what sequence it happened to me_END

B_2_C_25_25
BEGIN_
घृतम् श्वेतानि माल्यानि समिधः श्वेतसर्षपान् || २-२५-२८
उपसम्पादयामास कौसल्या पमाङ्गना |_END
BEGIN_
Kausalya, the excellent woman procured clarified butter , white garlands, ceremonial
sticks and white mustard seeds._END

B_2_C_24_34
BEGIN_
अपीदानीम् स कालः स्स्याद्वनात्प्रत्यागतम् पुनः || २-२४-३७
यत्त्वाम् पुत्रकः पश्येयम् जटावल्कधारिणम् |_END
BEGIN_
"How good it will be, if today itself is the day of your returning from the forest,
wearing twisted hair and garment made of bark."_END

B_2_C_21_52
BEGIN_नरैरिवोल्काभिरपोह्यमानो |
महागजोऽध्वानमनुप्रविष्टः |
भूयः प्रजज्वाल विलापमेवम् |
निशम्य रामः करुणम् जनन्या || २-२१-५३_END
BEGIN_After hearing the pathetic lamentation of his mother, he was highly anguished, as when 
an elephant is removed highly from its way by men with flames of fire._END

B_2_C_27_13
BEGIN_
सह त्वया गमिश्यामि वसमद्य न संशयः |
नाहम् शक्या महाभाग निवर्तयितु मुद्यता || २-२७१४_END
BEGIN_
"Today no doubt, I will come to forest along with you. Oh, the illustrious! I, with
this intention, cannot be prevented to do so."_END

B_2_C_26_19
BEGIN_
राज्ञा सत्य प्रतिज्ञेन पित्रा दशरथेन मे |
कैकेय्यै प्रीत मनसा पुरा दत्तौ महा वरौ || २-२६-२१_END
BEGIN_
Two great boons were given to my mother Kaikeyi long ago , by my father Dasaratha
who is true to a promise._END

B_2_C_25_26
BEGIN_
उपाध्यायः स विधिना हुत्व शान्तिमनामयम् || २-२५-२९
हुतहव्यावशेषेण बाह्यम् बलिमकल्पयत् |_END
BEGIN_
That preceptor performed ceremony for peace as per the statute as well as without
error and carried out propitiatory oblation externally with the remaining sacrificial food left
after the main offering ._END

B_2_C_24_35
BEGIN_
तथा हि रामम् वन वास निश्चितम् |
ददर्श देवी परमेण चेतसा |
उवाच रामम् शुभ लक्षणम् वचो|
बभूव च स्वस्त्ययन अभिकान्क्षिणी || २-२४-३८_END
BEGIN_
"The queen kausalya thus saw Rama who decided to go to forest .She spoke these words
with most excellent mind to Rama having auspicious qualities, being desirous of averting evil by
recitation of auspicious words."_END

B_2_C_21_53
BEGIN_स मातरम् चैव विसम्ज्ञकल्पा |
मार्तम् च सौमित्रि मभिप्रतप्तम् |
धर्मे स्थितो धर्म्यमुवाच वाक्यम् |
यथा स एवार्हति तत्र वक्तुम् || २-२१-५४_END
BEGIN_Rama, who was established in righteousness, spoke these words endowed with virtue, to 
his mother who was looking unconscious and to Lakshmana who was disturbed and exhausted with distress. 
He was the only person worthy of speaking thus at that time._END

B_2_C_27_14
BEGIN_
फल मूल अशना नित्यम् भविष्यामि न संशयः |
न ते दुह्खम् करिष्यामि निवसन्ती सह त्वया || २-२७-१५_END
BEGIN_
I shall live only on roots and fruits always, no doubt. Living along with you, I
shall not create any unpleasantness to you._END

B_2_C_26_20
BEGIN_
तया अद्य मम सज्जे अस्मिन्न् अभिषेके नृप उद्यते |
प्रचोदितः स समयो धर्मेण प्रतिनिर्जितः || २-२६-२२_END
BEGIN_
Now that the arrangements initiated by the king for my coronation are getting ready
, Kaikeyi came out with that promise of boons, turning the situation to her own advantage by
grounds of morality_END

B_2_C_25_27
BEGIN_
मधुदद्यक्षतघृतैः स्वस्तिवाच्य द्विजाम् स्ततः || २-२५-३०
वाचयामास रामस्य वने स्वस्त्ययनक्रियाः |_END
BEGIN_
She then got brahmanas to pronounce blessings with honey, curd , unbroken grains of
rice and clarified butter by the repetition of certain hymns and to utter prayers for the well -
being of Rama in the forest._END

B_2_C_21_54
BEGIN_अहम् हि ते लक्ष्मण नित्यमेव |
जानामि भक्तिम् च पराक्रमम् च |
मम त्वभिप्राय मसन्निरीक्ष्य |
मात्रा सहाभ्यर्दसि मा सुदुःखम् || २-२१-५५_END
BEGIN_"Oh, Lakshmana! I always know your devotion towards me as well as your strength. But 
now, you are joining with mother in afflicting much trouble to me without looking at my opinion."_END

B_2_C_27_15
BEGIN_
इच्चामि सरितः शैलान् पल्वलानि वनानि च |
द्रष्टुम् सर्वत्र निर्भीता त्वया नाथेन धीमता || २-२७-१६_END
BEGIN_
" With you the learned and the lord, I shall not have fear anywhere. I wish to see
rivers, mountains, small lakes and grooves."_END

B_2_C_26_21
BEGIN_
चतुर्दश हि वर्षाणि वस्तव्यम् दण्डके मया |
पित्रा मे भरतः च अपि यौवराज्ये नियोजितः || २-२६-२३_END
BEGIN_
I have to dwell in Dandaka forest for fourteen years .Bharata is being appointed as
prince by my father_END

B_2_C_25_28
BEGIN_
ततस्तन्मै द्विजेन्द्राय राममाता यशस्विनी || २-२५-३१
दक्षिणाम् प्रददौ काम्याम् राघवम् चेदमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
The illustrious Kausalya gave the desired fee to that chief of brahmanas and spoke
as follows to Rama:-_END

B_2_C_21_55
BEGIN_धर्मार्थकामाः खलु तात लोके |
समीक्षिता धर्मफलोदयेषु |
ते तत्र सर्वे स्युरसंशयम् मे |
भार्येव वश्याभिमता सुपुत्रा || २-२१-५६_END
BEGIN_"Oh, Lakshmana! In obtaining the fruit of good works in the world, righteousness utility 
and free will are being considered. As a wife who is obedient, who is beloved and who is having good 
sons, good work yields all these three things."_END

B_2_C_27_16
BEGIN_
हंस कारण्डव आकीर्णाः पद्मिनीः साधु पुष्पिताः |
इच्चेयम् सुखिनी द्रष्टुम् त्वया वीरेण सम्गता || २-२७-१७_END
BEGIN_
I shall be comfortable, by coming together with you, the courageous man. I desire to
see lotus- ponds filled with swans, water-fowls and excellently flowered._END

B_2_C_26_22
BEGIN_
सो अहम् त्वाम् आगतः द्रष्टुम् प्रस्थितः विजनम् वनम् |
भरतस्य समीपे ते न अहम् कथ्यः कदाचन || २-२६-२४
ऋद्धि युक्ता हि पुरुषा न सहन्ते पर स्तवम् |
तस्मान् न ते गुणाः कथ्या भरतस्य अग्रतः मम || २-२६-२५_END
BEGIN_
Before setting forth to the lonely forest, I came to see you. I should not be
praised at any time in the presence of Bharata . Men endowed with power and fortune indeed do not
tolerate praise of others . Therefore, my virtues should not be extolled by you in front of
Bharata._END

B_2_C_25_29
BEGIN_
यन् मन्गलम् सहस्र अक्षे सर्व देव नमः कृते || २-२५-३२
वृत्र नाशे समभवत् तत् ते भवतु मन्गलम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Which felicity occurred in Devendra the thousand- eyed, adored by all celestials
when a demon called Vritta was destroyed, let that felicity occur to you"_END

B_2_C_21_56
BEGIN_यस्मिंस्तु सर्वे स्युरसन्निविष्टा |
धर्मो यतः स्यात् तदुपक्रमेत |
द्वेष्यो भवत्यर्थपरो हि लोके |
कामात्मता खल्वपि न प्रशस्ता || २-२१-५७_END
BEGIN_"Only such an action, which is righteous, is to be initiated, leaving that in which wealth, 
desire and righteousness do not come together. One who is intested in wealth alone becomes indeed fit 
to be hated in the world. So also the one whose very essence is desire, cannot indeed be considered 
good._END

B_2_C_27_17
BEGIN_
अभिषेकम् करिष्यामि तासु नित्यम् यतव्रता |
सह त्वया विशाल अक्ष रंस्ये परम नन्दिनी || २-२७-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, the large eyed lord! Remaining dedicated to you, I shall take bath regularly in
those lakes and with full of joy, I shall sport with you."_END

B_2_C_26_23
BEGIN_
न अपि त्वम् तेन भर्तव्या विशेषेण कदाचन
अनुकूलतया शक्यम् समीपे तस्य वर्तितुम् || २-२६-२६_END
BEGIN_
You need not be attended in a special manner at any time by him. You can stay
familiar to him, by behaving with him conformably._END

B_2_C_25_30
BEGIN_
यन् मन्गलम् सुपर्णस्य विनता अकल्पयत् पुरा || २-२५-३३
अमृतम् प्रार्थयानस्य तत् ते भवतु मन्गलम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Which blessing was invoked by Vinata to Garuda who was setting off to bring nectar
in the past , may that blessing happen to you."_END

B_2_C_21_57
BEGIN_गुरुश्च राजा च पिता च वृद्धः |
क्रोधात्प्रहर्ष द्यदि वापि कामात् |
यद्व्यादिशेत् कार्यमवेक्ष्य धर्मम् |
कस्तन्न कुर्यादनृदनृशंसवृत्तिः || २-२१-५८_END
BEGIN_"When father, who is venerable, a king and old-aged, commands an action either by anger 
or by extreme joy or by even desire, which right person will not perform it? Only a person who chooses 
to be cruel will not do it."_END

B_2_C_27_18
BEGIN_
एवम् वर्ष सहस्राणाम् शतम् वा अहम् त्वया सह |
व्यतिक्रमम् न वेत्स्यामि स्वर्गोऽपि हि न मे मतः || २-२७-१९_END
BEGIN_
Thus spending even a hundred thousand years in your company I shall never find any
deviation/ Heaven also will not be acceptable to me otherwise._END

B_2_C_26_24
BEGIN_
तस्मै दत्तम् नृवतिना यौवराज्यम् सनातनम् |
स प्रसाद्यस्त्वया सीते नृपतिश्च विशेषतः || २-२६-२७_END
BEGIN_
The princely kingdom is given to him by the king permanently. Oh, Sita ! He is fit
to be rendered gracious by you, more so the king Dasaratha_END

B_2_C_25_31
BEGIN_
अमृतोत्पादने दैत्यान् घ्नतो वज्रधरस्य यत् || २-२५-३४
अदितिर्मङ्गळम् प्रादात् तत्ते भवतु मङ्गळम् |_END
BEGIN_
"While blessing was bestowed on Devendra, the wielder of the thunderbolt , killing
the demons at the time of producing nectar, let that blessing come to you "_END

B_2_C_21_58
BEGIN_सवै न शक्नोमि पितुः प्रतिज्ञा |
मिमामकर्तुम् सकलम् यथावत् |
स ह्यवयोस्तत गुरुर्नियोगे |
देवाश्च भर्ता स गतिस्स धर्मः || २-२१-५९_END
BEGIN_"I cannot avoid fulfilling the father's command completely. For both of us, he is an 
important person indeed to command us. To mother Kausalya also, he is the husband, the resource person 
and the personified law."_END

B_2_C_27_19
BEGIN_
स्वर्गे अपि च विना वासो भविता यदि राघव |
त्वया मम नर व्याघ्र न अहम् तम् अपि रोचये || २-२७-२०_END
BEGIN_
