Oh, Lion among men and seion of Raghu! Even if in heaven there is residence for me
without you, I do not like it._END

B_2_C_26_25
BEGIN_
अहम् च अपि प्रतिज्ञाम् ताम् गुरोह् समनुपालयन् |
वनम् अद्य एव यास्यामि स्थिरा भव मनस्विनि || २-२६-२८_END
BEGIN_
Keeping up the pledge of my father, today itself. Oh, Sita of magnanimous mind!
Remain firm._END

B_2_C_25_32
BEGIN_
तीन्विक्रमान् प्रकमतो विष्णोरमिततेजसः || २-२५-३५
यदासीन्मङ्गळम् प्रादात् तत्ते भवतु मङ्गळम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! Which good fortune occurred to Vishnu who was immensely glorious while
making his three strides (in order to measure the three worlds), let that good fortune come to
you_END

B_2_C_21_59
BEGIN_तस्मिन् पुनर्जीवति धर्मराजे |
विशेषतः स्वे पथि वर्तमाने |
देवी मया सार्थमितोऽपगच्छेत् |
कथम् स्विदन्या विधवेव नारी || २-२१-६०_END
BEGIN_"while the righteous king Dasaratha is alive and especially when he is following his 
own righteous path, how the mother Kausalya can go out with me from here leaving the city like other 
widowed woman?"_END

B_2_C_26_26
BEGIN_
याते च मयि कल्याणि वनम् मुनि निषेवितम् |
व्रत उपवास रतया भवितव्यम् त्वया अनघे || २-२६-२९_END
BEGIN_
Oh, Sita the good and faultless lady ! After I leave for the forest frequented by
the sages, you can become interested in religious vows and fastings._END

B_2_C_27_20
BEGIN_
अहम् गमिष्यामि वनम् सुदुर्गमम् |
मृग आयुतम् वानर वारणैः युतम् |
वने निवत्स्यामि यथा पितुर् गृहे |
तव एव पादाव् उपगृह्य सम्मता || २-२७-२१_END
BEGIN_
I shall proceed to the forest, which is very much inaccessible and occupied by
monkeys, elephants as well as other animals. Clining to your feet alone, I shall dwell in the
forest as though in father's home._END

B_2_C_25_33
BEGIN_
ऋतवः सागरा द्वीपा वेदा लोका दिश्श्चते || २-२५-३६
मम्गळानि महाबाहो दिशन्तु शुभवङ्गळाः |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama, the mighty armed! May the seasons , oceans , Dvipas (principal division
of earth girdled by oceans ), vedas, various spheres and quarters confer blessings with good luck
to you."_END

B_2_C_21_60
BEGIN_सा मानुमन्यस्व वनम् व्रजन्तम् |
कुरुष्व नः स्वस्त्ययनानि देवि |
यथा समाप्ते पुनराव्रजेयम् |
यथा हि स्त्येन पुनर्ययातिः || २-२१-६१_END
BEGIN_"Oh, mother the queen! Permit me to go to forest. As Yayati returned to heaven by the 
power of truth, give me your power of blessings so that I can return here after completion of exile."_END

B_2_C_27_21
BEGIN_
अनन्य भावाम् अनुरक्त चेतसम् |
त्वया वियुक्ताम् मरणाय निश्चिताम् |
नयस्व माम् साधु कुरुष्व याचनाम् |
न ते मया अतः गुरुता भविष्यति || २-२७-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Therefore, grant well my prayer and usher me- me without any other thought, whose
mind is fondly attached to you and who am determined to die if separated from you. Due to this,
there will be no burden to you from me."_END

B_2_C_26_27
BEGIN_
काल्यम् उत्थाय देवानाम् कृत्वा पूजाम् यथा विधि |
वन्दितव्यो दशरथः पिता मम नर ईश्वरः || २-२६-३०_END
BEGIN_
You can rise up in dawn , perform worship of the deities as per precept and do
salutation to my father , king Dasaratha._END

B_2_C_25_34
BEGIN_
इति पुत्रस्य शेषाश्च कृत्वा शिरसि भामिनी || २-२५-३७
गन्दांश्चापि समालभ्य राममायतलो चना |
ओषधीम् च अपि सिद्ध अर्थाम् विशल्य करणीम् शुभाम् || २-२५-३८
चकार रक्षाम् कौसल्या मन्त्रैः अभिजजाप च |_END
BEGIN_
saying so, Kausalya, the large eyed proud woman placed some unbroken rice grains on
her son's head, smeared varieties of sandal pastes over his body, fastened about his wrist by way
of an amulet, a herb called Visalyakarani(so called because it helps in painlessly extracting an
arrow stuck into one's body )which is efficacious and auspicious and muttered sacred hymns in order
to enhance its virtue._END

B_2_C_21_61
BEGIN_यशो ह्यहम् केवलराज्यकारणात् |
न पृष्ठतः कर्तुमलम् महोदयम् |
अदीर्घकाले न तु देवि जीविते |
वृणेऽवरामद्य महीमधर्मतः || २-२१-६२_END
BEGIN_"I cannot keep back reputation and glory for the sake of kingdom alone. This cannot unrighteously 
long for this inferior kingdom."_END

B_2_C_26_28
BEGIN_
माता च मम कौसल्या वृद्धा सम्ताप कर्शिता |
धर्मम् एव अग्रतः कृत्वा त्वत्तः सम्मानम् अर्हति || २-२६-३१_END
BEGIN_
Keeping in front of righteousness alone, you have to respect the aged Kausalya, my
mother who is getting emaciated by grief._END

B_2_C_27_22
BEGIN_
तथा ब्रुवाणाम् अपि धर्म वत्सलो |
न च स्म सीताम् नृ वरः निनीषति |
उवाच च एनाम् बहु सम्निवर्तने |
वने निवासस्य च दुह्खिताम् प्रति || २-२७-२३_END
BEGIN_
sita along with him eventhought she was speaking as a foresaid. To hold her back
from coming to forest, he also started talking highly of the various afflictions she might have to
face in a forest._END

B_2_C_25_35
BEGIN_
उवाचातिप्रहृष्टेव सा दुःखवशर्तिनी || २-२५-३९
वाङ्मात्रेण न भावेन वाचा संसज्जमानया |_END
BEGIN_
Though filled with grief inside, she appeared to be over-joyed outside and with
faltering words , spoke thus with only mouth and not with her heart._END

B_2_C_21_62
BEGIN_प्रसादयन् नर वृषभः स मातरम् |
पराक्रमाज्जिगमिषुरेव दोम्डकान् |
अथ अनुजम् भ्ऱ्शम् अनुशास्य दर्शनम् |
चकार ताम् ह्ऱ्दि जननीम् प्रदक्षिणम् || २-२१-६३_END
BEGIN_Rama, the best of men, decided to go to Dandaka forest fearlessly with his prowess, consoled 
his mother, advised his brother by good thoughts and made hearty circumbulatory salutation to his mother._END

B_2_C_26_29
BEGIN_
वन्दितव्याः च ते नित्यम् याः शेषा मम मातरः |
स्नेह प्रणय सम्भोगैः समा हि मम मातरः || २-२६-३२_END
BEGIN_
For me all my mothers are equal in my eyes in point if fondness, love and the way in
which they have looked after me ( in my childhood). Hence the rest of mothers also deserve to be
saluted always by you_END

B_2_C_25_36
BEGIN_
आनम्य मूर्ध्नि च आघ्राय परिष्वज्य यशस्विनी || २-२५-४०
अवदत् पुत्र सिद्ध अर्थो गच्च राम यथा सुखम् |_END
BEGIN_
The illusrious Kausalya embraced Rama, smelling his head by bending it and spoke
these words "Rama, my son! Go with ease with accomplishment of purpose, as you are."_END

B_2_C_25_37
BEGIN_
अरोगम् सर्व सिद्ध अर्थम् अयोध्याम् पुनर् आगतम् || २-२५-४१
पश्यामि त्वाम् सुखम् वत्स सुस्थितम् राज वेश्मनि |_END
BEGIN_
Oh, son! With all your purposes fulfilled and with good health, I shall see you
returning to Ayodhya happily and taking over the reins of the kingdom_END

B_2_C_26_30
BEGIN_
भ्रातृ पुत्र समौ च अपि द्रष्टव्यौ च विशेषतः |
त्वया लक्ष्मण शत्रुघ्नौ प्राणैः प्रियतरौ मम || २-२६-३३_END
BEGIN_
You, in particular, should regard Bharata and Satrughna, as your brothers or
sons._END

B_2_C_26_31
BEGIN_
विप्रियम् न च कर्तव्यम् भरतस्य कदाचन |
स हि राजा प्रभुः चैव देशस्य च कुलस्य च || २-२६-३४_END
BEGIN_
Bharata is indeed king and the master both for the kingdom and for our family .
Hence, you should not do what is displeasing to him at any time._END

B_2_C_25_38
BEGIN_
प्रणष्ठदुःखसंकल्पा हर्षविद्योतितानना || २-२५-४२
द्रक्ष्यामि त्वाम् वनात्र्पाप्तम् पूर्णचन्द्रमिवोदितम् |_END
BEGIN_
"All my thoughts of grief having been expulsed and my face shining with joy, I shall
behold you returning from the forest like the full moon rising from the horizon"_END

B_2_C_26_32
BEGIN_
आराधिता हि शीलेन प्रयत्नैः च उपसेविताः |
राजानः सम्प्रसीदन्ति प्रकुप्यन्ति विपर्यये || २-२६-३५_END
BEGIN_
Kings being pleased by good character and served by exerting one's self become
happy. They get angry if it is to the contrary_END

B_2_C_25_39
BEGIN_
भद्रासनगतम् राम वनवासादिहागतम् || २-२५-४३
द्रक्षामि च पुनस्त्वाम् तु तीर्णवन्तम् पितुर्वचः |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! I shall behold you returning here from your sojourn in the forest, having
fulfilled your father's word and installed on the splendid throne."_END

B_2_C_26_33
BEGIN_
औरसान् अपि पुत्रान् हि त्यजन्ति अहित कारिणः |
समर्थान् सम्प्रगृह्णन्ति जनान् अपि नर अधिपाः || २-२६-३६_END
BEGIN_
Kings abandon even their own sons, if they are antagonistic and accept even other
people if they are fitting_END

B_2_C_28_0
BEGIN_
सएवम् ब्रुवतीम् सीताम् धर्मज्ञो धर्म वत्सलः |
निवर्तन अर्थे धर्म आत्मा वाक्यम् एतत् उवाच ह || २-२८-१_END
BEGIN_
Thinking of difficulties one will be called upon to bear in the forest, Rama who was
fond of righteousness did not form the idea of taking Sita who was speaking as aforesaid._END

B_2_C_25_40
BEGIN_
मङ्गशैरुपसम्पन्नो वनवासादिहागतः || २-२५-४४
पध्वा मम च नित्यम् त्वम् कामान् सम्वर्ध याहि भोः |_END
BEGIN_
"Having come here from your sojourn in the forest, you will be familiar with
auspicious things and will ever be augmenting the desires of my daughter-in-law and of me. Depart
now, Oh, Rama !"_END

B_2_C_28_1
BEGIN_
सान्त्वयित्वा पुनस्ताम् तु बाष्पदूषितलोचनाम् |
निवर्तनार्थे धर्मात्मा वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह || २-२८-२_END
BEGIN_
Soothening with kind words to Sita, when eyes were blemished with tears, the
virtuous Rama spoke again as follows, for the purpose of waking her turn back._END

B_2_C_26_34
BEGIN_
सा त्वम् वसेह कल्याणि राज्ञः समनुवर्तिनी |
भरतस्य रता धर्मे सत्यव्रतपरायणा || २-२६-३७_END
BEGIN_
Oh good lady ! You such dwell here, doing conformably to the will of Bharata the
king, remaining devoted to righteousness and with a vow of truth as you end._END

B_2_C_25_41
BEGIN_
मया अर्चिता देव गणाः शिव आदयो |
महर्षयो भूत महा असुर उरगाः |
अभिप्रयातस्य वनम् चिराय ते|
हितानि कान्क्षन्तु दिशः च राघव || २-२५-४५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! Worshipped by me, let the hosts of gods headed by Siva, the Supreme
Being, the great sages, spirits, the chief of evil spirits, the celestial serpents and the
(four)quarters wish well of you, who is setting forth to forest, "_END

B_2_C_28_2
BEGIN_
सीते महा कुलीना असि धर्मे च निरता सदा |
इह आचर स्वधर्मम् त्वम् मा यथा मनसः सुखम् || २-२८-३_END
BEGIN_
"Sita! Your are born in a high lineage, ever devoted to righteousness. Perform your
own virtue here, which is agreable to my mind."_END

B_2_C_26_35
BEGIN_
अहम् गमिष्यामि महा वनम् प्रिये |
त्वया हि वस्तव्यम् इह एव भामिनि |
यथा व्यलीकम् कुरुषे न कस्यचित् |
तथा त्वया कार्यम् इदम् वचो मम || २-२६-३८_END
BEGIN_
Oh, my dear Sita ! I can go to the great forest. You can stay here only, without
doing harm to any one as it is .Listen to my words_END

B_2_C_25_42
BEGIN_
इति इव च अश्रु प्रतिपूर्ण लोचना|
समाप्य च स्वस्त्ययनम् यथा विधि |
प्रदक्षिणम् चैव चकार राघवम् |
पुनः पुनः च अपि निपीड्य सस्वजे || २-२५-४६_END
BEGIN_
Having so said and having completed the rite of invoking blessings befittingly,
Kausalya whose eyes were overflowing with tears, further went clockwise around Rama and having
pressed close to him, embraced again and again._END

B_2_C_28_3
BEGIN_
सीते यथा त्वाम् वक्ष्यामि तथा कार्यम् त्वया अबले |
वने दोषा हि बहवो वदतः तान् निबोध मे || २-२८-४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh Sita, the delicate! Do whatever I tell you. There are many inconveniencs in the
forest. Know them from me."_END

B_2_C_25_43
BEGIN_
तथा तु देव्या स कृत प्रदक्षिणो |
निपीड्य मातुः चरणौ पुनः पुनः |
जगाम सीता निलयम् महा यशाः |
स राघवः प्रज्वलितः स्वया श्रिया || २-२५-४७_END
BEGIN_
Having been done circumbulation (as a mark of protection) thus by the pious woman
Kausalya, that highly illustrious Rama pressing his mother's feet again and again , shining by his
own splendour, went to Sita's house_END

B_2_C_28_4
BEGIN_
सीते विमुच्यताम् एषा वन वास कृता मतिः |
बहु दोषम् हि कान्तारम् वनम् इति अभिधीयते || २-२८-५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Sita! Let your thought made about forest be given up. It is indeed said that
forest with its wilderness is fraught with many dangers."_END

B_2_C_28_5
BEGIN_
हित बुद्ध्या खलु वचो मया एतत् अभिधीयते |
सदा सुखम् न जानामि दुह्खम् एव सदा वनम् || २-२८-६_END
BEGIN_
This advice is given by me, keeping your welfare in view. I do not ever consider a
forest as comfortable. It is always uncomfortable."_END

B_2_C_28_6
BEGIN_
गिरि निर्झर सम्भूता गिरि कन्दर वासिनाम् |
सिम्हानाम् निनदा दुह्खाः श्रोतुम् दुह्खम् अतः वनम् || २-२८-७_END
BEGIN_
"The sounds created from waterfalls in hills and from lions resding in mountain
caves are unpleasant to hear. That is why living in a forest in uncomfortable."_END

B_2_C_29_0
BEGIN_
एतत् तु वचनम् श्रुत्वा सीता रामस्य दुह्खिता |
प्रसक्त अश्रु मुखी मन्दम् इदम् वचनम् अब्रवीत् || २-२९-१_END
BEGIN_
Seetha was distressed to hear these words of Rama and spoke these words slowly, with
her face with tears._END

B_2_C_28_7
BEGIN_
क्रीडमानाश्च विस्रब्धा मत्ताह् शून्ये महामृगाः |
दृष्ट्वा समभिवर्तन्ते सीते दुःखमतो वनम् || २-२८-८_END
BEGIN_
"Large wild animals which are fearless and intoxicated sporting in the desolate
forest; come forward, after seeing. Oh, Sita! That is why living in forest is uncomfortable."_END

B_2_C_28_8
BEGIN_
सग्राहाः सरितश्चैव पङ्कवत्यश्च दुस्तराः |
मत्तैरपि गजैर्नित्यमतो दुःखतरम् वनम् || २-२८-९_END
BEGIN_
"Even streams filled with crocodiles full of mire are difficult to be crossed by rut
elephants also. Hence dwelling in a forest is always very much uncomfortable._END

B_2_C_29_1
BEGIN_
ये त्वया कीर्तिता दोषा वने वस्तव्यताम् प्रति |
गुणान् इति एव तान् विद्धि तव स्नेह पुरः कृतान् || २-२९-२_END
BEGIN_
"know all those disadvantages you mentioned about dwelling in the forest become
advantages to me, if your affection is placed before them."_END

B_2_C_28_9
BEGIN_
लताकण्टकसम्पूर्णाः कृकवाकूपनादिताः |
निरपाश्च सुदुर्गाश्च मार्गा दुःखमतो वनम् || २-२८-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Pathways covered with creepers and thorns, echoed with noise of wild cocks, are
water-less and very difficult to enter. Hence dwelling in a forest is hardship."_END

B_2_C_29_2
BEGIN_
मृगाः सिम्हा गजाश्चैव शार्दूलाः शरभास्तथा |
पक्षिणः सृमराश्चैव ये चान्ये वनचारिणः || २-२९-३
अदृष्टपूर्वरूपत्वात्सर्वे ते तव राघव |
रूपम् दृष्ट्वापसर्पेयुर्भये सर्वे हि बिभ्यति || २-२९-४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh Rama! Antelopes, lions, elephants, tigers, sarabhas(legendary animal with eight
legs), birds, yaks and all others which roam in the forest, run away after seeing your form, since
they have never seen your figure before. When there is cause for fear, who would not have
fear?"_END

B_2_C_28_10
BEGIN_
सुप्यते पर्ण शय्यासु स्वयम् भग्नासु भू तले |
रात्रिषु श्रम खिन्नेन तस्मात् दुह्खतरम् वनम् || २-२८-११_END
BEGIN_
"One distress by fatigue has to sleep in nights on a bed of fallen leaves. Hence,
living in a forest is very much a misery."_END

B_2_C_29_3
BEGIN_
त्वया च सह गन्तव्यम् मया गुरु जन आज्ञया |
त्वद् वियोगेन मे राम त्यक्तव्यम् इह जीवितम् || २-२९-५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! As per the command of the elders, I also should go along with you. My
life is to be abandoned here, if I were separated from you."_END

B_2_C_28_11
BEGIN_
अहोरात्रम् च सन्तोषः कर्तव्यो नियतात्मना |
फलैर्वृक्षावपतितैः सीते दुःखमतो वनम् || २-२८-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Sita! With mind disciplined day and night, one has to necessarily satisfy
ourself with fruits fallen from trees. Hence, living in a forest is a suffering."_END

B_2_C_29_4
BEGIN_
न च माम् त्वत् समीपस्थम् अपि शक्नोति राघव |
सुराणाम् ईश्वरः शक्रः प्रधर्षयितुम् ओजसा || २-२९-६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh Rama! Even Devendra the Lord of celestials, by his strength, cannot over power
me, who is in your vicinity."_END

B_2_C_28_12
BEGIN_
उपवासः च कर्तव्या यथा प्राणेन मैथिलि |
जटा भारः च कर्तव्यो वल्कल अम्बर धारिणा || २-२८-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Sita the princess of Mithila! Fasting is to be done according to one's stamina.
Clothes of bark are to be worn and mass of matted hair has to be worn on the head."_END

B_2_C_29_5
BEGIN_
पति हीना तु या नारी न सा शक्ष्यति जीवितुम् |
कामम् एवम् विधम् राम त्वया मम विदर्शितम् || २-२९-७_END
BEGIN_
"Oh Rama! Verily such a thing was taught to me by you, that a woman disunited from
her husband should not be able to survive."_END

B_2_C_29_6
BEGIN_
अथ च अपि महा प्राज्ञ ब्राह्मणानाम् मया श्रुतम् |
पुरा पितृ गृहे सत्यम् वस्तव्यम् किल मे वने || २-२९-८_END
BEGIN_
"Oh Rama, the very wise! Besides, formerly in my father's house it was heard by me
from the month of brahmanas that I was destined to stay really in a forest."_END

B_2_C_28_13
BEGIN_
देवतानाम् पितृइणाम् चकर्तव्यम् विधिपूर्वकम् |
प्राप्तानामतिथीनाम् च नित्यशः प्रतिपूजनम् || २-२८-१४_END
BEGIN_
"The celestials, the ancestors, the guests who arrive are to be worshipped always
according to the preseribed rites."_END

B_2_C_29_7
BEGIN_
लक्षणिभ्यो द्विजातिभ्यः श्रुत्वा अहम् वचनम् गृहे |
वन वास कृत उत्साहा नित्यम् एव महा बल || २-२९-९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh Rama the man of great strength! Ever since I heard this word from brahmanas who
can interpret marks on the body, I was always eager to stay in a forest."_END

B_2_C_28_14
BEGIN_
कार्यस्त्रीरभिषेकश्च काले काले च नित्यशः |
चरता नियमेनैव तस्माद्दुःखतरम् वनम् || २-२८-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Bath is to be performed three times a day at appropriate time by the one moving in
the forest, with one's mind kept in restraint. Hence, living in a forest is very much a
misery."_END

B_2_C_29_8
BEGIN_
आदेशो वन वासस्य प्राप्तव्यः स मया किल |
सा त्वया सह तत्र अहम् यास्यामि प्रिय न अन्यथा || २-२९-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama the beloved! That prediction of dwelling in the forst is to be realised by
me. I must accordingly accompany you to the forest, it cannot be otherwise."_END

B_2_C_28_15
BEGIN_
उपहारश्च कर्तव्यः कुसुमैः स्वयमाहृतैः |
आर्षेण विधिना वेद्याम् बाले दुःखमतो वनम् || २-२८-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Sita the innocent! Offering is to be done with flowers brought by one's own
self at the altar, according to the rites prescribed by sages. Hence, living in a forest is a
hardship."_END

B_2_C_28_16
BEGIN_
यथालब्धेन कर्तव्यः सन्तोष्स्तेन मैथिलि |
यताहारैर्वनचरैः सीते दुःखमतो वनम् || २-२८-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Sita the princess of Mithila! The dwellers of forest are to be satisfied with
whatever is obtained there, the restricted food. Hence, living in forest is a misery._END

B_2_C_29_9
BEGIN_
कृत आदेशा भविष्यामि गमिष्यामि सह त्वया |
कालः च अयम् समुत्पन्नः सत्य वाग् भवतु द्विजः || २-२९-११_END
BEGIN_
"I shall be the one who has fulfilled the brahmana's word. I shall accompany you to
the forest. The time has come for brahmana's words to come true."_END

B_2_C_28_17
BEGIN_
अतीव वातः तिमिरम् बुभुक्षा च अत्र नित्यशः |
भयानि च महान्ति अत्र ततः दुह्खतरम् वनम् || २-२८-१८_END
BEGIN_
"In the forest, air and darkness are too much. There are always hunger and great
fears too. Hence, dwelling in a forest is very much a misery."_END

B_2_C_29_10
BEGIN_
वन वासे हि जानामि दुह्खानि बहुधा किल |
प्राप्यन्ते नियतम् वीर पुरुषैः अकृत आत्मभिः || २-२९-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh valiant prince! I know that in the forest, sufferings indeed are many and are
invariably obtained by men having unformed minds."_END

B_2_C_28_18
BEGIN_
सरी सृपाः च बहवो बहु रूपाः च भामिनि |
चरन्ति पृथिवीम् दर्पात् अतः दुखतरम् वनम् || २-२८-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Sita! Various creeping animals of different forms roam about on earth with
pride. Hence dwelling in a forst is a great misery."_END

B_2_C_29_11
BEGIN_
कन्यया च पितुर् गेहे वन वासः श्रुतः मया
भिक्षिण्याः साधु वृत्ताया मम मातुर् इह अग्रतः || २-२९-१३_END
BEGIN_
"While I was an unmarried girl, the prediction about my dwelling the forest was
heard by me in my father's house from a female mendicant having good manners, in the presence of my
mother."_END

B_2_C_28_19
BEGIN_
नदी निलयनाः सर्पा नदी कुटिल गामिनः |
तिष्ठन्ति आवृत्य पन्थानम् अतः दुह्खतरम् वनम् || २-२८-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Snakes dwelling in rivers, moving crookedly like rivers, stay obstucting the
pathways. Hence, living in forest is a great misery."_END

B_2_C_29_12
BEGIN_
प्रसादितः च वै पूर्वम् त्वम् वै बहु विधम् प्रभो |
गमनम् वन वासस्य कान्क्षितम् हि सह त्वया || २-२९-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh Lord! In the past, you have been really pleased for many a time to take me along
with you indeed for the tour of a forest, as longed by me."_END

B_2_C_28_20
BEGIN_
पतम्गा वृश्चिकाः कीटा दंशाः च मशकैः सह |
बाधन्ते नित्यम् अबले सर्वम् दुह्खम् अतः वनम् || २-२८-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, frail princess! Flying insects, scropious, insects including mosquitoes and
files always annoy every one. Hence, forest is full of hardship."_END

B_2_C_29_13
BEGIN_
कृत क्षणा अहम् भद्रम् ते गमनम् प्रति राघव |
वन वासस्य शूरस्य चर्या हि मम रोचते || २-२९-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! May all be well with you! I am waiting for a journey to the forest. A
work-out of adventurist is really delightful to me."_END

B_2_C_28_21
BEGIN_
द्रुमाः कण्टकिनः चैव कुश काशाः च भामिनि |
वने व्याकुल शाखा अग्राः तेन दुह्खतरम् वनम् || २-२८-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Sita! Forest is full of trees, kusa grass and bambooes with ends of their
branches spread on all sides. Hence, living in a forest is a great misery."_END

B_2_C_29_14
BEGIN_
शुद्ध आत्मन् प्रेम भावाद्द् हि भविष्यामि विकल्मषा |
भर्तारम् अनुगच्चन्ती भर्ता हि मम दैवतम् || २-२९-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, the pure-minded! Following my husband with loving devotion, I shall become
sin-less; for husband is the supreme deity to me."_END

B_2_C_28_22
BEGIN_
कायक्लेशाश्च बहवो भयानि विविधानि च |
अरण्यवासे वसतो क्धुःखमेव ततो वनम् || २-२८-२३_END
BEGIN_
"An inhabitant living in a forest has to face various bodily troubles and panics.
Hence, forest- life is readly a misery."_END

B_2_C_29_15
BEGIN_
प्रेत्य भावे अपि कल्याणः सम्गमः मे सह त्वया |
श्रुतिर् हि श्रूयते पुण्या ब्राह्मणानाम् यशस्विनाम् || २-२९-१७
इह लोके च पितृभिर् या स्त्री यस्य महा मते |
अद्भिर् दत्ता स्वधर्मेण प्रेत्य भावे अपि तस्य सा || २-२९-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Even after my death, I shall stay united with you. On this subject, the meritorious
words of brahmanas is being heard thus:- In this world, which woman was given away to whom by
parents with water according to the moral code binding on them, that woman belongs to him alone
even after death._END

B_2_C_28_23
BEGIN_
क्रोधलोभे विमोक्तव्यौ कर्तव्या तपसे मतिः |
न भेतव्यम् च भेतव्ये नित्यम् दुःखमतो वनम् || २-२८-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Anger and greed are to be abandoned by the dwellers of forest. Devotion is to be
bestowed on asceticism. What needs to be feared, should not be feared. Hence, living in a forest is
a suffereing."_END

B_2_C_29_16
BEGIN_
एवम् अस्मात् स्वकाम् नारीम् सुवृत्ताम् हि पति व्रताम् |
न अभिरोचयसे नेतुम् त्वम् माम् केन इह हेतुना || २-२९-१९_END
BEGIN_
"By what reason now are you thus not willing to take me, the woman having good
conduct, devoted to her husband and belonging to you, from this place?"_END

B_2_C_28_24
BEGIN_
तत् अलम् ते वनम् गत्वा क्षमम् न हि वनम् तव |
विमृशन्न् इह पश्यामि बहु दोषतरम् वनम् || २-२८-२५_END
BEGIN_
"Therefore, do away with the idea of your coming to the forest. Forest is not indeed
bearable for you. Reflecting now, I perceive forest as having too many disadvantages."_END

B_2_C_29_17
BEGIN_
भक्ताम् पति व्रताम् दीनाम् माम् समाम् सुख दुह्खयोह् |
नेतुम् अर्हसि काकुत्स्थ समान सुख दुह्खिनीम् || २-२९-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh Rama, the seion of Kakutsa! You ought to take me, who is a devotee, so devoted
to husband, who is distressed who feels alike in pleasure and pain and shares your joys and
sorrows."_END

B_2_C_28_25
BEGIN_
वनम् तु नेतुम् न कृता मतिस् तदा |
बभूव रामेण यदा महात्मना |
न तस्य सीता वचनम् चकार तत् |
ततः अब्रवीद् रामम् इदम् सुदुह्खिता || २-२८-२६_END
BEGIN_
As the great souled Rama did not agree to take her to the forest, the much aggrieved
Sita spoke to Rama as follows:-_END

B_2_C_29_18
BEGIN_
यदि माम् दुह्खिताम् एवम् वनम् नेतुम् न च इच्चसि |
विषम् अग्निम् जलम् वा अहम् आस्थास्ये मृत्यु कारणात् || २-२९-२१_END
BEGIN_
"I shall take resort to poison or fire or water for dying, if you are not willing to
take me, afflicted as I am, as above."_END

B_2_C_29_19
BEGIN_
एवम् बहु विधम् तम् सा याचते गमनम् प्रति |
न अनुमेने महा बाहुस् ताम् नेतुम् विजनम् वनम् || २-२९-२२_END
BEGIN_
Eventhough she requested him in many ways about setting out to the forest, he did
not agree to take her to the forest, which is a solitary place._END

B_2_C_29_20
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्ता तु सा चिन्ताम् मैथिली समुपागता |
स्नापयन्ती इव गाम् उष्णैः अश्रुभिर् नयन च्युतैः || २-२९-२३_END
BEGIN_
After hearing Rama's words, seetha was sorrowful, moistening with earth as it were
with burning tears, trickling down her eyes._END

B_2_C_29_21
BEGIN_
चिन्तयन्तीम् तथा ताम् तु निवर्तयितुम् आत्मवान् |
ताम्रोष्ठीं स तदा सीताम् काकुत्स्थो बह्व् असान्त्वयत् || २-२९-२४_END
BEGIN_
Rama the prudent man then pacified in many ways, to avert that Seetha with red lips,
who was sorrowful as above._END

B_2_C_30_0
BEGIN_
सान्त्व्यमाना तु रामेण मैथिली जनक आत्मजा |
वन वास निमित्ताय भर्तारम् इदम् अब्रवीत् || २-३०-१_END
BEGIN_
Seetha daughter of Janaka being pacified by Rama in the matter of living in the
forest, spoke the following words to her husband._END

B_2_C_30_1
BEGIN_
सा तम् उत्तम सम्विग्ना सीता विपुल वक्षसम् |
प्रणयाच् च अभिमानाच् च परिचिक्षेप राघवम् || २-३०-२_END
BEGIN_
Distressed and highly agitated, the said Seetha reproached Rama having a broad
chest, from affection and pride in the following words:-_END

B_2_C_30_2
BEGIN_
किम् त्वा अमन्यत वैदेहः पिता मे मिथिला अधिपः |
राम जामातरम् प्राप्य स्त्रियम् पुरुष विग्रहम् || २-३०-३_END
BEGIN_
"What my father, the king of Mithila belonging to the country of Videha, think of
himself having got as so-in-law you, a woman having the form of a man?"_END

B_2_C_30_3
BEGIN_
अनृतम् बल लोको अयम् अज्ञानात् यद्द् हि वक्ष्यति |
तेजो न अस्ति परम् रामे तपति इव दिवा करे || २-३०-४_END
BEGIN_
"It is a pity if these people of Ayodhya through ignorance tell the falsehood that
excellent valour is lacking in Rama as in a blazing sun."_END

B_2_C_30_4
BEGIN_
किम् हि कृत्वा विषण्णः त्वम् कुतः वा भयम् अस्ति ते |
यत् परित्यक्तु कामः त्वम् माम् अनन्य परायणाम् || २-३०-५_END
BEGIN_
"For what reason are you cast down or whence fear in you, for which you are willing
to desert me, for whom there is no other recourse."_END

B_2_C_31_0
BEGIN_
एवम् श्रुत्वा तु सम्वादम् लक्ष्मणः पूर्वमागतः |
बाष्पपर्याकुलमुखः शोकम् सोढुमशक्नुवन् || २-३१-१
स भ्रातुश्चरणौ गाढम् निपीड्य रघुनन्दनः |
सीतामुवाचातियशाम् राघवम् च महाव्रतम् || २-३१-२_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana who came there earlier, heard the conversation of Seetha and Rama, having
his eyes glut with tears, being unable to bear the anguish, tightly pressed the feet of his bother
and spoke (as floows) to Rama who was performing a great vow and to Seetha who enjoyed great
honour._END

B_2_C_30_5
BEGIN_
द्युमत्सेन सुतम् वीर सत्यवन्तम् अनुव्रताम् |
सावित्रीम् इव माम् विद्धि त्वम् आत्म वश वर्तिनीम् || २-३०-६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Brave man! Know me to be as dependent on your will as Savitri who was devoted
to Satyavan the son of Dyumatsena."_END

B_2_C_31_1
BEGIN_
यदि गन्तुम् कृता बुद्धिर्वनम् मृगगजायुतम् |
अहम् त्वानुगमिष्यामि वनमद्रे धनुर्धरः || २-३१-३_END
BEGIN_
"If you decided to go to the forest filled with antelopes and elephants, I, in front
wearingthe bow, shall accompany you to the forest."_END

B_2_C_30_6
BEGIN_
न तु अहम् मनसा अपि अन्यम् द्रष्टा अस्मि त्वद् ऋते अनघ |
त्वया राघव गच्चेयम् यथा अन्या कुल पांसनी || २-३०-७_END
BEGIN_
"Rama, the faultless man! I will not see, even in thought, anyone except you as any
other woman bringing disrepute to her family would! I shall accompany you to the forest."_END

B_2_C_31_2
BEGIN_
मया समेतोऽरण्यानि बहूनि विचरिष्यसि |
पक्षिभिर्मृगयूथैश्च सम्घुष्टानि समन्ततः || २-३१-४_END
BEGIN_
"Together with me, you will travel in the various forests, resonant with sounds of
birds and herds of wild animals."_END

B_2_C_30_7
BEGIN_
स्वयम् तु भार्याम् कौमारीम् चिरम् अध्युषिताम् सतीम् |
शैलूषैव माम् राम परेभ्यो दातुम् इच्चसि || २-३०-८_END
BEGIN_
" Oh, Rama! I am a young girl, lived for a long time with you, a chaste woman and
your wife. How would you like an actor intend to deliver me to oehrs by your own will?"_END

B_2_C_31_3
BEGIN_
न देवलोकाक्रमणम् नामरत्वमहम् वृणे |
ऐश्वर्यम् वापि लोकानाम् कामये न त्वया विना || २-३१-५_END
BEGIN_
"Without you, I do not want ascendency to heaven now do I desire immortality now do
I wish for sovereignity over the globes."_END

B_2_C_30_8
BEGIN_
यस्य पथ्यम् च रामात्थ यस्य चार्थेऽवरुध्यसे |
त्वम् तस्य भव वश्यश्च विधेयश्छ सदानघ|| २-३०-९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama the sinless one! Be you always dutiful and obedient to him, whom you speak
of welfare, for whose sake I am being kept back.(But it is improper to ask me to stay obedient to
him)."_END

B_2_C_31_4
BEGIN_
एवम् ब्रुवाणः सौमित्रिर्विनवासाय निश्चितः |
रामेण बहुभिः सान्वैर्निषिद्धः पुनरब्रवीत् || २-३१-६_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana who was speaking in favour of coming to the forst, was forbidden by Rama
through many of his pacifying words. After hearing them, Lakshmana again soke as follows:_END

B_2_C_30_9
BEGIN_
स माम् अनादाय वनम् न त्वम् प्रस्थातुम् अर्हसि |
तपो वा यदि वा अरण्यम् स्वर्गो वा स्यात् सह त्वया || २-३०-१०_END
BEGIN_
"It is not proper for you as such to set out to the forest without taking me. Any
term of austerities or forest or even heaven, let it be to me with you only."_END

B_2_C_31_5
BEGIN_
अनुज्ञातश्च भवता पूर्वमेव यदस्म्यहम् |
किमिदानीम् पुनरिदम् क्रियते मे निवारणम् || २-३१-७_END
BEGIN_
"I was indeed permitted by you earlier. How is it that you are prohibiting me
now?"_END

B_2_C_32_0
BEGIN_
ततः शासनम् आज्ञाय भ्रातुः शुभतरम् प्रियम् |
गत्वा स प्रविवेश आशु सुयज्ञस्य निवेशनम् || २-३२-१_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Lakshmana obeying his brother's order which is kindly and auspicious,
went immediately to the house of suyajna._END

B_2_C_30_10
BEGIN_
न च मे भविता तत्र कश्चित् पथि परिश्रमः |
पृष्ठतः तव गच्चन्त्या विहार शयनेष्व् अपि || २-३०-११_END
BEGIN_
"To me, who follow you behind, there will be no tiresomeness. I shall remain in the
path without any fatigue, as remaining in a place of recreation or as in a sleep._END

B_2_C_31_6
BEGIN_
यदर्थम् प्रतिषेधो मे क्रियते गन्तुमिच्छतः |
एतदिच्छामि विज्ञातुम् संशयो हि ममानघ || २-३१-८_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, the faultless man! I desire to know the reason for prohibiting me, who is
indeed willing to come to the forest, because there is doubt in my mind."_END

B_2_C_32_1
BEGIN_
तम् विप्रम् अग्नि अगारस्थम् वन्दित्वा लक्ष्मणो अब्रवीत् |
सखे अभ्यागच्च पश्य त्वम् वेश्म दुष्कर कारिणः || २-३२-२_END
BEGIN_
Offering salutation to that brahmana living in a house of fire, Lakshmana spoke as
follows: "Oh, friend! Come and see the house of Rama who is doing an arduous task."_END

B_2_C_30_11
BEGIN_
कुश काश शर इषीका ये च कण्टकिनो द्रुमाः |
तूल अजिन सम स्पर्शा मार्गे मम सह त्वया || २-३०-१२_END
BEGIN_
"While walking with you, blades of kusha grass, shrubs by the name of kaasa, reeds
and rushes and plants with prickles which fall in the path will touch my soles like a heap of
cotton or soft deerskin."_END

B_2_C_31_7
BEGIN_
ततः अब्रवीन् महा तेजा रामः लक्ष्मणम् अग्रतः |
स्थितम् प्राग् गामिनम् वीरम् याचमानम् कृत अन्जलिम् || २-३१-९_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter Rama of great splendour spoke to Lakshmana the valiant man who was
standing in front, intending to preceede Sri Rama and soliciting with joined palms._END

B_2_C_32_2
BEGIN_
ततः संध्याम् उपास्य आशु गत्वा सौमित्रिणा सह |
जुष्टम् तत् प्राविशल् लक्ष्म्या रम्यम् राम निवेशनम् || २-३२-३_END
BEGIN_
Then, Suyajna, having performed worship at the juncture of day and night, came at
once along with Lakshmana and entered Rama's house which was good-looking and inhabited by Lakshmi
the goddess of wealth._END

B_2_C_30_12
BEGIN_
महा वात समुद्धूतम् यन् माम् अवकरिष्यति |
रजो रमण तन् मन्ये पर अर्ध्यम् इव चन्दनम् || २-३०-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, beloved! I shall reckon the dust raised by the strongest wind that will cover
my body as sandal dust of highest advantage."_END

B_2_C_31_8
BEGIN_
स्निग्धो धर्मरतो वीरस्सततम् सत्पथे स्थितः |
प्रियः प्राणसमो वशो भ्राता चापि सखा च मे || २-३१-१०_END
BEGIN_
"You are so friendly, interested in righteousness, valiant, abiding always in a good
path, dear to me as life, obedient, my brother and a companion."_END

B_2_C_32_3
BEGIN_
तम् आगतम् वेदविदम् प्रान्जलिः सीतया सह |
सुयज्ञम् अभिचक्राम राघवो अग्निम् इव अर्चितम् || २-३२-४_END
BEGIN_
Seeing him arrived, Rama with joined palms along with Seetha, moved clockwise as
around sacrificial fire, that Suyajna the venerable man who had the knowledge of Vedas._END

B_2_C_30_13
BEGIN_
शाद्वलेषु यद् आसिष्ये वन अन्ते वन गोरचा |
कुथा आस्तरण तल्पेषु किम् स्यात् सुखतरम् ततः || २-३०-१४_END
BEGIN_
"While dwelling in the forest, in its midst, I shall lie down on green grass. Will
lying in beds with carpets be more comfortable than that?"_END

B_2_C_31_9
BEGIN_
मया अद्य सह सौमित्रे त्वयि गच्चति तत् वनम् |
को भरिष्यति कौसल्याम् सुमित्राम् वा यशस्विनीम् || २-३१-११_END
BEGIN_
"Oh Lakshmana! If you proceed to the forest along with me now, who will support
Kausalya or the illustrious Sumitra?"_END

B_2_C_32_4
BEGIN_
जात रूपमयैः मुख्यैः अन्गदैः कुण्डलैः शुभैः |
सहेम सूत्रैः मणिभिः केयूरैः वलयैः अपि || २-३२-५
अन्यैः च रत्नैः बहुभिः काकुत्स्थः प्रत्यपूजयत् |
सुयज्ञम् स तदा उवाच रामः सीता प्रचोदितः || २-३२-६_END
BEGIN_
Rama adored Suyajna with excellent Angadas(armlets) and beautiful earrings of gold,
gems stung on gold threads as also with keyuras( another ornament similar in shape to an Angada but
worn above it near the armpit) and bracelets as well as with many other excellent precious stones.
urged by Seetha, the said Rama then spoke to suyajna as follows:_END

B_2_C_30_14
BEGIN_
पत्रम् मूलम् फलम् यत् त्वम् अल्पम् वा यदि वा बहु |
दास्यसि स्वयम् आहृत्य तन् मे अमृत रस उपमम् || २-३०-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Leaves, tubers and fruits either a little or abundant in quantity brought and given
by you yourself will be like nectar to me."_END

B_2_C_33_0
BEGIN_
दत्त्वा तु सह वैदेह्या ब्राह्मणेभ्यो धनम् बहु |
जग्मतुः पितरम् द्रष्टुम् सीतया सह राघवौ || २-३३-१_END
BEGIN_
Rama and Lakshmana along with Seetha gave away abundant riches to brahmanas and went
along with Seetha to see their father._END

B_2_C_31_10
BEGIN_
अभिवर्षति कामैः यः पर्जन्यः पृथिवीम् इव |
स काम पाश पर्यस्तः महा तेजा मही पतिः || २-३१-१२_END
BEGIN_
"That emperor of great splendour, who used to shower blessings on the people as a
cloud sends down rain on the earth, stands circumscribed by cord of love."_END

B_2_C_32_5
BEGIN_
हारम् च हेम सूत्रम् च भार्यायै सौम्य हारय |
रशनाम् च अधुना सीता दातुम् इच्चति ते सखे || २-३२-७_END
BEGIN_
"Oh the gentle sage, my friend! Now, Seetha wants to give for your wife a pearl
necklace, a string of gold and a girdle. please take them."_END

B_2_C_30_15
BEGIN_
न मातुर् न पितुस् तत्र स्मरिष्यामि न वेश्मनः |
आर्तवानि उपभुन्जाना पुष्पाणि च फलानि च || २-३०-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Enjoying the flowers and fruits belonging to various seasons there, I shall neither
recollect my mother nor father nor my home."_END

B_2_C_33_1
BEGIN_
ततो गृहीते दुष्प्रेक्ष्येअशोभेताम् तदा आयुधे |
माला दामभिर् आसक्ते सीतया समलम्कृते || २-३३-२_END
BEGIN_
Those weapons held by Rama and Lakshmana were tied on with garlands by Seetha. The
weapons thus decorated were shining brilliantly and were fearful to look at._END

B_2_C_31_11
BEGIN_
सा हि राज्यम् इदम् प्राप्य नृपस्य अश्व पतेः सुता |
दुह्खितानाम् सपत्नीनाम् न करिष्यति शोभनम् || २-३१-१३_END
BEGIN_
"That Kaikeyi daughter of king Aswapathi, after obtaining this kingdom, will
certainly not accord good treatment to her step-wives, who are at grief."_END

B_2_C_32_6
BEGIN_
अङ्गदानि विचित्राणि केयूराणि शुभानि च |
पर्यन्कम् अग्र्य आस्तरणम् नाना रत्न विभूषितम् || २-३२-८_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, friend! Seetha who is departing to the forest, is giving you for your wife
armlets adorned with figures cut in them and beautiful keyuras."_END

B_2_C_30_16
BEGIN_
न च तत्र गतः किंचित् द्रष्टुम् अर्हसि विप्रियम् |
मत् कृते न च ते शोको न भविष्यामि दुर्भरा || २-३०-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Hence, you are not justified to see anything unpleasant there. There will be no
annoyance to you because of me. I will not be difficult to be maintained."_END

B_2_C_33_2
BEGIN_
ततः प्रासाद हर्म्याणि विमान शिखराणि च |
अधिरुह्य जनः श्रीमान् उदासीनो व्यलोकयत् || २-३३-३_END
BEGIN_
Then, wealthy people ascended lofty palatial mansions, large buildings and tops of
palaces of seven stories high and saw them spiritlessly,_END

B_2_C_31_12
BEGIN_
न स्मरिष्यति कौसल्याम् सुमित्राम् च सुदुःखिताम् |
भरतो राज्यमासाद्य कैकेय्याम् पर्यवस्थितः || २-३१-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Bharata on acquiring the kingdom will be devoted to Kaikeyi and will not think of
sorrowful Kausalya or Sumitra."_END

B_2_C_32_7
BEGIN_
पर्यङ्कमग्र्यास्तरणम् नानारत्नविभूषितम् |
तम् अपि इच्चति वैदेही प्रतिष्ठापयितुम् त्वयि || २-३२-९_END
BEGIN_
"Seetha wants to offer you that couch also inlaid with various jewels and provided
with an excellent coverlet."_END

B_2_C_30_17
BEGIN_
यः त्वया सह स स्वर्गो निरयो यः त्वया विना |
इति जानन् पराम् प्रीतिम् गच्च राम मया सह || २-३०-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Your companionship will be a heaven to me. Without you, it will be a hell. Oh,
Rama! By knowing thus my great love, obtain supreme joy with me."_END

B_2_C_33_3
BEGIN_
न हि रथ्याः स्म शक्यन्ते गन्तुम् बहु जन आकुलाः |
आरुह्य तस्मात् प्रासादान् दीनाः पश्यन्ति राघवम् || २-३३-४_END
BEGIN_
The streets were indeed difficult to walk, congested as they were, with many men.
For that reason, being in distress, they were seeing Rama by ascending lofty palatial
buildings._END

B_2_C_31_13
BEGIN_
तामार्याम् स्वयमेवेह राजाऽनुग्रहणेन वा |
सौमित्रे भर कौसल्या मुक्तमर्थमिमम् चर || २-३१-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Lakshmana! You stay here and support the venerable Kausalya through your own
self or by obtaining favour through the king. Do this thing, as said."_END

B_2_C_32_8
BEGIN_
नागः शत्रुम् जयो नाम मातुलो यम् ददौ मम |
तम् ते गज सहस्रेण ददामि द्विज पुम्गव || २-३२-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, the best of brahmanas! I am giving you this elephant called Satrunjaya, given
earlier to me by my maternal uncle as well as those thousand elephants."_END

B_2_C_30_18
BEGIN_
अथ माम् एवम् अव्यग्राम् वनम् न एव नयिष्यसि |
विषम् अद्य एव पास्यामि मा विशम् द्विषताम् वशम् || २-३०-१९_END
BEGIN_
"On the contrary, if you do not take me, who is not alarmed of the forest as such, I
shall drink poison now itself. But on no account would I bow to the enemies."_END

B_2_C_33_4
BEGIN_
पदातिम् वर्जितच् चत्रम् रामम् दृष्ट्वा तदा जनाः |
ऊचुर् बहु विधा वाचः शोक उपहत चेतसः || २-३३-५_END
BEGIN_
Then, by seeing Rama as a pedestrian without an umbrella, the people with their
hearts struck by grief were uttering words of many sorts._END

B_2_C_31_14
BEGIN_
एवम् मम च ते भक्तिर्भविष्यति सुदर्शिता |
धर्मज्ञ गुरुपूजायाम् धर्मश्चाप्यतुलो महान् || २-३१-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Lakshmana the knower of righteousness! Thus, your devotion towards me will have
been fully demonstrated by you. By honouring the elders, a great unqualled religious merit will
accrue to you."_END

B_2_C_32_9
BEGIN_
इति उक्तः स हि रामेण सुयज्ञः प्रतिगृह्य तत् |
राम लक्ष्मण सीतानाम् प्रयुयोज आशिषः शिवाः || २-३२-११_END
BEGIN_
As requested by Rama, suyajna accepted the gift and bestowed bening blessings to
Rama, Lakshmana and Seetha._END

B_2_C_30_19
BEGIN_
पश्चात् अपि हि दुह्खेन मम न एव अस्ति जीवितम् |
उज्झितायाः त्वया नाथ तदा एव मरणम् वरम् || २-३०-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Lord! As a result of grief I will not going to live even afterwards when
abandoned by you. Death is therefore better at the time of your relinquishment itself."_END

B_2_C_33_5
BEGIN_
यम् यान्तम् अनुयाति स्म चतुर् अन्ग बलम् महत् |
तम् एकम् सीतया सार्धम् अनुयाति स्म लक्ष्मणः || २-३३-६_END
BEGIN_
The same Sri Rama who was followed by a strong four wings of army(comprising
elephants, chariots, cavalry and infantry), is walking lonely with Seetha followed by
Lakshmana._END

B_2_C_31_15
BEGIN_
एवम् कुरुष्व सौमित्रे मत्क्ऱ्^ते रघुनन्दन |
अस्माभिर्विप्रहीनाया मातुर्नो न भवेत्सुखम् || २-३१-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Lakshmana, the exhilarator of Raghu dynasty! Do this for my sake. There will be
no happiness to our mother, if she is left behind by us."_END

B_2_C_32_10
BEGIN_
अथ भ्रातरम् अव्यग्रम् प्रियम् रामः प्रियम् वदः |
सौमित्रिम् तम् उवाच इदम् ब्रह्मा इव त्रिदश ईश्वरम् || २-३२-१२_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama who speaks polite words as coolly as Brahma to Devendra, spoke to his
beloved brother Lakshmana as follows:_END

B_2_C_30_20
BEGIN_
इदम् हि सहितुम् शोकम् मुहूर्तम् अपि न उत्सहे |
किम् पुनर् दश वर्षाणि त्रीणि च एकम् च दुह्खिता || २-३०-२१_END
BEGIN_
"I cannot bear this grief even for a moment, why again fourteen years in
misery."_END

B_2_C_33_6
BEGIN_
ऐश्वर्यस्य रसज्ञः सन् कामिनाम् चैव कामदः |
न इच्चति एव अनृतम् कर्तुम् पितरम् धर्म गौरवात् || २-३३-७_END
BEGIN_
Rama knew the taste of sovereignty. He can grant desires to the desirous. Even then,
because of his respect for virtue, he is careful not to believe his father's words._END

B_2_C_31_16
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्तः तु रामेण लक्ष्मणः श्लक्ष्णया गिरा |
प्रत्युवाच तदा रामम् वाक्यज्ञो वाक्य कोविदम् || २-३१-१८_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana who is intelligent in speech, after hearing Rama's words, replied in a
gentle voice to him who is skilled in speech._END

B_2_C_32_11
BEGIN_
अगस्त्यम् कौशिकम् चैव ताव् उभौ ब्राह्मण उत्तमौ |
अर्चय आहूय सौमित्रे रत्नैः सस्यम् इव अम्बुभिः || २-३२-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Lakshmana! Call those two excellent brahmanas Agastya and Kausika and worship
them with valuable gifts as water is poured to a crop of corn."_END

B_2_C_30_21
BEGIN_
इति सा शोक सम्तप्ता विलप्य करुणम् बहु |
चुक्रोश पतिम् आयस्ता भृशम् आलिन्ग्य सस्वरम् || २-३०-२२_END
BEGIN_
Seetha, burnt by grief, having got exerted, lamented much piteously, embraced her
husband and cried a lot with loud voice._END

B_2_C_33_7
BEGIN_
या न शक्या पुरा द्रष्टुम् भूतैः आकाशगैः अपि |
ताम् अद्य सीताम् पश्यन्ति राज मार्ग गता जनाः || २-३३-८_END
BEGIN_
Even people walking on road are able to see Seetha, who could not earlier be seen
even by beings going through the air._END

B_2_C_34_0
BEGIN_
ततःकमलपत्राक्षः श्यामो निरुपमो महान् |
उवाच रामस्तम् सूतं पितुराख्याहि मामिति || २-३४-१_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, the lotus-eyes Rama, who was dark-brown in complexion and great beyond
compare, spoke thus to the charioteer, "Tell about me to my father."_END

B_2_C_31_17
BEGIN_
तव एव तेजसा वीर भरतः पूजयिष्यति |
कौसल्याम् च सुमित्राम् च प्रयतः न अत्र संशयः || २-३१-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama the valiant! Bharata being inspired by your splendour of morality will
respect Kausalya and Sumitra. There is no doubt in this matter."_END

B_2_C_32_12
BEGIN_
तर्पयस्व महाबाहो गोसहसरैश्च मानद |
सुवर्णै रजतैश्चैव मणिभिश्च महाधनैः || २-३२-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Lakshmana the honour-giver, with great arms! Satiate them with thousands of
cows, gold, silver and with gems of great value."_END

B_2_C_30_22
BEGIN_
सा विद्धा बहुभिर् वाक्यैः दिग्धैः इव गज अन्गना |
चिर सम्नियतम् बाष्पम् मुमोच अग्निम् इव अरणिः || २-३०-२३_END
BEGIN_
persecuted with many homilies like a female elephant pierced with poisoned arrows,
she shed tears that had long been held back even as a piece of wood would emit fire(throught
attrition with another)_END

B_2_C_33_8
BEGIN_
अङ्ग राग उचिताम् सीताम् रक्त चन्दन सेविनीम् |
वर्षम् उष्णम् च शीतम् च नेष्यति आशु विवर्णताम् || २-३३-९_END
BEGIN_
Rain, heat and cold will quickly wane to pallor Seetha, who was fond of applying
suitable cosmetics and red sandal to the body._END

B_2_C_34_1
BEGIN_
स राम प्रेषितः क्षिप्रम् सम्ताप कलुष इन्द्रियः |
प्रविश्य नृपतिम् सूतः निह्श्वसन्तम् ददर्श ह || २-३४-२_END
BEGIN_
Quickly entering inside, when sent by Rama, the charioteer saw the king having
sighs, his senses disturbed by grief._END

B_2_C_31_18
BEGIN_
कौसल्या बिभृयात् आर्या सहस्रम् अपि मद् विधान् |
यस्याः सहस्रम् ग्रामाणाम् सम्प्राप्तम् उपजीवनम् || २-३१-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Kausalya obtained (by grant) thousand villages , which are dependent on her. Hence,
that venerable Kausalya can maintain even thousand people like me."_END

B_2_C_32_13
BEGIN_
कौसल्याम् च याअशीर्भिर् भक्तः पर्युपतिष्ठति |
आचार्यः तैत्तिरीयाणाम् अभिरूपः च वेदवित् || २-३२-१५
तस्य यानम् च दासीः च सौमित्रे सम्प्रदापय |
कौशेयानि च वस्त्राणि यावत् तुष्यति स द्विजः || २-३२-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Lakshmana! Which brahman is studying Taittiriya(a school of yajurveda), a
preceptor, a man of conformity; a knower of Vedas, serving Kausalya with his devotion and blessing,
to him see that he is duly gifted conveyance, servant maids and silken clothing till he gets
satisfied."_END

B_2_C_30_23
BEGIN_
तस्याः स्फटिक सम्काशम् वारि सम्ताप सम्भवम् |
नेत्राभ्याम् परिसुस्राव पन्कजाभ्याम् इव उदकम् || २-३०-२४_END
BEGIN_
Crystal-like tears woozed from her eyes because of grief, like water-drops from two
lotus flowers._END

B_2_C_33_9
BEGIN_
अद्य नूनम् दशरथः सत्त्वम् आविश्य भाषते |
न हि राजा प्रियम् पुत्रम् विवासयितुम् अर्हति || २-३३-१०_END


B_2_C_34_2
BEGIN_
उपरक्तमिवादित्यं भस्मच्छन्नमिवानलम्|
तटाकमिव निस्तोयमपश्यज्जगतीपतिम्|| २-३४-३_END
BEGIN_
He saw the king resembling an eclipsed sun, like fire covered by ash, as a lake
without water._END

B_2_C_31_19
BEGIN_
तदात्मभरणे चैव मम मातुस्तथैव च |
पर्याप्ता मद्विधानाम् च भरणाय यशस्विनी || २-३१-२१_END
BEGIN_
"The illustrious Kausalya is competent not only to maintain herself but also my
mother and people like me in addition."_END

B_2_C_32_14
BEGIN_
सूतः चित्र रथः च आर्यः सचिवः सुचिर उषितः |
तोषय एनम् महा अर्हैः च रत्नैः वस्त्रैः धनैअः तथा || २-३२-१७_END
BEGIN_
"The charioteer called Chitraratha the companion of our venerable father was of very
long standing. Gratify him with valuable gifts of great worth, with clothes, with money, with all
types of small animals and with thousands of cows."_END

B_2_C_30_24
BEGIN_
तच्चैवामलचन्ध्रभम् मुखमायतलोचनम् |
पर्यशुष्यत बाष्पेण जलोद्धृतमिवामुबुजम् || २-३०-२५_END
BEGIN_
Her face with shining brilliance of the moon and having longish eyes, withered with
tears as a lotus flower pulled out from water._END

B_2_C_33_10
BEGIN_
निर्गुणस्य अपि पुत्रस्या काथम् स्यात् विप्रवासनम् |
किम् पुनर् यस्य लोको अयम् जितः वृत्तेन केवलम् || २-३३-११_END
BEGIN_
How banishment can be affected on a son, even devoid of virtues? Why to tell further
of whom, this world is conquered merely by his mode of conduct?_END

B_2_C_34_3
BEGIN_
आलोक्य तु महा प्राज्ञः परम आकुल चेतसम् |
रामम् एव अनुशोचन्तम् सूतः प्रान्जलिर् आसदत् || २-३४-४_END
BEGIN_
The charioteer, a great intellectual, saw Dasaratha repenting with his mind greatly
agitated and approached him with joined palms._END

B_2_C_31_20
BEGIN_
कुरुष्व मामनुचरम् वैधर्म्यम् नेह विद्यते |
कृतार्थोऽहम् भविष्यामि तव चार्थः प्रकल्पते || २-३१-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Make me your attendant. In this, there is no unrighteousness. Besides, I will be
accomplishing my object. Your purpose also will be fulfilled."_END

B_2_C_32_15
BEGIN_
पशुकाभिकछ सर्वाभिर्गवाम् दशशतेन च |
ये चेमे कथकालापा बहवो दण्डमाणवाः || २-३२-१८
नित्यस्वाध्यायशीलत्वान्नान्यत्कुर्वन्ति किंचन |
अलसाः स्वादुकामाश्च महताम् चापि सम्मताः || २-३२-१९
शालि वाह सहस्रम् च द्वे शते भद्रकांस् तथा |
व्यन्जन अर्थम् च सौमित्रे गो सहस्रम् उपाकुरु || २-३२-२०_END
BEGIN_
Here are many religious students carrying staffs, belonging to katha and kalaapa
branches of Yajurveda, who being always engaged in studying the sacred scriptures, do not perform
any other austerities but are highly honoured by even noble men, are inactive( in the sense, they
do not move out for alms) and crave for sweets. Cause them to be given eighty carts loaded with
jewels, a thousand bullocks carrying loads of rice and two hundred bullocks used for cultivation.
Give a thousand cows for use in their nourishment, Oh Lakshmana!"_END

B_2_C_30_25
BEGIN_
ताम् परिष्वज्य बाहुभ्याम् विसम्ज्ञाम् इव दुह्खिताम् |
उवाच वचनम् रामः परिविश्वासयंस् तदा || २-३०-२६_END
BEGIN_
Then Rama embraced her, with arms, who was depressed and had fainted as it were,
spoke the following words, fully reassuring her._END

B_2_C_33_11
BEGIN_
आनृशंस्यम् अनुक्रोशः श्रुतम् शीलम् दमः शमः |
राघवम् शोभयन्ति एते षड् गुणाः पुरुष उत्तमम् || २-३३-१२_END
BEGIN_
Harmlessness, compassion, learning, good nature, self-control and tranquillity -
these six virtues adorn Rama, the best of men._END

B_2_C_34_4
BEGIN_
तम् वर्धयित्वा राजानम् सूतः पूर्वम् जयाशिषा|
भयविक्लबया वाचा मन्दया श्लक्ष्णमब्रवीत् || २-३४-५_END
BEGIN_
The charioteer, first inspiring the king with blessings of triumph, spoke thus in a
slow and sweet voice, overcome with fear._END

B_2_C_31_21
BEGIN_
धनुर् आदाय सशरम् खनित्र पिटका धरः |
अग्रतः ते गमिष्यामि पन्थानम् अनुदर्शयन् || २-३१-२३_END
BEGIN_
"Taking my bow and arrows and carrying a spade and a basket, I will walk in front of
you showing the path."_END

B_2_C_32_16
BEGIN_
मेखलीनाम् महासघः कौसल्याम् समुपस्थितः |
तेषाम् सहस्रम् सौमित्रे प्रत्येकम् सम्प्रदापय || २-३२-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Lakshmana! Many celebates wearing fillets stand near Kausalya, cause them to be
given a thousand cows each."_END

B_2_C_30_26
BEGIN_
न देवि तव दुह्खेन स्वर्गम् अपि अभिरोचये |
न हि मे अस्ति भयम् किंचित् स्वयम्भोर् इव सर्वतः || २-३०-२७_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, queen! I do not relish even heaven while you are in grief. There is indeed no
fear whatsoever to me, like the god of Brahma.'_END

B_2_C_33_12
BEGIN_
तस्मात् तस्य उपघातेन प्रजाः परम पीडिताः |
औदकानि इव सत्त्वानि ग्रीष्मे सलिल सम्क्षयात् || २-३३-१३_END
BEGIN_
Therefore, people are extremely painful for the injury done to him, as aquatic
beings in summer are afflicted because of depletion of water._END

B_2_C_34_5
BEGIN_
अयम् स पुरुष व्याघ्र द्वारि तिष्ठति ते सुतः |
ब्राह्मणेभ्यो धनम् दत्त्वा सर्वम् चैव उपजीविनाम् || २-३४-६_END
BEGIN_
"Your son, the tiger among men, having given away all his wealth to brahmanas and
dependents, is waiting at the gate."_END

B_2_C_31_22
BEGIN_
आहरिष्यामि ते नित्यम् मूलानि च फलानि च |
वन्यानि यानि च अन्यानि स्वाहाराणि तपस्विनाम् || २-३१-२४_END
BEGIN_
"I will procure for you for all time the tubers, fruits and other things which are
good food stuffs available in the forest for sages."_END

B_2_C_32_17
BEGIN_
अम्बा यथा च सा नन्देत्कौसल्या मम दक्षिणाम् |
तथा द्विजातीम् स्तान्सर्वान् लक्ष्मणार्च || २-३२-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Honour all those brahmanas in every way, so that my mother Kausalya will feel happy
to see my gifts."_END

B_2_C_30_27
BEGIN_
तव सर्वम् अभिप्रायम् अविज्ञाय शुभ आनने |
वासम् न रोचये अरण्ये शक्तिमान् अपि रक्षणे || २-३०-२८_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Seetha with the auspicious face! Eventhough I am able to protect you, without
knowing your entire opinion, I do not like to take you to the forest."_END

B_2_C_33_13
BEGIN_
पीडया पीडितम् सर्वम् जगद् अस्य जगत् पतेः |
मूलस्य इव उपघातेन वृक्षः पुष्प फल उपगः || २-३३-१४_END
BEGIN_
The entire world feels afflicted by the hardship inflicted on this protector of the
world, as a tree which acquired flowers and fruits is damaged by injury caused to its root._END

B_2_C_31_23
BEGIN_
भवांस् तु सह वैदेह्या गिरि सानुषु रंस्यते |
अहम् सर्वम् करिष्यामि जाग्रतः स्वपतः च ते || २-३१-२५_END
BEGIN_
"You along with Seetha enjoy yourself on mountain-ridges. I shall do everything
while you are waking or sleeping."_END

B_2_C_34_6
BEGIN_
स त्वा पश्यतु भद्रम् ते रामः सत्य पराक्रमः |
सर्वान् सुहृदाअपृच्च्य त्वाम् इदानीम् दिदृक्षते || २-३४-७_END
BEGIN_
"May auspiciousness betide you! Let that Rama, who is unfailingly brave, see you.
After bidding farewell to all friends, he wants to see you now."_END

B_2_C_35_0
BEGIN_
ततो निर्धूय सहसा शिरो निःश्वस्व चासकृत् |
पाणौ पाणिम् विनिष्पिष्य दन्तान् कटकटाय्य च || २-३५-१
लोचने कोपसम्रक्ते वर्णम् पूर्वोचितम् जहत् |
कोपाभिभूतः सहसा सम्तापमशुभम् गतः || २-३५-२
मनः समीक्षमाणश्च सूतो दशरथस्य सः |
कम्पयन्निव कैकेय्या हृदयम् वाक्छरैश्शितैः || २-३५-३
वाक्यवज्रैरनुपमैर्निर्भिन्दन्निव चाशुगैः |
कैकेय्या सर्वमर्माणि सुमन्त्रः प्रत्यभाषत || २-३५-४_END
BEGIN_
Then, moving his head all of a sudden sighing again and again, rubbing his hand in
hand, grinding his teeth, turning his eyes red with anger shedding his normal colour, overwhelmed
with wrath, suddenly getting the evil grief, carefully reading Dasaratha's mind, sumantra the
charioteer spoke(as follows) as though shaking Kaikeyi's heart with sharp arrows, in the form of
thunderbolting words speedily peircing all her vitals._END

B_2_C_32_18
BEGIN_
ततः स पुरुष व्याघ्रः तत् धनम् लक्ष्मणः स्वयम् |
यथा उक्तम् ब्राह्मण इन्द्राणाम् अददात् धनदो यथा || २-३२-२३_END
BEGIN_
Then, Lakshmana the tiger among men himself gave that wealth, like Kubera, to the
best of brahmanas as instructed._END

B_2_C_30_28
BEGIN_
यत् सृष्टा असि मया सार्धम् वन वासाय मैथिलि |
न विहातुम् मया शक्या कीर्तिर् आत्मवता यथा || २-३०-२९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Seetha! it appears that you are created indeed for dwelling in the forest with
me. Hence, you cannot be left behind by me, like the honour by a man of self-regard."_END

B_2_C_33_14
BEGIN_
मूलं ह्येष मनुष्याणाम् धर्मसारो महाद्युतिः |
पुष्पम् फलम् च पत्रम् च शाखाश्चा स्येतरे जनाः || २-३३-१५_END
BEGIN_
This Rama, the essence of virtue possessing great lustre, is indeed the root of the
tree of humanity. Other men are his flowers, fruits and branches._END

B_2_C_31_24
BEGIN_
रामः तु अनेन वाक्येन सुप्रीतः प्रत्युवाच तम् |
व्रज आपृच्चस्व सौमित्रे सर्वम् एव सुहृज् जनम् || २-३१-२६_END
BEGIN_
Rama, very much delighted of hearing these words, said to him: "Oh, Lakshmana! Go,
take leave of all your friends."_END

B_2_C_34_7
BEGIN_
गमिष्यति महा अरण्यम् तम् पश्य जगती पते |
वृतम् राज गुणैः सर्वैः आदित्यम् इव रश्मिभिः || २-३४-८_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, king! Rama is setting out to a great forest. See him who is resembling a sun
with rays of light, displaying royal qualities."_END

B_2_C_35_1
BEGIN_
यश्यास्तव पतिस्त्यक्तोराजा दशरथः स्वयम् |
भर्ता सर्वस्य जगतः स्थावरस्य चरश्य च || २-३५-५
न ह्यकार्यतमम् किंचित् तव देवीह विद्यते |_END
BEGIN_
"There is nothing on earth, anything which is most disgraceful for you by whom your
husband king Dasaratha the supporter of the entire creation the unmoving and the moving, is
betrayed, Oh, Kaikeyi!"_END

B_2_C_32_19
BEGIN_
अथ अब्रवीद् बाष्प कलांस् तिष्ठतः च उपजीविनः |
सम्प्रदाय बहु द्रव्यम् एकैकस्य उपजीविनः || २-३२-२४_END
BEGIN_
Rama, after giving abundant wealth to each one of the dependents, standing there
with tears in their throats, spoke to them as follows;_END

B_2_C_30_29
BEGIN_
धर्मः तु गज नास ऊरु सद्भिर् आचरितः पुरा |
तम् च अहम् अनुवर्ते अद्य यथा सूर्यम् सुवर्चला || २-३०-३०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh Seetha, with thighs like the posteriors of an elephant! Earlier, righeousness
(like fulfilling the father's command) was practised by good men. Now, I shall follow that
righteousness, like Suvarchala(wife of the sun) following the sun."_END

B_2_C_33_15
BEGIN_
ते लक्ष्मणैव क्षिप्रम् सपत्न्यः सह बान्धवाः |
गच्चन्तम् अनुगच्चामः येन गच्चति राघवः || २-३३-१६_END
BEGIN_
We as such along with our wives and relatives atone will follow Rama in the same way
as Lakshmana is going with the departing Rama._END

B_2_C_31_25
BEGIN_
ये च राज्ञो ददौ दिव्ये महात्मा वरुणः स्वयम् |
जनकस्य महा यज्ञे धनुषी रौद्र दर्शने || २-३१-२७
अभेद्य कवचे दिव्ये तूणी च अक्षय सायकौ |
आदित्य विमलौ च उभौ खड्गौ हेम परिष्कृतौ || २-३१-२८
सत्कृत्य निहितम् सर्वम् एतत् आचार्य सद्मनि |
स त्वम् आयुधम् आदाय क्षिप्रम् आव्रज लक्ष्मण || २-३१-२९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Lakshma! At a grand sacrifice perfomed by Janaka, the great-souled Varuna(god
of water) personally gave heavently bows which are dreadful to look at, divine impenetrable pices
of armour, quivers containing an inexhanstible stock of arms, two swords decked with gold and with
spotless lustre like that of a sun - all these were kept at the residence of our receptor Vasista,
after paying due reverence. Take all those arms and return soon."_END

B_2_C_34_8
BEGIN_
स सत्य वादी धर्म आत्मा गाम्भीर्यात् सागर उपमः |
आकाशैव निष्पन्को नर इन्द्रः प्रत्युवाच तम् || २-३४-९_END
BEGIN_
That king Dasaratha, who speaks truth, whose mind is virtuous, who is like an ocean
by his depth of character and who is blemish less like a sky, replied to Sumantra as follows:_END

B_2_C_35_2
BEGIN_
पतिघ्नीम् त्वामहम् मन्ये कुलघ्नीमपि चान्ततः || २-३५-६
यन्म हेंद्रमिवाजय्यम् दुष्प्रकम्प्यमिवाचलम् |
महोदधिमिवाक्षोभ्यम् सन्तापयसि कर्मभिः || २-३५-७_END
BEGIN_
"King Dasaratha is unconquerable as great Indra, unshakable as mountain and
imperturbable as a great ocean. By tormenting him with your actions, you are considered by me as
murderess of your husband and ultimately the exterminator of your race too."_END

B_2_C_32_20
BEGIN_
लक्ष्मणस्य च यद् वेश्म गृहम् च यद् इदम् मम |
अशून्यम् कार्यम् एकैकम् यावद् आगमनम् मम || २-३२-२५_END
BEGIN_
"Till my return, the house belonging to Lakshmana and also this house which is
occupied by me, should be guarded by each one of you, by turn."_END

B_2_C_30_30
BEGIN_
न खल्वहम् न गच्छेयम् वनम् जनकनन्दिनि |
वचनम् त्न्नयति माम् पितुः सत्योपबृंहितम् || २-३०-३१_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Seetha! I cannot desist from not going to forest. That word, of my father, made
strong by his truthfulnes is taking me to the forest."_END

B_2_C_33_16
BEGIN_
उद्यानानि परित्यज्य क्षेत्राणि च गृहाणि च |
एक दुह्ख सुखा रामम् अनुगच्चाम धार्मिकम् || २-३३-१७_END
BEGIN_
Abandoning gardens fields and houses, we shall follow Rama the righteous man, and
share his joys and sorrows._END

B_2_C_31_26
BEGIN_
स सुहृज् जनम् आमन्त्र्य वन वासाय निश्चितः |
इष्क्वाकु गुरुम् आमन्त्र्य जग्राह आयुधम् उत्तमम् || २-३१-३०_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana, who was assured of his sojourn in the forest, after bidding good bye ot
his friends, approached Vasista the preceptor of Ikshvaku dynasty and took the excellent
armoury._END

B_2_C_34_9
BEGIN_
सुमन्त्र आनय मे दारान् ये केचित् इह मामकाः |
दारैः परिवृतः सर्वैः द्रष्टुम् इच्चामि राघवम् || २-३४-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Sumantra! being all my wives, who are here. Surrounded by all of them, I want
to see the virtuous Rama."_END

B_2_C_32_21
BEGIN_
इति उक्त्वा दुह्खितम् सर्वम् जनम् तम् उपजीविनम् |
उवाच इदम् धन ध्यक्षम् धनम् आनीयताम् इति || २-३२-२६_END
BEGIN_
Having thus ordered those servants distressed as they were, he instructed his
treasurer as follows: "Let my wealth be brought(here)."_END

B_2_C_35_3
BEGIN_
मावमंस्था दशरथम् भर्तारम् वरदम् पतिम् |
भर्तुरिच्छा हि नारीणाम्पुत्रकोट्या विशिष्यते || २-३५-८_END
BEGIN_
"Do not despise Dasaratha the supporter, the bestower of boons and your husband. For
women, will of the husband is superior to that of ten million sons."_END

B_2_C_30_31
BEGIN_
एष धर्मः तु सुश्रोणि पितुर् मातुः च वश्यता |
अतः च आज्ञाम् व्यतिक्रम्य न अहम् जीवितुम् उत्सहे || २-३०-३२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, comely lady! Being obedient to father and mother is one's sacred duty. That is
why, I do not wish to survive, in violation of that duty."_END

B_2_C_33_17
BEGIN_
समुद्धृत निधानानि परिध्वस्त अजिराणि च |
उपात्त धन धान्यानि हृत साराणि सर्वशः || २-३३-१८
रजसा अभ्यवकीर्णानि परित्यक्तानि दैवतैः |
मूषकैः परिधावद्भिरुद्बिलैरावृतानि च || २-३३-१९
अपेतोदकधूमानि हीनसम्मार्जनानि च |
प्रनष्टबलिकर्मेज्यमन्त्रहोमजपानि च || २-३३-२०
दुष्कालेनेव भग्नानि भिभाजनवन्ति च |
अस्मत् त्यक्तानि वेश्मानि कैकेयी प्रतिपद्यताम् || २-३३-२१_END
BEGIN_
Let Kaikeyi obtain the houses deserted by us, their treasures unearthed, their
court-yards in ruined state, their wealth and food grains removed, their best parts robbed off from
all sides, covered by dust, deserted by the deities(presiding them), overrun by mice, coming out of
their holes and turning round here and there, without water and smoke, upswept, the rises of
offering oblations to all creatures as well as the sacred fire, worship of gods, the chanting of
sacred texts and muttering of prayers having altogether ceased, as though dilapidated by adverse
times and scattered with broken vessels._END

B_2_C_34_10
BEGIN_
सो अन्तः पुरम् अतीत्य एव स्त्रियः ता वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् |
आर्यो ह्वयति वो राजा गम्यताम् तत्र माचिरम् || २-३४-११_END
BEGIN_
Sumantra, after entering the gynaecium, spoke these words to those women as follows:
"Oh, the venerable ladies! The king is calling you. Go there without delay._END

B_2_C_31_27
BEGIN_
तत् दिव्यम् राज शार्दूलः सत्कृतम् माल्य भूषितम् |
रामाय दर्शयाम् आस सौमित्रिः सर्वम् आयुधम् || २-३१-३१_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana, a tiger among princes, showed to Rama all those arms, which were divine,
being worshipped and decorated by garlands._END

B_2_C_32_22
BEGIN_
ततः अस्य धनम् आजह्रुः सर्वम् एव उपजीविनः |
स राशिः सुमहांस्तत्र दर्शनीयो ह्यदृश्यत || २-३२-२७_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, the servants brought all the wealth of Rama. That very large heap of
wealth there appeared good-looking._END

B_2_C_35_4
BEGIN_
यथावयो हि राज्यानि प्राप्नुवन्ति नृपक्षये |
इक्ष्वाकुकुलनाथेऽस्मिंस्तल्लोपयितुमिच्छसि || २-३५-९_END
BEGIN_
"After death of a king, kingdoms are obtained as per the age of the princes. But,
you want to deprive this condition in the case of Rama the lord of Ikshvaku dynasty."_END

B_2_C_30_32
BEGIN_
अस्वाधीनम् कथम् दैवम् प्रकारैरभिराध्यते |
स्वाधीनम् समतिक्रम्य मातरम् पितरम् गुरुम् || २-३०-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Mother, father and teacher are at our own disposal. By negelecting them as such,
how can we worship god, who is not at our disposal, by various modes?"_END

B_2_C_33_18
BEGIN_
वनम् नगरम् एव अस्तु येन गच्चति राघवः |
अस्माभिः च परित्यक्तम् पुरम् सम्पद्यताम् वनम् || २-३३-२२_END
BEGIN_
As Rama is going away to the forest, let that forest become a city and let this city
being deserted by us become a forest._END

B_2_C_34_11
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्ताः स्त्रियः सर्वाः सुमन्त्रेण नृप आज्ञया |
प्रचक्रमुस् तत् भवनम् भर्तुर् आज्ञाय शासनम् || २-३४-१२_END
BEGIN_
All those women, asked thus by Sumantra as per the king's orders, went to his
palace, after knowing the instructions of their husband._END

B_2_C_31_28
BEGIN_
तम् उवाच आत्मवान् रामः प्रीत्या लक्ष्मणम् आगतम् |
काले त्वम् आगतः सौम्य कान्क्षिते मम लक्ष्मण || २-३१-३२_END
BEGIN_
Rama, who had fully controlled his mind, affectionately spoke as follows to
Lakshmana who arrived: "Oh, Lakshmana, the excellent man! You came in time as desired by me."_END

B_2_C_32_23
BEGIN_
ततः स पुरुष व्याघ्रः तत् धनम् सह लक्ष्मणः |
द्विजेभ्यो बाल वृद्धेभ्यः कृपणेभ्यो अभ्यदापयत् || २-३२-२८_END
BEGIN_
Rama, the tiger among men, along with Lakshmana then caused that wealth to be
distributed among the brahmanas, the children, the old-aged and the pitiable._END

B_2_C_35_5
BEGIN_
राजा भवतु ते पुत्रो भरतश्शास्तु मेदिनीम् |
वयम् तत्र गमिष्यामो रामो यत्र गमिष्यति || २-३५-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Let your son Bharata become the king and rule the earth. wherever Rama goes, we (on
our part) shall go there"._END

B_2_C_30_33
BEGIN_
यत्त्रयम् तत्त्रयो लोकाः पवित्रम् तत्समम् भुवि |
नान्यदस्ति शुभापाङ्गे तेनेदमभिराध्यते || २-३०-३४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, lady with enchanting glances! The triad of mother, father and teacher is the
world-triad. There is none other in the world equal to it. Hence, this triad is worthy of
worship."_END

B_2_C_33_19
BEGIN_
बिलानि दम्ष्ट्रिणः सर्वे सानूनि मृग पक्षिणः |
अस्मत् त्यक्तम् प्रपद्यन्ताम् सेव्यमानम् त्यजन्तु च || २-३३-२३
इति एवम् विविधा वाचो नाना जन समीरिताः |_END
BEGIN_
Scared by fear of us, let all the snakes abandon their holes, the dears and birds
the mountain peaks, the elephants and the lions the forest itself. let them leave the region going
to be inhabited by us and reach the city of Ayodhya._END

B_2_C_31_29
BEGIN_
अहम् प्रदातुम् इच्चामि यद् इदम् मामकम् धनम् |
ब्राह्मणेभ्यः तपस्विभ्यः त्वया सह परम्तप || २-३१-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Lakshmana, the chastiser of foes! along with you, I want to give all this wealth
pertaining to me to brahmanas, practising ansterities."_END

B_2_C_34_12
BEGIN_
अर्ध सप्त शताः ताः तु प्रमदाः ताम्र लोचनाः |
कौसल्याम् परिवार्य अथ शनैः जग्मुर् धृत व्रताः || २-३४-१३_END
BEGIN_
Encircling Kausalya, three hundred fifty women, steadfast in their vow(of devotion
to their husband), with their eyes reddened, went there slowly._END

B_2_C_32_24
BEGIN_
तत्र आसीत् पिन्गलो गार्ग्यः त्रिजटः नाम वै द्विजः |
क्षतवृत्तिर्वने नित्यम् फालकुद्दाललाङ्गली || २-३२-२९_END
BEGIN_
"There lived a brahmana by name Trijata who was born in garga community and was
reddish born in colour. He used to make his living in the forest by digging the soil, always
carrying an axe, a spade and a plough."_END

B_2_C_35_6
BEGIN_
न हि ते विषये कश्चिद्ब्राह्मणो वस्तुमर्हति |
तादृशम् त्वममर्यादमद्य कर्म चिकीर्षसि || २-३५-११_END
BEGIN_
"Now any brahmana cannot indeed dwell in your kigdom as now you want to do such an
act, transgressing the due limits."_END

B_2_C_30_34
BEGIN_
न सत्यम् दानमानौ वा न यज्ञाश्चाप्तदक्षिणाः |
तथा बलकराः सीते यथा सेवा पितुर्मता || २-३०-३५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Seetha! In which manner service to father is regarded as strengthening, in the
same manner truth or sacrificial rites where presents are received by officiating priest are not
strengthening."_END

B_2_C_33_20
BEGIN_
तृणमांसफलादानाम् देशम् व्यालमृगद्विजम् || २-३३-२४
प्रपद्यताम् हि कैकेयी सपुत्रा सहबान्धवैः |
राघावेण वने सर्वे सह वत्स्याम निर्वृताः || २-३३-२५_END
BEGIN_
Let Kaikeyi with her son along with her relatives indeed inhabit the region where
ferocious animals and vultures live with grass, meat and fruits. Let us all (on the other hand)
live happily in the forest along with Rama._END

B_2_C_31_30
BEGIN_
वसन्ति इह दृढम् भक्त्या गुरुषु द्विज सत्तमाः |
तेषाम् अपि च मे भूयः सर्वेषाम् च उपजीविनाम् || २-३१-३४_END
BEGIN_
"I also desire to give to those excellent brahmanas residing here as strong devotees
to their proceptors and to all my dependents."_END

B_2_C_32_25
BEGIN_
तम् वृद्धम् तरुणी भार्या बालानादाय दारकान् |
अब्रवीद्बाह्मणम् वाक्यम् दारिद्र्येणाभिपीडिता || २-३२-३०_END
BEGIN_
His young wife, having been afflicted with poverty, taking her small children with
her, spoke to that aged brahmana as follows:_END

B_2_C_34_13
BEGIN_
आगतेषु च दारेषु समवेक्ष्य मही पतिः |
उवाच राजा तम् सूतम् सुमन्त्र आनय मे सुतम् || २-३४-१४_END
BEGIN_
After arrival of his wives, king Dasaratha spoke to that charioteer as follows, "Oh,
Sumantra! Bring my son here."_END

B_2_C_35_7
BEGIN_
नूनम् सर्वे गमिष्यामो मार्गम् रामनिषेवितम् |
त्यक्ताया बान्धवैः सर्वैर्ब्राह्मणैः साधुभिः सदा || २-३५-१२
का प्रीती राज्यलाभेन तव देवि भविष्यति |
तादृशम् त्वममर्यादम् कर्म कर्तुम् चिकीर्षसि || २-३५-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Certainly, all of us will proceed in the path followed by Rama. Oh, queen Kaikeyi!
What pleasure will be derived through attainment of soverignity, when your relatives, all brahmanas
and pious souls desert you forever? Now, you want to do such an act of impropriety"_END

B_2_C_30_35
BEGIN_
स्वर्गो धनम् वा धान्यम् वा विद्याः पुत्राः सुखानि च |
गुरुवृत्त्यनुरोधेन न किंचित्\dapi दुर्लभम् || २-३०-३६_END
BEGIN_
"By compliance with the wishes of one's elders, heavenly bliss or riches, foodgrains
or leaving, sons or amenities of life - nothing whatsoever is hard to obtain."_END

B_2_C_33_21
BEGIN_
इत्येवम् विविधा वाचो नानाजनसमीरिताः|
शुश्राव रामः श्रुत्वा च न विचक्रे अस्य मानसम् || २-३३-२६_END
BEGIN_
Rama heard various kinds of remarks thus made by many people. Hearing them also, his
mind was not disturbed._END

B_2_C_31_31
BEGIN_
वसिष्ठ पुत्रम् तु सुयज्ञम् आर्यम् |
त्वम् आनय आशु प्रवरम् द्विजानाम् |
अभिप्रयास्यामि वनम् समस्तान् |
अभ्यर्च्य शिष्टान् अपरान् द्विजातीन् || २-३१-३५_END
BEGIN_
"You bring boon the venerable Suyagna, the son of Vasista, the best. After adoring
all other brahmanas also who are cultured, I will go to the forest."_END

B_2_C_32_26
BEGIN_
अपास्य फालम् कुद्दालम् कुरुष्व वचनम् ममम् |
रामम् दर्शय धर्मज्ज़्नम् यदि किंचिदवाप्स्यसि || २-३२-३१_END
BEGIN_
"Throw away the axe and the spade. Carry out my word. Seek for the presence of Rama
who knows his duty and see if you get at least something."_END

B_2_C_34_14
BEGIN_
स सूतः रामम् आदाय लक्ष्मणम् मैथिलीम् तदा |
जगाम अभिमुखः तूर्णम् सकाशम् जगती पतेः || २-३४-१५_END
BEGIN_
Taking Rama, Lakshmana and Seetha, that charioteer then speedily went to the king's
presence._END

B_2_C_35_8
BEGIN_
आश्चर्यमिव पश्यामि यस्यास्ते वृत्तमीदृशम् |
आचरन्त्या न विदृता सद्यो भवति मेदिनी || २-३५-१४_END
BEGIN_
"I am looking only with surprise, why the earth is not immediately rent asunder,
while you conduct yourself with such an act"_END

B_2_C_30_36
BEGIN_
देवगन्धर्वगोलोकान् ब्रह्मलोकम् तथापरान् |
प्राप्नुवन्ति महात्मानो मातापितृपरायणाः || २-३०-३७_END
BEGIN_
"High souled men, wholly devoted to their parents obtain the regions of gods and the
gandharvas, the seventh heaven presided the gandharvas, the seventh heaven presided by Brahma (the
creator) and Goloka (the highest heaven abiding in cows and presided over by Sri Radha and Sri
Krishna the first couple)._END

B_2_C_36_0
BEGIN_
ततः सुमन्त्रम् ऐक्ष्वाकः पीडितः अत्र प्रतिज्ञया |
सबाष्पम् अतिनिह्श्वस्य जगाद इदम् पुनः पुनः || २-३६-१_END
BEGIN_
Then, Dasaratha the scion of Ikshvaku dynasty, squeezed by his own promise in the
matter of sending Rama to exile, sighed heavily with tears and spoke the following words again and
agian to Sumantra._END

B_2_C_33_22
BEGIN_
स तु वेश्म पितुर्दूरा त्कैलासशिखरप्रभम् |
अभिचक्राम धर्मात्मा मत्तमातङ्गविक्रमः || २-३३-२७_END
BEGIN_
That Rama the virtuous man, by walking with strides of an elephant in rut,
approached his father's palace, which from a distance glowed like a peak of the Kailasa
mountain._END

B_2_C_32_27
BEGIN_
स भार्यावचनम् श्रुत्वा शाटीमाच्छाद्य दुश्छदाम् |
स प्रतिष्ठत पन्थानम् यत्र रामनिवेशनम् || २-३२-३२_END
BEGIN_
He heard the request of his wife, wrapped a strip of cloth that could hardly cover
his body and set out towards the track wherein lies Rama's palace._END

B_2_C_34_15
BEGIN_
स राजा पुत्रम् आयान्तम् दृष्ट्वा दूरात् कृत अन्जलिम् |
उत्पपात आसनात् तूर्णम् आर्तः स्त्री जन सम्वृतः || २-३४-१६_END
BEGIN_
King Dasaratha surrounded by women, seeing from a distance his son coming with
folded hands, distressed as he was, rose swiftly from his seat._END

B_2_C_35_9
BEGIN_
महाब्रह्मर्षिसृष्टा वा ज्वलन्तो भीमदर्शना |
धिग्वाग्दण्डणा न हिंसन्ति रामप्रव्राजने स्थिताम् || २-३५-१५_END
BEGIN_
"It is also surprising me why rods of reproaching words fiery and fearful to look at
uttered by great brahmana sages are not killing you, who are bent on sending Rama to exile."_END

B_2_C_30_37
BEGIN_
स माम् पिता यथा शास्ति सत्य धर्म पथे स्थितः |
तथा वर्तितुम् इच्चामि स हि धर्मः सनातनः || २-३०-३८_END
BEGIN_
"I desire to obey in the same manner as to how my father, abiding in truthfulness
and virtue, commands me. That itself is indeed the law of morality, which is eternal."_END

B_2_C_36_1
BEGIN_
सूत रत्न सुसम्पूर्णा चतुर् विध बला चमूः |
रागवस्य अनुयात्रा अर्थम् क्षिप्रम् प्रतिविधीयताम् || २-३६-२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Sumantra! Let a military body consisting of (all) the four limbs of the arms,
filled with the best of its kind, be arranged immediately"_END

B_2_C_33_23
BEGIN_
विनीतवीरपुरुषं प्रविश्य तु नृपालयम् |
ददर्शवस्थितम् दीनम् सुमन्त्रमविदूरतः || २-३३-२८_END
BEGIN_
After entering the royal palace, which had in it disciplined and valiant attendants,
saw Sumantra standing dejected not far from the palace._END

B_2_C_32_28
BEGIN_
भृग्वङ्गिरसमम् दीप्त्या त्रिजटम् जनसंसदि |
आ पन्चमायाः कक्ष्याया न एनम् कश्चित् अवारयत् || २-३२-३३_END
BEGIN_
Up to the fifth gate, none in that society of men could obstruct this Trijata, who
was equal in spiritual splendour with the sages Bhrigu and Angira._END

B_2_C_34_16
BEGIN_
सो अभिदुद्राव वेगेन रामम् दृष्ट्वा विशाम् पतिः |
तम् असम्प्राप्य दुह्ख आर्तः पपात भुवि मूर्चितः || २-३४-१७_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Rama, King Dasaratha ran speedily towards him. But without reaching him he
fell on the floor senseless, afflicted as he was with sorrow._END

B_2_C_35_10
BEGIN_
आम्रम् चित्वा कुठारेन निम्बम् परिचरेत्तु यः |
यश्चेनम् पयसा सिञ्चेन्नैवास्य मधुरो भवेत् || २-३५-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Who will nurture a neem tree, cutting down a mango tree with an axe? And a neem
tree will not turn sweet for him who nourishes it with milk."_END

B_2_C_30_38
BEGIN_
मम सन्ना मतिः सीते त्वाम् नेतुम् दण्डकावनम् |
वसिष्यामीति सात्वम् मामनुयातुम् सुनिश्चिता || २-३०-३९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Seetha! My mind was depressed to take you to the forest of Dandaka. But you are
saying that you will reside in the forst, duly determined to follow me."_END

B_2_C_36_2
BEGIN_
रूप आजीवा च शालिन्यो वणिजः च महा धनाः |
शोभयन्तु कुमारस्य वाहिनीम् सुप्रसारिताः || २-३६-३_END
BEGIN_
"Let courtesans well versed in speaking and merchants with great riches having
exposure for extension of sales bestow elegance to the forces of the Prince"_END

B_2_C_33_24
BEGIN_
प्रतीक्षमाणो अभिजनम् तदा आर्तम् |
अनार्त रूपः प्रहसन्न् इव अथ|
जगाम रामः पितरम् दिदृक्षुः |
पितुर् निदेशम् विधिवच् चिकीर्षुः || २-३३-२९_END
BEGIN_
The, Rama even on seeing the people disturbed, appeared unmoved and smiling,
intending to fulfill his father's behest and went to see his father._END

B_2_C_32_29
BEGIN_
स राज पुत्रम् आसाद्य त्रिजटः वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् |
निर्धनो बहु पुत्रः अस्मि राज पुत्र महा यशः |
क्षतवृत्तिर्वने नित्यम् प्रत्यवेक्षस्व मामिति || २-३२-३४_END
BEGIN_
That Trijata having approached the prince Rama, spoke the following words: "Oh, the
most illustrious prince! I am a destitute, having many children in my family. I always dwell in the
forest, with an occupation of digging the soil. Look to me, as you know."_END

B_2_C_35_11
BEGIN_
अभिजात्यम् हि ते मन्ये यथा मातुस्तथैव च |
न हि निम्बात्स्रवेत्क्षौद्रम् लोके निगदितम् वचः || २-३५-१७_END
BEGIN_
"I think, by birth your nature is as exactly as that of your mother. a proverb is
quoted in the world saying that honey does not ooze from a neem tree."_END

B_2_C_34_17
BEGIN_
तम् रामः अभ्यपातत् क्षिप्रम् लक्ष्मणः च महा रथः |
विसम्ज्ञम् इव दुह्खेन सशोकम् नृपतिम् तदा || २-३४-१८_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama and Lakshmana an eminent car-warrior, quickly approached that king who
seemed unconscious with full of grief as he was, through agony._END

B_2_C_30_39
BEGIN_
सा हि दिष्टाऽनवद्याङ्गी वनाय वदिरेक्षणे |
अनुगच्चस्व माम् भीरु सह धर्म चरी भव || २-३०-४०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, mistress with fascinating eyes and flawless limbs! Since you were allowed to
come to forest, Oh Seetha the timid lady, follow me and become my help-mate."_END

B_2_C_33_25
BEGIN_
तत् पूर्वम् ऐक्ष्वाक सुतः महात्मा |
रामः गमिष्यन् वनम् आर्त रूपम् |
व्यतिष्ठत प्रेक्ष्य तदा सुमन्त्रम् |
पितुर् महात्मा प्रतिहारण अर्थम् || २-३३-३०_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Sumantra appearing disturbed before that, Rama the son of Dasaratha( a scion
of Ikshhvaaku) whose mind is mighty and who is setting out to the forest, waited awhile to have his
presence announced to his father._END

B_2_C_36_3
BEGIN_
ये च एनम् उपजीवन्ति रमते यैः च वीर्यतः |
तेषाम् बहु विधम् दत्त्वा तान् अपि अत्र नियोजय || २-३६-४_END
BEGIN_
Appoint in this contingent those too, by giving abundant money to them who were
dependent on Rama and on whom he took delight in gallantry"_END

B_2_C_32_30
BEGIN_
तमुवाच ततो रामः परिहाससमन्वितम् |
गवाम् सहस्रमप्येकम् न च विश्राणितम् मया |
परिक्षिपसि दण्डेन यावत्तावदवाप्य्ससि || २-३२-३५_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Rama replied jestingly to him as follows: " By me, even one thousand cows
were not given away so far. You will get as many cows to such an extent as you will throw this
staff."_END

B_2_C_35_12
BEGIN_
तव मातुरसद्ग्राहम् विद्मः पूर्वम् यथाश्रुतम् |
पितुस्ते वरदः कश्चिद्ददौ वरमनुत्तमम् || २-३५-१८
सर्वभूतरुतम् तस्मात्सम्जज्ञे वसुधाधिपः |
तेन तिर्यग्गतानाम् च भूतानाम् विदितम् वचः || २-३५-१९_END
BEGIN_
"We know, as heard of in the past, your mother's conduct of evil satisfaction.
Someone capable of giving boons, granted a great boon to your father. By that boon he could
identify the language of all created beings. The talk of those beings belonging to sub human
species could be known by him."_END

B_2_C_34_18
BEGIN_
स्त्री सहस्र निनादः च सम्जज्ञे राज वेश्मनि |
हाहा राम इति सहसा भूषण ध्वनि मूर्चितः || २-३४-१९_END
BEGIN_
Sounds of thousands of women crying "Alas! Alas! Oh Rama!" generated all at once
from the royal palace, mixed with the sound of tinkling ornaments._END

B_2_C_30_40
BEGIN_
सर्वथा सदृशम् सीते मम स्वस्य कुलस्य च |
व्यवसायमनुक्रान्ता कान्ते त्वमतिशोभनम् || २-३०-४१_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Seetha the beautiful! You adopted very auspicious resolve, suitable in all ways
to me and to your race."_END

B_2_C_33_26
BEGIN_
पितुर्निदेशेन तु धर्मवत्सलो |
वन प्रवेशे कृत बुद्धि निश्चयः |
स राघवः प्रेक्ष्य सुमन्त्रम् अब्रवीन् |
निवेदयस्व आगमनम् नृपाय मे || २-३३-३१_END
BEGIN_
That Rama, who had passion towards piety, having made up his mind positively to
enter the exile as per his father's command, spoke thus, seeing Sumantra, "Inform my arrival to the
king."_END

B_2_C_36_4
BEGIN_
आयुधानि च मुख्यानि नागराः शकटानि च |
अनुगच्छन्तु काकुत्थ्सम् व्याधाश्चारण्यगोचराः || २-३६-५_END
BEGIN_
"Let important weapons, chiefs of police and vehicles, hunters knowing the secrets
of forest accompany Rama(scion of Kakutsa)"_END

B_2_C_32_31
BEGIN_
स शाटीम् त्वरितः कट्याम् सम्ब्रान्तः परिवेष्ट्य ताम् |
आविद्ध्य दण्डम् चिक्षेप सर्वप्राणेन वेगितः || २-३२-३६_END
BEGIN_
Winding his loin cloth round his waist hurrily and twirling his staff, he swiftly
threw it with all his strength, excited as he was._END

B_2_C_35_13
BEGIN_
ततो जृम्भस्य शयने विरुताद्भूरिवर्चसा |
पितुस्ते विदितो भावः स तत्र बहुधाऽहसत् || २-३५-२०_END
BEGIN_
"From the sound of an ant called Jrimbha near his bed, the meaning of that sound was
deciphered by your exceedingly brilliant father and he laughed over it repeatedly."_END

B_2_C_34_19
BEGIN_
तम् परिष्वज्य बाहुभ्याम् ताव् उभौ राम लक्ष्मणौ |
पर्यन्के सीतया सार्धम् रुदन्तः समवेशयन् || २-३४-२०_END
BEGIN_
Holding Dasaratha in their arms and crying, both Rama and Lakshmana along with
Seetha laid him on the couch._END

B_2_C_30_41
BEGIN_
आरभस्व शुभश्रोणि वनवासक्षमाः क्रियाः |
नेदानीम् त्वदृते सीते स्वर्गोऽपि मम रोचते || २-३०-४२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, lady with charming hip and loins! Now itself, begin with duties appropriate for
living in exile. Oh, Seetha! Even a heaven is not a liking to me without your presence."_END

B_2_C_36_5
BEGIN_
निघ्नन् मृगान् कुन्जरामः च पिबमः च आरण्यकम् मधु |
नदीः च विविधाः पश्यन् न राज्यम् संस्मरिष्यति || २-३६-६_END
BEGIN_
"Killing deer and elephants, drinking forest-honey, seeing various rivers, he would
not remember of sovereignty"_END

B_2_C_32_32
BEGIN_
स तीर्त्वा सरयूपारम् दण्डस्तस्य कराच्च्युतः |
गोव्रजे बहुसाहास्रे पपातोक्षणसन्निधौ || २-३२-३७_END
BEGIN_
Flying away from his hand and crossing across the Sarayu river, that staff fell
close to a bull amidst a flock of cows numbering in several thousands._END

B_2_C_35_14
BEGIN_
तत्र ते जननी क्रुद्धा मृत्युपाशमभीप्सती |
हासम् ते नृपते सौम्य जिज्ञासामीति भाब्रवीत् || २-३५-२१_END
BEGIN_
Your mother, becoming angry over his laugh, wishing even to hand him to death(in
case he refuses to disclose the reason for his laughter), spoke thus: "Oh king, the gentle sir! I
want to know the meaning of your laughter."_END

B_2_C_34_20
BEGIN_
अथ रामः मुहूर्तेन लब्ध सम्ज्ञम् मही पतिम् |
उवाच प्रान्जलिर् भूत्वा शोक अर्णव परिप्लुतम् || २-३४-२१_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama with folded hands spoke thus to king Dasaratha who got consciousness
within a short time and who was inundated in a sea of sorrow._END

B_2_C_30_42
BEGIN_
ब्राह्मणेभ्यः च रत्नानि भिक्षुकेभ्यः च भोजनम् |
देहि च आशंसमानेभ्यः सम्त्वरस्व च माचिरम् || २-३०-४३_END
BEGIN_
"Give valuable gifts to Brahmanas and food to mendicants. Be very quick. Do not
delay."_END

B_2_C_36_6
BEGIN_
धान्य कोशः च यः कश्चित् धन कोशः च मामकः |
तौ रामम् अनुगच्चेताम् वसन्तम् निर्जने वने || २-३६-७_END
BEGIN_
"Let the granary and the treasury belonging to me be sent to Rama residing in the
uninhabited forest."_END

B_2_C_32_33
BEGIN_
तम् परिष्वज्य धर्मात्मा आतस्मात्सरयूतटात् |
आनयामास ता गोपैस्त्रिजटायाश्रमम् प्रति || २-३२-३८_END
BEGIN_
Embracing him, Rama of virtuous mind caused to be delivered to Trijata's hermitage
the cows up to that bank of Sarayu._END

B_2_C_35_15
BEGIN_
नृपश्चोवाच ताम् देवीम् देवि शंसामि ते यदि |
ततो मे मरणम् सद्यो भविष्यति न संशयः || २-३५-२२_END
BEGIN_
"The king replied to that queen as follows: "Oh, royal lady! If I tell you the
reason of my laughter, my death will immediately follow thereafter. There is no doubt about
it."_END

B_2_C_34_21
BEGIN_
आपृच्चे त्वाम् महा राज सर्वेषाम् ईश्वरः असि नः |
प्रस्थितम् दण्डक अरण्यम् पश्य त्वम् कुशलेन माम् || २-३४-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, emperor! I take leave of you, who are the lord of all of us. See auspiciously
towards me, who am about to leave for Dandaka forest."_END

B_2_C_37_0
BEGIN_
महा मात्र वचः श्रुत्वा रामः दशरथम् तदा |
अन्वभाषत वाक्यम् तु विनयज्ञो विनीतवत् || २-३७-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of the chief minister, Rama who was well-versed in courtesy, spoke
then to Dasaratha as follows:_END

B_2_C_30_43
BEGIN_
भूषणानि महार्हाणि वरवस्त्राणि यानि च |
रमणीयाश्च ये केचित्क्रीडार्थाश्चापुयुपस्कराः || २-३०-४४
शयनीयानि यानानि मम चान्यानि यानि च |
देहि स्वभृत्यवर्गस्य ब्राह्मणानामनन्तरम् || २-३०-४५_END
BEGIN_
"Give to the various classes of your dependents whatever costly ornaments, beautiful
and fine articles of wearing apparel, gadgets used for sports, my couches, conveyances and other
articles left after satisfying brahmanas."_END

B_2_C_36_7
BEGIN_
यजन् पुण्येषु देशेषु विसृजमः च आप्त दक्षिणाः |
ऋषिभिः च समागम्य प्रवत्स्यति सुखम् वने || २-३६-८_END
BEGIN_
"Rama can spend his exile happily, by performing sacrificial rite in holy places and
disbursing appropriate gifts, along with sages living in the forest "_END

B_2_C_32_34
BEGIN_
उवाच च ततो रामस्तम् गार्ग्यमभिसान्त्वयन् |
मन्युर्न खलु कर्तव्यः परिहासो ह्ययम् मम || २-३२-३९_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Rama pacifyingly spoke to that son of Gargi as follows: "You need not
express your contempt, for this was only a jest indulged in by me."_END

B_2_C_34_22
BEGIN_
लक्ष्मणम् च अनुजानीहि सीता च अन्वेति माम् वनम् |
कारणैः बहुभिस् तथ्यैः वार्यमाणौ न च इच्चतः || २-३४-२३_END
BEGIN_
"Permit Lakshmana also and Seetha too who is accompanying me to the forest. Even if
prevented(by me0 on many true reasons, these two are not agreeing to stay behind"_END

B_2_C_35_16
BEGIN_
माता ते पितरम् देवि ततह् केकयमब्रवीत् |
