शंस मे जीव वा मा वा न मामपहसिष्यसि || २-३५-२३_END
BEGIN_
"Your mother then said to your father, the king of Kekayas, Live or die as you will.
tell me the laughter. Do not ridicule me."_END

B_2_C_37_1
BEGIN_
त्यक्त भोगस्य मे राजन् वने वन्येन जीवतः |
किम् कार्यम् अनुयात्रेण त्यक्त सन्गस्य सर्वतः || २-३७-२_END
BEGIN_
"Of what use for me, who have forsaken enjoyments, cast away attachment for
everything and am going to live in the forest on nomadic food, Oh king, with an army accompanying
me?"_END

B_2_C_30_44
BEGIN_
अनुकूलम् तु सा भर्तुर् ज्ञात्वा गमनम् आत्मनः |
क्षिप्रम् प्रमुदिता देवी दातुम् एव उपचक्रमे || २-३०-४६_END
BEGIN_
Seetha the divine lady, elated to know her departure acceptable to her husband,
quickly set about, making gifts._END

B_2_C_36_8
BEGIN_
भरतः च महा बाहुर् अयोध्याम् पालयिष्यति |
सर्व कामैः पुनः श्रीमान् रामः संसाध्यताम् इति || २-३६-९_END
BEGIN_
"The mighty armed Bharata will rule Ayodhya. Let the glorious Rama be sent alog with
all objects of enjoyment"_END

B_2_C_32_35
BEGIN_
इदम् हि तेजस्तव यद्धुरत्ययम् |
तदेव जिज्ञासितु मिच्छता मया |
इमम् भवानर्थमभिप्रचोदितो |
वृणीष्व किंचेदपरम् व्यवस्यति || २-३२-४०_END
BEGIN_
"I only desired to know your strength, which is unfathomable and hence this trial
for you. If you desire any other thing, opt for it."_END

B_2_C_35_17
BEGIN_
प्रियया च तथोक्तः सन् केकयः पृथीवीपतिः |
तस्मै तम् वरदायार्थम् कथयामास तत्त्वतः || २-३५-२४_END
BEGIN_
Having been spoken thus by his beloved consort, the said king of the Kekayas on his
part correctly reported the matter to the sage who had bestowed the boon on him._END

B_2_C_34_23
BEGIN_
अनुजानीहि सर्वान् नः शोकम् उत्सृज्य मानद |
लक्ष्मणम् माम् च सीताम् च प्रजापतिर् इव प्रजाः || २-३४-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Giving up grief, Oh the bestower of honour, grant leave to all of us, Lakshmana
myself and Seetha as Brahma(the lord of creation) did to his sons(sanaka and his three brothers who
intended to go to forest for practising austerities)."_END

B_2_C_37_2
BEGIN_
यो हि दत्त्वा द्विप श्रेष्ठम् कक्ष्यायाम् कुरुते मनः |
रज्जु स्नेहेन किम् तस्य त्यजतः कुन्जर उत्तमम् || २-३७-३_END
BEGIN_
"Who, after giving away a first-class elephant, will work out his mind on a rope
with which it is tied? What use is there for him through attachment to the rope after abandaning
the excellent elephant?"_END

B_2_C_30_45
BEGIN_
ततः प्रहृष्टा परिपूर्ण मानसा |
यशस्विनी भर्तुर् अवेक्ष्य भाषितम् |
धनानि रत्नानि च दातुम् अन्गना |
प्रचक्रमे धर्मभृताम् मनस्विनी || २-३०-४७_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, the illustrious and pure-minded lady, becoming delighted on hearing the
speech of her husband, started giving riches and valuable gifts to virtuous souls._END

B_2_C_36_9
BEGIN_
एवम् ब्रुवति काकुत्स्थे कैकेय्या भयम् आगतम् |
मुखम् च अपि अगमात् शेषम् स्वरः च अपि न्यरुध्यत || २-३६-१०_END
BEGIN_
While Dasartha was speaking thus, fear drew near Kaikeyi. Her mouth too also got
parched. her voice also got choked._END

B_2_C_32_36
BEGIN_
ब्रवीमि सत्येन न तेऽस्ति यन्त्रणा |
धनम् हि यद्यन्मम विप्रकारणात् |
भवत्सु सम्यक्र्पतिपादनेन त |
न्मयार्जितम् प्रीतियश्स्करम् भवेत् || २-३२-४१_END
BEGIN_
" I am telling the truth here. There is no limitation for you. Whatever riches
belonging to me, are indeed for brahmanas. If the wealth earned by me is given abundantly to you,
it will bring in joy and fame."_END

B_2_C_35_18
BEGIN_
ततः स वरदह् साधु राजानम् प्रत्यभाषत |
म्रियताम् ध्वंसताम् वेयम् मा कृथास्त्वम् महीपते || २-३५-२५_END
BEGIN_
Then the sage who had bestowed the boon replied to the king as follows: "Oh, lord of
the earth! Let her die or ruin. Do not reveal the reason to her."_END

B_2_C_34_24
BEGIN_
प्रतीक्षमाणम् अव्यग्रम् अनुज्ञाम् जगती पतेः |
उवाच रर्जा सम्प्रेक्ष्य वन वासाय राघवम् || २-३४-२५_END
BEGIN_
Gazing at Rama who is unruffled, awaiting permission of the king for stay in the
forest, the king Dasaratha spoke thus:_END

B_2_C_37_3
BEGIN_
तथा मम सताम् श्रेष्ठ किम् ध्वजिन्या जगत् पते |
सर्वाणि एव अनुजानामि चीराणि एव आनयन्तु मे || २-३७-४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, the best among good men! So also, what use is there for me by the army Oh,
King, when I am giving away absolutely all. Let the dresses of a mendicant be brought to me.'_END

B_2_C_36_10
BEGIN_
सा विषण्णा च सम्त्रस्ता कैकेयी वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् |
राजानमेवाभिमुखी कैकेयी वाक्यमब्रवीत् || २-३६-११_END
BEGIN_
Feeling depressed and apprehensive, with her mouth getthing parched and her face
turned towards the king, Kaikeyi spoke as follows:_END

B_2_C_32_37
BEGIN_
तत स्सभार्य स्त्रिजटो महामुनि |
र्गवामनीकम् प्रतिगृह्य मोदितः |
यशोबलप्रीतिसुखोपबृम्हणी |
स्तदाशिषः प्रत्यवदन्महात्मनः || २-३२-४२_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Trijata along with his wife accepted that flock of cows and were
delighted. Then, he pronounced on Rama the virtuous man, the blessings to enhance reputation,
strength, delight and happiness._END

B_2_C_35_19
BEGIN_
स तच्छ्रुत्वा वचस्तस्य प्रसन्नमनसो नृपः |
मातरम् ते निरस्याशु विजहार कुबेरवत् || २-३५-२६_END
BEGIN_
"Having heard the words of that sage who was pure-minded, the king repudiated your
mother and lived happily like Kubera the Lord of riches."_END

B_2_C_34_25
BEGIN_
अहम् राघव कैकेय्या वर दानेन मोहितः |
अयोध्यायाः त्वम् एव अद्य भव राजा निगृह्य माम् || २-३४-२६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! I was stupefied by Kaikeyi through a boon. Now, by confining me, be you
the king of Ayodhya."_END

B_2_C_37_4
BEGIN_
खनित्र पिटके च उभे मम आनयत गच्चतः |
चतुर् दश वने वासम् वर्षाणि वसतः मम || २-३७-५_END
BEGIN_
"I am going to reside in the abode of forest for fourteen years. Bring a shoel and a
basket both for me."_END

B_2_C_36_11
BEGIN_
राज्यम् गत जनम् साधो पीत मण्डाम् सुराम् इव |
निरास्वाद्यतमम् शून्यम् भरतः न अभिपत्स्यते || २-३६-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Bharata will not accept the kingdom, which will become uninhabited, hollow and
which will be absolutely unenjoyable like wine, quaffed of its spiriteous part, Oh noble soul!"_END

B_2_C_32_38
BEGIN_
स चापि रामः प्रतिपूर्णमानसो |
महद्धनम् धर्मबलैरुपार्जितम् |
नियोजयामास सुहृज्जनेऽचिरा |
द्यथार्हसम्मानवचःप्रचोदितः || २-३२-४३_END
BEGIN_
Rama being inspired by the befitting words of honour and having his heart satisfied,
immediately bestowed on friendly people, a great wealth earned by righteous might._END

B_2_C_35_20
BEGIN_
तथा त्वमपि राजानम् दुर्जनाचरिते पथि |
असद्ग्राहमिमम् मोहात्कुरुषे पापदर्शिनि || २-३५-२७_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Kaikeyi, seeing evil everywhere! You, too, thus following the path trodden by
wicked men, are making this bad resolution by ignorance."_END

B_2_C_34_26
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्तः नृपतिना रामः धर्मभृताम् वरः |
प्रत्युवाच अन्जलिम् कृत्वा पितरम् वाक्य कोविदः || २-३४-२७_END
BEGIN_
When told thus by the king, Rama the best man in supporting righteousness and who is
proficient in expression, replied( as follows) to his father, after making salutation with joined
palms._END

B_2_C_37_5
BEGIN_
अथ चीराणि कैकेयी स्वयम् आहृत्य राघवम् |
उवाच परिधत्स्व इति जन ओघे निरपत्रपा || २-३७-६_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Kaikeyi shamelessly bringing personally of men, said to Rama; "Put these
on"_END

B_2_C_36_12
BEGIN_
कैकेय्याम् मुक्त लज्जायाम् वदन्त्याम् अतिदारुणम् |
राजा दशरथो वाक्यम् उवाच आयत लोचनाम् || २-३६-१३_END
BEGIN_
While Kaikeyi who has cast off her shame was thus uttering th emost cruel words,
King Dasaratha spoke these words to that lady with large eyes:_END

B_2_C_32_39
BEGIN_
द्विजः सुहृद्भृत्यजनोऽथवा तदा |
दरिद्रभिक्षाचरणश्च योऽभवत् |
न तत्र कश्चिन्न बभूव तर्पितो |
यथार्ह सम्मानन दान सम्ब्रमैः || २-३२-४४_END
BEGIN_
At that time in Ayodhya, there was no brahmana, relative, dependant, pauper or
mendicant who was not satiated with befittingly deserving honour, gifts and respect._END

B_2_C_35_21
BEGIN_
सत्यश्चाद्य प्रवादोऽयम् लौकिकः प्रतिभाति मा |
पित्ऱ्^ऊन् समनुजायन्ते नरा मातरमङ्गनाः || २-३५-२८_END
BEGIN_
"The popular saying that males are born confirming to their fathers and females to
their mothers, occurs to me as true."_END

B_2_C_37_6
BEGIN_
स चीरे पुरुष व्याघ्रः कैकेय्याः प्रतिगृह्य ते |
सूक्ष्म वस्त्रम् अवक्षिप्य मुनि वस्त्राणि अवस्त ह || २-३७-७_END
BEGIN_
Taking those two pieces of bark (as loin cloth and cover) from kaikeyi and
discarding his clothing of fine yarn, Rama put on the garb of ascetics._END

B_2_C_34_27
BEGIN_
भवान् वर्ष सहस्राय पृथिव्या नृपते पतिः |
अहम् तु अरण्ये वत्स्यामि न मे कार्यम् त्वया अनृतम् || २-३४-२८_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, king! You be the ruler of the earth for thousand years. But, I for my part,
will stay in the forest. For my sake, do not generate untruth about you."_END

B_2_C_36_13
BEGIN_
वहन्तम् किम् तुदसि माम् नियुज्य धुरि मा आहिते |
अनार्ये कृत्यमार्ब्धम् किम् न पूर्वमुपारुधः || २-३६-१४_END
BEGIN_
Having charged me with a burden, Oh hostile woman, why do you prick me while I am
carrying it? Why did you not check before(while asking the boons by putting a condition that Rama
should not be allowed to take anything with him) the deed(of sending troups etc with Rama) in the
begining itself, Oh the vulgar woman!"_END

B_2_C_35_22
BEGIN_
नैवम् भव ग़ृहाणेदम् यदाह वसुधाधिपः |
भर्तुरिच्चामुपास्वेह जनस्यास्य गतिर्भव || २-३५-२९_END
BEGIN_
Do not conform to the traits of your mother. Understand that which is said by the
king. following the desire of your husband, be a protectress to these people here."_END

B_2_C_37_7
BEGIN_
लक्ष्मणः च अपि तत्र एव विहाय वसने शुभे |
तापसाच् चादने चैव जग्राह पितुर् अग्रतः || २-३७-८_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana too there itself before his father put on the clothing of ascetics, by
discarding his beautiful raiment._END

B_2_C_34_28
BEGIN_
नव पञ्च च वर्षाणि वनवासे विहृत्य ते |
पुनः पादौ ग्रहीष्यामि प्रतिज्ञान्ते नराधिपः || २-३४-२९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, ruler of men! Having strolled in the forest for fourteen years, I shall clasp
your feet once more after fulfilling my promise."_END

B_2_C_38_0
BEGIN_
तस्याम् चीरम् वसानायाम् नाथवत्याम् अनाथवत् |
प्रचुक्रोश जनः सर्वो धिग् त्वाम् दशरथम् तु इति || २-३८-१_END
BEGIN_
On seeing Seetha wearing bark of trees like a helpless woman, eventhough protected
by her husband all the people there loudly cried out: "Fie upon you, Dasaratha!"_END

B_2_C_36_14
BEGIN_
तस्यैतत्क्रोधसम्युक्तमुक्तम् श्रुत्वा वराङ्गना |
कैकेयी द्वि गुणम् क्रुद्धा राजानम् इदम् अब्रवीत् || २-३६-१५_END
BEGIN_
Doubly enraged in hearing this angry question of Dasaratha, Kaikeyi the beautiful
woman replied to the king as follows:_END

B_2_C_35_23
BEGIN_
मा त्वम् प्रोत्साहिता पापैर्देवराजसमप्रभम् |
भर्तारम् लोकभर्तारमसद्धर्ममुपादधाः || २-३५-३०_END
BEGIN_
"Incitedby the evil minded, do not put before the public an improper course of
conduct of your husband who spendour is equal to that of king Devendra and who is a protector of
this world._END

B_2_C_37_8
BEGIN_
अथ आत्म परिधान अर्थम् सीता कौशेय वासिनी |
समीक्ष्य चीरम् सम्त्रस्ता पृषती वागुराम् इव || २-३७-९_END
BEGIN_
Then, Seetha who wore silken clothing, by seeing the piece of bark intended to be
worne by her, felt alarming as a deer would on seeing a snare(set for entrapping)_END

B_2_C_34_29
BEGIN_
रुदन्नाह प्रियम् पुत्रं सत्यपाशेन संयतः |
कैकेय्या चोद्यमान्स्तु मिथो राजा तमब्रवीत् || २-३४-३०_END
BEGIN_
Prompted secretly by kaikeyi, the distressed king, tied up by fetters of truth, said
weeping to that beloved son._END

B_2_C_38_1
BEGIN_
तेन तत्र प्रणादेन दुःखितस्स महीपतिः |
चिच्छेद जीविते श्रद्धाम् धर्मे यशसि चात्मनः || २-३८-२_END
BEGIN_
Pained by that loud cry there, King Dasaratha lost interest in his life, religious
merit and esteem._END

B_2_C_36_15
BEGIN_
तव एव वंशे सगरः ज्येष्ठम् पुत्रम् उपारुधत् |
असमन्जैति ख्यातम् तथा अयम् गन्तुम् अर्हति || २-३६-१६_END


B_2_C_35_24
BEGIN_
न हि मिथ्या प्रतिज्ञातम् करिष्यति तवानघः |
श्रीमान्दशरथो राजा देवि राजीवलोचनः || २-३५-३१_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Kaikeyi! Dasaratha the faultless man, the majesty, the lotus-eyed man and the
king cannot indeed belie the promise given to you(Hence, you alone has to change your opinion)"_END

B_2_C_37_9
BEGIN_
सा व्यपत्रपमाणा इव प्रतिगृह्य च दुर्मनाः |
गन्धर्व राज प्रतिमम् भर्तारम् इदम् अब्रवीत् || २-३७-१०
अश्रुसंपूर्ण्नेत्रा च धर्मज्ञा धर्मदर्शिनी |
गन्धर्वराजप्रतिमम् भर्तारमिदमब्रवीत् || २-३७-११_END
BEGIN_
Feeling abashed while taking the wearing apparel made of Kusa grass and greatly
troubled in mind, Seetha who bore auspicious marks knew what is righteousness who was an
illustration of righteousness spoke these words with her eyes filled with tears to her husband who
looked like Chitraratha(the king of Gandharvas)_END

B_2_C_34_30
BEGIN_
श्रेयसे वृद्धये तात पुनर् आगमनाय च |
गच्चस्व अरिष्टम् अव्यग्रः पन्थानम् अकुतः भयम् || २-३४-३१_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, darling! Proceed for welfare, for advancement and for coming again. Let your
path of travel be auspicious, undistracted and fearless from any quarter."_END

B_2_C_38_2
BEGIN_
स निह्श्वस्य उष्णम् ऐक्ष्वाकः ताम् भार्याम् इदम् अब्रवीत् |
कैकेयि कुश चीरेण न सीता गन्तुम् अर्हति || २-३८-३_END
BEGIN_
Dasaratha with a warm sigh, spoke to his wife these words. "Oh, Kaikeyi! Seetha does
not deserve to go with a robe made of Kusa grass."_END

B_2_C_35_25
BEGIN_
ज्येष्ठो वदान्यः कर्मण्यः स्वधर्मपरिरक्षिता |
रक्षिता जीवलोकस्य बली रामोऽभिषिच्यताम् || २-३५-३२_END
BEGIN_
"Let Rama the eldest(of the sons) who is generous strong skilled, capable of
protecting his own duty as Kshatriya but also of protecting the world of living beings, be
installed on the throne of Ayodhya"_END

B_2_C_36_16
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्तः धिग् इति एव राजा दशरथो अब्रवीत् |
व्रीडितः च जनः सर्वः सा च तन् न अवबुध्यत || २-३६-१७_END
BEGIN_
Spoken to as above, king Dasaratha uttered only a word "Shame!". The entire people
there were ashamed. But Kaikeyi did not perceive it"_END

B_2_C_34_31
BEGIN_
न हि सत्यात्मनस्तात धर्माभिमनसस्तव |
विनिवर्त यितुं बुद्धि शक्यते रघुनन्दन || २-३४-३२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, darling, the seion of Raghu! Truthful as you are by nature and your mind being
given to righteousness, your decision cannot be reversed."_END

B_2_C_37_10
BEGIN_
कथम् नु चीरम् बध्नन्ति मुनयो वन वासिनः |
इति ह्यकुशला सीता सामुमोह मुहुर्मुहुः || २-३७-१२_END
BEGIN_
"How ascetics residing in the forest wear this piece of bark?" Thus saying, Seetha
who was not adept in wearing the bark of trees, erred again and again(in her attempt to wear
it)_END

B_2_C_38_3
BEGIN_
सुकुमारी च बाला च सततम् च सुखोचिता |
नेयम् वनस्य योग्येति सत्यमाह गुरुर्मम || २-३८-४_END
BEGIN_
"My preceptro truly says that Seetha, who is delicate young and ever habituated to
comforts, is not fit for forest-life"_END

B_2_C_36_17
BEGIN_
तत्र वृद्धो महा मात्रः सिद्ध अर्थो नाम नामतः |
शुचिर् बहु मतः राज्ञः कैकेयीम् इदम् अब्रवीत् || २-३६-१८_END
BEGIN_
There, the aged and the upright chief minister siddhartha by name who was highly
esteemed by the king, spoke to Kaikeyi these words:_END

B_2_C_35_26
BEGIN_
परिवादो हि ते देवि महान्लोके चरिष्यति |
यदि रामो वनम् याति विहाय पितरम् नृपम् || २-३५-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Kaikeyi! A great accusation will surely roam about you in the world, if Rama
leaving his royal father goes to the forest._END

B_2_C_34_32
BEGIN_
अद्य तु इदानीम् रजनीम् पुत्र मा गच्च सर्वथा |
मातरम् माम् च सम्पश्यन् वस इमाम् अद्य शर्वरीम् || २-३४-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, son! Do not leave in any case today, now at night time. Even by seeing you for
one day, I may live happily."_END

B_2_C_37_11
BEGIN_
कृत्वा कण्ठे च सा चीरम् एकम् आदाय पाणिना |
तस्थौ हि अकुषला तत्र व्रीडिता जनक आत्मज || २-३७-१३_END
BEGIN_
Keeping one piece of bark on her neck as well as holding it with her hand, Seetha
stood abashed, not adept as she was in wearing it._END

B_2_C_38_4
BEGIN_
इयम् हि कश्यापकरोति किंचि |
त्तपस्विनी राजवरस्य कन्या |
या चीरमासाद्य जनस्य मध्ये |
स्थिता विसम्ज्ञा श्रमणीव काचित् || २-३८-५_END
BEGIN_
"has this pitiable daughter of Janaka, the jewel of kings, done any harm to any one
that, having obtained a bark of tree she is standing like a hermitess dumbfounded in the midst of
men?"_END

B_2_C_35_27
BEGIN_
स राज्यम् राघवः पातु भवत्वम् विगतज्वरा |
न हि ते राघवादन्यः क्षमः पुरवरे वसेत् || २-३५-३४_END
BEGIN_
"Let Rama of that character protect this kingdom! Be you free from distress. There
is none other than Rama living in your excellent city who is competent to rule this Ayodhya"_END

B_2_C_36_18
BEGIN_
असमन्जो गृहीत्वा तु क्रीडितः पथि दारकान् |
सरय्वाः प्रक्षिपन्न् अप्सु रमते तेन दुर्मतिः || २-३६-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Asamanja the evil-minded, catching hold of children playing in the street and
throwing them in the waters of saryu river, took delight in it"_END

B_2_C_37_12
BEGIN_
तस्याः तत् क्षिप्रम् आगम्य रामः धर्मभृताम् वरः |
चीरम् बबन्ध सीतायाः कौशेयस्य उपरि स्वयम् || २-३७-१४_END
BEGIN_
Rama, the foremost of those upholding virute, quicky came and personally fastened
that bark over the sild garment of Seetha._END

B_2_C_34_33
BEGIN_
मातरं माम् च सम्पश्यन् वसेमामद्य शर्वरीम् |
तर्पितः सर्वकामैस्त्वम् स्वः काले साधयिष्यसि || २-३४-३४_END
BEGIN_
"Looking at your mother and myself, stay at least for this night today. Satiated by
all the desired objects, you may leave tomorrow at dawn."_END

B_2_C_38_5
BEGIN_
चीराण्यसास्या जनकस्य कन्या |
नेयम् प्रतिज्ञा मम दत्तपूर्वा |
यथासुखम् गच्छतु राजपुत्री |
वनम् सम्ग्रा सह सर्वर्त्नैः || २-३८-६_END
BEGIN_
"Seetha the daughter of Janaka need not wear these barks of trees. No such pledge
was given be me earlier. hence, let this prinecess go to the forest happily fully provided ewith
all valuable possesssions."_END

B_2_C_35_28
BEGIN_
रामे हि यौवराज्यस्थे राजा दशरथो वनम् |
प्रवेक्ष्यति महेष्वासः पूर्ववृत्तमनुस्मरन् || २-३५-३५_END
BEGIN_
"In the event of Rama being installe din the office of the prince Regent, King
Dasaratha wielder of the great bow will surely have recourse to the forest, cherishly recollecting
the conduct of his forebears"_END

B_2_C_36_19
BEGIN_
तम् दृष्ट्वा नागरः सर्वे क्रुद्धा राजानम् अब्रुवन् |
असमन्जम् वृषीण्व एकम् अस्मान् वा राष्ट्र वर्धन || २-३६-२०_END
BEGIN_
By watching him, all the citizens were angry and spoke to the king, "choose either
to keep yourself Asamanja alone or to preserve us, Oh the promoter of the state!"_END

B_2_C_37_13
BEGIN_
रामम् प्रेक्ष्य तु सीतायाः बध्नन्तम् चीरमुत्तमम् |
अन्तःपुरगता नार्यो मुमुचुर्वारि नेत्रजम् || २-३७-१५_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the greatest Rama fastening the bark to Seetha in that manner, the women in
the gynaecium shed tears from their eyes._END

B_2_C_34_34
BEGIN_
दुष्करम् क्रियते पुत्र सर्वथा राघव तया |
मत्प्रियार्थम् प्रियांस्त्यक्त्वा यद्यासि विजनम् वनम् || २-३४-३५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh Rama, my son! An incorrigible thing is being done by you since for my pleasure
you are going to the forest a solitary place, leaving beloved ones."_END

B_2_C_38_6
BEGIN_
अजीवनार्हेण मया नृशंसा |
कृता प्रतिज्ञा नियमेन तावत् |
त्वया हि बाल्यात् प्रतिपन्नमेतत् |
त्न्माम् दहेद् वेणुमिवात्मपुष्पम् || २-३८-७_END
BEGIN_
"A Cruel pledge has been made on oath by me, who do not deserve to survive. This
(providing robes of hermitess to Seetha) has been initiated by you by sheer childishness. That will
consume me, as by its own flower to a bamboo."_END

B_2_C_35_29
BEGIN_
इति सान्वैश्च तीक्ष्णै कैकेयीम् राजसंसदि |
सुवन्त्रः क्षोभयामास भूय एव कृताञ्जलिः || २-३५-३६_END
BEGIN_
Thus, Sumantra repeatedly with joint palms, caused a shaking to Kaikeyi in the royal
assmebly, by his kind words as well as bitter words._END

B_2_C_36_20
BEGIN_
तान् उवाच ततः राजा किम् निमित्तम् इदम् भयम् |
ताः च अपि राज्ञा सम्पृष्टा वाक्यम् प्रकृतयो अब्रुवन् || २-३६-२१_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon the king said to them, "For what reason is this fear? Duly asked by the
king, those people also replied these words:_END

B_2_C_37_14
BEGIN_
उचुश्च परमायस्ता रामम् ज्वलिततेजसम् |
वत्स नैवम् नियुक्तेयम् वनवासे मनस्विनी || २-३७-१६_END
BEGIN_
Very much distress as they were, they spoke to Rama of dazzling glory as follows: "
Dear child! This Seetha the high sould, was not so commanded to reside in the forest."_END

B_2_C_34_35
BEGIN_
न चैतन्मे प्रियम् पुत्र शपे सत्येन राघव |
छन्नया छलितस्त्वस्नु स्त्रुया छन्नाग्निकल्पया || २-३४-३६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh Rama my son! Your exile is not agreeable to me. I was cheated by Kaikeyi who had
concealed intentions and resembled fire with ashes."_END

B_2_C_38_7
BEGIN_
रामेण यदि ते पा पे किंचित्कृतमशोभनम् |
अपकारः क इह ते वैदेह्या दर्शितोऽधमे || २-३८-८_END
BEGIN_
"Oh evil woman! (Even) supposing a little offence is done by Rama to you, what harm
was displayed to you here by Seetha? Oh, mean woman!"_END

B_2_C_36_21
BEGIN_
क्रीडितः तु एष नः पुत्रान् बालान् उद्भ्रान्त चेतनः |
सरय्वाम् प्रक्षिपन् मौर्ख्यात् अतुलाम् प्रीतिम् अश्नुते || २-३६-२२_END
BEGIN_
"He obtains incomparable delight by throwing, through stupidity, our playing
children in sarayu river in a whirled state of mind."_END

B_2_C_37_15
BEGIN_
पितुर्वाक्यानुरोधेन गतस्य विजनम् वनम् |
तावद्दर्शनमस्या नः सफलम् भवतु प्रभो || २-३७-१७_END
BEGIN_
"When you departed to the forest in seclusion following the words of your father, Oh
Rama, let her sight be a reward to us till your return."_END

B_2_C_35_30
BEGIN_
नैवसाक्षुभ्यते देवी न च स्म परिदूयते |
न चास्या मुखवर्णस्य विक्रिया लक्ष्यते तदा || २-३५-३७_END
BEGIN_
That queen Kaikeyi, however, was neither excited nor repented in her heart nor was
any change observed in the colour of her face._END

B_2_C_34_36
BEGIN_
पञ्चना या तु लब्धा मे तां त्वम् निस्तर्तुमिच्छसि |
अनया वृत्तसादिन्या कैकेय्याऽभिप्रचोदितः || २-३४-३७_END
BEGIN_
Incited by Kaikeyi who has destroyed established customs, you wish to redeem my
deceit, derived by me from her._END

B_2_C_38_8
BEGIN_
मृगीवोत्फुल्लनयना मृदुशीला तपस्विनी |
अपकारम् कमिह ते करोति जनकात्मजा || २-३८-९_END
BEGIN_
"What harm on earth can be done to you by Seetha, who has blooming eyes like those
of a female deer, soft in disposition a practiser of penance?"_END

B_2_C_37_16
BEGIN_
लक्ष्मणेन सहायेन वनम् गच्छस्व पुत्रक |
नेयमर्हति कल्याणी वस्तुम् तापसवद्वने || २-३७-१८_END
BEGIN_
" You go to the forest along with Lakshmana as your companion Oh son! Seetha the
beautiful girl is not fit to reside in a forest like an ascetic."_END

B_2_C_36_22
BEGIN_
स तासाम् वचनम् श्रुत्वा प्रकृतीनाम् नर अधिप |
तम् तत्याज अहितम् पुत्रम् तासाम् प्रिय चिकीर्षया || २-३६-२३_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of those poeple, that king abandoned the son repugnant to his
subjects, in a bid to do good to them._END

B_2_C_39_0
BEGIN_
रामस्य तु वचः श्रुत्वा मुनि वेष धरम् च तम् |
समीक्ष्य सह भार्याभी राजा विगत चेतनः || २-३९-१
न एनम् दुह्खेन सम्तप्तः प्रत्यवैक्षत राघवम् |
न च एनम् अभिसम्प्रेक्ष्य प्रत्यभाषत दुर्मनाः || २-३९-२_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Rama's words and seeing him clad in a garb of hermit, king Dasaratha with
his wives fell unconscious. Consumed by grief, he could not look towards Rama. Troubled in mind as
he was, the king could not speak to Rama by seeing into his face._END

B_2_C_34_37
BEGIN_
न चैतदाश्चर्यतमम् यत्तज्ज्येष्ठस्सुतो मम |
अपानृतकथम् पुत्र पितरम् कर्तुमिच्छ्सि || २-३४-३८_END
BEGIN_
"It is not a great surprise, my son, that you my eldest son should seek to make your
father as one who does not have false promises."_END

B_2_C_38_9
BEGIN_
ननु पर्याप्तम् एतत् ते पापे राम विवासनम् |
किम् एभिः कृपणैः भूयः पातकैः अपि ते कृतैः || २-३८-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, the evil woman! Sending Rama to exile thus indeed is enough for you. What use
is there for you in further doing these wretched, sinful acts too._END

B_2_C_36_23
BEGIN_
तम् यानम् श्रीघ्रमारोप्य सभार्यम् सपरिच्छदम् |
यावज्जीवम् विवास्योऽयमिति स्वानन्वशात् पिता || २-३६-२४_END
BEGIN_
Arranging immediately to place him along with his wife together with the
paraphrenalia (like utensils, implements etc) in a vehicle, the king instructed his persons thus:
"He should be exiled for life."_END

B_2_C_37_17
BEGIN_
कुरु नो याचनाम् पुत्र! सीता तिष्ठतु भामिनी |
धर्मनित्यः स्वयम् स्थातुम् न हीदानीम् त्वमिच्छसि || २-३७-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Accept our prayer, Oh son! Let Seetha the beautiful young lady stay here. Indeed,
you the ever righteous in any case do not wish to stay back._END

B_2_C_39_1
BEGIN_
स मुहूर्तम् इव असम्ज्ञो दुह्खितः च मही पतिः |
विललाप महा बाहू रामम् एव अनुचिन्तयन् || २-३९-३_END
BEGIN_
The mighty armed Dasaratha was unconscious for some time, distressed and repented in
various ways thinking of Rama alone._END

B_2_C_34_38
BEGIN_
अथ रामः तथा श्रुत्वा पितुर् आर्तस्य भाषितम् |
लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा दीनो वचनम् अब्रवीत् || २-३४-३९_END
BEGIN_
After hearing these words of their father who was depressed, Rama and Lakshmana were
upset. Then Rama spoke these words._END

B_2_C_38_10
BEGIN_
प्रतिज्ञातम् मया तावत् त्वयोक्तम् देवि शृण्वता |
रामम् यदभिषेकाय त्वमिहाअत मब्रवीः || २-३८-११_END
BEGIN_
"Hearing the speech you gave to Rama who came here for coronation, only that much
was acceded by me, Oh queen!"_END

B_2_C_36_24
BEGIN_
स फालपिटकम् गृह्य गिरिदुर्गान्यलोडयत् |
दिशः सर्वास्त्वनुचरन् स यथा पापकर्मकृत् || २-३६-२५_END
BEGIN_
Roaming in all directions as though he has done sinful deeds, he ransacked mountain
passes, by taking a basket and a shovel._END

B_2_C_37_18
BEGIN_
तासामेवम्विधा वाचः शृण्वन् दशरथात्मजः |
बबन्धैव तदा चीरम् सीतया तुल्यशीलया || २-३७-२०_END
BEGIN_
Even after hearing their words in this manner, Rama fastened that piece of bark to
Seetha, who has a well-matched nature._END

B_2_C_39_2
BEGIN_
मन्ये खलु मया पूर्वम् विवत्सा बहवः कृताः |
प्राणिनो हिंसिता वा अपि तस्मात् इदम् उपस्थितम् || २-३९-४_END
BEGIN_
"I think that previously many people were separated from their children by me or in
any case many living beings were killed. Hence, this (calamity) has befallen me."_END

B_2_C_34_39
BEGIN_
प्राप्स्यामि यान् अद्य गुणान् को मे श्वस्तान् प्रदास्यति |
अपक्रमणम् एव अतः सर्व कामैः अहम् वृणे || २-३४-४०_END
BEGIN_
Even if these worldly pleasures are obtained today, who will offer those things to
me tomorrow? Therefore I desire only to get away in lieu of all these enjoyments._END

B_2_C_38_11
BEGIN_
तत्त्वेतत्समतिक्रम्य निरयम् गन्तुमिच्छसि |
मैथिलीमपि या हि त्व मीक्षसे चीरवासिनीम् || २-३८-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Transgressing all that, you somehow or other wish to go to hell, by perceiving
Seetha also clad in bark of trees._END

B_2_C_37_19
BEGIN_
चीरे गृहीते तु तया समीक्ष्य नृपतेर्गुरुः |
निवार्य सीताम् कैकेयीम् वसिष्ठो वाक्यमब्रवीत् || २-३७-२१_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Seetha accepting the piece of bark, Vasistha the king's preceptor prevented
her and spoke thus to Kaikeyi._END

B_2_C_36_25
BEGIN_
इति एवम् अत्यजद् राजा सगरः वै सुधार्मिकः |
रामः किम् अकरोत् पापम् येन एवम् उपरुध्यते || २-३६-२६_END
BEGIN_
"The highly righteous King Sagara abandoned Asamanja for perpetration sinful deeds
as above. But, what sin Rama has done, for which he was debarred in this way?"_END

B_2_C_39_3
BEGIN_
न तु एव अनागते काले देहाच् च्यवति जीवितम् |
कैकेय्या क्लिश्यमानस्य मृत्युर् मम न विद्यते || २-३९-५
मो अहम् पावक सम्काशम् पश्यामि पुरतः स्थितम् |
विहाय वसने सूक्ष्मे तापस आच्चादम् आत्मजम् || २-३९-६_END
BEGIN_
"life does not decamp from the body surely without the arrival of time. Death does
not claim me, even being tormented by Kaikeyi and eventhough I behold my son, efflugent as fire,
standing before me clad in the robes of an ascetic having cast off his fine garments."_END

B_2_C_34_40
BEGIN_
इयम् सराष्ट्रा सजना धन धान्य समाकुला |
मया विसृष्टा वसुधा भरताय प्रदीयताम् || २-३४-४१_END
BEGIN_
"This earth being relinquished by me; which included various provinces, filled with
people, imbued with riches and food grains, may be given to Bharata."_END

B_2_C_38_12
BEGIN_
इतीव राजा विलपन्महात्मा |
शोकस्य नान्तम् स ददर्श किंचित् |
भृशातुरत्वाच्च पपात भूमौ |
तेनैव पुत्रव्यसनेन मग्नः || २-३८-१३_END
BEGIN_
That high-souled king thus lamenting, did not see any ending to that sorrow.
Drenched as he was in excessive devotion to his son and having been hurt vey much, he fell down on
the ground._END

B_2_C_37_20
BEGIN_
अतिप्रवृत्ते दुर्मेधे कैकेयि कुलपांसनि |
वञ्यित्वा च राजानम् न प्रमाणेऽवतिष्ठसे || २-३७-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh the evil minded Kaikeyi, who have exceeded your limits, who have brought
disgrace to your family! You are not establishing justifiable standard and you misled the king._END

B_2_C_36_26
BEGIN_
न हि कंचन पश्यामो राघवस्यागुणम् वयम् |
दुर्लभो यस्य निरयः श्शाङ्कस्येव कल्मषम् || २-३६-२७_END
BEGIN_
We do not indeed perceive any fault in Rama. It is as difficult to find a taint in
him as in a new moon._END

B_2_C_39_4
BEGIN_
एकस्याः खलु कैकेय्याः कृते अयम् क्लिश्यते जनः |
स्व अर्थे प्रयतमानायाः संश्रित्य निकृतिम् त्विमाम् || २-३९-७_END
BEGIN_
"All these people are suffering on account of only Kaikeyi, who sought refuge in
chincanery, with an implicit intent of selfishness"_END

B_2_C_34_41
BEGIN_
वनवासकृता बुद्धिर्न च मेऽद्य चलिष्यति |
यस्तुष्टेन वरो दत्तः कैकेय्यै वरद त्वया || २-३४-४२
दीयताम् निखिलेनैव सत्यस्त्वम् भव पार्थिव |_END
BEGIN_
"I cannot budge now from my decision made about my stay in the forest. Oh king the
bestower of boons! You were pleased to give a boon to Kaikeyi and let it be fulfilled completely.
Be you a truthful man."_END

B_2_C_38_13
BEGIN_
एवम् ब्रुवन्तम् पितरम् रामः सम्प्रस्थितः वनम् |
अवाक् शिरसम् आसीनम् इदम् वचनम् अब्रवीत् || २-३८-१४_END
BEGIN_
Rama, who was setting out to the forest, spoke these words to his father, who was
speaking thus bowing down his head, sitting there._END

B_2_C_37_21
BEGIN_
न गन्तव्यम् वनम् देव्या सीतया शीलवर्जिते |
अनुष्ठास्यति रामस्य सीता प्रकृतमासनम् || २-३७-२३_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, the woman without decorum! Seetha the princess shall not proceed to forest. She
will occuply the throne, which was awarded to Rama."_END

B_2_C_39_5
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्त्वा तु वचनम् बाष्पेण पिहित ईक्ष्णह |
राम इति सकृद् एव उक्त्वा व्याहर्तुम् न शशाक ह || २-३९-८_END
BEGIN_
Having uttered these words and saying "Oh, Rama!" only once, he was not able to
speak any more, his organs of voice being choked by tears._END

B_2_C_36_27
BEGIN_
अथवा देवि दोषम् त्वं कंचित्पश्यसि राघवे |
तमद्य ब्रूहि तत्वैन तदा रोमो विवास्यताम् || २-३६-२८_END
BEGIN_
"Or if you see any fault in Rama, Oh Kaikeyi you tell about it now correctly. Then,
Rama will be exiled."_END

B_2_C_34_42
BEGIN_
अहम् निदेशम् भवतो यथोक्तमनुपालयन् || २-३४-४३
चतुर्दश समा वत्स्ये वने वनचरैः सह |_END
BEGIN_
"I , as promised, fulfilling your command, shall live in the forest along with
forest-dwellers for fourteen years."_END

B_2_C_38_14
BEGIN_
इयम् धार्मिक कौसल्या मम माता यशस्विनी |
वृद्धा च अक्षुद्र शीला च न च त्वाम् देव गर्हिते || २-३८-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, virtuous king! This glorious Kausalya, my mother is aged. She is not of base
nature and will not accuse you._END

B_2_C_37_22
BEGIN_
आत्मा हि दाराः सर्वेषाम् दारसम्ग्रहवर्तिनाम् |
आत्मेयमिति रामस्य पालयिष्यति मेदिनीम् || २-३७-२४_END
BEGIN_
"A wife is very self to all, who constantly care for their wives. As Seetha is
Rama's self, she can rule the earth."_END

B_2_C_39_6
BEGIN_
सम्ज्ञाम् तु प्रतिलभ्य एव मुहूर्तात् स मही पतिः |
नेत्राभ्याम् अश्रु पूर्णाभ्याम् सुमन्त्रम् इदम् अब्रवीत् || २-३९-९_END
BEGIN_
Regaining consciousness after a moment, the king, with his eyes filled with tears,
spoke these words to Sumantra:_END

B_2_C_36_28
BEGIN_
अदुष्टस्य हि सम्त्यागः सत्पथे निरतस्य च |
निर्दहे दपि शक्रस्य द्युतिम् धर्मनिरोधनात् || २-३६-२९_END
BEGIN_
As it is contradictory to righteousness to abandon one who is guilty and who is
devoted to a good path, it would consume the splendour of even Indra (the ruler of gods)_END

B_2_C_34_43
BEGIN_
मा विमर्शो वसुमती भरताय प्रदीयताम् || २-३४-४४
न हि मे काम्क्षितम् राज्यम् सुखमात्मनि वा प्रियम् |
यथा निदेशम् कर्तुम् वै तवैव रघुनन्धन || २-३४-४५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, king! Do not have any hesitation in offering the kingdom to Bharata. Neither
kingdom nor happiness indeed is desired by my nature. It is dear to me only to do your command as
directed."_END

B_2_C_38_15
BEGIN_
मया विहीनाम् वरद प्रपन्नाम् शोक सागरम् |
अदृष्ट पूर्व व्यसनाम् भूयः सम्मन्तुम् अर्हसि || २-३८-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, the bestower of boons! You are worthy of amply respection her, who is deprived
of me, who is immersed in an ocean of sorrow and who has not see such an affliction earlier."_END

B_2_C_37_23
BEGIN_
अथ यास्यति वैदेही वनम् रामेण सम्गता |
वयमप्यनुयास्यामः पुरम् चेदम् गमिष्यति || २-३७-२५_END
BEGIN_
"Or rather, if Seetha goes to forest together with Rama, we also will follow suit.
This city too will go."_END

B_2_C_39_7
BEGIN_
औपवाह्यम् रथम् युक्त्वा त्वम् आयाहि हय उत्तमैः |
प्रापय एनम् महा भागम् इतः जन पदात् परम् || २-३९-१०_END
BEGIN_
"You come with a chariot, fit for driving, yoked with excellent horses and take this
highly distinguished prince beyond this territory."_END

B_2_C_36_29
BEGIN_
तदलम् देवि रामस्य श्रिया विहतया त्वया |
लोकतोऽप् हि ते रक्ष्यः परिवादः शुभानने || २-३६-३०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Kaikeyi! Hence, there is no need of impeding the royal fortune of Rama. Oh,
lady with a charming face! Even blame from the public should be taken care of by you."_END

B_2_C_38_16
BEGIN_
पुत्रशोकम् यथा नर्चेत्त्वया पूज्येन पूजिता |
माम् हि संचिन्तयन्ती सा त्वयि जीवेत् तपस्विनी || २-३८-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Having been honoured by you the venerable man, she the pitiable woman will not get
such a grief for her son, thinking of me alone and she will draw breath in you."_END

B_2_C_34_44
BEGIN_
अपगच्चतु ते दुह्खम् मा भूर् बाष्प परिप्लुतः |
न हि क्षुभ्यति दुर्धर्षः समुद्रः सरिताम् पतिः || २-३४-४६_END
BEGIN_
"Let your sorrow disappear! Do not be overwhelmed with tears. The ocean, the lord of
rivers which is difficult to assail, indeed does not get agitated."_END

B_2_C_39_8
BEGIN_
एवम् मन्ये गुणवताम् गुणानाम् फलम् उच्यते |
पित्रा मात्रा च यत् साधुर् वीरः निर्वास्यते वनम् || २-३९-११_END
BEGIN_
"Since a pious and a valiant son is being sent to exile by father and mother, I
think such is said to be the reward of virtues of the virtueous."_END

B_2_C_37_24
BEGIN_
अन्तपालाश्च यास्यन्ति सदारो यत्र राघवः |
सहोपजीव्यम् राष्ट्रम् च पुरम् च सपरिच्छदम् || २-३७-२६_END
BEGIN_
"The fronitier- guards and the State including its patrons, as well as this city
with its goods and chattels will go whereever Rama and his wife are there."_END

B_2_C_36_30
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा तु सिद्ध अर्थ वचो राजा श्रान्ततर स्वनः |
शोक उपहतया वाचा कैकेयीम् इदम् अब्रवीत् || २-३६-३१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Siddhartha, king Dasaratha spoke to Kaikeyi in the most
tiresome tone, with a voice choked with deep anguish, as follows._END

B_2_C_38_17
BEGIN_
इमाम् महा इन्द्र उपम जात गर्भिनीम् |
तथा विधातुम् जनमीम् मम अर्हसि |
यथा वनस्थे मयि शोक कर्शिता |
न जीवितम् न्यस्य यम क्षयम् व्रजेत् || २-३८-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, the king akim to the mighty Indra the ruler of gods! You must see that my
mother, who has high affection towards her son, will not depart to the house of Yama the God of
Death, by abandoning her life being emaciated by grief after my departure for the forest."_END

B_2_C_34_45
BEGIN_
न एव अहम् राज्यम् इच्चामि न सुखम् न च मैथिलीम् |
त्वाम् अहम् सत्यम् इच्चामि न अनृतम् पुरुष ऋषभ || २-३४-४७_END
BEGIN_
"I do not crave for kingdom or happiness nor again for Seetha nor even all these
enjoyments nor for heaven nor even for life."_END

B_2_C_37_25
BEGIN_
भरतश्च सशत्रुघ्नश्चीरवासा वनेचरः |
वने वसन्तम् काकुत्थ्समनुवत्स्यति पूर्वजम् || २-३७-२७_END
BEGIN_
"Wearing pieces of bark, Bharata along with Shatrughna will live along with Rama
their brother residing in the forest and moving in the forest."_END

B_2_C_39_9
BEGIN_
राज्ञो वचनम् आज्ञाय सुमन्त्रः शीघ्र विक्रमः |
योजयित्वा आययौ तत्र रथम् अश्वैः अलम्कृतम् || २-३९-१२_END
BEGIN_
Sumantra obeying the words of the king, walked away quickly and arrived there fitted
with horses, a chariot duly decorated._END

B_2_C_36_31
BEGIN_
एतद्वचो नेच्छ्सि पापवृत्ते |
हितम् न जानासि ममात्मनो वा |
आस्थाय मार्गम् कृपणम् कुचेष्टा |
चेष्टा हि ते साधुपदादपेता || २-३६-३२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, the sinful being! Do you not agree with these words of Siddhartha? By resorting
to the path of the deplorable, you with a bad behaviour, are not alive to my interests or to your
own. Your action is deprived of a righteous path."_END

B_2_C_40_0
BEGIN_
अथ रामः च सीता च लक्ष्मणः च कृत अन्जलिः |
उपसम्गृह्य राजानम् चक्रुर् दीनाः प्रदक्षिणम् || २-४०-१_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama Seetha and Lakshmana, who felt miserable, bowed down by touching the feet
of the king and went round him clockwise with joined palms._END

B_2_C_34_46
BEGIN_
त्वामहम् सत्यमिच्छामि नानृतम् पुरुषर्षभ |
प्रत्यक्षम् तव सत्येन सुकृतेन च ते शपे || २-३४-४८_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Jewel among men! I wish you to be a truthful mean, not a fallacious man. I
swear to you in your presence by truth and by virtue."_END

B_2_C_37_26
BEGIN_
ततह् शून्याम् गतजनाम् वसुधाम् पादपैः सह |
त्वमेका शाधि दुर्वृत्ता प्रजानामहिते स्थिता || २-३७-२८_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, singly you alone with bad conduct hurt to people, rule this earth which
is bereft of people and desolate, with its trees alone remaining._END

B_2_C_39_10
BEGIN_
तम् रथम् राज पुत्राय सूतः कनक भूषितम् |
आचचक्षे अन्जलिम् कृत्वा युक्तम् परम वाजिभिः || २-३९-१३_END
BEGIN_
The charioteer told the prince with joined palms about that chariot decorated by
gold, fitted wih superb horses._END

B_2_C_36_32
BEGIN_
अनुव्रजिष्याम्य् अहम् अद्य रामम् |
राज्यम् परित्यज्य सुखम् धनम् च |
सह एव राज्ञा भरतेन च त्वम् |
यथा सुखम् भुन्क्ष्व चिराय राज्यम् || २-३६-३३_END
BEGIN_
"I am accompanying Rama now, by abandoning my kingdom, happiness and wealth. You
enjoy the kingdom for a long time, happily together with Bharata the King."_END

B_2_C_40_1
BEGIN_
तम् च अपि समनुज्ञाप्य धर्मज्ञः सीतया सह |
राघवः शोक सम्मूढो जननीम् अभ्यवादयत् || २-४०-२_END
BEGIN_
After taking leave of Dasaratha, Rama who knew what is right and stood confounded by
sorrow, bowed along with Seetha to Kausalya._END

B_2_C_34_47
BEGIN_
न च शख्यम् मया तात स्थातुम् क्षणमपि प्रभो |
स शोकम् ध्रारयस्वेमम् न हि मेऽस्ति विपर्ययः || २-३४-४९_END
BEGIN_
"It is not possible for me, Oh father, to stay on even for a moment. Therefore,
contain this grief, Oh Lord, for there is no going back upon my word."_END

B_2_C_37_27
BEGIN_
न हि तद्भविता राष्ट्रम् यत्र रामो न भूपतिः |
तद्वनम् भविता राष्ट्रम् यत्र रामो निवत्स्यति || २-३७-२९_END
BEGIN_
"Where Rama is not a king, that place will not indeed become on kingdom. That
forest, where Rama will be living, can become a kingdom."_END

B_2_C_39_11
BEGIN_
राजा सत्वरम् आहूय व्यापृतम् वित्त संचये |
उवाच देश कालज्ञो निश्चितम् सर्वतः शुचि || २-३९-१४_END
BEGIN_
The king, who knew what should be done at a proper place and time and was clear by
all means, quickly called an officer placed in charge of the treasury and spoke in a decisive tone
(as follows);-_END

B_2_C_40_2
BEGIN_
अन्वक्षम् लक्ष्मणो भ्रातुः कौसल्याम् अभ्यवादयत् |
अथ मातुः सुमित्राया जग्राह चरणौ पुनः || २-४०-३_END
BEGIN_
Immediately following his brother, Lakshmana too bowed to Kausalya, then clasped the
feet of his mother Sumitra._END

B_2_C_34_48
BEGIN_
अर्थितो ह्यस्मि कैकेय्या वनम् गच्छेति राघव |
मया चोक्तं प्रजामीति तत्सत्यमनुपालये || २-३४-५०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh Dasaratha the seion of Raghu! I was indeed asked by Kaikeyi to go to the forest.
It was also replied by me that I would go. I shall redeem that pledge."_END

B_2_C_37_28
BEGIN_
न ह्यदत्ताम् महीम् पित्रा भरतः शास्तुमर्हति |
त्वयि वा पुत्रवद्वस्तुम् यदि जातो महीपतेः || २-३७-३०_END
BEGIN_
"If Bharata is born to king Dasaratha, he is not fit either to rule the earth that
is not being offered by his father nor to live as a son in your case."_END

B_2_C_39_12
BEGIN_
वासांसि च महा अर्हाणि भूषणानि वराणि च |
वर्षाणि एतानि सम्ख्याय वैदेह्याः क्षिप्रम् आनय || २-३९-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Quickly bring for Seetha, clothings of great worth and ornaments of high quality,
taking into consideration all these years (that Seetha has to spend in exile)_END

B_2_C_40_3
BEGIN_
तम् वन्दमानम् रुदती माता सौमित्रिम् अब्रवीत् |
हित कामा महा बाहुम् मूर्ध्नि उपाघ्राय लक्ष्मणम् || २-४०-४_END
BEGIN_
Smelling (as a token of affection) the head of Lakshmana mighty armed, who was
saluting her, his mother Sumitra who wished well of him, spoke weepin, to that son of her ( as
follows)_END

B_2_C_34_49
BEGIN_
मा चोत्कण्थां कृथा देव वने रंस्यामहे वयम् |
प्रशान्तहरिणाकीर्णे नानाशकुनिनादिते || २-३४-५१_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, king! Do not feel anxious. We shall sport in the forest, flocked with peaceful
deer and rendered noisy by birds of various types."_END

B_2_C_37_29
BEGIN_
यद्यपि त्वम् क्षितितलाद्गगनम् चोत्पतिष्यसि |
पितुर्व्ंशचरित्रज्ञः सोऽन्यथा न करिष्यति ||२-३७-३१_END
BEGIN_
"Even if you can jump from the surface of the earth to the sky, Bharata who knows
the record of his father's dynasty will not do as you wish him to do"_END

B_2_C_39_13
BEGIN_
नर इन्द्रेण एवम् उक्तः तु गत्वा कोश गृहम् ततः |
प्रायच्चत् सर्वम् आहृत्य सीतायै क्षिप्रम् एव तत् || २-३९-१६_END
BEGIN_
After thus spoken by the king, the officer went to the treasury, brought all that in
a lot and gave to Seetha._END

B_2_C_40_4
BEGIN_
सृष्टः त्वम् वन वासाय स्वनुरक्तः सुहृज् जने |
रामे प्रमादम् मा कार्षीः पुत्र भ्रातरि गच्चति || २-४०-५_END
BEGIN_
"Highly fond of your kinsman Rama, you have been pemitted (by me) to dwell in the
forest(with your eldest half-brother). Do not neglect your half-brother). Do not neglect your
half-brother Rama, who is going to the forest, my son!"_END

B_2_C_34_50
BEGIN_
पिता हि दैवतम् तात देवतानामपि स्मृतम् |
तस्माद्दैवतमित्येव करिष्यामि पितुर्वचः || २-३४-५२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, father! It was indeed said that even for celestials, father is the god.
Therefore, I shall carry out the father's word, considering it as divine."_END

B_2_C_37_30
BEGIN_
तत्त्वया पुत्रगर्धिन्या पुत्रस्य कृतमप्रियम् |
लोके हि स न विद्येत यो न राममनुव्रतः || २-३७-३२_END
BEGIN_
"therefore, an unfriendly act(alone) has been done by you, eventhough you are
covetons towards his well-being. There is none indeed in this world who is not devoted to Rama"_END

B_2_C_39_14
BEGIN_
सा सुजाता सुजातानि वैदेही प्रस्थिता वनम् |
भूषयाम् आस गात्राणि तैः विचित्रैः विभूषणैः || २-३९-१७_END
BEGIN_
Setting out as she was to the forest, Seetha of noble birth adorned her beautiful
limbs with those wonderful jewels._END

B_2_C_40_5
BEGIN_
व्यसनी वा समृद्धो वा गतिर् एष तव अनघ |
एष लोके सताम् धर्मः यज् ज्येष्ठ वशगो भवेत् || २-४०-६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, sinless one! Whether in adversity or in riches, he alone is refugee to you. It
should become the code of conduct in the world, that younger brother should be subject to the
control of his elder brother."_END

B_2_C_34_51
BEGIN_
चतुर्धशसु वर्षेषु गतेषु नरसत्तम |
पुनर्द्रक्ष्यसि माम् प्राप्तम् सन्तापोऽयम् विमुच्यताम् || २-३४-५३_END
BEGIN_
"Oh father, the best among men! You will see me, when I come back after elapsing
fourteen years. Let this grief be given up."_END

B_2_C_37_31
BEGIN_
द्रक्ष्यस्यद्यैव कैकेयि पशुव्याळमृगद्विजान् |
गच्छतः सह रामेण पादपांश्च तदुन्मुखान् || २-३७-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Kaikeyi! You will see now itself that beasts, elephants, deers and birds going
with Rama and trees also turning their faces towards Rama."_END

B_2_C_39_15
BEGIN_
व्यराजयत वैदेही वेश्म तत् सुविभूषिता |
उद्यतः अंशुमतः काले खम् प्रभा इव विवस्वतः || २-३९-१८_END
BEGIN_
Seetha, beautifully adorned as she was, illumined that palace, as the sky in a
morning is illuminated by a rising sun._END

B_2_C_40_6
BEGIN_
इदम् हि वृत्तम् उचितम् कुलस्य अस्य सनातनम् |
दानम् दीक्षा च यज्ञेषु तनु त्यागो मृधेषु च || २-४०-७_END
BEGIN_
"It is indeed a practice right from ancient times in your race, to make gifts, to
dedicate onself to performance of sacrificial rites and to foresake one's body to fight
battles."_END

B_2_C_41_0
BEGIN_
तस्मिंस्तु पुरुषव्याघ्रे विनिर्याति कृताञ्जलौ |
आर्तशब्दोऽथ सम्जज्ञे स्त्रीणामन्तह्पुते तदा || २-४१-१_END
BEGIN_
As Rama the tiger among men, having paid obeisance with joined palms departed, a
great cry of distress arose among women of inner apartments._END

B_2_C_34_52
BEGIN_
येन संस्तम्भनीयोऽयम् सर्वो बाष्पगळो जनः |
स त्वम् पुरुषशार्दूल किमर्थम् विक्रियाम् गतः || २-३४-५४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, tiger among men! Why have you got perturbed-you by whom all these people bathed
in tears, ought to be consoled?"_END

B_2_C_37_32
BEGIN_
अथोत्तमान्याभरणानि देवि |
देहि स्नुषायै व्यपनीय चीरम् |
न चीरमस्याः प्रविधीयतेति |
न्यवारयत् तद्वसनम् वसिष्ठः || २-३७-३४_END
BEGIN_
"Moreover, putting aside the bark of trees, give excellent jewellery to your
daughter-in-law, Oh, Kaikeyi! the bark of trees is not ordained for her" Thus saying so, Vasishta
prevented that wearing of garment by Seetha._END

B_2_C_39_16
BEGIN_
ताम् भुजाभ्याम् परिष्वज्य श्वश्रूर् वचनम् अब्रवीत् |
अनाचरन्तीम् कृपणम् मूध्नि उपाघ्राय मैथिलीम् || २-३९-१९_END
BEGIN_
Embracing in her arms that princess of Mithila, who never behaved in self-pity, and
smelling her head(as a token of affection), her mother-in-law(Kausalya) spoke as follows:_END

B_2_C_40_7
BEGIN_
लक्स्मणम् त्वेवम्क्त्वा सा संसिद्धम् प्रियराघवम् |
सुमित्रा गच्छ गच्छेति पुनः पुनरुवाच तम् || २-४०-८_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking to Lakshmana, who was in readiness to leave the forest and who loved
Rama dearly, Sumitra repeatedly said to him, "fare forth, fare forth!"_END

B_2_C_41_1
BEGIN_
अनाथस्य जनस्य अस्य दुर्बलस्य तपस्विनः |
यो गतिम् शरणम् च आसीत् स नाथः क्व नु गच्चति || २-४१-२_END
BEGIN_
Where is he going, who was the path, who became the protector of the people, who are
now defenseless weak and unhappy?"_END

B_2_C_34_53
BEGIN_
पुरम् च राष्ट्रम् च मही च केवला |
मया निसृष्टा भरताय दीयताम् |
अहम् निदेशम् भवतः अनुपालयन् |
वनम् गमिष्यामि चिराय सेवितुम् || २-३४-५५_END
BEGIN_
"Let this city, province and whole of this earth left by me, be given to Bharata. I
for one following your instructions, shall proceed to the forest to dwell in it for long."_END

B_2_C_37_33
BEGIN_
एकस्य रामस्य वने निवास |
स्त्वया वृतह् केकयराजपुत्रि |
विभूषितेयम् प्रतिकर्मनित्या |
वसत्वरण्ये सह राघवेण || २-३७-३५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Kaikeyi! It was solicited by you, the dwelling in the forest of Rama only. Let
Seetha, to be decorated daily, be adorned with ornaments and live in the forest along with
Rama."_END

B_2_C_39_17
BEGIN_
असत्यः सर्व लोके अस्मिन् सततम् सत्कृताः प्रियैः |
भर्तारम् न अनुमन्यन्ते विनिपात गतम् स्त्रियः || २-३९-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Dishonest women, eventhough adored all the time by their husbands, cease to esteem
their husband who has come to pass into evil days, throughout this world."_END

B_2_C_40_8
BEGIN_
रामम् दशरथम् विद्धि माम् विद्धि जनक आत्मजाम् |
अयोध्याम् अटवीम् विद्धि गच्च तात यथा सुखम् || २-४०-९_END
BEGIN_
"Know Rama to be Dasaratha. Look upon Seetha the daughter of Janaka as myself.
Consider the forest as Ayodhya and depart happily, my son!"_END

B_2_C_41_2
BEGIN_
न क्रुध्यति अभिशस्तः अपि क्रोधनीयानि वर्जयन् |
क्रुद्धान् प्रसादयन् सर्वान् सम दुह्खः क्व गच्चति || २-४१-३_END
BEGIN_
"Where has he gone, who was not angry even when provoked, who resolved every
misunderstanding and who propitiated all those who were angry by sharing their suffering?_END

B_2_C_34_54
BEGIN_
मया निसृष्टाम् भरतः महीम् इमाम् |
सशैल खण्डाम् सपुराम् सकाननाम् |
शिवाम् सुसीमाम् अनुशास्तु केवलम् |
त्वया यद् उक्तम् नृपते यथा अस्तु तत् || २-३४-५६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, king! Let this earth with multitude of mountains, comprising of cities with
their gardens relinquished by me, be ruled over barely by Bharata, within the bounds of
righteousness. Let the word of honour given by you(to Kaikeyi) come true."_END

B_2_C_37_34
BEGIN_
यानैश्च मुख्यैः परिचारकैश्च |
सुसम्वृता गच्छतु राजपुत्री |
वस्रैश्च सर्वैः सहितैर्विधानै |
र्नेयम् वृता ते वरसम्प्रदाने || २-३७-३६_END
BEGIN_
"Let Seetha go with excellent conveyances, well accompanied by attendants, with all
costumes and useful accessories. Her exile was not indeed solicted by you, while asking for
boons"_END

B_2_C_39_18
BEGIN_
एष स्वभावो नारीणामनुभूय पुरा सुखम् |
अल्पामप्यापदम् प्राप्य दुष्यन्ति प्रजहत्यपि || २-३९-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Having enjoyed happiness in the past, they become spoiled and even desert their
husband, on obtaining even the least misfortune: such is the nature of (bad) women."_END

B_2_C_40_9
BEGIN_
ततः सुमन्त्रः काकुत्स्थम् प्रान्जलिर् वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् |
विनीतः विनयज्ञः च मातलिर् वासवम् यथा || २-४०-१०_END
BEGIN_
Then, Sumantra the humble man, who was aware of humility, joined his palms and spoke
these words to Rama even as Matali(charioteer of Indra) would to Indra (the ruler of gods)._END

B_2_C_41_3
BEGIN_
कौसल्यायाम् महा तेजा यथा मातरि वर्तते |
तथा यो वर्तते अस्मासु महात्मा क्व नु गच्चति || २-४१-४_END
BEGIN_
That illustrious and great-souled Rama, who treated us with the same reverence he
paid to his own mother, where has he gone?"_END

B_2_C_34_55
BEGIN_
न मे तथा पार्थिव धीयते मनो |
महत्सु कामेषु न च आत्मनः प्रिये |
यथा निदेशे तव शिष्ट सम्मते |
व्यपैतु दुह्खम् तव मत् कृते अनघ || २-३४-५७_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, the faultless king! My mind is not directed on haughty physical enjoyments or
sensuous pleasures which is approved by the wise. Let your agony disappear, for my sake."_END

B_2_C_37_35
BEGIN_
तस्मिंस्तथा जल्पति विप्रमुख्ये |
गुरौ नृपस्याप्रतिमप्रभावे |
नैव स्म सीता विनिवृत्तभावा |
प्रियस्य भर्तुः प्रतिकारकामा || २-३७-३७_END
BEGIN_
Eventhough Vasista, the preceptor of the king, who had an influenc beyond compare
and the best of brahmanas was speaking as above, Seetha did not turn away here resolution to follow
the ways of her beloved husband._END

B_2_C_39_19
BEGIN_
असत्यशीला विकृता दुर्र्गाह्याहृदयास्तथा |
युवत्यः पापसम्कल्पाः क्षणमात्राद्विरागिणः || २-३९-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Young women, who are evil-minded, are untruthful in their disposition, are affected
by passion and their essence, incomprehensible. They get aversion within a moment."_END

B_2_C_40_10
BEGIN_
रथम् आरोह भद्रम् ते राज पुत्र महा यशः |
क्षिप्रम् त्वाम् प्रापयिष्यामि यत्र माम् राम वक्ष्यसि || २-४०-११_END
BEGIN_
"Mount the chariot, oh the highly illustrious prince! May all be well with you! I
shall take you speedily, wherever you direct me to go."_END

B_2_C_41_4
BEGIN_
कैकेय्या क्लिश्यमानेन राज्ञा संचोदितः वनम् |
परित्राता जनस्य अस्य जगतः क्व नु गच्चति || २-४१-५_END
BEGIN_
"Where has he gone, he the protector of the people and the whole world, driven to
the forest by the king, goaded on by Kaikeyi? ''_END

B_2_C_34_56
BEGIN_
तत् अद्य न एव अनघ राज्यम् अव्ययम् |
न सर्व कामान् न सुखम् न मैथिलीम् |
न जीवितम् त्वाम् अनृतेन योजयन् |
वृणीय सत्यम् व्रतम् अस्तु ते तथा || २-३४-५८_END
BEGIN_
Oh, the sinless king! Therefore, now associating you with untruth, I just do not
desire for kingdom, nor all the sensual enjoyments, nor happiness nor existence nor even Seetha.
Let your pledge(given to Kaikeyi) prove true."_END

B_2_C_39_20
BEGIN_
न कुलम् न कृतम् विद्या न दत्तम् नापि सम्ग्रहः |
स्त्रीणाम् गृह्णाति हृदयमनित्यहृदया हि ताः || २-३९-२३_END
BEGIN_
Neither a noble descent, nor an accomplishment, nor learning, nor a gift nor even
entertainment can capture the heart of women. They are unstbale of their heart indeed!"_END

B_2_C_40_11
BEGIN_
चतुर् दश हि वर्षाणि वस्तव्यानि वने त्वया |
तानि उपक्रमितव्यानि यानि देव्या असि चोदितः || २-४०-१२_END
BEGIN_
"you have to reside in the forest for fourteen years. Those years, as directed by
the queen, are to be considered having commenced."_END

B_2_C_41_5
BEGIN_
अहो निश्चेतनो राजा जीव लोकस्य सम्प्रियम् |
धर्म्यम् सत्य व्रतम् रामम् वन वासो प्रवत्स्यति || २-४१-६_END
BEGIN_
"Alas! In his folly, the king has banished the virtuous the beloved and the strictly
truthful Rama to the forest!"_END

B_2_C_34_57
BEGIN_
फलानि मूलानि च भक्षयन् वने |
गिरीमः च पश्यन् सरितः सरांसि च |
वनम् प्रविश्य एव विचित्र पादपम् |
सुखी भविष्यामि तव अस्तु निर्वृतिः || २-३४-५९_END
BEGIN_
"I shall be happy, entering the forest filled with wonderful trees, eating fruits
and tubers as well as seeing mountains rivers and lakes in the forest. Let there be satisfaction
for you._END

B_2_C_39_21
BEGIN_
साध्वीनाम् हि स्थितानाम् तु शीले सत्ये श्रुते शमे |
स्त्रीणाम् पवित्रम् परमम् पतिरेको विशिष्यते || २-३९-२४_END
BEGIN_
"But, for women established in good conduct, truthfulness, sacred learning and
mental quietness, their husband alone is the most sacred entity, the best of all."_END

B_2_C_40_12
BEGIN_
तम् रथम् सूर्य सम्काशम् सीता हृष्टेन चेतसा |
आरुरोह वर आरोहा कृत्वा अलम्कारम् आत्मनः || २-४०-१३_END
BEGIN_
Having adorned herself, Seetha with her comely buttocks, mounted with a delighted
mind, that chariot which was shining like the sun._END

B_2_C_41_6
BEGIN_
इति सर्वा महिष्यः ता विवत्साइव धेनवः |
रुरुदुः चैव दुह्ख आर्ताः सस्वरम् च विचुक्रुशुः || २-४१-७_END
BEGIN_
Thus did all the queens lament, like unto cows deprived of their calves and in there
affection cried out loudly._END

B_2_C_34_58
BEGIN_
एवम् स राजा व्यसनाभिपन्नः |
शोकेन दुःखेन च ताम्यमानः |
आलिङ्ग्य पुत्रम् सुविनष्टसम्ज्ञो |
मोहम् गतो नैव चिचेश्ट किंचित् || २-३४-६०_END
BEGIN_
Embracing his son, that king Dasaratha, who had thus fallen on evil days, was
tormented with grief and distress, got fainted, fully losing his consciousness and not moving even
a little._END

B_2_C_39_22
BEGIN_
स त्वया न अवमन्तव्यः पुत्रः प्रव्राजितः मम |
तव दैवतम् अस्तु एष निर्धनः सधनो अपि वा || २-३९-२५_END
BEGIN_
"My son who is being sent to the forest should not be despised by you. Even if he is
invested with riches or without riches, let him be a deity to you."_END

B_2_C_40_13
BEGIN_
तथैव आयुध जातानि भ्रातृभ्याम् कवचानि च |
रथ उपस्थे प्रतिन्यस्य सचर्म कठिनम् च तत् || २-४०-१४_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, Rama and Lakshmana the brothers quickly mounted that chariot, which was
replendent like fire and decked with gold._END

B_2_C_41_7
BEGIN_
स तम् अन्तः पुरे घोरम् आर्त शब्दम् मही पतिः |
पुत्र शोक अभिसम्तप्तः श्रुत्वा च आसीत् सुदुह्खितः || २-४१-८_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those terrible crying sounds in the private apartments, the king profoundly
afflicted by the departure of his son, became increasingly depressed._END

B_2_C_34_59
BEGIN_
देव्यस्ततः सम्रुरुदुः समेता |
स्ताम् वर्जयित्वा नरदेवपत्नीम् |
रुदन् सुमन्त्रोऽपि जगाम मूर्छाम् |
हा हा कृतम् तत्र बभूव सर्वम् || २-३४-६१_END
BEGIN_
Then, all the queens assembled there except Kaikeyi began to cry. Sumantra also fell
into a swoon, while weeping. Everything there became loud lamenting._END

B_2_C_39_23
BEGIN_
विज्ञाय वचनम् सीता तस्या धर्म अर्थ सम्हितम् |
कृत अन्जलिर् उवाच इदम् श्वश्रूम् अभिमुखे स्थिता || २-३९-२६_END
BEGIN_
perceiving her words, endowed with essence of righteousness and joining her palms,
Seetha replied to her mother-in-law standing in front of her, as follows:-_END

B_2_C_41_8
BEGIN_
न अग्नि होत्राणि अहूयन्त सूर्यः च अन्तर् अधीयत |
व्यसृजन् कवलान् नागा गावो वत्सान् न पाययन् || २-४१-९_END
BEGIN_
On the departure of Rama to the forest, the sacred fires were no longer performed,
no house holder prepared food, the people did not do their acts and even the sun went into
eclipse._END

B_2_C_40_14
BEGIN_
वनवासम् हि सम्ख्यय वासांस्याभरणानि च |
भर्तारमनुगच्छन्त्यै सीतायै श्वशुरो ददौ || २-४०-१५_END
BEGIN_
For Seetha who was accompanying with her husband, Dasaratha gave away garments and
jewellery, taking into consideration the period for which she had to stay in the forest._END

B_2_C_42_0
BEGIN_
यावत् तु निर्यतः तस्य रजो रूपम् अदृश्यत |
न एव इक्ष्वाकु वरः तावत् सम्जहार आत्म चक्षुषी || २-४२-१_END
BEGIN_
As long as the dust raised by the wheels of Rama's chariot could be seen, so long
did the king not withdraw his gaze from it._END

B_2_C_39_24
BEGIN_
करिष्ये सर्वम् एव अहम् आर्या यद् अनुशास्ति माम् |
अभिज्ञा अस्मि यथा भर्तुर् वर्तितव्यम् श्रुतम् च मे || २-३९-२७_END
BEGIN_
"I shall do just all that, as your venerable self instructs me. I know how I should
behave towards my husband. I have also heard about it earlier."_END

B_2_C_41_9
BEGIN_
व्यसृजन् कबलान्नागा गावो वत्सान्न पाययन् |
पुत्रम् प्रथमजम् लब्ध्वा जननी नाभ्यनन्दत || २-४१-१०_END
BEGIN_
Elephants threw out the morsels of food they had taken into their mouths. Cows did
not give suck to their calves. Mother did not rejoice, for having got a son born for the first
time._END

B_2_C_40_15
BEGIN_
तथैवायुधजालानि भ्रातृभ्याम् कवचानि च |
रथोपस्थे प्रतिन्यस्य सचर्म कठिनम् च तत् || २-४०-१६
सीता तृतीयान् आरूढान् दृष्ट्वा धृष्टम् अचोदयत् |
सुमन्त्रः सम्मतान् अश्वान् वायु वेग समान् जवे || २-४०-१७_END
BEGIN_
Even so for the two brothers, keeping the sets of weapon, an armour of hard make
with leather-cover in the midst of the chariot, Sumantra saw the three of whom Seetha constituted
the third mounted and quickly drove the horses which were highly admired, with their swiftness
resembling the velocity of wind._END

B_2_C_42_1
BEGIN_
यावद् राजा प्रियम् पुत्रम् पश्यति अत्यन्त धार्मिकम् |
तावद् व्यवर्धत इव अस्य धरण्याम् पुत्र दर्शने || २-४२-२_END
BEGIN_
As long as the king was seeing his beloved son who was exceedingly virtuous, so long
did the dust in the earth appear to be rising for the purpose of seeing his son._END

B_2_C_39_25
BEGIN_
न माम् असज् जनेन आर्या समानयितुम् अर्हति |
धर्मात् विचलितुम् न अहम् अलम् चन्द्रात् इव प्रभा || २-३९-२८_END
BEGIN_
"Your venerable self is not worthy of equating me with evil women. I am unable to
deviate from virtue, even as a moon from the moonlight"_END

B_2_C_41_10
BEGIN_
त्रिशन्कुर् लोहित अन्गः च बृहस्पति बुधाव् अपि |
दारुणाः सोमम् अभ्येत्य ग्रहाः सर्वे व्यवस्थिताः || २-४१-११_END
BEGIN_
Trisanku, Lohintanga, Brihaspati as also Budha and all other planets assumed a
menacing aspect and got stayed with the moon._END

B_2_C_40_16
BEGIN_
प्रयाते तु महा अरण्यम् चिर रात्राय राघवे |
बभूव नगरे मूर्च्चा बल मूर्च्चा जनस्य च || २-४०-१८_END
BEGIN_
Rama after departing to the great forest for a long term, unconsciousness prevailed
in the city. There was faintness in the strength of people._END

B_2_C_42_2
BEGIN_
न पश्यति रजो अपि अस्य यदा रामस्य भूमिपः |
तदा आर्तः च विषण्णः च पपात धरणी तले || २-४२-३_END
BEGIN_
When the dust raised by Rama's chariot was no longer visible, the unfortunate king
afflicted by dejection, fell insensible on ground._END

B_2_C_39_26
BEGIN_
न अतन्त्री वाद्यते वीणा न अचक्रः वर्तते रथः |
न अपतिः सुखम् एधते या स्यात् अपि शत आत्मजा || २-३९-२९_END
BEGIN_
"Vina (Indian lute) does not resonate without chords. Chariot does not move without
wheels. Now can a wife bereft of her husband, even if blessed with hundred children, will not lie
happily in comfort."_END

B_2_C_41_11
BEGIN_
नक्षत्राणि गत अर्चीम्षि ग्रहाः च गत तेजसः |
विशाखाः च सधूमाः च नभसि प्रचकाशिरे || २-४१-१२_END
BEGIN_
Stars ceased to twinkle. Planets were deprived of their splendour. The stars of
Visakha appeared in the heaven, veiled in the mist._END

B_2_C_40_17
BEGIN_
तत् समाकुल सम्भ्रान्तम् मत्त सम्कुपित द्विपम् |
हय शिन्जित निर्घोषम् पुरम् आसीन् महा स्वनम् || २-४०-१९_END
BEGIN_
The city( of Ayodhya) is filled with flurry, with its elephants intoxicated in rut
and highly excited and resonant with tinkling of ornaments of horses._END

B_2_C_42_3
BEGIN_
तस्य दक्षिणम् अन्वगात् कौसल्या बाहुम् अन्गना |
वामम् च अस्य अन्वगात् पार्श्वम् कैकेयी भरत प्रिया || २-४२-४_END
BEGIN_
When Dasaratha fell down, Kausalya his wife took her place on his right side to lift
him up and Kaikeyi of charming limbs took her place on his left side._END

B_2_C_39_27
BEGIN_
मितम् ददाति हि पिता मितम् माता मितम् सुतः |
अमितस्य हि दातारम् भर्तारम् का न पूजयेत् || २-३९-३०_END
BEGIN_
"A father indeed gives a limited extent, a mother in a limited measure and a son in
moderation. Which woman, then, would not adore her husband, the bestower of unlimitedness!"_END

B_2_C_41_12
BEGIN_
कालिकानिलवेगेन महोदधिरिवोत्थितः |
रामे वनम् प्रव्रजिते नगरम् प्रचचाल तत् || २-४१-१३_END
BEGIN_
The great ocean rose, as by a speed of a long-lasting tempest. While Rama went to
the forest, that city was shaken._END

B_2_C_40_18
BEGIN_
ततः सबाल वृद्धा सा पुरी परम पीडिता |
रामम् एव अभिदुद्राव घर्म आर्तः सलिलम् यथा || २-४०-२०_END
BEGIN_
That city, including the youngsters and the old, stricken with extreme agony, ran
towards Rama alone, in the same way as the one afflicted with heat of the sun rushes towards
water._END

B_2_C_42_4
BEGIN_
ताम् नयेन च सम्पन्नो धर्मेण निवयेन च |
उवाच राजा कैकेयीम् समीक्ष्य व्यथित इन्द्रियः || २-४२-५_END
BEGIN_
The king endowed with wisdom virtue and discretion seeing Kaikeyi beside him, said
to her in great agitation as follows:_END

B_2_C_39_28
BEGIN_
सा अहम् एवम् गता श्रेष्ठा श्रुत धर्म पर अवरा |
आर्ये किम् अवमन्येयम् स्त्रीणाम् भर्ता हि दैवतम् || २-३९-३१_END
BEGIN_
"Having heard about the special and ordinary duties of a wife from the most
excellent women, how can I, as such, despise my husband, Oh venerable lady? Husband is indeed a
deity to women."_END

B_2_C_41_13
BEGIN_
दिशः पर्याकुलाः सर्वा स्तिमिरेणेव सम्वृताः |
न ग्रहो नापि नक्षत्रं प्रचकाशे न किंचन || २-४१-१४_END
BEGIN_
All the cardinal points, having been disturbed, were covered by darkness. Planets
did not become visible, nor the stars nor any other thing in heaven._END

B_2_C_40_19
BEGIN_
पार्श्वतः पृष्ठतः च अपि लम्बमानाः तत् उन्मुखाः |
बाष्प पूर्ण मुखाः सर्वे तम् ऊचुर् भृश दुह्खिताः || २-४०-२१_END
BEGIN_
Having down towards sides and back of the chariot with their faces turned towards
Rama and with their faces filled with tears, all those people said with loud voices to Sumantra
thus:_END

B_2_C_42_5
BEGIN_
कैकेयि मा मम अन्गानि स्प्राक्षीस् त्वम् दुष्ट चारिणी |
न हि त्वाम् द्रष्टुम् इच्चामि न भार्या न च बान्धवी || २-४२-६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, wicked Kaikeyi! Do not touch my limbs. I do not wish to see you .You are no
longer my wife nor a relative."_END

B_2_C_39_29
BEGIN_
सीताया वचनम् श्रुत्वा कौसल्या हृदयम् गमम् |
शुद्ध सत्त्वा मुमोच अश्रु सहसा दुह्ख हर्षजम् || २-३९-३२_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Seetha's words, which touched her heart, Kausalya of pure mind suddenly
started shedding tears born of agony and delight._END

B_2_C_41_14
BEGIN_
अकस्मान् नागरः सर्वो जनो दैन्यम् उपागमत् |
आहारे वा विहारे वा न कश्चित् अकरोन् मनः || २-४१-१५_END
BEGIN_
All the people of the city suddenly became apathetic. No one was interested in
either food or in pastime._END

B_2_C_40_20
BEGIN_
सम्यच्च वाजिनाम् रश्मीन् सूत याहि शनैः शनैः |
मुखम् द्रक्ष्यामि रामस्य दुर्दर्शम् नो भविष्यति || २-४०-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Hold in the reins of the horses and go slowly and slowly, Oh charioteer! We would
behold the face of Rama, which would be henceforth difficult to behold for us"_END

B_2_C_42_6
BEGIN_
ये च त्वाम् उपजीवन्ति न अहम् तेषाम् न ते मम |
केवल अर्थ पराम् हि त्वाम् त्यक्त धर्माम् त्यजाम्य् अहम् || २-४२-७_END
BEGIN_
"I am not of those who are dependent on you nor are they anything to me. I discord
you, by whom righteousness has been discorded and who are solely interested in avariciousness."_END

B_2_C_39_30
BEGIN_
ताम् प्रान्जलिर् अभिक्रम्य मातृ मध्ये अतिसत्कृताम् |
रामः परम धर्मज्ञो मातरम् वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् || २-३९-३३_END
BEGIN_
Rama, the most virtuous man, joining his palms, approached and spoke these words to
his mother, who is highly respected among all his mothers:_END

B_2_C_41_15
BEGIN_
शोकपर्यायसन्तप्तः सततं दीर्घमुच्छ्वसन् |
अयोध्यायाम् जनः सर्वः शुशोच जगतीपतिम् || २-४१-१६_END
BEGIN_
All the people of Ayodhya, afflicted by grief in succession, heaved profound and
burning sighs and bewailed about the departure of the Lord of the earth._END

B_2_C_40_21
BEGIN_
आयसम् हृदयम् नूनम् राम मातुर् असंशयम् |
यद् देव गर्भ प्रतिमे वनम् याति न भिद्यते || २-४०-२३_END
BEGIN_
"The heart of Rama's mother(Kausalya) is surely and undoubtedly made of iron, since
it does not get broken when Rama resembling an offspring of gods is going to the forest"_END

B_2_C_42_7
BEGIN_
अगृह्णाम् यच् च ते पाणिम् अग्निम् पर्यणयम् च यत् |
अनुजानामि तत् सर्वम् अस्मिम्ल् लोके परत्र च || २-४२-८_END
BEGIN_
All that contract which I entered into by taking your hand and circumambulating the
sacred fire, I now renounce in this world and the next. "_END

B_2_C_39_31
BEGIN_
अम्ब मा दुह्खिता भूस् त्वम् पश्य त्वम् पितरम् मम |
क्षयो हि वन वासस्य क्षिप्रम् एव भविष्यति || २-३९-३४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, mother! You do not grieve. You look after my father. The end of exile will come
rather soon."_END

B_2_C_41_16
BEGIN_
बाष्प पर्याकुल मुखो राज मार्ग गतः जनः |
न हृष्टः लक्ष्यते कश्चित् सर्वः शोक परायणः || २-४१-१७_END
BEGIN_
The people in the king's way were wearing distressed faces filled with tears. No one
appeared rejoicing. All were possessed by grief._END

B_2_C_43_0
BEGIN_
ततः समीक्ष्य शयने सन्नम् शोकेन पार्थिवम् |
कौसल्या पुत्र शोक आर्ता तम् उवाच मही पतिम् || २-४३-१_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, Kausalya afflicted with grief of her son and seeing the king lying down
depressed with sorrow, spoke to the monarch as follows:_END

B_2_C_40_22
BEGIN_
कृत कृत्या हि वैदेही चाया इव अनुगता पतिम् |
न जहाति रता धर्मे मेरुम् अर्क प्रभा यथा || २-४०-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Seetha(the princess of Videha kingdom) has done what ought to be done, by going
along with him like a shadow, delighted in virtue as she was and does not leave her husband in the
same way as Mount Meru does not leave the efflugence of sun"_END

B_2_C_42_8
BEGIN_
भरतः चेत् प्रतीतः स्यात् राज्यम् प्राप्य इदम् अव्ययम् |
यन् मे स दद्यात् पित्र् अर्थम् मा मा तत् दत्तम् आगमत् || २-४२-९_END
BEGIN_
"If Bharata feels cheerful for having got this kingdom which is imperishable, let
the obsequial rites performed to me after my death do not reach me"_END

B_2_C_39_32
BEGIN_
सुप्तायाः ते गमिष्यन्ति नव वर्षाणि पन्च च |
सा समग्रम् इह प्राप्तम् माम् द्रक्ष्यसि सुहृद् वृतम् || २-३९-३५_END
BEGIN_
"Fourteen years will elapse, while you are asleep. you as such, will see me, duly
arrived here in my entire being, surrounded by my well-wishers."_END

B_2_C_41_17
BEGIN_
न वाति पवनः शीतः न शशी सौम्य दर्शनः |
न सूर्यः तपते लोकम् सर्वम् पर्याकुलम् जगत् || २-४१-१८_END
BEGIN_
The wind was not blowing coolly. The moon did not appear beneficient. The sun did
not give out warmth to the earth. The entire world was in disorder_END

B_2_C_43_1
BEGIN_
राघवो नर शार्दूल विषम् उप्त्वा द्विजिह्ववत् |
विचरिष्यति कैकेयी निर्मुक्ता इव हि पन्नगी || २-४३-२_END
BEGIN_
"Having planted her poison on Rama the tiger among men, indeed Kaikeyi of crooked
ways will surely wander about freely like a female serpent that has cast off its slough"_END

B_2_C_40_23
BEGIN_
अहो लक्ष्मण सिद्ध अर्थः सतताम् प्रिय वादिनम् |
भ्रातरम् देव सम्काशम् यः त्वम् परिचरिष्यसि || २-४०-२५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Lakshmana! You are attending ever to your brother who speaks affectionately and
is equal to the god. Ah, you are the accomplisher of purpose!"_END

B_2_C_42_9
BEGIN_
अथ रेणु समुध्वस्तम् तम् उत्थाप्य नर अधिपम् |
न्यवर्तत तदा देवी कौसल्या शोक कर्शिता || २-४२-१०_END
BEGIN_
Meanwhile Kausalya the queen overwhelmed with grief, lifted up the king who was
covered with dust and returned to her house._END

B_2_C_39_33
BEGIN_
एतावद् अभिनीत अर्थम् उक्त्वा स जननीम् वचः |
त्रयः शत शत अर्धा हि ददर्श अवेक्ष्य मातरः || २-३९-३६_END
BEGIN_
Uttering the aforesaid words of such quality and appropriate meaning to his mother,
Rama thought once again and gazed at his three hundred and fifty step-mothers._END

B_2_C_41_18
BEGIN_
अनर्थिनः सुताः स्त्रीणाम् भर्तारः भ्रातरः तथा |
सर्वे सर्वम् परित्यज्य रामम् एव अन्वचिन्तयन् || २-४१-१९_END
BEGIN_
Sons did not ask for their mothers and husbands did not ask for their wives.
Brothers did not enquire about their sisters. All gave up every thing and thought of Rama
alone._END

B_2_C_43_2
BEGIN_
विवास्य रामम् सुभगा लब्ध कामा समाहिता |
त्रासयिष्यति माम् भूयो दुष्ट अहिर् इव वेश्मनि || २-४३-३_END
BEGIN_
"Having fulfilled her desire of expelling Rama to the forest, Kaikeyi the charming
woman will frighten by clamping down upon me, like a dangerous serpent in the house."_END

B_2_C_40_24
BEGIN_
महति एषा हि ते सिद्धिर् एष च अभ्युदयो महान् |
एष स्वर्गस्य मार्गः च यद् एनम् अनुगच्चसि || २-४०-२६_END
BEGIN_
"It is an immense fulfilment for you, it is a tremendous good fortune for you, nay,
it is even a means to heaven that you are following this Rama"_END

B_2_C_42_10
BEGIN_
हत्वा इव ब्राह्मणम् कामात् स्पृष्ट्वा अग्निम् इव पाणिना |
अन्वतप्यत धर्म आत्मा पुत्रम् संचिन्त्य तापसम् || २-४२-११_END
BEGIN_
The virtuous monarch, thinking deeply of his son Rama, was so desolated as one who
has slain a brahmin intentionally or as touching the fire by hand._END

B_2_C_41_19
BEGIN_
ये तु रामस्य सुहृदः सर्वे ते मूढ चेतसः |
शोक भारेण च आक्रान्ताः शयनम् न जुहुस् तदा || २-४१-२०_END
BEGIN_
Then, all of Rama's own friends were bewildered in mind and the weight of their
agony overwhelmed them. They did not leave their beds._END

B_2_C_39_34
BEGIN_
ताः च अपि स तथैव आर्ता मातृऋर् दशरथ आत्मजः |
धर्म युक्तम् इदम् वाक्यम् निजगाद कृत अन्जलिः || २-३९-३७_END
BEGIN_
Rama joined his palms and saluted those step mothers also, who were too distressed
in the same way and spoke these words which were in consonance with the spirit of
righteousness._END

B_2_C_43_3
BEGIN_
अथ स्म नगरे रामः चरन् भैक्षम् गृहे वसेत् |
काम कारः वरम् दातुम् अपि दासम् मम आत्मजम् || २-४३-४_END
BEGIN_
"Even giving my son to her as a slave would have been better. By that Rama would
have at least stayed in the house by doing the work entrusted by her and roaming about in the city,
asking alms._END

B_2_C_40_25
BEGIN_
एवम् वदन्तः ते सोढुम् न शेकुर् बाष्पम् आगतम् |
अथ राजा वृतः स्त्रीभिर् दीनाभिर् दीन चेतनः || २-४०-२७_END
BEGIN_
Saying so, those people were not able to restrain their tears that come and followed
that Rama, their beloved delight of the Ikshvakus._END

B_2_C_42_11
BEGIN_
निवृत्य एव निवृत्य एव सीदतः रथ वर्त्मसु |
राज्ञो न अतिबभौ रूपम् ग्रस्तस्य अंशुमतः यथा || २-४२-१२_END
BEGIN_
Turning again and again towards the track of the chariot, the countenance of the
king in grief lost its radiance like sun losing its radiance when swallowed by Rahu._END

B_2_C_39_35
BEGIN_
सम्वासात् परुषम् किंचित् अज्ञानात् वा अपि यत् कृतम् |
तन् मे समनुजानीत सर्वाः च आमन्त्रयामि वः || २-३९-३८_END
BEGIN_
"Please excuse me, if I have done any mistake either becuase of our living together
or due to ignorance on my part. I now take leave of you all."_END

B_2_C_41_20
BEGIN_
ततः तु अयोध्या रहिता महात्मना |
पुरंदरेण इव मही सपर्वता |
चचाल घोरम् भय भार पीडिता |
सनाग योध अश्व गणा ननाद च || २-४१-२१_END
BEGIN_
Afflicted by fear and grief, the earth with its mountains, deprived of that great
souled Rama, suffered a terrible convulsion, as when it is abandoned by Indra the lord of rain, and
a great uproar reigned in the city which was filled with elephants, warriors and horses._END

B_2_C_43_4
BEGIN_
पातयित्वा तु कैकेय्या रामम् स्थानात् यथा इष्टतः |
प्रदिष्टः रक्षसाम् भागः पर्वणि इव आहित अग्निना || २-४३-५_END
BEGIN_
"Having willfully thrown Rama out of his position, Kaikeyi has acted in the same way
as one who tends the sacred fire throws a part of the sacrifice to ogres on a new or full
moon."_END

B_2_C_40_26
BEGIN_
अथ राजा वृतः स्त्रीभिर्दीनाभिर्दीनचेतनः |
निर्जगाम प्रियम् पुत्रम् द्रक्ष्यामि इति ब्रुवन् गृहात् || २-४०-२८_END
BEGIN_
Then, the king with the distressed mind, saying that he would behold his beloved
saw, came out of his palace surrounded by women who were too dejected._END

B_2_C_42_12
BEGIN_
विललाप च दुह्ख आर्तः प्रियम् पुत्रम् अनुस्मरन् |
नगर अन्तम् अनुप्राप्तम् बुद्ध्वा पुत्रम् अथ अब्रवीत् || २-४२-१३_END
BEGIN_
Afflicted by grief, thinking of his beloved son he lamented. Knowing that his son
reached the end of the city, he said as follows:_END

B_2_C_39_36
BEGIN_
वचनम् राघवस्यैतद्धर्मयुक्तम् समाहितम् |
शुश्रुवु स्ताः स्त्रियम् सर्वाः शोकोपहतचेतसः || २-३९-३९_END
BEGIN_
All those women, whose mind was overpowered with grief, heard the aforesaid cool
submission of Rama, which was in consonance with righteousness._END

B_2_C_43_5
BEGIN_
गज राज गतिर् वीरः महा बाहुर् धनुर् धरः |
वनम् आविशते नूनम् सभार्यः सह लक्ष्मणः || २-४३-६_END
BEGIN_
Together with his wife, accompanied by Lakshmana and walking like king of elephants
having a bow in hand, the mighty armed hero surely will have entered the forest "_END

B_2_C_40_27
BEGIN_
शुश्रुवे च अग्रतः स्त्रीनाम् रुदन्तीनाम् महा स्वनः |
यथा नादः करेणूनाम् बद्धे महति कुन्जरे || २-४०-२९_END
BEGIN_
In front of him was heard a huge noise of crying women, echoing like trumpeting of
female elephants when a lordly elephant has been pinioned._END

B_2_C_42_13
BEGIN_
वाहनानाम् च मुख्यानाम् वहताम् तम् मम आत्मजम् |
पदानि पथि दृश्यन्ते स महात्मा न दृश्यते || २-४२-१४_END
BEGIN_
"The marks of hooves of excellent horses which carried away my child are seen on the
way. But he the great souled one is not being seen"_END

B_2_C_39_37
BEGIN_
जज्ञे अथ तासाम् सम्नादः क्रौन्चीनाम् इव निह्स्वनः |
मानव इन्द्रस्य भार्याणाम् एवम् वदति राघवे || २-३९-४०_END
BEGIN_
While Rama was speaking thus, an outery, resembling the wail of female cranes arose
from those wives of Dasaratha._END

B_2_C_43_6
BEGIN_
वने तु अदृष्ट दुह्खानाम् कैकेय्या अनुमते त्वया |
त्यक्तानाम् वन वासाय का न्व् अवस्था भविष्यति || २-४३-७_END
BEGIN_
" In the forest, what fate will befall them who had never seen such a suffering
before and who have been sent by you to a forest life as per the wishes of Kaikeyi?"_END

B_2_C_40_28
BEGIN_
पिता च राजा काकुत्स्थः श्रीमान् सन्नः तदा बभौ |
परिपूर्णः शशी काले ग्रहेण उपप्लुतः यथा || २-४०-३०_END
BEGIN_
At that time, the father of Rama as is well known as a glorious king Dasaratha(a
scion of Kakutstha) looked shrunk, like the full moon oversadowed by an eclipse._END

B_2_C_42_14
BEGIN_
स नूनम् क्वचित् एव अद्य वृक्ष मूलम् उपाश्रितः |
काष्ठम् वा यदि वा अश्मानम् उपधाय शयिष्यते || २-४२-१५
उत्थास्यति च मेदिन्याः कृपणः पांशु गुण्ठितः |
विनिह्श्वसन् प्रस्रवणात् करेणूनाम् इव ऋषभः || २-४२-१६_END
BEGIN_
"He who slept on comfort on coverings sprinkled with the essence of sandalwood and
refreshed by fans waved over by him by the most deserving women, Rama the best of all my sons ,
will from now on , has to take refuge at the foot of a tree somewhere, lying down on its trunk or
rest on a stone."_END

B_2_C_39_38
BEGIN_
मुरज पणव मेघ घोषव |
द्दशरथ वेश्म बभूव यत् पुरा |
विलपित परिदेवन आकुलम् |
व्यसन गतम् तत् अभूत् सुदुह्खितम् || २-३९-४१_END
BEGIN_
Dasaratha' s palace, which was earlier resounding with tomtoms, large drums and
Meghas( musical instruments which sound like rumbling of clouds) was now filled with wails and
cries and fallen on evil days._END

B_2_C_43_7
BEGIN_
ते रत्न हीनाः तरुणाः फल काले विवासिताः |
कथम् वत्स्यन्ति कृपणाः फल मूलैः कृत अशनाः || २-४३-८_END
BEGIN_
"Devoid of riches, those youthful beings, in exile at the age when they should be
enjoying diversions of every kind, how are they to live in misery, having only roots and fruits for
their nourishment?"_END

B_2_C_40_29
BEGIN_
स च श्रीमानचिन्त्यात्मा रामो दशरथात्मजः |
सूतम् संचोदयामास त्वरितम् वाह्यतामिति || २-४०-३१_END
BEGIN_
That glorious son of Dasaratha(Rama) of inconceivable courage, directed the
charioteer in the words "Let the chariot be driven fast."_END

B_2_C_42_15
BEGIN_
उत्थास्यति च मेदिन्याः कृपणः पांसुगुण्ठितः |
विनिःस्वसन् प्रस्रवणात्क रेणूनामि वर्ष्भः || २-४२-१७_END
BEGIN_
"The unfortunate one will wake up from the hard earth stained with dust, sighing
like a bull-elephant rising from the side of a hill"_END

B_2_C_43_8
BEGIN_
अपि इदानीम् स कालः स्यान् मम शोक क्षयः शिवः |
सभार्यम् यत् सह भ्रात्रा पश्येयम् इह राघवम् || २-४३-९_END
BEGIN_
"When that auspicious hour will come to me that will bring an end to my sorrows and
I shall see Rama with his wife and brother returning here?"_END

B_2_C_40_30
BEGIN_
रामो याहीति सूतम् तम् तिष्ठेति स जनस्तदा |
उभयम् नाशकत्सूतः कर्तुमध्वनि चोदितः || २-४०-३२_END
BEGIN_
Rama commanded that charioteer with the words "Move on!" The people said to him
"stop!" Urged on the passage, the charioteer could not do both._END

B_2_C_42_16
BEGIN_
द्रक्ष्यन्ति नूनम् पुरुषा दीघ बाहुम् वने चराः |
रामम् उत्थाय गच्चन्तम् लोक नाथम् अनाथवत् || २-४२-१८_END
BEGIN_
From today the inhabitants of the forest will behold that long armed lord of the
world, Rama, rising from the ground and wandering around like an orphan"_END

B_2_C_43_9
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा एव उपस्थितौ वीरौ कदा अयोध्या भविष्यति |
यशस्विनी हृष्ट जना सूच्च्रित ध्वज मालिनी || २-४३-१०_END
BEGIN_
"When will Ayodhya regain her pristine glory, with people thrilling with rapture and
be adorned with rows of towering banners the moment it hears of the two heroic princes (Rama and
Lakshmana) being present ? "_END

B_2_C_40_31
BEGIN_
निर्गच्छति महाबाहौ रामे पौरजनाश्रुभिः |
पतितैरभ्यवहितम् प्रशशाम महीरजः || २-४०-३३_END
BEGIN_
The dust raised on the road due to moving out of mighty armed Rama, was suppressed
by the falling tears of the citizens._END

B_2_C_42_17
BEGIN_
सा नुनं जनकस्येष्टा सुता सुखसदेचिता |
कण्टकाक्रमण क्लान्तावनमद्य गमिष्यति || २-४२-१९_END
BEGIN_
"The daughter of Janaka, who was always accustomed to comforts, will wander
exhausted in the forest through the thorny undergrowth "_END

B_2_C_43_10
BEGIN_
कदा प्रेक्ष्य नर व्याघ्राव् अरण्यात् पुनर् आगतौ |
नन्दिष्यति पुरी हृष्टा समुद्रैव पर्वणि || २-४३-११_END
BEGIN_
"When will the city rejoice like an ocean swelling jubilantly on a full moon night
to perceive the two princes who are tigers among men come back from the forest? "_END

B_2_C_40_32
BEGIN_
रुदिताश्रुपरिद्यूनम् हाहाकृतमचेतनम् |
प्रयाणे राघवस्यासीत्पुरम् परमपीडितम् || २-४०-३४_END
BEGIN_
With full of wailing tears, the citizens of after making loud cries became
unconscious with deep agony, at the time of departure of Rama._END

B_2_C_42_18
BEGIN_
अनभिज्ञा वनानाम् सा नूनम् भयमुपैष्यति |
श्वापदान्र्धितम् श्रुत्वा गमिभीरम् रोमहर्ष्णम् || २-४२-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Sita who was not earlier accustomed to woodlands, from now on will live in terror,
hearing the roaring sound of wild beasts ,which was thundering ."_END

B_2_C_43_11
BEGIN_
कदा अयोध्याम् महा बाहुः पुरीम् वीरः प्रवेक्ष्यति |
पुरः कृत्य रथे सीताम् वृषभो गो वधूम् इव || २-४३-१२_END
BEGIN_
"When will the mighty armed hero (Rama) enter the city of Ayodhya placing Sita in
his front in the chariot as a bull would follow a cow?"_END

B_2_C_40_33
BEGIN_
सुस्राव नयनैः स्त्रीणामस्रमायाससम्भवम् |
मीनसम्क्षोभचलितैः सलिलम् पङ्कजैरिव || २-४०-३५_END
BEGIN_
Tears born of anguish flowed from the eyes of women like(drops of) water falling
from lotuses by the commotion of fish._END

B_2_C_42_19
BEGIN_
सकामा भवकैकेयि विधवा राज्य मावस |
न हि तम् पुरुष व्याघ्रम् विना जीवितुम् उत्सहे || २-४२-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Kaikeyi! Let your desire be fulfilled! Dwell in the kingdom as a widow. I do
not indeed wish to survive without Rama the tiger among men."_END

B_2_C_43_12
BEGIN_
कदा प्राणि सहस्राणि राज मार्गे मम आत्मजौ |
लाजैः अवकरिष्यन्ति प्रविशन्ताव् अरिम् दमौ || २-४३-१३_END
BEGIN_
"When will thousands of men shower the parched grains of paddy on the royal highway
over my two sons (Rama and Lakshmana) the subduer of their enemies, entering the city?"_END

B_2_C_40_34
BEGIN_
दृष्ट्वा तु नृपतिः श्रीमानेकचित्तगतम् पुरम् |
निपपातैव दुःखेन हतमूल इव द्रुमः || २-४०-३६_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the city with singleness of mind, the glorious monarch Dasaratha fell down
with agony, like a tree slain at its root._END

B_2_C_42_20
BEGIN_
इति एवम् विलपन् राजा जन ओघेन अभिसम्वृतः |
अपस्नातैव अरिष्टम् प्रविवेश पुर उत्तमम् || २-४२-२२_END
BEGIN_
Thus lamenting, the king surrounded by his people, entered Ayodhya the best of
cities like entering a disastrous house by one who has taken the funeral bath._END

B_2_C_44_0
BEGIN_
विलपन्तीम् तथा ताम् तु कौसल्याम् प्रमद उत्तमाम् |
इदम् धर्मे स्थिता धर्म्यम् सुमित्रा वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् || २-४४-१_END
BEGIN_
Sumitra, who was devoted to righteousness spoke the following words, which were
virtuous, to the celebrated Kausalya, the foremost among women, who had been wailing as
aforesaid_END

B_2_C_43_13
BEGIN_
प्रविशनौ कदाऽपियोध्याम् द्रक्ष्यामि शुभकुण्डता |
उदग्रायुधनिस्त्रींशौ सशृङ्गाविव पर्वतौ || २-४३-१४_END
BEGIN_
"When shall I see the two princes adorned with splendid ear-rings and armed with
excellent bows and swords, entering Ayodhya like a pair of mountains crowned with peaks?"_END

B_2_C_40_35
BEGIN_
ततओ हल हला शब्दो जज्ञे रामस्य पृष्ठतः |
नराणाम् प्रेक्ष्य राजानम् सीदन्तम् भृश दुह्खितम् || २-४०-३७_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, seeing the king becoming feeble and much distressed, the outery of the
people rose from the rear of Rama._END

B_2_C_42_21
BEGIN_
शून्य चत्वर वेश्म अन्ताम् सम्वृत आपण देवताम् |
क्लान्त दुर्बल दुह्ख आर्ताम् न अत्याकीर्ण महा पथाम् |
ताम् अवेक्ष्य पुरीम् सर्वाम् रामम् एव अनुचिन्तयन् |
विलपन् प्राविशद् राजा गृहम् सूर्यैव अम्बुदम् || २-४२-२३_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the entire city with its road-junctions and mansions deserted, its shops and
temples closed, with its people exhausted with fatigue and plunged in affliction; its highways not
very crowded ,the king entered his palace wailing and thinking of Rama alone as the sun enters a
cloud._END

B_2_C_44_1
BEGIN_
तव आर्ये सद् गुणैः युक्तः पुत्रः स पुरुष उत्तमः |
किम् ते विलपितेन एवम् कृपणम् रुदितेन वा || २-४४-२_END
BEGIN_
"That son of yours, oh the venerable one, is endowed with excellent virtues and is
the foremost among men. What is the use in your lamenting in this way or in weeping piteously?"_END

B_2_C_43_14
BEGIN_
कदा सुमनसः कन्या द्विजातीनाम् फलानि च |
प्रदिशन्त्यः पुरीम् हृष्टाः करिष्यन्ति प्रदक्षिणम् || २-४३-१५_END
BEGIN_
"When will those two princes with Sita merrily go round the city clockwise, giving
away flowers and fruits to virgins and brahmanas?"_END

B_2_C_40_36
BEGIN_
हा राम इति जनाः केचित् राम माता इति च अपरे |
अन्तः पुरम् समृद्धम् च क्रोशन्तम् पर्यदेवयन् || २-४०-३८_END
BEGIN_
