Some poeple crying "Oh, Rama!" and some other scrying "Oh, Rama's mother!", made the
entire women in the gynaecium to weap._END

B_2_C_42_22
BEGIN_
महा ह्रदम् इव अक्षोभ्यम् सुपर्णेन हृत उरगम् |
रामेण रहितम् वेश्म वैदेह्या लक्ष्मणेन च || २-४२-२४_END
BEGIN_
Bereft of Rama Sita and Lakshmana, the palace looked like a big pool rendered
unperturbed due to emptying of snakes in it by Garuda*_END

B_2_C_44_2
BEGIN_
यः तव आर्ये गतः पुत्रः त्यक्त्वा राज्यम् महा बलः |
साधु कुर्वन् महात्मानम् पितरम् सत्य वादिनाम् || २-४४-३
शिष्टैः आचरिते सम्यक् शश्वत् प्रेत्य फल उदये |
रामः धर्मे स्थितः श्रेष्ठो न स शोच्यः कदाचन || २-४४-४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, noble lady! Your son is having mighty strength. He proved his high- soled
father perfectly truthful by renouncing his throne. He stood firmly in righteousness, which is
always practiced perfectly by disciples and which gives fruits even after death. That Rama, the
most excellent man, never deserves to be lamented."_END

B_2_C_43_15
BEGIN_
कदा परिणतः बुद्ध्या वयसा च अमर प्रभः |
अभ्युपैष्यति धर्मज्ञः त्रिवर्षैव माम् ललन् || २-४३-१६_END
BEGIN_
"When will the pious Rama, grown ripe in intellect and shining like a god in point
of age ,return to me, cherishing the world like the proportious and timely rain?"_END

B_2_C_40_37
BEGIN_
अन्वीक्षमाणो रामः तु विषण्णम् भ्रान्त चेतसम् |
राजानम् मातरम् चैव ददर्श अनुगतौ पथि || २-४०-३९_END
BEGIN_
Looking back, Rama saw the king sorrowful and perplexed in mind, as well as his
mother following (him) on the road._END

B_2_C_42_23
BEGIN_
अथ गद्गदशब्दस्तु विलपन्मनुजाधिपः |
उवाच मृदुमन्धार्थम् वचनम् दीन मस्वरम् || २-४२-२५_END
BEGIN_
The lamenting monarch spoke in trembling accents and in soft, pitiful, indistinct
and not clearly intelligible words (as follows):_END

B_2_C_44_3
BEGIN_
वर्तते च उत्तमाम् वृत्तिम् लक्ष्मणो अस्मिन् सदा अनघः |
दयावान् सर्व भूतेषु लाभः तस्य महात्मनः || २-४४-५_END
BEGIN_
"Lakshmana, the faultless man and the compassionate man towards all beings, always
renders the best form of service to Rama. His conduct is beneficial to the high-soled Rama."_END

B_2_C_43_16
BEGIN_
निह्संशयम् मया मन्ये पुरा वीर कदर्यया |
पातु कामेषु वत्सेषु मातृऋणाम् शातिताः स्तनाः || २-४३-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Undoubtedly in some past life, through mean-mindedness, Oh, valiant king, I believe
that the teats of cows were cut off by me while their calves were longing to suck them."_END

B_2_C_40_38
BEGIN_
स बद्ध इव पाशेन किशोरो मातरम् यथा |
धर्मपाशेन सम्क्षिप्तः प्रकाशम् नाभुदैक्षत || २-४०-४०_END
BEGIN_
Rama, bound by the chord of righteousness, could not gaze openly at his parents, as
a foal caught in asnare would not properly look at its dam._END

B_2_C_42_24
BEGIN_
कौसल्याया गृहम् शीघ्रम् राम मातुर् नयन्तु माम् |
इति ब्रुवन्तम् राजानम् अनयन् द्वार दर्शितः || २-४२-२६_END
BEGIN_
"Take me quickly to the apartment of Kausalya the mother of Rama. Nowhere else my
heart will find solace "_END

B_2_C_44_4
BEGIN_
अरण्य वासे यद् दुह्खम् जानती वै सुख उचिता |
अनुगच्चति वैदेही धर्म आत्मानम् तव आत्मजम् || २-४४-६_END
BEGIN_
Sita, who was habituated to comforts, even after knowing the pain whatsoever, is
accompanying your virtuous- soled son."_END

B_2_C_43_17
BEGIN_
सा अहम् गौर् इव सिम्हेन विवत्सा वत्सला कृता |
कैकेय्या पुरुष व्याघ्र बाल वत्सा इव गौर् बलात् || २-४३-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, tiger among heroes! Fond of my child like a cow, I, as such was forcibly
deprived of my child by Kaikeyi in the same way as a cow having a calf of tender age may be
deprived of her calf by a lion."_END

B_2_C_42_25
BEGIN_
इति ब्रुवन्तम् राजान मनयन् द्वार्दर्शिनः |
कौसल्याया गृहम् तत्र न्यवेश्यत विनीतवत् || २-४२-२७_END
BEGIN_
The attendants took the king who was speaking as aforesaid, to Kausalya's house and
there he was gently laid (on a coach)._END

B_2_C_40_39
BEGIN_
पदातिनौ च यान अर्हाव् अदुह्ख अर्हौ सुख उचितौ |
दृष्ट्वा संचोदयाम् आस शीघ्रम् याहि इति सारथिम् || २-४०-४१_END
BEGIN_
Seeing them coming by foot, though worthy of a chariot, habituated to comfort and
unworthy of suffering, Rama commanded the charioteer with words: "Drive fast!"_END

B_2_C_44_5
BEGIN_
कीर्ति भूताम् पताकाम् यो लोके भ्रामयति प्रभुः |
दम सत्य व्रत परः किम् न प्राप्तः तव आत्मजः || २-४४-७_END
BEGIN_
"What has not been secured by your capable son, who is rich in virtue and is
engrossed in the vow of truthfulness, and the banner of whose fame flutters though out the
world?"_END

B_2_C_45_0
BEGIN_
अनुरक्ता महात्मानम् रामम् सत्य परक्रमम् |
अनुजग्मुः प्रयान्तम् तम् वन वासाय मानवाः || २-४५-१_END
BEGIN_
The people devoted to the high- soled Rama of unfailing bravery accompanied him on
his way to the forest for exile._END

B_2_C_43_18
BEGIN_
न हि तावद् गुणैः जुष्टम् सर्व शास्त्र विशारदम् |
एक पुत्रा विना पुत्रम् अहम् जीवितुम् उत्सहे || २-४३-१९_END
BEGIN_
"I cannot indeed wish to survive without my only son who is adorned with all virtues
and is well-versed in all scriptures."_END

B_2_C_42_26
BEGIN_
ततः तत्र प्रविष्टस्य कौसल्याया निवेशनम् |
अधिरुह्य अपि शयनम् बभूव लुलितम् मनः || २-४२-२८_END
BEGIN_
Having entered Kausalya's apartment and even though laid on a coach, his heart
became agitated._END

B_2_C_40_40
BEGIN_
न हि तत् पुरुष व्याघ्रः दुह्खदम् दर्शनम् पितुः |
मातुः च सहितुम् शक्तः तोत्र अर्दितैव द्विपः || २-४०-४२_END
BEGIN_
Rama the tiger among men, feeling pained, as an elephant being pricked by a good,
indeed was not able to bear that plight of his father and his mother._END

B_2_C_44_6
BEGIN_
व्यक्तम् रामस्य विज्ञाय शौचम् माहात्म्यम् उत्तमम् |
न गात्रम् अंशुभिः सूर्यः सम्तापयितुम् अर्हति || २-४४-८_END
BEGIN_
"Having known the purity and magnanimity of Rama , the sun assuredly will not be
able to torment Rama's body with his rays."_END

B_2_C_45_1
BEGIN_
निवर्तिते अपि च बलात् सुहृद् वर्गे च राजिनि |
न एव ते सम्न्यवर्तन्त रामस्य अनुगता रथम् || २-४५-२_END
BEGIN_
When the king was forced (in the interests of his son) to turn back, the group of
friends who were following Rama's chariot did not return._END

B_2_C_43_19
BEGIN_
न हि मे जीविते किंचित् सामर्थम् इह कल्प्यते |
अपश्यन्त्याः प्रियम् पुत्रम् महा बाहुम् महा बलम् || २-४३-२०_END
BEGIN_
"There is not the least capacity imaginable in me to sustain my life here so long as
I fail to perceive my beloved son (Rama) who is mighty armed and Lakshmana of great strength"_END

B_2_C_42_27
BEGIN_
पुत्रद्वयविहीनम् च स्नुषयापि विवर्जितम् |
अपश्यद्भवनम् राजा नष्टचन्ध्रमिवाम्बरम् || २-४२-२९_END
BEGIN_
Bereft of his two sons and his daughter -in-law also having deserted, the king saw
that house devoid of charm as a sky without a moon._END

B_2_C_40_41
BEGIN_
प्रत्यगारमिवायान्ती वत्सला वत्सकारणात् |
बद्धवत्सा यथा धेनू राममाताभ्याधावत || २-४०-४३_END
BEGIN_
Rama's mother (Kausalya) ran towards her son, as a cow fond of her calf and whose
calf is tied(in a stall), runs home for her calf._END

B_2_C_44_7
BEGIN_
शिवः सर्वेषु कालेषु काननेभ्यो विनिह्सृतः |
राघवम् युक्त शीत उष्णः सेविष्यति सुखो अनिलः || २-४४-९_END
BEGIN_
"Auspicious and delightful breeze of moderate heat and cold, blowing from woods at
all times , will render service to Rama"_END

B_2_C_45_2
BEGIN_
अयोध्या निलयानाम् हि पुरुषाणाम् महा यशाः |
बभूव गुण सम्पन्नः पूर्ण चन्द्रैव प्रियः || २-४५-३_END
BEGIN_
Rama who enjoyed great celebrity and who was richly endowed with every virtue,
resembling the full moon, had indeed become the favorite for the people living in Ayodhya._END

B_2_C_43_20
BEGIN_
अयम् हि माम् दीपयते समुत्थितः |
तनूज शोक प्रभवो हुत अशनः |
महीम् इमाम् रश्मिभिर् उत्तम प्रभो |
यथा निदाघे भगवान् दिवा करः || २-४३-२१_END
BEGIN_
"This fire born of grief occasioned by separation from my son, is torturing me in
the same way as the illustrious sun, possessed of greatest splendor, scorches this earth with its
rays in summer."_END

B_2_C_42_28
BEGIN_
तच् च दृष्ट्वा महा राजो भुजम् उद्यम्य वीर्यवान् |
उच्चैः स्वरेण चुक्रोश हा राघव जहासि माम् || २-४२-३०_END
BEGIN_
Looking at that palace and lifting up his arm, the powerful monarch cried in a loud
voice, " Oh, Rama! You have left us both, your mother and I."_END

B_2_C_40_42
BEGIN_
तथा रुदन्तीम् कौसल्याम् रथम् तम् अनुधावतीम् |
क्रोशन्तीम् राम राम इति हा सीते लक्ष्मण इति च || २-४०-४४
रामलक्ष्मणसीतार्थम् स्रवन्तीम् वारि नेत्रजम् |
असकृत् प्रैक्षत तदा नृत्यन्तीम् इव मातरम् || २-४०-४५_END
BEGIN_
Rama again and again saw that Kausalya, his mother who was crying thus, running
after that chariot as though dancing, shouting"Oh, Rama, Rama!" "Oh, Seetha!" and "Oh, Lakshmana!"
trickling tears descending from her eyes for the sake of Rama Lakshmana and Seetha._END

B_2_C_44_8
BEGIN_
शयानम् अनघम् रात्रौ पिता इव अभिपरिष्वजन् |
रश्मिभिः संस्पृशन् शीतैः चन्द्रमा ह्लादयिष्यति || २-४४-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Gently touching with its cool rays when he is reposing at night and embracing him
like a father, the moon will refresh Rama"_END

B_2_C_45_3
BEGIN_
स याच्यमानः काकुत्स्थः स्वाभिः प्रकृतिभिस् तदा |
कुर्वाणः पितरम् सत्यम् वनम् एव अन्वपद्यत || २-४५-४_END
BEGIN_
Despite the entreaties of the people of his own, Rama(the scion of the Kakutstha),
in order to honor his father's vow; proceeded towards the forest._END

B_2_C_42_29
BEGIN_
सुखिता बत तम् कालम् जीविष्यन्ति नर उत्तमाः |
परिष्वजन्तः ये रामम् द्रक्ष्यन्ति पुनर् आगतम् || २-४२-३१_END
BEGIN_
"Alas! Those jewels among men who will survive the term of fourteen years, seeing
Rama come back and embrace him, will be happy indeed."_END

B_2_C_40_43
BEGIN_
तिष्ठ इति राजा चुक्रोष याहि याहि इति राघवः |
सुमन्त्रस्य बभूव आत्मा चक्रयोः इव च अन्तरा || २-४०-४६_END
BEGIN_
Dasaratha exclaimed saying "Stop!" while Rama called out "Go on, proceed!" (In that
way) Sumantra's mind became confused, as in between two (opposing) whirl pools._END

B_2_C_44_9
BEGIN_
ददौ च अस्त्राणि दिव्यानि यस्मै ब्रह्मा महा ओजसे |
दानव इन्द्रम् हतम् दृष्ट्वा तिमि ध्वज सुतम् रणे || २-४४-११
स शूरः पुरुषव्याघ्रः स्वबाहुबलमाश्रितः |
असन्त्रस्तोऽ प्यरण्यस्थो वेश्मनीव निवत्स्यति || २-४४-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Formerly, when Rama killed Subahu the son of Sambarasura the chief of demons,
Brahma being delighted , gave celestial weapons to Rama, the man with great splendor. Rama the hero
and the tiger among men, relying on the strength of his own arms, will dwell fearlessly in the
forest as if in his own palace"_END

B_2_C_45_4
BEGIN_
अवेक्षमाणः सस्नेहम् चक्षुषा प्रपिबन्न् इव |
उवाच रामः स्नेहेन ताः प्रजाः स्वाः प्रजाइव || २-४५-५_END
BEGIN_
Fondly gazing on the people as though drinking with his eyes, Rama lovingly spoke
(as follows) as though they were his own children:_END

B_2_C_44_10
BEGIN_
यस्येषुपदमासाद्य विनाशम् यान्ति शत्रवः |
कथम् न प्ऱ्^थिवी तस्य शासने स्थातुमर्हति || २-४४-१३_END
BEGIN_
"How can earth cannot be under the command of Rama, to whose aim of arrows, the
enemies fall an easy prey?"_END

B_2_C_42_30
BEGIN_
अथ रात्र्याम् प्रपन्नायाम् कालरात्र्यामिआत्मनः |
अर्धरात्रे दशरथह् कौसल्यामिदमब्रवीत् || २-४२-३२_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, the night having fallen, the night resembling the hour of death to him,
Dasaratha spoke these words to Kausalya when the midnight struck :_END

B_2_C_40_44
BEGIN_
न अश्रौषम् इति राजानम् उपालब्धो अपि वक्ष्यसि |
चिरम् दुह्खस्य पापिष्ठम् इति रामः तम् अब्रवीत् || २-४०-४७_END
BEGIN_
Rama said to him: "You can say to the king that you did not hear (his call), even
when scolded (later). seeing their grief for a long time is quite unbearbale."_END

B_2_C_45_5
BEGIN_
या प्रीतिर् बहुमानः च मय्य् अयोध्या निवासिनाम् |
मत् प्रिय अर्थम् विशेषेण भरते सा निवेश्यताम् || २-४५-६_END
BEGIN_
"The respect and affection that has been bestowed upon me by you (the residents of
Ayodhya) may for my satisfaction be bestowed in a special measure on Bharata._END

B_2_C_44_11
BEGIN_
या श्रीःशौर्यम् च रामस्य या च कल्याणसत्वता |
निवृत्तारण्यवासः स्वं क्षिप्रम् राज्यमवाप्स्यति || २-४४-१४_END
BEGIN_
"The splendor endowed with Rama, the valor that is in him and the beneficent
strength that resides in him lead one to believe that when he completes the term of his exile in
the forest, he will speedily regain his kingdom."_END

B_2_C_40_45
BEGIN_
रामस्य स वचः कुर्वन्न् अनुज्ञाप्य च तम् जनम् |
व्रजतः अपि हयान् शीघ्रम् चोदयाम् आस सारथिः || २-४०-४८_END
BEGIN_
The charioteer, doing as per Rama's words, took leave of those citizens and drive
the horses more speedily even while they are going._END

B_2_C_42_31
BEGIN_
रामम् मेऽनुगता दृष्टिरद्यापि न निवर्तते |
न त्वाम् पश्यामि कौसल्ये साधु माम् पाणिना स्पृश || २-४२-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Kausalya! My sight has extinguished along with Rama and not returned. Even now,
I am not able to see you properly. Touch me with your hand."_END

B_2_C_45_6
BEGIN_
स हि कल्याण चारित्रः कैकेय्या आनन्द वर्धनः |
करिष्यति यथावद् वः प्रियाणि च हितानि च || २-४५-७_END
BEGIN_
"Bharata who enhances the delight of Kaikeyi and who possesses excellent conduct,
will indeed do pleasing and beneficial things to you appropriately."_END

B_2_C_44_12
BEGIN_
सूर्यस्यापि भवेत्सूर्योह्यग्नेरग्निः प्रभोः प्रभोः |
श्रियश्च श्रीर्भवेदग्र्या कीर्त्याः क्षमाक्षमा || २-४४-१५
दैवतम् दैवतानाम् च भूतानाम् भूतसत्तमः |
तस्य केह्यगुणा देवि वने वा प्यथवा पुरे || २-४४-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Kausalya! Rama is the illuminator of even the sun, fire of fire, the ruler of
rules, the splendor of splendor, the foremost glory of glory, the forbearance of forbearance, the
god of gods and the foremost being of all the beings. Indeed, what handicaps are there for him in
the forest or in Ayodhya?"_END

B_2_C_42_32
BEGIN_
तम् रामम् एव अनुविचिन्तयन्तम् |
समीक्ष्य देवी शयने नर इन्द्रम् |
उप उपविश्य अधिकम् आर्त रूपाउप |
विनिह्श्वसन्ती विललाप कृच्च्रम् || २-४२-३४_END
BEGIN_
Perceiving that monarch on the coach absorbed in the thought of Rama alone, Kausalya
appeared very sad and sitting beside him, began to sigh and lament with a distressed look._END

B_2_C_40_46
BEGIN_
न्यवर्तत जनो राज्ञो रामम् कृत्वा प्रदक्षिणम् |
मनसा अपि अश्रु वेगैः च न न्यवर्तत मानुषम् || २-४०-४९_END
BEGIN_
The king's people returned after (mentally) going round Rama. Their minds did not
return. Their impulse of tears also did not get reduced._END

B_2_C_45_7
BEGIN_
ज्ञान वृद्धो वयो बालो मृदुर् वीर्य गुण अन्वितः |
अनुरूपः स वो भर्ता भविष्यति भय अपहः || २-४५-८_END
BEGIN_
"Bharata who is matured in knowledge but young in age, who is gentle but endowed
with virility and virtue, will become your worthy master who can dispel your fears"_END

B_2_C_44_13
BEGIN_
पृथिव्या सह वैदेह्या श्रिया च पुरुष ऋषभः |
क्षिप्रम् तिसृभिर् एताभिः सह रामः अभिषेक्ष्यते || २-४४-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Rama the best among men will be installed on the throne soon along with the Mother
Earth (the consort of lord Vishnu), Sita the princess of Videha kingdom and Lakshmi ( the goddess
of fortune another consort of Vishnu)"_END

B_2_C_40_47
BEGIN_
यम् इच्चेत् पुनर् आयान्तम् न एनम् दूरम् अनुव्रजेत् |
इति अमात्या महा राजम् ऊचुर् दशरथम् वचः || २-४०-५०_END
BEGIN_
The ministers spoke to king Dasaratha as follows:" We should not follow to a long
distance him whom we wish to see come back."_END

B_2_C_45_8
BEGIN_
स हि राज गुणैः युक्तः युव राजः समीक्षितः |
अपि च अपि मया शिष्टैः कार्यम् वो भर्तृ शासनम् || २-४५-९_END
BEGIN_
"Bharata who is endowed with royal virtues is being marked as the prince. Further,
king's command is to be carried out by me and the rest of you._END

B_2_C_44_14
BEGIN_
दुह्खजम् विसृजन्ति अस्रम् निष्क्रामन्तम् उदीक्ष्य यम् |
समुत्स्रक्ष्यसि नेत्राभ्याम् क्षिप्रम् आनन्दजम् पयः || २-४४-१८
कुशचीरधरम् देवम् गच्छन्तमपराजितम् |
सीतेवानुगता लक्ष्मीस्तस्य किम् नाम दुर्लभम् || २-४४-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing Rama departing, all the people in Ayodhya smitten as they were with upsurge
of grief shed tears born of agony. The goddess of fortune as Sita followed the invincible hero even
as he departed for the forest, clad in a garment of the sacred Kusa grass. Indeed, what can be
difficult for him to obtain?"_END

B_2_C_40_48
BEGIN_
तेषाम् वचः सर्व गुण उपपन्नम् |
प्रस्विन्न गात्रः प्रविषण्ण रूपः |
निशम्य राजा कृपणः सभार्यो |
व्यवस्थितः तम् सुतम् ईक्षमाणः || २-४०-५१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing their words, which were befilting with all virtues, the king Dasaratha felt
miserable, stopped short, gazing along with his wife, at his son Rama, with his whole body
perspiring and wearing a dejected look._END

B_2_C_45_9
BEGIN_
न च तप्येद् यथा च असौ वन वासम् गते मयि |
महा राजः तथा कार्यो मम प्रिय चिकीर्षया || २-४५-१०_END
BEGIN_
"If you desire to please me, see that the king does not suffer agony when I have
gone to forest for exile"_END

B_2_C_44_15
BEGIN_
धनुर्ग्रहवरो यस्य बाणखड्गास्त्रभृत्स्वयम् |
लक्ष्मणोव्रजति ह्यग्रे तस्य किम् नाम दुर्लभम् || २-४४-२०_END
BEGIN_
"What can be difficult to obtain for, to whose front indeed walks Lakshmana himself
the best among the holders of bow wielding arrows, sword and missiles?"_END

B_2_C_45_10
BEGIN_
यथा यथा दाशरथिर् धर्मम् एव आस्थितः अभवत् |
तथा तथा प्रकृतयो रामम् पतिम् अकामयन् || २-४५-११_END
BEGIN_
The more Rama the son of Dasaratha, showed himself to be faithful to his duty, the
more the people wished to have him as their master "_END

B_2_C_44_16
BEGIN_
निवृत्तवनवासम् तम् द्रष्टासि पुनरागतम् |
जहिशोकम् च मोहम् च देवि सत्यम् ब्रवीमि ते || २-४४-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Kausalya! I tell you the truth : you can see Rama coming back, on having
completed the term of his exile in the forest . Abandon grief and infatuation."_END

B_2_C_45_11
BEGIN_
बाष्पेण पिहितम् दीनम् रामः सौमित्रिणा सह |
चकर्ष इव गुणैः बद्ध्वा जनम् पुनर् इव आसनम् || २-४५-१२_END
BEGIN_
Rama accompanied by son of Sumitra, drew the people of the city, who were weeping
piteously, after him as if tied and pulled with cords._END

B_2_C_46_0
BEGIN_
ततः तु तमसा तीरम् रम्यम् आश्रित्य राघवः |
सीताम् उद्वीक्ष्य सौमित्रिम् इदम् वचनम् अब्रवीत् || २-४६-१_END
BEGIN_
Then Rama taking his position at the banks of Tamasa river and looking at Sita,
spoke to Lakshmana as follows :_END

B_2_C_44_17
BEGIN_
शिरसा चरणावेतौ वन्दमानमनिन्दिते |
पुनर्द्रक्ष्यसि कल्याणि! पुत्रं चन्द्रमिवोदितम् || २-४४-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, auspicious Kausalya, the irreproachable one! You will be able to see your son,
like the rising moon, saluting respectfully your feet, by bowing his head."_END

B_2_C_45_12
BEGIN_
ते द्विजाः त्रिविधम् वृद्धा ज्ञानेन वयसा ओजसा |
वयः प्रकम्प शिरसो दूरात् ऊचुर् इदम् वचः || २-४५-१३_END
BEGIN_
Those brahmanas, who were triply revered for their learning, their age and their
spirituality, their heads shaking with advanced years, cried out :_END

B_2_C_46_1
BEGIN_
इयम् अद्य निशा पूर्वा सौमित्रे प्रस्थिता वनम् |
वन वासस्य भद्रम् ते स न उत्कण्ठितुम् अर्हसि || २-४६-२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Lakshmana! We have been sent to the forest. Today is the first night of our
residence in the forest .You ought not feel anxious. May all be well with you!"_END

B_2_C_44_18
BEGIN_
पुनः प्रविष्टम् द्ऱ्^ष्ट्वा तमभिषिक्तम् महाश्रियम् |
समुत्स्रक्ष्यसि नेत्राभ्याम् क्षिप्रमान्न्दजम् पयः || २-४४-२३_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing Rama shining with great splendor appearing before you again, having been
coroneted, you will be shedding soon tears of joy from your eyes "_END

B_2_C_45_13
BEGIN_
वहन्तः जवना रामम् भो भो जात्याः तुरम् गमाः |
निवर्तध्वम् न गन्तव्यम् हिता भवत भर्तरि || २-४५-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh Noble Steeds, of speedy breed! You who are carrying Rama, do come back! Do not
proceed! Be friendly to your master (since by taking Rama against our wishes, you will be doing a
disservice to him)"_END

B_2_C_46_2
BEGIN_
पश्य शून्यानि अरण्यानि रुदन्ति इव समन्ततः |
यथा निलयम् आयद्भिर् निलीनानि मृग द्विजैः || २-४६-३_END
BEGIN_
"Look here: As the animals and birds are returning to their respective abodes
seeking for shelter, the desolate woods seem to be crying from all sides"_END

B_2_C_44_19
BEGIN_
मा शोको देवि दुःखम् वा न राअमे दृअह्य्ऱ्Wऽशिवम् |
क्षिप्रम् द्रक्ष्यसि पुत्रम् त्वम् ससीतम् सह लक्ष्मणम् || २-४४-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Kausalya! Do not have uneasiness or grief. Rama has no ill luck. You will be
able to see soon your son along with Sita, accompanied by Lakshmana"._END

B_2_C_45_14
BEGIN_
कर्णवन्ति हि भूतानि विशेषण तुरम्गमाः |
यूयम् तस्मान्निवर्तध्वम् याचनाम् प्रतिवेदिताः || २-४५-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Indeed all things, which are endowed with ears, more so horses, stand appraised of
our entreaty. Therefore, you return."_END

B_2_C_46_3
BEGIN_
अद्य अयोध्या तु नगरी राज धानी पितुर् मम |
सस्त्री पुंसा गतान् अस्मान् शोचिष्यति न संशयः || २-४६-४_END
BEGIN_
"Now, the city of Ayodhya the capital of my father with its men and women will
lament about us that have departed (to the forest). There is no doubt"_END

B_2_C_44_20
BEGIN_
त्वया शेषोओ जनश्चैव समाश्वास्यो यदाऽनघे |
किमिदानीमिदम् देवि करोषि हृदि विक्लबम् || २-४४-२५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, the faultless queen! While people are to be consoled by you at this moment, why
are you fostering grief in your heart?"_END

B_2_C_45_15
BEGIN_
धर्मतः स विशुद्धात्मा वीरः शुभदृढप्रतह् |
उपवाह्यः तु वो भर्ता न अपवाह्यः पुरात् वनम् || २-४५-१६_END
BEGIN_
"That hero of the pure soul, of virtuous and auspicious firm resolve, that master,
deserves to be brought back to the city and not to be taken to the forest."_END

B_2_C_46_4
BEGIN_
अनुरक्ता हि मनुजा राजानम् बहुभिर्गुणैः |
त्वाम् च माम् च नरव्याघ्र शत्रघ्नभरतौ तथा || २-४६-५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, tiger among men! The citizens (of Ayodhya) are indeed having affection to the
king no less than to you and myself, as also to Bharata and Satrughna, for many of our
virtues."_END

B_2_C_44_21
BEGIN_
नार्हा त्वम् शोचितुम् देवि यस्यास्ते राघवस्सुतः |
न हि रामात्परो लोके विद्यते सत्पथे स्थितः || २-४४-२६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh,queen! You, whose son is Rama, ought not to grieve, for none is established in
right path in the world than Rama."_END

B_2_C_45_16
BEGIN_
एवम् आर्त प्रलापांस् तान् वृद्धान् प्रलपतः द्विजान् |
अवेक्ष्य सहसा रामः रथात् अवततार ह || २-४५-१७_END
BEGIN_
Seeing those aged brahmanas uttering those painful words, Rama quickly got down from
the chariot._END

B_2_C_46_5
BEGIN_
पितरम् चानुशोचामि मातरम् च यशस्विनीम् |
अपि वानौध भवेताम् तु रुदन्तौ तावभीक्ष्णशः || २-४६-६_END
BEGIN_
"I feel repented for my father and my illustrious mother. I fear whether they will
become even blind, by weeping incessantly."_END

B_2_C_44_22
BEGIN_
अभिवादयमानम् तम् दृष्ट्वा ससुहृदम् सुतम् |
मुदा अश्रु मोक्ष्यसे क्षिप्रम् मेघ लेका इव वार्षिकी || २-४४-२७_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing your son saluting with his friends, you will at once begin to shed tears,
like a line of clouds in a rainy season"_END

B_2_C_45_17
BEGIN_
पद्भ्याम् एव जगाम अथ ससीतः सह लक्ष्मणः |
सम्निकृष्ट पद न्यासो रामः वन परायणः || २-४५-१८_END
BEGIN_
Rama with Sita and Lakshmana, taking close strides, proceeded on foot towards the
forest._END

B_2_C_47_0
BEGIN_
प्रभातायाम् तु शर्वर्याम् पौराः ते राघवो विना |
शोक उपहत निश्चेष्टा बभूवुर् हत चेतसः || २-४७-१_END
BEGIN_
As the night was beginning to become dawn, those citizens relinquished by Raghava
were perplexed with grief and became motionless._END

B_2_C_46_6
BEGIN_
भरतः खलु धर्म आत्मा पितरम् मातरम् च मे |
धर्म अर्थ काम सहितैः वाक्यैः आश्वासयिष्यति ||२-४६-७_END
BEGIN_
"Bharata, the virtuous man, can indeed console my father and mother by his kind
words."_END

B_2_C_44_23
BEGIN_
पुत्रः ते वरदः क्षिप्रम् अयोध्याम् पुनर् आगतः |
पाणिभ्याम् मृदुपीनाभ्याम् चरणौ पीडयिष्यति || २-४४-२८_END
BEGIN_
"Your son the bestower of boons, will soon return to Ayodhya, and touch your feet
with his gentle but muscular hands "_END

B_2_C_45_18
BEGIN_
द्विजातींस् तु पदातींस् तान् रामः चारित्र वत्सलः |
न शशाक घृणा चक्षुः परिमोक्तुम् रथेन सः || २-४५-१९_END
BEGIN_
That Rama who was affectionate in his disposition and had compassion in his eyes,
could not abandon those brahmanas walking on foot, far behind the chariot._END

B_2_C_47_1
BEGIN_
शोकज अश्रु परिद्यूना वीक्षमाणाः ततः ततः |
आलोकम् अपि रामस्य न पश्यन्ति स्म दुह्खिताः || २-४७-२_END
BEGIN_
Made miserable with tears born of anguish and agony, they could not notice even a
glimmer of Rama, though casting their eyes everywhere._END

B_2_C_46_7
BEGIN_
भरतस्य आनृशंसत्वम् संचिन्त्य अहम् पुनः पुनः |
न अनुशोचामि पितरम् मातरम् च अपि लक्ष्मण || २-४६-८_END
BEGIN_
"Oh,Lakshmana! Thinking of Bharata's kindness again and again, I do not grieve for
our father and mother"_END

B_2_C_44_24
BEGIN_
अभिवाद्य नमस्यन्तम् शूरम् ससुहृदम् सुतम् |
मुदास्रैः प्रोक्ष्यसि पुनर्मेघराजि रिवाचलम् || २-४४-२९_END
BEGIN_
"When your son the hero along with his friends salute you respectfully in adoration,
you will sprinkle tears of joy in the same way as a line of clouds pour rain on the mountain."_END

B_2_C_45_19
BEGIN_
गच्चन्तम् एव तम् दृष्ट्वा रामम् सम्भ्रान्त मानसाः |
ऊचुः परम सम्तप्ता रामम् वाक्यम् इदम् द्विजाः || २-४५-२०_END
BEGIN_
Perceiving Rama still going towards the forest, those brahmanas perplexed in mind
and greatly distressed, spoke the following words :_END

B_2_C_47_2
BEGIN_
ते विषादार्तवदना रहितास्तेन धिमता |
कृपणाः करुणा वाचो वदन्ति स्म मनस्विनः || २-४७-३_END
BEGIN_
Their faces distorted with sorrow, deprived as they were of sagacious Rama and
therefore non-pulsed, the citizens broke into piteous exclamations, saying:-_END

B_2_C_46_8
BEGIN_
त्वया कार्यम् नर व्याघ्र माम् अनुव्रजता कृतम् |
अन्वेष्टव्या हि वैदेह्या रक्षण अर्थे सहायता || २-४६-९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Lakshmana, tiger among men! You have done well by accompanying me, as
otherwise, a help would have to be sought for by me for protecting Seetha"_END

B_2_C_44_25
BEGIN_
आश्वासयन्ती विविधैश्च वाक्यै |
र्वाक्योपचारे कुशलानाद्या |
रामस्य ताम् मातरमेवमुक्त्वा |
देवी सुमित्राविरराम रामा || २-४४-३०_END
BEGIN_
Sumitra the queen, skilled in her employment of words, who is faultless and
charming, thus consoled Rama's mother with various words and finally stopped speaking._END

B_2_C_45_20
BEGIN_
ब्राह्मण्यम् कृत्स्नम् एतत् त्वाम् ब्रह्मण्यम् अनुगच्चति |
द्विज स्कन्ध अधिरूढाः त्वाम् अग्नयो अपि अनुयान्ति अमी || २-४५-२१_END
BEGIN_
"The whole of this brahmana community is following you, devoted (as you are) to the
brahmanas. See, they are bearing the sacred fires on their shoulders"_END

B_2_C_47_3
BEGIN_
धिगस्तु खलु निद्राम् ताम् ययापहृतचेतसः |
नाद्य पश्यामहे रामम् पृथूरस्कम् महाभुजम् || २-४७-४_END
BEGIN_
"Cursed be to that slumber, rendered unconscious, by which we could not behold today
that mighty armed Rama with a broad chest."_END

B_2_C_46_9
BEGIN_
अद्भिर् एव तु सौमित्रे वत्स्याम्य् अद्य निशाम् इमाम् |
एतद्द् हि रोचते मह्यम् वन्ये अपि विविधे सति || २-४६-१०_END
BEGIN_
" Oh, Lakshmana! I shall live on water alone tonight. Though there are various kinds
of wild fruits and roots, this is indeed a liking for me"_END

B_2_C_44_26
BEGIN_
निशम्य तल् लक्ष्मण मातृ वाक्यम् |
रामस्य मातुर् नर देव पत्न्याः |
सद्यः शरीरे विननाश शोकः |
शरद् गतः मेघैव अल्प तोयः || २-४४-३१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of Sumitra the mother of Lakshmana, the agony of Kausalya Rama's
mother and the wife of Dasaratha quickly disappeared in the same way as an autumnal cloud with a
little water in it disappears quickly._END

B_2_C_45_21
BEGIN_
वाजपेय समुत्थानि चत्राणि एतानि पश्य नः |
पृष्ठतः अनुप्रयातानि हंसान् इव जल अत्यये || २-४५-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Look at these canopies (obtained by us while observing Vajpeya sacrifice*)
accompanying our backs like clouds at the end of the rainy season"_END

B_2_C_47_4
BEGIN_
कथम् नाम महाबाहुः स तथाऽवितथक्रियः |
भक्तम् जनम् परित्यज्य प्रवासम् राघवो गतः || २-४७-५_END
BEGIN_
"How that Rama the strong armed, whose actions are never ineffectual, leave for
exile, abandoning his devoted citizens?"_END

B_2_C_46_10
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्त्वा तु सौमित्रम् सुमन्त्रम् अपि राघवः |
अप्रमत्तः त्वम् अश्वेषु भव सौम्य इति उवाच ह || २-४६-११_END
BEGIN_
Thus telling Lakshmana, Rama spoke also to Sumantra as follows: "Oh, gentle man!
Attend to the horses carefully."_END

B_2_C_45_22
BEGIN_
अनवाप्त आतपत्रस्य रश्मि सम्तापितस्य ते |
एभिः चायाम् करिष्यामः स्वैः चत्रैः वाजपेयिकैः || २-४५-२३_END
BEGIN_
"With these canopies of ours, we shall give shade to you, who have got no canopy and
are being scored with rays (of the sun.)"_END

B_2_C_47_5
BEGIN_
यो नः सदा पालयति पिता पुत्रानिवौरसान् |
कथम् रघूणाम् स श्रेष्ठस्त्यक्त्वा नो विपिनम् गतः || २-४७-६_END
BEGIN_
"How did the chief of Raghus, who protected us ever, like a father the children born
of his loins, could proceed to the forest, leaving us?"_END

B_2_C_46_11
BEGIN_
सो अश्वान् सुमन्त्रः सम्यम्य सूर्ये अस्तम् समुपागते |
प्रभूत यवसान् कृत्वा बभूव प्रत्यनन्तरः || २-४६-१२_END
BEGIN_
The sun having completely set, Sumantra tied up the horses, supplied them with
abundant grass and immediately stood nearest (to Rama)._END

B_2_C_45_23
BEGIN_
या हि नः सततम् बुद्धिर् वेद मन्त्र अनुसारिणी |
त्वत् कृते सा कृता वत्स वन वास अनुसारिणी || २-४५-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Dear child! The intellect of ours, which was forever engaged in perusing the
study of Vedic texts has been now made to follow the course of exile to the forest"_END

B_2_C_47_6
BEGIN_
इहैव निधनम् यामो महाप्रस्थानमेव वा |
रामेण रहितानाम् हि किमर्थम् जीवितम् हि नः || २-४७-७_END
BEGIN_
"Let us have recourse to death here itself, or definitely set out for a grand
journey ( to the north with a resolve to die). For what purpose can life be good for us, separated
as we are from Rama?"_END

B_2_C_46_12
BEGIN_
उपास्यतु शिवाम् संध्याम् दृष्ट्वा रात्रिम् उपस्थिताम् |
रामस्य शयनम् चक्रे सूतः सौमित्रिणा सह || २-४६-१३_END
BEGIN_
Having worshipped the beautiful evening twilight and having seen the night come
nearer, Sumantra along with Lakshmana made the bed for Rama._END

B_2_C_45_24
BEGIN_
हृदयेष्व् अवतिष्ठन्ते वेदा ये नः परम् धनम् |
वत्स्यन्ति अपि गृहेष्व् एव दाराः चारित्र रक्षिताः || २-४५-२५_END
BEGIN_
"We will carry the Vedas in our hearts as our excellent treasure and our wives too
will remain at home, protected by their character"_END

B_2_C_48_0
BEGIN_
तेषामेवम् विष्ण्णानाम्पीडितानामतीव च |
बाष्पविप्लुतनेत्राणाम् सशोकानाम् मुमूर्षया || २-४८-१
अनुगम्य निवृत्तानाम् रामम् नगर वासिनाम् |
उद्गतानि इव सत्त्वानि बभूवुर् अमनस्विनाम् || २-४८-२_END
BEGIN_
The lives of those citizens, who had returned dejected and cheerless in this way
after accompanying Rama were greatly hurt, having their eyes filled with tears afflicted with
grief, longing to give up their lives and appeared as though they were dead._END

B_2_C_47_7
BEGIN_
सन्ति शुष्काणि काष्ठानि प्रभूतानि महान्ति च |
तैः प्रज्वाल्य चिताम् सर्वे प्रविशामोऽथ पावकम् || २-४७-८_END
BEGIN_
" Or there are a number of big dry logs of wood here. Lighting a funeral fire out of
them, let us all enter the fire."_END

B_2_C_46_13
BEGIN_
ताम् शय्याम् तमसा तीरे वीक्ष्य वृक्ष दलैः कृताम् |
रामः सौमित्रिणाम् सार्धम् सभार्यः सम्विवेश ह || २-४६-१४_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that bed made of leaves of a tree on the bank of Tamasa river with the help
of Lakshmana, Rama along with his wife laid down on it._END

B_2_C_45_25
BEGIN_
न पुनर् निश्चयः कार्यः त्वद् गतौ सुकृता मतिः |
त्वयि धर्म व्यपेक्षे तु किम् स्यात् धर्मम् अवेक्षितुम् || २-४५-२६_END
BEGIN_
"We shall not revoke our decision. Our mind is fully determined to go along with you
(to the forest). If you do not pay attention to piety, what being will remain devoted to the path
of virtue?"_END

B_2_C_48_1
BEGIN_
स्वम् स्वम् निलयम् आगम्य पुत्र दारैः समावृताः |
अश्रूणि मुमुचुः सर्वे बाष्पेण पिहित आननाः || २-४८-३_END
BEGIN_
Reaching each his own house, all of them surrounded by their sons and wife, shed
tears, their faces being covered by them._END

B_2_C_47_8
BEGIN_
किम् व्ख्स्यामो महाबाहुरनसूयः प्रियम्वद |
नीतः स राघवोऽस्माभिर्ति वक्तुम् कथम् क्षमम् || २-४७-९_END
BEGIN_
"What shall we say to our fellow citizens? �The great armed Rama who is free from
egoism and who speaks kindly ( to all ) has been conveyed to the forest by us!' How can we say
so?"_END

B_2_C_46_14
BEGIN_
सभार्यम् सम्प्रसुप्तम् तम् भ्रातरम् वीक्ष्य लक्ष्मणः |
कथयाम् आस सूताय रामस्य विविधान् गुणान् || २-४६-१५_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that brother sleeping along with his wife, Lakshmana narrated Rama's various
virtues to Sumantra._END

B_2_C_45_26
BEGIN_
याचितः नो निवर्तस्व हंस शुक्ल शिरः रुहैः |
शिरोभिर् निभृत आचार मही पतन पांशुलैः || २-४५-२७_END
BEGIN_
" Oh, prince of resolute conduct! We entreat you by our heads having gray hair like
the white color of the swans, that are soiled with dust as a result of their falling on the ground
(in the course of our prostration to you) (pray) turn back."_END

B_2_C_47_9
BEGIN_
सा नूनम् नगरी दीना दृष्ट्वाऽस्मान् राघवम् विना |
भविष्यति निरानन्दा सस्त्रीबालवयोधिका || २-४७-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing us returning without Rama, that city of Ayodhya, already desolate, will with
its women, children and the aged, become even deeply cheerless."_END

B_2_C_48_2
BEGIN_
न च आहृष्यन् न च अमोदन् वणिजो न प्रसारयन् |
न च अशोभन्त पण्यानि न अपचन् गृह मेधिनः || २-४८-४_END
BEGIN_
None was either delightful or merry. Merchants no longer exhibited their wares, nor
their merchandise looked charming. Those in charge of home did not attend to cooking._END

B_2_C_46_15
BEGIN_
जाग्रतः हि एव ताम् रात्रिम् सौमित्रेर् उदितः रविः |
सूतस्य तमसा तीरे रामस्य ब्रुवतः गुणान् || २-४६-१६_END
BEGIN_
WhileLakshmana was thus recounting Rama's excellences to Sumantra, keeping awake
that whole night at the bank of Tamasa river, the sun rose._END

B_2_C_45_27
BEGIN_
बहूनाम् वितता यज्ञा द्विजानाम् यैह आगताः |
तेषाम् समाप्तिर् आयत्ता तव वत्स निवर्तने || २-४५-२८_END
BEGIN_
"Sacrifices have been commenced by many of those Brahmanas that have come here.
Their completion, oh dear child, depends on your return"_END

B_2_C_47_10
BEGIN_
निर्यातास्तेन वीरेण सह नित्यम् जितात्मना |
विहिनास्तेन च पुनः कथम् पश्याम ताम् पुरीम् || २-४७-११_END
BEGIN_
"Having left the city thus with that hero, the conqueror of one's own self, how can
we look on that city again without him?"_END

B_2_C_48_3
BEGIN_
नष्टम् दृष्ट्वा न अभ्यनन्दन् विपुलम् वा धन आगमम् |
पुत्रम् प्रथमजम् लब्ध्वा जननी न अभ्यनन्दत || २-४८-५_END
BEGIN_
None was delightful for instance on finding out a lost fortune, or on getting riches
in abundance. No mother did rejoice even on obtaining a son born for the first time._END

B_2_C_46_16
BEGIN_
गो कुल आकुल तीरायाः तमसायाः विदूरतः |
अवसत् तत्र ताम् रात्रिम् रामः प्रकृतिभिः सह || २-४६-१७_END
BEGIN_
At a good distance from Tamasa river, whose banks were crowded with herds of cows,
Rama passed that night there with the citizens._END

B_2_C_45_28
BEGIN_
भक्तिमन्ति हि भूतानि जम्गम अजम्गमानि च |
याचमानेषु तेषु त्वम् भक्तिम् भक्तेषु दर्शय || २-४५-२९_END
BEGIN_
"Beings both animate and inanimate, Oh, Rama, are indeed devoted to you. Show
affection to those devotees, who entreat you to return."_END

B_2_C_47_11
BEGIN_
इतीव बहुधा वाचो बाहुमुद्यम्य ते जनाः |
विलपन्तिस्म दुःखर्ता विवत्सा इव धेनवः || २-४७-१२_END
BEGIN_
Uplifting their arms , those men stricken with anguish, like cows bereft of their
calves, lamented in various ways as above._END

B_2_C_48_4
BEGIN_
गृहे गृहे रुदन्त्यः च भर्तारम् गृहम् आगतम् |
व्यगर्हयन्तः दुह्ख आर्ता वाग्भिस् तोत्रैः इव द्विपान् || २-४८-६_END
BEGIN_
Oppressed with sorrow and weeping, women in every house heaped reproaches on their
husbands who came home, with words as sharp as pricks of the goad which attack an elephant._END

B_2_C_46_17
BEGIN_
उत्थाय तु महा तेजाः प्रकृतीस् ता निशाम्य च |
अब्रवीद् भ्रातरम् रामः लक्ष्मणम् पुण्य लक्षणम् || २-४६-१८_END
BEGIN_
Getting up from the bed and seeing those citizens, Rama with an extraordinary
splendor, spoke to his brother, Lakshmana who was endowed with auspicious bodily marks:_END

B_2_C_45_29
BEGIN_
अनुगम्तुम् अशक्ताः त्वाम् मूलैः उद्धिऋत वेगिभिः |
उन्नता वायु वेगेन विक्रोशन्ति इव पादपाः || २-४५-३०_END
BEGIN_
"The trees held by their roots, unable to accompany you, seen to be weeping,
hump-backed by the force of wind"_END

B_2_C_48_5
BEGIN_
किम् नु तेषाम् गृहैः कार्यम् किम् दारैः किम् धनेन वा |
पुत्रैः वा किम् सुखैः वा अपि ये न पश्यन्ति राघवम् || २-४८-७_END
BEGIN_
"What purpose of theirs who do not see Rama, will be served by their dwellings, wife
or wealth or sons or pleasures even?"_END

B_2_C_47_12
BEGIN_
ततः मार्ग अनुसारेण गत्वा किंचित् क्षणम् पुनः
मार्ग नाशात् विषादेन महता समभिप्लुतः || २-४७-१३_END
BEGIN_
Then, proceeding to some distance along the tracks for a while, they were
overwhelmed with great despair again due to sudden disappearance of tracks._END

B_2_C_46_18
BEGIN_
अस्मद् व्यपेक्षान् सौमित्रे निरपेक्षान् गृहेष्व् अपि |
वृक्ष मूलेषु संसुप्तान् पश्य लक्ष्मण साम्प्रतम् || २-४६-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Observe, Oh Lakshmana, the citizens full of longing for us, unmindful even of their
homes, sleeping together at the roots of trees, Oh, the son of Sumitra!"_END

B_2_C_45_30
BEGIN_
निश्चेष्ट आहार संचारा वृक्ष एक स्थान विष्ठिताः |
पक्षिणो अपि प्रयाचन्ते सर्व भूत अनुकम्पिनम् || २-४५-३१_END
BEGIN_
"Birds too, which sit motionless and are unable to go out in search of food and
which remain fixed at one spot on trees, are supplicating you to return, compassionate as you are
to all created beings"_END

B_2_C_48_6
BEGIN_
एकः सत् पुरुषो लोके लक्ष्मणः सह सीतया |
यो अनुगच्चति काकुत्स्थम् रामम् परिचरन् वने || २-४८-८_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana alone is a good man in this world, who was accompanying Rama belonging to
Kakutstha dynasty, along with Sita ,duly rendering service to them in the forest."_END

B_2_C_47_13
BEGIN_
रथस्य मार्ग नाशेन न्यवर्तन्त मनस्विनः |
किम् इदम् किम् करिष्यामः दैवेन उपहताइति || २-४७-१४_END
BEGIN_
The good-natured citizens, due to disappearance of the tracks of the chariot,
returned to Ayodhya, saying thus, " How is it? What shall we do? We are afflicted by
providence"_END

B_2_C_46_19
BEGIN_
यथा एते नियमम् पौराः कुर्वन्ति अस्मन् निवर्तने |
अपि प्राणान् असिष्यन्ति न तु त्यक्ष्यन्ति निश्चयम् || २-४६-२०_END
BEGIN_
"From the way in which these citizens are making coercion to take us back (to
Ayodhya), it seems they will even lay down their lives, but in no case would give up their
resolve"_END

B_2_C_45_31
BEGIN_
एवम् विक्रोशताम् तेषाम् द्विजातीनाम् निवर्तने |
ददृशे तमसा तत्र वारयन्ति इव राघवम् || २-४५-३२_END
BEGIN_
While those brahmanas were crying thus with a view to persuading Rama to return, the
river Tamasa appeared there, as though retarding the progress of Rama "_END

B_2_C_48_7
BEGIN_
आपगाः कृत पुण्याः ताः पद्मिन्यः च सरांसि च |
येषु स्नास्यति काकुत्स्थो विगाह्य सलिलम् शुचि || २-४८-९_END
BEGIN_
"Fortunate too are the rivers; lotus ponds and lakes for bathing in whose sacred
waters Rama entered into."_END

B_2_C_47_14
BEGIN_
ततः यथा आगतेन एव मार्गेण क्लान्त चेतसः |
अयोध्याम् अगमन् सर्वे पुरीम् व्यथित सज्जनाम् || २-४७-१५_END
BEGIN_
Therafter, all of them with aggrieved hearts went to the city of Ayodhya, which was
comprising of virtuous people with distress, by the same path on which they had come._END

B_2_C_46_20
BEGIN_
यावद् एव तु संसुप्ताः तावद् एव वयम् लघु |
रथम् आरुह्य गच्चामः पन्थानम् अकुतः भयम् || २-४६-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Till which time the citizens are asleep, within that time, let us quickly mount the
chariot and take a route which has no fear from any quarter"_END

B_2_C_45_32
BEGIN_
ततः सुमन्त्रोऽपि रथाद्विमुच्य |
श्रान्तान्हयान्सम्परिवर्त्य श्रीघ्राम् |
पीतोदकांस्तोयपरिप्लुताङ्गा |
नचारयद्वै तमसाविदूरे || २-४५-३३_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter Sumantra the charioteer too released the horses, tired as they were, from
the chariot and quickly making them roll, allowed them to graze not very far from the (bank of)
Tamasa once they had drunk water and had their body washed in the river."_END

B_2_C_48_8
BEGIN_
शोभयिष्यन्ति काकुत्स्थम् अटव्यो रम्य काननाः |
आपगाः च महा अनूपाः सानुमन्तः च पर्वताः || २-४८-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Forests with beautiful row of trees, tracks of land abounding in water, rivers and
mountains with alluring peaks will bring splendor to Rama."_END

B_2_C_46_21
BEGIN_
अतः भूयो अपि न इदानीम् इक्ष्वाकु पुर वासिनः |
स्वपेयुर् अनुरक्ता माम् वृष्क मूलानि संश्रिताः || २-४६-२२_END
BEGIN_
"From this the citizens of Ayodhya (the ancient capital of Ikshvaku), who are
longing for me, may not sleep as of now, at the roots of trees again and again"_END

B_2_C_47_15
BEGIN_
आलोक्य नगरीम् ताम् च क्षयव्याकुलमानसाः |
आवर्तयन्त त्ऽश्रूणि नयनैः शोकपीडितैः || २-४७-१६_END
BEGIN_
Beholding the city, they shed tears through their eyes stricken as they were in
grief , their minds distressed through cheerlessness._END

B_2_C_48_9
BEGIN_
काननम् वा अपि शैलम् वा यम् रामः अभिगमिष्यति |
प्रिय अतिथिम् इव प्राप्तम् न एनम् शक्ष्यन्ति अनर्चितुम् || २-४८-११_END
BEGIN_
"Any mountain or forest which Rama will visit, will not fail to respect him like a
beloved guest who has arrived."_END

B_2_C_46_22
BEGIN_
पौरा हि आत्म कृतात् दुह्खात् विप्रमोच्या नृप आत्मजैः |
न तु खल्व् आत्मना योज्या दुह्खेन पुर वासिनः || २-४६-२३_END
BEGIN_
"The residents of city should indeed be made free of their suffering brought about
by (citizens) themselves, by the sons of their rulers. The citizens should on no account be
burdened with hardship caused by (princes) them selves as is our case."_END

B_2_C_47_16
BEGIN_
एषा रामेण नगरी रहिता नातिशोभते |
आपगा गरुडेनेव ह्रदादुद्धृतपन्नगा || २-४७-१७_END
BEGIN_
Bereft of Rama, the aforesaid city of Ayodhya was not any more enchanting than a
river whose snakes were uplifted from its pool by Garuda._END

B_2_C_48_10
BEGIN_
विचित्र कुसुम आपीडा बहु मन्जलि धारिणः |
अकाले च अपि मुख्यानि पुष्पाणि च फलानि च || २-४८-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Plants with many -colored flowers as their chaplets, bearing copious clusters of
blossoms full of bees exhibit themselves at Rama."_END

B_2_C_46_23
BEGIN_
अब्रवील् लक्ष्मणो रामम् साक्षात् धर्मम् इव स्थितम् |
रोचते मे महा प्राज्ञ क्षिप्रम् आरुह्यताम् इति || २-४६-२४_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana replied as follows to Rama, who is standing firm like righteousness
personified: "Oh, wise brother! What you say is agreeable to me. (Pray) ascend the chariot
quickly"_END

B_2_C_47_17
BEGIN_
चन्द्रहीनमिवाकाशम् तोयहीनमिवार्णवम् |
अपश्यन्निहतानन्दम् नगरम् ते विचेतसः || २-४७-१८_END
BEGIN_
As the sky without the moon or the sea without the water, these disconcerted men
beheld the city from which all joy had fled._END

B_2_C_48_11
BEGIN_
अकाले चापि मुख्यानि पुष्पाणि च फलानि च |
दर्शयिष्यन्ति अनुक्रोशात् गिरयो रामम् आगतम् || २-४८-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Even in unseasonable ness, mountains in compassion will present principal flowers
and fruits to Rama, on his arrival."_END

B_2_C_46_24
BEGIN_
अथ रामोऽब्रवीच्छ्रीमान् सुमन्त्रम् युज्यताम् रथः |
गमिष्यामि ततोऽरण्यम् गच्छ श्रीघ्रमितः प्रभो || २-४६-२५_END
BEGIN_
Then, the glorious Rama spoke to the charioteer as follows: "Oh, capable man! Keep
the chariot ready. I shall proceed to the forest. Let us go quickly from here."_END

B_2_C_47_18
BEGIN_
ते तानि वेश्मानि महाधनानि |
दुःखेन दुःखोपहता विशन्तः |
नैव प्रजज्ञुः स्वजनम् जनम् वा |
निरीक्षमाणाः प्रविणष्टहर्षाः || २-४७-१९_END
BEGIN_
Entering their houses full of abundant riches with uneasiness, the citizens could
not distinguish between their own people and others, even though being looked at, stricken as they
were with grief, their joy having altogether extinguished._END

B_2_C_48_12
BEGIN_
प्रस्रविष्यन्ति तोयानि विमलानि महीधराः |
विदर्शयन्तः विविधान् भूयः चित्रामः च निर्झरान् || २-४८-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Mountains will show various wonderful waterfalls again and again, duly streaming
forth uncontaminated waters."_END

B_2_C_46_25
BEGIN_
सूतः ततः सम्त्वरितः स्यन्दनम् तैः हय उत्तमैः |
योजयित्वा अथ रामाय प्रान्जलिः प्रत्यवेदयत् || २-४६-२६_END
BEGIN_
Then, Sumantra quickly fastened the chariot to its excellent horses and thereafter
submitted with joined palms to Rama (as follows):_END

B_2_C_48_13
BEGIN_
पादपाः पर्वत अग्रेषु रमयिष्यन्ति राघवम् |
यत्र रामः भयम् न अत्र न अस्ति तत्र पराभवः || २-४८-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Trees on apex of mountains will enrapture Rama. Where there is Rama, there is
neither fear nor humiliation"._END

B_2_C_46_26
BEGIN_
अयम् युक्तो महाबाहो रथस्ते रथिनाम् वर |
त्वमारोहस्व भद्रम् ते ससीतः सहलक्ष्मणः || २-४६-२७_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, mighty armed prince! Your chariot is kept ready. You ascend it along with Sita
and with Lakshmana, Oh jewel among car-warriors! May prosperity attend you"_END

B_2_C_48_14
BEGIN_
स हि शूरः महा बाहुः पुत्रः दशरथस्य च |
पुरा भवति नो दूरात् अनुगच्चाम राघवम् || २-४८-१६_END
BEGIN_
"That Rama the son of Dasaratha, the hero and the mighty armed will come to our view
not far from us. Let us run after him."_END

B_2_C_46_27
BEGIN_
तम् स्यन्दनमधिष्ठाय राघवः सपरिच्छदः |
शीघ्रगामाकुलावर्ताम् तमसामतरन्नदीम् || २-४६-२८_END
BEGIN_
Rama mounted the chariot with all necessaries (like bow, armor, quiver, spade,
basket, and so on) and crossed the swift flowing Tamasa river, thickly set with whirl- pools._END

B_2_C_49_0
BEGIN_
रामः अपि रात्रि शेषेण तेन एव महद् अन्तरम् |
जगाम पुरुष व्याघ्रः पितुर् आज्ञाम् अनुस्मरन् || २-४९-१_END
BEGIN_
Rama the tiger among men, revolving in his mind the command of his father, covered a
long distance during the rest of the night._END

B_2_C_46_28
BEGIN_
स सम्तीर्य महाबाहुः श्रीमान् शिवमकण्टकम् |
प्रापद्यत महामार्गमभयम् भयदर्शिनाम् || २-४६-२९_END
BEGIN_
Having duly crossed the stream, the glorious Rama the mighty armed reached a great
road free from obstacles and safe even for those who are apprehensive of danger._END

B_2_C_48_15
BEGIN_
पादच् चाया सुखा भर्तुस् तादृशस्य महात्मनः |
स हि नाथो जनस्य अस्य स गतिः स परायणम् || २-४८-१७_END
BEGIN_
"The shelter of the feet of the lord and the high-souled Rama is in itself a joy.
Rama indeed is the protector of all of us, he the refuge and our supreme asylum "_END

B_2_C_49_1
BEGIN_
तथैव गच्चतः तस्य व्यपायात् रजनी शिवा |
उपास्य स शिवाम् संध्याम् विषय अन्तम् व्यगाहत || २-४९-२_END
BEGIN_
While Rama was traveling with the same alacrity, that delightful night passed away.
Having worshipped the blissful morning twilight, he passed beyond the boundary of that country._END

B_2_C_46_29
BEGIN_
मोहन अर्थम् तु पौराणाम् सूतम् रामः अब्रवीद् वचः |
उदन् मुखः प्रयाहि त्वम् रथम् आस्थाय सारथे || २-४६-३०
मुहूर्तम् त्वरितम् गत्वा निर्गतय रथम् पुनः |
यथा न विद्युः पौरा माम् तथा कुरु समाहितः || २-४६-३१_END
BEGIN_
In order to elude the citizens, Rama spoke to Sumantra as follows: "Oh, charioteer!
You mount the chariot and go northward. Proceed for a while quickly and bring back the chariot
again. Remaining careful, do it in such a way that the citizens may not be able to locate me"_END

B_2_C_48_16
BEGIN_
वयम् परिचरिष्यामः सीताम् यूयम् तु राघवम् |
इति पौर स्त्रियो भर्तृऋन् दुह्ख आर्ताः तत् तत् अब्रुवन् || २-४८-१८_END
BEGIN_
"We shall serve Sita; while you attend on Rama." Thus, the citizen's wives,
afflicted with agony, spoke in so many words to their husbands._END

B_2_C_49_2
BEGIN_
ग्रामान् विकृष्ट सीमान् तान् पुष्पितानि वनानि च |
पश्यन्न् अतिययौ शीघ्रम् शरैः इव हय उत्तमैः || २-४९-३
शृण्वन् वाचो मनुष्याणाम् ग्राम सम्वास वासिनाम् |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing villages, whose outskirts have been tilled and the woodlands laden with
blossoms and hearing as follows the words of men dwelling together in the midst of the village,
Rama proceeded apace in those excellent horses as though slowly (engrossed as he was in enjoying
the sights)._END

B_2_C_48_17
BEGIN_
युष्माकम् राघवो अरण्ये योग क्षेमम् विधास्यति |
सीता नारी जनस्य अस्य योग क्षेमम् करिष्यति || २-४८-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Rama will secure the needs and interests of yours in the forest, while Sita will do
the same thing with regard to us womenfolk."_END

B_2_C_46_30
BEGIN_
रामस्य वचनम् श्रुत्वा तथा चक्रे स सारथिः |
प्रत्यागम्य च रामस्य स्यन्दनम् प्रत्यवेदयत् || २-४६-३२_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Rama's advice, the charioteer made a round of the chariot as he was
suggested and on returning, reported to Rama about the arrival of the chariot._END

B_2_C_49_3
BEGIN_
राजानम् धिग् दशरथम् कामस्य वशम् आगतम् || २-४९-४
हा नृशंस अद्य कैकेयी पापा पाप अनुबन्धिनी |
तीक्ष्णा सम्भिन्न मर्यादा तीक्ष्णे कर्मणि वर्तते || २-४९-५
या पुत्रम् ईदृशम् राज्ञः प्रवासयति धार्मिकम् |
वन वासे महा प्राज्ञम् सानुक्रोशम् अतन्द्रितम् || २-४९-६_END
BEGIN_
"Woe unto the king Dasaratha who fell into the clutches of concupiscence. Alas!
Kaikeyi the cruel and the sinful one now is still engaged in a cruel game. She is sending to exile
the prince Rama, the pious man, the great intellectual, the compassionate man and he who subdued
the senses. That hot-tempered Kaikeyi is behaving in a rude manner, transgressing the bounds of
propriety"_END

B_2_C_48_18
BEGIN_
को न्व् अनेन अप्रतीतेन स उत्कण्ठित जनेन च |
सम्प्रीयेत अमनोज्ञेन वासेन हृत चेतसा || २-४८-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Who will be highly pleased with this residence in the city, which is apprehensible,
with anxious people in it and not being a pleasant spot with unsettled minds?"_END

B_2_C_46_31
BEGIN_
तौ सम्प्रयुक्तम् तु रथम् समासित्थौ |
तदा ससीतौ रघवंशवर्धनौ |
प्रचोदयामास ततस्तुरम्गमान् |
स सारथिर्येन पथा तपोवनम् || २-४६-३३_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama and Lakshmana(the promoters of the race of Raghu) along with Sita
ascended the chariot yoked together. The charioteer urged the horses along the route by which they
can reach a grove suited to the practice of austerities._END

B_2_C_49_4
BEGIN_
कथम् नाम महाभागा सीता जनकनन्दिनी |
सदा सुखेष्वभिरता दुःखान्यनुभविष्यति || २-४९-७_END
BEGIN_
"How Sita the venerable woman, the daughter of Janaka, who was delighted always in
homely comforts can now experience hardships in the forest?"_END

B_2_C_48_19
BEGIN_
कैकेय्या यदि चेद् राज्यम् स्यात् अधर्म्यम् अनाथवत् |
न हि नो जीवितेन अर्थः कुतः पुत्रैः कुतः धनैः || २-४८-२१_END
BEGIN_
"If it were to be the rule of Kaikeyi, it will not be in consonance with
righteousness, with no protector and indeed with no use for our lives, mush less for our sons and
riches."_END

B_2_C_46_32
BEGIN_
ततः समास्थाय रथम् महारथः
ससारथिर्धाशरथिर्वनम् ययौ |
उदङ्मुखम् तम् तु रथम् चकार स |
प्रयाणमाङ्गश्यनिवितदर्शनात् || २-४६-३४_END
BEGIN_
However, Sumantra placed that chariot by facing it to the north, for he saw omens
auspicious for journey (in that quarter). Rama (son of Dasaratha) the mighty car-warrior, along
with the charioteer mounted the chariot and proceeded to the forest._END

B_2_C_49_5
BEGIN_
अहो दशरथो राजा निस्नेहः स्वसुत प्रियम् |
प्रजानामनघम् रामम् परित्यक्तुमिहेच्छति || २-४९-८_END
BEGIN_
"What a surprise! The king Dasaratha, having no love for his son, now wants to
abandon Rama who is so beloved to the people and is even faultless."_END

B_2_C_48_20
BEGIN_
यया पुत्रः च भर्ता च त्यक्ताव् ऐश्वर्य कारणात् |
कम् सा परिहरेद् अन्यम् कैकेयी कुल पांसनी || २-४८-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Whom else Kaikeyi will not abandon? --that Kaikeyi, by whom her son and her husband
were forsaken for the sake of power and who brought disgrace to her family."_END

B_2_C_49_6
BEGIN_
एता वाचो मनुष्याणाम् ग्राम सम्वास वासिनाम् |
शृण्वन्न् अति ययौ वीरः कोसलान् कोसल ईश्वरः || २-४९-९_END
BEGIN_
Hearing these words of people residing in villages and hamlets, Rama the heroic
prince of Kosala crossed the boundaries of Kosala state._END

B_2_C_48_21
BEGIN_
कैकेय्या न वयम् राज्ये भृतका निवसेमहि |
जीवन्त्या जातु जीवन्त्यः पुत्रैः अपि शपामहे || २-४८-२३_END
BEGIN_
"We swear even by our sons that while Kaikeyi is surviving and as long as we live,
we will never inhabit this kingdom as Kaikeyi's servants!"_END

B_2_C_49_7
BEGIN_
ततः वेद श्रुतिम् नाम शिव वारि वहाम् नदीम् |
उत्तीर्य अभिमुखः प्रायात् अगस्त्य अध्युषिताम् दिशम् || २-४९-१०_END
BEGIN_
Having crossed the river of auspicious waters called Vedashruti, Rama then stretched
forth, facing the quarter occupied by Sage Agastya._END

B_2_C_48_22
BEGIN_
या पुत्रम् पार्थिव इन्द्रस्य प्रवासयति निर्घृणा |
कः ताम् प्राप्य सुखम् जीवेद् अधर्म्याम् दुष्ट चारिणीम् || २-४८-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Who can live happily on having obtained (as one's ruler) that impious woman of
wicked conduct, who banished the son of the king without any pity?"_END

B_2_C_49_8
BEGIN_
गत्वा तु सुचिरम् कालम् ततः शीत जलाम् नदीम् |
गोमतीम् गोयुत अनूपाम् अतरत् सागरम् गमाम् || २-४९-११_END
BEGIN_
After traveling a pretty long time from there, Rama crossed the river Gomati having
beautiful waters, whose banks were adorned with cows and which headed towards the sea._END

B_2_C_48_23
BEGIN_
उपद्रुतमिदम् सर्वमनालम्बमनायकम् |
कैकेय्या हि कृते सर्वम् विनाशमुपयास्यति || २-४८-२५_END
BEGIN_
"The whole of this kingdom, without any leader, having no support and visited by
calamities, will meet with ruin because of Kaikeyi's fault."_END

B_2_C_49_9
BEGIN_
गोमतीम् च अपि अतिक्रम्य राघवः शीघ्रगैः हयैः |
मयूर हंस अभिरुताम् ततार स्यन्दिकाम् नदीम् || २-४९-१२_END
BEGIN_
Reaching the other bank of Gomati river with the help of the swift moving horses,
Rama crossed the river called Syandika which had resounded with howls of peacocks and swans._END

B_2_C_48_24
BEGIN_
न हि प्रव्रजिते रामे जीविष्यति मही पतिः |
मृते दशरथे व्यक्तम् विलोपः तत् अनन्तरम् || २-४८-२६_END
BEGIN_
"For, Rama having gone into exile, the monarch will not survive and when Dasaratha
is dead, utter regrets will remain thereafter. It is certain!"_END

B_2_C_49_10
BEGIN_
स महीम् मनुना राज्ञा दत्ताम् इक्ष्वाकवे पुरा |
स्फीताम् राष्ट्र आवृताम् रामः वैदेहीम् अन्वदर्शयत् || २-४९-१३_END
BEGIN_
The said Rama showed to Sita the land (of Kosala, the southern boundary of which was
defined by Syandika river)given long ago by the king Manu to Ikshvaku and which was bounded by many
territories._END

B_2_C_48_25
BEGIN_
ते विषम् पिबत आलोड्य क्षीण पुण्याः सुदुर्गताः |
राघवम् वा अनुगच्चध्वम् अश्रुतिम् वा अपि गच्चत || २-४८-२७_END
BEGIN_
"So, drink poison duly stirred up, since your merits are exhausted and you are
marked out by ill fortune. Otherwise, follow Rama to forest or reach a place where even the name of
Kaikeyi may not reach your ears."_END

B_2_C_49_11
BEGIN_
सूतैति एव च आभाष्य सारथिम् तम् अभीक्ष्णशः |
हंस मत्त स्वरः श्रीमान् उवाच पुरुष ऋषभः || २-४९-१४_END
BEGIN_
The glorious Rama, the foremost among men, whose voice resembled the cackling of a
swan in rut, addressed the charioteer with great affection, in the words "Oh, charioteer!" and
spoke as follows :_END

B_2_C_48_26
BEGIN_
मिथ्या प्रव्राजितः रामः सभार्यः सह लक्ष्मणः |
भरते सम्निषृष्टाः स्मः सौनिके पशवो यथा || २-४८-२८_END
BEGIN_
"Rama has been sent to exile along with Sita and Lakshmana deceitfully. We have been
handed over now to Bharata, like the beasts in the hands of a slaughterer."_END

B_2_C_48_27
BEGIN_
पूर्णचन्द्राननः श्यामो गूढजत्रुररिंदमः |
आजानुबाहुः पद्माक्षो रामो लक्ष्मनपूर्वजः || २-४८-२९
पूर्वाभिभाषी मधुरः सत्यवादी महाबलः |
सौम्यः सर्वस्य लोकस्य चन्द्रवत्प्रियदर्शनः || २-४८-३०
नूनम् पुरुषशार्दूलो मत्तमातङ्गविक्रमः |
शोभयुश्यत्यरण्यानि विचरन् स महारथः || २-४८-३१_END
BEGIN_
"Rama, whose face is like the full moon, of dark brown complexion, whose collar-bone
is invisible (because of its being covered with flesh), a conqueror of foes, whose arms descend to
his knees, whose eyes resemble lotuses, the elder brother of Lakshmana, who takes initiative in
speaking and expresses with sweetness, truthful of speech and possessed of extra ordinary strength,
is benevolent to all, delightfully charming as the moon, that tiger among men, as mighty as an
elephant in rut, that great car-warrior, will surely adorn the woods, while roaming through
them.."_END

B_2_C_49_12
BEGIN_
कदा अहम् पुनर् आगम्य सरय्वाः पुष्पिते वने |
मृगयाम् पर्याटष्यामि मात्रा पित्रा च सम्गतः || २-४९-१५_END
BEGIN_
"When, coming back and united with my mother and father, shall I roam hunting in the
forest, bordering on Sarayu river and laden with blossoms?"_END

B_2_C_49_13
BEGIN_
न अत्यर्थम् अभिकान्क्षामि मृगयाम् सरयू वने |
रतिर् हि एषा अतुला लोके राज ऋषि गण सम्मता || २-४९-१६
राजर्षीणाम् हि लोकेऽस्मिन् रत्यर्थम् मृगया वने |
काले कृताम् ताम् मनुजैर्धन्विनामभिकाङ्क्षिताम् || २-४९-१७_END
BEGIN_
"I do not hanker much after hunting in the woodlands bordering on Sarayu river. In
fact it is a delightful spot, made much of in the world by hosts of royal sages. Hunting in the
forest is indeed for gratification of royal sages in this world. At times; the bow- men adopted it.
But I do not long for it excessively."_END

B_2_C_48_28
BEGIN_
तास्तथा विलपन्त्यस्तु नगरे नागरस्त्रियः |
चुक्रुशुर्दुःखसम्तप्तामृत्योरिव भयागमे || २-४८-३२_END
BEGIN_
Those wives of citizens in the city of Ayodhya, lamenting as aforesaid, began
weeping, as though fear has cropped up for a forth-coming death._END

B_2_C_49_14
BEGIN_
स तम् अध्वानम् ऐक्ष्वाकः सूतम् मधुरया गिरा
तम् तम् अर्थम् अभिप्रेत्य ययौवाक्यम् उदीरयन् || २-४९-१८_END
BEGIN_
Uttering in sweet voice to the charioteer on various topics dearer to him, Rama
advanced thus along that route._END

B_2_C_48_29
BEGIN_
इत्येव विलपन्तीनाम् स्त्रीणाम् वेश्मसु राघवम् |
जगामास्तम् दिनकरो रजनी चाभ्यवर्तत || २-४८-३३_END
BEGIN_
The sun sank below the horizon and the night fell, while the women in the houses
were weeping in that manner about Rama._END

B_2_C_48_30
BEGIN_
नष्टज्वलनसम्पाता प्रशान्ताध्यायसत्कथा |
तिमिरेणाभिलिप्तेव तदा सा नगरी बभौ || २-४८-३४_END
BEGIN_
The city of Ayodhya, in which the kindling of fires had ceased and the chanting of
Vedas and narration of sacred stories died out, looked as though it was coated with darkness at
that time._END

B_2_C_48_31
BEGIN_
उपशान्तवणिक्पण्या नष्टहर्षा निराश्रया |
अयोध्या नगरी चासीन्नष्टतारमिवाम्बरम् || २-४८-३५_END
BEGIN_
The city of Ayodhya, in which the business of the trading class had come to a
stand-still, in which joy had been faded out, which had become (now) support less, looked dim as
though stars had disappeared in the sky._END

B_2_C_48_32
BEGIN_
तथा स्त्रियो राम निमित्तम् आतुरा |
यथा सुते भ्रातरि वा विवासिते |
विलप्य दीना रुरुदुर् विचेतसः |
सुतैः हि तासाम् अधिको हि सो अभवत् || २-४८-३६_END
BEGIN_
The women whose minds became sick on account of Rama, as one would feel on one's own
son or brother having been sent into exile, cried miserably expressing their grief in various ways.
To them, Rama was dearer than their very sons!_END

B_2_C_48_33
BEGIN_
प्रशान्तगीतोत्सव नृत्तवादना |
व्यपास्तहर्षा पिहितापणोदया |
तदा ह्ययोध्या नगरी बभूव सा |
महार्णवः सम्क्षपितोदको यथा ||२-४८-३७_END
BEGIN_
That city of Ayodhya, in which singing, rejoicing, dancing and instrumental music
had been completely set at rest, when jpy had departed forever and whose shops had been closed,
looked at that time like a grat ocean whose waters had dried up._END

B_2_C_50_0
BEGIN_
विशालान् कोसलान् रम्यान् यात्वा लक्ष्मण पूर्वजः |
अयोध्याभिमुखो धीमान् प्राञ्ञ्लिर्वाक्वमब्रवीत् || २-५०-१_END
BEGIN_
Having traveled the extensive and beautiful Kosala territory and standing with his
face turned towards Ayodhya, the wise Rama with joined palms spoke the following words:_END

B_2_C_50_1
BEGIN_
आपृच्छे त्वाम् पुरीश्रेष्ठे काकुत्स्थपरिपालिते |
दैवतानि च यानि त्वाम् पालयन्त्यावसन्ति च || २-५०-२_END
BEGIN_
"I bid farewell to you, Oh best of the cities, carefully protected by Dasaratha born
in Kakutstha dynasty, as well as of the deities who protect you and dwell in you."_END

B_2_C_50_2
BEGIN_
निवृत्तवनवासस्त्वामनृणो जगतीपतेः |
पुनर्ध्रक्ष्यामि मात्रा च पित्रा च सह सम्गतः || २-५०-३_END
BEGIN_
"After getting relieved from exile in the forest and thus freed from the debt to the
emperor, I shall see you again, duly getting united with my mother and father."_END

B_2_C_50_3
BEGIN_
ततो रुधिरताम्राक्षो भुजमुद्यम्य दक्षिणम् |
अश्रुपूर्णमुखो दीनोऽब्रवीज्जानपदम् जनम् || २-५०-४_END
BEGIN_
Lifting his right arm and wearing a woeful look, his face covered with tears, Rama
possessing lovely reddish eyes, spoke them to the people hailing from the countryside.(as follows)
:_END

B_2_C_50_4
BEGIN_
अनुक्रोशो दया चैव यथार्हम् मयि वह् कृतः |
चिरम् दुःखस्य पापीयो गम्यतामर्थसिद्धये || २-५०-५_END
BEGIN_
"Mercy and compassion according to my worth (in your view) have been shown to me by
you. Keeping agony for a long time is undesirable. Let each return to accomplish your desired
object(attending to your house-hold work)!"_END

B_2_C_51_0
BEGIN_
तम् जाग्रतम् अदम्भेन भ्रातुर् अर्थाय लक्ष्मणम् |
गुहः सम्ताप सम्तप्तः राघवम् वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् || २-५१-१_END
BEGIN_
Distressed with anguish (to see Rama and Sita lying on the ground) Guha said to
Lakshmana, the scion of Raghu, who kept awake, through sincere love, for the protection of his
brother Rama._END

B_2_C_50_5
BEGIN_
तेऽभिवाद्य महात्मानम् कृत्वा चापि प्रदक्षिणम् |
विलपन्तो नरा घोरम् व्यतिष्ठन्त क्वचित् क्वचित् || २-५०-६_END
BEGIN_
Respectfully saluting the high soled prince and going round him clockwise (as a mark
of reverence), those men stood rooted here and there, wailing frightfully._END

B_2_C_51_1
BEGIN_
इयम् तात सुखा शय्या त्वद् अर्थम् उपकल्पिता |
प्रत्याश्वसिहि साध्व् अस्याम् राज पुत्र यथा सुखम् || २-५१-२_END
BEGIN_
"Here is a comfortable bed made for you, my friend! Relax well comfortably on it,
Oh, prince!"_END

B_2_C_50_6
BEGIN_
तथा विलपताम् तेषामतृप्तानाम् च राघवः |
अचक्षुरिषयम् प्रायाद्यथार्कः क्षणदामुखे || २-५०-७_END
BEGIN_
While they were lamenting thus unceasingly, Rama passed beyond their sight, as the
sun sinks out of view at nightfall._END

B_2_C_51_2
BEGIN_
उचितः अयम् जनः सर्वः क्लेशानाम् त्वम् सुख उचितः |
गुप्ति अर्थम् जागरिष्यामः काकुत्स्थस्य वयम् निशाम् || २-५१-३_END
BEGIN_
"All of us are habituated to hardships. You are habituated to comforts. We shall
keep awake this night, for the protection of Rama"_END

B_2_C_50_7
BEGIN_
ततो धान्यधनोपेतान् दानशीलजनान् शिवान् |
अकुतश्चिद्भयान् रम्याम् श्चैत्ययूपसमावृतान् || २-५०-८
उद्यानाम्रवनोपेतान् सम्पन्नसलिलाशयान् |
तुष्टपुष्टजनाकीर्णान् गोकुलाकुलसेवितान् || २-५०-९
लक्षणीयान्न रेंद्राणाम् ब्रह्मघोषाभिनादितान् |
रथेन पुरुषव्याघ्रः कोसलानत्यवर्तत || २-५०-१०_END
BEGIN_
Then Rama, a tiger among men, in his chariot, crossed Kosala territory, which was
rich in grain and treasure, inhabited by men given to charity, benevolent and free from every
danger, pleasing, full of temples and sacrificial stakes, adorned with gardens and mango-orchards,
intersected by ponds full of water, populated by contented and well nourished people, abounded in
herds of cows which deserved to be seen by all kings and which re-echoed to the chanting of
religious texts._END

B_2_C_51_3
BEGIN_
न हि रामात् प्रियतरः मम अस्ति भुवि कश्चन |
ब्रवीम्य् एतत् अहम् सत्यम् सत्येन एव च ते शपे || २-५१-४_END
BEGIN_
"For, none is dearer to me than Rama in this world. I speak the truth and swear to
you by truth."_END

B_2_C_50_8
BEGIN_
मध्येन मुदितम् स्फीतम् रम्योद्यानसमाकुलम् |
राज्यम् भोग्यम् नरेन्द्राणाम् ययौ धृतिमताम् वरः || २-५०-११_END
BEGIN_
Rama, the best among the resolute, moved into the middle of a happy and prosperous
kingdom, abounding in lovely gardens and fit to be enjoyed by kings._END

B_2_C_51_4
BEGIN_
अस्य प्रसादात् आशंसे लोके अस्मिन् सुमहद् यशः |
धर्म अवाप्तिम् च विपुलाम् अर्थ अवाप्तिम् च केवलाम् || २-५१-५_END
BEGIN_
"I hope to acquire abundant acclaim and supreme merit in this world as also full
reward of wealth, by the sole grace of Rama"_END

B_2_C_50_9
BEGIN_
तत्र त्रिपथगाम् दिव्याम् शिव तोयाम् अशैवलाम् |
ददर्श राघवो गन्गाम् पुण्याम् ऋषि निसेविताम् || २-५०-१२_END
BEGIN_
There, Rama beheld the celestial and lovely river of Ganga with its tree
tributaries, carrying clear waters without green moss and frequented by sages._END

B_2_C_51_5
BEGIN_
सो अहम् प्रिय सखम् रामम् शयानम् सह सीतया |
रक्षिष्यामि धनुष् पाणिः सर्वतः ज्ञातिभिः सह || २-५१-६_END
BEGIN_
"As such, I along with my kindred, shall protect my dear friend Rama who is reposing
with Sita in every way, with bow in hand."_END

B_2_C_50_10
BEGIN_
आश्रमैरविदूर्स्थैः श्रीमद्भिः समलम् कृताम् |
कालेऽप्सरोभिर्हृष्टाभिः सेविताम्भोह्रदाम् शिवाम् || २-५०-१३_END
BEGIN_
The River Ganga was adorned with splendid hermitages within easy distance from one
another, with pools overflowing with water, visited at suitable hours by celestial nymphs thrilling
with rapture._END

B_2_C_51_6
BEGIN_
न हि मे अविदितम् किंचित् वने अस्मिमः चरतः सदा |
चतुर् अन्गम् हि अपि बलम् सुमहत् प्रसहेमहि || २-५१-७_END
BEGIN_
"Nothing is indeed unknown in this forest to me, where I wander continually. We can
able to withstand even a vast army too, comprising of four parts (elephants, chariots, cavalry, and
infantry)."_END

B_2_C_50_11
BEGIN_
देवदानवगन्धर्वैः किन्नरैरुपशोभिताम् |
नागगन्धर्वपत्नीभिः सेविताम् सततम् शिवाम् || २-५०-१४_END
BEGIN_
The blessed river was graced by gods and demons, Gandharvas(celestial musicians) and
kinnaras and was constantly visited by consorts of Nagas and Gandharvas._END

B_2_C_51_7
BEGIN_
लक्ष्मणः तम् तदा उवाच रक्ष्यमाणाः त्वया अनघ |
न अत्र भीता वयम् सर्वे धर्मम् एव अनुपश्यता || २-५१-८_END
BEGIN_
Then, Lakshmana replied to Guha as follows: "Oh, sinless Guha! Being protected by
you, who keep your duty alone in view, all of us are fearless in this land."_END

B_2_C_50_12
BEGIN_
देवाक्रीडशताकीर्णाम् देवोद्यानशतायुताम् |
देवार्थमाकाशगमाम् विख्याताम् देवपद्मिनीम् || २-५०-१५_END
BEGIN_
The well known river was hemmed in by hills serving as the play- ground of hundreds
of celestials and embellished with hundreds of celestial gardens; it coursed through the heavens
for the benefit of gods and which in heaven was named "The stream of Golden Lotuses"._END

B_2_C_51_8
BEGIN_
कथम् दाशरथौ भूमौ शयाने सह सीतया |
शक्या निद्रा मया लब्धुम् जीवितम् वा सुखानि वा || २-५१-९_END
BEGIN_
"When Rama, the son of Dasaratha is lying on the ground with Sita, how is it
possible for me to sleep or to enjoy the pleasures of life?"_END

B_2_C_50_13
BEGIN_
जलघाताट्टहासोग्राम् फेननिर्मलहासिनीम् |
क्वचिद्वेणीकृतजलाम् क्वचिदावर्तशोभिताम् || २-५०-१६_END
BEGIN_
The holy river, the sound of whose clashing waves and its striking with rocks
resembled a deep laughter, having a bright smile as white as a foam, its waters reduced at some
places to the shape of a maiden's plaited locks, was rendered beautiful at some places by whirl
pools._END

B_2_C_51_9
BEGIN_
यो न देव असुरैः सर्वैः शक्यः प्रसहितुम् युधि |
तम् पश्य सुख सम्विष्टम् तृणेषु सह सीतया || २-५१-१०_END
BEGIN_
"See that Rama, who cannot be vanquished in combat even by the gods and demons
combined, now sleeping profoundly on the grass along with Sita."_END

B_2_C_50_14
BEGIN_
क्वचित्स्तिमितगम्भीराम् क्वचिद्वेगजलाकुलाम् |
क्वचिद्गम्भीरनिर्घोषाम् क्वचिद्भैरवनिस्वनाम् || २-५०-१७_END
BEGIN_
At some places, its waters were still and deep. At some places, they were disturbed
with violent agitation. At some places, they made a deep roaring sound. At some places, they were
having a terrific noise_END

B_2_C_51_10
BEGIN_
यो मन्त्र तपसा लब्धो विविधैः च परिश्रमैः |
एको दशरथस्य एष पुत्रः सदृश लक्षणः || २-५१-११
अस्मिन् प्रव्रजितः राजा न चिरम् वर्तयिष्यति |
विधवा मेदिनी नूनम् क्षिप्रम् एव भविष्यति || २-५१-१२_END
BEGIN_
When Rama- who is endowed with similar characteristics as Dasaratha, uniquely
beloved, the son obtained by Dasaratha by virtue of his chanting of several sacred texts and
austerities and by various undertakings (in the form of sacrificial performances) has gone to
exile, the king will not live long and the earth will become surely widowed forthwith._END

B_2_C_50_15
BEGIN_
देवसम्घाप्लुतजलाम् निर्मलोत्पलशोभिताम् |
क्वचिदाभोगपुलिनाम् क्वचिन्नर्मलवालुकाम् || २-५०-१८_END
BEGIN_
Hosts of gods took a dip into its water .It was adorned by white lotuses. It was
hemmed in, with expanse of small islands and at some places, lined with white sands._END

B_2_C_51_11
BEGIN_
विनद्य सुमहा नादम् श्रमेण उपरताः स्त्रियः |
निर्घोष उपरतम् तात मन्ये राज निवेशनम् || २-५१-१३_END
BEGIN_
Having cried out in a high-pitched tone, the women having exhausted, will have
fallen silent and I am sure that a profound stillness reigns in the palace._END

B_2_C_52_0
BEGIN_
प्रभातायाम् तु शर्वर्याम् पृथु वृक्षा महा यशाः |
उवाच रामः सौमित्रिम् लक्ष्मणम् शुभ लक्षणम् || २-५२-१_END
BEGIN_
That night having given way to dawn, the illustrious Rama with a broad chest spoke
(as follows) to Lakshmana, the son of Sumitra and who was endowed with auspicious signs :_END

B_2_C_51_12
BEGIN_
कौसल्या चैव राजा च तथैव जननी मम |
न आशंसे यदि जीवन्ति सर्वे ते शर्वरीम् इमाम् || २-५१-१४_END
BEGIN_
"I do not expect Kausalya, Dasaratha and my mother all of them to remain alive for
this night."_END

B_2_C_50_16
BEGIN_
हंस सरस सम्घुष्टाम् चक्र वाक उपकूजिताम् |
सदामदैश्च विहगैरभिसम्नादिताम् तराम् || २-५०-१९_END
BEGIN_
The river was rendered resonant by swans and cranes, was graced with cackling of
Chakrawaka** birds and other birds which are in rut all through the year kept hovering on its
water._END

B_2_C_52_1
BEGIN_
भास्कर उदय कालो अयम् गता भगवती निशा |
असौ सुकृष्णो विहगः कोकिलः तात कूजति || २-५२-२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, dear brother! This is the hour of sunrise. The auspicious night has departed.
That bird of dark plumage, the cuckoo, is singing."_END

B_2_C_50_17
BEGIN_
क्वचित्तीररुहैर्वृक्षैर्मालाभिरिव शोभिताम् |
क्वचित्फुल्लोत्पलच्छन्नाम् क्वचित्पद्मवनाकुलाम् || २-५०-२०_END
BEGIN_
At some places the river was adorned with trees growing on its banks encircling like
garlands, at some places crowded with thick cluster of lotuses._END

B_2_C_51_13
BEGIN_
जीवेद् अपि हि मे माता शत्रुघ्नस्य अन्ववेक्षया |
तत् दुह्खम् यत् तु कौसल्या वीरसूर् विनशिष्यति || २-५१-१५_END
BEGIN_
"By looking forward to meet Satrughna, my mother might even stay alive. But it will
be painful if Kausalya who has given birth to a heroic son, dies."_END

B_2_C_52_2
BEGIN_
बर्हिणानाम् च निर्घोषः श्रूयते नदताम् वने |
तराम जाह्नवीम् सौम्य शीघ्रगाम् सागरम् गमाम् || २-५२-३_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, good brother! Hear the cries of peacocks resounding in the forest. Let us cross
the swift-flowing Ganga River that gushes to the sea."_END

B_2_C_50_18
BEGIN_
क्वचित्कुमुदष्ण्डैश्च कुड्मलैरुपशोभिताम् |
नानापुष्परजोध्वस्ताम् समदामिव च क्वचित् || २-५०-२१_END
BEGIN_
At some places, it was graced with beds of water lilies in the form of buds and at
some places, it was reddened with the pollen of numerous flowers, as though excited with
passion._END

B_2_C_51_14
BEGIN_
अनुरक्त जन आकीर्णा सुख आलोक प्रिय आवहा |
राज व्यसन संसृष्टा सा पुरी विनशिष्यति || २-५१-१६_END
BEGIN_
That city of Ayodhya, filled with devoted people, hitherto a source of joy and which
brought pleasure to the world, when seized with agony over the king's death, will perish._END

B_2_C_52_3
BEGIN_
विज्ञाय रामस्य वचः सौमित्रिर् मित्र नन्दनः |
गुहम् आमन्त्र्य सूतम् च सो अतिष्ठद् भ्रातुर् अग्रतः || २-५२-४_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana, the delight of his friends, having understood the words of Rama, called
Guha as well as Sumantra and stood in front of his brother._END

B_2_C_50_19
BEGIN_
व्यपेतमलसम्घाताम् मणिनिर्मलदर्शनाम् |
दिशागजैर्वनगजैर्मत्तैश्च वरवारणैः || २-५०-२२
देवोपवाह्यश्च मुहुः सम्नादितवनान्तराम् |_END
BEGIN_
Having every aggregation of dirt removed, the river presented a spotlessly clear
appearance like a crystal. The interior of the forest was reddened noisy again and again by the
elephants guarding the quarters, by the ruttiest wild elephants and the elephants of excellent
breed used for riding by gods._END

B_2_C_51_15
BEGIN_
कथम् पुत्रम् महात्मानम् ज्येष्ठम् प्रियमपस्यतः |
शरीरम् धारयुष्यान्ति प्राणा राज्ञो महात्मनः || २-५१-१७_END
BEGIN_
"How, in the absence of his magnanimous and the first born son, will the vital airs
in the body of the generous king be maintained?"_END

B_2_C_52_4
BEGIN_
स तु रामस्य वचनम् निशम्य प्रतिगृह्य च |
स्थपतिस्तूर्णमाहुय सचिवानिदमब्रवीत् || २-५२-५_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the command of Rama, Guha quickly received it, invited his ministers and
spoke to them as follows:_END

B_2_C_50_20
BEGIN_
प्रमदामिव यत्ने न भूषिताम् भूषणोत्तमैः || २-५०-२३
फलैः पुष्पैः किसलयैर्वऋताम् गुल्मैद्द्विजैस्तथा |
शिंशुमरैः च नक्रैः च भुजम्गैः च निषेविताम् || २-५०-२४_END
BEGIN_
Surrounded by fruits and flowers and tender leaves, shrubs and birds, it looked like
a young woman artistically decked with the best of jewels. The river was infested with dolphins,
crocodiles and snakes._END

B_2_C_51_16
BEGIN_
विनष्टे नृपतौ पश्चात्कौसल्या विनशिष्यति |
अनन्तरम् च माताऽपि मम नाशमुपैष्यति || २-५१-१८_END
BEGIN_
"After the death of king, Kausalya will die. My mother also will die thereafter._END

B_2_C_52_5
BEGIN_
अस्य वाहनसम्युक्ताम् कर्णग्राहवतीम् शुभाम् |
सुप्रताराम् दृढाम् तीर्खे शीग्रम् नावमुपाहर || २-५२-६_END
BEGIN_
"Let a beautiful boat that is solidly constructed, sails well and a helmsman in it,
be brought to the bank to carry this hero across!"_END

B_2_C_50_21
BEGIN_
विष्णुपादच्युताम् दिव्यामपापाम् पापनाशिनीम् |
ताम् शङ्करजटाजूटाद्भ्रष्टाम् सागरतेजसा || २-५०-२५
समुद्रमहीषीम् गङ्गाम् सारसक्रौञ्चनादिताम् |
आससाद महाबाहुः शृङ्गिबेरपुरम् प्रति || २-५०-२६_END
BEGIN_
Rama, the mighty armed, reached the river Ganga, which is devoid of sins and which
dispels all sins, which had fallen from the mass of matted hair of Lord Shankara through the
spiritual power of Emperor Bhagiratha, which is rendered noisy by cranes and herons, which is a
consort of the ocean and which is in the vicinity of Sringaverapura(the modern Singraur)._END

B_2_C_51_17
BEGIN_
अतिक्रान्तम् अतिक्रान्तम् अनवाप्य मनोरथम् |
राज्ये रामम् अनिक्षिप्य पिता मे विनशिष्यति || २-५१-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Having failed to install Rama in the kingdom, failed forever, which was the most
cherished wish of his heart, my father will leave this world._END

B_2_C_52_6
BEGIN_
तम् निशम्य समादेशम् गुहामात्यगणो महान् |
उपोह्य रुचिराम् नावम् गुहाय प्रत्यवेदयत् || २-५२-७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that command, the chief minister of King Guha brought a charming boat to the
bank and reported the matter to Guha._END

B_2_C_50_22
BEGIN_
ताम् ऊर्मि कलिल आवर्ताम् अन्ववेक्ष्य महा रथः |
सुमन्त्रम् अब्रवीत् सूतम् इह एव अद्य वसामहे || २-५०-२७_END
BEGIN_
Beholding the river Ganga with its waves covering whirlpools, Rama the great warrior
said to Sumantra the charioteer as follows: "We shall halt here itself today."_END

B_2_C_51_18
BEGIN_
सिद्ध अर्थाः पितरम् वृत्तम् तस्मिन् काले हि उपस्थिते |
प्रेत कार्येषु सर्वेषु संस्करिष्यन्ति भूमिपम् || २-५१-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Those who are fortunate will consecrate our deceased father and the king in the
course of all funeral rites, when the hour has struck._END

B_2_C_52_7
BEGIN_
ततः सप्राञ्जलिर्भूत्वा गुहो राघवमब्रवीत् |
उपस्थितेयम् नौर्देव भूयः किम् करवाणि ते || २-५२-८_END
BEGIN_
Then, Guha with folded hands spoke to Rama as follows: "Oh, Lord! Here, the boat has
arrived. What more can I do for you?"_END

B_2_C_50_23
BEGIN_
अविदूरात् अयम् नद्या बहु पुष्प प्रवालवान् |
सुमहान् इन्गुदी वृक्षो वसामः अत्र एव सारथे || २-५०-२८_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, charioteer! Not far from the river stands this very large sacred fig tree with
its many flowers and shoots. We shall stay here itself."_END

B_2_C_51_19
BEGIN_
रम्य चत्वर संस्थानाम् सुविभक्त महा पथाम् |
हर्म्य प्रसाद सम्पन्नाम् गणिका वर शोभिताम् || २-५१-२१
रथ अश्व गज सम्बाधाम् तूर्य नाद विनादिताम् |
सर्व कल्याण सम्पूर्णाम् हृष्ट पुष्ट जन आकुलाम् || २-५१-२२
आराम उद्यान सम्पन्नाम् समाज उत्सव शालिनीम् |
सुखिता विचरिष्यन्ति राज धानीम् पितुर् मम || २-५१-२३_END
BEGIN_
People will joyfully move in the capital belonging to my father and the city with
its quadrangular places allocated at lovely sites, and well- aligned roads, rich in mansions of
well-to-do men, temples and royal palaces adorned with the foremost of courtesans, its chariots
horses and elephants that obstruct the roads, the musical instruments that resound there- full of
all blessings and crowded with merry and well fed men, well- provided with gardens and royal parks
and bright with festivities carried on under the patronage of associations._END

B_2_C_53_0
BEGIN_
स तम् वृक्षम् समासाद्य संध्याम् अन्वास्य पश्चिमाम् |
रामः रमयताम् श्रेष्ठैति ह उवाच लक्ष्मणम् || २-५३-१_END
BEGIN_
Rama, the foremost of those affording happiness to others, reached the aforesaid
tree, worshipped the western twilight and spoke to Lakshmana as follows:_END

B_2_C_52_8
BEGIN_
तवामरसुतप्रख्य तर्तुम् सागरगाम् नदीम् |
नौरियम् पुरुषव्याग्र! ताम् त्वमारोह सुव्रत! || २-५२-९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, tiger among men! Oh, Rama resembling a son of divinity! Here is the boat for
you to cross the river, which flows into the sea. Oh, virtuous one! (Pray) get into it."_END

B_2_C_50_24
BEGIN_
द्रक्ष्यामः सरिताम् श्रेष्ठाम् सम्मान्यसलिलाम् शिवाम् |
देवदानवगन्धर्वमृगमानुषपक्षिणाम् || २-५०-२९_END
BEGIN_
"I shall see (from here) the excellent river Ganga, which is auspicious and whose
waters deserve to be respected by gods, men, Gandharvas, beasts, reptiles and birds ."_END

B_2_C_51_20
BEGIN_
अपि जीवेद्धशरथो वनवासात्पुनर्वयम् |
प्रत्यागम्य महात्मानमपि पश्येम सुव्रतम् || २-५१-२४_END
BEGIN_
Will Dasaratha remain alive? After returning from exile, can we see the high-soled
king Dasaratha of noble vows again?_END

B_2_C_53_1
BEGIN_
अद्य इयम् प्रथमा रात्रिर् याता जन पदात् बहिः |
या सुमन्त्रेण रहिता ताम् न उत्कण्ठितुम् अर्हसि || २-५३-२_END
BEGIN_
"This might which has got past us today outside the inhabited territory is the first
night which has passed without Sumantra. You ought not repent over it."_END

B_2_C_52_9
BEGIN_
अथोवाच महातेजा रामो गुहमिदम् वचः |
कृतकामोऽस्मि भवता शीघ्रमारोप्यतामिति || २-५२-१०_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama with great splendor, spoke to Guha as follows: "My desire has been
accomplished by you. Let us embark with all speed."_END

B_2_C_50_25
BEGIN_
लक्षणः च सुमन्त्रः च बाढम् इति एव राघवम् |
उक्त्वा तम् इन्गुदी वृक्षम् तदा उपययतुर् हयैः || २-५०-३०_END
BEGIN_
Saying �so be it' and nothing more to Rama, Lakshmana and Sumantra too then directed
the horses to that sacred fig tree._END

B_2_C_51_21
BEGIN_
अपि सत्य प्रतिज्ञेन सार्धम् कुशलिना वयम् |
निवृत्ते वन वासे अस्मिन्न् अयोध्याम् प्रविशेमहि || २-५१-२५_END
BEGIN_
Can we safely return to Ayodhya, after completion of the exile in the forest along
with Rama who is faithful to his promises?_END

B_2_C_53_2
BEGIN_
जागर्तव्यम् अतन्द्रिभ्याम् अद्य प्रभृति रात्रिषु |
योग क्षेमः हि सीताया वर्तते लक्ष्मण आवयोह् || २-५३-३_END
BEGIN_
"Remaining free from lassitude, we must both keep awake during nights, from today
Lakshmana! The safety and welfare of Sita indeed depend on us two."_END

B_2_C_52_10
BEGIN_
ततः कलापान् सम्नह्य खड्गौ बद्ध्वा च धन्विनौ |
जग्मतुर् येन तौ गन्गाम् सीतया सह राघवौ || २-५२-११_END
BEGIN_
Having equipped themselves with a quiver each with arrows, fastening their swords
and armed with their bows, Rama and Lakshmana, with Sita, proceeded towards the river of Ganga._END

B_2_C_50_26
BEGIN_
रामः अभियाय तम् रम्यम् वृक्षम् इक्ष्वाकु नन्दनः |
रथात् अवातरत् तस्मात् सभार्यः सह लक्ष्मणः || २-५०-३१_END
BEGIN_
Rama, the delight of Ikshvaku dynasty, reached that beautiful tree and got down from
the chariot along with Sita and Lakshmana._END

B_2_C_51_22
BEGIN_
परिदेवयमानस्य दुह्ख आर्तस्य महात्मनः |
तिष्ठतः राज पुत्रस्य शर्वरी सा अत्यवर्तत || २-५१-२६_END
BEGIN_
While the high-soled Lakshmana thus lamenting, stood on ground, afflicted with
anguish as he was, that night rolled away._END

B_2_C_53_3
BEGIN_
रात्रिम् कथंचित् एव इमाम् सौमित्रे वर्तयामहे |
उपावर्तामहे भूमाव् आस्तीर्य स्वयम् आर्जितैः || २-५३-४_END
BEGIN_
"Let us pass this night anyhow, Lakshmana! Let us lie down on the ground, covering
it by straw, leaves and so on, procured by our own hands."_END

B_2_C_52_11
BEGIN_
रामम् एव तु धर्मज्ञम् उपगम्य विनीतवत् |
किम् अहम् करवाणि इति सूतः प्रान्जलिर् अब्रवीत् || २-५२-१२_END
BEGIN_
Sumantra joining his palms in humility, approached Rama who knew what is right and
said, "What shall I do?"_END

B_2_C_50_27
BEGIN_
सुमन्त्रः अपि अवतीर्य एव मोचयित्वा हय उत्तमान् |
वृक्ष मूल गतम् रामम् उपतस्थे कृत अन्जलिः || २-५०-३२_END
BEGIN_
Sumantra too dismounted from the chariot, unyoked the superb horses after which with
joined palms, he seated himself near Rama at the foot of the tree._END

B_2_C_51_23
BEGIN_
तथा हि सत्यम् ब्रुवति प्रजा हिते |
नर इन्द्र पुत्रे गुरु सौहृदात् गुहः |
मुमोच बाष्पम् व्यसन अभिपीडितः |
ज्वरा आतुरः नागैव व्यथा आतुरः || २-५१-२७_END
BEGIN_
While Lakshmana (son of Dasaratha), who was concerned with the welfare of the
people; was thus speaking the truth out of his affection for his elder brother (Rama), Guha,
overcome with agony and oppressed with adversity shed tears like an elephant tormented with
fever._END

B_2_C_53_4
BEGIN_
स तु सम्विश्य मेदिन्याम् महा अर्ह शयन उचितः |
इमाः सौमित्रये रामः व्याजहार कथाः शुभाः || २-५३-५_END
BEGIN_
Streching himself on the bare ground, Rama, who was accustomed to a luxurious coach,
uttered the following suitable words to Lakshmana:_END

B_2_C_50_28
BEGIN_
तत्र राजा गुहो नाम रामस्य आत्म समः सखा |
निषाद जात्यो बलवान् स्थपतिः च इति विश्रुतः || २-५०-३३_END
BEGIN_
There, a king named Guha was Rama's friend dear to him as his own life. He was
Nishada by birth, a strong man and well known as a ruler of Nishadas._END

B_2_C_52_12
BEGIN_
ततोऽब्रवीद्दाशरथिः सुमन्त्रम् |
स्पृशन् करेणोत्तमदक्षिणेन |
सुमन्त्र शीघ्रम् पुनरेव याहि |
राज्ञः सकाशे भवचाप्रमत्तः || २-५२-१३_END
BEGIN_
Touching Sumantra with his auspicious right hand, Rama then said: "Oh, Sumantra!
Return quickly to the king's presence and be attentive in serving him."_END

B_2_C_53_5
BEGIN_
ध्रुवम् अद्य महा राजो दुह्खम् स्वपिति लक्ष्मण |
कृत कामा तु कैकेयी तुष्टा भवितुम् अर्हति || २-५३-६_END
BEGIN_
"Assuredly the emperor is sleeping badly tonight, while Kaikeyi, having realized her
ambitions, ought to feel satisfied."_END

B_2_C_50_29
BEGIN_
स श्रुत्वा पुरुष व्याघ्रम् रामम् विषयम् आगतम् |
वृद्धैः परिवृतः अमात्यैः ज्ञातिभिः च अपि उपागतः || २-५०-३४_END
BEGIN_
