Hearing of Rama the tiger among men having come to his territory, he approached the
prince, escorted by elderly ministers and relatives._END

B_2_C_52_13
BEGIN_
निवर्तस्व इति उवाच एनम् एतावद्द् हि कृतम् मम |
रथम् विहाय पद्भ्याम् तु गमिष्यामि महावनम् || २-५२-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Go now, that your service to me has been completed. Abandoning the chariot, I shall
go on foot to the mighty forest," Rama said._END

B_2_C_53_6
BEGIN_
सा हि देवी महा राजम् कैकेयी राज्य कारणात् |
अपि न च्यावयेत् प्राणान् दृष्ट्वा भरतम् आगतम् || २-५३-७_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing Bharata returned, queen Kaikeyi, I am afraid, may not expel the lives of the
emperor for the sake of kingdom."_END

B_2_C_50_30
BEGIN_
ततः निषाद अधिपतिम् दृष्ट्वा दूरात् अवस्थितम् |
सह सौमित्रिणा रामः समागच्चद् गुहेन सः || २-५०-३५_END
BEGIN_
Seeing from a distance the king of Nishada coming, Rama along with Lakshmana
thereupon went forth to meet Guha._END

B_2_C_52_14
BEGIN_
आत्मानम् तु अभ्यनुज्ञातम् अवेक्ष्य आर्तः स सारथिः |
सुमन्त्रः पुरुष व्याघ्रम् ऐक्ष्वाकम् इदम् अब्रवीत् || २-५२-१५_END
BEGIN_
Finding himself dismissed, Sumantra the charioteer was distressed and spoke to Rama,
the tiger among men, as follows:_END

B_2_C_53_7
BEGIN_
अनाथः चैव वृद्धः च मया चैव विनाकृतः |
किम् करिष्यति काम आत्मा कैकेय्या वशम् आगतः || २-५३-८_END
BEGIN_
"Aged and (therefore) helpless, deprived of my presence, what will he do, dominated
as he is by his passion for Kaikeyi and who has fallen into the clutches of Kaikeyi."_END

B_2_C_52_15
BEGIN_
न अतिक्रान्तम् इदम् लोके पुरुषेण इह केनचित् |
तव सभ्रातृ भार्यस्य वासः प्राकृतवद् वने || २-५२-१६_END
BEGIN_
"None in the world has had to suffer such a fate as yourself; that you should have
to dwell in the forest with your brother and your consort as if you were an ordinary man!"_END

B_2_C_50_31
BEGIN_
तम् आर्तः सम्परिष्वज्य गुहो राघवम् अब्रवीत् |
यथा अयोध्या तथा इदम् ते राम किम् करवाणि ते || २-५०-३६
ईदृशम् हि महाबाहो कः प्रप्स्यत्यतिथिम् प्रियम् |_END
BEGIN_
Closely embracing Rama, Guha who felt disturbed, spoke to him, "This city too is as
much as Ayodhya to you. What can I do for you? Oh mighty armed! Who indeed will get such a lovely
guest?"_END

B_2_C_53_8
BEGIN_
इदम् व्यसनम् आलोक्य राज्ञः च मति विभ्रमम् |
कामएव अर्ध धर्माभ्याम् गरीयान् इति मे मतिः || २-५३-९_END
BEGIN_
"Reflecting on this misfortune of the king and his mental derangement, I deem that
passion alone is greater than early gain and religious merit."_END

B_2_C_52_16
BEGIN_
न मन्ये ब्रह्म चर्ये अस्ति स्वधीते वा फल उदयः |
मार्दव आर्जवयोः वा अपि त्वाम् चेद् व्यसनम् आगतम् || २-५२-१७_END
BEGIN_
"I think that there is no reward in leading a life of religious student or in
studying religious scriptures or even in cultivating tenderness and straight forwardness, when
adversity has come to you."_END

B_2_C_50_32
BEGIN_
ततः गुणवद् अन्न अद्यम् उपादाय पृथग् विधम् |
अर्घ्यम् च उपानयत् क्षिप्रम् वाक्यम् च इदम् उवाच ह || २-५०-३७_END
BEGIN_
Having brought pristine cooked rice of excellent quality and other dishes of various
kinds, he then quickly offered him water to wash his hands and spoke as follows:_END

B_2_C_53_9
BEGIN_
को हि अविद्वान् अपि पुमान् प्रमदायाः कृते त्यजेत् |
चन्द अनुवर्तिनम् पुत्रम् तातः माम् इव लक्ष्मण || २-५३-१०_END
BEGIN_
"what man however deluded, what father on account of a woman, at his own will and
pleasure, abandon a son like myself?_END

B_2_C_52_17
BEGIN_
सह राघव वैदेह्या भ्रात्रा चैव वने वसन् |
त्वम् गतिम् प्राप्स्यसे वीर त्रीम्ल् लोकांस् तु जयन्न् इव || २-५२-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, heroic Rama! Living in the forest along with Sita and your brother, you will
obtain the same position as one who has conquered the three worlds."_END

B_2_C_50_33
BEGIN_
स्वागतम् ते महा बाहो तव इयम् अखिला मही |
वयम् प्रेष्या भवान् भर्ता साधु राज्यम् प्रशाधि नः || २-५०-३८_END
BEGIN_
"Welcome to you, Oh, mighty armed! All this land is yours. We are your servants. You
are the Lord. Rule over our kingdom in an efficient way."_END

B_2_C_53_10
BEGIN_
सुखी बत सभार्यः च भरतः केकयी सुतः |
मुदितान् कोसलान् एको यो भोक्ष्यति अधिराजवत् || २-५३-११_END
BEGIN_
"Alas, Kaikeyi's son Bharata (alone) is happy along with his wife. Like an overlord,
he is going to enjoy the prosperous kingdom of Kosala."_END

B_2_C_52_18
BEGIN_
वयम् खलु हता राम ये तया अपि उपवन्चिताः |
कैकेय्या वशम् एष्यामः पापाया दुह्ख भागिनः || २-५२-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! We are actually ruined, in that, disappointed in our hopes by you too, we
shall fall under the sway of Kaikeyi the sinful woman and reap the suffering."_END

B_2_C_50_34
BEGIN_
भक्ष्यम् भोज्यम् च पेयम् च लेह्यम् च इदम् उपस्थितम् |
शयनानि च मुख्यानि वाजिनाम् खादनम् च ते || २-५०-३९_END
BEGIN_
"Here have arrived various kinds of dishes, drinks and syrups as also excellent beds
(for you to sleep on) and food for your horses"_END

B_2_C_53_11
BEGIN_
स हि सर्वस्य राज्यस्य मुखम् एकम् भविष्यति |
ताते च वयसा अतीते मयि च अरण्यम् आश्रिते || २-५३-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Father is superannuated. I am staying in the forest. Bharata will become the prime
head for the entire kingdom."_END

B_2_C_50_35
BEGIN_
गुहम् एव ब्रुवाणम् तम् राघवः प्रत्युवाच ह || २-५०-४०
अर्चिताः चैव हृष्टाः च भवता सर्वथा वयम् |
पद्भ्याम् अभिगमाच् चैव स्नेह संदर्शनेन च || २-५०-४१_END
BEGIN_
To Guha who was speaking as aforesaid, Rama replied thus: "We stand honored by you,
by your very visit to us on foot, as well as your show of affection and are pleased with you"_END

B_2_C_52_19
BEGIN_
इति ब्रुवन्न् आत्म समम् सुमन्त्रः सारथिस् तदा |
दृष्ट्वा दुर गतम् रामम् दुह्ख आर्तः रुरुदे चिरम् || २-५२-२०_END
BEGIN_
Sumantra the charioteer thus speaking, wept for a long time, stricken with grief,
seeing Rama, equal to his soul, departing to a distance._END

B_2_C_53_12
BEGIN_
अर्थ धर्मौ परित्यज्य यः कामम् अनुवर्तते |
एवम् आपद्यते क्षिप्रम् राजा दशरथो यथा || २-५३-१३_END
BEGIN_
"He who pursues sensuous pleasures neglecting his real interests and discipline soon
comes to distress; in the same way as king Dasaratha has."_END

B_2_C_50_36
BEGIN_
भुजाभ्याम् साधु वृत्ताभ्याम् पीडयन् वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् |
दिष्ट्या त्वाम् गुह पश्यामिअरोगम् सह बान्धवैः || २-५०-४२
अपि ते कूशलम् राष्ट्रे मित्रेषु च धनेषु च |_END
BEGIN_
Pressing gently with his muscular arms, Rama spoke these words: " Oh, Guha! Thank
heaven that I am seeing you in good health with your relatives. Is all well with the kingdom, the
allies and the treasure?"_END

B_2_C_52_20
BEGIN_
ततः तु विगते बाष्पे सूतम् स्पृष्ट उदकम् शुचिम् |
रामः तु मधुरम् वाक्यम् पुनः पुनर् उवाच तम् || २-५२-२१_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama again and again spoke these sweet words as follows to that charioteer,
whose tears got dried up and who had sipped some water and got himself purified:_END

B_2_C_53_13
BEGIN_
मन्ये दशरथ अन्ताय मम प्रव्राजनाय च |
कैकेयी सौम्य सम्प्राप्ता राज्याय भरतस्य च || २-५३-१४_END
BEGIN_
"It seems that Kaikeyi came into our house, oh good brother, to bring about an end
to Dasaratha, to send me into exile and to secure kingship for Bharata."_END

B_2_C_50_37
BEGIN_
यत् तु इदम् भवता किंचित् प्रीत्या समुपकल्पितम् |
सर्वम् तत् अनुजानामि न हि वर्ते प्रतिग्रहे || २-५०-४३_END
BEGIN_
"I know your affection by which all this is extensively well arranged by you. But I
am not in a position indeed to accept it."_END

B_2_C_52_21
BEGIN_
इक्ष्वाकूणाम् त्वया तुल्यम् सुहृदम् न उपलक्षये |
यथा दशरथो राजा माम् न शोचेत् तथा कुरु || २-५२-२२_END
BEGIN_
"I do not see any one who is as great a friend of the Ikshvakus as you are. (Pray)
act in such a way that king Dasaratha may not lament about me"_END

B_2_C_54_0
BEGIN_
ते तु तस्मिन् महा वृक्षौषित्वा रजनीम् शिवाम् |
विमले अभ्युदिते सूर्ये तस्मात् देशात् प्रतस्थिरे || २-५४-१_END
BEGIN_
Having spent the beautiful night under the big tree, Rama, Seetha and Lakshmana
started from that place when the immaculate sun had risen._END

B_2_C_53_14
BEGIN_
अपि इदानीम् न कैकेयी सौभाग्य मद मोहिता |
कौसल्याम् च सुमित्राम् च सम्प्रबाधेत मत् कृते || २-५३-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Blinded by pride of good fortune, Kaikeyi may even now persecute Kausalya and
Sumitra because of their relationship with me."_END

B_2_C_50_38
BEGIN_
कुश चीर अजिन धरम् फल मूल अशनम् च माम् |
विद्धि प्रणिहितम् धर्मे तापसम् वन गोचरम् || २-५०-४४_END
BEGIN_
"Know me as under a vow to be an ascetic, wearing the robes of bark and deerskin and
by piety, I am determined to live in the forest by eating roots and fruits only."_END

B_2_C_52_22
BEGIN_
शोक उपहत चेताः च वृद्धः च जगती पतिः |
काम भार अवसन्नः च तस्मात् एतत् ब्रवीमि ते || २-५२-२३_END
BEGIN_
"The king, his mind afflicted with grief, is aged as well. He is pressed down by a
burden of passion. Hence, I tell you this."_END

B_2_C_54_1
BEGIN_
यत्र भागीरथी गन्गा यमुनाम् अभिवर्तते |
जग्मुस् तम् देशम् उद्दिश्य विगाह्य सुमहद् वनम् || २-५४-२
ते भूमिम् आगान् विविधान् देशामः च अपि मनो रमान् |
अदृष्ट पूर्वान् पश्यन्तः तत्र तत्र यशस्विनः || २-५४-३_END
BEGIN_
Having penetrated into a deep forest, they the illustrious trios, while seeing many
stretches of land and at some places, attractive scenery never seen before, proceeded in the
direction of that region where river Yamuna was flowing forth towards river Ganga, associated with
the name of Emperor Bhagiratha._END

B_2_C_53_15
BEGIN_
मा स्म मत् कारणात् देवी सुमित्रा दुह्खम् आवसेत् |
अयोध्याम् इतएव त्वम् काले प्रविश लक्ष्मण || २-५३-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Queen Sumitra is likely to suffer hardship because of her affinity to us. From this
very place, you proceed to Ayodhya next morning, oh, Lakshmana!"_END

B_2_C_50_39
BEGIN_
अश्वानाम् खादनेन अहम् अर्थी न अन्येन केनचित् |
एतावता अत्र भवता भविष्यामि सुपूजितः || २-५०-४५_END
BEGIN_
"I desire nothing but a little forage for the horses. By being provided with this
much at the present moment, I shall be duly satisfied by you."_END

B_2_C_52_23
BEGIN_
यद् यद् आज्ञापयेत् किंचित् स महात्मा मही पतिः |
कैकेय्याः प्रिय काम अर्थम् कार्यम् तत् अविकान्क्षया || २-५२-२४_END
BEGIN_
"What so ever act that high-soled emperor may enjoin you to do, with intent to
oblige the desire of Kaikeyi, it is to be done unhesitatingly."_END

B_2_C_54_2
BEGIN_
यथा क्षेमेण गच्चन् स पश्यमः च विविधान् द्रुमान् |
निवृत्त मात्रे दिवसे रामः सौमित्रिम् अब्रवीत् || २-५४-४_END
BEGIN_
Observing various trees while walking at ease, Rama spoke to Lakshmana (as follows)
when the day had just receded._END

B_2_C_53_16
BEGIN_
अहम् एको गमिष्यामि सीतया सह दण्डकान् |
अनाथाया हि नाथः त्वम् कौसल्याया भविष्यसि || २-५३-१७_END
BEGIN_
"I shall proceed to Dandaka forest alone with Sita, while you will be the protector
for Kausalya, who has no defender."_END

B_2_C_50_40
BEGIN_
एते हि दयिता राज्ञः पितुर् दशरथस्य मे |
एतैः सुविहितैः अश्वैः भविष्याम्य् अहम् अर्चितः || २-५०-४६_END
BEGIN_
"These horses were cherished by the king Dasaratha, my father. I shall feel honored
by these horses being duly fed."_END

B_2_C_52_24
BEGIN_
एतत् अर्थम् हि राज्यानि प्रशासति नर ईश्वराः |
यद् एषाम् सर्व कृत्येषु मनो न प्रतिहन्यते || २-५२-२५_END
BEGIN_
"The kings indeed rule the states with this end in view that their will may not be
frustrated in any undertaking."_END

B_2_C_54_3
BEGIN_
प्रयागम् अभितः पश्य सौमित्रे धूमम् उन्नतम् |
अग्नेर् भगवतः केतुम् मन्ये सम्निहितः मुनिः || २-५४-५_END
BEGIN_
"Perceive, Oh Lakshmana, the smoke looking prominent as a sign of the glorious god
of fire near Prayaga (the confluence of the holy Ganga and Yamuna rivers). I think that sage
Bharadwaja is staying nearby."_END

B_2_C_53_17
BEGIN_
क्षुद्र कर्मा हि कैकेयी द्वेषात् अन्याय्यम् आचरेत् |
परिदद्या हि धर्मज्ञे भरते मम मातरम् || २-५३-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Kaikeyi of base deeds may resort to unjustified means to be disliked. Give (for
protection) my mother to Bharata, oh virtuous Prince!"_END

B_2_C_52_25
BEGIN_
यद्यथा स महा राजो न अलीकम् अधिगच्चति |
न च ताम्यति दुह्खेन सुमन्त्र कुरु तत् तथा || २-५२-२६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Sumantra! Carry out everything in such a way that the said emperor neither
finds it unpleasing nor gets tormented by grief."_END

B_2_C_50_41
BEGIN_
अश्वानाम् प्रतिपानम् च खादनम् चैव सो अन्वशात् |
गुहः तत्र एव पुरुषांस् त्वरितम् दीयताम् इति || २-५०-४७_END
BEGIN_
Then Guha on that spot commanded his men as follows: "Let water for drinking and
forage be supplied promptly to horses"_END

B_2_C_54_4
BEGIN_
नूनम् प्राप्ताः स्म सम्भेदम् गन्गा यमुनयोः वयम् |
तथा हि श्रूयते शम्ब्दो वारिणा वारि घट्टितः || २-५४-६_END
BEGIN_
"We have certainly reached the confluence of rivers Ganga and Yamuna. Yes, the noise
produced by clashing of waters is heard."_END

B_2_C_55_0
BEGIN_
उषित्वा रजनीम् तत्र राजपुत्रावरिंदमौ |
महर्षिमभिवाद्याथ जग्मतुस्तम् गिरिम् प्रति || २-५५-१_END
BEGIN_
Having stayed that night there, those princes the annihilators of enemies,
thereafter offered salutation to the sage Bharadwaja and proceeded towards that mountain of
Chitrakuta._END

B_2_C_53_18
BEGIN_
नूनम् जाति अन्तरे कस्मिंस् स्त्रियः पुत्रैः वियोजिताः |
जनन्या मम सौमित्रे तत् अपि एतत् उपस्थितम् || २-५३-१९_END
BEGIN_
"In some other (past) birth, women must have been deprived of their sons by my
mother (Kausalya), oh, Lakshmana! For that reason this has arisen certainly."_END

B_2_C_52_26
BEGIN_
अदृष्ट दुह्खम् राजानम् वृद्धम् आर्यम् जित इन्द्रियम् |
ब्रूयाः त्वम् अभिवाद्य एव मम हेतोर् इदम् वचः || २-५२-२७_END
BEGIN_
"Only after performing respectful salutation to the old and venerable king, who has
never known suffering and who has subdued his senses, you tell these words to him on my
behalf."_END

B_2_C_50_42
BEGIN_
ततः चीर उत्तर आसन्गः संध्याम् अन्वास्य पश्चिमाम् |
जलम् एव आददे भोज्यम् लक्ष्मणेन आहृतम् स्वयम् || २-५०-४८_END
BEGIN_
Having worshipped the evening twilight appearing in the west, with an upper garment
made of bark(on his person); Rama then took for food only water brought by Lakshmana himself._END

B_2_C_54_5
BEGIN_
दारूणि परिभिन्नानि वनजैः उपजीविभिः |
भरद्वाज आश्रमे च एते दृश्यन्ते विविधा द्रुमाः || २-५४-७_END
BEGIN_
"Pieces of timber split up by men who are dependent upon forest-products, as also
these trees of various kinds are seen in the hermitage of Bharadwaja."_END

B_2_C_55_1
BEGIN_
तेषाम् चैव स्वस्त्ययनम् महर्षिः स चकार ह |
प्रस्थितांश्चैव तान् प्रेक्ष्यपिता पुत्रानिवान्वगात् || २-५५-२_END
BEGIN_
That great sage Bharadwaja performed a religious rite ensuring a sage journey
(scattering boiled rice on the ground and invoking blessing through the repetition of certain
sacred texts0 for them. Perceiving them setting out for the journey, the sage accompanied them for
a distance, as a father would do for his sons (and daughter-in-law)._END

B_2_C_53_19
BEGIN_
मया हि चिर पुष्टेन दुह्ख सम्वर्धितेन च |
विप्रायुज्यत कौसल्या फल काले धिग् अस्तु माम् || २-५३-२०_END
BEGIN_
"At a time when Kausalya should have obtained benefits for her labors repaid by me,
she has been deprived of my company by me, who was nurtured by her for a long time and brought up
with great pains. Woe to me."_END

B_2_C_52_27
BEGIN_
न एव अहम् अनुशोचामि लक्ष्मणो न च मैथिली |
अयोध्यायाः च्युताः च इति वने वत्स्यामह इति वा (महेति!)|| २-५२-२८_END
BEGIN_
"Indeed neither I nor Lakshmana and Sita grieve for having moved from Ayodhya or
that we are going to dwell in a forest."_END

B_2_C_50_43
BEGIN_
तस्य भूमौ शयानस्य पादौ प्रक्षाल्य लक्ष्मणः |
सभार्यस्य ततः अभ्येत्य तस्थौ वृष्कम् उपाश्रितः || २-५०-४९_END
BEGIN_
Having washed the feet of Rama who was lying on the ground along with his consort,
Lakshmana then came and stood near a tree._END

B_2_C_54_6
BEGIN_
धन्विनौ तौ सुखम् गत्वा लम्बमाने दिवा करे |
गन्गा यमुनयोह् संधौ प्रापतुर् निलयम् मुनेः || २-५४-८_END
BEGIN_
Having walked comfortably, Rama and Lakshmana wielding their bows, reached the abode
of the sage Bhardwaja, near the confluence of rivers Ganga and Yamuna, while the Sun was falling to
the west._END

B_2_C_55_2
BEGIN_
ततः प्रचक्रमे वक्तुम् वचनम् स महामुनिः |
भर्द्वाजो महातेजा रामम् सत्यपराक्रमम् || २-५५-३_END
BEGIN_
Bharadwaja the great sage with a remarkable splendour began to speak the following
words to Rama the truly brave man._END

B_2_C_53_20
BEGIN_
मा स्म सीमन्तिनी काचिज् जनयेत् पुत्रम् ईदृशम् |
सौमित्रे यो अहम् अम्बाया दद्मि शोकम् अनन्तकम् || २-५३-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Let no woman ever give birth to such a son as myself, who have caused perpetual
grief to my mother, oh, Lakshmana!"_END

B_2_C_52_28
BEGIN_
चतुर् दशसु वर्षेषु निवृत्तेषु पुनः पुनः |
लक्ष्मणम् माम् च सीताम् च द्रक्ष्यसि क्षिप्रम् आगतान् || २-५२-२९_END
BEGIN_
"After completing fourteen years, you will once more see Lakshmana, myself and Sita
too returned apace from the forest."_END

B_2_C_50_44
BEGIN_
गुहो अपि सह सूतेन सौमित्रिम् अनुभाषयन् |
अन्वजाग्रत् ततः रामम् अप्रमत्तः धनुर् धरः || २-५०-५०_END
BEGIN_
Guha too along with the charioteer conversed with Lakshmana and thereafter wielding
a bow; alertly kept a vigil over Rama._END

B_2_C_54_7
BEGIN_
रामः तु आश्रमम् आसाद्य त्रासयन् मृग पक्षिणः |
गत्वा मुहूर्तम् अध्वानम् भरद्वाजम् उपागमत् || २-५४-९_END
BEGIN_
Having reached the hermitage and scaring the beasts and birds (by his very
appearance as a bowman) and having proceeded on the intervening path for a while, Rama approached
the vicinity of Bharadwaja._END

B_2_C_55_3
BEGIN_
गङ्गायमुनयोः सन्धिमासाद्य मनुजर्षभौ |
काळिन्दीमनुगच्छेताम् नदीम् पश्चान्मुखाश्रिताम् || २-५५-४_END
BEGIN_
"After approaching Oh, the best of men! The confluence of Ganga and Yamuna, follow
the river Yamuna which takes to the direction of west."_END

B_2_C_53_21
BEGIN_
मन्ये प्रीति विशिष्टा सा मत्तः लक्ष्मण सारिका |
यस्याः तत् श्रूयते वाक्यम् शुक पादम् अरेर् दश || २-५३-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Lakshmana! I think that myna (which is kept as a pet by mother Kausalya) is
more affectionate than I, since her are heard the words, "Bite, oh parrot, the foot of the
enemy."_END

B_2_C_52_29
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्त्वा तु राजानम् मातरम् च सुमन्त्र मे |
अन्याः च देवीः सहिताः कैकेयीम् च पुनः पुनः || २-५२-३०
आरोग्यम् ब्रूहि कौसल्याम् अथ पाद अभिवन्दनम् |
सीताया मम च आर्यस्य वचनाल् लक्ष्मणस्य च || २-५२-३१_END
BEGIN_
"Oh,Sumantra! This is what you should say to the king, my mother, all other queens
and Kaikeyi. Tell Kausalya again and again that I am keeping good health. Thereafter, convey
salutations at her feet on behalf of Sita as well as myself and Lakshmana the faithful man."_END

B_2_C_50_45
BEGIN_
तथा शयानस्य ततः अस्य धीमतः |
यशस्विनो दाशरथेर् महात्मनः |
अदृष्ट दुह्खस्य सुख उचितस्य सा |
तदा व्यतीयाय चिरेण शर्वरी || २-५०-५१_END
BEGIN_
The illustrious, lofty minded and the high-soled son of Dasaratha, who had never
seen suffering and who deserved all comforts, remained lying on the ground thereafter, while that
long night passed away._END

B_2_C_54_8
BEGIN_
ततः तु आश्रमम् आसाद्य मुनेर् दर्शन कान्क्षिणौ |
सीतया अनुगतौ वीरौ दूरात् एव अवतस्थतुः || २-५४-१०_END
BEGIN_
Arriving at the hermitage, the two valiant princes, who wished to see the sage,
accompanied by Seetha, halted at first at some distance off._END

B_2_C_55_4
BEGIN_
अथासाद्य तु काळिन्न्धीम् शीघ्रस्रोतसमापगाम् |
तस्यास्तीर्थम् प्रचरितम् पुराणम् प्रेक्ष्य राघवौ || २-५५-५
तत्र यूयम् प्लवम् कृत्वा तरतांशुमतीम् नदीम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Reaching the River Yamuna belonging to olden times, having a rapid stream and
perceiving in it a passage for descent into the river, which is too much frequented the river,
which is too much frequented, you cross the River Yamuna (the daughter of the sun-god) by preparing
a raft there, Oh Rama!"_END

B_2_C_53_22
BEGIN_
शोचन्त्याः च अल्प भाग्याया न किंचित् उपकुर्वता |
पुर्त्रेण किम् अपुत्राया मया कार्यम् अरिम् दम || २-५३-२३_END
BEGIN_
"What can be done by me, her son, who cannot go to her aid even a little to her, my
mother, who is weeping, who is unfortunate and who has no son, oh conqueror of foes?"_END

B_2_C_52_30
BEGIN_
ब्रूयाः च हि महा राजम् भरतम् क्षिप्रम् आनय |
आगतः च अपि भरतः स्थाप्यो नृप मते पदे || २-५२-३२_END
BEGIN_
"Tell our salutations to the emperor too. Bring Bharata quickly. After his arrival,
Bharata may be installed in the position, as desired by the king."_END

B_2_C_54_9
BEGIN_
स प्रविश्य महात्मानमृषिम् शिष्यगणैर्वऋतम् |
संशितव्रतमेकाग्रम् तपसा लब्धचक्षुषम् || २-५४-११
हुत अग्नि होत्रम् दृष्ट्वा एव महा भागम् कृत अन्जलिः |
रामः सौमित्रिणा सार्धम् सीतया च अभ्यवादयत् || २-५४-१२_END
BEGIN_
Entering the hermitage and beholding the high-souled sage who was austere and
contemplative, his glance sharpened through severe meditation, surrounded by a group of disciples,
who had kindled sacrificial fire, the highly fortunate man as he was, Rama together with Lakshmana
and Seetha greeted him with joined palms._END

B_2_C_55_5
BEGIN_
ततो न्यग्रोधमासाद्य महान्तम् हरितच्छदम् || २-५५-६
विवृद्धम् बहुभिर्वऋक्षैह् श्यामम् सिद्धोपसेवितम् |
तस्मै सीताञ्जलिम् कृत्वा प्रयुञ्जीताशिषः शिवाः || २-५५-७_END
BEGIN_
After crossing the river Yamuna and approaching a large banyan tree named Syama
(dark-green) having green leaves surrounded by many tress and visited by Siddhas, Seetha should,
joining her palms, recite her auspicious prayers to the tree."_END

B_2_C_52_31
BEGIN_
भरतम् च परिष्वज्य यौवराज्ये अभिषिच्य च |
अस्मत् सम्तापजम् दुह्खम् न त्वाम् अभिभविष्यति || २-५२-३३_END
BEGIN_
"When you embrace Bharata and install him in the office of the Prince Regent, the
agony caused by the repentance felt by you on our account will not overpower you."_END

B_2_C_53_23
BEGIN_
अल्प भाग्या हि मे माता कौसल्या रहिता मया |
शेते परम दुह्ख आर्ता पतिता शोक सागरे || २-५३-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Kausalya my mother of poor luck indeed, bereft of me, is stricken with great
melancholy and lies plunged in a sea of grief"_END

B_2_C_54_10
BEGIN_
न्यवेदयत च आत्मानम् तस्मै लक्ष्मण पूर्वजः |
पुत्रौ दशरथस्य आवाम् भगवन् राम लक्ष्मणौ || २-५४-१३_END
BEGIN_
Rama (the elder brother of Lakshmana) introduced himself to the sage as follows: "Oh
venerable sage! We both are Rama and Lakshmana the sons of Dasaratha."_END

B_2_C_55_6
BEGIN_
समासाद्य तु तम् वृक्षम् वसेद्वातिक्रमेत वा |
क्रोशमात्रम् ततो गत्वा नीलम् द्रक्ष्यथ काननम् || २-५५-८
पलाशबदरीमिश्रम् रम्यम् वंशैश्च यामुनैः |_END
BEGIN_
"Having approached that tree, you can stay there or go beyond it. After going only
for two miles from there, you will see a beautiful forest blue in colour with bamboo trees touching
upon Yamuna river and interspersed with Sallaka and jujube trees."_END

B_2_C_52_32
BEGIN_
भरतः च अपि वक्तव्यो यथा राजनि वर्तसे |
तथा मातृषु वर्तेथाः सर्वास्व् एव अविशेषतः || २-५२-३४_END
BEGIN_
"Bharata too is to be told thus: "Treat without distinction all your mothers with
the same regard as you behave towards the king."_END

B_2_C_54_11
BEGIN_
भार्या मम इयम् वैदेही कल्याणी जनक आत्मजा |
माम् च अनुयाता विजनम् तपो वनम् अनिन्दिता || २-५४-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Here is my blessed and irreproachable wife Seetha, daughter of Janaka who has
accompanied me to the lonely forest suitable for religious austerities."_END

B_2_C_53_24
BEGIN_
एको हि अहम् अयोध्याम् च पृथिवीम् च अपि लक्ष्मण |
तरेयम् इषुभिः क्रुद्धो ननु वीर्यम् अकारणम् || २-५३-२५_END
BEGIN_
"Enraged, I can subdue with my arrows single handed not only Ayodhya but also the
earth. But it is not a question of valor here."_END

B_2_C_55_7
BEGIN_
स पन्थाश्चित्रकूटस्य गतः सुबहुशो मया || २-५५-९
रम्ये मार्दवयुक्तश्च वनदावैर्विपर्जितः |_END
BEGIN_
"It is the way to Chitrakuta. I visited that place many times. It is beautiful,
endowed with serenity and free from forest-fire."_END

B_2_C_52_33
BEGIN_
यथा च तव कैकेयी सुमित्रा च अविशेषतः |
तथैव देवी कौसल्या मम माता विशेषतः || २-५२-३५_END
BEGIN_
"As is your affection for Kaikeyi, so let it be for Sumitra and also the divine
Kausalya, my mother"_END

B_2_C_54_12
BEGIN_
पित्रा प्रव्राज्यमानम् माम् सौमित्रिर् अनुजः प्रियः |
अयम् अन्वगमद् भ्राता वनम् एव दृढ व्रतः || २-५४-१५_END
BEGIN_
"While I was being sent to exile by my father, my young and beloved brother
Lakshmana (son of Sumitra) of firm vows has also followed me to the forest."_END

B_2_C_53_25
BEGIN_
अधर्म भय भीतः च पर लोकस्य च अनघ |
तेन लक्ष्मण न अद्य अहम् आत्मानम् अभिषेचये || २-५३-२६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, the sinless Lakshmana! I am terribly concerned of doing wrong and of ruining my
prospects in the other world. Hence, I do not allow myself to be crowned."_END

B_2_C_55_8
BEGIN_
इति पन्थानमावेद्य महर्षः स न्यवर्तत || २-५५-१०
अभिवाद्य तथेत्युक्त्वा रामेण विनिवर्तितः |_END
BEGIN_
Having thus informed the way and ebbing urged by Rama to return after he had paid
obeisance to the sage and Rama having replied �so be it', the great sage Bharadwaja returned._END

B_2_C_52_34
BEGIN_
तातस्य प्रियकामेन यौवराज्यमपेक्षता |
लोकयोरुभयोः शक्यम् त्वया यत्सुखमेधितुम् || २-५२-३६_END
BEGIN_
"If you accept the princely kingdom with an intent to please our father, it will be
possible for you to enhance happiness in both the worlds (in this world and the next)."_END

B_2_C_54_13
BEGIN_
पित्रा नियुक्ता भगवन् प्रवेष्यामः तपो वनम् |
धर्मम् एव आचरिष्यामः तत्र मूल फल अशनाः || २-५४-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Venerable sage! Commanded by our father, we are entering a lonely forest to
practise asceticism, living on roots and fruits."_END

B_2_C_53_26
BEGIN_
एतत् अन्यच् च करुणम् विलप्य विजने बहु |
अश्रु पूर्ण मुखो रामः निशि तूष्णीम् उपाविशत् || २-५३-२७_END
BEGIN_
Rama during the night in that lonely forest, wailed piteously thus and in so many
other ways and sat quite, his face full of tears._END

B_2_C_55_9
BEGIN_
उपावृत्ते मुनौ तस्मिन् रामो लक्ष्मणमब्रवीत् || २-५५-११
कृतपुण्याः स्म सौमित्रे मुनिर्यन्नोऽनुकम्पते |_END
BEGIN_
That sage having returned, Rama spoke to Lakshmana as follows: "Oh Lakshmana! We are
fortunate that the sage has shown compassion towards us."_END

B_2_C_52_35
BEGIN_
निवर्त्यमानो रामेण सुमन्त्रः शोक कर्शितः |
तत् सर्वम् वचनम् श्रुत्वा स्नेहात् काकुत्स्थम् अब्रवीत् || २-५२-३७_END
BEGIN_
Sumantra, who was being sent back by Rama, was agonized with grief after hearing the
whole of that discourse and affectionately spoke to Rama as follows:_END

B_2_C_54_14
BEGIN_
तस्य तत् वचनम् श्रुत्वा राज पुत्रस्य धीमतः |
उपानयत धर्म आत्मा गाम् अर्घ्यम् उदकम् ततः || २-५४-१७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of that virtuous prince (Rama), the pious minded sage Bharadwaja
then offered Madhuparka* as well as water to wash his hands with._END

B_2_C_53_27
BEGIN_
विलप्य उपरतम् रामम् गत अर्चिषम् इव अनलम् |
समुद्रम् इव निर्वेगम् आश्वासयत लक्ष्मणः || २-५३-२८_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana consoled Rama as follows when the later had ceased lamenting like a fire whose flames had gone out and as a sea without a violent motion._END

B_2_C_55_10
BEGIN_
इति तौ पुरुषव्याघ्रौ मन्त्रयित्वा मनस्विनौ || २-५५-१२
सीतामेवाग्रतः कृत्वा काळिन्दीम् जग्मतुर्नदीम् |_END
BEGIN_
Deliberating thus, Rama and Lakshmana the tigers among men who were highly
intelligent, headed for the river Yamuna guarding Seetha still in front._END

B_2_C_52_36
BEGIN_
यद् अहम् न उपचारेण ब्रूयाम् स्नेहात् अविक्लवः |
भक्तिमान् इति तत् तावद् वाक्यम् त्वम् क्षन्तुम् अर्हसि || २-५२-३८_END
BEGIN_
"If I spoke to you fearlessly in a friendly tone without following courteousness,
you ought to forgive my mode of expression, considering me as your devotee"_END

B_2_C_54_15
BEGIN_
नानाविधानन्नरसान् वन्यमूलफलाश्रयान् |
तेभ्यो ददौ तप्ततपा वासम् चैवाभ्यकल्पयत् || २-५४-१८_END
BEGIN_
The sage, who had practiced austerities, gave them various kinds of delicacies
prepared from wild roots and fruits and also arranged accommodation for them._END

B_2_C_53_28
BEGIN_
ध्रुवम् अद्य पुरी रामायोध्या युधिनाम् वर |
निष्प्रभा त्वयि निष्क्रान्ते गत चन्द्रा इव शर्वरी || २-५३-२९_END
BEGIN_
"The city of Ayodhya, now that you have come away from it, has certainly been
divested of its splendor and resembles a night without the moon, Oh, Rama the jewel among armed
warriors!"_END

B_2_C_55_11
BEGIN_
अथा साद्य तु काळिन्दीम् शीघ्रस्रोतोवहाम् नदीम् || २-५५-१३
चिन्तामापेदिरे सर्वे नदीजलतितीर्षवः_END
BEGIN_
Having reached the River Yamuna, running with rapid stream, all of them then plunged
into a thought of how to cross those river-waters._END

B_2_C_54_16
BEGIN_
मृग पक्षिभिर् आसीनो मुनिभिः च समन्ततः |
रामम् आगतम् अभ्यर्च्य स्वागतेन आह तम् मुनिः || २-५४-१९_END
BEGIN_
Honouring with words of welcome, the sage Bharadwaja seated, being surrounded on all
sides with beasts, birds and hermits, spoke thus to Rama._END

B_2_C_52_37
BEGIN_
कथम् हि त्वद् विहीनो अहम् प्रतियास्यामि ताम् पुरीम् |
तव तात वियोगेन पुत्र शोक आकुलाम् इव || २-५२-३९_END
BEGIN_
"How indeed can I return without you to that city, which through separation from
you, has been reduced to the state of a mother stricken with grief due to separation from her
son"_END

B_2_C_53_29
BEGIN_
न एतत् औपयिकम् राम यद् इदम् परितप्यसे |
विषादयसि सीताम् च माम् चैव पुरुष ऋषभ || २-५३-३०_END
BEGIN_
"It is not proper, oh Rama, that you should grieve in this way. You cause distress
to Sita and me too, oh jewel among men!"_END

B_2_C_55_12
BEGIN_
तौ काष्ठसम्घातमथो चक्रतुस्तु महाप्लवम् || २-५५-१४
शुष्कैर्वंशैः समास्तीर्णमुळीरैश्च समावृतम् |_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama and Lakshmana prepared a big raft with pieces of timber fastened
together, covered with a kind of grass and spread over with dry bamboo canes._END

B_2_C_54_17
BEGIN_
प्रतिगृह्य च ताम् अर्चाम् उपविष्टम् स राघवम् |
भरद्वाजो अब्रवीद् वाक्यम् धर्म युक्तम् इदम् तदा || २-५४-२०_END
BEGIN_
Bharadwaja then said these endowed with righteousness to Rama, who had since taken
his seat after accepting the aforesaid hospitality:_END

B_2_C_52_38
BEGIN_
सरामम् अपि तावन् मे रथम् दृष्ट्वा तदा जनः |
विना रामम् रथम् दृष्ट्वा विदीर्येत अपि सा पुरी || २-५२-४०_END
BEGIN_
"By seeing my chariot on that day even with Rama in it, the people were lamenting so
much. Now, if they see the chariot without Rama the city of Ayodhya will even be broken
asunder."_END

B_2_C_53_30
BEGIN_
न च सीता त्वया हीना न च अहम् अपि राघव |
मुहूर्तम् अपि जीवावो जलान् मत्स्याव् इव उद्धृतौ || २-५३-३१_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! Bereft of you , neither Sita nor I will not survive even for a moment,
like fish pulled out of water."_END

B_2_C_56_0
BEGIN_
अथ रात्र्याम् व्यतीतायाम् अवसुप्तम् अनन्तरम् |
प्रबोधयाम् आस शनैः लक्ष्मणम् रघु नन्दनः || २-५६-१_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama gently woke up Lakshmana, who was sleeping without break, even when the
night was passing away._END

B_2_C_55_13
BEGIN_
ततो वेतसशाखाश्च जम्बूशाखाश्च वीर्यवान् || २-५५-१५
चकार लक्ष्मणश्छित्वा सीतायाः सुखमासनम् |_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, the valiant Lakshmana made for Seetha a comfortable seat, after chopping
branches of reeds and of rose apple tree._END

B_2_C_52_39
BEGIN_
दैन्यम् हि नगरी गच्चेद् दृष्ट्वा शून्यम् इमम् रथम् |
सूत अवशेषम् स्वम् सैन्यम् हत वीरम् इव आहवे || २-५२-४१_END
BEGIN_
"The city will be plunged in misery, like an army in which its commander is lost in
a combat with the charioteer alone surviving, on seeing this chariot without you."_END

B_2_C_54_18
BEGIN_
चिरस्य खलु काकुत्स्थ पश्यामि त्वाम् इह आगतम् |
श्रुतम् तव मया च इदम् विवासनम् अकारणम् || २-५४-२१_END
BEGIN_
"In fact, I am seeing you, arriving here after a long time, Oh scion of Kakutstha!
And I have heard of your unjust banishment."_END

B_2_C_53_31
BEGIN_
न हि तातम् न शत्रुघ्नम् न सुमित्राम् परम् तप |
द्रष्टुम् इच्चेयम् अद्य अहम् स्वर्गम् वा अपि त्वया विना || २-५३-३२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama causing pain to the foes! Without you, I do not wish to see either our
father or Satrughna or Sumitra or even the heaven."_END

B_2_C_56_1
BEGIN_
सौमित्रे शृणु वन्यानाम् वल्गु व्याहरताम् स्वनम् |
सम्प्रतिष्ठामहे कालः प्रस्थानस्य परम् तप || २-५६-२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Lakshmana! Hear the sound of wild animals, resounding beautifully. It is time
for our journey. Let us start."_END

B_2_C_55_14
BEGIN_
तत्र श्रियमिवाचिन्त्याम् रामो दाशरथिः प्रियाम् || २-५५-१६
ईष्त्सन्कह्हनाबान् तानग्तारिओअतत् प्लवम् |_END
BEGIN_
Then Rama the son of Dasaratha helped Seetha his beloved consort who was
unimaginable like the goddess of fortune and who was feeling shy a little- to mount the raft._END

B_2_C_52_40
BEGIN_
दूरे अपि निवसन्तम् त्वाम् मानसेन अग्रतः स्थितम् |
चिन्तयन्त्यो अद्य नूनम् त्वाम् निराहाराः कृताः प्रजाः || २-५२-४२_END
BEGIN_
"Thinking of you, who though residing far away are established foremost in their
minds, the people of Ayodhya must have been deprived of their food today."_END

B_2_C_54_19
BEGIN_
अवकाशो विविक्तः अयम् महा नद्योह् समागमे |
पुण्यः च रमणीयः च वसतु इह भगान् सुखम् || २-५४-२२_END
BEGIN_
"This holy place at the confluence of the two rivers is secluded and delightful. You
stay here comfortably."_END

B_2_C_53_32
BEGIN_
ततस्तत्र सुखासीने नातिदूरे निरीक्ष्य ताम् |
न्यग्रोधे सुकृताम् शय्याम् भेजाते धर्मवत्सलौ || २-५३-३३_END
BEGIN_
Then Rama and Lakshmana the lovers of piety, sitting comfortably there and on seeing
a bed well- prepared under a banyan tree, sought for the bed._END

B_2_C_56_2
BEGIN_
स सुप्तः समये भ्रात्रा लक्ष्मणः प्रतिबोधितः |
जहौ निद्राम् च तन्द्रीम् च प्रसक्तम् च पथि श्रमम् || २-५६-३_END
BEGIN_
That Lakshmana who was sleeping, being woken up by his brother at the right moment,
had relinquished sleep, sloth and strain which resulted on the way._END

B_2_C_55_15
BEGIN_
पार्श्वे च तत्र वैदेह्या वसने चूष्णानि च || २-५५-१७
प्लवे कठिनकाजम् च रामश्चक्रे सहायुधैः |_END
BEGIN_
Rama kept the two robes the jewellery, a shovel and a basket by the side of Seetha
in the raft there, along with weapons._END

B_2_C_52_41
BEGIN_
दृष्टं तद्धि त्वया राम! यादृशम् त्वत्प्रवासने |
प्रजानाम् सम्कुलम् वृत्तम् त्वच्छोकक्लान्तचेतसाम् || २-५२-४३_END
BEGIN_
"The great perplexity that ensued, on the occasion of your exile, among the people
(of Ayodhya), whose minds were depressed through grief on your account, was witnessed by you
indeed, Oh, Rama!"_END

B_2_C_54_20
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्तः तु वचनम् भरद्वाजेन राघवः |
प्रत्युवाच शुभम् वाक्यम् रामः सर्व हिते रतः || २-५४-२३_END
BEGIN_
Addressed in these words by Bharadwaja, Rama, born in Raghu dynasty, for his part,
interested in the welfare of all, replied in the following pleasant words._END

B_2_C_53_33
BEGIN_
स लक्ष्मणस्य उत्तम पुष्कलम् वचो |
निशम्य च एवम् वन वासम् आदरात् |
समाः समस्ता विदधे परम् तपः |
प्रपद्य धर्मम् सुचिराय राघवः || २-५३-३४_END
BEGIN_
Attentively hearing Lakshmana's words which were excellent and wholistic and
adopting for a fairly long period the course of conduct prescribed for hermits, Rama resolved to
spend all the fourteen years in exile with Lakshmana._END

B_2_C_56_3
BEGIN_
ततौत्थाय ते सर्वे स्पृष्ट्वा नद्याः शिवम् जलम् |
पन्थानम् ऋषिणा उद्दिष्टम् चित्र कूटस्य तम् ययुः || २-५६-४_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, all of them raised up touched the auspicious water (took bath) in the
river and proceeded towards the path leading to Chitrakuta mountain, as suggested by the sage
Bharadwaja._END

B_2_C_55_16
BEGIN_
आरोप्य प्रथमम् सीताम् सम्घाटम् प्रतिगृह्य तौ || २-५५-१८
ततः प्रतेरतुर्य त्तौ वीरौ दशरथात्मजौ |_END
BEGIN_
Those valiant sons of Dasaratha firmly held that raft, firstly helped Seetha to
ascend it and then ferried across the river watchfully._END

B_2_C_52_42
BEGIN_
आर्त नादो हि यः पौरैः मुक्तः तत् विप्रवासने |
रथस्थम् माम् निशाम्य एव कुर्युः शत गुणम् ततः || २-५२-४४_END
BEGIN_
"The cry of distress raised by the citizens (of Ayodhya) will be increased a
hundred-fold, when they see me with an empty chariot."_END

B_2_C_54_21
BEGIN_
भगवन्न् इताअसन्नः पौर जानपदो जनः |
सुदर्शमिह माम् प्रेक्ष्य मन्येऽह मिममाश्रमम् || २-५४-२४
आगमिष्यति वैदेहीम् माम् च अपि प्रेक्षको जनः |
अनेन कारणेन अहम् इह वासम् न रोचये || २-५४-२५_END
BEGIN_
"The people of the city and the rural folks Oh venerable sir, are nearer to this
place. Finding me easy to see at this place, people keen to see Seetha and myself, I presume, will
make their appearance at this hermitage. For this reason, I do not wish to stay here."_END

B_2_C_53_34
BEGIN_
ततस्तु तस्मिन् विजने वने तदा |
महाबलौ राघववंशवर्धनौ |
न तौ भयम् सम्भ्रममभ्युपेयतु |
र्यथैव सिम्हौ गिरिसानुगोचरौ || २-५३-३५_END
BEGIN_
Thence forward, those two powerful offspring of the Raghu race (Rama and Lakshmana)
never admitted fear or agitation (while dwelling) in that vast and lonely forest any more than a
couple of lions on the slopes of a mountain._END

B_2_C_56_4
BEGIN_
ततः सम्प्रस्थितः काले रामः सौमित्रिणा सह |
सीताम् कमल पत्र अक्षीम् इदम् वचनम् अब्रवीत् || २-५६-५_END
BEGIN_
Rama who set out along with Lakshmana at that dawn, spoke as follows to Seetha whose
eyes looked like lotus leaves._END

B_2_C_55_17
BEGIN_
काळिन्दीमध्यमायाता सीता त्वेनामवन्दत || २-५५-१९
स्वस्ति देवि तरामि त्वाम् पार्येन्मे पतिर्वतम् |
यक्ष्ये त्वाम् गोनहस्रेण सुराघटशतेन च || २-५५-२०
स्वस्ति प्रत्यागते रामे पुरीमिक्ष्वाकुपालिताम् |_END
BEGIN_
Having arrived at the middle of Yamuna river, Seetha offered salutation to the river
and prayed as follows: "Oh, goddess of Yamuna! Adieu! I am crossing you! May my husband complete
his vow! When Rama safely comes back again towards the city of Ayodhya, ruled by Ikshvaku kings I
shall propitiate you by offering a thousand cows and a hundred drinking vessels."_END

B_2_C_54_22
BEGIN_
एक अन्ते पश्य भगवन्न् आश्रम स्थानम् उत्तमम् |
रमते यत्र वैदेही सुख अर्हा जनक आत्मजा || २-५४-२६_END
BEGIN_
"See some excellent Seetha suitable for a hermitage in some lonely place, Oh
venerable sir, where Seetha, the daughter of Janaka, who is worthy of every comfort, may find
delight in it."_END

B_2_C_52_43
BEGIN_
अहम् किम् च अपि वक्ष्यामि देवीम् तव सुतः मया |
नीतः असौ मातुल कुलम् सम्तापम् मा कृथाइति || २-५२-४५_END
BEGIN_
"Further, shall I say to the queen Kausalya as follows: - �Your son, Rama has been
taken by me to the house of his maternal uncle, do not grieve'."_END

B_2_C_56_5
BEGIN_
आदीप्तान् इव वैदेहि सर्वतः पुष्पितान् नगान् |
स्वैः पुष्पैः किंशुकान् पश्य मालिनः शिशिर अत्यये || २-५६-६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Seetha! Behold Kimshuka trees with their diadem of flower blossoming all over,
as if they are blazing up, in this winter."_END

B_2_C_55_18
BEGIN_
काळिन्दीमथ सीता तु याचमाना कृताञ्जलिः || २-५५-२१
तीरमेवाभिसम्प्राप्ता दक्षिणम् वरवर्णिनी |_END
BEGIN_
Seetha of excellent complexion thus praying with joined palms to Yamuna River,
forthwith reached the southern side of the river._END

B_2_C_54_23
BEGIN_
एतत् श्रुत्वा शुभम् वाक्यम् भरद्वाजो महा मुनिः |
राघवस्य ततः वाक्यम् अर्थ ग्राहकम् अब्रवीत् || २-५४-२७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing these auspicious words of Rama, Bharadwaja the great sage then for his part
spoke these suggestive words._END

B_2_C_52_44
BEGIN_
असत्यम् अपि न एव अहम् ब्रूयाम् वचनम् ईदृशम् |
कथम् अप्रियम् एव अहम् ब्रूयाम् सत्यम् इदम् वचः || २-५२-४६_END
BEGIN_
"I cannot tell such words too which are untrue. How can I tell, �I abandoned your
son in the forest', which words are true but unkind?"_END

B_2_C_56_6
BEGIN_
पश्य भल्लातकान् फुल्लान् नरैः अनुपसेवितान् |
फल पत्रैः अवनतान् नूनम् शक्ष्यामि जीवितुम् || २-५६-७_END
BEGIN_
"Look at these Bhallataka (cashew nut) trees, abounding in flowers and bent down
with fruits and leaves, all unplucked by men. We can certainly live here."_END

B_2_C_55_19
BEGIN_
ततः प्लवेनांशुमतीम् शीघ्रगामूर्मिमालिनीम् || २-५५-२२
तीरजैर्बहुभिर्वृक्षैः सम्तेरुर्यमुनाम् नदीम् |_END
BEGIN_
Thus, by the raft, Seetha Rama and lakshmaNa crossed the River Yamuna, which flows
briskly, wreathed with waves, with many trees born on its bank and having rays for it
reflection._END

B_2_C_52_45
BEGIN_
मम तावन् नियोगस्थाः त्वद् बन्धु जन वाहिनः |
कथम् रथम् त्वया हीनम् प्रवक्ष्यन्ति हय उत्तमाः || २-५२-४७_END
BEGIN_
"How will the excellent horses obedient to me, which carried yourself, Sita and
Lakshmana, draw the chariot bereft of you?"_END

B_2_C_56_7
BEGIN_
पश्य द्रोण प्रमाणानि लम्बमानानि लक्ष्मण |
मधूनि मधु कारीभिः सम्भृतानि नगे नगे || २-५६-८_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Lakshmana! Behold in every tree the hanging honey-combs, with sizes of a
water-trough, gathered by honey-bees._END

B_2_C_54_24
BEGIN_
दश क्रोशैतः तात गिरिर् यस्मिन् निवत्स्यसि |
महर्षि सेवितः पुण्यः सर्वतः सुख दर्शनः || २-५४-२८
गो लान्गूल अनुचरितः वानर ऋष्क निषेवितः |
चित्र कूटैति ख्यातः गन्ध मादन सम्निभः || २-५४-२९_END
BEGIN_
"Sixty miles from here, dear son, lies a sacred mountain on which you may takeup
your dwelling, which region is inhabited by great sages, is charming to look at from all sides,
infested by the black species of monkeys with a long tail, haunted by apes and bears, known by the
name of Chitrakuta and which closely resembles Gandha maadana mountain."_END

B_2_C_55_20
BEGIN_
ते तीर्णाः प्लवमुत्सृज्य प्रस्थाय यमुनावनात् || २-५५-२३
श्यामम् न्यग्रोधमासेदुः शीतलम् हरितच्छदम् |_END
BEGIN_
They, who have crossed the river, abandoned the raft and march through the
river-forest of Yamuna and reached a cool banyan tree called Syama having green leaves._END

B_2_C_52_46
BEGIN_
तन्न शक्ष्याम्यहम् गन्तुमयोध्याम् त्वदृतेऽनघ |
वनवासानुयानाय मामनुज्ञातुमर्हसि || २-५२-४८_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, the faultless Rama! For this reason, I cannot go back to Ayodhya. (Pray) permit
me to accompany you to the forest."_END

B_2_C_56_8
BEGIN_
एष क्रोशति नत्यूहः तम् शिखी प्रतिकूजति |
रमणीये वन उद्देशे पुष्प संस्तर सम्कटे || २-५६-९_END
BEGIN_
In this beautiful forest-region, dense with a scattered mass of flowers, a Chataka
bird is crying and a peacock is responding to it."_END

B_2_C_54_25
BEGIN_
यावता चित्र कूटस्य नरः शृन्गाणि अवेक्षते |
कल्याणानि समाधत्ते न पापे कुरुते मनः || २-५४-३०_END
BEGIN_
"As long as a man observes the peaks of Chitrakuta mountain, he will perform
virtuous deeds and will never set his mind on a sin."_END

B_2_C_55_21
BEGIN_
न्य्ग्रोधम् तमुपागम्य वैदेहि वाक्यमब्रवीत् || २-५५-२४
नमस्तेऽन्तु महावृक्ष पारयेन्मे पतिर्वतम् |
कौसल्याम् चैव पश्येयम् सुमित्राम् च यशस्विनीम् || २-५५-२५
इति सीताञ्जलिम् कृत्वा पर्यगच्छद्वनस्पतिम् |_END
BEGIN_
Having approached that banyan tree, Seetha spoke these words, "Oh, great tree!
Obeisance to you! Let my husband complete his vow! Let me see again Kausalya and the illustrious
Sumitra." Thus speaking, Seetha circumambulated that tree with joined palms._END

B_2_C_56_9
BEGIN_
मातम्ग यूथ अनुसृतम् पक्षि सम्घ अनुनादितम् |
चित्र कूटम् इमम् पश्य प्रवृद्ध शिखरम् गिरिम् || २-५६-१०_END
BEGIN_
"See this Chitrakuta mountain with a high and mighty peak, wide-spread with a
multitude of elephants and made to resound by a congregation of birds."_END

B_2_C_52_47
BEGIN_
यदि मे याचमानस्य त्यागम् एव करिष्यसि |
सरथो अग्निम् प्रवेक्ष्यामि त्यक्त मात्रैह त्वया || २-५२-४९_END
BEGIN_
"If you leave me even though I solicit you to take me with you, I shall enter a fire
with chariot and all, here itself the moment I am forsaken by you"_END

B_2_C_54_26
BEGIN_
ऋषयः तत्र बहवो विहृत्य शरदाम् शतम् |
तपसा दिवम् आरूधाः कपाल शिरसा सह || २-५४-३१_END
BEGIN_
"On that mountain, many sages having spent hundred years in austerities as though in
sport , ascended to heaven, duly attaining their final emancipation."_END

B_2_C_55_22
BEGIN_
अवलोक्य ततः सीतामायाचन्तीमनिन्दिताम् || २-५५-२६
दयिताम् च विधेयम् च रामो लक्ष्मणमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the irreproachable Seetha, who was beloved and obedient to him thus praying,
Rama spoke to Lakshmana as follows:_END

B_2_C_56_10
BEGIN_
समभूमितले रम्ये द्रुमैर्बहुभिरावृते |
पुण्ये रंस्यामहे तात चित्रकूटस्य कानने || २-५६-११_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, brother! We shall sport in this forest of Chitrakuta, having a level-ground
beautifully extensive with many trees and is pure."_END

B_2_C_57_0
BEGIN_
कथयित्वा सुदुह्ख आर्तः सुमन्त्रेण चिरम् सह |
रामे दक्षिण कूलस्थे जगाम स्व गृहम् गुहः || २-५७-१_END
BEGIN_
While Rama landed upon the southern shore, Guha conversed for a long time with
Sumantra and with much distress, went to his house._END

B_2_C_52_48
BEGIN_
भविष्यन्ति वने यानि तपो विघ्न कराणि ते |
रथेन प्रतिबाधिष्ये तानि सत्त्वानि राघव || २-५२-५०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! With the help of the chariot, I shall ward off those animals in the
forest, which create obstacles to your austerities."_END

B_2_C_54_27
BEGIN_
प्रविविक्तम् अहम् मन्ये तम् वासम् भवतः सुखम् |
इह वा वन वासाय वस राम मया सह || २-५४-३२_END
BEGIN_
"I consider that mountain to be a very lonely and comfortable place for you to live
in. Orelse stay with m here itself, during the period of your exile, Oh Rama!"_END

B_2_C_55_23
BEGIN_
सीतामादाय गच्छ त्वमग्रतो भरतानुज || २-५५-२७
पृष्ठतोऽहम् गमिष्यामि सायुधो द्विपदाम् वर |_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Lakshmana, the excellent of men! You take Seetha and proceed in the front. I,
along with weapons, will follow you behind."_END

B_2_C_57_1
BEGIN_
भरद्वाजाभिगमनम् प्रयागे च सहासनम् |
आगिरेर्गमनम् तेषाम् तत्रस्थैरभिलक्षितम् || २-५७-२_END
BEGIN_
It was gathered by those who were there (Guha and others) about Seetha, Rama and
Lakshmana coming to sage Bharadwaja, their staying with him in Prayaga and their departure to
Chitrakuta Mountain._END

B_2_C_52_49
BEGIN_
तत् कृतेन मया प्राप्तम् रथ चर्या कृतम् सुखम् |
आशंसे त्वत् कृतेन अहम् वन वास कृतम् सुखम् || २-५२-५१_END
BEGIN_
"The pleasure of driving your chariot has been obtained by me because of you and it
is through you that I seek the happiness that comes in dwelling in a forest."_END

B_2_C_56_11
BEGIN_
ततः तौ पाद चारेण गच्चन्तौ सह सीतया |
रम्यम् आसेदतुः शैलम् चित्र कूटम् मनो रमम् || २-५६-१२_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, Rama and Lakshmana along with Seetha traveling on foot, approached the
mountain of Chitrakuta, which was pleasant and lovely._END

B_2_C_54_28
BEGIN_
स रामम् सर्व कामैअः तम् भरद्वाजः प्रिय अतिथिम् |
सभार्यम् सह च भ्रात्रा प्रतिजग्राह धर्मवित् || २-५४-३३_END
BEGIN_
The pious sage Bharadwaja fulfilled all desires of Rama; who was his beloved guest
and who was accompanied by his consort, Seetha and his brother, Lakshmana._END

B_2_C_55_24
BEGIN_
यद्यत्फलम् प्रार्थयते पुष्पम् वा जनकात्मजा || २-५५-२८
तत्तत्प्रदद्या वैदेह्या यत्रास्य रमते मनः |_END
BEGIN_
"Give to Seetha whatever fruit or flower she desires it and wherever this Seetha's
mind finds delight."_END

B_2_C_52_50
BEGIN_
प्रसीद इच्चामि ते अरण्ये भवितुम् प्रत्यनन्तरः |
प्रीत्या अभिहितम् इच्चामि भव मे पत्यनन्तरः || २-५२-५२_END
BEGIN_
"Be graceful. I desire to become your close associate in the forest. I wish to hear
your loving assent with the words �be my close associate!"_END

B_2_C_57_2
BEGIN_
अनुज्ञातः सुमन्त्रः अथ योजयित्वा हय उत्तमान् |
अयोध्याम् एव नगरीम् प्रययौ गाढ दुर्मनाः || २-५७-३_END
BEGIN_
Sumantra, being allowed to depart by Rama, tied excellent horses to the chariot and
with intense anguish, rode towards the very city of Ayodhya._END

B_2_C_56_12
BEGIN_
तम् तु पर्वतम् आसाद्य नाना पक्षि गण आयुतम् |
बहुमूलफलम् रम्यम् सम्पन्नम् सरसोदकम् || २-५६-१३_END
BEGIN_
Reaching that mountain, with various flocks of birds, with many roots and fruits,
lovely and rich in streaming water, Rama said to Lakshmana as follows:_END

B_2_C_54_29
BEGIN_
तस्य प्रयागे रामस्य तम् महर्षिम् उपेयुषः |
प्रपन्ना रजनी पुण्या चित्राः कथयतः कथाः || २-५४-३४_END
BEGIN_
While Rama, having approached that great sage at Prayaga(the confluence of Ganga and
Yamuna), was discoursing on various topics, the auspicious night arrived._END

B_2_C_55_25
BEGIN_
गच्चतोस्तु तयोर्मध्ये बभूव जनकात्मजा || २-५५-२९
मातङ्गयोर्मद्यगता शुभा नागवधूरिव |_END
BEGIN_
Seetha who was walking in the middle of both of them was like an auspicious female
elephant in the middle of two elephants._END

B_2_C_52_51
BEGIN_
इमे चापि हया वीर यदि ते वनवासिनः |
परिचर्याम् करिष्यन्ति प्राप्स्यन्ति परमाम् गतिम् || २-५२-५३_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, hero! If these horses too can render service to you, they can attain a supreme
abode."_END

B_2_C_57_3
BEGIN_
स वनानि सुगन्धीनि सरितः च सरांसि च |
पश्यन्न् अतिययौ शीघ्रम् ग्रामाणि नगराणि च || २-५७-४_END
BEGIN_
Sumantra, seeing the sweet-smelling woods, rivers, lakes, villages and towns on the
way, soon crossed them._END

B_2_C_56_13
BEGIN_
मनोज्ज़्नोऽयम् तिरिः सौम्य नानाद्रुमलतायतह् |
बहुमूलफलो रम्यः स्वाजीवः प्रतिभाति मे || २-५६-१४_END
BEGIN_
"It is appearing to me that this beautiful Chitrakuta mountain yields an easy
sustenance, for, it is charmingly filled with various kinds of trees and creepers with different
kinds of roots and fruits."_END

B_2_C_54_30
BEGIN_
सीतातृतीय काकुत्स्थह् परिश्रान्तः सुखोचितः |
भरद्वाजाश्रमे रम्ये ताम् रात्रि मवस्त्सुखम् || २-५४-३५_END
BEGIN_
Greatly fatigued, Rama(Scion of Kakutstha) accompanied by Seetha as the third
(Lakshmana being the second) who was accustmed to all comforts, happily spent that night at the
lovely hermitage of Bharadwaja._END

B_2_C_55_26
BEGIN_
एकैकम् पादपम् गुल्मम् लताम् वा पुष्पशालिनीम् || २-५५-३०
अदृष्टपूर्वाम् पश्यन्ती रामम् पप्रच्छ साऽबला |_END
BEGIN_
That Seetha asked Rama whenever she saw the one or the other tree or a bush or a
creeper shining with flowers which was not seen earlier._END

B_2_C_52_52
BEGIN_
तव शुश्रूषणम् मूर्ध्ना करिष्यामि वने वसन् |
अयोध्याम् देव लोकम् वा सर्वथा प्रजहाम्य् अहम् || २-५२-५४_END
BEGIN_
-"By all means, I am leaving for good, Ayodhya or even heaven. Dwelling in the
forest, with my head bent low, I shall render service to you."_END

B_2_C_57_4
BEGIN_
ततः साय अह्न समये तृतीये अहनि सारथिः |
अयोध्याम् समनुप्राप्य निरानन्दाम् ददर्श ह || २-५७-५_END
BEGIN_
Reaching Ayodhya in the evening time of the third day Sumantra saw that city,
joyless._END

B_2_C_56_14
BEGIN_
मनयश्च महात्मानो वसन्त्य शिलोच्चये |
अयम् वासो भवेत् तावद् अत्र सौम्य रमेमहि || २-५६-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, gentle brother! High souled sages are also staying on this mountain. Let this
become the dwelling. Let us have a pleasant resort here."_END

B_2_C_54_31
BEGIN_
प्रभातायाम् रजन्याम् तु भरद्वाजम् उपागमत् |
उवाच नर शार्दूलो मुनिम् ज्वलित तेजसम् || २-५४-३६_END
BEGIN_
When the night was gleaming into a dawn, Rama the lion among men approached the sage
Bharadwaja, who was gleaming with resplendence and spoke as follows:_END

B_2_C_55_27
BEGIN_
रमणीयान् बहुविधान् पादपान् कुसुमोत्कटान् || २-५५-३१
सीतावचनसम्रब्द अनयामास लक्स्मणः |_END
BEGIN_
Duly grasping Seetha's words; Lakshmana brought to her many kinds of beautiful twigs
of trees, full of flowers._END

B_2_C_57_5
BEGIN_
स शून्याम् इव निह्शब्दाम् दृष्ट्वा परम दुर्मनाः |
सुमन्त्रः चिन्तयाम् आस शोक वेग समाहतः || २-५७-६_END
BEGIN_
Beholding Ayodhya as if deserted in silence, Sumantra becoming very much distressed
in mind and having afflicted with intense anguish, surmised as follows:_END

B_2_C_52_53
BEGIN_
न हि शक्या प्रवेष्टुम् सा मया अयोध्या त्वया विना |
राज धानी महा इन्द्रस्य यथा दुष्कृत कर्मणा || २-५२-५५_END
BEGIN_
"As a doer of wicked deeds cannot enter Amaravati, the capital of Devendra, so also
I cannot enter Ayodhya without you."_END

B_2_C_56_15
BEGIN_
इति सीता च रामश्च लक्ष्मणश्च कृताञ्जलिः |
अभिगम्याश्रमम् सर्वे वाल्मीकि मभिवादयन् || २-५६-१६_END
BEGIN_
After deciding thus Seetha, Rama and Lakshmana all with joined palms approached the
hermitage and offered salutation to the sage Valmiki._END

B_2_C_54_32
BEGIN_
शर्वरीम् भवनन्न् अद्य सत्य शील तव आश्रमे |
उषिताः स्म इह वसतिम् अनुजानातु नो भवान् || २-५४-३७_END
BEGIN_
"We have lodged in your hermitage tonight, Oh venerable sir! (Pray) you give us
permission for fixing our residence now, Oh sage practicing truthfulness !"_END

B_2_C_55_28
BEGIN_
विचित्रवालुकजलाम् हससारसनादिताम् || २-५५-३२
रेमे जनकराजस्य तदा प्रेक्ष्य सुता नदीम् |_END
BEGIN_
Then Seetha the daughter of King Janaka was please to see the River Yamuna with
wonderful sands and waters re-echoing to the cry of swans and cranes._END

B_2_C_57_6
BEGIN_
कच्चिन् न सगजा साश्वा सजना सजन अधिपा |
राम सम्ताप दुह्खेन दग्धा शोक अग्निना पुरी || २-५७-७_END
BEGIN_
"I hope the city of Ayodhya with its elephants, horses, people and the kings was not
burnt away by a fire of sorrow and blazing grief towards Rama._END

B_2_C_52_54
BEGIN_
वन वासे क्षयम् प्राप्ते मम एष हि मनो रथः |
यद् अनेन रथेन एव त्वाम् वहेयम् पुरीम् पुनः || २-५२-५६_END
BEGIN_
"This is indeed my desire that after reaching the end of your exile, I may take you
back to the city of Ayodhya in this very chariot."_END

B_2_C_56_16
BEGIN_
तान्महर्षिः प्रमुदितः पूजयामास धर्मवित् |
आस्यतामिति चोवाच स्वागतम् तु निवेद्य च || २-५६-१७_END
BEGIN_
The great sage Valmiki, who knew what is right, full of delight, treated them with
honour, offered cordial welcome and requested them to sit._END

B_2_C_54_33
BEGIN_
रात्र्याम् तु तस्याम् व्युष्टायाम् भरद्वाजो अब्रवीद् इदम् |
मधु मूल फल उपेतम् चित्र कूटम् व्रज इति ह || २-५४-३८_END
BEGIN_
That night having come to an end, Bharadwaja replied for his part, as follows:
"Proced to Chitrakuta, rich in honey, tubers and fruits."_END

B_2_C_55_29
BEGIN_
क्रोशमात्रम् ततो गत्वा भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मनौ || २-५५-३३
बहून्मेध्यान् मृगान् हत्वा चेरतुर्यमुनावने |_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter having travelled only a couple of miles the two brothers Rama and
Lakshmana killed many consecrated deer and ate in the river-forest of Yamuna._END

B_2_C_57_7
BEGIN_
इति चिन्ता परः सूतः वाजिभिः श्रीघ्रपातिभिः |
नगरद्वारमासाद्य त्वरितः प्रविवेश ह || २-५७-८_END
BEGIN_
Sumantra, thus lost in thought, reaching the city-gate through the fast-running
horses, entered the city quickly._END

B_2_C_52_55
BEGIN_
चतुर् दश हि वर्षाणि सहितस्य त्वया वने |
क्षण भूतानि यास्यन्ति शतशः तु ततः अन्यथा || २-५२-५७_END
BEGIN_
"So long as I am with you together in the forest, fourteen years will slip away
momentarily. Otherwise than this, they will multiply a hundred- fold."_END

B_2_C_56_17
BEGIN_
ततोऽब्रवीन्महाबाहुर्लकमणम् लक्ष्मणाग्रजः |
सम्निवेद्य यथान्याय मात्मानमृष्ये प्रभुः || २-५६-१८_END
BEGIN_
Then Rama, the lord with mighty arms, in accord with tradition, reported to the
ascetic all that concerned them and spoke to Lakshmana as follows:_END

B_2_C_54_34
BEGIN_
वासमौपयिकम् मन्ये तव राम महाबल |
नानानगगणोपेतः किन्नरोरगसेवितह् || २-५४-३९
मयूरनादाभिरुतो गजराजनिषेवितः |
गम्यताम् भवता शैलश्चित्रकूटः स विश्रुतः || २-५४-४०
पुण्यश्च रमणीयश्च बहुमूलफलायुतः |_END
BEGIN_
"I consider the abode of Chitrakuta as the right place for you to stay, Oh Rama,
possessed of great strength! You set off for that well-known, sacred and lovely mountain,
Chitrakuta which is adoned with clusters of trees of every description, frequented by Kinnaras and
Nagas, is rendered charming by the cried of peacocks and infested with lordly elephants and
bountiful with tubers and fruits."_END

B_2_C_55_30
BEGIN_
विहृत्य ते बर्हिणपूगनादिते |
शुभे वने वानरवारणायुते |
समम् नदीवप्रमुपेत्य सम्मतम् |
निवासमाजग्मु रदीनदर्शनाः || || २-५५-३४_END
BEGIN_
Having strolled in the charming forest, mad noisy by a number of peacocks and which
was inhabited by elephants and monkeys and reaching an agreeable level ground at the bank of the
river wearing an undejected look finally sought for an abode for the night._END

B_2_C_58_0
BEGIN_
प्रत्याश्वस्तः यदा राजा मोहात् प्रत्यागतः पुनः |
थाजुहाव तम् सूतम् राम वृत्त अन्त कारणात् || २-५८-१_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, the king when recovered from loss of consciousness and again returned to
his breath, he called that charioteer for the purpose of getting the report on Rama._END

B_2_C_52_56
BEGIN_
भृत्य वत्सल तिष्ठन्तम् भर्तृ पुत्र गते पथि |
भक्तम् भृत्यम् स्थितम् स्थित्याम् त्वम् न माम् हातुम् अर्हसि || २-५२-५८_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, prince, who are so fond of your dependents! You ought not abandon me, your
devoted servant, established in the path followed by the son of his master and (always)keeping
within bounds."_END

B_2_C_57_8
BEGIN_
सुमन्त्रम् अभियान्तम् तम् शतशो अथ सहस्रशः |
क्व रामैति पृच्चन्तः सूतम् अभ्यद्रवन् नराः || २-५७-९_END
BEGIN_
Meanwhile, seeing Sumantra the charioteer approaching, hundreds and thousands of
people ran towards him asking, "Where is Rama?"_END

B_2_C_56_18
BEGIN_
लक्ष्मण आनय दारूणि दृढानि च वराणि च |
कुरुष्व आवसथम् सौम्य वासे मे अभिरतम् मनः || २-५६-१९_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana, my gentle brother! Bring strong and choicest timber and construct a
dwelling. My mind is fascinated in dwelling here."_END

B_2_C_54_35
BEGIN_
तत्र कुन्जर यूथानि मृग यूथानि च अभितः || २-५४-४१
विचरन्ति वन अन्तेषु तानि द्रक्ष्यसि राघव |_END
BEGIN_
"Since herds of elephants and troops of deer wander all around in the woodlands
there, you will visibly notice them Oh Rama!"_END

B_2_C_52_57
BEGIN_
एवम् बहु विधम् दीनम् याचमानम् पुनः पुनः |
रामः भृत्य अनुकम्पी तु सुमन्त्रम् इदम् अब्रवीत् || २-५२-५९_END
BEGIN_
Rama, who was compassionate towards his dependents, spoke as follows to Sumantra,
who was miserably entreating him again and again in many modes._END

B_2_C_58_1
BEGIN_
तदा सूतो महाराज कृताञ्जलिरुपस्थितः|
राममेव अनुशोचन्तं दुःखशोकसमन्वितम् || २-५८-२
वृद्धम् परम सम्तप्तम् नव ग्रहम् इव द्विपम् |
विनिःश्वसन्तम् ध्यायन्तम् अस्वस्थम् इव कुन्जरम् || २-५८-३_END
BEGIN_
Then, Sumantra, who joined his palms in reverence, approached the monarch who was
repenting about Rama alone, filled with pain and sorrow, advanced in age, greatly anguished,
sighing like a newly caught elephant and reflecting on something as a sick elephant._END

B_2_C_57_9
BEGIN_
तेषाम् शशंस गङ्गायाम् अहम् आपृच्च्य राघवम् |
अनुज्ञातः निवृत्तः अस्मि धार्मिकेण महात्मना || २-५७-१०_END
BEGIN_
He replied them thus: "Bidding farewell to Rama at the shore of Ganga when sent back
by that virtuous and high-souled Rama, I returned here."_END

B_2_C_56_19
BEGIN_
तस्य तत् वचनम् श्रुत्वा सौमित्रिर् विविधान् द्रुमान् |
आजहार ततः चक्रे पर्ण शालाम् अरिम् दम || २-५६-२०_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of Rama, Lakshmana brought various kinds of trees. Thereafter,
he the annihilator of enemies, constructed a leaf-hut._END

B_2_C_54_36
BEGIN_
सरित्प्रस्रवणप्रस्थान् दरीकन्धरनिर्घरान् || २-५४-४२
चरतः सीतया सार्धम् नन्दिष्यति मनस्तव |_END
BEGIN_
"Roaming about with Seetha, your mind will be delighted to see rivers, cascades,
peaks of mountains, fissures in rocks, caves and rivulets."_END

B_2_C_52_58
BEGIN_
जानामि परमाम् भक्तिम् मयि ते भर्तृ वत्सल |
शृणु च अपि यद् अर्थम् त्वाम् प्रेषयामि पुरीम् इतः || २-५२-६०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, charioteer so fond of your master! I know your excellent devotion to me. Hear
wherefore I send you from here to the city of Ayodhya."_END

B_2_C_58_2
BEGIN_
राजा तु रजसा सूतम् ध्वस्त अङ्गम् समुपस्थितम् |
अश्रु पूर्ण मुखम् दीनम् उवाच परम आर्तवत् || २-५८-४_END
BEGIN_
The king, having great distress, spoke to Sumantra, whose body was covered with
dust, his face filled with tears, who was miserable and who approached near him (as follows):_END

B_2_C_57_10
BEGIN_
ते तीर्णाइति विज्ञाय बाष्प पूर्ण मुखा जनाः |
अहो धिग् इति निश्श्वस्य हा राम इति च चुक्रुशुः || २-५७-११_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that Seetha, Rama and Lakshmana had crossed River Ganga, the people with
their faces filled with tears sighed, "Oh, fie upon us! And cried aloud, "Alas, Rama!"_END

B_2_C_56_20
BEGIN_
ताम् निष्ठताम् बद्धकटाम् दृष्ट्वा रमः सुदर्शनाम् |
शुश्रूषमाणम् एक अग्रम् इदम् वचनम् अब्रवीत् || २-५६-२१_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that hut, which was firmly built and thatched as well as beautiful to look
at, Rama spoke the following words to Lakshmana who listened to his command and who was closely
attentive to him:_END

B_2_C_54_37
BEGIN_
प्रहृष्ट कोयष्टिक कोकिल स्वनैः |
र्विनादितम् तम् वसुधा धरम् शिवम् |
मृगैः च मत्तैः बहुभिः च कुन्जरैः |
सुरम्यम् आसाद्य समावस आश्रमम् || २-५४-४३_END
BEGIN_
"After reaching the auspicious and absolutely beautiful Chitrakuta mountain,
reveberant in all direction with the notes of small white cranes and cucukoo birds as well as with
many kinds of deer and elephants in rut, settle down there in a hermitage."_END

B_2_C_52_59
BEGIN_
नगरीम् त्वाम् गतम् दृष्ट्वा जननी मे यवीयसी |
कैकेयी प्रत्ययम् गच्चेद् इति रामः वनम् गतः || २-५२-६१_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing you, returning to Ayodhya, Kaikeyi, my younger mother will get the proof
that Rama has gone to the forest."_END

B_2_C_58_3
BEGIN_
क्व नु वत्स्यति धर्म आत्मा वृक्ष मूलम् उपाश्रितः |
सो अत्यन्त सुखितः सूत किम् अशिष्यति राघवः || २-५८-५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Sumantra! Where can Rama the virtuous man abide, taking refuge at the root of a
tree? What that Rama, who enjoyed very many pleasantries, can eat now?"_END

B_2_C_57_11
BEGIN_
शुश्राव च वचः तेषाम् बृन्दम् बृन्दम् च तिष्ठताम् |
हताः स्म खलु ये न इह पश्यामैति राघवम् || २-५७-१२_END
BEGIN_
Sumantra also heard the words of those people standing in groups and telling, "Lost
indeed are we, who do not see Rama here!"_END

B_2_C_56_21
BEGIN_
ऐणेयम् मांसम् आहृत्य शालाम् यक्ष्यामहे वयम् |
कर्त्व्यम् वास्तुशमनम् सौमित्रे चिरजीवभिः || २-५६-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Lakshmana! Bring the meat of an antelope. We shall perform a purifactory
ceremony while entering the house. Which is to be done by those who wish to live long."_END

B_2_C_52_60
BEGIN_
परितुष्टा हि सा देवि वन वासम् गते मयि |
राजानम् न अतिशन्केत मिथ्या वादी इति धार्मिकम् || २-५२-६२_END
BEGIN_
"Having completely satisfied, about me having gone to forest, Kaikeyi will leave her
strong suspicion that the virtuous king may be a person who speaks untruth."_END

B_2_C_58_4
BEGIN_
दुःखस्यानुचितो दुःखम् सुमन्त्र शयनोचितः |
भूमि पाल आत्मजो भूमौ शेते कथम् अनाथवत् || २-५८-६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Sumantra! How can Rama the prince, who was habituated to good beds, sleep with
such discomfort on a floor like an orphan?"_END

B_2_C_57_12
BEGIN_
दान यज्ञ विवाहेषु समाजेषु महत्सु च |
न द्रक्ष्यामः पुनर् जातु धार्मिकम् रामम् अन्तरा || २-५७-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Never again can we see the pious Rama on the occasions of bestowing gifts,
sacrificial performances or marriages or in large meetings._END

B_2_C_56_22
BEGIN_
मृगम् हत्वाऽऽनय क्षिप्रम् लक्ष्मणेह शुभेक्षण
कर्तव्यः शास्त्रदृष्टो हि विधिर्दर्ममनुस्मर || २-५६-२३_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, large-eyed Lakshmana! Killing the antelope quickly, bring it here. The
prescribed rite according to scriptural point of view indeed is to be performed. Keep in mind the
sacred obligation."_END

B_2_C_52_61
BEGIN_
एष मे प्रथमः कल्पो यद् अम्बा मे यवीयसी |
भरत आरक्षितम् स्फीतम् पुत्र राज्यम् अवाप्नुयात् || २-५२-६३_END
BEGIN_
"This is my first priority that my younger mother should get the extensive kingdom,
protected by Bharata and thus ruled by her own son."_END

B_2_C_58_5
BEGIN_
यम् यान्तम् अनुयान्ति स्म पदाति रथ कुण्ज़्जराः |
स वत्स्यति कथम् रामः विजनम् वनम् आश्रितः || २-५८-७_END
BEGIN_
"Foot soldiers, Chariots and elephants used to follows whenever Rama was marching
ahead. How such a man can take shelter and stay in a forest devoid of people?"_END

B_2_C_57_13
BEGIN_
किम् समर्थम् जनस्य अस्य किम् प्रियम् किम् सुख आवहम् |
इति रामेण नगरम् पितृवत् परिपालितम् || २-५७-१४_END
BEGIN_
The city of Ayodhya was protected by Rama, as by a father, with due regard to what
was appropriate, what was congenial and what brought happiness to its people._END

B_2_C_56_23
BEGIN_
भ्रातुर्वचन माज्ञाय लक्ष्मणः परवीरहा |
चकार स यथोक्तम् च तम् रामः पुनरब्रवीत् || २-५६-२४_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana the slayer of enemies, understanding his brother's words, acted as
instructed. Rama spoke again to Lakshmana as follows._END

B_2_C_52_62
BEGIN_
मम प्रिय अर्थम् राज्ञः च सरथः त्वम् पुरीम् व्रज |
संदिष्टः च असि या अनर्थांस् तांस् तान् ब्रूयाः तथा तथा || २-५२-६४_END
BEGIN_
"For my pleasure and pleasure of the king, you go along with the chariot to Ayodhya
and inform all the matters that you have been asked to tell each in the way you have been asked to
do."_END

B_2_C_58_6
BEGIN_
व्याळैः मृगैः आचरितम् कृष्ण सर्प निषेवितम् |
कथम् कुमारौ वैदेह्या सार्धम् वनम् उपस्थितौ || २-५८-८_END
BEGIN_
"How Seetha Rama and Lakshmana entered forest filled with wild animals and black
snakes?"_END

B_2_C_57_14
BEGIN_
वात अयन गतानाम् च स्त्रीणाम् अन्वन्तर आपणम् |
राम शोक अभितप्तानाम् शुश्राव परिदेवनम् || २-५७-१५_END
BEGIN_
While driving through bazaars, Sumantra heard the sounds of lamentation of women,
coming forth from windows, consumed by anguish on account of Rama's exile._END

B_2_C_56_24
BEGIN_
इणेयम् श्रपयस्वैतच्च्चालाम् यक्ष्यमहे वयम् |
त्वरसौम्य मुहूर्तोऽयम् ध्रुवश्च दिवसोऽप्ययम् || २-५६-२५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, gentle brother! Boil this antelope's meat. We shall worship the leaf-hut. This
day and this instant also are of a distinctive character. Be quick."_END

B_2_C_52_63
BEGIN_
इति उक्त्वा वचनम् सूतम् सान्त्वयित्वा पुनः पुनः |
गुहम् वचनम् अक्लीबम् रामः हेतुमद् अब्रवीत् || २-५२-६५_END
BEGIN_
Having spoken thus to the charioteer, the courageous Rama consoled him again and
again. Then, he spoke the following reasoned words to Guha:_END

B_2_C_58_7
BEGIN_
सुकुमार्या तपस्विन्या सुमन्त्र सह सीतया |
राज पुत्रौ कथम् पादैः अवरुह्य रथात् गतौ || २-५८-९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Sumantra! How those princes with Seetha the delicate and the poor lady went on
foot, after descending from the chariot?"_END

B_2_C_57_15
BEGIN_
स राज मार्ग मध्येन सुमन्त्रः पिहित आननः |
यत्र राजा दशरथः तत् एव उपययौ गृहम् || २-५७-१६_END
BEGIN_
Going through the middle of the royal highway, Sumantra by covering his face,
reached the house of Dasaratha._END

B_2_C_56_25
BEGIN_
स लक्ष्मणः कृष्ण मृगम् हत्वा मेध्यम् पतापवान् |
अथ चिक्षेप सौमित्रिः समिद्धे जात वेदसि || २-५६-२६_END
BEGIN_
Then, Lakshmana the strong man and son of Sumitra, killing a holy back antelope,
tossed it in an ignited fire._END

B_2_C_52_64
BEGIN_
नेदानीम् गुह योग्योऽयम् वसो मे सजने वने |
अवश्यम् ह्याश्रमे वासह् कर्तव्यस्तद्गतो विधिः || २-५२-६६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Guha! This stay in the inhabited woods is not proper for me. My stay should
definitely be in a hermitage. Let an action diverted towards that aim be taken"_END

B_2_C_58_8
BEGIN_
सिद्ध अर्थः खलु सूत त्वम् येन दृष्टौ मम आत्मजौ |
वन अन्तम् प्रविशन्तौ ताव् अश्विनाव् इव मन्दरम् || २-५८-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Sumantra! You have seen my sons entering the forest, as though divinities of
Aswini had entered the Mountain-range of Mandara. You are indeed lucky."_END

B_2_C_57_16
BEGIN_
सो अवतीर्य रथात् शीघ्रम् राज वेश्म प्रविश्य च |
कक्ष्याः सप्त अभिचक्राम महा जन समाकुलाः || २-५७-१७_END
BEGIN_
Sumantra descended from the chariot, entered quickly the royal palace and traversed
the seven inner apartments of the palace, filled with a large number of people._END

B_2_C_56_26
BEGIN_
तम् तु पक्वम् समाज्ञाय निष्टप्तम् चिन्न शोणितम् |
लक्ष्मणः पुरुष व्याघ्रम् अथ राघवम् अब्रवीत् || २-५६-२७_END
BEGIN_
Feeling certain that it is cooked and heated thoroughly with no blood remaining,
Lakshmana spoke to Rama the lion among man as follows:_END

B_2_C_52_65
BEGIN_
सोऽहम् गृहीत्वा नियमम् तपस्विजनभूषणम् |
हितकामः पितुर्भूयः सीताया लक्ष्मणस्य च || २-५२-६७
जटाः कृत्वा गमिष्यामि न्यग्रोध क्षीरम् आनय |_END
BEGIN_
"I as such, wishing well of my father, Sita as well as Lakshmana and having taken up
a discipline to be followed by ascetics, want to proceed further, wearing matted hair. Please bring
the latex of a banyan tree."_END

B_2_C_58_9
BEGIN_
किम् उवाच वचो रामः किम् उवाच च लक्ष्मणः |
सुमन्त्र वनम् आसाद्य किम् उवाच च मैथिली || २-५८-११_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Sumantra! After reaching the forest, what words did Rama speak? What did
Lakshmana speak? What did Seetha speak?"_END

B_2_C_57_17
BEGIN_
हर्म्यैर्विमानैः प्रासादैरवेक्ष्याथ समागतम् |
हाहाकारकृता नार्यो रामदर्शनकर्शिताः || २-५७-१८_END
BEGIN_
Then, finding the forthcoming Sumantra from their large mansions, from seven-storied
buildings and from royal palaces, the women who had been emaciated in not being able to see Rama,
cried "Alas! Alas"._END

B_2_C_56_27
BEGIN_
अयम् कृष्णः समाप्त अन्गः शृतः कृष्ण मृगो यथा |
देवता देव सम्काश यजस्व कुशलो हि असि || २-५६-२८_END
BEGIN_
"This black antelope, with its complete limbs, has been cooked completely by me. Oh,
Rama resembling God! Worship the concerned deity, as you are skilled in that act."_END

B_2_C_52_66
BEGIN_
तत् क्षीरम् राज पुत्राय गुहः क्षिप्रम् उपाहरत् || २-५२-६८
लक्ष्मणस्य आत्मनः चैव रामः तेन अकरोज् जटाः |_END
BEGIN_
Guha immediately brought that latex to the prince. With that, Rama made matted hair
to himself and to Lakshmana._END

B_2_C_58_10
BEGIN_
आसितम् शयितम् भुक्तम् सूत रामस्य कीर्तय |
जीविष्याम्यहमेतेन ययातिरिव साधुषु || २-५८-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, charioteer! Tell me where Rama sat, slept and took food. By hearing these
things, I shall survive, as Yayati survived in the company of saints."_END

B_2_C_57_18
BEGIN_
आयतैर्विमलैर्नेत्रैरश्रुवेगपरिप्लुतैः |
अन्योन्यमभिवीक्षन्तेऽव्यक्तमार्ततराः स्त्रीयः || २-५७-१९_END
BEGIN_
Those women, extremely confounded with grief with their long and bright eyes filled
with a stream of tears, looked at each other imperceptibly._END

B_2_C_56_28
BEGIN_
रामः स्नात्वा तु नियतः गुणवान् जप्य कोविदः |
सम्ग्रहेणाकरोत्सर्वान् मन्त्रन् सत्रावसानिकान् || २-५६-२९_END
BEGIN_
Rama, the virtuous man and the learned man in chanting of sacred spells, after
taking bath and with subdued mind, briefly chanted all the sacred scripts to be chanted at the end
of a purifactory ceremony._END

B_2_C_52_67
BEGIN_
दीर्घबाहुर्नरव्याघ्रो जटिलत्व मधारयत् || २-५२-६९
तौ तदा चीर वसनौ जटा मण्डल धारिणौ |
अशोभेताम् ऋषि समौ भ्रातरौ राम रक्ष्मणौ || २-५२-७०_END
BEGIN_
Rama, tiger among men who possessed long arms wore the distinguished mark of an
ascetic (in the shape of matted hair) . Then, Rama and Lakshmana the brothers clad in the bark of
trees and wearing a round mass of matted locks (on their head) looked bright like two ascetic
sages._END

B_2_C_58_11
BEGIN_
इति सूतः नर इन्द्रेण चोदितः सज्जमानया |
उवाच वाचा राजानम् स बाष्प परिर्बद्धया || २-५८-१३_END
BEGIN_
As asked thus by the king, Sumantra spoke to the emperor in a voice quivering and
choked with tears (as follows)._END

B_2_C_57_19
BEGIN_
ततः दशरथ स्त्रीणाम् प्रासादेभ्यः ततः ततः |
राम शोक अभितप्तानाम् मन्दम् शुश्राव जल्पितम् || २-५७-२०_END
BEGIN_
Sumantra also heard the feeble conversation of Dasaratha's wives absorbed in anguish
on account of Rama's exile, from their respective inner apartments._END

B_2_C_56_29
BEGIN_
इष्ट्वा देवगणान् सर्वान् विवेशावसथम् शुचिः |
बभूव च मनोह्लादो रामस्यामिततेजसः || २-५६-३०_END
BEGIN_
Worshipping all classes of deities and getting himself purified, Rama entered the
house. There was a heartful joy in rama, with his limitless splendour._END

B_2_C_52_68
BEGIN_
ततः वैखानसम् मार्गम् आस्थितः सह लक्ष्मणः |
व्रतम् आदिष्टवान् रामः सहायम् गुहम् अब्रवीत् || २-५२-७१_END
BEGIN_
Having adopted the way of a hermit (temporarily) along with Lakshmana, Rama then
accepted the vow of an ascetic life and spoke to Guha, his friend as follows:_END

B_2_C_58_12
BEGIN_
अब्रवीन् माम् महा राज धर्मम् एव अनुपालयन् |
अन्जलिम् राघवः कृत्वा शिरसा अभिप्रणम्य च || २-५८-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, emperor! Rama, keeping up the prescribed course of conduct, making salutation
with joined palms and bowing his head in reverence to you, spoke to me as follows:"_END

B_2_C_57_20
BEGIN_
सह रामेण निर्यातः विना रामम् इह आगतः |
सूतः किम् नाम कौसल्याम् शोचन्तीम् प्रति वक्ष्यति || २-५७-२१_END
BEGIN_
"What Sumantra will reply to the lamenting Kausalya, when he now returns here
without Rama while he formerly went out with Rama?"_END

B_2_C_56_30
BEGIN_
वैश्वदेवबलिम् कृत्वा रौद्रम् वैष्णवमेव च |
वास्तुसंशमनीयानि मङ्गळानि प्रवर्तयन् || २-५६-३१
जपम् च न्यायतः कृत्वा स्नात्वा नद्याम् यथाविधि |
पाप संशमनम् रामः चकार बलिम् उत्तमम् || २-५६-३२_END
BEGIN_
Having taken bath in the river as prescribed Rama offered oblations to Lord Rudra
and Lord Vishnu after offereing tributes to Vaisvadeva. He performed benedictions relating to the
purification of house and also a silent prayer as per prescribed rites. He finally offered
excellent tributes to the deities, for removing sins._END

B_2_C_52_69
BEGIN_
अप्रमत्तः बले कोशे दुर्गे जन पदे तथा |
भवेथा गुह राज्यम् हि दुरारक्षतमम् मतम् || २-५२-७२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Guha! Remain vigilant in defense, finance, internal security and public
relations, for a kingdom is the most difficult one to be protected!"_END

B_2_C_58_13
BEGIN_
सूत मद्वचनात् तस्य तातस्य विदित आत्मनः |
शिरसा वन्दनीयस्य वन्द्यौ पादौ महात्मनः || २-५८-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, charioteer! Tell my salutations to my father, the one with a remarkable
intellect, a mighty soul and the one to be respectfully greeted."_END

B_2_C_56_31
BEGIN_
वेदिस्थलविधानानि चैत्यान्यायतनानि च |
आश्रमस्यानुरूपाणि स्थापयामास राघवः || २-५६-३३_END
BEGIN_
Lakshmana erected altars in all the quarters of the hermitage as was fitting,
Chaityas (places for worship of Lord Ganesha and others) and Ayatanas (places for worship of Vishnu
and others)_END

B_2_C_57_21
BEGIN_
यथा च मन्ये दुर्जीवम् एवम् न सुकरम् ध्रुवम् |
आच्चिद्य पुत्रे निर्याते कौसल्या यत्र जीवति || २-५७-२२_END
BEGIN_
"In spite of her son (Rama) having left Ayodhya, Kausalya continues to survive. I
think that surely it is difficult thus to live and it is not so easy to preserve it too!"_END

B_2_C_52_70
BEGIN_
ततः तम् समनुज्ञाय गुहम् इक्ष्वाकु नन्दनः |
जगाम तूर्णम् अव्यग्रः सभार्यः सह लक्ष्मणः || २-५२-७३_END
BEGIN_
Then Rama, who was a delight to Ikshvaku dynasty, bade farewell to Guha and departed
quickly, remaining undistracted, along with his consort and together with Lakshmana._END

B_2_C_58_14
BEGIN_
सर्वम् अन्तः पुरम् वाच्यम् सूत मद्वचनात्त्वया |
आरोग्यम् अविशेषेण यथा अर्हम् च अभिवादनम् || २-५८-१६_END
BEGIN_
Oh, charioteer! Enquire about the health of all the people in the gynaeceum without
any disparity and offer my appropriate salutations to them._END

B_2_C_56_32
BEGIN_
वन्यैर्माल्यैः फलैर्मूलैः पक्वैर्मांसैर्यथाविधि |
अद्भर्जपैश्च वेदोक्तै र्धर्भैश्च ससमित्कुशैः || २-५६-३४
तौ तर्पयित्वा भूतानि राघवौ सह सीतया |
तदा विविशतुः शालाम् सुशुभाम् शुभलक्षणौ || २-५६-३५_END
BEGIN_
Rama and Lakshmana along with Seetha, having auspicious characteristics, satisfied
the sirits by crowns of flowers obtained in the forest, by fruits roots and cooked meat, by water,
by prayers as uttered in the sacred texts (Vedas), by sacred grass, by fuel and Kusa grass and then
entered the auspicious leaf-hut._END

B_2_C_57_22
BEGIN_
सत्य रूपम् तु तत् वाक्यम् राज्ञः स्त्रीणाम् निशामयन् |
प्रदीप्तम् इव शोकेन विवेश सहसा गृहम् || २-५७-२३_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those credible words of Dasaratha's wives, Sumantra all at once entered the
house, that appeared to be set ablaze with grief._END

B_2_C_52_71
BEGIN_
स तु दृष्ट्वा नदी तीरे नावम् इक्ष्वाकु नन्दनः |
तितीर्षुः शीघ्रगाम् गन्गाम् इदम् लक्ष्मणम् अब्रवीत् || २-५२-७४_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the boat on the bank of the river and keen to cross the swift- flowing Ganga,
Rama spoke to Lakshmana as follows: -_END

B_2_C_59_0
BEGIN_
मम तु अश्वा निवृत्तस्य न प्रावर्तन्त वर्त्मनि |
उष्णम् अश्रु विमुन्चन्तः रामे सम्प्रस्थिते वनम् || २-५९-१_END
BEGIN_
"Rama having departed to the forest, horses on the return path however, shedding
warm tears, did not proceed further on the way."_END

B_2_C_58_15
BEGIN_
माता च मम कौसल्या कुशलम् च अभिवादनम् |
अप्रमादम् च वक्तव्या ब्रूयाश्चैमिदम् वचः || २-५८-१७_END
BEGIN_
My mother Kausalya is to be told about my welfare, about my offering salutations to
her and about my meticulousness._END

B_2_C_57_23
BEGIN_
स प्रविश्य अष्टमीम् कक्ष्याम् राजानम् दीनम् आतुलम् |
पुत्र शोक परिम्लानम् अपश्यत् पाण्डुरे गृहे || २-५७-२४_END
BEGIN_
Sumantra entered the eighth inner apartment and saw in that white house, King
Dasaratha the miserable the sick and the exhausted man on account of the exhausted man on account
of the grief for his son._END

B_2_C_56_33
BEGIN_
ताम् वृक्ष पर्णच् चदनाम् मनोज्ञाम् |
यथा प्रदेशम् सुकृताम् निवाताम् |
वासाय सर्वे विविशुः समेताः |
सभाम् यथा देव गणाः सुधर्माम् || २-५६-३६_END
BEGIN_
All of them (Seetha, Rama and Lakshmana) together for residential purpose, entered
that hut, thatched with leaves of trees, looking beautiful, well-constructed at a suitable site and
protected from winds, as if entering an assembly-hall called Sudharma (in heavn) by a group of
celestials._END

B_2_C_52_72
BEGIN_
आरोह त्वम् नर व्याघ्र स्थिताम् नावम् इमाम् शनैः |
सीताम् च आरोपय अन्वक्षम् परिगृह्य मनस्विनीम् || २-५२-७५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Lakshmana the tiger among men! You get into the boat stationed here unhurriedly
afterwards, having helped Sita the virtuous wife step into it."_END

B_2_C_59_1
BEGIN_
उभाभ्याम् राज पुत्राभ्याम् अथ कृत्वा अहम् ज्ञलिम् |
प्रस्थितः रथम् आस्थाय तत् दुह्खम् अपि धारयन् || २-५९-२_END
BEGIN_
"I, on my part, offering salutation with joined palms to both the princes and
keeping back from that grief, ascended the chariot and moved on."_END

B_2_C_58_16
BEGIN_
धर्मनित्या यथाकालमग्न्यगारपरा भव |
देवि देवस्य पादौ च देववत् परिपालय || २-५८-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, godly lady! Be always righteous and be interested in offering worship and
sacrifices as per the prescribed timings in the House of Fire worship. Nurture the feet of the Lord
Dasaratha, like with a god."_END

B_2_C_57_24
BEGIN_
अभिगम्य तम् आसीनम् नर इन्द्रम् अभिवाद्य च |
सुमन्त्रः राम वचनम् यथा उक्तम् प्रत्यवेदयत् || २-५७-२५_END
BEGIN_
Sumantra approached that king who was seated, offered his salutation and presented
Rama's message as told._END

B_2_C_56_34
BEGIN_
अनेक नाना मृग पक्षि सम्कुले |
विचित्र पुष्प स्तबलैः द्रुमैः युते |
वन उत्तमे व्याल मृग अनुनादिते |
तथा विजह्रुः सुसुखम् जित इन्द्रियाः || २-५६-३७_END
BEGIN_
Seetha, Rama and Lakshmana who subdued their senses, very happily strolled in that
excellent forest, filled with many classes and multitude of beasts and birds, trees having
multi-coloured crowns of flowers, and resonating with sounds of elephants in rut and of
antelopes._END

B_2_C_52_73
BEGIN_
स भ्रातुः शासनम् श्रुत्वा सर्वम् अप्रतिकूलयन् |
आरोप्य मैथिलीम् पूर्वम् आरुरोह आत्मवांस् ततः || २-५२-७६_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the command completely of his elder brother, the prudent Lakshmana, by not
counteracting it, made Sita to ascend the boat first and stepped into it afterwards._END

B_2_C_59_2
BEGIN_
गुहा इव सार्धम् तत्र एव स्थितः अस्मि दिवसान् बहून् |
आशया यदि माम् रामः पुनः शब्दापयेद् इति || २-५९-३_END
BEGIN_
"With the hope that I shall be called again by Rama, I stayed there along with Guha
for three days."_END

B_2_C_58_17
BEGIN_
अभिमानम् च मानम् च त्यक्त्वा वर्तस्व मातृषु |
अनु राजान मार्याम् च कैकेयीमम्ब कारय || २-५८-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, mother! Behave towards my other mothers, abandoning self-conceit and
indignation. Make the venerable Kaikeyi, agreeable to the king."_END

B_2_C_57_25
BEGIN_
स तूष्णीम् एव तत् श्रुत्वा राजा विभ्रान्त चेतनः |
मूर्चितः न्यपतत् भूमौ राम शोक अभिपीडितः || २-५७-२६_END
BEGIN_
That king heard silently the message of Rama, was bewildered, afflicted by grief,
for his son, became fainted and fell on the ground._END

B_2_C_52_74
BEGIN_
अथ आरुरोह तेजस्वी स्वयम् लक्ष्मण पूर्वजः |
ततः निषाद अधिपतिर् गुहो ज्ञातीन् अचोदयत् || २-५२-७७_END
BEGIN_
Then, the glorious Rama got into the boat himself. Thereafter, Guha the ruler of
Nishadas commanded his kinsfolk to row them across the river._END

B_2_C_56_35
BEGIN_
सुरम्यम् आसाद्य तु चित्र कूटम् |
नदीम् च ताम् माल्यवतीम् सुतीर्थाम् |
ननन्द हृष्टः मृग पक्षि जुष्टाम् |
जहौ च दुह्खम् पुर विप्रवासात् || २-५६-३८_END
BEGIN_
Delighted and joyful to reach the lovely Chitrakuta mountain and the river
Malyavati, provided with good descents and frequented by birds and beasts, Seetha, Rama and
Lakshmana shed the agony caused by their exile from the City of Ayodhya._END

B_2_C_59_3
BEGIN_
विषये ते महा राज माम व्यसन कर्शिताः |
अपि वृक्षाः परिम्लानः सपुष्प अन्कुर कोरकाः || २-५९-४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, emperor! Even trees in your domain have withered, without giving flowers
sprouts and buds, having emaciated due to Rama's separation."_END

B_2_C_58_18
BEGIN_
कुमारे भरते वृत्तिर्वर्तितव्याच राजवत् |
अर्थज्येष्ठा हि राजानो राजधर्ममनुस्मर || २-५८-२०_END
BEGIN_
"In respect of Bharata your son, follow a respectable behaviour as with a king.
Kings are indeed sovereign in substance. Remember the rules relating to kings."_END

B_2_C_57_26
BEGIN_
ततः अन्तः पुरम् आविद्धम् मूर्चिते पृथिवी पतौ |
उद्धृत्य बाहू चुक्रोश नृपतौ पतिते क्षितौ || २-५७-२७_END
BEGIN_
The king thus having fainted, the gynaeceum was hurt. While the king was falling on
the ground, the inmates of gynaeceum wept, raising their hands in distress._END

B_2_C_52_75
BEGIN_
राघवोऽपि महातेजा नावमारुह्य ताम् ततः |
ब्रह्मवत् क्षत्रवच्चैव जजाप हितमात्मनः || २-५२-७८_END
BEGIN_
After ascending the boat, Rama too of mighty splendor then recited a sacred text
(daiviim naavam etc) fit for brahmanas and Kshatriyas alike and conducive to his own good._END

B_2_C_59_4
BEGIN_
उपतप्तोदका नद्यः पल्वलानि सरांसि च |
परिष्कुपलाशानि वनान्युपवनानि च || २-५९-५_END
BEGIN_
"Rivers, pools and lakes were with hot water. Groves and gardens were with their
leaves, parched up."_END

B_2_C_58_19
BEGIN_
भरतः कुशलम् वाच्यो वाच्यो मद् वचनेन च |
सर्वास्व एव यथा न्यायम् वृत्तिम् वर्तस्व मातृषु || २-५८-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Bharata is to be enquired about his well-being and he is also to be informed as
follows: "Follow good behaviour indeed judiciously towards all your mothers."_END

B_2_C_57_27
BEGIN_
सुमित्रया तु सहिता कौसल्या पतितम् पतिम् |
उत्थापयाम् आस तदा वचनम् च इदम् अब्रवीत् || २-५७-२८_END
BEGIN_
Kausalya along with Sumitra lifted up their husband, who fell on the ground.
Kausalya also spoke these words to Dasaratha._END

B_2_C_52_76
BEGIN_
आचम्य च यथाशास्त्रम् नदीम् ताम् सह सीतया |
प्राणमत्प्रीतिसम्हृष्टो लक्ष्मणश्चामितप्रभः || २-५२-७९_END
BEGIN_
Having sipped water as per scriptures and with extreme delight, Rama with Sita made
obeisance to that river. Lakshmana, of infinite splendor, followed suit._END

B_2_C_59_5
BEGIN_
न च सर्पन्ति सत्त्वानि व्याला न प्रसरन्ति च |
राम शोक अभिभूतम् तन् निष्कूजम् अभवद् वनम् || २-५९-६_END
BEGIN_
"Living beings are not moving. Wild animals too are not roaming around. That forest
became silent, predominated by grief towards Rama."_END

B_2_C_58_20
BEGIN_
वक्तव्यः च महा बाहुर् इक्ष्वाकु कुल नन्दनः |
