पितरम् यौवराज्यस्थो राज्यस्थम् अनुपालय || २-५८-२२_END
BEGIN_
"The mighty armed Bharata the son of Ikshvaku race, is to be told as follows: �Being
installed in the office of Prince Regent, attend to your father who still stays in the
throne'."_END

B_2_C_52_77
BEGIN_
अनुज्ञाय सुमन्त्रम् च सबलम् चैव तम् गुहम् |
आस्थाय नावम् रामः तु चोदयाम् आस नाविकान् || २-५२-८०_END
BEGIN_
Bidding farewell to Guha with his army of men and Sumantra, Rama sat on the boat and
directed the boatmen to move on._END

B_2_C_57_28
BEGIN_
इमम् तस्य महा भाग दूतम् दुष्कर कारिणः |
वन वासात् अनुप्राप्तम् कस्मान् न प्रतिभाषसे || २-५७-२९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, illustrious king! Why are you not speaking to this Rama's messenger who came
from the forest and who has done difficult things?"_END

B_2_C_58_21
BEGIN_
अतिक्रान्तवया राजा मास्मैनम् व्यवरोरुधः |
कुमारराज्ये जीव त्वम् तस्यैवाज्ञ्प्रवर्तनाम् || २-५८-२३_END
BEGIN_
"The king has crossed his age. But do not depose him on that score. By proceeding
according to the orders of the king, you live as a prince."_END

B_2_C_59_6
BEGIN_
लीन पुष्कर पत्राः च नर इन्द्र कलुष उदकाः |
सम्तप्त पद्माः पद्मिन्यो लीन मीन विहम्गमाः || २-५९-७_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, emperor! Lotus-lakes were with lotus-leaves hiding under water pressing
themselves closely together, with muddy waters, with parched lotus-flowers and in which fish and
water fowls have completely disappeared."_END

B_2_C_52_78
BEGIN_
ततः तैः चोदिता सा नौः कर्ण धार समाहिता |
शुभ स्फ्य वेग अभिहता शीघ्रम् सलिलम् अत्यगात् || २-५२-८१_END
BEGIN_
Propelled by those splendid and vigorous oarsmen, that boat furnished with a pilot,
rapidly moved across the water._END

B_2_C_57_29
BEGIN_
अद्य इमम् अनयम् कृत्वा व्यपत्रपसि राघव |
उत्तिष्ठ सुकृतम् ते अस्तु शोके न स्यात् सहायता || २-५७-३०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Dasaratha! After doing an evil act, you are now feeling shameful. Rise up! Let
it be a meritorious act for you. You cannot get a help, when you weep like this."_END

B_2_C_60_0
BEGIN_
ततः भूत उपसृष्टा इव वेपमाना पुनः पुनः |
धरण्याम् गत सत्त्वा इव कौसल्या सूतम् अब्रवीत् || २-६०-१_END
BEGIN_
Then, Kausalya, trembling again and again, as though possessed by a spirit, and
lying on the floor without proper disposition of mind, spoke to Sumantra as follows:_END

B_2_C_59_7
BEGIN_
जलजानि च पुष्पाणि माल्यानि स्थलजानि च |
न अद्य भान्ति अल्प गन्धीनि फलानि च यथा पुरम् || २-५९-८_END
BEGIN_
"Water-born flowers and flowers living on dry lands now give very little fragrance
and fruits do not have a luscious look as before."_END

B_2_C_58_22
BEGIN_
अब्रवीच्चापि माम् भूयो भृशमश्रूणि वर्तयन् |
मातेव मम माता ते द्रष्टव्या पुत्रगर्धिनी || २-५८-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Shedding tears profusely, Rama again spoke to me as follows : �My mother, who is
very much longing her son, is to be looked after by you as if she is your mother'."_END

B_2_C_57_30
BEGIN_
देव यस्या भयात् रामम् न अनुपृच्चसि सारथिम् |
न इह तिष्ठति कैकेयी विश्रब्धम् प्रतिभाष्यताम् || २-५७-३१_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, king! On whose fear, you are not enquiring with Sumantra about the welfare of
Rama, that Kaikeyi is not here. Speak fearlessly."_END

B_2_C_52_79
BEGIN_
मध्यम् तु समनुप्राप्य भागीरथ्याः तु अनिन्दिता |
वैदेही प्रान्जलिर् भूत्वा ताम् नदीम् इदम् अब्रवीत् || २-५२-८२_END
BEGIN_
Coming to the middle of Bhagirathi river, the irreproachable Sita with joined palms,
spoke as follows to the said river: -_END

B_2_C_60_1
BEGIN_
नय माम् यत्र काकुत्स्थः सीता यत्र च लक्ष्मणः |
तान् विना क्षणम् अपि अत्र जीवितुम् न उत्सहे हि अहम् || २-६०-२_END
BEGIN_
"Wherever Rama, Seetha and Lakshmana are there, take me to them. Without them, I do
not cherish to live here even for a moment."_END

B_2_C_58_23
BEGIN_
इति एवम् माम् महाराज बृवन्न् एव महा यशाः |
रामः राजीव ताम्र अक्षो भृशम् अश्रूणि अवर्तयत् || २-५८-२५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, emperor! Rama of the most beautiful appearance with red eyes resembling red
lotus flowers, while even uttering these words to me profusely shed tears."_END

B_2_C_59_8
BEGIN_
अत्रोद्यानानि शून्यानि प्रलीनविहगानि च |
न चाभिरामानारामान् पश्यामि मनुजर्षभ || २-५९-९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, best of men! The gardens here are empty of men and the birds have vanished. I
am not seeing the gardens as charming (as before)."_END

B_2_C_57_31
BEGIN_
सा तथा उक्त्वा महा राजम् कौसल्या शोक लालसा |
धरण्याम् निपपात आशु बाष्प विप्लुत भाषिणी || २-५७-३२_END
BEGIN_
Kausalya, speaking excitedly in tears and entirely given up to anguish uttered thus
to the monarch and soon fell to the ground._END

B_2_C_52_80
BEGIN_
पुत्रः दशरथस्य अयम् महा राजस्य धीमतः |
निदेशम् पालयतु एनम् गन्गे त्वद् अभिरक्षितः || २-५२-८३
चतुर् दश हि वर्षाणि समग्राणि उष्य कानने |
भ्रात्रा सह मया चैव पुनः प्रत्यागमिष्यति || २-५२-८४
ततः त्वाम् देवि सुभगे क्षेमेण पुनर् आगता |
यक्ष्ये प्रमुदिता गन्गे सर्व काम समृद्धये || २-५२-८५_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Ganga! Let Rama, the son of the emperor Dasaratha honor his father's command
under your protection! Having dwelled in the forest in full fourteen years, may he return once more
to your bank with his brother, Lakshmana and myself! Oh, blessed goddess Ganga! Returning safely,
with all my desires fulfilled, I shall worship you with great joy."_END

B_2_C_60_2
BEGIN_
निवर्तय रथम् शीघ्रम् दण्डकान् नय माम् अपि |
अथ तान् न अनुगच्चामि गमिष्यामि यम क्षयम् || २-६०-३_END
BEGIN_
"Turn back the chariot quickly. Take also myself to the forest of Dandaka. Now, if I
do not go after them, I shall enter the Death's abode."_END

B_2_C_58_24
BEGIN_
लक्ष्मणः तु सुसम्क्रुद्धो निह्श्वसन् वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् |
केन अयम् अपराधेन राज पुत्रः विवासितः || २-५८-२६_END
BEGIN_
"But Lakshmana was very angry and breathing a sigh, spoke to me as follows: �On
which offence this prince was expelled from home?'"_END

B_2_C_59_9
BEGIN_
प्रविशन्तम् अयोध्याम् माम् न कश्चित् अभिनन्दति |
नरा रामम् अपश्यन्तः निह्श्वसन्ति मुहुर् मुहुः || २-५९-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Nobody greeted me, entering into Ayodhya City. Having not seen Rama, the people are
breathing their sigh of lamentation again and again."_END

B_2_C_52_81
BEGIN_
त्वम् हि त्रिपथगा देवि ब्रह्म लोकम् समीक्षसे |
भार्या च उदधि राजस्य लोके अस्मिन् सम्प्रदृश्यसे || २-५२-८६_END
BEGIN_
You, Oh goddess flowing through three regions (namely heaven, earth and subterranean
regions), include in your basin the realm of Brahma (the outermost of the six spheres enveloping
the earth) and are vividly seen on this terrestrial plane as a consort of the ocean king."_END

B_2_C_57_32
BEGIN_
एवम् विलपतीम् दृष्ट्वा कौसल्याम् पतिताम् भुवि |
पतिम् च अवेक्ष्य ताः सर्वाः सुस्वरम् रुरुदुः स्त्रियः || २-५७-३३_END
BEGIN_
All those women cried in loud voice, seeing Kausalya fallen on the ground weeping as
aforesaid and gazing their husband too (lying unconscious)._END

B_2_C_60_3
BEGIN_
बाष्प वेगौपहतया स वाचा सज्जमानया |
इदम् आश्वासयन् देवीम् सूतः प्रान्जलिर् अब्रवीत् || २-६०-४_END
BEGIN_
Sumantra with joined palms and with a voice choked with tears and in faint accents,
consoling Kausalya, spoke these words to her._END

B_2_C_58_25
BEGIN_
राज्ञा तु खलु कैकेय्या लघु त्वाश्रित्य शासनम् |
कृतम् कार्यमकार्यम् वा वयम् येनाभिपीडिताः || २-५८-२७_END
BEGIN_
"The king even took shelter under a wretched decree of Kaikeyi and performed an act
not to be done, as though it is a proper deed, for which we are now tormented."_END

B_2_C_59_10
BEGIN_
देव राजरथम् दृष्ट्वा विना राममिहागतम् |
दुःखादश्रुमुखः सर्वो राजमार्गगतो जनः || २-५९-११_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, emperor! Seeing the royal chariot returning here without Rama, all the people
along the royal high-way are shedding tears with grief."_END

B_2_C_52_82
BEGIN_
सा त्वाम् देवि नमस्यामि प्रशंसामि च शोभने |
प्राप्त राज्ये नर व्याघ्र शिवेन पुनर् आगते || २-५२-८७
गवाम् शत सहस्राणि वस्त्राणि अन्नम् च पेशलम् |
ब्राह्मणेभ्यः प्रदास्यामि तव प्रिय चिकीर्षया || २-५२-८८_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, charming goddess! I, Sita, greet you and extol you too. When Rama the tiger
among men safely returns and regains his kingdom, I shall give away a lakh of cows, soft clothing
and food to brahmanas with intent to please you."_END

B_2_C_57_33
BEGIN_
ततः तम् अन्तः पुर नादम् उत्थितम् |
समीक्ष्य वृद्धाः तरुणाः च मानवाः |
स्त्रियः च सर्वा रुरुदुः समन्ततः |
पुरम् तदा आसीत् पुनर् एव सम्कुलम् || २-५७-३४_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that crying sound raised in gynaeceum, all aged and young men and women on
all sides gathered around weeping. The city then again became disturbed._END

B_2_C_60_4
BEGIN_
त्यज शोकम् च मोहम् च सम्भ्रमम् दुह्खजम् तथा |
व्यवधूय च सम्तापम् वने वत्स्यति राघवः || २-६०-५_END
BEGIN_
"Abandon grief, delusion and haste born of affliction. Rama, can reside in the
forest, warding off anguish."_END

B_2_C_58_26
BEGIN_
यदि प्रव्राजितः रामः लोभ कारण कारितम् |
वर दान निमित्तम् वा सर्वथा दुष्कृतम् कृतम् || २-५८-२८_END
BEGIN_
"Even if this was done for the good pleasure of the king or through the will of God,
I do not see any justification for Rama's abandonment."_END

B_2_C_59_11
BEGIN_
हर्म्यैः विमानैः प्रासादैः अवेक्ष्य रथम् आगतम् |
हाहा कार कृता नार्यो राम अदर्शन कर्शिताः || २-५९-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing the returned chariot, women from mansions, seven-storied buildings and royal
palaces are crying �ha ha!', being troubled by the non-appearance of Rama."_END

B_2_C_52_83
BEGIN_
सुराघटसहस्रेण मांसभूतोदनेन च |
यक्ष्ये त्वाम् प्रयता देवि पुरीम् पुनरुपागता || २-५२-८९_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, goddess! After reaching back the city of Ayodhya, I shall worship you with
thousand pots of spirituous liquor and jellied meat with cooked rice well prepared for the solemn
rite."_END

B_2_C_60_5
BEGIN_
लक्ष्मणः च अपि रामस्य पादौ परिचरन् वने |
आराधयति धर्मज्ञः पर लोकम् जित इन्द्रियः || २-६०-६_END
BEGIN_
"Lakshmana too, knowing about a righteous conduct, having subdued his senses and
serving the feet of Rama in the forest, is propitiating the other world."_END

B_2_C_58_27
BEGIN_
इदम् तावद्यथाकाममीश्वरस्य कृते कृतम् |
रामस्य तु परित्यागे न हेतुम् उपलक्षये || २-५८-२९_END
BEGIN_
"Even if this was done for the good pleasure of the king or through the will of god,
I do not see any justification for Rama's abandonment."_END

B_2_C_59_12
BEGIN_
आयतैः विमलैः नेत्रैः अश्रु वेग परिप्लुतैः |
अन्योन्यम् अभिवीक्षन्ते व्यक्तम् आर्ततराः स्त्रियः || २-५९-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Women, being more sorrowful, are looking at each other indistinctly with their long
bright eyes overwhelmed with a flood of tears."_END

B_2_C_60_6
BEGIN_
विजने अपि वने सीता वासम् प्राप्य गृहेष्व् इव |
विस्रम्भम् लभते अभीता रामे सम्न्यस्त मानसा || २-६०-७_END
BEGIN_
"Seetha, getting a dwelling place resembling a house even in a lonely forest, her
mind encamped in Rama and being fearless, is acquiring confidence._END

B_2_C_52_84
BEGIN_
यानि त्वत्तीरवासीनि दैवतानि च सन्ति हि |
तानि सर्वाणि यक्ष्यामि तीर्थान्यायतनानि च || २-५२-९०_END
BEGIN_
"I shall worship all deities dwelling on your banks as also sacred spots and
sanctuaries."_END

B_2_C_61_0
BEGIN_
वनम् गते धर्म परे रामे रमयताम् वरे |
कौसल्या रुदती स्वार्ता भर्तारम् इदम् अब्रवीत् || २-६१-१_END
BEGIN_
When Rama, who is excellent in virtue and outstanding among those causing delight,
having left for the forest, Kausalya who was feeling pained, spoke, weeping to her husband as
follows:_END

B_2_C_59_13
BEGIN_
न अमित्राणाम् न मित्राणाम् उदासीन जनस्य च |
अहम् आर्ततया कंचित् विशेषम् न उपलक्षये || २-५९-१४_END
BEGIN_
"I do not see any distinction in their agony, whether they are non-friends, friends
or neutral people."_END

B_2_C_58_28
BEGIN_
असमीक्ष्य समारब्धम् विरुद्धम् बुद्धि लाघवात् |
जनयिष्यति सम्क्रोशम् राघवस्य विवासनम् || २-५८-३०_END
BEGIN_
"Rama's exile, an illegal decision undertaken whether due to levity of judgment or
due to lack of reflection, will raise countless protests."_END

B_2_C_60_7
BEGIN_
न अस्या दैन्यम् कृतम् किंचित् सुसूक्ष्मम् अपि लक्षये |
उचिता इव प्रवासानाम् वैदेही प्रतिभाति मा || २-६०-८_END
BEGIN_
"Not even very minute depression, even a little, is seen developed in Seetha. It
appears to me as though Seetha is accustomed to so many exiles."_END

B_2_C_52_85
BEGIN_
पुनरेव महाबाउर्मया भ्रात्रा च सम्गतः |
अयोध्याम् वनवासात्तु प्रविशत्वनघोऽनघे || २-५२-९१_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, irreproachable goddess! May the sinless Rama (with mighty arms) re-enter
Ayodhya again from the forest, along with Lakshmana and myself."_END

B_2_C_61_1
BEGIN_
यद्यपि त्रिषु लोकेषु प्रथितम् ते मयद् यशः |
सानुक्रोशो वदान्यः च प्रिय वादी च राघवः || २-६१-२
कथम् नर वर श्रेष्ठ पुत्रौ तौ सह सीतया |
दुह्खितौ सुख सम्वृद्धौ वने दुह्खम् सहिष्यतः || २-६१-३_END
BEGIN_
"Despite the fame in the three worlds of your great glory that Dasaratha is
compassionate, bountiful and kind in his words, how your two sons along with Seetha who grew
comfortably can bear suffering in the forest when faced with hardships, O the best among the
foremost of men!"_END

B_2_C_59_14
BEGIN_
अप्रहृष्ट मनुष्या च दीन नाग तुरम्गमा |
आर्त स्वर परिम्लाना विनिह्श्वसित निह्स्वना || २-५९-१५
निरानन्दा महा राज राम प्रव्राजन आतुला |
कौसल्या पुत्र हीना इवायोध्या प्रतिभाति मा मा || २-५९-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, emperor! The city of Ayodhya with its joy-less people, with its elephants and
horses looking miserable, with sighing exhaustion due to cries of pain, filled with sounds of
moaning, cheerless and feeling anguish due to Rama's exile, appears to me, like Queen Kausalya
without her son."_END

B_2_C_58_29
BEGIN_
अहम् तावन् महा राजे पितृत्वम् न उपलक्षये |
भ्राता भर्ता च बन्धुः च पिता च मम राघवः || २-५८-३१_END
BEGIN_
"I do not consider the emperor as my father. For me, Rama is the brother, lord,
relative and my father."_END

B_2_C_60_8
BEGIN_
नगर उपवनम् गत्वा यथा स्म रमते पुरा |
तथैव रमते सीता निर्जनेषु वनेष्व् अपि || २-६०-९_END
BEGIN_
"Seetha is taking delight in the desolate forests in the same manner as she was
earlier enjoying in visiting gardens in the city."_END

B_2_C_52_86
BEGIN_
तथा सम्भाषमाणा सा सीता गन्गाम् अनिन्दिता |
दक्षिणा दक्षिणम् तीरम् क्षिप्रम् एव अभ्युपागमत् || २-५२-९२_END
BEGIN_
Thus praying to Ganga, the efficient and irreproachable Sita rapidly reached the
right bank of the river._END

B_2_C_61_2
BEGIN_
सा नूनम् तरुणी श्यामा सुकुमारी सुख उचिता |
कथम् उष्णम् च शीतम् च मैथिली प्रसहिष्यते || २-६१-४_END
BEGIN_
"That Seetha, who is a young lady in the prime of her youth and very delicate, can
really tolerate heat and cold?"_END

B_2_C_59_15
BEGIN_
सूतस्य वचनम् श्रुत्वा वाचा परम दीनया |
बाष्प उपहतया राजा तम् सूतम् इदम् अब्रवीत् || २-५९-१७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Sumantra's words, the king in a voice choked with tears and very much
woeful, spoke to that charioteer as follows:_END

B_2_C_58_30
BEGIN_
सर्व लोक प्रियम् त्यक्त्वा सर्व लोक हिते रतम् |
सर्व लोको अनुरज्येत कथम् त्वा अनेन कर्मणा || २-५८-३२_END
BEGIN_
"Leaving Rama the beloved of all people and who is interested in the welfare of all
human beings, how would all these people would be interested in you by this act of yours?"_END

B_2_C_60_9
BEGIN_
बाला इव रमते सीता बाल चन्द्र निभ आनना |
रामा रामे हि अदीन आत्मा विजने अपि वने सती || २-६०-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Seetha, a charming woman with her face resembling a full moon and with her mind
absorbed in Rama, even though staying in a lonely forest, is enjoying it like a little girl."_END

B_2_C_52_87
BEGIN_
तीरम् तु समनुप्राप्य नावम् हित्वा नर ऋषभः |
प्रातिष्ठत सह भ्रात्रा वैदेह्या च परम् तपः || २-५२-९३_END
BEGIN_
Reaching the bank and leaving the boat, Rama the best among men and the chastiser of
foes proceeded further along with Lakshmana and Sita._END

B_2_C_61_3
BEGIN_
भुक्त्वा अशनम् विशाल अक्षी सूप दंश अन्वितम् शुभम् |
वन्यम् नैवारम् आहारम् कथम् सीता उपभोक्ष्यते || २-६१-५_END
BEGIN_
"How the large-eyed Seetha can eat a food prepared with wild rice, she having eaten
here a good food containing soups and snacks?"_END

B_2_C_59_16
BEGIN_
कैकेय्या विनियुक्तेन पाप अभिजन भावया |
मया न मन्त्र कुशलैः वृद्धैः सह समर्थितम् || २-५९-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Enjoined by Kaikeyi with her sinful birth and intention, I could not deliberate
with people experienced in counsel or with elders beforehand."_END

B_2_C_58_31
BEGIN_
सर्वप्रजाभिरामम् हि रामम् प्रव्राज्य धार्मिकम् |
सर्वलोकम् विरुध्येमम् कथम् राजा भविष्यसि || २-५८-३३_END
BEGIN_
"By banishing Rama who is delightful to entire people and who is a virtuous man and
by opposing all this entire world, how will you stay as a king?"_END

B_2_C_60_10
BEGIN_
तत् गतम् हृदयम् हि अस्याः तत् अधीनम् च जीवितम् |
अयोध्या अपि भवेत् तस्या राम हीना तथा वनम् || २-६०-११_END
BEGIN_
"Seetha's heart is directed towards Rama. Her life also is dependent on him. Even if
Ayodhya is without Rama, then it becomes a forest to her."_END

B_2_C_52_88
BEGIN_
अथ अब्रवीन् महा बाहुः सुमित्र आनन्द वर्धनम् |
भव सम्रक्षणार्थाय सजने विजनेऽपि वा || २-५२-९४_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama the mighty armed, spoke to Lakshmana (who heightened the joy of Sumitra)
as follows:_END

B_2_C_61_4
BEGIN_
गीत वादित्र निर्घोषम् श्रुत्वा शुभम् अनिन्दिता |
कथम् क्रव्य अद सिम्हानाम् शब्दम् श्रोष्यति अशोभनम् || २-६१-६_END
BEGIN_
"How that irreproachable Seetha can hear the horrid sounds of cruel animals and
lions, after hearing the auspicious sounds of singing and music here?"_END

B_2_C_59_17
BEGIN_
न सुहृद्भिर् न च अमात्यैः मन्त्रयित्वा न नैगमैः |
मया अयम् अर्थः सम्मोहात् स्त्री हेतोह् सहसा कृतः || २-५९-१९_END
BEGIN_
"This act has been done by me in haste due to infatuation for the sake of a woman,
without consulting with friends or ministers or with interpreters of sacred texts."_END

B_2_C_58_32
BEGIN_
जानकी तु महा राज निःश्वसन्ती तपस्विनी |
भूत उपहत चित्ता इव विष्ठिता वृष्मृता स्थिता || २-५८-३४_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, King! The wise Seetha for her part with her mind like one possessed and
forgetting her own existence, stood sighing and static._END

B_2_C_60_11
BEGIN_
परि पृच्चति वैदेही ग्रामामः च नगराणि च |
गतिम् दृष्ट्वा नदीनाम् च पादपान् विविधान् अपि || २-६०-१२
रामम् हि लक्ष्मनम् वापि पृष्ट्वा जानाति जानती |
अयोध्याक्रोशमात्रे तु विहारमिव संश्रिता || २-६०-१३_END
BEGIN_
"As if only a couple of miles away from Ayodhya and as being in a garden there,
Seetha on seeing villages, towns, movement of rivers, and various types of trees, enquires with
Rama or Lakshmana and Knows well about them."_END

B_2_C_61_5
BEGIN_
महा इन्द्र ध्वज सम्काशः क्व नु शेते महा भुजः |
भुजम् परिघ सम्काशम् उपधाय महा बलः || २-६१-७_END
BEGIN_
Where Rama the mighty hero, resplendent as Mahendra's standard and the mighty armed
is sleeping indeed with his arm as a pillow?"_END

B_2_C_52_89
BEGIN_
अवश्यम् रक्षणम् कार्यमदृष्टे विजने वने |
अग्रतः गच्च सौमित्रे सीता त्वाम् अनुगच्चतु || २-५२-९५_END
BEGIN_
"Security is an inevitable need in a forest, which has unforeseen dangers and is
uninhabited, Oh, Lakshmana! Go in front. Let Sita follow you."_END

B_2_C_59_18
BEGIN_
भवितव्यतया नूनम् इदम् वा व्यसनम् महत् |
कुलस्य अस्य विनाशाय प्राप्तम् सूत यदृच्चया || २-५९-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Sumantra! This great calamity, surely, has come as an inevitable consequence or
for the ruin of this race or accidentally."_END

B_2_C_58_33
BEGIN_
अदृष्ट पूर्व व्यसना राज पुत्री यशस्विनी |
तेन दुह्खेन रुदती न एव माम् किंचित् अब्रवीत् || २-५८-३५_END
BEGIN_
"The illustrious Seetha having not seen such misfortune earlier, could not even to
speak me anything, weeping as she was with that uneasiness."_END

B_2_C_60_12
BEGIN_
इदमेव स्मराम्यस्याः सहसैवोपजल्पितम् |
कैकेयीसंश्रितम् वाक्यम् नेदानीम् प्रतिभाति माम् || २-६०-१४_END
BEGIN_
"I am remembering only these incidents about Seetha. It does not flash to my mind
now of the words hurriedly spoken of by Seetha about Kaikeyi."_END

B_2_C_61_6
BEGIN_
पद्म वर्णम् सुकेश अन्तम् पद्म निह्श्वासम् उत्तमम् |
कदा द्रक्ष्यामि रामस्य वदनम् पुष्कर ईक्षणम् || २-६१-८_END
BEGIN_
"When can I see the face of Rama with the colour of a lotus, framed with marvelous
locks of lotus-perfume, with eyes resembling lotus-petals and excellent?"_END

B_2_C_52_90
BEGIN_
पृष्ठतः अहम् गमिष्यामि त्वाम् च सीताम् च पालयन् |
अन्योन्यस्य हि नो रक्षा कर्तव्या पुरुषर्षभ || २-५२-९६_END
BEGIN_
"I shall proceed in the rear, protecting you and Sita. Oh, jewel among men! We must
accord protection here to one another."_END

B_2_C_59_19
BEGIN_
सूत यद्य् अस्ति ते किंचिन् मया अपि सुकृतम् कृतम् |
त्वम् प्रापय आशु माम् रामम् प्राणाः सम्त्वरयन्ति माम् || २-५९-२१_END
BEGIN_
Oh, sumantra! If at all I have done any favour to you, lead me fast to Rama. My
vital spirits are hastening me."_END

B_2_C_58_34
BEGIN_
उद्वीक्षमाणा भर्तारम् मुखेन परिशुष्यता |
मुमोच सहसा बाष्पम् माम् प्रयान्तम् उदीक्ष्य सा || २-५८-३६_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing me going back, Seetha with emaciated face, perceiving her husband, soon shed
down tears."_END

B_2_C_62_0
BEGIN_
एवम् तु क्रुद्धया राजा राम मात्रा सशोकया |
श्रावितः परुषम् वाक्यम् चिन्तयाम् आस दुह्खितः || २-६२-१_END
BEGIN_
When harsh words with anger in this manner by the grief-stricken Kausalya, Rama's
mother were heard, king Dasaratha felt depressed and reflected upon them._END

B_2_C_60_13
BEGIN_
ध्वंसयित्वा तु तद्वाक्यम् प्रमादात्पर्युपस्थितम् |
ह्लदनम् वचनम् सूतो देव्या मधुरमब्रवीत् || २-६०-१५_END
BEGIN_
Expunging the remarks spoken by Seetha about Kaikeyi coming almost nearer to his
lips by inadvertence, Sumantra spoke only delightful and sweet words to Kausalya._END

B_2_C_61_7
BEGIN_
वज्र सारमयम् नूनम् हृदयम् मे न संशयः |
अपश्यन्त्या न तम् यद् वै फलति इदम् सहस्रधा || २-६१-९_END
BEGIN_
There is no doubt that my heart is fully made of the solid-interior of a diamond,
for which reason this heart is not shattered into a thousand pieces, even in my not seeing of that
Rama."_END

B_2_C_52_91
BEGIN_
न हि तावदतिक्रान्ता सुकरा काचन क्रिया |
अद्य दुःखम् तु वैदेही वनवासस्य वेत्स्यति || २-५२-९७_END
BEGIN_
"An act which has gone out of hand, whatsoever, cannot indeed be remedied again.
Sita will experience the hardship of staying in a forest only from now."_END

B_2_C_59_20
BEGIN_
यद् यद् या अपि मम एव आज्ञा निवर्तयतु राघवम् |
न शक्ष्यामि विना राम मुहूर्तम् अपि जीवितुम् || २-५९-२२_END
BEGIN_
"If there is the same unlimited authority of mine even now, let Rama be brought back
to Ayodhya. I cannot survive without Rama even for a moment."_END

B_2_C_58_35
BEGIN_
तथैव रामः अश्रु मुखः कृत अन्जलिः |
स्थितः अभवल् लक्ष्मण बाहु पालितः स्थितः |
तथैव सीता रुदती तपस्विनी |
निरीक्षते राज रथम् तथैव माम् || २-५८-३७_END
BEGIN_
"In the same way, Rama with tears on his face and with joined palms, stood being
shielded by the arms of Lakshmana. The miserable Seetha in the same manner was weeping and seeing
the royal chariot and me."_END

B_2_C_62_1
BEGIN_
चिन्तयित्वा स च नृपो मुमोह व्याकुलेन्द्रियः |
अथ दीर्घेण कालेन सम्ज्ञामाप परतपः || २-६२-२_END
BEGIN_
The king fell brooding thus perplexed as he was in his mind and lost his
consciousness. Thereafter, that king who torments the enemies regained his consciousness after a
long time._END

B_2_C_60_14
BEGIN_
अध्वना वात वेगेन सम्भ्रमेण आतपेन च |
न हि गच्चति वैदेह्याः चन्द्र अंशु सदृशी प्रभा || २-६०-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Seetha's radiance resembling a moon's gleam is not fading away due to her travel in
the forest or due to the velocity of wind or because of her bewilderment or due to heat of the
sun."_END

B_2_C_61_8
BEGIN_
यत्त्वया करुणम् कर्म व्यपोह्य मम बान्धवाः |
निरस्ता परिधावन्ति सुखार्हः कृपणा वने || २-६१-१०_END
BEGIN_
"It was not a kindly act by you that you banished my kith and kin, who were worthy
of comforts to wander around in the forest in such a miserable condition."_END

B_2_C_52_92
BEGIN_
प्रणष्टजनसम्बाधम् क्षेत्रारामविवर्बितम् |
विषमम् च प्रपातम् च वनमद्य प्रवेक्ष्यति || २-५२-९८_END
BEGIN_
"Today she will enter the forest, where density of people is not seen, which is
utterly devoid of fields and gardens, has a rugged surface and is full of stumbles."_END

B_2_C_59_21
BEGIN_
अथवा अपि महा बाहुर् गतः दूरम् भविष्यति |
माम् एव रथम् आरोप्य शीघ्रम् रामाय दर्शय || २-५९-२३_END
BEGIN_
"Or perhaps Rama the mighty-armed might have gone a long way. Make me to ascend the
chariot and quickly show me to Rama."_END

B_2_C_62_2
BEGIN_
स सम्ज्ञाअमुपलब्यैव दीर्घमुष्णम् च निःससन् |
कौसल्याम् पार्श्वतो दृष्ट्वा ततश्चिन्तामुपागमत् || २-६२-३_END
BEGIN_
After restoring his consciousness he, breathing a long and hot sigh and seeing
Kausalya by his side, began to worry again._END

B_2_C_60_15
BEGIN_
सदृशम् शत पत्रस्य पूर्ण चन्द्र उपम प्रभम् |
वदनम् तत् वदान्याया वैदेह्या न विकम्पते || २-६०-१७_END
BEGIN_
"That face of altruistic Seetha resembling a lotus flower, whose lustre is similar
to that of a full moon, did not become changed."_END

B_2_C_61_9
BEGIN_
यदि पञ्चदशे वर्षे राघवः पुनरेष्यति |
जह्याद्राज्यम् च कोशम् च भरतो नोपल्स्ख्यते || २-६१-११_END
BEGIN_
"Even if Rama comes back in the fifteenth year, it cannot be inferred that Bharata
will abandon the kingdom and the treasury."_END

B_2_C_52_93
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा रामस्य वचनम् प्रतिस्थे लक्ष्मणोऽग्रतः |
अनन्तरम् च सीताया राघवो रघुनन्दनः || २-५२-९९_END
BEGIN_
Listening to Rama's words, Lakshmana walked in front. Immediately after Sita, Rama,
the delight of Raghu dynasty, advanced._END

B_2_C_59_22
BEGIN_
वृत्त दम्ष्ट्रः महा इष्वासः क्व असौ लक्ष्मण पूर्वजः |
यदि जीवामि साध्व् एनम् पश्येयम् सह सीतया || २-५९-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Where is that Rama having pearl-like teeth and wearing a large bow? If only I can
see him well with Seetha, I can survive."_END

B_2_C_62_3
BEGIN_
तस्य चिन्तयमानस्य प्रत्यभात् कर्म दुष्कृतम् |
यद् अनेन कृतम् पूर्वम् अज्ञानात् शब्द वेधिना || २-६२-४_END
BEGIN_
As he thus brooded over, he recalled in his mind, a sinful deed that was done by him
out of ignorance long ago, by shooting with an arrow an unseen object, the sound of which was only
heard._END

B_2_C_60_16
BEGIN_
अलक्त रस रक्त अभाव् अलक्त रस वर्जितौ |
अद्य अपि चरणौ तस्याः पद्म कोश सम प्रभौ || २-६०-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Her feet, which even though no longer painted with vermilion, still looks red as
Alakta (red juice obtained from resin of certain trees), with lustre equal to that of red lotus
buds."_END

B_2_C_61_10
BEGIN_
भोजयन्ति किल श्राद्धे केचित्स्वनेव बान्धवान् |
ततः पश्चात्समीक्षन्ते कृतकार्या द्विजर्षभान् || २-६१-१२_END
BEGIN_
"There are those who in a ceremony in hour of dead relatives, first feed their
relatives and thereafter, to fulfill their duty, remember to invite the illustrious Twice-born._END

B_2_C_52_94
BEGIN_
गतम् तु गन्गा पर पारम् आशु |
रामम् सुमन्त्रः प्रततम् निरीक्ष्य |
अध्व प्रकर्षात् विनिवृत्त दृष्टिर् |
र्मुमोच बाष्पम् व्यथितः तपस्वी || २-५२-१००_END
BEGIN_
Constantly gazing at Rama, who reached soon the other bank of Ganga River, the
distressed Sumantra, his vision having failed due to the long distance and perturbed as he was,
shed tears (of grief over separation from Rama)._END

B_2_C_59_23
BEGIN_
लोहित अक्षम् महा बाहुम् आमुक्त मणि कुण्डलम् |
रामम् यदि न पश्यामि गमिष्यामि यम क्षयम् || २-५९-२५_END
BEGIN_
"If I cannot see Rama having red eyes, mighty arms and with ear-rings made of gems,
I shall proceed to the world of Death."_END

B_2_C_62_4
BEGIN_
अमनाः तेन शोकेन राम शोकेन च प्रभुः |
द्वाभ्यामपि महाराजः शोकाब्यामभितप्यतो || २-६२-५_END
BEGIN_
The mighty emperor felt distressed through agony caused by that sinful dead and as
also through agony caused by separation from Rama and was tormented by the dual grief._END

B_2_C_60_17
BEGIN_
नूपुर उद्घुष्ट हेला इव खेलम् गच्चति भामिनी |
इदानीम् अपि वैदेही तत् रागा न्यस्त भूषणा || २-६०-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Seetha, sporting her tinkling anklets, walks playfully. Even now, Seetha dons her
ornaments, as a mark of Her passion towards Rama."_END

B_2_C_61_11
BEGIN_
तत्र ये गुणवन्तश्च विद्वांसश्च द्विजातयः |
न पश्चात्तेऽभिमन्यन्ते सुधामपि सुरोपमाः || २-६१-१३_END
BEGIN_
"The virtuous and the learned Brahmins, who are like unto gods, do not accept
afterwards even food as delicious as ambrosia."_END

B_2_C_52_95
BEGIN_
स लोकपालप्रतिमप्रभाववाम् |
स्तीर्त्वा महात्मा वरदो महानदीम् |
ततः समृद्धान् शुभसस्यमालिनः |
क्रमेण वत्सान् मुदितानुपागमत् || २-५२-१०१_END
BEGIN_
Having crossed the great river, Rama the high-soled, the bestowal of boons, equal in
glory with the guardians of spheres, then reached progressively the prosperous and the happy land
of Vatsa; which contained rows of beautiful crops._END

B_2_C_59_24
BEGIN_
अतः नु किम् दुह्खतरम् यो अहम् इक्ष्वाकु नन्दनम् |
इमाम् अवस्थाम् आपन्नो न इह पश्यामि राघवम् || २-५९-२६_END
BEGIN_
"What is more distressing to me after getting into this condition, in not seeing
here, Rama who is a delight to Ikshvaku dynasty?"_END

B_2_C_62_5
BEGIN_
दह्यमानः तु शोकाभ्याम् कौसल्याम् आह भू पतिः |
वेपमानोऽञ्जलिम् कृत्वा प्रसादर्तमवाङ्मुखः || २-६२-६_END
BEGIN_
That king, tormented by the afflictions, was trembling, bent his head down, joined
his palms in salutation, desirous of getting her grace and spoke to Kausalya as follows:_END

B_2_C_60_18
BEGIN_
गजम् वा वीक्ष्य सिम्हम् वा व्याघ्रम् वा वनम् आश्रिता |
न आहारयति सम्त्रासम् बाहू रामस्य संश्रिता || २-६०-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Seetha who stays in the forest, takes refuge in the arms of Rama and hence does not
give Herself to fear, even by seeing an elephant or a lion or a tiger."_END

B_2_C_61_12
BEGIN_
ब्राह्मणेष्वपि तृप्तेषु पश्चाद्भोक्तुम् द्विजर्षभाः |
नाभ्युपैतुमलम् प्राज्ञाः शृङ्गच्चेदमिवर्ष्भाः || २-६१-१४_END
BEGIN_
"The best of Brahmins in their wisdom, will not accept what remains of the food of
which other Brahmins have partaken, regarding it as a bull shorn of its horns."_END

B_2_C_52_96
BEGIN_
तौ तत्र हत्वा चतुरः महा मृगान् |
वराहम् ऋश्यम् पृषतम् महा रुरुम् |
आदाय मेध्यम् त्वरितम् बुभुक्षितौ|
वासाय काले ययतुर् वनः पतिम् || २-५२-१०२_END
BEGIN_
Having hunted there four deer, namely Varaaha, Rishya, Prisata; and Mahaaruru (the
four principal species of deer) and taking quickly the portions that were pure, being hungry as
they were, Rama and Lakshmana reached a tree to take rest in the evening._END

B_2_C_59_25
BEGIN_
हा राम राम अनुज हा हा वैदेहि तपस्विनी |
न माम् जानीत दुह्खेन म्रियमाणम् अनाथवत् || २-५९-२७_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Rama! Oh, Younger Brother of Rama! Oh, unfortunate Seetha! You do not know that
I am dying with grief, like one abandoned."_END

B_2_C_62_6
BEGIN_
प्रसादये त्वाम् कौसल्ये रचितः अयम् मया अन्जलिः |
वत्सला च आनृशंसा च त्वम् हि नित्यम् परेष्व् अपि || २-६२-७_END
BEGIN_
"O, Kausalya! I seek your grace. This joining of palms is set out by me. You are
always affectionate even towards others and even indeed kind."_END

B_2_C_60_19
BEGIN_
न शोच्याः ते न च आत्मा ते शोच्यो न अपि जन अधिपः |
इदम् हि चरितम् लोके प्रतिष्ठास्यति शाश्वतम् || २-६०-२१_END
BEGIN_
"There is no need to pity them nor us nor the king too. This story will thrive in
the world forever."_END

B_2_C_61_13
BEGIN_
एवम् कनीयसा भ्रात्रा भुक्तम् राज्यम् विशाम् पते |
भ्राता ज्येष्ठा वरिष्ठाः च किम् अर्थम् न अवमंस्यते || २-६१-१५_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! Why not the eldest and the best brother refuse to accept the kingdom
enjoyed by the younger brother?"_END

B_2_C_59_26
BEGIN_
स तेन राजा दुःखेन भृशमर्पितचेतनः |
अवगाढः सुदुष्पारम् शोकसागमब्रवीत् || २-५९-२८_END
BEGIN_
King Dasaratha, his mind very much despaired with grief and plunged in an ocean of
sorrow, very difficult to be crossed, spoke (as follows)_END

B_2_C_62_7
BEGIN_
भर्ता तु खलु नारीणाम् गुणवान् निर्गुणो अपि वा |
धर्मम् विमृशमानानाम् प्रत्यक्षम् देवि दैवतम् || २-६२-८_END
BEGIN_
"O, queen! For women reflecting on righteousness, a husband whether he is virtuous
or worthless, is a visible god indeed."_END

B_2_C_60_20
BEGIN_
विधूय शोकम् परिहृष्ट मानसा |
महर्षि याते पथि सुव्यवस्थिताः |
वने रता वन्य फल अशनाः पितुः |
शुभाम् प्रतिज्ञाम् परिपालयन्ति ते || २-६०-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Abandoning grief, possessing cheerful minds, settling well in the path followed by
great sages, delighting in the forest-life and eating fruits of the forest, they are keeping up the
promise given to their father."_END

B_2_C_61_14
BEGIN_
न परेण आहृतम् भक्ष्यम् व्याघ्रः खादितुम् इच्चति |
एवम् एव नर व्याघ्रः पर लीढम् न मंस्यते || २-६१-१६_END
BEGIN_
"A tiger does not wish to share a part of food eaten by another animal. In the same
manner, Rama the tiger among men may not accept that which has been enjoyed by another."_END

B_2_C_59_27
BEGIN_
रामशोकमहाभोगः सीताविरहपारगः |
श्वसितोर्मिमहावर्तो बाष्पफेनजलाविलः || २-५९-२९
बाहुविक्षेपमीनौघो विक्रन्दितमहास्वनः |
प्रकीर्णकेशशैवालः कैकेयीबडबामुखः || २-५९-३०
ममाश्रुवेगप्रभवः कुब्जावाक्यमहाग्रहः |
वरवेलो नृशंसाया रामप्रव्राजनायतः || २-५९-३१
यस्मिन् बत निमग्नोऽहम् कौसल्ये राघवम् विना |
दुस्तरः जीवता देवि मया अयम् शोक सागरः || २-५९-३२_END
BEGIN_
"Oh, Queen Kausalya! I am plunged in this ocean of grief. Its area of sorrow is for
Rama. its other shore is Seetha's separation. Its waves and huge whirlpools are sighs of anguish.
It is agitated with water and foam as tears. Throwing away of arms is the swarm of fishes. Its
great sounds are cries of lamentation. The scattered hari is its duck-week. Kaikeyi is its
submarine fire. Which is the cause for the rush in my tears. The words of the hum-backed are its
huge crocodiles. Its shores are the boons asked by the cruel Kaikeyi. Its long stretch is due to
sending of Rama to far away place. I cannot cross this ocean alive, without Rama. What a pity!"_END

B_2_C_62_8
BEGIN_
सा त्वम् धर्म परा नित्यम् दृष्ट लोक पर अवर |
न अर्हसे विप्रियम् वक्तुम् दुह्खिता अपि सुदुह्खितम् || २-६२-९_END
BEGIN_
"You as such, who is ever intent on virtue, who has understood good and evil
fortunes in the world, even if grief-stricken, ought not to have spoken unpleasant words to me, who
is too much in distress."_END

B_2_C_60_21
BEGIN_
तथा अपि सूतेन सुयुक्त वादिना |
निवार्यमाणा सुत शोक कर्शिता |
न चैव देवी विरराम कूजितात् |
प्रिय इति पुत्र इति च राघव इति च || २-६०-२३_END
BEGIN_
Even if averted thus by Sumantra, who is speaking appropriately well, being
emaciated by sorrow for her son, could not stop crying, "O, my dear son Rama!"_END

B_2_C_63_0
BEGIN_
प्रतिबुद्धो मुहुर् तेन शोक उपहत चेतनः |
अथ राजा दशरथः स चिन्ताम् अभ्यपद्यत || २-६३-१_END
BEGIN_
The king, awakened after some time, with his mind afflicted with grief, got into an
anxious thinking._END

B_2_C_61_15
BEGIN_
हविर् आज्यम् पुरोडाशाः कुशा यूपाः च खादिराः |
न एतानि यात यामानि कुर्वन्ति पुनर् अध्वरे || २-६१-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Oblations, clarified butter, leavings of an offering, sacred grass and sacrificial
posts made of trunk of Khadira tree, once used, are not put to use again in a sacrifice."_END

B_2_C_59_28
BEGIN_
अशोभनम् यो अहम् इह अद्य राघवम् |
दिदृक्षमाणो न लभे सलक्ष्मणम्
इति इव राजा विलपन् महा यहाशः
पपात तूर्णम् शयने स मूर्चितः || २-५९-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Though I want to see Rama and Lakshmana now, I am not able to see them here. It is
very bad." - thus lamenting, the king of great renown soon became unconscious and fell down on his
couch._END

B_2_C_62_9
BEGIN_
तत् वाक्यम् करुणम् राज्ञः श्रुत्वा दीनस्य भाषितम् |
कौसल्या व्यसृजद् बाष्पम् प्रणाली इव नव उदकम् || २-६२-१०_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those miserable words spoken by the distressed king, Kausalya shed tears,
akin to new rain water flowing from channel._END

B_2_C_63_1
BEGIN_
राम लक्ष्मणयोः चैव विवासात् वासव उपमम् |
आविवेश उपसर्गः तम् तमः सूर्यम् इव आसुरम् || २-६३-२_END
BEGIN_
Due to banishing of Rama and Lakshmana, a great calamity befell on Dasaratha who was
equal in strength to Indra like sun seized by obscurity, which is attributed to the demon Rahu._END

B_2_C_61_16
BEGIN_
तथा हि आत्तम् इदम् राज्यम् हृत साराम् सुराम् इव |
न अभिमन्तुम् अलम् रामः नष्ट सोमम् इव अध्वरम् || २-६१-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Thus, Rama cannot accept the kingdom taken away by other, as those not accepting an
ambrosia whose essence has been taken away or as in a sacrifice, stalks of Soma plant (from which a
beverage called Soma is prepared) are lost."_END

B_2_C_59_29
BEGIN_
इति विलपति पार्थिवे प्रनष्टे |
करुणतरम् द्विगुणम् च राम हेतोः |
वचनम् अनुनिशम्य तस्य देवी |
भयम् अगमत् पुनर् एव राम माता || २-५९-३४_END
BEGIN_
Hearing his words lamenting as much as twice more pitiably for Rama and the king
having fallen unconscious, Kausalya was alarmed once again._END

B_2_C_62_10
BEGIN_
स मूद्र्ह्नि बद्ध्वा रुदती राज्ञः पद्मम् इव अन्जलिम् |
सम्भ्रमात् अब्रवीत् त्रस्ता त्वरमाण अक्षरम् वचः || २-६२-११_END
BEGIN_
Capturing on her own head, the king's palms joined in the form of a lotus, Kausalya
was scared and spoke weeping in hurriedly lettered words in eagerness._END

B_2_C_63_2
BEGIN_
सभार्ये निर्गते रामे कौसल्याम् कोसलेश्वरः |
विवक्षुरसितापाङ्गाम् स्मृवा दुष्कृतमात्मनः || २-६३-३_END
BEGIN_
After Rama along with his wife departed to the forest, Dasaratha the king of Kosala
recalling his earlier sin, wanted to tell Kausalya, whose eye-corners were dark in colour all about
it._END

B_2_C_61_17
BEGIN_
न एवम् विधम् असत्कारम् राघवो मर्षयिष्यति |
बलवान् इव शार्दूलो बालधेर् अभिमर्शनम् || २-६१-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Rama will not go through such a type of dishonour, as a strong tiger does not
endure even touching of its tail."_END

B_2_C_62_11
BEGIN_
प्रसीद शिरसा याचे भूमौ निततिता अस्मि ते |
याचिता अस्मि हता देव हन्तव्या अहम् न हि त्वया || २-६२-१२_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! I appeal to you with my bowed head. I lie prostrate on the floor. I am
ruined. I am not to be forgiven indeed by you."_END

B_2_C_61_18
BEGIN_
नैतस्य सहिता लोका भयम् कुर्युर्महामृधे |
अधर्मम् त्विह धर्मात्मा लोकम् धर्मेण योजयेत् || २-६१-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Even if all the worlds combine together in a great battle, they cannot stir up fear
in him. The virtuous minded Rama will provide righteousness to the people with
unrighteousness."_END

B_2_C_63_3
BEGIN_
स राजा रजनीम् षष्ठीम् रामे प्रव्रजिते वनम् |
अर्ध रात्रे दशरथः संस्मरन् दुष्कृतम् कृतम् || २-६३-४_END
BEGIN_
After Rama was sent into exile to the forest, King Dasaratha, on the sixth night at
mid-night, was recalling his sin done (long ago)._END

B_2_C_62_12
BEGIN_
न एषा हि सा स्त्री भवति श्लाघनीयेन धीमता |
उभयोः लोकयोः वीर पत्या या सम्प्रसाद्यते || २-६२-१३_END
BEGIN_
"O, Valiant man! In both the worlds, it is ill-becoming of a woman, being
propitiated by her husband, who is praise worthy and possessing good disposition."_END

B_2_C_61_19
BEGIN_
नन्वसौ काञ्चनैर्बाणैर्महावीर्यो महाभुजः |
युगान्त इव भूतानि सागरानपि निर्दहेत् || २-६१-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Rama with great prowess and with his mighty arms can surely burn up all beings and
even the ocean itself by his golden arrows; like at the time of destruction of the world."_END

B_2_C_63_4
BEGIN_
स राजा पुत्रशोकार्तः स्मरन् दुष्कृतमात्मनः |
कौसल्याम् पुत्र शोक आर्ताम् इदम् वचनम् अब्रवीत् || २-६३-५_END
BEGIN_
King Dasaratha, afflicted by grief for his son, recalling his sin, spoke the
following words to Kausalya who was suffering from sorrow for her son._END

B_2_C_62_13
BEGIN_
जानामि धर्मम् धर्मज्ञ त्वाम् जाने सत्यवादिनम् |
पुत्र शोक आर्तया तत् तु मया किम् अपि भाषितम् || २-६२-१४_END
BEGIN_
"O, valiant man! In both the worlds, it of a woman, being propitiated by her
husband, who is praise worthy and possessing good disposition."_END

B_2_C_61_20
BEGIN_
स तादृशः सिम्ह बलो वृषभ अक्षो नर ऋषभः |
स्वयम् एव हतः पित्रा जलजेन आत्मजो यथा || २-६१-२२_END
BEGIN_
"That excellent man with such a lion's strength and with eyes like those of a bull
was ruined indeed by his own father, like killing its child-fish by an adult fish."_END

B_2_C_63_5
BEGIN_
यद् आचरति कल्याणि शुभम् वा यदि वा अशुभम् |
तत् एव लभते भद्रे कर्ता कर्मजम् आत्मनः || २-६३-६_END
BEGIN_
"O, blessed lady! O gracious one! A doer reaps surely the fruit of his own deeds
corresponding to the nature of work either good or bad, of that which he does!"_END

B_2_C_62_14
BEGIN_
शोको नाशयते धैर्यम् शोको नाशयते श्रुतम् |
शोको नाशयते सर्वम् न अस्ति शोक समः रिपुः || २-६२-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Grief ruins courage. Grief ruins sacred learning, grief ruins all. There is no
enemy like grief."_END

B_2_C_61_21
BEGIN_
द्विजाति चरितः धर्मः शास्त्र दृष्टः सनातनः |
यदि ते धर्म निरते त्वया पुत्रे विवासिते || २-६१-२३_END
BEGIN_
"A son, who is devoted to righteousness, has been sent to exile by you. Is it a
right thing for you, as seen by scriptures or is it an eternal conduct as practiced by the Twice
born?"_END

B_2_C_63_6
BEGIN_
गुरु लाघवम् अर्थानाम् आरम्भे कर्मणाम् फलम् |
दोषम् वा यो न जानाति स बालैति ह उच्यते || २-६३-७_END
BEGIN_
"He who does not consider, while undertaking actions, the relative value of their
fruits as well as the utilities or defects accruing from them, is surely called a fool."_END

B_2_C_62_15
BEGIN_
शक्यम् आपतितः सोढुम् प्रहरः रिपु हस्ततः |
सोढुम् आपतितः शोकः सुसूक्ष्मः अपि न शक्यते || २-६२-१६_END
BEGIN_
"A hitting that descended from the hands of an enemy is possible to be tolerated.
But, the grief suddenly descended, even if so small, is not possible to be tolerated."_END

B_2_C_61_22
BEGIN_
गतिर् एवाक् पतिर् नार्या द्वितीया गतिर् आत्मजः |
तृतीया ज्ञातयो राजमः चतुर्थी न इह विद्यते || २-६१-२४_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! A husband is a chief refuge for a woman. Her second refuge is a son. The
third refuge is her near-relative. There is no fourth one here."_END

B_2_C_63_7
BEGIN_
कश्चित् आम्र वणम् चित्त्वा पलाशामः च निषिन्चति |
पुष्पम् दृष्ट्वा फले गृध्नुः स शोचति फल आगमे || २-६३-८_END
BEGIN_
"Anyone, who after seeing their (charming and big) flowers, greedily desires their
(large and luscious) fruits and nourishes Palasa trees, by cutting off a mongo grove, he will come
to grief after bearing of their fruit."_END

B_2_C_62_16
BEGIN_
दर्मज्ञाः श्रुतिमन्तोऽपि चिन्नधर्मार्थसंशयाः |
यतयो वीर मुह्यन्ति शोकसम्मूढचेतसः || २-६२-१७_END
BEGIN_
"O, valiant man! Even ascetics, who know righteousness, who have learnt sacred texts
and who have rent asunder doubts relating to religious merit and wealth, go astray having their
minds infatuated with grief."_END

B_2_C_61_23
BEGIN_
तत्र त्वम् चैव मे न अस्ति रामः च वनम् आश्रितः |
न वनम् गन्तुम् इच्चामि सर्वथा हि हता त्वया || २-६१-२५_END
BEGIN_
"Among those three refuges, you do not indeed exist. Rama on his part took refuge in
a forest and I do not wish to go there. Thus, I have been ruined in all ways, by you."_END

B_2_C_63_8
BEGIN_
अविज्ञाय फलम् यो हि कर्म त्वेवानुधावति |
स शोचेत्फलवेळायाम् यथा किंशुकसेचकः || २-६३-९_END
BEGIN_
"He who without knowing the result goes running towards action, will come to grief
as a nourisher of Kimsuka trees coming to grief at the time of their fruit-bearing."_END

B_2_C_62_17
BEGIN_
वन वासाय रामस्य पन्च रात्रः अद्य गण्यते |
यः शोक हत हर्षायाः पन्च वर्ष उपमः मम || २-६२-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Today it is counted as five days since Rama has gone to exile. It is equal to five
years for me, since grief has ruined my happiness."_END

B_2_C_61_24
BEGIN_
हतम् त्वया राज्यम् इदम् सराष्ट्रम् |
हतः तथा आत्मा सह मन्त्रिभिः च |
हता सपुत्रा अस्मि हताः च पौराः |
सुतः च भार्या च तव प्रहृष्टौ || २-६१-२६_END
BEGIN_
"This kingdom along with neighboring states has been ruined by you. You yourself
along with ministers have been ruined. I along with my son are ruined. Citizens too are ruined.
Your son Bharata and your wife Kaikeyi only are delighted."_END

B_2_C_63_9
BEGIN_
सो अहम् आम्र वणम् चित्त्वा पलाशामः च न्यषेचयम् |
रामम् फल आगमे त्यक्त्वा पश्चात् शोचामि दुर्मतिः || २-६३-१०_END
BEGIN_
"I nourished Palasa trees, by cutting off mango grove. Being wicked-minded in
abandoning Rama at the time of arrival of fruit, I am lamenting thereafter."_END

B_2_C_64_0
BEGIN_
वधमप्रतिरूपम् तु महर्षेस्तस्य राघवः |
विलपन्ने व धर्मात्मा कौसल्याम् पुन रब्रवीत् || २-६४-१_END
BEGIN_
The high souled Dasaratha, while lamenting about the unworthy killing of that sage,
spoke further to Kausalya as follows:_END

B_2_C_62_18
BEGIN_
तम् हि चिन्तयमानायाः शोको अयम् हृदि वर्धते |
अदीनाम् इव वेगेन समुद्र सलिलम् महत् || २-६२-१९_END
BEGIN_
"While I think of Rama, this grief in my heart is increasing, like water in a great
ocean increases with the fast streaming of rivers._END

B_2_C_61_25
BEGIN_
इमाम् गिरम् दारुण शब्द संश्रिताम् |
निशम्य राजा अपि मुमोह दुह्खितः |
ततः स शोकम् प्रविवेश पार्थिवः |
स्वदुष्कृतम् च अपि पुनः तदा अस्मरत् || २-६१-२७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the aforesaid voice of Kausalya, consisting of her cruel words, the king
also being distressed, became disillusioned. Thereafter, the king then looking back on his own evil
act, was entangled in grief_END

B_2_C_63_10
BEGIN_
लब्ध शब्देन कौसल्ये कुमारेण धनुष्मता |
कुमारः शब्द वेधी इति मया पापम् इदम् कृतम् || २-६३-११_END
BEGIN_
"This sin was done by me while I was young and wielding a bow. At that time, I was
famous as a young man, who can shoot heard (but unseen) object by an arrow, O Kausalya!"_END

B_2_C_64_1
BEGIN_
तत् अज्ञानान् महत् पापम् कृत्वा सम्कुलित इन्द्रियः |
एकः तु अचिन्तयम् बुद्ध्या कथम् नु सुकृतम् भवेत् || २-६४-२_END
BEGIN_
Having done that great sin inadvertently, having my senses confounded and I being
alone, I thought of using my reason of what best can be done."_END

B_2_C_62_19
BEGIN_
एवम् हि कथयन्त्याः तु कौसल्यायाः शुभम् वचः |
मन्द रश्मिर् अभूत् सुर्यो रजनी च अभ्यवर्तत || २-६२-२०_END
BEGIN_
While Kausalya was telling auspicious words indeed as aforesaid the sun became
feeble and turned towards night too._END

B_2_C_63_11
BEGIN_
तत् इदम् मे अनुसम्प्राप्तम् देवि दुह्खम् स्वयम् कृतम् |
सम्मोहात् इह बालेन यथा स्यात् भक्षितम् विषम् || २-६३-१२_END
BEGIN_
"This grief, obtained by my own accord, has befallen me, as by a boy in ignorance
eating poison in the world; O, Kausalya!"_END

B_2_C_64_2
BEGIN_
ततः तम् घटम् आदय पूर्णम् परम वारिणा |
आश्रमम् तम् अहम् प्राप्य यथा आख्यात पथम् गतः || २-६४-३_END
BEGIN_
"Taking the best water fully in that pitcher, I went to that hermitage by the path
as directed by the young sage._END

B_2_C_62_20
BEGIN_
तथ प्रह्लादितः वाक्यैः देव्या कौसल्यया नृपः |
शोकेन च समाक्रान्तः निद्राया वशम् एयिवान् || २-६२-२१_END
BEGIN_
The king, thus cheered up by the queen Kausalya, got subjected to slumber, after
having been overcome by grief._END

B_2_C_63_12
BEGIN_
यथान्यः पुरुषः कश्चित्पलाशैर्मोओहितो भवेत् |
एवम् मम अपि अविज्ञातम् शब्द वेध्यमयम् फलम् || २-६३-१३_END
BEGIN_
"How the other man became disillusioned by Palasa trees, I also became disillusioned
in the same manner, without knowing accurately the correct result of hitting a target by means of
sound only."_END

B_2_C_64_3
BEGIN_
तत्र अहम् दुर्बलाव् अन्धौ वृद्धाव् अपरिणायकौ |
अपश्यम् तस्य पितरौ लून पक्षाव् इव द्विजौ || २-६४-४
तन् निमित्ताभिर् आसीनौ कथाभिर् अपरिक्रमौ |
ताम् आशाम् मत् कृते हीनाव् उदासीनाव् अनाथवत् || २-६४-५_END
BEGIN_
"There I saw the frail, blind and aged parents of the young sage. They were without
a guide to support them, as birds whose wings were cut-off. Without any other occupation, they were
narrating words only about their son. Having no protector and being immobile they lost the hope of
their son, because of me."_END

B_2_C_63_13
BEGIN_
देव्य् अनूढा त्वम् अभवो युव राजो भवाम्य् अहम् |
ततः प्रावृड् अनुप्राप्ता मद काम विवर्धिनी || २-६३-१४_END
BEGIN_
"O, Kausalya! You were unmarried till then and I was the Prince Regent. Then came
the rainy season which enhanced excitement and desire (for hunting)."_END

B_2_C_64_4
BEGIN_
शोकोपहतचित्तश्च भयसम्त्रस्तचेतनः |
तच्चाश्रमपदम् गत्वा भूयः शोकमहम् गतः || २-६४-६_END
BEGIN_
"With my mind afflicted by grief and worried about the impending peril, I fell a
prey to further grief after reaching the hermitage._END

B_2_C_63_14
BEGIN_
उपास्यहि रसान् भौमांस् तप्त्वा च जगद् अंशुभिः |
परेत आचरिताम् भीमाम् रविर् आविशते दिशम् || २-६३-१५_END
BEGIN_
"The sun, partaking fluids from earth and warming the world with its rays, entered
the terrible southern quarter haunted by spirits."_END

B_2_C_64_5
BEGIN_
पद शब्दम् तु मे श्रुत्वा मुनिर् वाक्यम् अभाषत |
किम् चिरायसि मे पुत्र पानीयम् क्षिप्रम् आनय || २-६४-७_END
BEGIN_
"Hearing the sound of my foot-steps, that sage spoke as follows: "O, son! Why are
you late? Give me the water soon."_END

B_2_C_65_0
BEGIN_
अथ रात्र्याम् व्यतीतायाम् प्रातर् एव अपरे अहनि |
वन्दिनः पर्युपातिष्ठंस् तत् पार्थिव निवेशनम् || २-६५-१
सूताः परमसंस्काराः मङ्गळाश्चोओत्तमश्रुताः |
गायकाः स्तुतिशीलाश्च निगदन्तः पृथक् पृथक्|| २-६५-२_END
BEGIN_
While the night passed away, there arrived at the residence of the emperor, at the
dawn of the next day, highly cultured and excellently learned bards who were pronouncers of
benedictions and whose custom was to eulogize the king, as well as singers and panegyrists uttering
recitations in different styles._END

B_2_C_63_15
BEGIN_
उष्णम् अन्तर् दधे सद्यः स्निग्धा ददृशिरे घनाः |
ततः जहृषिरे सर्वे भेक सारन्ग बर्हिणः || २-६३-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Heat disappeared suddenly. Resplendent clouds appeared in the sky. All frogs,
cuckoos and peacocks were full of joy."_END

B_2_C_64_6
BEGIN_
यन् निमित्तम् इदम् तात सलिले क्रीडितम् त्वया |
उत्कण्ठिता ते माता इयम् प्रविश क्षिप्रम् आश्रमम् || २-६४-८_END
BEGIN_
"My dear son! Your mother is regretting why you are playing in water in this manner.
Enter the hermitage quickly."_END

B_2_C_65_1
BEGIN_
राजानम् स्तुताम् तेषामुदात्ताभिहिताशिषाम् |
प्रासादाभोगविस्तीर्णः स्तुतिशब्दो ह्यवर्तत || २-६५-३_END
BEGIN_
Their sounds of praises, uttering benedictions in a loud voice and pronouncing
accolades of the king, pervaded in full the interior area of the palace._END

B_2_C_63_16
BEGIN_
क्लिन्नपक्षोत्तराः स्नाताः कृच्च्रादिव वतत्रिणः |
वृष्टिवातावधूताग्रान् पादपानभिपेदिरे || २-६३-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Birds with moistened top of their wings as if they bathed, reached with great
difficulty the trees, the tops of which were shaken off by rain and wind."_END

B_2_C_64_7
BEGIN_
यद् व्यलीकम् कृतम् पुत्र मात्रा ते यदि वा मया |
न तन् मनसि कर्तव्यम् त्वया तात तपस्विना || २-६४-९_END
BEGIN_
"O, son! My dear! If any disagreeable thing has been done by your mother, or me,
you, as a sage ought not have kept it in your mind."_END

B_2_C_65_2
BEGIN_
ततस्तु स्तुवताम् तेषाम् सूतानाम् पाणिवादकाः |
अवदानान्युदाहृत्य पाणिवादा नवादयन् || २-६५-४_END
BEGIN_
While those bards are uttering praises, others who make a bang of claps, patted the
claps, eulogizing the previous glorious acts of Dasaratha._END

B_2_C_63_17
BEGIN_
पतितेन अम्भसा चन्नः पतमानेन च असकृत् |
आबभौ मत्त सारन्गः तोय राशिर् इव अचलः || २-६३-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Enveloped by water falling again and again on the water already fallen, the
mountain with its antelopes in rut, glowed like an ocean."_END

B_2_C_64_8
BEGIN_
त्वम् गतिस् तु अगतीनाम् च चक्षुस् त्वम् हीन चक्षुषाम् |
समासक्ताः त्वयि प्राणाः किंचिन् नौ न अभिभाषसे || २-६४-१०_END
BEGIN_
"We being helpless, you are our refuge. We being blind, you are our eyes. Our lives
are encircled around you. Why are you not talking with us?"_END

B_2_C_65_3
BEGIN_
तेन शब्देन विहगाः प्रतिबुद्धा विसस्वनुः |
शाखास्थाः पञ्जरस्थाश्च ये राजकुलगोचराः || २-६५-५_END
BEGIN_
The birds dwelling in royal palaces perched on the branches of trees and others in
cages were awakened by that sound and began to twitter._END

B_2_C_63_18
BEGIN_
पाण्डुरारुणवर्णानि स्रोओतांसि विमलान्यपि |
सुस्रुवुर्गिरिधातुभ्यः सभस्मानि भुजङ्गवत् || २-६३-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Although the water-streams were crystal clear, they flowed in serpentine courses,
with white and red colours because of their admixture with ashes and mountain-minerals on the
way."_END

B_2_C_64_9
BEGIN_
मुनिम् अव्यक्तया वाचा तम् अहम् सज्जमानया |
हीन व्यन्जनया प्रेक्ष्य भीतः भीतैव अब्रुवम् || २-६४-११_END
BEGIN_
"As though fearful in mind to behold the ascetic, I spoke to him in a tone which was
indistinct inarticulate and without some consonants?"_END

B_2_C_65_4
BEGIN_
व्याहृताः पुण्य्शब्दाश्च वीणानाम् चापि निस्स्वनाः |
आशीर्गेयम् च गाथानाम् पूरयामास वेश्म तत || २-६५-६_END
BEGIN_
The auspicious words uttered by bards parrots etc and the notes of Vina as well as
blissful songs of the metric verses filled that palace._END

B_2_C_63_19
BEGIN_
आकुलारुणतोयानि स्रोओतांसि विमलान्यपि |
उन्मार्गजलवाहीनि बभूवुर्जलदागमे || २-६३-२०_END
BEGIN_
"The water-streams, which were crystal-clear till then, became churned with reddish
waters, carrying water by a wrong way, after the onset of rain."_END

B_2_C_64_10
BEGIN_
मनसः कर्म चेष्टाभिर् अभिसंस्तभ्य वाग् बलम् |
आचचक्षे तु अहम् तस्मै पुत्र व्यसनजम् भयम् || २-६४-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Having strengthened the firmness in my speech and having abandoned fear in my mind
by deliberate efforts, I told him of the alarm that awaited him of his son's death."_END

B_2_C_65_5
BEGIN_
ततः शुचि समाचाराः पर्युपस्थान कोविदः |
स्त्री वर्ष वर भूयिष्ठाउपतस्थुर् यथा पुरम् || २-६५-७_END
BEGIN_
Then, as before, persons who maintain pure practices and those who were skilled in
the services to the king, most of whom were women and eunuchs, arrived there to serve the king._END

B_2_C_63_20
BEGIN_
तस्मिन्न् अतिसुखे काले धनुष्मान् इषुमान् रथी |
व्यायाम कृत सम्कल्पः सरयूम् अन्वगाम् नदीम् || २-६३-२१_END
BEGIN_
"With a wish to do hunting as an exercise in that most comfortable season, I went
along Sarayu River, in a chariot, wearing bow and arrows."_END

B_2_C_64_11
BEGIN_
क्षत्रियो अहम् दशरथो न अहम् पुत्रः महात्मनः |
सज्जन अवमतम् दुह्खम् इदम् प्राप्तम् स्व कर्मजम् || २-६४-१३_END
BEGIN_
"I am Dasaratha, belonging to warrior- class. I am not your high-souled son. This
calamity created by my own act, despised by noble men, befell upon me."_END

B_2_C_65_6
BEGIN_
हरि चन्दन सम्पृक्तम् उदकम् कान्चनैः घटैः |
आनिन्युः स्नान शिक्षा आज्ञा यथा कालम् यथा विधि || २-६५-८_END
BEGIN_
Those who took care of royal ablutions brought water sprinkled with yellow sandal in
golden pitchers in accordance with appropriate time and the set procedures._END

B_2_C_63_21
BEGIN_
निपाने महिषम् रात्रौ गजम् वा अभ्यागतम् नदीम् |
अन्यम् वा श्वा पदम् कंचिज् जिघांसुर् अजित इन्द्रियः || २-६३-२२
तस्मिंस्तत्राहमेकान्ते रात्रौ विवृतकार्मुकः |_END
BEGIN_
"Without my senses under control and with an intent to kill there a (wild) buffalo
or an elephant or any other wild animal coming in the night at that place for the purpose of
drinking water, I was ready with my bow at a solitary place."_END

B_2_C_64_12
BEGIN_
भगवमः च अपहस्तः अहम् सरयू तीरम् आगतः |
जिघांसुः श्वा पदम् किंचिन् निपाने वा आगतम् गजम् || २-६४-१४_END
BEGIN_
"O, venerable sage! Wearing a bow in hand, I came to the bank of Sarayu River with
an intent to kill an elephant arrived to a ford (for drinking water) or any other wild animal."_END

B_2_C_65_7
BEGIN_
मन्गल आलम्भनीयानि प्राशनीयान् उपस्करान् |
उपनिन्युस् तथा अपि अन्याः कुमारी बहुलाः स्त्रियः || २-६५-९_END
BEGIN_
In that manner, women too most of whom were virgins brought all that were pleasing
to the touch, eatables, decorative clothing and ornaments._END

B_2_C_63_22
BEGIN_
तत्राहम् सम्वृतम् वन्यम् हतवांस्तीरमागतम् || २-६३-२३
अन्यम् चापि मृगम् हिंस्रम् शब्दम् श्रुत्वाभु पागतम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Hearing the sound, I killed turning towards it, a wild animal, which came to the
bank of Sarayu River and another violent beast too which came there."_END

B_2_C_64_13
BEGIN_
ततः श्रुतः मया शब्दो जले कुम्भस्य पूर्यतः |
द्विपो अयम् इति मत्वा हि बाणेन अभिहतः मया || २-६४-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Then by me was heard the sound of a pitcher being filled with water. Guessing it as
an elephant, I killed it with an arrow."_END

B_2_C_65_8
BEGIN_
सर्वलक्षणसम्पन्नम् सर्वम् विधिवदर्चितम् |
सर्वम् सुगुणलक्स्मीवत्तद्भभूवाभिहारिकम् || २-६५-१०_END
BEGIN_
All that was brought near him was endowed with all auspicious characteristics
offered with reverence as per prescribed scriptures. All that was extremely graceful._END

B_2_C_63_23
BEGIN_
अथ अन्ध कारे तु अश्रौषम् जले कुम्भस्य पर्यतः || २-६३-२४
अचक्षुर् विषये घोषम् वारणस्य इव नर्दतः |_END
BEGIN_
"Meanwhile, in that darkness and not within the react of the eye, I heard the sound
of a pitcher being filled up, the sound of which appeared like that of an elephant."_END

B_2_C_64_14
BEGIN_
गत्वा नद्याः ततः तीरम् अपश्यम् इषुणा हृदि |
विनिर्भिन्नम् गत प्राणम् शयानम् भुवि तापसम् || २-६४-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Thereafter, reaching the bank of the river there, I saw an ascetic lying dead on
the ground, with the arrow pierced into his heart."_END

B_2_C_65_9
BEGIN_
ततः सूर्योदयम् यावत्सर्वम् परिसमुत्सुकम् |
तस्थावनुपसम्प्राप्तम् किम् स्विदित्युपश् || २-६५-११_END
BEGIN_
All that retinue, greatly excited as they were, without coming near to the king and
with a suspicion as to what was it, stayed thus till sunrise._END

B_2_C_63_24
BEGIN_
ततः अहम् शरम् उद्धृत्य दीप्तम् आशी विष उपमम् || २-६३-२५
शब्दम् प्रति गजप्रेप्सुरभिलक्ष्य त्वपातयम् |_END
BEGIN_
"With an intent to hit that elephant, I drew out a shining arrow resembling a
serpent, targeted towards the direction sound and discharged it."_END

B_2_C_64_15
BEGIN_
भगवन् शब्दम् आलक्ष्य मया गज जिघांसुना |
विसृष्टः अम्भसि नाराचः तेन ते निहतः सुतः || २-६४-१७_END
BEGIN_
"O, honorable sage! With a desire to kill an elephant by targeting the sound, I
released an iron arrow, and thus your son was killed (hit)"_END

B_2_C_65_10
BEGIN_
अथ याः कोसल इन्द्रस्य शयनम् प्रत्यनन्तराः |
ताः स्त्रियः तु समागम्य भर्तारम् प्रत्यबोधयन् || २-६५-१२_END
BEGIN_
The women who were empowered to go near the bed of Dasaratha went in proximity to
him and woke him up._END

B_2_C_63_25
BEGIN_
अमुन्चम् निशितम् बाणम् अहम् आशी विष उपमम् || २-६३-२६
तत्र वाग् उषसि व्यक्ता प्रादुर् आसीद् वन ओकसः |
हा हा इति पततः तोये बाणाभिहतमर्मणः || २-६३-२७_END
BEGIN_
"I released a sharp arrow, resembling a serpent. There, at dawn, arose a distinct
voice uttering 'Ah! Ah!' of a forest-inhabitant, dropping down in water after his vital part was
hit by an arrow."_END

B_2_C_64_16
BEGIN_
ततस्तस्यैव वचनादुपेत्य परितप्यतः |
स मया सहसा बण उद्धृतो मर्मतस्तदा || २-६४-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Approaching as per his request, closer to him who was suffering from pain, I took
out the arrow soon from his vital part."_END

B_2_C_65_11
BEGIN_
तथाप्युचितवृत्तास्ता विनयेन नयेन च |
न ह्यस्य शयनम् स्पृष्ट्वा किम् चिदप्युपलेभिरे || २-६५-१३_END
BEGIN_
Even so, those modest and prudent women with proper conduct, touched Dasaratha's bed
and could not detect any sign of life whatsoever in him._END

B_2_C_63_26
BEGIN_
तस्मिन्निपतिते बाणे वागभूत्तत्र मानुषी |
कथम् अस्मद् विधे शस्त्रम् निपतेत् तु तपस्विनि || २-६३-२८_END
BEGIN_
"While that arrow was attacking a human voice there was heard, saying, 'Oh, how a
weapon did rush upon an ascetic like me?' "_END

B_2_C_64_17
BEGIN_
स च उद्धृतेन बाणेन तत्र एव स्वर्गम् आस्थितः |
भगवन्ताव् उभौ शोचन्न् अन्धाव् इति विलप्य च || २-६४-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Soon after taking out the arrow, he worried about both of you the parents,
lamenting that you were blind and there itself he attained Heaven"_END

B_2_C_65_12
BEGIN_
ताः स्त्रीयः स्वप्नशीलज्ञास्चेष्टासंचलनादिषु |
ता वेपथु परीताः च राज्ञः प्राणेषु शन्किताः || २-६५-१४
प्रतिस्रोतः तृण अग्राणाम् सदृशम् संचकम्पिरे |_END
BEGIN_
Those women knew the condition of a body in sleep, by its gestures, movements and
others. As such, they were possessed of tremor apprehensive as they were about the king's life and
they resembled like tips of reeds standing against a stream._END

B_2_C_63_27
BEGIN_
प्रविविक्ताम् नदीम् रात्राव् उदाहारः अहम् आगतः |
इषुणा अभिहतः केन कस्य वा किम् कृतम् मया || २-६३-२९_END
BEGIN_
'I came to the river, which is away from habitation, in the night to fetch water. By
whom I was hit by an arrow? On the other hand what wrong have I done to anyone?"_END

B_2_C_64_18
BEGIN_
अज्ञानात् भवतः पुत्रः सहसा अभिहतः मया |
शेषम् एवम् गते यत् स्यात् तत् प्रसीदतु मे मुनिः || २-६४-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Unknowingly and unexpectedly your son was killed by me. It has happened like that.
Let the honorable sage command me what to do in this matter."_END

B_2_C_63_28
BEGIN_
ऋषेर् हि न्यस्त दण्डस्य वने वन्येन जीवतः |
कथम् नु शस्त्रेण वधो मद् विधस्य विधीयते || २-६३-३०_END
BEGIN_
"To a seer like me, of having laid down violence and living a fruits and roots of
wild plants in the forest, how a killing by an arrow is enjoined?"_END

B_2_C_65_13
BEGIN_
अथ सम्वेपमनानाम् स्त्रीणाम् दृष्ट्वा च पार्थिवम् || २-६५-१५
यत् तत् आशन्कितम् पापम् तस्य जज्ञे विनिश्चयः |_END
BEGIN_
Now, seeing the king, certainty arose in the minds of those doubting women about the
calamity (of death) that was apprehended._END

B_2_C_64_19
BEGIN_
स तत् श्रुत्वा वचः क्रूरम् निह्श्वसन् शोक कर्शितः |
नाशकत्तीव्रमायासमकर्तुम् भगवानृषिः || २-६४-२१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that cruel news pronounced by me, confessing my sin, that venerable sage
could not resist his severe anger."_END

B_2_C_63_29
BEGIN_
जटा भार धरस्य एव वल्कल अजिन वाससः |
को वधेन मम अर्थी स्यात् किम् वा अस्य अपकृतम् मया || २-६३-३१_END
BEGIN_
"Who is desirous of killing me, wearing a mass of locks of hair and clad with bark
of trees and deer-skin? What harm was done to him by me?"_END

B_2_C_65_14
BEGIN_
कौसल्या च सुमित्रा च पुत्रशोकपराजिते || २-६५-१६
प्रसुप्ते न प्रबुध्येते यथा कालसमन्विते |_END
BEGIN_
Overpowered by grief for their sons, the slumbering Kausalya and Sumitra did not
wake up, as though they were completely overtaken by death._END

B_2_C_64_20
BEGIN_
सबाष्पपूर्णवदनो निःश्वसन् शोककर्शितः |
माम् उवाच महा तेजाः कृत अन्जलिम् उपस्थितम् || २-६४-२२_END
BEGIN_
"That sage with great splendor, whose face was filled with tears and troubled by
sorrow, spoke with a sigh to me who came near him with joined palms"_END

B_2_C_63_30
BEGIN_
एवम् निष्फलम् आरब्धम् केवल अनर्थ सम्हितम् |
न कश्चित् साधु मन्येत यथैव गुरु तल्पगम् || २-६३-३२_END
BEGIN_
"A vain act concerning only with a useless objective is undertaken in this manner.
No one will admire him, as for instance like any man seeking the bed of his preceptor's wife, as
good."_END

B_2_C_65_15
BEGIN_
निष्प्रभा च विवर्णा च सन्ना शोकेन सन्नता || २-६५-१७
न व्यराजत कौसल्या तारेव तिमिरावृता |_END
BEGIN_
Kausalya bereft of luster, pale faced, emaciated with grief and dispirited, did not
shine brightly (as before) like a star hidden away in darkness._END

B_2_C_64_21
BEGIN_
यद्य् एतत् अशुभम् कर्म न स्म मे कथयेः स्वयम् |
फलेन् मूर्धा स्म ते राजन् सद्यः शत सहस्रधा || २-६४-२३_END
BEGIN_
"If you have not told me about this shameful deed yourself, O. king, your head would
have burst instantly into a hundred thousand pieces."_END

B_2_C_63_31
BEGIN_
नहम् तथा अनुशोचामि जीवित क्षयम् आत्मनः |
मातरम् पितरम् च उभाव् अनुशोचामि मद् विधे || २-६३-३३_END
BEGIN_
"I do not worry that much of my death. I worry both for my mother and father, in the
case of my death."_END

B_2_C_65_16
BEGIN_
कौसल्यानन्तरम् राज्ञः सुमित्रा तदन्तनरम् || २-६५-१८
न स्म विभ्राजते देवी शोकाश्रुलुलितानना |_END
BEGIN_
The queen Kausalya, immediately close to the king and with Sumitra on her side, was
not shining as before with her face ruffled by tears of grief._END

B_2_C_64_22
BEGIN_
क्षत्रियेण वधो राजन् वानप्रस्थे विशेषतः |
ज्ञान पूर्वम् कृतः स्थानाच् च्यावयेद् अपि वज्रिणम् || २-६४-२४_END
BEGIN_
"A killing brought about by a warrior premeditatedly and in particular to a hermit,
would expel even Indra from his post."_END

B_2_C_66_0
BEGIN_
तम् अग्निम् इव संशान्तम् अम्बु हीनम् इव अर्णवम् |
हतप्रभम् इव आदित्यम् स्वर्गथम् प्रेक्ष्य भूमिपम् || २-६६-१
कौसल्या बाष्प पूर्ण अक्षी विविधम् शोक कर्शिता |
उपगृह्य शिरः राज्ञः कैकेयीम् प्रत्यभाषत || २-६६-२_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the aforesaid deceased king, who looked like a fully extinguished fire, a
waterless ocean and a lusterless sun, Kausalya holding the king's head on her lap with her eyes
full of tears and who was stricken with grief of various sorts, spoke to Kausalya as follows:_END

B_2_C_63_32
BEGIN_
तत् एतान् मिथुनम् वृद्धम् चिर कालभृतम् मया |
मयि पन्चत्वम् आपन्ने काम् वृत्तिम् वर्तयिष्यति || २-६३-३४_END
BEGIN_
'By what means of livelihood this elderly couple, maintained since a long time by
me, support themselves when I obtain my death?'_END

B_2_C_65_17
BEGIN_
ते च दृष्ट्वा तथा सुप्ते शुभे देव्यौ च तम् नृपम् || २-६५-१९
सुप्तमे वोद्गतप्राणमन्तः पुरमन्यत |_END
BEGIN_
The persons in the gynaecium, having seen those distinguished queens in slumber and
also the king in that manner, thought that the king had lost his life while just sleeping._END

B_2_C_64_23
BEGIN_
सप्तधा तु फलेन्मूर्धा मुनौ तपसि तिष्ठति |
ज्ञानाद्विसृजतः शस्त्रम् तादृशे ब्रह्मचारिणि || २-६४-२५_END
BEGIN_
"The head of a dispatcher of a weapon with a knowledge of the matter on a sage
established in austerity or such an unmarried student practicing sacred study, gets burst into
seven pieces."_END

B_2_C_66_1
BEGIN_
सकामा भव कैकेयि भुन्क्ष्व राज्यम् अकण्टकम् |
त्यक्त्वा राजानम् एक अग्रा नृशंसे दुष्ट चारिणि || २-६६-३_END
BEGIN_
"O Kaikeyi the cruel one and the doer of evils! You be there, having fulfilled your
desires. Deserting the king, you can enjoy the kingdom undisturbed and without any hindrance._END

B_2_C_63_33
BEGIN_
वृद्धौ च माता पितराव् अहम् च एक इषुणा हतः |
केन स्म निहताः सर्वे सुबालेन अकृत आत्मना || २-६३-३५_END
BEGIN_
"I and my aged parents are killed by a single arrow. By a man without self control
and being very much a fool, all of as are virtually killed."_END

B_2_C_65_18
BEGIN_
ततः प्रचुक्रुशुर् दीनाः सस्वरम् ता वर अन्गनाः || २-६५-२०
करेणवैव अरण्ये स्थान प्रच्युत यूथपाः |_END
BEGIN_
Then, those beautiful women miserably cried loudly with their voice, like female
elephants crying when their group leader an elephant was removed from their place in the
forest._END

B_2_C_64_24
BEGIN_
अज्ञानाद्द् हि कृतम् यस्मात् इदम् तेन एव जीवसि |
अपि हि अद्य कुलम् नस्यात् राघवाणाम् कुतः भवान् || २-६४-२६_END
BEGIN_
"You are still surviving because you have done it unknowingly. Not even you, but
today the whole of Ikshvaaku dynasty would have been no more, if it is not the case."_END

B_2_C_66_2
BEGIN_
विहाय माम् गतः रामः भर्ता च स्वर् गतः मम |
विपथे सार्थ हीना इव न अहम् जीवितुम् उत्सहे || २-६६-४_END
BEGIN_
"Rama has left me and gone to the forest. My husband too has left for heaven. I do
not wish to live, as one left behind by a caravan in a wrong road."_END

B_2_C_63_34
BEGIN_
तम् गिरम् करुणाम् श्रुत्वा मम धर्म अनुकान्क्षिणः |
कराभ्याम् सशरम् चापम् व्यथितस्य अपतत् भुवि || २-६३-३६_END
BEGIN_
"Hearing those pitiable words and since I was always intent on righteousness, I felt
distressed. The bow and arrow fell down from my hands to the ground."_END

B_2_C_65_19
BEGIN_
तासाम् आक्रन्द शब्देन सहसा उद्गत चेतने || २-६५-२१
कौसल्या च सुमित्राच त्यक्त निद्रे बभूवतुः |_END
BEGIN_
Kausalya and Sumitra suddenly obtained consciousness by the sound of their cries and
woke up from sleep._END

B_2_C_64_25
BEGIN_
नय नौ नृप तम् देशम् इति माम् च अभ्यभाषत |
अद्य तम् द्रष्टुम् इच्चावः पुत्रम् पश्चिम दर्शनम् || २-६४-२७
रुधिरेण अवसित अन्गम् प्रकीर्ण अजिन वाससम् |
शयानम् भुवि निह्सम्ज्ञम् धर्म राज वशम् गतम् || २-६४-२८_END
BEGIN_
"He spoke to me thus: "O, king! Now we want to see, as our last look, our son whose
body is drenched in blood, with his garment of deer-skin scattered from him, lying unconscious on
the ground and who is subjected to the dominion of Yama(god of death) . Take both of us to that
place."_END

B_2_C_66_3
BEGIN_
भर्तारम् तम् परित्यज्य का स्त्री दैवतम् आत्मनः |
इच्चेज् जीवितुम् अन्यत्र कैकेय्याः त्यक्त धर्मणः || २-६६-५_END
BEGIN_
"Which woman would wish to survive, leaving her husband who was divine, except
Kaikeyi who kicked off righteousness?"_END

B_2_C_63_35
BEGIN_
तस्याहम् करुणम् श्रुत्वा निशि लालपतो बहु |
सम्भ्रानतः शोकवेगेन भृशमास विचेतनः || २-६३-३७_END
BEGIN_
"Hearing his pathetic cry, weeping profusely during the night, I became unconscious
frequently, utterly bewildered as I was, due to flare-up of my grief."_END

B_2_C_65_20
BEGIN_
कौसल्या च सुमित्रा च दृष्ट्वा स्पृष्ट्वा च पार्थिवम् || २-६५-२२
हा नाथ इति परिक्रुश्य पेततुर् धरणी तले |_END
BEGIN_
Kausalya and Sumitra, on seeing and touching king Dasaratha, cried �O, Lord!' and
fell on the ground._END

B_2_C_64_26
BEGIN_
अथ अहम् एकः तम् देशम् नीत्वा तौ भृश दुह्खितौ |
अस्पर्शयम् अहम् पुत्रम् तम् मुनिम् सह भार्यया || २-६४-२९_END
BEGIN_
"Thereafter, taking both of them, who were weeping profusely, to that place, I for
one made that sage and his wife to touch their son."_END

B_2_C_66_4
BEGIN_
न लुब्धो बुध्यते दोषान् किम् पाकम् इव भक्षयन् |
कुब्जा निमित्तम् कैकेय्या राघवाणान् कुलम् हतम् || २-६६-६_END
BEGIN_
"A greedy person cannot understand one's faults, like one who eats a forbidden dish.
Due to that hump- backed woman, Kaikeyi has ruined the race of Raghu dynasty."_END

B_2_C_63_36
BEGIN_
तम् देशम् अहम् आगम्य दीन सत्त्वः सुदुर्मनाः |
अपश्यम् इषुणा तीरे सरय्वाः तापसम् हतम् || २-६३-३८
अवकीर्णजटाभारम् प्रविद्धकलशोदकम् |
पासुशोणितदिग्धाङ्गम् शयानम् शल्यपीडितम् || २-६३-३९_END
BEGIN_
"Distressed in mind and with much sorrowful feeling, I reached that place and saw
the ascetic, hit by the arrow at the bank of Sarayu River, with his tresses of hair scattered, his
pitcher of water thrown asunder, having his limbs anointed with sand and blood lying down as he
was, hurt by the arrow."_END

B_2_C_65_21
BEGIN_
सा कोसल इन्द्र दुहिता वेष्टमाना मही तले || २-६५-२३
न बभ्राज रजो ध्वस्ता तारा इव गगन च्युता |_END
BEGIN_
Rolling on the floor and covered by dust, Kausalya the daughter of Kosala king was
not shining as before and resembled a star falling down from the sky._END

B_2_C_64_27
BEGIN_
तौ पुत्रम् आत्मनः स्पृष्ट्वा तम् आसाद्य तपस्विनौ |
निपेततुः शरीरे अस्य पिता च अस्य इदम् अब्रवीत् || २-६४-३०_END
BEGIN_
"Approaching their son, that miserable couple touched their son's body and fell on
it . Then, his father spoke as follows."_END

B_2_C_66_5
BEGIN_
अनियोगे नियुक्तेन राज्ञा रामम् विवासितम् |
सभार्यम् जनकः श्रुत्वा पतितप्स्यति अहम् यथा || २-६६-७_END
BEGIN_
"Hearing Rama along with his wife have been sent to exile by the king as he was
coerced as he was (Kaikeyi) to do an unworthy act, Janaka will profusely lament as I do."_END

B_2_C_63_37
BEGIN_
स माम् उद्वीक्ष्य नेत्राभ्याम् त्रस्तम् अस्वस्थ चेतसम् |
इति उवाच वचः क्रूरम् दिधक्षन्न् इव तेजसा || || २-६३-४०_END
BEGIN_
Looking up with his eyes, as if going to scorch with his glory, at me who stood
terrified and sick in mind, he spoke those harsh words then:_END

B_2_C_65_22
BEGIN_
नृपे शान्तगुणे जाते कौसल्याम् पतिताम् भुवि || २-६५-२४
आपश्यंस्ताः स्त्रियः सर्वा हताम् नागवधूमिव |_END
BEGIN_
While the king was deceased, all the women saw Kausalya who fell on the floor
appearing as a female elephant, which was killed and felled on the ground._END

B_2_C_64_28
BEGIN_
न न्व् अहम् ते प्रियः पुत्र मातरम् पश्य धार्मिक |
किम् नु न आलिन्गसे पुत्र सुकुमार वचो वद || २-६४-३१_END
BEGIN_
"My dear boy! You are not offering salutation to me, nor do you talk to me. Why are
you sleeping on the floor? Are you angry?"_END

B_2_C_63_38
BEGIN_
किम् तव अपकृतम् राजन् वने निवसता मया |
जिहीर्षिउर् अम्भो गुर्व् अर्थम् यद् अहम् ताडितः त्वया || २-६३-४१_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! I, who was carrying water for my parents, was hit by you. What was the
harm done to you by me who is residing in a forest?"_END

B_2_C_66_6
BEGIN_
स मामनाथाम् विधवाम् नाद्य जानाति धार्मिकः |
रामः कमल पत्र अक्षो जीव नाशम् इतः गतः || २-६६-८_END
BEGIN_
"Rama the pious man who is possessed of like lotus leaves, and who has disappeared
from here even though living, now does not know me to have because a support -less widow._END

B_2_C_65_23
BEGIN_
ततः सर्वा नरेन्द्रस्य कैकेयीप्रमुखाः स्त्रियः || २-६५-२५
रुदन्त्यः शोकसन्तप्ता निपेतुर्गतचेतनाः |_END
BEGIN_
Kaikeyi and all other wives of king Dasaratha were weeping afflicted by grief and
fell unconscious._END

B_2_C_64_29
BEGIN_
न त्वहम् ते प्रियः पुत्र मातरम् पस्य धार्मिक |
किम् नु नालिङ्गसे पुत्र सुकुमार वचो वद || २-६४-३२_END
BEGIN_
"O, righteous son! I am beloved to you. Otherwise, see your mother. Why are you not
embracing, my son? Utter some words, O delicate youth!"_END

B_2_C_63_39
BEGIN_
एकेन खलु बाणेन मर्मणि अभिहते मयि |
द्वाव् अन्धौ निहतौ वृद्धौ माता जनयिता च मे || २-६३-४२_END
BEGIN_
'Being hit on my secret part by a single arrow, you virtually killed both my mother
and father, who are blind and aged.'_END

B_2_C_66_7
BEGIN_
विदेह राजस्य सुता तहा सीता तपस्विनी |
दुह्खस्य अनुचिता दुह्खम् वने पर्युद्विजिष्यति || २-६६-९_END
BEGIN_
"Even so, Sita, the daughter of king of Videha, the pitiable lady and who is
unworthy of lamentation, will get frightened with grief in the forest._END

B_2_C_65_24
BEGIN_
ताभिः स बलवान्नादः क्रोशन्तीभिरनुद्रुतः || २-६५-२६
येन स्फीतीकृतो भूयस्तद्गृहम् समनादयत् |_END
BEGIN_
That great noise was supplemented by those wailing women, bloated by which, it
rendered the house all the more noisy._END

B_2_C_67_0
BEGIN_
आक्रन्दितनिरानन्दा सास्रकम्ठजनाविला |
आयोध्यायामतितता सा व्यतीयाय शर्वरी || २-६७-१_END
BEGIN_
That night in Ayodhya, which was joyless in a weeping tone and thronged with people
with tears in their throats, slowly passed over._END

B_2_C_64_30
BEGIN_
कस्य वा अपर रात्रे अहम् श्रोष्यामि हृदयम् गमम् |
अधीयानस्य मधुरम् शास्त्रम् वा अन्यद् विशेषतः || २-६४-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Whose sweet and heart touching voice, reciting one sacred text or the other in
particular at the end of the night, shall I hear from now?"_END

B_2_C_63_40
BEGIN_
तौ नूनम् दुर्बलाव् अन्धौ मत् प्रतीक्षौ पिपासितौ |
चिरम् आशा कृताम् तृष्णाम् कष्टाम् संधारयिष्यतः || २-६३-४३_END
BEGIN_
"Both of them, weak blind and thirsty, might have refrained their thirst with
difficulty and waited with expectation of my arrival since long. I am sure."_END

B_2_C_66_8
BEGIN_
नदताम् भीम घोषाणाम् निशासु मृग पक्षिणाम् |
निशम्य नूनम् संस्त्रस्ता राघवम् संश्रयिष्यति || २-६६-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Greatly alarmed to hear the fearful cries of wild animals and birds making their
noises in nights, surely she will cling herself to Rama._END

B_2_C_65_25
BEGIN_
तत् समुत्त्रस्त सम्भ्रान्तम् पर्युत्सुक जन आकुलम् || २-६५-२७
सर्वतः तुमुल आक्रन्दम् परिताप आर्त बान्धवम् |
सद्यो निपतित आनन्दम् दीन विक्लव दर्शनम् || २-६५-२८
बभूव नर देवस्य सद्म दिष्ट अन्तम् ईयुषः |_END
BEGIN_
That gynaecium of the king who met his appointed end was filled with people who felt
bewildered with fear and restlessness, with tumultuous wail all around, and crowded with relatives
disturbed by sorrow, with happiness withered away in it suddenly and became a sight of misery and
despondency._END

B_2_C_67_1
BEGIN_
व्यतीतायाम् तु शर्वर्याम् आदित्यस्य उदये ततः |
समेत्य राज कर्तारः सभाम् ईयुर् द्विजातयः || २-६७-२_END
BEGIN_
At sunrise, when the night had passed over, the Brahmins who place a king on the
throne, together gathered at the assembly._END

B_2_C_64_31
BEGIN_
को माम् संध्याम् उपास्य एव स्नात्वा हुत हुत अशनः |
श्लाघयिष्यति उपासीनः पुत्र शोक भय अर्दितम् || २-६४-३४_END
BEGIN_
"O, son! Who after taking bath, worshipping the goddess of dawn, and offering
oblations in fire, will be sitting beside me and talking confidently looking at me, as I was
afflicted with grief and fear?"_END

B_2_C_63_41
BEGIN_
न नूनम् तपसो वा अस्ति फल योगः श्रुतस्य वा |
पिता यन् माम् न जानाति शयानम् पतितम् भुवि || २-६३-४४_END
BEGIN_
'Surely, our (mine or father's) religious austerity or sacred knowledge have not
borne fruit because my father does not have information about me, having fallen down and lying on
the ground.'_END

B_2_C_66_9
BEGIN_
वृद्धः चैव अल्प पुत्रः च वैदेहीम् अनिचिन्तयन् |
सो अपि शोक समाविष्टः ननु त्यक्ष्यति जीवितम् || २-६६-११_END
BEGIN_
"Janaka too who is aged, and who is not having sons, will be thinking of Sita, over
whelmed with grief and will surely abandon his life._END

B_2_C_65_26
BEGIN_
अतीतम् आज्ञाय तु पार्थिव ऋषभम् |
यशस्विनम् सम्परिवार्य पत्नयः |
भृशम् रुदन्त्यः करुणम् सुदुह्खिताः |
प्रगृह्य बाहू व्यलपन्न् अनाथवत् || २-६५-२९._END
BEGIN_
Knowing that the glorious king of excellence had passed away, the king's wives
surrounded him with great sorrow; pitiably wailing profusely and lamented, grasping their hands one
another, like orphans._END

B_2_C_67_2
BEGIN_
मार्कण्डेयो अथ मौद्गल्यो वामदेवः च काश्यपः |
कात्ययनो गौतमः च जाबालिः च महा यशाः || २-६७-३
एते द्विजाः सह अमात्यैः पृथग् वाचम् उदीरयन् |
वसिष्ठम् एव अभिमुखाः श्रेष्ठः राज पुरोहितम् || २-६७-४_END
BEGIN_
Markandeya, Moudgalya, Vamadeva, Kasyapa,Katyayana, Goutama and the greatly famous
Jabali-all these Brahmans together with the ministers turned towards the excellent royal priest
Vasishta and one by one spoke as follows:_END

B_2_C_64_32
BEGIN_
कन्द मूल फलम् हृत्वा को माम् प्रियम् इव अतिथिम् |
भोजयिष्यति अकर्मण्यम् अप्रग्रहम् अनायकम् || २-६४-३५_END
BEGIN_
"Who will feed me, like a beloved guest is fed, with roots and fruits while I am
sitting without any work, without fetching anything and without having any guide making me to
walk?"_END

B_2_C_63_42
BEGIN_
जानन्न् अपि च किम् कुर्यात् अशक्तिर् अपरिक्रमः |
चिद्यमानम् इव अशक्तः त्रातुम् अन्यो नगो नगम् || २-६३-४५_END
BEGIN_
"What my disabled father, unable to walk around can do, even if he knows like a tree
unable to protect another tree which is being cut off?"_END

B_2_C_66_10
BEGIN_
साहमद्यैव दिष्टान्तम् गमिष्यामि पतिव्रता |
इदम् शरीरमालिङ्ग्य प्रवेक्ष्यामि हुताशनम् || २-६६-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Today itself, I too in devotion to my husband, will meet my appointed end. I shall
enter the fire, duly embracing this body of my husband._END

B_2_C_67_3
BEGIN_
अतीता शर्वरी दुह्खम् या नो वर्ष शत उपमा |
अस्मिन् पन्चत्वम् आपन्ने पुत्र शोकेन पार्थिवे || २-६७-५_END
BEGIN_
"King Dasaratha having obtained death due to grief born of separation from his sons
(Rama and Lakshmana), the night which burdened like a hundred years, has passed over with great
difficulty."_END

B_2_C_64_33
BEGIN_
इमाम् अन्धाम् च वृद्धाम् च मातरम् ते तपस्विनीम् |
कथम् पुत्र भरिष्यामि कृपणाम् पुत्र गर्धिनीम् || २-६४-३६_END
BEGIN_
O, delicate youth! How can I support your mother, who is blind, aged and a poor
woman in a pitiable condition, longing for her son?"_END

B_2_C_63_43
BEGIN_
पितुस् त्वम् एव मे गत्वा शीघ्रम् आचक्ष्व राघव |
न त्वाम् अनुदहेत् क्रुद्धो वनम् वह्निर् इव एधितः || २-६३-४६_END
BEGIN_
'O, Dasaratha! Going there soon, you alone tell my father; so that he will not
scorch you by his anger, as a forest is scorched by a flared-up fire.'_END

B_2_C_66_11
BEGIN_
ताम् ततः सम्परिष्वज्य विलपन्तीम् तपस्विनीम् |
व्यपनिन्युः सुदुह्ख आर्ताम् कौसल्याम् व्यावहारिकाः || २-६६-१३_END
BEGIN_
The chamberlains reverently removed from that place that unfortunate Kausalya, who
was in excess of her grief and was closely embracing her dead husband._END

B_2_C_64_34
BEGIN_
तिष्ठ मा मा गमः पुत्र यमस्य सदनम् प्रति |
श्वो मया सह गन्ता असि जनन्या च समेधितः || २-६४-३७_END
BEGIN_
"O, son! Come to a halt. Do not go to Yama's abode. You can proceed tomorrow with me
and with your mother."_END

B_2_C_67_4
BEGIN_
स्वर् गतः च महा राजो रामः च अरण्यम् आश्रितः |
लक्ष्मणः च अपि तेजस्वी रामेण एव गतः सह || २-६७-६_END
BEGIN_
"The monarch has gone to heaven. Rama took retreat in a forest. The brilliant
Lakshmana followed suit and went along with Rama."_END

B_2_C_63_44
BEGIN_
इयम् एक पदी राजन् यतः मे पितुर् आश्रमः |
तम् प्रसादय गत्वा त्वम् न त्वाम् स कुपितः शपेत् || २-६३-४७_END
BEGIN_
'O, king! This foot-path will lead you to my father's hermitage. After going there,
seek his graciousness, lest he should get angry and execrate you."_END

B_2_C_66_12
BEGIN_
तैल द्रोण्याम् अथ अमात्याः सम्वेश्य जगती पतिम् |
राज्ञः सर्वाणि अथ आदिष्टाः चक्रुः कर्माणि अनन्तरम् || २-६६-१४_END
BEGIN_
The ministers assigned for the job kept the king in an oil trough and did all the
acts that were to be done therafter._END

B_2_C_67_5
BEGIN_
उभौ भरत शत्रुघ्नौ क्केकयेषु परम् तपौ |
पुरे राज गृहे रम्ये मातामह निवेशने || २-६७-७_END
BEGIN_
"Both Bharata and Satrughna, the annihilator of enemies, are encamped in the
beautiful house of their maternal uncle in the city of Rajagriha in the kingdom of Kekaya."_END

B_2_C_64_35
BEGIN_
उभाव् अपि च शोक आर्ताव् अनाथौ कृपणौ वने |
क्षिप्रम् एव गमिष्यावः त्वया हीनौ यम क्षयम् || २-६४-३८_END
BEGIN_
"Bereft of you, afflicted with grief, without any protection in the forest and poor,
both of us also will come soon along with you to Yama's abode."_END

B_2_C_63_45
BEGIN_
विशल्यम् कुरु माम् राजन् मर्म मे निशितः शरः |
रुणद्धि मृदु स उत्सेधम् तीरम् अम्बु रयो यथा || २-६३-४८_END
BEGIN_
'O, king! Extract this arrow-head from my body. This sharp arrow torments my
delicate vital part in the same way as a river-current corrodes the sandy bank, which is at a
height.'_END

B_2_C_66_13
BEGIN_
न तु सम्कलनम् राज्ञो विना पुत्रेण मन्त्रिणः |
सर्वज्ञाः कर्तुम् ईषुस् ते ततः रक्षन्ति भूमिपम् || २-६६-१५_END
BEGIN_
The ministers who were knowing all such matters were not willing to do cremation for
the king in the absence of his sons and that is why preserved the king's body .(in an oil
through)._END

B_2_C_64_36
BEGIN_
ततः वैवस्वतम् दृष्ट्वा तम् प्रवक्ष्यामि भारतीम् |
क्षमताम् धर्म राजो मे बिभृयात् पितराव् अयम् || २-६४-३९_END
BEGIN_
"Thereafter, seeing Yama, I shall tell these words to him. �O, Yama! Excuse me. Let
this boy nourish his parents.' "_END

B_2_C_67_6
BEGIN_
इक्ष्वाकूणाम् इह अद्य एव कश्चित् राजा विधीयताम् |
अराजकम् हि नो राष्ट्रम् न विनाशम् अवाप्नुयात् || २-६७-८_END
BEGIN_
"Hence, let anyone here in Ikshvaku dynasty be made a king today itself lest our
nation without a king should result in a collapse indeed."_END

B_2_C_63_46
BEGIN_
सशल्यः क्लिश्यते प्राणैर्विशल्यो विनशिष्यति |
इति मामविशच्चिन्ता तस्य शल्यापकर्षणे || २-६३-४९_END
BEGIN_
"While extracting the arrow-head from him, this thought entered my mind. With
arrow-head in his body he will suffer, even though surviving. But after extracting the arrow-head,
he will die."_END

B_2_C_66_14
BEGIN_
तैल द्रोण्याम् तु सचिवैः शायितम् तम् नर अधिपम् |
हा मृतः अयम् इति ज्ञात्वा स्त्रियः ताः पर्यदेवयन् || २-६६-१६_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that the king was laid down in an oil through by the ministers those women in
