the gynaacium cried "Alas! He is dead!"_END

B_2_C_64_37
BEGIN_
दातुमर्हति धर्मात्मा लोकपालो महायशाः |
ईदृषस्य ममाक्षय्या मेकामभयदक्षिणाम् || २-६४-४०_END
BEGIN_
"The most glorious and high souled Yama, the guardian of the world will be obliged
to give this solitary imperishable boon in the form of fearlessness to me, who is in such a
condition."_END

B_2_C_67_7
BEGIN_
न अराजले जन पदे विद्युन् माली महा स्वनः |
अभिवर्षति पर्जन्यो महीम् दिव्येन वारिणा || २-६७-९_END
BEGIN_
"Lightning clouds in the sky with a great noise of thunder, will not yield rain on
the land in a country without a king."_END

B_2_C_63_47
BEGIN_
दुःखितस्य च दीनस्य मम शोकातुरस्य च |
लक्ष्यामास हृदये चिन्ताम् मुनिसुत स्तदा || २-६३-५०_END
BEGIN_
"Then, the son of the sage perceived worry in the heart of myself, who was lamenting
pitiably, suffering from anguish."_END

B_2_C_66_15
BEGIN_
बाहून् उद्यम्य कृपणा नेत्र प्रस्रवणैः मुखैः |
रुदन्त्यः शोक सम्तप्ताः कृपणम् पर्यदेवयन् || २-६६-१७_END
BEGIN_
Crying their faces with eyes flowing with tears, the miserable women through up
their arms, stricken with grief as they were and pitiably lamented as follows:_END

B_2_C_64_38
BEGIN_
अपापो असि यथा पुत्र निहतः पाप कर्मणा |
तेन सत्येन गच्च आशु ये लोकाः शस्त्र योधिनाम् || २-६४-४१_END
BEGIN_
"O, son! This criminal killed you. As it is true that you were sinless, you will
soon obtain the realms as reached by those who die fighting with weapons."_END

B_2_C_67_8
BEGIN_
न अराजके जन पदे बीज मुष्टिः प्रकीर्यते |
न अराकके पितुः पुत्रः भार्या वा वर्तते वशे || २-६७-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Even a fist of seeds are not disbursed in a ruler- less land. In anarchy, even a
son is not amenable to the control of a father nor a wife in the authority of her husband."_END

B_2_C_63_48
BEGIN_
ताम्यमानः स माम् दुःखादुवाच परमार्तवत् |
सीदमानो विवृत्ताङ्गो वेष्टमानो गतः क्षयम् || २-६३-५१_END
BEGIN_
Sinking into despondency with distress, distorting his limbs in agony, coiling round
himself on the floor with extreme pain and having approached the end of his life, he spoke to me
(as follows) with great difficulty._END

B_2_C_66_16
BEGIN_
हा महाराज रामेण सततम् प्रियवादिना |
विहीनाः सत्यसन्धेन किमर्थम् विजहासि नः || २-६६-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Alas! Great king! When we are already deprived of Rama who speaks lovingly and who
always keeps up his promise, why have you left us?"_END

B_2_C_64_39
BEGIN_
यान्ति शूरा गतिम् याम् च सम्ग्रामेष्व् अनिवर्तिनः |
हताः तु अभिमुखाः पुत्र गतिम् ताम् परमाम् व्रज || २-६४-४२_END
BEGIN_
"O, son! Move on to that which is the highest state, which is obtained by the
warriors, who do not return even while being killed, from the direction facing their enemies in
battles."_END

B_2_C_67_9
BEGIN_
अराजके धनम् न अस्ति न अस्ति भार्या अपि अराजके |
इदम् अत्याहितम् च अन्यत् कुतः सत्यम् अराजके || २-६७-११_END
BEGIN_
"In a rulerless land, there is no wealth. Where there is no king, there is no
(faithful) wife. Another very dangerous thing is there. In a ruler less territory, how can there be
truth? "_END

B_2_C_63_49
BEGIN_
संस्तभ्य धैर्येण स्थिरचित्तो भवाम्यहम् |
ब्रह्महत्याकृतम् पापम् हृदयादपनीयताम् || २-६३-५२_END
BEGIN_
'Suppressing my grief with firmness, I am becoming stable-minded. Let the torment in
your heart, caused by the thought of your having killed Brahmana be removed.'_END

B_2_C_66_17
BEGIN_
कैकेय्या दुष्टभावाया राघवेण वियोजिताः |
कथम् पतिघ्न्या वत्स्यामः समीपे विधवा वयम् || २-६६-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Far in distance from Rama, how shall we without our husband, live in proximity to
Kaikeyi of wretched nature, who killed her husband?_END

B_2_C_64_40
BEGIN_
याम् गतिम् सगरः शैब्यो दिलीपो जनमेजयः |
नहुषो धुन्धुमारः च प्राप्ताः ताम् गच्च पुत्रक || २-६४-४३_END
BEGIN_
"Obtain the destiny which was obtained by Sagara, Saibya, Dilipa, Janamejeya,
Nahusha and Dundumara."_END

B_2_C_67_10
BEGIN_
न अराजके जन पदे कारयन्ति सभाम् नराः |
उद्यानानि च रम्याणि हृष्टाः पुण्य गृहाणि च || २-६७-१२_END
BEGIN_
"In a ruler- less country, people do not cause to make a delightful assembly nor
erect beautiful parks or temples."_END

B_2_C_68_0
BEGIN_
तेषाम् तत् वचनम् श्रुत्वा वसिष्ठः प्रत्युवाच ह |
मित्र अमात्य गणान् सर्वान् ब्राह्मणांस् तान् इदम् वचः || २-६८-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing their words, Vasistha replied thus to that group of friends as well as
ministers and to all the Brahmans (assembled there):_END

B_2_C_63_50
BEGIN_
न द्विजातिर् अहम् राजन् मा भूत् ते मनसो व्यथा |
शूद्रायाम् अस्मि वैश्येन जातः जन पद अधिप || २-६३-५३_END
BEGIN_
'O, king the ruler of the country! I am not a Brahmana. Let there be no agony in
your mind. I am born through a Sudra woman by a Vysya._END

B_2_C_66_18
BEGIN_
स हि नाथः सदास्माकम् तव च प्रभुरात्मवान् |
वनम् रामो गतः श्रीमान् विहाय नृपतिश्रियम् || २-६६-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Rama, a protector to you and all of us as well as a capable, prudent and an eminent
man, has indeed gone on exile to the forest, leaving this lovely kingdom._END

B_2_C_64_41
BEGIN_
या गतिः सर्व साधूनाम् स्वाध्यायात् पतसः च या |
भूमिदस्य आहित अग्नेः चएक पत्नी व्रतस्य च || २-६४-४४
गो सहस्र प्रदातृऋणाम् या या गुरुभृताम् अपि |
देह न्यास कृताम् या च ताम् गतिम् गच्च पुत्रक || २-६४-४५_END
BEGIN_
"O, son! Obtain that destiny, which is obtained by all the sages, by those who
studied scriptures, by an act of austerity, by a gift of the land, by him who has maintained sacred
fire, who has taken a vow of marrying a single wife, who gifts a thousand cows, who are owed to the
service of the preceptor and that which is obtained by those who have abandoned their body (by
journeying to Himalayan Mountains, or drowning themselves in water or leaping into the flames)"_END

B_2_C_67_11
BEGIN_
न अराजके जन पदे यज्ञ शीला द्विजातयः |
सत्राणि अन्वासते दान्ता ब्राह्मणाः संशित व्रताः || २-६७-१३_END
BEGIN_
"In a ruler- less territory, those who frequently perform sacrificial rites, those
who have self-restraint, those who firmly adhere to a vow as well as Brahmins do not carry out Soma
sacrifices."_END

B_2_C_68_1
BEGIN_
यद् असौ मातुल कुले पुरे राज गृहे सुखी |
भरतः वसति भ्रात्रा शत्रुघ्नेन समन्वितः || २-६८-२
तत् शीघ्रम् जवना दूता गच्चन्तु त्वरितैः हयैः |
आनेतुम् भ्रातरौ वीरौ किम् समीक्षामहे वयम् || २-६८-३_END
BEGIN_
"Bharata, who was given kingdom (by Dasaratha) is staying very happily in his
maternal uncle's home, along with Satrughna. Hence messengers in fast running horses are to be sent
quickly to bring back those heroic brothers. What are we to think of further in this matter?"_END

B_2_C_63_51
BEGIN_
इति इव वदतः कृच्च्रात् बाण अभिहत मर्मणः |
विघूर्णतो विचेष्टस्य वेपमाचस्य भूतले || २-६३-५४
तस्य तु आनम्यमानस्य तम् बाणम् अहम् उद्धरम् |
तस्य त्वानम्यमानस्य तम् बाणामहमुद्धरम् || २-६३-५५_END
BEGIN_
"While he was speaking in that manner with great difficulty, his vital part having
been hit by an arrow and was rolling on the ground, now exerting himself, now trembling and
sinking, I drew out that arrow from him. That sage looked up towards me in fear and relinquished
his life."_END

B_2_C_66_19
BEGIN_
त्वया तेन च वीरेण विना व्यसनमोहिताः |
कथम् वयम् निवत्स्यामः कैकेय्या च विदूषिताः || २-६६-२१_END
BEGIN_
"How can we, being disgraced by Kaikeyi, and stupefied by evil passion, live without
you and the heroic Rama."_END

B_2_C_64_42
BEGIN_
न हि तु अस्मिन् कुले जातः गच्चति अकुशलाम् गतिम् |
स तु यास्यति येन त्वम् निहतो मम बान्धवः || २-६४-४६_END
BEGIN_
"The one born in the race of sages will not obtain an unsafe destiny. The person,
who killed you, my son, will obtain that bad destiny."_END

B_2_C_67_12
BEGIN_
न अराजके जनपदे महायज्ञेषु यज्वनः |
ब्राह्मणा वसुसम्पन्ना विसृजन्त्याप्तदक्षिणाः || २-६७-१४_END
BEGIN_
"In a rulerless land, Brahmans who obtained wealth and sacrificers in great
sacrificial rites do not bestow proper gifts"_END

B_2_C_68_2
BEGIN_
गच्चन्तु इति ततः सर्वे वसिष्ठम् वाक्यम् अब्रुवन् |
तेषाम् तत् वचनम् श्रुत्वा वसिष्ठो वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् || २-६८-४_END
BEGIN_
Then all of them uttered words agreeing to send the messengers quickly. Hearing
their words, Vasistha spoke as follows:_END

B_2_C_63_52
BEGIN_
जल आर्द्र गात्रम् तु विलप्य कृच्चान् |
मर्म व्रणम् सम्ततम् उच्चसन्तम् |
ततः सरय्वाम् तम् अहम् शयानम् |
समीक्ष्य भद्रे सुभृशम् विषण्णः || २-६३-५६_END
BEGIN_
"O, my dear Kausalya! Seeing him, with his body drenched in water, weeping with
anguish, unceasingly sighing his breath, with injury in his vital part and lying down in River
Sarayu as he was, I became very much grief-stricken."_END

B_2_C_66_20
BEGIN_
यया तु राजा रामश्च लक्ष्मणश्च महाबलः |
सीतया सह सम्त्य्क्ताः सा कमन्यम् न हास्यति || २-६६-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Whom else will Kaikeyi by whom have been abandoned the king as well as Rama along
with Lakshmana great strength and Sita- not abandon?_END

B_2_C_64_43
BEGIN_
एवम् स कृपणम् तत्र पर्यदेवयत असकृत् |
ततः अस्मै कर्तुम् उदकम् प्रवृत्तः सह भार्यया || २-६४-४७_END
BEGIN_
"Thus, that sage repeatedly wept there pitiably. Then he, along with his wife,
started doing the ceremony of offering water to his demised son."_END

B_2_C_67_13
BEGIN_
न अराजके जन पदे प्रभूत नट नर्तकाः |
उत्सवाः च समाजाः च वर्धन्ते राष्ट्र वर्धनाः || २-६७-१५_END
BEGIN_
"In a ruler- less territory, festivals and gatherings exalting the kingdom in which
actors, and dancers exhibit their talents are not frequently arranged"_END

B_2_C_68_3
BEGIN_
एहि सिद्ध अर्थ विजय जयन्त अशोक नन्दन |
श्रूयताम् इतिकर्तव्यम् सर्वान् एव ब्रवीमि वः || २-६८-५_END
BEGIN_
"O, Siddhartha! O, Jay anta! O, Vijaya! O, Ashoka! O, Nandana! Please come. I am
telling you all. Hear that which is to be done"_END

B_2_C_66_21
BEGIN_
ता बाष्पेण च सम्वीताः शोकेन विपुलेन च |
व्यवेष्टन्त निरानन्दा राघवस्य वरस्त्रीयः || २-६६-२३_END
BEGIN_
"With tears and excessive agony, those excellent Dasaratha's wives together in a
row, rolled on the ground, sorrowful as they were."_END

B_2_C_64_44
BEGIN_
स तु दिव्येन रूपेण मुनि पुत्रः स्व कर्मभिः |
स्वर्गमाध्यारुहत् ख्षिप्रम् शक्रेण सह खर्मवित् || २-६४-४८_END
BEGIN_
"The pious son of the sage on his part, soon ascended the Heaven, wearing a
wonderful form along with Indra (the king of celestials) as a result of his own pious acts."_END

B_2_C_68_4
BEGIN_
पुरम् राज गृहम् गत्वा शीघ्रम् शीघ्र जवैः हयैः |
त्यक्त शोकैः इदम् वाच्यः शासनात् भरतः मम || २-६८-६_END
BEGIN_
"After starting quickly from here by traveling in rapidly running horses, you reach
the city of Rajagriha. After relieving yourself of the grief, you have to tell Bharata these words
as my orders:"_END

B_2_C_67_14
BEGIN_
न अरजके जन पदे सिद्ध अर्था व्यवहारिणः |
कथाभिर् अनुरज्यन्ते कथा शीलाः कथा प्रियैः || २-६७-१६_END
BEGIN_
"In a ruler less land, litigants do not get their disputes settled and persons who
have a knack for narrating stories do not gratify story- lovers with their tales."_END

B_2_C_66_22
BEGIN_
निशा नक्षत्र हीना इव स्त्री इव भर्तृ विवर्जिता |
पुरी न अराजत अयोध्या हीना राज्ञा महात्मना || २-६६-२४_END
BEGIN_
The city of Ayodhya, bereft of the high-soled king Dasaratha, was splendour-less, as
a night without moon and as awoman without husband._END

B_2_C_68_5
BEGIN_
पुरोहितः त्वाम् कुशलम् प्राह सर्वे च मन्त्रिणः |
त्वरमाणः च निर्याहि कृत्यम् आत्ययिकम् त्वया || २-६८-७_END
BEGIN_
"The royal priest and other ministers are asking about your welfare. Come forth, by
starting quickly. There is a very urgent work with you."_END

B_2_C_64_45
BEGIN_
आबभाषे च वृद्धौ तौ सह शक्रेण तापसः |
आश्वास्य च मुहूर्तम् तु पितरौ वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् || २-६४-४९_END
BEGIN_
"That son of the sage who was together with Indra, talked to his parents. Consoling
his parents for a while, he spoke the following words."_END

B_2_C_67_15
BEGIN_
न अराजके जनपदे उद्यानानि समागताः |
सायाह्ने क्रीडितुम् यान्ति कुमार्यो हेमभूषिताः || २-६७-१७_END
BEGIN_
"In a ruler less territory, girls adorned in gold do not go together to parks to
play there in the evening."_END

B_2_C_66_23
BEGIN_
बाष्प पर्याकुल जना हाहा भूत कुल अन्गना |
शून्य चत्वर वेश्म अन्ता न बभ्राज यथा पुरम् || २-६६-२५_END
BEGIN_
With people disturbed with tears, with virtuous women raising cries of distress and
with its cross -roads and entrances of houses looking desolate, the city of Ayodhya did not shine
as before._END

B_2_C_68_6
BEGIN_
मा च अस्मै प्रोषितम् रामम् मा च अस्मै पितरम् मृतम् |
भवन्तः शंसिषुर् गत्वा राघवाणाम् इमम् क्षयम् || २-६८-८_END
BEGIN_
"After going there, do not tell him that Rama has gone to exile or that his father
is dead or about this calamity occurred to the descendents of Raghu dynasty."_END

B_2_C_64_46
BEGIN_
स्थानम् अस्मि महत् प्राप्तः भवतोह् परिचारणात् |
भवन्ताव् अपि च क्षिप्रम् मम मूलम् उपैष्यतः || २-६४-५०_END
BEGIN_
"I obtained the supreme state because of my service to both of you. You will also
obtain soon my vicinity."_END

B_2_C_67_16
BEGIN_
न अराजके जन पदे वाहनैः शीघ्र गामिभिः |
नरा निर्यान्ति अरण्यानि नारीभिः सह कामिनः || २-६७-१८_END
BEGIN_
"In a lord less land, lustful men do not go out to woods with ladies in speedily
moving vehicles"_END

B_2_C_66_24
BEGIN_
गत प्रभा द्यौर् इव भास्करम् विना |
व्यपेत नक्षत्र गणा इव शर्वरी |
निवृत्तचारः सहसा गतो रविः |
प्रवृत्तचारा राजनी ह्युपस्थिता || २-६६-२६_END
BEGIN_
While the king has gone to heaven due to grief and while the king's wives were lying
on the ground , the sun suddenly went away retreating its movement. The night approached, with its
darkness having proceeded to spread throughout._END

B_2_C_68_7
BEGIN_
कौशेयानि च वस्त्राणि भूषणानि वराणि च |
क्षिप्रम् आदाय राज्ञः च भरतस्य च गच्चत || २-६८-९_END
BEGIN_
"Go quickly, taking silk clothes and excellent ornaments to the king and to Bharata
"_END

B_2_C_64_47
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्त्वा तु दिव्येन विमानेन वपुष्मता |
आरुरोह दिवम् क्षिप्रम् मुनि पुत्रः जित इन्द्रियः || २-६४-५१_END
BEGIN_
"The son of the sage, whose senses were subdued, thus spoke and by a wonderful aero
plane with beautiful form, quickly reached Heaven."_END

B_2_C_67_17
BEGIN_
न अराकजे जन पदे धनवन्तः सुरक्षिताः |
शेरते विवृत द्वाराः कृषि गो रक्ष जीविनः || २-६७-१९_END
BEGIN_
"In a lord less land, rich people living on agriculture and cattle rearing do not
sleep in their abodes well protected, with their doors open"_END

B_2_C_66_25
BEGIN_
ऋते तु पुत्राद्दहनम् महीपते |
र्नरोचयन्ते सुहृदः समागताः |
इतीव तस्मिन् शयने न्यवेशय |
न्विचिन्त्य राजानमचिन्त्य दर्शनम् || २-६६-२७_END
BEGIN_
The friends and relatives who came there, did not like the king's cremation in the
absence of his sons. Thus thinking, they kept the king of inconceivable sight in that resting
place(oil- trough)_END

B_2_C_68_8
BEGIN_
दत्तपथ्यशना दूताजग्मुः स्वम् स्वम् निवेशनम् |
केकयांस्ते गमिष्यन्तो हयानारुह्य सम्मतान् || २-६८-१०_END
BEGIN_
The messengers, who are going to leave for the land of Kekayas, took sufficient
eatables required on their way and went to their respective houses, by riding on their admirable
horses._END

B_2_C_64_48
BEGIN_
स कृत्वा तु उदकम् तूर्णम् तापसः सह भार्यया |
माम् उवाच महा तेजाः कृत अन्जलिम् उपस्थितम् || २-६४-५२_END
BEGIN_
"That ascetic with great splendor along with his wife soon performed the ceremony
offering water to his dead son and spoke to me, who was standing near him with folded hands."_END

B_2_C_67_18
BEGIN_
न अराजके जनपदे बद्दघण्टा विषाणीनः |
आटन्ति राजमार्गेषु कुञ्जराः षष्टिहायनाः || २-६७-२०_END
BEGIN_
"In a land without emperor, sixty year old elephants with bells tied around their
tusks, do not roam around on royal high ways_END

B_2_C_66_26
BEGIN_
गतप्रभा द्यौरिव भास्करम् विना |
व्यपेतनक्षत्रगणेव शर्वरी |
पुरी बभासे रहिता मह आत्मना |
न च अस्र कण्ठ आकुल मार्ग चत्वरा || २-६६-२८_END
BEGIN_
Deserted by the high-soled Dasaratha, with its roads and cross roads filled with
people choked with tears in their throats, the city of Ayodhya, looking like sky without sun and
night with its multitude of stars disappeared, did not shine with its light having gone away._END

B_2_C_68_9
BEGIN_
ततः प्रास्थानिकम् कृत्वा कार्यशेषमनन्तरम् |
वसिष्ठेनाभ्यनुज्ञाता दूताः सम्त्वरिता ययुः || २-६८-११_END
BEGIN_
Having completed all the remaining preparations for the journey and having been
permitted by Vasistha, the messengers quickly proceeded (to the destination)._END

B_2_C_64_49
BEGIN_
अद्य एव जहि माम् राजन् मरणे न अस्ति मे व्यथा |
यत् शरेण एक पुत्रम् माम् त्वम् अकार्षीर् अपुत्रकम् || २-६४-५३_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! You have made me, without a son, by killing my one and the only one son,
by an arrow. You kill me also now. I am not frightened about death."_END

B_2_C_67_19
BEGIN_
न अराजके जनपदे शरान् सम्ततमस्यताम् |
श्रूयते तलनिर्घोष इष्वस्त्राणामुपासने || २-६७-२१_END
BEGIN_
"In a ruler less land, the noise of plucking the bow string with the palm, produced
by archers continuously discharging arrows while practicing the use of their bows, is not
heard."_END

B_2_C_66_27
BEGIN_
नराः च नार्यः च समेत्य सम्घशो |
विगर्हमाणा भरतस्य मातरम् |
तदा नगर्याम् नर देव सम्क्षये |
बभूवुर् आर्ता न च शर्म लेभिरे || २-६६-२९_END
BEGIN_
After the king's death, men and women in the city converged in groups, abusing
Bharata's mother, became disturbed and did not obtain happiness._END

B_2_C_68_10
BEGIN_
न्यन्तेनापरतालस्य प्रलम्बस्योत्तरम् प्रति |
निषेवमाणास्ते जग्मुर्नदीम् मध्येन मालिनीम् || २-६८-१२_END
BEGIN_
Those messengers went on touching Malini River, flowing between the passing
Aparatala Mountain and the northern end of Pralamba Mountain._END

B_2_C_64_50
BEGIN_
त्वया तु यद् अविज्ञानान् निहतः मे सुतः शुचिः |
तेन त्वाम् अभिशप्स्यामि सुदुह्खम् अतिदारुणम् || २-६४-५४_END
BEGIN_
"Since you have killed my holy son through ignorance, I shall pronounce a most
painful and very cruel curse on you."_END

B_2_C_67_20
BEGIN_
न अराजके जन पदे वणिजो दूर गामिनः |
गच्चन्ति क्षेमम् अध्वानम् बहु पुण्य समाचिताः || २-६७-२२_END
BEGIN_
"In a rulerless land, traders who go to distant places, carrying with them several
merchandises, cannot travel safely in their voyages."_END

B_2_C_68_11
BEGIN_
ते हस्तिनापुरे गङ्गाम् तीर्त्वा प्रत्यङ्मुखा ययुः |
पाञलदेशमासाद्य मध्येन कुरुजाङ्गलम् || २-६८-१३
सरांसि च सुपूर्णानि नदीश्च विमलोदकाः |
निरीक्षमाणास्ते जग्मुर्दूताः कार्यवशाद्द्रुतम् || २-६८-१४_END
BEGIN_
Having crossed Ganga River at Hastinapura, they proceeded towards west and, reaching
Panchala kingdom through Kuru Jangala and observing well filled lakes and rivers with clear water,
the aforesaid messengers went briskly, due to the pressing nature of their mission._END

B_2_C_64_51
BEGIN_
पुत्र व्यसनजम् दुह्खम् यद् एतन् मम साम्प्रतम् |
एवम् त्वम् पुत्र शोकेन राजन् कालम् करिष्यसि || २-६४-५५_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! Even as I am suffering from agony now because of the loss of my son, in
the same manner; you will also die due to agony caused by the loss of your son."_END

B_2_C_67_21
BEGIN_
न अराजके जन पदे चरति एक चरः वशी |
भावयन्न् आत्मना आत्मानम् यत्र सायम् गृहो मुनिः || २-६७-२३_END
BEGIN_
"In a rulerless land, a monk who wanders alone, who has subdued his senses, who
mediates himself on the soul and who takes up an abode wherever evening overtakes him, cannot roam
around the city."_END

B_2_C_68_12
BEGIN_
ते प्रसन्नोदकाम् दिव्याम् नानाविहगसेविताम् |
उपातिजग्मुर्वेगेन शरदण्डाम् जनाकुलाम् || २-६८-१५_END
BEGIN_
They speedily moved on, crossing the beautiful Saradanda River, containing clear
water frequented by various kinds of birds._END

B_2_C_64_52
BEGIN_
अज्ञानात्तु हतो यस्मात् क्षत्रियेण त्वया मुनिः |
तस्मात्त्वाम् नाविशत्याशु ब्रह्महत्या नराधिप || २-६४-५६_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! Since the sage was killed by you, belonging to the warrior class, through
ignorance, the son of killing a Brahmin will not take possession of you."_END

B_2_C_67_22
BEGIN_
न अराजके जन पदे योग क्षेमम् प्रवर्तते |
न च अपि अराजके सेना शत्रून् विषहते युधि || २-६७-२४_END
BEGIN_
"In a rulerless land; gain and security are not duly established. In anarchy, army
cannot conquer enemies in battle."_END

B_2_C_69_0
BEGIN_
याम् एव रात्रिम् ते दूताः प्रविशन्ति स्म ताम् पुरीम् |
भरतेन अपि ताम् रात्रिम् स्वप्नो दृष्टः अयम् अप्रियः || २-६९-१_END
BEGIN_
On that very night those messengers entered the city; Bharata also had experienced
an unpleasant dream._END

B_2_C_68_13
BEGIN_
निकूलवृक्षमासाद्य दिव्यम् सत्योपयाचनम् |
अभिगम्याभिवाद्यम् तम् कुलिङ्गाम् प्राविशन् पुरीम् || २-६८-१६_END
BEGIN_
Reaching a holy coastal tree called Satyopayaachana (so called because prayers made
to it become fulfilled); which was worthy of salutation and going round it clockwise (as a mark of
respect) the messengers entered the city of Kulinga_END

B_2_C_64_53
BEGIN_
त्वामप्येतादृशो भावः क्षिप्रमेव गमिष्यति |
जीवितान्तकरो घोरो दातारमिव दक्षिणा || २-६४-५७_END
BEGIN_
"A feeling similar to this, which makes the life awful and extinct, will indeed
quickly come to you, even as a merit accrues to the donor of a donation to the priest."_END

B_2_C_67_23
BEGIN_
न अराजके जनपदे हृष्टैः परमवाजिभिः |
नराः सम्यान्ति सहसा रथैश्च परिमण्डिताः || २-६७-२५_END
BEGIN_
"In a rulerless land, people beautifully adorned, cannot go fast cheerfully in
excellent horses and chariots."_END

B_2_C_69_1
BEGIN_
व्युष्टाम् एव तु ताम् रात्रिम् दृष्ट्वा तम् स्वप्नम् अप्रियम् |
पुत्रः राज अधिराजस्य सुभृशम् पर्यतप्यत || २-६९-२_END
BEGIN_
Bharata, the son of Dasaratha the paramount sovereign, after seeing that unpleasant
dream just at the dawn of that night, felt very much anguished._END

B_2_C_68_14
BEGIN_
अभिकालम् ततः प्राप्यते बोधिभवनाच्च्युताम् |
पितृपैतामहीम् पुण्याम् तेरुरिक्षुमतीम् नदीम् || २-६८-१७_END
BEGIN_
From there having reached a village named Abhikala, they crossed the holy Ikshumati
River, which was flowing down from Bodhibhavana Mountain. This region was associated with the
father and grandfather of Dasaratha._END

B_2_C_64_54
BEGIN_
एवम् शापम् मयि न्यस्य विलप्य करुणम् बहु |
चितामारोप्य देहम् तन्मिथुनम् स्वर्गमभ्ययात् || २-६४-५८_END
BEGIN_
"Pronouncing the curse thus on me, that couple wept many times pitiably, placed
their body on the funeral pile and proceeded to heaven."_END

B_2_C_67_24
BEGIN_
न अराजके जनपदे नराः शास्त्रविशारदाः |
सम्पदन्तोऽवतिष्ठन्ते वनेषूपवनेषु च || २-६७-२६_END
BEGIN_
"In a rulerless land, persons skilled in sacred treatises cannot sit speaking
together in forests and groves."_END

B_2_C_69_2
BEGIN_
तप्यमानम् समाज्ञाय वयस्याः प्रिय वादिनः |
आयासम् हि विनेष्यन्तः सभायाम् चक्रिरे कथाः || २-६९-३_END
BEGIN_
Knowing Bharata to have been in anguish, his graceful speaking friends arranged
recitation of stories in the palace; so as to erase his anguish._END

B_2_C_68_15
BEGIN_
अवेक्स्याञ्जलिपानांश्च ब्राह्मणान् वेदपारगान् |
ययुर्मध्येन बाह्लीकान् सुदामानम् च पर्वतम् || २-६८-१८_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Brahmans skilled in Vedas who survived by only drinking water through hollows
of their palms, they proceeded through Bahlika kingdom towards a mountain called Sudama._END

B_2_C_64_55
BEGIN_
तदेतच्चिन्तयानेन स्मऋतम् पापम् मया स्वयम् |
तदा बाल्यात्कृतम् देवि शब्दवेध्यनुकर्षिणा || २-६४-५९_END
BEGIN_
"O, Kausalya! The sin I myself committed through ignorance on that day, by invoking
an arrow and hitting an invisible object the sound of which was heard, I remember it now on
reflection over it."_END

B_2_C_67_25
BEGIN_
न अराजके जनपदे माल्यमोदकदक्षिणाः |
देवताभ्यर्चनार्थय कल्प्यन्ते नियतैर्जनैः || २-६७-२७_END
BEGIN_
"In a rulerless land, floral garlands, sweet-meats and gifts for the sake of
offering to the deities, are not arranged by the appointed persons."_END

B_2_C_69_3
BEGIN_
वादयन्ति तथा शान्तिम् लासयन्ति अपि च अपरे |
नाटकानि अपरे प्राहुर् हास्यानि विविधानि च || २-६९-४_END
BEGIN_
Some played musical instruments for bringing about peacefulness. Likewise some
others arranged for exhibition of dramas and some others told various types of jokes._END

B_2_C_64_56
BEGIN_
तस्यायम् कर्मणो देवि विपाकः समुपस्थितः |
अपथ्यैः सह सम्भुक्ते व्याधिरन्नरसे यथा || २-६४-६०_END
BEGIN_
"O, Kausalya! As a disease comes sometime after eating a nutriment mixed with
forbidden things, this present occurrence came as a result of the sinful act by me long ago."_END

B_2_C_68_16
BEGIN_
विष्णोः पदम् प्रेक्षमाणा विपाशाम् चापि शाल्मालीम् |
नदीर्वापीस्तटाकानि पल्वलानि सरांसि च || २-६८-१९
पस्यन्तो विविधांश्चापि सिमहव्याग्रमृगद्विपान् |
ययुः पथातिमहता शासनम् भर्तुरीप्सवः || २-६८-२०_END
BEGIN_
Perceiving a locality called Vishnu padam, Vipasa river, Salmali trees, rivers,
ponds, tanks, pools and lakes, as well as seeing many kinds of lions, tigers, antelopes and
elephants, they proceeded by that broad lofty high way desirous as they were to execute the command
of their master._END

B_2_C_67_26
BEGIN_
न अराजके जनपदे चन्दनागुरुरूषिताः |
राजपुत्रा विराजन्ते वसन्त इव शाखिनः || २-६७-२८_END
BEGIN_
"In a rulerless land, royal princes smeared with paste of sandal and aloe-wood do
not figure brilliantly like trees in a spring time."_END

B_2_C_69_4
BEGIN_
स तैः महात्मा भरतः सखिभिः प्रिय वादिभिः |
गोष्ठी हास्यानि कुर्वद्भिर् न प्राहृष्यत राघवः || २-६९-५_END
BEGIN_
That high-soled Bharata born in Raghu Dynasty could not be made cheerful by his
gently speaking friends by stage-plays or jokes._END

B_2_C_64_57
BEGIN_
तस्मान् माम् आगतम् भद्रे तस्य उदारस्य तत् वचः |
यद् अहम् पुत्र शोकेन सम्त्यक्ष्याम्य् अद्य जीवितम् || २-६४-६१_END
BEGIN_
"O, my dear lady! Those words of that noble sage, saying that I shall give up my
life due to grief for the loss of my son, have come true to me now."_END

B_2_C_68_17
BEGIN_
ते श्रान्त वाहना दूता विकृष्टेन सता पथा |
गिरि व्रजम् पुर वरम् शीघ्रम् आसेदुर् अन्जसा || २-६८-२१_END
BEGIN_
Those messengers, though riding on tired horses on a long route, reached quickly and
safely to the excellent city of Girivraja._END

B_2_C_67_27
BEGIN_
यथा हि अनुदका नद्यो यथा वा अपि अतृणम् वनम् |
अगोपाला यथा गावः तथा राष्ट्रम् अराजकम् || २-६७-२९_END
BEGIN_
"A rulerless country is like the water less rivers, like the lawn less garden and
like the cowherd less cows."_END

B_2_C_69_5
BEGIN_
तम् अब्रवीत् प्रिय सखो भरतम् सखिभिर् वृतम् |
सुहृद्भिः पर्युपासीनः किम् सखे न अनुमोदसे || २-६९-६_END
BEGIN_
A close friend spoke to Bharata, who was surrounded by his companions, as follows,
"O, friend! Why are you not rejoicing, even when entertained by your friends?"_END

B_2_C_64_58
BEGIN_
चक्षुर्भ्याम् त्वाम् न पश्यामि कौसल्ये साधु मांस्फृश |
इत्युक्त्वा स रुदंस्त्रस्तो भार्यामाह च भूमिपः || २-६४-६२_END
BEGIN_
"O, Kausalya! I am not able to see you with my eyes. Touch me well" Thus speaking,
King Dasaratha, terribly weeping said to his wife as follows:_END

B_2_C_68_18
BEGIN_
भर्तुः प्रिय अर्थम् कुल रक्षण अर्थम् |
भर्तुः च वंशस्य परिग्रह अर्थम् |
अहेडमानाः त्वरया स्म दूता |
रात्र्याम् तु ते तत् पुरम् एव याताः || २-६८-२२_END
BEGIN_
For the sake of fulfilling the beloved object of their master (Vasistha), for the
sake of preserving the royal family and for keeping up the prestige of the sovereign race, those
messengers quickly and respectfully reached that city in the night._END

B_2_C_67_28
BEGIN_
ध्वजो रथस्य प्रज्ञानम् धूमो ज्ञानम् विभावसोः |
तेषाम् यो नो ध्वजो राज स देवत्वमितो गतः || २-६७-३०_END
BEGIN_
"A flag is an identity for a chariot. A smoke is an identity for a fire. King
Dasaratha, like a flag, was an identity for us and he has left the world for a heavenly abode."_END

B_2_C_69_6
BEGIN_
एवम् ब्रुवाणम् सुहृदम् भरतः प्रत्युवाच ह |
शृणु त्वम् यन् निमित्तम्मे दैन्यम् एतत् उपागतम् || २-६९-७_END
BEGIN_
Bharata replied to the friend who spoke thus, as follows "You listen to me the
reason for which this depression came to me"_END

B_2_C_70_0
BEGIN_
भरते ब्रुवति स्वप्नम् दूताः ते क्लान्त वाहनाः |
प्रविश्य असह्य परिखम् रम्यम् राज गृहम् पुरम् || २-७०-१
समागम्य तु राज्ञा च राज पुत्रेण च अर्चिताः |
राज्ञः पादौ गृहीत्वा तु तम् ऊचुर् भरतम् वचः || २-७०-२_END
BEGIN_
While Bharata was narrating his dream, the messengers whose horses were tired,
entered the beautiful city called Rajagriha, which has too big a palace-gate and met the king
Kekeya and the prince Yudhajit, who received them hospitably. They saluted the feet of the king
Kekeya and spoke the following words to Bharata:_END

B_2_C_64_59
BEGIN_
एतन्मे सदृशम् देवि यन्मया राघवे कृतम् |
सदृशम् तत्तु तस्यैव यदनेन कृतम् मयि || २-६४-६३_END
BEGIN_
"O, queen! The wrong that was done by me in respect of Rama was not befitting of me.
But the good that was done by Rama in my case was worthy only of him."_END

B_2_C_69_7
BEGIN_
स्वप्ने पितरम् अद्राक्षम् मलिनम् मुक्त मूर्धजम् |
पतन्तम् अद्रि शिखरात् कलुषे गोमये ह्रदे || २-६९-८_END
BEGIN_
"I have seen a dream in which my father with his soiled body and with his hair
disheveled, was falling from the top of a mountain into a polluted pond defiled with cow dung._END

B_2_C_67_29
BEGIN_
न अराजके जन पदे स्वकम् भवति कस्यचित् |
मत्स्याइव नरा नित्यम् भक्षयन्ति परस्परम् || २-६७-३१_END
BEGIN_
"In a rulerless land, there is no one's own property for any one. Like fishes,
persons always eat away each other."_END

B_2_C_70_1
BEGIN_
पुरोहितः त्वा कुशलम् प्राह सर्वे च मन्त्रिणः |
त्वरमाणः च निर्याहि कृत्यम् आत्ययिकम् त्वया || २-७०-३_END
BEGIN_
"Vasistha, the family-priest and all the ministers were asking about your welfare.
Come forth indeed quickly. There is an urgent work with you."_END

B_2_C_64_60
BEGIN_
दुर्वृत्तमपि कः पुत्रम् त्यजेद्भुवि विचक्षणः |
कश्च प्रव्राज्यमानो वा नासूयेत्पितरम् सुतः || २-६४-६४_END
BEGIN_
"Which wise man on this earth can abandon his son, even if he is of a bad conduct?
Which son, even if he is sent to an exile, cannot become angry with his father?"_END

B_2_C_69_8
BEGIN_
प्लवमानः च मे दृष्टः स तस्मिन् गोमय ह्रदे |
पिबन्न् अन्जलिना तैलम् हसन्न् इव मुहुर् मुहुः || २-६९-९_END
BEGIN_
"He was seen by me, as he was floating in that pond defiled with cow dung, drinking
an oil through his hollowed palms and laughing again and again"_END

B_2_C_67_30
BEGIN_
येहि सम्भिन्न मर्यादा नास्तिकाः चिन्न संशयाः |
ते अपि भावाय कल्पन्ते राज दण्ड निपीडिताः || २-६७-३२_END
BEGIN_
"The atheists, who were separated from their right path and who had been tormented;
with punishment earlier by the king, are now without fear and are able to exercise their old
temperament (due to anarchy)"_END

B_2_C_70_2
BEGIN_
इमानि च महार्हाणि वस्त्राण्य़ाभरणानि च |
प्रतिगृह्य विशालाक्ष मातुलस्य च दापय || २-७०-४_END
BEGIN_
"O, Bharata the wide-eyed man! Take these very valuable clothes and jewels and give
them to your maternal uncle"_END

B_2_C_64_61
BEGIN_
यदि माम् संस्पृशेद् रामः सकृदद्य लभेत वा |
यमक्षयमनुप्राप्ता द्रक्ष्यन्ति न हि मानवाः || २-६४-६५_END
BEGIN_
"Can Rama now touch me or approach me forth with? Men who attained the world of Yama
(god of death) cannot even see their kith and kin."_END

B_2_C_69_9
BEGIN_
ततः तिलोदनम् भुक्त्वा पुनः पुनर् अधः शिराः |
तैलेन अभ्यक्त सर्व अन्गः तैलम् एव अवगाहत || २-६९-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Thereafter, having eaten cooked rice mixed with gingelly seeds repeatedly, with his
head bent down and with his whole body smeared with oil, he plunged into the oil itself_END

B_2_C_67_31
BEGIN_
यथा दृष्टिः शरीरस्य नित्यमेवप्रवर्तते |
तथा नरेन्द्रो राष्ट्रस्य प्रभवः सत्यधर्मयोः || २-६७-३३_END
BEGIN_
"As the eye sight is helpful regularly for a proper setting -in-motion of the body,
so also a king is the cause of existence for truth and righteousness of a country."_END

B_2_C_70_3
BEGIN_
अत्र विंशति कोट्यः तु नृपतेर् मातुलस्य ते |
दश कोट्यः तु सम्पूर्णाः तथैव च नृप आत्मज || २-७०-५_END
BEGIN_
"O, prince! In these jewels and clothes, a worth of hundred crores is to be given to
the king Kekeya and likewise a worth of ten crores in full to your maternal uncle."_END

B_2_C_69_10
BEGIN_
स्वप्ने अपि सागरम् शुष्कम् चन्द्रम् च पतितम् भुवि |
सहसा च अपि संशन्तम् ज्वलितम् जात वेदसम् || २-६९-११
औपवाह्यस्य नागस्य विषाणम् शकलीकृतम् |
सहसा चापि संशान्तम् ज्वलितम् जातवेदसम् || २-६९-१२
अवदीर्णाम् च पृथिवीम् शुष्कामः च विविधान् द्रुमान् |
अहम् पश्यामि विध्वस्तान् सधूमामः चैव पार्वतान् || २-६९-१३_END
BEGIN_
"I saw in the dream, the ocean dry up, the moon fall on the ground, the earth
molested as if covered by darkness, a tusk of an elephant (on which the monarch rode) broken to
pieces, a blazing fire suddenly extinguished, the earth riven, the various trees dry up, and the
mountains whirl up into a mist."_END

B_2_C_64_62
BEGIN_
चक्षुषा त्वाम् न पश्यामि स्मृतिर् मम विलुप्यते |
दूता वैवस्वतस्य एते कौसल्ये त्वरयन्ति माम् || २-६४-६६_END
BEGIN_
"O, Kausalya! I am not able to see you with my eyes. My memory- power is fading
away. Messengers of Yama (god of death) are hastening me to come."_END

B_2_C_67_32
BEGIN_
राजा सत्यम् च धर्मश्च राजा कुलवताम् कुलम् |
राजा माता पिता चैव राजा हितकरो नृणाम् || २-६७-३४_END
BEGIN_
"The king is truthfulness and righteousness personified in him. In a race, he
belongs to a noble family. The king is a mother and a father. The king is a benefactor to
people."_END

B_2_C_70_4
BEGIN_
प्रतिगृह्य च तत् सर्वम् स्वनुरक्तः सुहृज् जने |
दूतान् उवाच भरतः कामैः सम्प्रतिपूज्य तान् || २-७०-६_END
BEGIN_
Bharata, who had a great affection towards his kind hearted relatives, took all
that, honored these messengers profusely with gifts of their liking and spoke(as follows) :_END

B_2_C_69_11
BEGIN_
पीठे कार्ष्णायसे च एनम् निषण्णम् कृष्ण वाससम् |
प्रहसन्ति स्म राजानम् प्रमदाः कृष्ण पिन्गलाः || २-६९-१४_END
BEGIN_
"I saw my father in the dream, wearing black clothes, sitting on a stool made of
iron and women with black and reddish brown complexion deriding the king."_END

B_2_C_64_63
BEGIN_
अतः तु किम् दुह्खतरम् यद् अहम् जीवित क्षये |
न हि पश्यामि धर्मज्ञम् रामम् सत्य पराक्यमम् || २-६४-६७_END
BEGIN_
"What can be more sorrowful than the fact I am not able to see Rama, who knows
righteousness and who is a truly brave man, at the time of my death?"_END

B_2_C_67_33
BEGIN_
यमो वैश्रवणः शक्रो वरुणश्च महाबलः |
विशेष्यन्ते नरेन्द्रेण वृत्तेन महाता ततः || २-६७-३५_END
BEGIN_
"Hence, Yama (the god of Death); Kubera (the god of riches), Indra (the ruler of
celestials) and the very mighty Varuna (the Lord of Waters) are outstretched by the a high and
eminent conduct."_END

B_2_C_70_5
BEGIN_
कच्चित् सुकुशली राजा पिता दशरथो मम |
कच्चिच् च अरागता रामे लक्ष्मणे वा महात्मनि || २-७०-७_END
BEGIN_
"I hope that king Dasaratha, my father is quite safe. I also hope that Rama and the
high-soled Lakshmana are well."_END

B_2_C_69_12
BEGIN_
त्वरमाणः च धर्म आत्मा रक्त माल्य अनुलेपनः |
रथेन खर युक्तेन प्रयातः दक्षिणा मुखः || २-६९-१५_END
BEGIN_
"My father, the virtuous man, adorned with red garlands and his body besmeared with
sandal paste and seated in a chariot drawn by asses, proceeded hurriedly towards the south."_END

B_2_C_64_64
BEGIN_
तस्यादर्शनजः शोकः सुतस्याप्रतिकर्मणः |
उच्चोषयति मे प्राणान्वारि स्तोकमिवातवः || २-६४-६८_END
BEGIN_
"The grief arising out of non-appearance of that son, who performs unparalleled
actions, is parching up my life, as sun- shine dries up a water drop"_END

B_2_C_67_34
BEGIN_
अहो तमैव इदम् स्यान् न प्रज्ञायेत किंचन |
राजा चेन् न भवेन् लोके विभजन् साध्व् असाधुनी || २-६७-३६_END
BEGIN_
"Alas! If a king is not there in the world, with his power of discrimination between
good and evil, this world will be dark and nothing will be clearly perceived."_END

B_2_C_70_6
BEGIN_
आर्या च धर्म निरता धर्मज्ञा धर्म दर्शिनी |
अरोगा च अपि कौसल्या माता रामस्य धीमतः || २-७०-८_END
BEGIN_
"Is Kausalya, the venerable lady, who is intent on virtue, who knows righteousness,
who visualizes goodness and who is the mother of the wise Rama, also well? "_END

B_2_C_64_65
BEGIN_
न ते मनुष्या देवाः ते ये चारु शुभ कुण्डलम् |
मुखम् द्रक्ष्यन्ति रामस्य वर्षे पन्च दशे पुनः || २-६४-६९_END
BEGIN_
"They are not humans but celestials, who will be able to see again in the fifteenth
year, the beautiful face of Rama, wearing his handsome ear-rings."_END

B_2_C_69_13
BEGIN_
प्रहसन्तीव राजानम् प्रमदा रक्तवासिनी |
प्रकर्षन्ती मया दृष्टा राक्षसी विकृतासना || २-६९-१६_END
BEGIN_
"I saw an ugly faced female demon, wearing red colored clothes, laughingly dragging
away the king._END

B_2_C_67_35
BEGIN_
जीवति अपि महा राजे तव एव वचनम् वयम् |
न अतिक्रमामहे सर्वे वेलाम् प्राप्य इव सागरः || २-६७-३७_END
BEGIN_
"Even when the emperor was alive, we all of us did not transgress your words, only
any more than an ocean transgresses its coast."_END

B_2_C_70_7
BEGIN_
कच्चित् सुमित्रा धर्मज्ञा जननी लक्ष्मणस्य या |
शत्रुघ्नस्य च वीरस्य सारोगा च अपि मध्यमा || २-७०-९_END
BEGIN_
"I hope that Sumitra, who knows righteousness, who is the mother of Lakshmana as
well as the heroic Satrughna and our middle mother, is well."_END

B_2_C_64_66
BEGIN_
पद्म पत्र ईक्षणम् सुभ्रु सुदम्ष्ट्रम् चारु नासिकम् |
धन्या द्रक्ष्यन्ति रामस्य तारा अधिप निभम् मुखम् || २-६४-७०_END
BEGIN_
"The fortunate can see the face of Rama, looking like a moon, with its eyes
resembling lotus leaves, with beautiful eye brows, with a comely row of teeth and a charming
nose."_END

B_2_C_69_14
BEGIN_
एवम् एतन् मया दृष्टम् इमाम् रात्रिम् भय आवहाम् |
अहम् रामः अथ वा राजा लक्ष्मणो वा मरिष्यति || २-६९-१७_END
BEGIN_
"This fearful dream was seen thus by me during that night. I myself or the king or
Lakshmana may die."_END

B_2_C_67_36
BEGIN_
स नः समीक्ष्य द्विज वर्य वृत्तम् |
नृपम् विना राज्यम् अरण्य भूतम् |
कुमारम् इक्ष्वाकु सुतम् वदान्यम् |
त्वम् एव राजानम् इह अभिषिन्चय || २-६७-३८_END
BEGIN_
"O, the excellent Brahmana! After renewing the circumstances here and seeing that
the kingdom is becoming a jungle without a king, you yourself anoint a youth born in Ikshvaku race
or anyone here as a king."_END

B_2_C_70_8
BEGIN_
आत्म कामा सदा चण्डी क्रोधना प्राज्ञ मानिनी |
अरोगा च अपि कैकेयी माता मे किम् उवाच ह || २-७०-१०_END
BEGIN_
"As Kaikeyi, who loves herself, a forever fiery lady of wrathful nature, who prides
herself to be highly intelligent and my mother, also well? What did she say?"_END

B_2_C_69_15
BEGIN_
नरः यानेन यः स्वप्ने खर युक्तेन याति हि |
अचिरात् तस्य धूम अग्रम् चितायाम् सम्प्रदृश्यते || २-६९-१८_END
BEGIN_
"If in a dream, a person sees a man going in a chariot, yoked with donkeys, the
smoke of a funeral pyre will soon be seen ascending him."_END

B_2_C_64_67
BEGIN_
सदृशम् शारदस्य इन्दोह् फुल्लस्य कमलस्य च |
सुगन्धि मम नाथस्य धन्या द्रक्ष्यन्ति तन् मुखम् || २-६४-७१_END
BEGIN_
"Fortunate are they, who can see the sweat smelling face of Rama, resembling the
autumnal moon and also a full- blown lotus."_END

B_2_C_70_9
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्ताः तु ते दूता भरतेन महात्मना |
ऊचुः सम्प्रश्रितम् वाक्यम् इदम् तम् भरतम् तदा || २-७०-११_END
BEGIN_
On hearing the words of the high soled Bharata, those messengers then respectfully
spoke to Bharata as follows:_END

B_2_C_69_16
BEGIN_
एतन् निमित्तम् दीनो अहम् तन् न वः प्रतिपूजये |
शुष्यति इव च मे कण्ठो न स्वस्थम् इव मे मनः || २-६९-१९_END
BEGIN_
"For this reason, I have become broken hearted. Hence, I am not able to treat you
properly. My throat seems to be drying up. My mind is not at ease."_END

B_2_C_64_68
BEGIN_
निवृत्त वन वासम् तम् अयोध्याम् पुनर् आगतम् |
द्रक्ष्यन्ति सुखिनो रामम् शुक्रम् मार्ग गतम् यथा || २-६४-७२_END
BEGIN_
"Happy ones can see Rama, who having finished his exile, will come to Ayodhya like
the planet Venus coming from a journey."_END

B_2_C_71_0
BEGIN_
स प्रान् मुखो राज गृहात् अभिनिर्याय वीर्यवान् |
ततः सुदामाम् द्युतिमान् सम्तीर्वावेक्ष्य ताम् नदीम् || २-७१-१
ह्लादिनीम् दूर पाराम् च प्रत्यक् स्रोतः तरन्गिणीम् |
शतद्रूम् अतरत् श्रीमान् नदीम् इक्ष्वाकु नन्दनः || २-७१-२_END
BEGIN_
That brilliant and glorious Bharata, who was a rejoice to Ikshvaku dynasty marching
in easterly direction from the city of Rajagriha, thereafter observing and crossing Sudama* river
as well as the wide Hladini river, whose stream flowed towards eastern direction._END

B_2_C_70_10
BEGIN_
कुशलाः ते नर व्याघ्र येषाम् कुशलम् इच्चसि |
श्रीश्च त्वाम् वृणुते पद्मा युज्यताम् चापि ते रकः || २-७०-१२_END
BEGIN_
"O, tiger among men! Those, of whom you do enquire, are all well. The goddess of
prosperity, holding a lotus in her hand, awaits you. Let your chariot be made ready."_END

B_2_C_69_17
BEGIN_
न पश्यामि भयस्थानम् भयम् चैवोपधारये |
भ्रष्टश्च स्वरयोगो मे चाया चोपहता मम || २-६९-२०
जुगुप्सन्न् इव च आत्मानम् न च पश्यामि कारणम् |_END
BEGIN_
"I do not see the root cause of this fear. But I am experiencing a fear indeed. My
voice is choked. My luster is affected. I abhor me myself and I do not see a reason for it."_END

B_2_C_64_69
BEGIN_
कौसल्ये चित्त मोहेन हृदयम् सीदतीव मे |
वेदये न च समुक्तान् शब्दस्पर्शरसानहम् || २-६४-७३_END
BEGIN_
"O, Kausalya! My heart is sinking down by delusion of mind. I am not able to grasp
the related sound, touch and the smell."_END

B_2_C_71_1
BEGIN_
एल धाने नदीम् तीर्त्वा प्राप्य च अपर पर्पटान् |
शिलाम् आकुर्वतीम् तीर्त्वाआग्नेयम् शल्य कर्तनम् || २-७१-३
सत्य संधः शुचिः श्रीमान् प्रेक्षमाणः शिला वहाम् |
अत्ययात् स महा शैलान् वनम् चैत्र रथम् प्रति || २-७१-४_END
BEGIN_
The pure and illustrious Bharata, who kept up his promise, crossing shatradru river
at Eladhana village, reaching the region of Apara parpata, crossing a rocky hill called akurvati,
seeing the villages of Agneyam and salyakartana as well as Silavaha river, crossed huge mountains
and traveled towards the woods of Chitraratha._END

B_2_C_70_11
BEGIN_
भरतः च अपि तान् दूतान् एवम् उक्तः अभ्यभाषत |
आपृच्चे अहम् महा राजम् दूताः सम्त्वरयन्ति माम् || २-७०-१३_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words Bharata spoke to the messengers as follows: "I will get permission
from the monarch(to leave for Ayodhya) saying that the messengers are hastening me up."_END

B_2_C_69_18
BEGIN_
इमाम् हि दुह्स्वप्न गतिम् निशाम्य ताम् |
अनेक रूपाम् अवितर्किताम् पुरा |
भयम् महत् तद्द् हृदयान् न याति मे |
विचिन्त्य राजानम् अचिन्त्य दर्शनम् || २-६९-२१_END
BEGIN_
"That great fear is not going away from my heart, having seen such a course of this
bad dream in varied forms and which dream was not imagined by me earlier and also reflecting on
that inconceivable sight of the king."_END

B_2_C_64_70
BEGIN_
चित्तनाशाद्विपद्यन्ते सर्वाण्येवेन्द्रियाणि मे |
क्षिणस्नेहस्य दीपस्य संसक्ता रश्मयो यथा || २-६४-७४_END
BEGIN_
"All of my senses are getting scared away due to mental break down, as rays of light
of a lamp whose oil is exhausted, starts splattering."_END

B_2_C_71_2
BEGIN_
सरस्वतीम् च गङ्गाम् च उग्मेन प्रतिपद्य च |
उत्तरम् वीरमत्स्यानाम् भारुण्डम् प्राविशद्वनम् || २-७१-५_END
BEGIN_
Arriving at the confluence of Saraswati and Ganga rivers, Bharata entered the woods
of Bharmuda, the north of Viramatsaya region._END

B_2_C_70_12
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्त्वा तु तान् दूतान् भरतः पार्थिव आत्मजः |
दूतैः संचोदितः वाक्यम् मातामहम् उवाच ह || २-७०-१४_END
BEGIN_
Bharata the prince having been asked to move quickly (to Ayodhya) by the messengers,
spoke as aforesaid to those messengers and uttered the following words to his maternal uncle:_END

B_2_C_64_71
BEGIN_
अयम् आत्म भवः शोको माम् अनाथम् अचेतनम् |
संसादयति वेगेन यथा कूलम् नदी रयः || २-६४-७५_END
BEGIN_
"This grief caused by my own self is collapsing me, who am helpless and insensible,
like a river bank being collapsed by the floods of a river stream."_END

B_2_C_71_3
BEGIN_
वेगिनीम् च कुलिन्ग आख्याम् ह्रादिनीम् पर्वत आवृताम् |
यमुनाम् प्राप्य सम्तीर्णो बलम् आश्वासयत् तदा || २-७१-६_END
BEGIN_
Reaching and crossing a refreshing river named Kulinga, which is swift and
surrounded by mountains as well as Yamuna river, the army was then made to rest there._END

B_2_C_70_13
BEGIN_
राजन् पितुर् गमिष्यामि सकाशम् दूत चोदितः |
पुनर् अपि अहम् एष्यामि यदा मे त्वम् स्मरिष्यसि || २-७०-१५_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! Requested by the messengers to come to Ayodhya urgently, I am going to my
father's presence. I shall again come, whenever you recall me."_END

B_2_C_64_72
BEGIN_
हा राघव महा बाहो हा मम आयास नाशन |
हा पितृप्रिय मे नाथ हाद्य क्वासि गतः सुत || २-६४-७६_END
BEGIN_
"O, mighty armed! O, Rama! O, annihilator of my grief! Alas! O, darling of your
father! O, my protector! O, my son! Where have you gone?"_END

B_2_C_71_4
BEGIN_
शीतीकृत्य तु गात्राणि क्लान्तान् आश्वास्य वाजिनः |
तत्र स्नात्वा च पीत्वा च प्रायात् आदाय च उदकम् || २-७१-७_END
BEGIN_
Making cool the limbs of the tired horses by bathing there and cheering up them,
nay, taking a bath himself, drinking some water and carrying it for future use, Bharata proceeded
further._END

B_2_C_70_14
BEGIN_
भरतेन एवम् उक्तः तु नृपो मातामहः तदा |
तम् उवाच शुभम् वाक्यम् शिरस्य् आघ्राय राघवम् || २-७०-१६_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Bharata, the king Kekeya, his maternal uncle smelled (as a
token of affection) the head of Bharata and spoke the following auspicious words:_END

B_2_C_64_73
BEGIN_
हा कौसल्ये नशिष्यामि हा सुमित्रे तपस्विनि |
हा नृशंसे ममामित्रे कैकेयि कुलपांसनि || २-६४-७७_END
BEGIN_
"O, Kausalya! O, Sumitra, the miserable! Alas! O, Kaikeyi, the cruel one! My enemy!
The disgrace of my family! I am going to die."_END

B_2_C_71_5
BEGIN_
राज पुत्रः महा अरण्यम् अनभीक्ष्ण उपसेवितम् |
भद्रः भद्रेण यानेन मारुतः खम् इव अत्ययात् || २-७१-८_END
BEGIN_
The blessed prince Bharata traversed that rarely frequented huge forest by his
excellent chariot as the wind glides through an atmosphere._END

B_2_C_70_15
BEGIN_
गच्च तात अनुजाने त्वाम् कैकेयी सुप्रजाः त्वया |
मातरम् कुशलम् ब्रूयाः पितरम् च परम् तप || २-७०-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Go, my dear child! I am permitting you. Kaikeyi is fortunate to have a good son
like you. Bear my greetings to your mother and father."_END

B_2_C_64_74
BEGIN_
इति रामस्य मातुश्च सुमित्रायाश्च सन्निधौ |
राजा दशरथः शोचन् जीवित अन्तम् उपागमत् || २-६४-७८_END
BEGIN_
In this manner, King Dasaratha weeping as aforesaid, reached the end of his life in
the presence of Kausalya and Sumitra._END

B_2_C_71_6
BEGIN_
भागीरथीम् दुष्प्रतरामंशुधाने महानदीम् |
उपायाद्राघवस्तूर्णम् प्राग्वटे विश्रुते पुरे || २-७१-९_END
BEGIN_
Bharata soon reached the great river, Bharathi, which is difficult to be crossed, at
the city of pragvata in the region of Amsudhana._END

B_2_C_70_16
BEGIN_
पुरोहितम् च कुशलम् ये च अन्ये द्विज सत्तमाः |
तौ च तात महा इष्वासौ भ्रातरु राम लक्ष्मणौ || २-७०-१८_END
BEGIN_
" My dear child! Pay obeisance to your family priest, the other illustrious Brahmins
and your brothers Rama and Lakshmana the wielders of bows."_END

B_2_C_64_75
BEGIN_
यथा तु दीनम् कथयन् नर अधिपः |
प्रियस्य पुत्रस्य विवासन आतुरः |
गते अर्ध रात्रे भृश दुह्ख पीडितः |
तदा जहौ प्राणम् उदार दर्शनः || २-६४-७९_END
BEGIN_
King Dasaratha of noble appearance, thus speaking, who was already miserable and
distressed for sending his son to exile, felt afflicted with extreme grief by the time the mid-
night passed and forthwith abandoned his life._END

B_2_C_71_7
BEGIN_
स गङ्गाम् प्राग्वटे तीर्त्वे समायात्कुटिकोष्ठिकाम् |
सबलस्ताम् स तीर्त्वाथ समायाद्धर्मवर्धनम् || २-७१-१०_END
BEGIN_
Crossing the River Ganga at the city of Pragvata, he reached the river
Kulikoshthika, traversed it along with his army and then arrived at the region of
Dharmavardhana._END

B_2_C_70_17
BEGIN_
तस्मै हस्ति उत्तमामः चित्रान् कम्बलान् अजिनानि च |
अभिसत्कृत्य कैकेयो भरताय धनम् ददौ || २-७०-१९_END
BEGIN_
The king Kekaya, treating him hospitably gave that Bharata the best of elephants,
woolen clothes of varied colors, antelope skins and riches (gold and silver vessels etc)._END

B_2_C_71_8
BEGIN_
तोरणम् दक्षिण अर्धेन जम्बू प्रस्थम् उपागमत् |
वरूथम् च ययौ रम्यम् ग्रामम् दशरथ आत्मजः || २-७१-११_END
BEGIN_
Bharata reached Jambuprasta village, which is located at the southern part of Torana
region and from there he arrived at a beautiful village too, named Varutha._END

B_2_C_70_18
BEGIN_
रुक्म निष्क सहस्रे द्वे षोडश अश्व शतानि च |
सत्कृत्य कैकेयी पुत्रम् केकयो धनम् आदिशत् || २-७०-२०_END
BEGIN_
The king Kekeya generously gave as gifts to Bharata, two thousands coins of gold and
sixteen hundred horses._END

B_2_C_71_9
BEGIN_
तत्र रम्ये वने वासम् कृत्वा असौ प्रान् मुखो ययौ |
उद्यानम् उज्जिहानायाः प्रियका यत्र पादपाः || २-७१-१२_END
BEGIN_
Making a camp in thatbeautiful forest there, Bharata traveled towards the east and
reached a garden in the city of Ujjihana, in which there are a number of Kadamba trees._END

B_2_C_70_19
BEGIN_
तथा अमात्यान् अभिप्रेतान् विश्वास्यामः च गुण अन्वितान् |
ददाव् अश्व पतिः शीघ्रम् भरताय अनुयायिनः || २-७०-२१_END
BEGIN_
Likewise, Aswapati sent some attendants, who were dear, reliable, endowed with
virtues and inmates of his palace with Bharata (to accompany him on the return journey)_END

B_2_C_71_10
BEGIN_
सालांस् तु प्रियकान् प्राप्य शीघ्रान् आस्थाय वाजिनः |
अनुज्ञाप्य अथ भरतः वाहिनीम् त्वरितः ययौ || २-७१-१३_END
BEGIN_
Having reached Sala and Kadamba trees, Bharata yoked swifter horses to his chariot,
allowed his army to come after him and quickly went ahead._END

B_2_C_70_20
BEGIN_
ऐरावतान् ऐन्द्र शिरान् नागान् वै प्रिय दर्शनान् |
खरान् शीघ्रान् सुसम्युक्तान् मातुलो अस्मै धनम् ददौ || २-७०-२२_END
BEGIN_
Yuddhajit, his maternal uncle gave him as gifts, elephants of Airavata race born in
Indrasira mountain-range and which were charming to behold as well as mules which could walk
quickly and were well trained_END

B_2_C_71_11
BEGIN_
वासम् कृत्वा सर्व तीर्थे तीर्त्वा च उत्तानकाम् नदीम् |
अन्या नदीः च विविधाः पार्वतीयैअः तुरम् गमैः || २-७१-१४
हस्ति पृष्ठकम् आसाद्य कुटिकाम् अत्यवर्तत |
ततार च नर व्याघ्रः लौहित्ये स कपीवतीम् || २-७१-१५_END
BEGIN_
Having halted min Sarvatirtha village and having crossed Uttamika river and various
other rivers by mountain -ponies and reaching Hast prasthaka village, Bharata crossed Kutika river
and traversed kapivati river at Lohitya village._END

B_2_C_70_21
BEGIN_
अन्तः पुरे अतिसम्वृद्धान् व्याघ्र वीर्य बल अन्वितान् |
दम्ष्ट्र आयुधान् महा कायान् शुनः च उपायनम् ददौ || २-७०-२३_END
BEGIN_
He gave as a gift, large bodied dogs, which were well nourished in the gynoecium,
possessing strength and vitality of a tiger and which were using their tusks as weapons._END

B_2_C_71_12
BEGIN_
एक साले स्थाणुमतीम् विनते गोमतीम् नदीम् |
कलिन्ग नगरे च अपि प्राप्य साल वनम् तदा || २-७१-१६
भरतः क्षिप्रम् आगच्चत् सुपरिश्रान्त वाहनः |_END
BEGIN_
Bharata, after crossing Sthanumati river at Ekasala village and Gomati river at
Vinata village, took rest at a grove of Sala trees at Kalinga city as the horses were very much
tired and then proceeded quickly._END

B_2_C_70_22
BEGIN_
स मातामहम् आपृच्च्य मातुलम् च युधा जितम् |
रथम् आरुह्य भरतः शत्रुघ्न सहितः ययौ || २-७०-२४_END
BEGIN_
The wealth of gifts bestowed by the king Kekeya did not rejoice Bharata, Kaikeyi's
son, who was then in a hurry to go._END

B_2_C_71_13
BEGIN_
वनम् च समतीत्य आशु शर्वर्याम् अरुण उदये || २-७१-१७
अयोध्याम् मनुना राज्ञा निर्मिताम् स ददर्श ह |_END
BEGIN_
Driving through grove quickly in the night, Bharata at the dawn saw the city of
Ayodhya, which was earlier built by King Manu._END

B_2_C_70_23
BEGIN_
बभूव ह्यस्य हृदते चिन्ता सुमहती तदा |
त्वरया चापि दूतानाम् स्वप्नस्यापि च दर्शनात् || २-७०-२५_END
BEGIN_
Due to goading of messengers and visualization of the dream, a very big worry was
formed at that time in his heart._END

B_2_C_71_14
BEGIN_
ताम् पुरीम् पुरुष व्याघ्रः सप्त रात्र उषिटः पथि || २-७१-१८
अयोध्याम् अग्रतः दृष्ट्वा रथे सारथिम् अब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the city of Ayodhya in front, after spending seven nights on his way, Bharata
the tiger among men, spoke the following words to his charioteer:_END

B_2_C_70_24
BEGIN_
स स्ववेश्माभ्यतिक्रम्य नरनागश्वसम्वृतम् |
प्रपेदे सुमहच्छ्रीमान् राजमार्गमनुत्तमम् || २-७०-२६_END
BEGIN_
The glorious Bharata crossed his very big palace, augmented with men elephants and
horses and entered the excellent royal high way._END

B_2_C_71_15
BEGIN_
एषा न अतिप्रतीता मे पुण्य उद्याना यशस्विनी || २-७१-१९
अयोध्या दृश्यते दूरात् सारथे पाण्डु मृत्तिका |
यज्वभिर् गुण सम्पन्नैः ब्राह्मणैः वेद पारगैः || २-७१-२०
भूयिष्ठम् ऋषैः आकीर्णा राज ऋषि वर पालिता |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Charioteer! The famous city of Ayodhya comes into view vaguely to me from a
distance, as a heap of white clay. It has beautiful gardens. It is filled with performers of
sacrifices and with people endowed with good qualities as well as well versed in the Vedas and with
Brahmins inmost abundant reaches , It is being ruled by a royal sage."_END

B_2_C_70_25
BEGIN_
अभ्यतीत्य ततोऽपश्यदन्तः पुरमुदारधीः |
ततस्तद्भरतः श्रीमानाविवेशानिवारितः || २-७०-२७_END
BEGIN_
The sagacious Bharata crossed the royal high way and perceived the gynoecia. Then,
the glorious Bharata entered those gynoecia._END

B_2_C_71_16
BEGIN_
अयोध्यायाम् पुरा शब्दः श्रूयते तुमुलो महान् || २-७१-२१
समन्तान् नर नारीणाम् तम् अद्य न शृणोम्य् अहम् |_END
BEGIN_
Earlier , a big clattering voice of men and women used to be heard all round in
Ayodhya. Now, I am not hearing that voice."_END

B_2_C_71_17
BEGIN_
उद्यानानि हि साय अह्ने क्रीडित्वा उपरतैः नरैः || २-७१-२२
समन्तात् विप्रधावद्भिः प्रकाशन्ते मम अन्यदा |_END
BEGIN_
"The parks which used to beam with men streaming forth on all sides, having given up
sporting in the morning after entering them in thee evening having spent the whole night in sport,
now appear to me otherwise"_END

B_2_C_70_26
BEGIN_
स माता महमापृच्च्य मातुलम् च युधाजितम् |
रथमारुह्य भरतः शत्रुघ्नसहितो ययौ || २-७०-२८_END
BEGIN_
Bharata took leave of his maternal grandfather and also Yudhajit, his maternal uncle
and set out on a chariot (for Ayodhya) along with Satrughna._END

B_2_C_71_18
BEGIN_
तानि अद्य अनुरुदन्ति इव परित्यक्तानि कामिभिः || २-७१-२३
अरण्य भूता इव पुरी सारथे प्रतिभाति मे |_END
BEGIN_
"These parks deserted by the lovers now turn out to be dejected . O, charioteer! To
me, the city appears to have changed into a forest."_END

B_2_C_70_27
BEGIN_
रथान् मण्डल चक्रामः च योजयित्वा परः शतम् |
उष्ट्र गो अश्व खरैः भृत्या भरतम् यान्तम् अन्वयुः || २-७०-२९_END
BEGIN_
With more than hundred chariots variegated with jewels yoked to camels, bullocks,
horses and mules as also servants followed Bharata as he departed._END

B_2_C_71_19
BEGIN_
न हि अत्र यानैः दृश्यन्ते न गजैः न च वाजिभिः || २-७१-२४
निर्यान्तः वा अभियान्तः वा नर मुख्या यथा पुरम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Here, as before, important persons indeed are not seen going into the city or
coming out it in carriages or on horses or on elephants."_END

B_2_C_70_28
BEGIN_
बलेन गुप्तः भरतः महात्मा |
सह आर्यकस्य आत्म समैः अमात्यैः |
आदाय शत्रुघ्नम् अपेत शत्रुर् |
गृहात् ययौ सिद्धैव इन्द्र लोकात् || २-७०-३०_END
BEGIN_
Being protected by the army, the high soled Bharata, who was free from enemies,
taking Shatrughna along with other companions good enough to him, started from the palace of his
venerable maternal uncle, as a Siddha(a semi- divine being of great purity and perfection and said
to possess supernatural faculties) would start from Indraloka( the world of celestials)._END

B_2_C_71_20
BEGIN_
उद्यानानि पुरा भान्ति मत्तप्रमुदितानि च || २-७१-२५
जनानाम् रतिसम्योगेष्वत्यन्तगुणवन्ति च |_END
BEGIN_
"Earlier parks used to be conspicuously excited with joy and gaiety and were most
congenial for love contacts of men."_END

B_2_C_71_21
BEGIN_
तान्येतान्यद्य वश्यामि निरानन्दानि सर्वशः || २-७१-२६
स्रस्तपर्णैरनुपथम् विक्रोशद्भिरिव द्रुमैः |_END
BEGIN_
"I am seeing the same parks., today with lack of enjoyments on all sides and with
trees having their leaves fallen along the road, looking like picture of dismay."_END

B_2_C_71_22
BEGIN_
नाद्यापि श्रूयते शब्दो मत्तानाम् मृगपक्षिणाम् || २-७१-२७
सम्रक्ताम् मधुराम् वाणीम् कलम् व्याहरताम् बहु |_END
BEGIN_
"Even now at dawn, charming sounds with sweet and much melodious tone of animals and
birds intoxicated with happiness are not being heard."_END

B_2_C_71_23
BEGIN_
चन्दनागुरुसम्पृक्तो धूपसम्मूर्चितोऽतुलः || २-७१-२८
प्रवाति पवनः श्रीमान् किम् नु नाद्य यथापुरम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Why does, as before, pure and auspicious breeze laden with aloes and sandal wood
intensified with the fume of burnt incense,not blow today.?"_END

B_2_C_71_24
BEGIN_
भेरीमृदङ्गवीणानाम् कोणसम्घट्टितः पुनः || २-७१-२९
किमद्य शब्दो विरतः सदाऽदीनगतिः पुरा |_END
BEGIN_
"Why today have the sounds of kettledrums, clay tomtoms and Vinas played upon with
drum-sticks or palms or fingers stopped which formerly never ceased at any time."_END

B_2_C_71_25
BEGIN_
अनिष्टानि च पापानि पश्यामि विविधानि च || २-७१-३०
निमित्तानि अमनोज्ञानि तेन सीदति ते मनः |_END
BEGIN_
"I perceive various kinds of evil sinful and silly omens and by this, my mind is
dejected."_END

B_2_C_71_26
BEGIN_
सर्वथा कुशलम् सूत दुर्लभम् मम बन्धुषु || २-७१-३१
तथा ह्यसति सम्मोहे हृदयम् सीदतीव मे |_END
BEGIN_
"O, charioteer! It is not possible that all sounds be well with my kinsfolk, as
indeed, even without anycause for a grievance, my spirit is cast down"_END

B_2_C_71_27
BEGIN_
विषण्णः शान्तहृदयस्त्रस्तः सुलुलितेन्द्रियः || २-७१-३२
भरतः प्रविवेशाशु पुरीमिक्ष्वाकुपालिताम् |_END
BEGIN_
Despondent, distressed in mind, frightened and extremely entered the city, which was
ruled by the descendents of Ikshvaku._END

B_2_C_71_28
BEGIN_
द्वारेण वैजयन्तेन प्राविशत् श्रान्त वाहनः || २-७१-३३
द्वाह्स्थैः उत्थाय विजयम् पृष्टः तैः सहितः ययौ |_END
BEGIN_
Bharata, with his tiered horses entered the city through Vaijayanta gate. Greeted
with slogans of victory by the standing gatekeepers, he went inside, along with others._END

B_2_C_71_29
BEGIN_
स तु अनेक अग्र हृदयो द्वाह्स्थम् प्रत्यर्च्य तम् जनम् || २-७१-३४
सूतम् अश्व पतेः क्लान्तम् अब्रवीत् तत्र राघवः |_END
BEGIN_
Bharata, with a distracted mind, responded to the salutations of those porters at
the gate and those porters at the gate and spoke to the charioteer who was beloved to Asvapati as
follows:_END

B_2_C_71_30
BEGIN_
किमहम् त्वरयानीतः कारणेन विनानघ || २-७१-३५
अशुभाशङ्कि हृदयम् शीलम् च पततीव मे |_END
BEGIN_
"O, the faultless charioteer! Why was I brought so quickly without any reason? My
mind is apprehending some evil. I lost my all energy."_END

B_2_C_71_31
BEGIN_
श्रुता नो यादृशाः पूर्वम् नृपतीनाम् विनाशने || २-७१-३६
आकाराः तान् अहम् सर्वान् इह पश्यामि सारथे |_END
BEGIN_
"Whatever things were heard by us formerly in the same case of ruin of kings, I am
seeing here all those signs."_END

B_2_C_71_32
BEGIN_
सम्मार्जनविहीनानि परुषाण्युपलक्षये || २-७१-३७
असम्यतकवाटानि श्रीविहीनानि सर्वशः |
बलिकर्मविहीनानि धूपसम्मेदनेन च || २-७१-३८
अनाशितकुटुम्बानि प्रभाहीनजनानि च |
अलक्स्मीकानि पश्यामि कुटुम्बिभवनान्यहम् || २-७१-३९_END
BEGIN_
"I am seeing the family horses in which dirt is not swept away, with their doors
wide open, bereft of splendor on all sides without any offerings being made, and with no incense
burned . Families are starving and people look miserably without any charming appearance."_END

B_2_C_71_33
BEGIN_
अपेतमाल्यशोभानि असम्मृष्टाजिराणि च |
देवागाराणि शून्यानि न चाभान्ति यथापुरम् || २-७१-४०_END
BEGIN_
"The temples of gods are deserted and have lost their radiance, with their splendor
of floral decorations lost, nor are there any assembling to perform sacrifices as before."_END

B_2_C_71_34
BEGIN_
देवतार्चाः प्रविद्धाश्च यज्ञ्गोष्ठ्यस्तथाविधाः |
माल्यापणेषु राजन्ते नाद्य पण्यानि वा तथा || २-७१-४१_END
BEGIN_
"Worships of the deities were placed aside. Assemblies of prayers are also not
adorned with saleable flowers and garlands today."_END

B_2_C_71_35
BEGIN_
दृश्यन्ते वणिजोऽप्यद्य न यथापूर्वमत्रवै |
ध्यानसम्विग्नहृदयाः नष्टव्यापारयन्त्रिताः || २-७१-४२_END
BEGIN_
"Even traders lost interest in trading tie-ups and their minds are tied up in
thoughts. They are not being seen here today, as before."_END

B_2_C_71_36
BEGIN_
देवायतनचैत्येषुदीनाः पक्षिगणास्तथा || २-७१-४३
मलिनम् च अश्रु पूर्ण अक्षम् दीनम् ध्यान परम् कृशम् |
सस्त्री पुंसम् च पश्यामि जनम् उत्कण्ठितम् पुरे || २-७१-४४_END
BEGIN_
"Clusters of birds in temples and large trees in the city are looking desolate. The
population of men and women in the city look thoughtful anguished weak messy and despondent with
their eyes held in tears."_END

B_2_C_71_37
BEGIN_
इति एवम् उक्त्वा भरतः सूतम् तम् दीन मानसः |
तानि अनिष्टानि अयोध्यायाम् प्रेक्ष्य राज गृहम् ययौ || २-७१-४५_END
BEGIN_
After seeing those bad omens in Ayodhya, the broken hearted Bharata spoke to the
charioteer as aforesaid and went to the royal palace._END

B_2_C_71_38
BEGIN_
ताम् शून्य शृन्ग अटक वेश्म रथ्याम् |
रजो अरुण द्वार कपाट यन्त्राम् |
दृष्ट्वा पुरीम् इन्द्र पुरी प्रकाशाम् |
दुह्खेन सम्पूर्णतरः बभूव || २-७१-४६_END
BEGIN_
Beholding the city of Ayodhya,that formerly possessed the splendor of the capital
city of Indra, now with its squares houges and high ways deserted, the doors and hinges covered
with rust , Bharata was overcome with grief._END

B_2_C_71_39
BEGIN_
बहूनि पश्यन् मनसो अप्रियाणि |
यानि अन्न्यदा न अस्य पुरे बभूवुः |
अवाक् शिरा दीन मना नहृष्टः |
पितुर् महात्मा प्रविवेश वेश्म || २-७१-४७_END
BEGIN_
Seeing many things disenchanted to mind which did not occur at any time before in
the city, the high soled Bharata with his head bent down and with his mind miserable gloomily
entered his father's house._END

B_2_C_72_0
BEGIN_
अपश्यंस् तु ततः तत्र पितरम् पितुर् आलये |
जगाम भरतः द्रष्टुम् मातरम् मातुर् आलये || २-७२-१_END
BEGIN_
Not finding his father there in his father's palace, Bharata went to his mother's
apartment to see his mother._END

B_2_C_72_1
BEGIN_
अनुप्राप्तम् तु तम् दृष्ट्वा कैकेयी प्रोषितम् सुतम् |
उत्पपात तदा हृष्टा त्यक्त्वा सौवर्ण मानसम् || २-७२-२_END
BEGIN_
Beholding his son who was absent from home for long and returned, Kaikeyi was
delighted and then sprang up, leaving her golden seat to receive him._END

B_2_C_72_2
BEGIN_
स प्रविश्य एव धर्म आत्मा स्व गृहम् श्री विवर्जितम् |
भरतः प्रेक्ष्य जग्राह जनन्याः चरणौ शुभौ || २-७२-३_END
BEGIN_
Soon after entering his house, which was devoid of any splendor, Bharata the
righteous man, grasped the auspicious feet of his mother in obeisance._END

B_2_C_72_3
BEGIN_
सा तम् मूर्ध्नि समुपाघ्राय परिष्वज्य यशस्विनम् |
अङ्के भरतम् आरोप्य प्रष्टुम् समुपचक्रमे || २-७२-४_END
BEGIN_
Kaikeyi smelled (as mark of affection) the head of the illustrious Bharata, embraced
him, made him to ascend on her lap and started questions._END

B_2_C_72_4
BEGIN_
अद्य ते कतिचित् रात्र्यः च्युतस्य आर्यक वेश्मनः |
अपि न अध्व श्रमः शीघ्रम् रथेन आपततः तव || २-७२-५_END
BEGIN_
"How many days passed since you have left your maternal grand father's house? Is
there no travel fatigue to you, who have come speedily in a chariot?"_END

B_2_C_72_5
BEGIN_
आर्यकः ते सुकुशलो युधा जिन् मातुलः तव |
प्रवासाच् च सुखम् पुत्र सर्वम् मे वक्तुम् अर्हसि || २-७२-६_END
BEGIN_
"O,son! Is your grand father doing well? Is Yudhajit, your maternal uncle doing
well? Were you happy in being absent from home ? Be good enough to tell me all?"_END

B_2_C_72_6
BEGIN_
एवम् पृष्ठः तु कैकेय्या प्रियम् पार्थिव नन्दनः |
आचष्ट भरतः सर्वम् मात्रे राजीव लोचनः || २-७२-७_END
BEGIN_
Affectionately enquired thus by Kaikeyi, the lotus eyed bharata, the prince,
narrated all to his mother._END

B_2_C_72_7
BEGIN_
अद्य मे सप्तमी रात्रिः च्युतस्य आर्यक वेश्मनः |
अम्बायाः कुशली तातः युधाजिन् मातुलः च मे || २-७२-८_END
BEGIN_
"It is seventh day to me today since I left the grand father's house. Yudhajit, your
father as well as my maternal uncle are doing well"_END

B_2_C_72_8
BEGIN_
यन् मे धनम् च रत्नम् च ददौ राजा परम् तपः |
परिश्रान्तम् पथि अभवत् ततः अहम् पूर्वम् आगतः || २-७२-९_END
BEGIN_
"Carrying the gifts and jewels, given to me by the king who annihilates enemies my
followers became tired on the way and I arrived ahead of them"_END

B_2_C_72_9
BEGIN_
राज वाल्य हरैः दूतैअः त्वर्यमाणो अहम् आगतः |
यद् अहम् प्रष्टुम् इच्चामि तत् अम्बा वक्तुम् अर्हसि || २-७२-१०_END
BEGIN_
"I came soon because of the horridness communicated by royal messengers. Let my
mother be good enough to tell that which I desire to ask her."_END

B_2_C_72_10
BEGIN_
शून्यो अयम् शयनीयः ते पर्यन्को हेम भूषितः |
न च अयम् इक्ष्वाकु जनः प्रहृष्टः प्रतिभाति मे || २-७२-११_END
BEGIN_
"This couch of yours, which is fit for rest and decorated with gold, is empty. These
men and women of Ikshvaku race do not appear to me to be cheerful."_END

B_2_C_72_11
BEGIN_
राजा भवति भूयिष्ठ्गम् इह अम्बाया निवेशने |
तम् अहम् न अद्य पश्यामि द्रष्टुम् इच्चन्न् इह आगतः || २-७२-१२_END
BEGIN_
"King Dasaratha mostly used to here in your house. Now, I am not seeing him. I came
here, desirous of seeing him."_END

B_2_C_72_12
BEGIN_
पितुर् ग्रहीष्ये चरणौ तम् मम आख्याहि पृच्चतः |
आहोस्विद् अम्ब ज्येष्ठायाः कौसल्याया निवेशने || २-७२-१३_END
BEGIN_
"O, mother! I will grasp in obeisance my father's feet. Tell about him, as I ask
you. Or is he in the house of Kausalya the senior most of my mothers?"_END

B_2_C_72_13
BEGIN_
तम् प्रत्युवाच कैकेयी प्रियवद् घोरम् अप्रियम् |
अजानन्तम् प्रजानन्ती राज्य लोभेन मोहिता || २-७२-१४_END
BEGIN_
Deluded by the greed for kingdom, Kaikeyi who knew everything closely, told the
terribly unpleasant news to Bharata, who did not know anything, as though the news was
delightful._END

B_2_C_72_14
BEGIN_
या गतिः सर्व भूतानाम् ताम् गतिम् ते पिता गतः |
राजा महात्मा तेजस्वी यायजूकः सताम् गतिः || २-७२-१५_END
BEGIN_
"King Dasaratha, your father who was having a noble nature, who was respect and
performing frequent sacrifices as well as a refuge to good men followed that path which all beings
follow."_END

B_2_C_72_15
BEGIN_
तत् श्रुत्वा भरतः वाक्यम् धर्म अभिजनवान् शुचिः |
पपात सहसा भूमौ पितृ शोक बल अर्दितः || २-७२-१६_END
BEGIN_
Bharata, a righteous man with a noble descent and an honest man, hearing that news ,
immediately fell down on the ground, being exceedingly tormented by the grief for his father._END

B_2_C_72_16
BEGIN_
हा हातोऽस्मीति कृपणाम् दीनाम् वाचमुदीरयन् |
निपपात महाबाहुर्बाहु विक्षिप्य वीर्यवान् || २-७२-१७_END
BEGIN_
The mighty armed and heroic Bharata, raising his grievous and depressed voice,
cried, "Alas, I am undone' and lifting up his arms, fell down._END

B_2_C_72_17
BEGIN_
ततः शोकेन सम्वीतः पितुर् मरण दुह्खितः |
विललाप महा तेजा भ्रान्त आकुलित चेतनः || २-७२-१८_END
BEGIN_
Then, Bharata of great majesty, who was enveloped in grief and whose mind was
troubled by reeling under the death of his father, lamented profusely._END

B_2_C_72_18
BEGIN_
एतत् सुरुचिरम् भाति पितुर् मे शयनम् पुरा |
शशिनेवामलम् रात्रौ गगनम् तोयदात्यये || २-७२-१९_END
BEGIN_
"These beautiful couch of my father earlier used to enhance its charm with his
splendor, as the moon irradiates the stainless sky in the night at the end of a rainy season."_END

B_2_C_72_19
BEGIN_
तत् इदम् न विभाति अद्य विहीनम् तेन धीमता |
व्योमेव श्शिना हीनमप्भुष्क इव सागरः || २-७२-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Being unoccupied by my virtuous father, the same couch now is bereft of its glory,
like the sky without the moon or like the sea with its water dried up."_END

B_2_C_72_20
BEGIN_
बाष्पमुत्सृज्य कण्ठे स्वात्मना परिपीडितः |
आच्चाद्य वदनम् श्रीमद्वस्त्रेण जयताम् वरः || २-७२-२१_END
BEGIN_
Covering his lovely face with a raiment, Bharata the first of those who are
victorious, with a proffond distress in his mind shed tears in lamentation._END

B_2_C_72_21
BEGIN_
तम् आर्तम् देव सम्काशम् समीक्ष्य पतितम् भुवि |
निकृत्तमिव सालस्य स्कन्धम् परशुना वने || २-७२-२२
मत्तमातङ्गसम्काशम् चन्द्रार्कसदृशम् भुवः |
उत्थापयित्वा शोक आर्तम् वचनम् च इदम् अब्रवीत् || २-७२-२३_END
BEGIN_
Kaikeyi lifted up from the floor, her son Bharata, who was pained with sorrow,
looking like a god, who fell on the ground like a sala tree, cut off by an axe, appearing like an
elephant in rut, looking like the moon and sun,afflicted with grief as he was and spoke the
following words:_END

B_2_C_72_22
BEGIN_
उत्तिष्ठ उत्तिष्ठ किम् शेषे राज पुत्र महा यशः |
त्वद् विधा न हि शोचन्ति सन्तः सदसि सम्मताः || २-७२-२४_END
BEGIN_
"O, the highly illustrious prince! Arise,arise! Why are you lying down? Gentlemen,
like you, respected in the assembly of men, do not grieve indeed."_END

B_2_C_72_23
BEGIN_
दानयज्ञाधिकारा हि शीलश्रुतिवचोनुगा |
बुद्धिस्ते बुद्धिसम्पन्न प्रभेवार्कस्य मन्दिरे || २-७२-२५_END
BEGIN_
"O, Bharata endowed with understanding! Your intellect, which follows good character
as well as sacred scriptures, has an authority to donate and sacrifice, ever shining as such like a
splendor in the abode of the sun._END

B_2_C_72_24
BEGIN_
स रुदत्या चिरम् कालम् भूमौ विपरिवृत्य च |
जननीम् प्रत्युवाच इदम् शोकैः बहुभिर् आवृतः || २-७२-२६_END
BEGIN_
Encircled by numerous afflictions, Bharata weeping for a long time , rolled over the
floor and replied to his mother as follows:_END

B_2_C_72_25
BEGIN_
अभिषेक्ष्यति रामम् तु राजा यज्ञम् नु यक्ष्यति |
इति अहम् कृत सम्कल्पो हृष्टः यात्राम् अयासिषम् || २-७२-२७_END
BEGIN_
"Making up my mind that the king was either going to anoint Rama as a prince regent
or to perform a sacrifice, I cheerfully got into the journey."_END

B_2_C_72_26
BEGIN_
तत् इदम् हि अन्यथा भूतम् व्यवदीर्णम् मनो मम |
पितरम् यो न पश्यामि नित्यम् प्रिय हिते रतम् || २-७२-२८_END
BEGIN_
"All this turned to be otherwise. By not beholding my father, who was forever
interested in my wishes and welfare, my heart is broken to pieces"_END

B_2_C_72_27
BEGIN_
अम्ब केन अत्यगात् राजा व्याधिना मय्य् अनागते |
धन्या राम आदयः सर्वे यैः पिता संस्कृतः स्वयम् || २-७२-२९_END
BEGIN_
"O, mother! On what ailment did the king die, when I was not here? Rama and others
who performed purificatory rites by themselves for our father indeed fortunate."_END

B_2_C_72_28
BEGIN_
न नूनम् माम् महा राजः प्राप्तम् जानाति कीर्तिमान् |
उपजिघ्रेद्द् हि माम् मूर्ध्नि तातः सम्नम्य सत्वरम् || २-७२-३०_END
BEGIN_
"It is sure that the illustrious monarch does not know the fact of my arrival.
Otherwise, my father quickly would have indeed smelled my head, by bending me in affection."_END

B_2_C_72_29
BEGIN_
क्व स पाणिः सुख स्पर्शः तातस्य अक्लिष्ट कर्मणः |
येन माम् रजसा ध्वस्तम् अभीक्ष्णम् परिमार्जति || २-७२-३१_END
BEGIN_
"Where is the caressing hand of my dear father of unwearied action wipe away the
dust with which I am covered?"_END

B_2_C_72_30
BEGIN_
यो मे भ्राता पिता बन्धुर् यस्य दासो अस्मि धीमतः |
तस्य माम् शीघ्रम् आख्याहि रामस्य अक्लिष्ट कर्मणः || २-७२-३२_END
BEGIN_
"Announce soon about my arrival to Rama of immortal exploits, he who is a wise
brother to me, my father, my friend and to whom Iam a servant."_END

B_2_C_72_31
BEGIN_
पिता हि भवति ज्येष्ठो धर्मम् आर्यस्य जानतः |
तस्य पादौ ग्रहीष्यामि स हि इदानीम् गतिर् मम || २-७२-३३_END
BEGIN_
"An elder brother indeed becomes a father for a faithful man who knows
righteousness. I will grasp his feet in obeisance. He is indeed the refuge for me now."_END

B_2_C_72_32
BEGIN_
धर्मविद्धर्मनित्यश्च सत्यसन्धो दृढव्रतः |
आर्ये किम् अब्रवीद् राजा पिता मे सत्य विक्रमः || २-७२-३४_END
BEGIN_
"What did my father the king, who know virtue , who was forever pious, who was true
to his promise, who was strictly truthful, who was truly valiant and who was honorable, say?"_END

B_2_C_72_33
BEGIN_
पश्चिमम् साधु संदेशम् इच्चामि श्रोतुम् आत्मनः |
इति पृष्टा यथा तत्त्वम् कैकेयी वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् || २-७२-३५_END
BEGIN_
"I want to hear exactly the last message of my father to me." Thus requested by
Bharata, Kaikeyi spoke the following words in accordance with truth._END

B_2_C_72_34
BEGIN_
राम इति राजा विलपन् हा सीते लक्ष्मण इति च |
स महात्मा परम् लोकम् गतः गतिमताम् वरः || २-७२-३६_END
BEGIN_
That high soled king, who was excellent in understanding the Universal spirit,
departed to the world, crying �O, Rama, O, Sita, O, Lakshmana!'_END

B_2_C_72_35
BEGIN_
इमाम् तु पश्चिमाम् वाचम् व्याजहार पिता तव |
काल धर्म परिक्षिप्तः पाशैः इव महा गजः || २-७२-३७_END
BEGIN_
"Your father spoke the following last words also, when he was abandoned by the
operation of time , like a huge elephant surrendered into a trap."_END

B_2_C_72_36
BEGIN_
सिद्ध अर्थाः तु नरा रामम् आगतम् सीतया सह |
लक्ष्मणम् च महा बाहुम् द्रक्ष्यन्ति पुनर् आगतम् || २-७२-३८_END
BEGIN_
"Those men who are able to see Rama returning Sita and the mighty armed Lakshmana
are those who are fortunate enough"_END

B_2_C_72_37
BEGIN_
तत् श्रुत्वा विषसाद एव द्वितीया प्रिय शंसनात् |
विषण्ण वदनो भूत्वा भूयः पप्रच्च मातरम् || २-७२-३९_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the aforesaid pronouncement, which disclosed second unpleasant news, Bharata
was dejected. Becoming gloomy faced, he once again asked his mother as follows:_END

B_2_C_72_38
BEGIN_
क्व च इदानीम् स धर्म आत्मा कौसल्य आनन्द वर्धनः |
लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा सीतया च समम् गतः || २-७२-४०_END
BEGIN_
"Where did the virtuous Rama, who augments Kausalya' s delight go now along with my
brother Lakshmana and with Sita?"_END

B_2_C_72_39
BEGIN_
तथा पृष्टा यथा तत्त्वम् आख्यातुम् उपचक्रमे |
माता अस्य युगपद् वाक्यम् विप्रियम् प्रिय शन्कया || २-७२-४१_END
BEGIN_
Asked by Bharata in this manner, his mother started telling so greatly unpleasant
words, exactly as it had happened, as though they were very pleasant words._END

B_2_C_72_40
BEGIN_
स हि राज सुतः पुत्र चीर वासा महा वनम् |
दण्डकान् सह वैदेह्या लक्ष्मण अनुचरः गतः || २-७२-४२_END
BEGIN_
"O, son! He, that prince Rama, wearing long narrow pieces of bark, went indeed to
the great forest of Dandaka, followed by Lakshmana and also sita."_END

B_2_C_72_41
BEGIN_
तत् श्रुत्वा भरतः त्रस्तः भ्रातुः चारित्र शन्कया |
स्वस्य वंशस्य माहात्म्यात् प्रष्टुम् समुपचक्रमे || २-७२-४३_END
BEGIN_
Hearing these words, Bharata being aware of the glory of his race, doubted and
fearedwhether Rama was sent to exile because of his unrighteous conduct, if any and again asked his
mother as follows:_END

B_2_C_72_42
BEGIN_
कच्चिन् न ब्राह्मण वधम् हृतम् रामेण कस्यचित् |
कच्चिन् न आढ्यो दरिद्रः वा तेन अपापो विहिंसितः || २-७२-४४_END
BEGIN_
"Has not Rama indeed stolen the wealth of some Brahmana? Has not he done any harm
either to a rich or to a poor virtuous man?"_END

B_2_C_72_43
BEGIN_
कच्चिन् न पर दारान् वा राज पुत्रः अभिमन्यते |
कस्मात् स दण्डक अरण्ये भ्रूणहा इव विवासितः || २-७२-४५_END
BEGIN_
"Has the prince indeed not longed for the wife of another? Why was my brother Rama
expelled to the forest of Dandaka?"_END

B_2_C_72_44
BEGIN_
अथ अस्य चपला माता तत् स्व कर्म यथा तथम् |
तेन एव स्त्री स्वभावेन व्याहर्तुम् उपचक्रमे || २-७२-४६_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter his mother, an unsteady woman, on account of her feminine nature began to
narrate her act which was the exact state of the case._END

B_2_C_72_45
BEGIN_
एवमुक्ता तु कैकेयी भरतेन महात्मना |
उवाच वचनम् हृष्टा मूढा पण्डितमानिनी || २-७२-४७_END
BEGIN_
Kaikeyi, a fool thing herself to be learned, after hearing the queries of the
virtuous Bharata, delightfully spoke the following words:_END

B_2_C_72_46
BEGIN_
न ब्राह्मण धनम् किंचिद्द् हृतम् रामेण कस्यचित् |
कश्चिन् न आढ्यो दरिद्रः वा तेन अपापो विहिंसितः || २-७२-४८
न रामः पर दारामः च चक्षुर्भ्याम् अपि पश्यति |_END
BEGIN_
"Not even a little of belonging to a Brahman was stolen by Rama,No harm was done by
him either to a rich or to a poor virtuous man. Rama does not even look with his eyes, the wives of
others."_END

B_2_C_72_47
BEGIN_
मया तु पुत्र श्रुत्वा एव रामस्य एव अभिषेचनम् || २-७२-४९
याचितः ते पिता राज्यम् रामस्य च विवासनम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O, son! Immediately on hearing decidedly about the coronation ceremony of Rama by
me then, I asked your father to bestow kingdom to you and for banishment of Rama to the forest"_END

B_2_C_72_48
BEGIN_
स स्व वृत्तिम् समास्थाय पिता ते तत् तथा अकरोत् || २-७२-५०
रामः च सह सौमित्रिः प्रेषितः सह सीतया |_END
BEGIN_
"Submitting to his own decree, King Dasaratha, your father has done all that was
requested by me. Rama along with Lakshmana and Sita too were sent into exile."_END

B_2_C_72_49
BEGIN_
तम् अपश्यन् प्रियम् पुत्रम् मही पालो महा यशाः || २-७२-५१
पुत्र शोक परिद्यूनः पन्चत्वम् उपपेदिवान् |_END
BEGIN_
"That beloved son having not been seen, the very celebrated monarch was made
miserable by the grief for his son and obtained death"_END

B_2_C_72_50
BEGIN_
त्वया तु इदानीम् धर्मज्ञ राजत्वम् अवलम्ब्यताम् || २-७२-५२
त्वत् कृते हि मया सर्वम् इदम् एवम् विधम् कृतम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Bharata knowing righteousness! The king- ship may be taken charge by you now.
All this was indeed done for your sake in this manner by me."_END

B_2_C_72_51
BEGIN_
मा शोकम् मा च सम्तापम् धैर्यमाश्रय पुत्रक || २-७२-५३
त्वदधीना हि नगरी राज्यम् चैतदनामयम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O, son! Do not dwell in grief and anguish. Dwell in courage. This city along with
the salubrious kingdom indeed is subservient to you."_END

B_2_C_72_52
BEGIN_
तत् पुत्र शीघ्रम् विधिना विधिज्ञैः |
वसिष्ठ मुख्यैः सहितः द्विज इन्द्रैः |
सम्काल्य राजानम् अदीन सत्त्वम् |
आत्मानम् उर्व्याम् अभिषेचयस्व || २-७२-५४_END
BEGIN_
"Hence, meet the chiefs of Brahmanas like Vasishta and others who know the rituals,
perform soon the sacred rites to the king and become crowned as a king yourself to the earth, being
not depressed in spirit._END

B_2_C_73_0
BEGIN_
श्रुत्वा तु पितरम् वृत्तम् भ्रातरु च विवासितौ |
भरतः दुह्ख सम्तप्तैदम् वचनम् अब्रवीत् || २-७३-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that his father was dead and both his brothers were exiled; Bharata was
tormented with grief and spoke the following words:_END

B_2_C_73_1
BEGIN_
किम् नुण्कार्यम् हतस्य इह मम राज्येन शोचतः |
विहीनस्य अथ पित्रा च भ्रात्रा पितृ समेन च || २-७३-२_END
BEGIN_
Bereft of my father as well as my brother too, who is exactly like my father, what
is the use of a kingdom now to me, lamenting as I am with despair?"_END

B_2_C_73_2
BEGIN_
दुह्खे मे दुह्खम् अकरोर् व्रणे क्षारम् इव आदधाः |
राजानम् प्रेत भावस्थम् कृत्वा रामम् च तापसम् || २-७३-३_END
BEGIN_
"Making Dasaratha to die and turning Rama to be an ascetic, you brought one calamity
after another like sprinkling salt on a wound."_END

B_2_C_73_3
BEGIN_
कुलस्य त्वम् अभावाय काल रात्रिर् इव आगता |
अन्गारम् उपगूह्य स्म पिता मे न अवबुद्धवान् || २-७३-४_END
BEGIN_
"You came for destruction of our race, like the night of destruction coming at the
end of the world. My father could not be aware of his embracing a live char-coal to his bosom."_END

B_2_C_73_4
BEGIN_
मृत्युमापादितो राजा त्वया मे पापदर्शिनि |
सुखम् परिहृतम् मोहात्कुलेऽस्मिन् कुलपांसनि || २-७३-५_END
BEGIN_
"O, the malevolent woman! You caused the death of my father. O, the one who made our
race unchaste! In this race, happiness is deserted through your ignorance."_END

B_2_C_73_5
BEGIN_
त्वाम् प्राप्य हि पिता मे.द्य सत्यसन्धो महायशाः |
तीव्रदुःखाभिसम्तप्तो वृत्तो दशरथो नृपः || २-७३-६_END
BEGIN_
"My father, king Dasaratha, who was true to his promise and immensely famous, now
died, tormented as he was with bitter grief, because of you."_END

B_2_C_73_6
BEGIN_
विनाशितो महाराजः पिता मे धर्मवत्सलः |
कस्मात्प्रव्राजितो रामः कस्मादेव वनम् गतः || २-७३-७_END
BEGIN_
"Why did you kill my father the monarch, who was intent on righteousness? Why did
you send Rama on exile to the forest?"_END

B_2_C_73_7
BEGIN_
कौसल्या च सुमित्रा च पुत्र शोक अभिपीडिते |
दुष्करम् यदि जीवेताम् प्राप्य त्वाम् जननीम् मम || २-७३-८_END
BEGIN_
"It is impossible that Kausalya and Sumitra, who are afflicted with grief for their
sons, will live in fellowship with you, my mother."_END

B_2_C_73_8
BEGIN_
ननु तु आर्यो अपि धर्म आत्मा त्वयि वृत्तिम् अनुत्तमाम् |
वर्तते गुरु वृत्तिज्ञो यथा मातरि वर्तते || २-७३-९_END
BEGIN_
"Even Rama my elder brother, a pious man who knows how to behave with elders, used
to act with the best behavior in your case, exactly as how he was behaving with his own
mother."_END

B_2_C_73_9
BEGIN_
तथा ज्येष्ठा हि मे माता कौसल्या दीर्घ दर्शिनी |
त्वयि धर्मम् समास्थाय भगिन्याम् इव वर्तते || २-७३-१०_END
BEGIN_
"In the same manner, Kausalya, my elder mother having far sightedness and
established in piety, indeed used to behave with you as your sister."_END

B_2_C_73_10
BEGIN_
तस्याः पुत्रम् कृत आत्मानम् चीर वल्कल वाससम् |
प्रस्थाप्य वन वासाय कथम् पापे न शोचसि || २-७३-११_END
BEGIN_
"Why are you not lamenting, after sending Rama, the disciplined Kausalya 's son,
clothed in a bark dress, to live in a forest? O, sinful one!"_END

B_2_C_73_11
BEGIN_
अपाप दर्शिनम् शूरम् कृत आत्मानम् यशस्विनम् |
प्रव्राज्य चीर वसनम् किम् नु पश्यसि कारणम् || २-७३-१२_END
BEGIN_
"You indeed sent into exile, clad in a bark dress, Rama having a virtuous
disposition, a valiant man, a self controlled and illustrious man as he was. What reason do you
gather for it?"_END

B_2_C_73_12
BEGIN_
लुब्धाया विदितः मन्ये न ते अहम् राघवम् प्रति |
तथा हि अनर्थो राज्य अर्थम् त्वया नीतः महान् अयम् || २-७३-१३_END
BEGIN_
"I think it is not known to you, a greedy woman, about my devotion towards Rama. It
is exactly so. You have brought in this great calamity for the sake of a kingdom."_END

B_2_C_73_13
BEGIN_
अहम् हि पुरुष व्याघ्राव् अपश्यन् राम लक्ष्मणौ |
केन शक्ति प्रभावेन राज्यम् रक्षितुम् उत्सहे || २-७३-१४_END
BEGIN_
"By which source of strength can I be able to protect the kingdom, without those
lions among men, Rama and Lakshmana in proximity to me?"_END

B_2_C_73_14
BEGIN_
तम् हि नित्यम् महा राजो बलवन्तम् महा बलः |
उअपाश्रितः अभूद् धर्म आत्मा मेरुर् मेरु वनम् यथा || २-७३-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Dasaratha the monarch, having great strength and a pious mind always indeed used to
take refuge in that strong man Rama as the Meru mountain takes refuge in a forest surrounding the
mountain."_END

B_2_C_73_15
BEGIN_
सो अहम् कथम् इमम् भारम् महा धुर्य समुद्यतम् |
दम्यो धुरम् इव आसाद्य सहेयम् केन च ओजसा || २-७३-१६_END
BEGIN_
"By what stamina, shall I sustain this burden of kingship any more than a young
bullock that is yet to be tamed, would stand the strain on getting a load, lifted up with ease by a
giant bullock."_END

B_2_C_73_16
BEGIN_
अथ वा मे भवेत् शक्तिर् योगैः बुद्धि बलेन वा |
सकामाम् न करिष्यामि त्वाम् अहम् पुत्र गर्धिनीम् || २-७३-१७_END
BEGIN_
