"Or even if a strength can be brought into existence in me by following certain
suitable methods or by strength of intelligence, I will not allow you, who are greedy in fetching
of kingdom for your son, to fulfill your desire."_END

B_2_C_73_17
BEGIN_
न मे विकाङ्खा जायेत त्यक्तुम् त्वाम् पापनिश्चयाम् |
यदि रामस्य नावेक्षा त्वयि स्यान्मातृवत्सदा || २-७३-१८_END
BEGIN_
"No aversion would be felt by me even to desert you, a woman of evil designs, if
Rama did not treat you like a mother at all times."_END

B_2_C_73_18
BEGIN_
उत्पन्ना तु कथम् बुद्धिस्तवेयम् पापदर्शिनि |
साधुचारित्रविभ्राष्टे पूर्वेषाम् नो विगर्हिता || २-७३-१९_END
BEGIN_
"O, malevolent woman with your good conduct disappeared! How this idea forbidden by
our ancestors, has arisen in your mind at all?"_END

B_2_C_73_19
BEGIN_
अस्मिन् कुले हि सर्वेषाम् ज्येष्ठो राज्येऽभिषिच्यते |
अपरे भ्रातरस्तस्मिन् प्रवर्तन्ते समाहिताः || २-७३-२०_END
BEGIN_
"The eldest of all in this race should be indeed anointed as a king. The rest of his
brothers are to behave reverently towards their elder brother."_END

B_2_C_73_20
BEGIN_
न हि मन्ये नृशसे त्वम् राजधर्ममवेक्षसे |
गतिम् वा न विजानासि राजवृत्तस्य शाश्वतीम् || २-७३-२१_END
BEGIN_
"O, cruel woman! I feel that you are not catching even a glimpse of the rules
relating to kings or not even aware of a permanent procedure prevailing in the administration of
kings."_END

B_2_C_73_21
BEGIN_
सततम् राजवृत्ते हि ज्येष्ठो राज्येऽभिषिच्यते |
राज्ञामेतत्समम् तत्स्यादिक्ष्वाकूणाम् विशेषतः || २-७३-२२_END
BEGIN_
"According to the administration of kings the eldest son always indeed gets
inaugurated in kingdom. This procedure is similar to all kings; especially so in the case of
Ikshvaku kings."_END

B_2_C_73_22
BEGIN_
तेषाम् धर्मैकरक्षाणाम् कुलचारित्रयोगिनाम् |
अत्र चारित्रशौण्डीर्यम् त्वाम् प्राप्य विनिवर्ततम् || २-७३-२३_END
BEGIN_
"The pride of reputation of those belonging to Ikshvaku race, who protect
righteousness alone and who possessed good family conduct, is turned away by you today."_END

B_2_C_73_23
BEGIN_
तवापि सुमहाभागा जनेन्द्राः कुलपूर्वगाः |
बुद्धेर्मोहः कथमयम् सम्भूतस्त्वयि गर्हितः || २-७३-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Even kings belonging to your ancestral race were great people. How has this
contemptible stupidity of mind born in you?"_END

B_2_C_73_24
BEGIN_
न तु कामम् करिष्यामि तवाऽह्म् पापनिश्चये |
त्वया व्यसनमारब्धम् जीवितान्तकरम् मम || २-७३-२५_END
BEGIN_
"O, woman with evil designs! I for one will not fulfill your desire. A criminal act,
which will cause even an end to my life, has been undertaken by you."_END

B_2_C_73_25
BEGIN_
एष त्विदानीमेवाहमप्रियार्थम् तवनघम् |
निवर्तयिष्यामि वनात् भ्रातरम् स्वजन प्रियम् || २-७३-२६_END
BEGIN_
"Now itself at the cause of your dislike, I for one will bring back from the forest,
my brother, who is a faultless man and a beloved man of his people."_END

B_2_C_73_26
BEGIN_
निवर्तयित्वा रामम् च तस्याहम् दीप्ततेजनः |
दासभूतो भविष्यामि सुस्थिरेणान्तरात्मना || २-७३-२७_END
BEGIN_
"Bringing back Rama with a very firm mind, I will become a servant to him, who is
radiant with glory."_END

B_2_C_73_27
BEGIN_
इति एवम् उक्त्वा भरतः महात्मा |
प्रिय इतरैः वाक्य गणैअः तुदंस् ताम् |
शोक आतुरः च अपि ननाद भूयः |
सिम्हो यथा पर्वत गह्वरस्थः || २-७३-२८_END
BEGIN_
Speaking as aforesaid, the high soled Bharata, pricking her with a multitude of
unpleasant words, roared again like a lion stationed in a mountain cave._END

B_2_C_74_0
BEGIN_
ताम् तथा गर्हयित्वा तु मातरम् भरतः तदा |
रोषेण महता आविष्टः पुनर् एव अब्रवीद् वचः || २-७४-१_END
BEGIN_
Reproaching Kaikeyi in that manner, Bharata again spoke the following words, wrapped
as he was in great anger._END

B_2_C_74_1
BEGIN_
राज्यात् भ्रंशस्व कैकेयि नृशंसे दुष्ट चारिणि |
परित्यक्ता च धर्मेण मा मृतम् रुदती भव || २-७४-२_END
BEGIN_
"O, Kaikeyi! The cruel and evil-mannered woman! Get lost from this kingdom. You
having abandoned righteousness, remain lamenting about me, who will be dead soon."_END

B_2_C_74_2
BEGIN_
किम् नु ते अदूषयद् राजा रामः वा भृश धार्मिकः |
ययोः मृत्युर् विवासः च त्वत् कृते तुल्यम् आगतौ || २-७४-३_END
BEGIN_
"What harm king Dasaratha or the highly righteous Rama have done to you so harshly
that Dasaratha's death and Rama's exile have occurred at one and the same time because of you?"_END

B_2_C_74_3
BEGIN_
भ्रूणहत्याम् असि प्राप्ता कुलस्य अस्य विनाशनात् |
कैकेयि नरकम् गच्च मा च भर्तुः सलोकताम् || २-७४-४_END
BEGIN_
"O, Kaikeyi! You got the sin of killing an embryo because of the destruction of this
race. O, Kaikeyi! Go to hell .Do not get the residence in the same heaven as your husband."_END

B_2_C_74_4
BEGIN_
यत्त्वया हीदृशम् पापम् कृतम् घोरेण कर्मणा |
सर्वलोकप्रियम् हित्वा ममाप्यापादितम् भयम् || २-७४-५_END
BEGIN_
"You have done this terrific act and committed such a great sin. By forsaking the
persons beloved by all, an alarm has been created in me also."_END

B_2_C_74_5
BEGIN_
त्वत् कृते मे पिता वृत्तः रामः च अरण्यम् आश्रितः |
अयशो जीव लोके च त्वया अहम् प्रतिपादितः || २-७४-६_END
BEGIN_
"My father died and Rama is dwelling in a forest, because of you. You got me ill
fame in this world of beings."_END

B_2_C_74_6
BEGIN_
मातृ रूपे मम अमित्रे नृशंसे राज्य कामुके |
न ते अहम् अभिभाष्यो अस्मि दुर्वृत्ते पति घातिनि || २-७४-७_END
BEGIN_
"Though in appearance you are my mother, you are inimical to me. You are a cruel
woman, greedy of kingdom. With evil conduct, you killed your husband. I should never speak to
you."_END

B_2_C_74_7
BEGIN_
कौसल्या च सुमित्रा च याः च अन्या मम मातरः |
दुह्खेन महता आविष्टाः त्वाम् प्राप्य कुल दूषिणीम् || २-७४-८_END
BEGIN_
"Kausalya, Sumitra and my other mothers are engrossed in a great misfortune, by
falling victim to you, who brought disgrace to our family."_END

B_2_C_74_8
BEGIN_
न त्वम् अश्व पतेः कन्या धर्म राजस्य धीमतः |
राक्षसी तत्र जाता असि कुल प्रध्वंसिनी पितुः || २-७४-९
यत् त्वया धार्मिको रामः नित्यम् सत्य परायणः |
वनम् प्रस्थापितः दुह्खात् पिता च त्रिदिवम् गतः || २-७४-१०_END
BEGIN_
"The righteous Rama, who is forever devoted to truth, was sent to the forest. Due to
grief for his son, my father went to heaven. You do not seem to be the daughter of Asvapati, the
pious and sensible king. You were born there as a demo ness, to destroy the house of my
father."_END

B_2_C_74_9
BEGIN_
यत् प्रधाना असि तत् पापम् मयि पित्रा विना कृते |
भ्रातृभ्याम् च परित्यक्ते सर्व लोकस्य च अप्रिये || २-७४-११_END
BEGIN_
"The aforesaid sin you have committed has made me father less. Besides, I have been
abandoned by my brothers and all the people dislike me now."_END

B_2_C_74_10
BEGIN_
कौसल्याम् धर्म सम्युक्ताम् वियुक्ताम् पाप निश्चये |
कृत्वा कम् प्राप्स्यसे तु अद्य लोकम् निरय गामिनी || २-७४-१२_END
BEGIN_
"O, woman having evil desires, moving towards hell! Which world will you attain now,
after making Kausalya endowed with righteousness, deprived of her son?"_END

B_2_C_74_11
BEGIN_
किम् न अवबुध्यसे क्रूरे नियतम् बन्धु संश्रयम् |
ज्येष्ठम् पितृ समम् रामम् कौसल्याय आत्म सम्भवम् || २-७४-१३_END
BEGIN_
"O, cruel woman! Don't you know that Rama the son of Kausalya is a subdued man, who
is devoted to his relatives and as an eldest brother, equal to a father?"_END

B_2_C_74_12
BEGIN_
अन्ग प्रत्यन्गजः पुत्रः हृदयाच् च अपि जायते |
तस्मात् प्रियतरः मातुः प्रियत्वान् न तु बान्धवः || २-७४-१४_END
BEGIN_
"A son is the most beloved to his mother as he is born from the primary and
secondary limbs of her body and also from her heart. The other relatives are only like
friends."_END

B_2_C_74_13
BEGIN_
अन्यदा किल धर्मज्ञा सुरभिः सुर सम्मता |
वहमानौ ददर्श उर्व्याम् पुत्रौ विगत चेतसौ || २-७४-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Once upon a time, Kamadhenu the mythical cow of Vasista, who knew righteousness and
was worshipped by celestials, is said to have seen her sons, drawing a heavy burden on earth and
became unconscious."_END

B_2_C_74_14
BEGIN_
ताव् अर्ध दिवसे श्रान्तौ दृष्ट्वा पुत्रौ मही तले |
रुरोद पुत्र शोकेन बाष्प पर्याकुल ईक्षणा || २-७४-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing her sons (a pair of bullocks) fatigued, after toiling for half a part of
their day on earth, Kamadhenu the mythical cow cried with her eyes full of tears in grief for the
fate of her sons."_END

B_2_C_74_15
BEGIN_
अधस्तात् व्रजतः तस्याः सुर राज्ञो महात्मनः |
बिन्दवः पतिता गात्रे सूक्ष्माः सुरभि गन्धिनः || २-७४-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Small and sweet smelling tear drops of that mythical cow fell on the limbs of the
high soled Indra the lord of celestials, who was traveling below in a lower region."_END

B_2_C_74_16
BEGIN_
इन्द्रोऽप्यश्रुनिपातम् तम् स्वगात्रे पुण्यगन्धिनम् |
सुरभिम् मन्यते दृष्ट्वा भूयसीम् ताम् सुरेश्वरः || २-७४-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing those sweet- scented tears falling on his limbs, Indra the Lord of
celestials identified the tears to be those of the great Kamadhenu the mythical cow."_END

B_2_C_74_17
BEGIN_
निरीक्समाणः शक्रस्ताम् ददर्श सुरभिम् स्थिताम् |
आकाशे विष्ठिताम् दीनाम् रुदतीम् भृशदुःखिताम् || २-७४-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Looking into the sky, Indra saw that Kamadhenu standing there with anguish and
pitiably weeping with great grief."_END

B_2_C_74_18
BEGIN_
ताम् दृष्ट्वा शोक सम्तप्ताम् वज्र पाणिर् यशस्विनीम् |
इन्द्रः प्रान्जलिर् उद्विग्नः सुर राजो अब्रवीद् वचः || २-७४-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Indra the lord of celestials with a thunder bolt in his hand, seeing that beautiful
Kamadhenu the mythical cow, tormented with grief, spoke eagerly with joined palms to her, as
follows:_END

B_2_C_74_19
BEGIN_
भयम् कच्चिन् न च अस्मासु कुतश्चित् विद्यते महत् |
कुतः निमित्तः शोकः ते ब्रूहि सर्व हित एषिणि || २-७४-२१_END
BEGIN_
"O, cow the well wisher of all! I hope there is no great panic from any quarter to
us. For what occasion is your sorrow?"_END

B_2_C_74_20
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्ता तु सुरभिः सुर राजेन धीमता |
पत्युवाच ततः धीरा वाक्यम् वाक्य विशारदा || २-७४-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Hearing the words of the intelligent Indra the god of celestials, the prudent
Kamadhenu who was skilled in expressing words, replied as follows:_END

B_2_C_74_21
BEGIN_
शान्तम् पातम् न वः किंचित् कुतश्चित् अमर अधिप |
अहम् तु मग्नौ शोचामि स्व पुत्रौ विषमे स्थितौ || २-७४-२३
एतौ दृष्ट्वा कृषौ दीनौ सूर्य रश्मि प्रतापिनौ |
अर्ध्यमानौ बली वर्दौ कर्षकेण सुर अधिप || २-७४-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Heaven forefend that evil! O, Indra the lord of celestials! There is no danger
whatsoever to you from any quarter. Seeing these pair of bullocks, my sons, who are in hardship,
being scorched by sun's rays, becoming weak, being troubled by the man who ploughs the land and
being immersed in grief, I am pitiably weeping O, Indra!"_END

B_2_C_74_22
BEGIN_
मम कायात् प्रसूतौ हि दुह्खितौ भार पीडितौ |
यौ दृष्ट्वा परितप्ये अहम् न अस्ति पुत्र समः प्रियः || २-७४-२५_END
BEGIN_
"By seeing them who are afflicted with the burden and aggrieved, I am greatly
anguished. They are indeed born of my body. There is no dearest one equal to a son indeed!"_END

B_2_C_74_23
BEGIN_
यस्याः पुत्र सहस्त्रैस्तु कृत्स्नम् व्याप्तमिदम् जगत् |
ताम् दृष्ट्वा रुदतीम् शक्रो न सुतान्मन्यते परम् || २-७४-२६_END
BEGIN_
Seeing such a sacred cow weeping, whose hundreds of sons pervaded the entire world,
Indra reckoned none whosoever as more than a son (to a mother) ._END

B_2_C_74_24
BEGIN_
सदाऽप्रतिमवृत्ताया लोकधारणकाम्यया |
श्रीमत्या गुणनित्यायाः स्वभावपरिचेष्टया || २-७४-२७
यस्याः पुत्रसहस्राणि सापि शोचै कामधुक् |
किम् पुनर् या विना रामम् कौसल्या वर्तयिष्यति || २-७४-२८_END
BEGIN_
"Such a Kamadhenu the sacred cow, which is desirous of maintaining the world always
having unequalled behavior, the venerable one, by its very nature functioning forever with good
qualities and to whom there are thousands of sons, is lamenting, how much more indeed Kausalya will
drag her existence, without Rama?"_END

B_2_C_74_25
BEGIN_
एक पुत्रा च साध्वी च विवत्सा इयम् त्वया कृता |
तस्मात् त्वम् सततम् दुह्खम् प्रेत्य च इह च लप्स्यसे || २-७४-२९_END
BEGIN_
"She, who has only one son and who is a holy woman, has been made without a child by
you. Thereafter, you will obtain grief forever after your death or even here while living."_END

B_2_C_74_26
BEGIN_
अहम् हि अपचितिम् भ्रातुः पितुः च सकलाम् इमाम् |
वर्धनम् यशसः च अपि करिष्यामि न संशयः || २-७४-३०_END
BEGIN_
"I for my part, shall toil for the complete reinstatement of my brother and complete
the obsequial rites due to my father as well as for their prosperity and glory. There is no
doubt."_END

B_2_C_74_27
BEGIN_
आनाययित्वा तनयम् कौसल्याया महा द्युतिम् |
स्वयम् एव प्रवेक्ष्यामि वनम् मुनि निषेवितम् || २-७४-३१_END
BEGIN_
"Rama the son of Kausalya, of great prowess will be brought back to Ayodhya and I,
myself will go to the forest inhabited by the sages."_END

B_2_C_74_28
BEGIN_
न ह्यहम् पापसम्कल्पे पापे पापम् त्वया कृतम् |
शक्तो धारयितुम् पौरैरश्रुकण्ठै र्निरीक्षितः || २-७४-३२_END
BEGIN_
"O, wretched and evil minded woman! By seeing the sorrow stricken citizens, I am
indeed not able to bear the inequity done by you."_END

B_2_C_74_29
BEGIN_
सा त्वमग्निम् प्रविश वा स्वयम् वा दण्डकान्विश |
रज्जुम् बधान वा कण्ठे न हि तेऽन्यत्परायणम् || २-७४-३३_END
BEGIN_
"As for you, enter the fire or you yourself go to forest of Dandaka.or fasten a rope
around your neck. There is no other recourse for you."_END

B_2_C_74_30
BEGIN_
अहमप्यवनिम् प्राप्ते रामे सत्यपराक्रमे |
कृतकृत्यो भविष्यामि विप्रवासितकल्मषः || २-७४-३४_END
BEGIN_
"After Rama the truly mighty man, obtains his native land, I will even become an
accomplished man, with my sins duly washed away."_END

B_2_C_74_31
BEGIN_
इति नागैव अरण्ये तोमर अन्कुश चोदितः |
पपात भुवि सम्क्रुद्धो निह्श्वसन्न् इव पन्नगः || २-७४-३५_END
BEGIN_
As an elephant in a forest pricked with a javelin and a goad and as a hissing
serpent, Bharata was enraged and fell on the ground._END

B_2_C_74_32
BEGIN_
सम्रक्त नेत्रः शिथिल अम्बरः तदा |
विधूत सर्व आभरणः परम्तपः |
बभूव भूमौ पतितः नृप आत्मजः |
शची पतेः केतुर् इव उत्सव क्षये || २-७४-३६_END
BEGIN_
His eyes inflamed, his clothes in disarray, and his all ornaments discarded, Bharata
the prince and the tormentor of foes, lay on the earth, like a banner of Indra raised at the end of
a ceremony**_END

B_2_C_75_0
BEGIN_
दीर्घकालात्समुत्थाय सम्ज्ञाम् लब्ध्वा च वीर्यवान् |
नेत्राभ्यामश्रुपूर्णाभ्याम् दीनामुद्वीक्ष्य मातरम् || २-७५-१
सोऽमात्यमध्येभरतो जननीमभ्यकुत्सयत् |_END
BEGIN_
That valiant Bharata, having come to himself a long time on obtaining consciousness,
saw his mother whose eyes were filled pitiably with tears, reproached her mother in the midst of
the ministers and said as follows:-_END

B_2_C_75_1
BEGIN_
राज्यम् न कामये जातु मन्त्रये नापि मातरम् || २-७५-२
अभिषेकम् न जानामि यो.भूद्रज्ज़्ना समीक्षितः |
विप्रकृष्टे ह्यहम् देशे शत्रुघ्न सहितोऽवसम् || २-७५-३_END
BEGIN_
"I never desired for the kingdom nor consulted about this matter with even my
mother. I was not aware of the proposed coronation, which has of the been contemplated by king
Dasaratha; since I was staying indeed in a distant land, along with Satrughna."_END

B_2_C_75_2
BEGIN_
वनवासम् न जानामि रामस्यहम् महात्मनः |
विवासनम् वा सौमित्रेः सीतायाश्च यथाभवत् || २-७५-४_END
BEGIN_
"I was neither aware of the banishment of Rama to the forest nor about how the exile
of Lakshmana and Seetha have occurred."_END

B_2_C_75_3
BEGIN_
तथैव क्रोशतः तस्य भरतस्य महात्मनः |
कौसल्या शब्दम् आज्ञाय सुमित्राम् इदम् अब्रवीत् || २-७५-५_END
BEGIN_
Recognising the voice of Bharata the noble man, crying out in that manner, Kausalya
spoke the following words to Sumitra:_END

B_2_C_75_4
BEGIN_
आगतः क्रूर कार्यायाः कैकेय्या भरतः सुतः |
तम् अहम् द्रष्टुम् इच्चामि भरतम् दीर्घ दर्शिनम् || २-७५-६_END
BEGIN_
"Bharata, the son of Kaikeyi, the doer terrific deeds arrived. I went to see that
far-sighted Bharata."_END

B_2_C_75_5
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्त्वा सुमित्राम् सा विवर्णा मलिन अम्बरा |
प्रतस्थे भरतः यत्र वेपमाना विचेतना || २-७५-७_END
BEGIN_
That kausalya who became pale with her demeanor, dirty and emaciated, speaking to
Sumitra as aforesaid, became agitated and absent minded and proceeded to Bharata's place._END

B_2_C_75_6
BEGIN_
स तु राम अनुजः च अपि शत्रुघ्न सहितः तदा |
प्रतस्थे भरतः यत्र कौसल्याया निवेशनम् || २-७५-८_END
BEGIN_
Bharata, the younger brother of Rama on his part, along with Shatrughna started out
to Kausalya's place._END

B_2_C_75_7
BEGIN_
ततः शत्रुघ्न भरतौ कौसल्याम् प्रेक्ष्य दुह्खितौ |
पर्यष्वजेताम् दुह्ख आर्ताम् पतिताम् नष्ट चेतनाम् || २-७५-९
रुदन्तौ रुदतीम् दुःखात्समेत्यार्याम् मनस्स्विनीम् |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Kausalya who was afflicted with grief, who fell unconscious (on the way) who
was crying and who was an honorable woman with a noble mind. Shatrughna and Bharata wept in sorrow,
approached her painfully and embraced her._END

B_2_C_75_8
BEGIN_
भरतम् प्रत्युवाच इदम् कौसल्या भृश दुह्खिता || २-७५-१०
इदम् ते राज्य कामस्य राज्यम् प्राप्तम् अकण्टकम् |
सम्प्राप्तम् बत कैकेय्या शीघ्रम् क्रूरेण कर्मणा || २-७५-११_END
BEGIN_
Kausalya who was very much in sorrow , spoke the following words to Bharata: "you,
who have a desire for kingdom, have got this invincible kingdom ."Alas! By the cruel deed of
Kaikeyi, it was obtained by you soon!"_END

B_2_C_75_9
BEGIN_
प्रस्थाप्य चीर वसनम् पुत्रम् मे वन वासिनम् |
कैकेयी कम् गुणम् तत्र पश्यति क्रूर दर्शिनी || २-७५-१२_END
BEGIN_
"The ruthless Kaikeyi condemned my son to wear garments of bark and sent him to
dwell in the forest: What merit has she gained from this?"_END

B_2_C_75_10
BEGIN_
क्षिप्रम् माम् अपि कैकेयी प्रस्थापयितुम् अर्हति |
हिरण्य नाभो यत्र आस्ते सुतः मे सुमहा यशाः || २-७५-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Kaikeyi ought to send me too without delay to the place where my illustrious son
with a golden novel (the distinguished mark of Vishnu the god of creation) is there."_END

B_2_C_75_11
BEGIN_
अथवा स्वयम् एव अहम् सुमित्र अनुचरा सुखम् |
अग्नि होत्रम् पुरः कृत्य प्रस्थास्ये यत्र राघवः || २-७५-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Otherwise, I for my own satisfaction accompanied by Sumitra, placing in
front(carried by Brahmana) the sacred fire*** will happily set out to the place Raghava has
gone."_END

B_2_C_75_12
BEGIN_
कामम् वा स्वयम् एव अद्य तत्र माम् नेतुम् अर्हसि |
यत्र असौ पुरुष व्याघ्रः तप्यते मे तपः सुतः || २-७५-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Otherwise, you yourself ought to conduct me now, if you so desire, to the place
where my son, the tiger among men, is living as an ascetic."_END

B_2_C_75_13
BEGIN_
इदम् हि तव विस्तीर्णम् धन धान्य समाचितम् |
हस्ति अश्व रथ सम्पूर्णम् राज्यम् निर्यातितम् तया || २-७५-१६_END
BEGIN_
"This vast kingdom, endowed with elephants, horses and chariots and stock piled with
grains and riches, has been made over to you by her."_END

B_2_C_75_14
BEGIN_
इत्यादिबहुभिर्वाक्यैः क्रूरैः सम्भर्स्तितोऽनघः |
विव्यथे भरतस्तीव्रम् व्रणे तुद्येव सूचिना || २-७५-१७_END
BEGIN_
Derided with these and other harsh words that he had not merited, Bharata was
extremely perturbed, as if a needle was thrust into an open wound._END

B_2_C_75_15
BEGIN_
पपात चरणौ तस्यास्तदा सम्भ्रान्तचेतनः |
विलप्य बहुधाऽसम्ज्ञो लब्धसम्ज्ञ्स्ततः स्थितः || २-७५-१८_END
BEGIN_
His mind being perplexed and having lost his consciousness, Bharata then coming his
senses, wailed in many ways and fell at the feet of the queen._END

B_2_C_75_16
BEGIN_
एवम् विलपमानाम् ताम् भरतः प्रान्जलिस् तदा |
कौसल्याम् प्रत्युवाच इदम् शोकैः बहुभिर् आवृताम् || २-७५-१९_END
BEGIN_
Then, Bharata with folded hands, replied as follows to Kausalya who was encircled by
afflictions and weeping as aforesaid in many ways:_END

B_2_C_75_17
BEGIN_
आर्ये कस्मात् अजानन्तम् गर्हसे माम् अकिल्बिषम् |
विपुलाम् च मम प्रीतिम् स्थिराम् जानासि राघवे || २-७५-२०_END
BEGIN_
"O, noble woman! Why do you reproach me, sinless as I am, for those things that I do
not know anything? Nay, you know well of the greatest affection I have for Rama."_END

B_2_C_75_18
BEGIN_
कृता शास्त्र अनुगा बुद्धिर् मा भूत् तस्य कदाचन |
सत्य संधः सताम् श्रेष्ठो यस्य आर्यो अनुमते गतः || २-७५-२१_END
BEGIN_
"May the mind of the one who in any way whatsoever allowed for the departure of my
elder brother the best of men who keeps up his promise, be closed to all the seriptures."_END

B_2_C_75_19
BEGIN_
प्रैष्यम् पापीयसाम् यातु सूर्यम् च प्रति मेहतु |
हन्तु पादेन गाम् सुप्ताम् यस्य आर्यो अनुमते गतः || २-७५-२२_END
BEGIN_
"May he who counseled the banishment of my noble brother become the slave of the
vilest scoundrels, may he answer the calls of nature in the face of the sun and may he kick with
his foot, a sleeping cow."_END

B_2_C_75_20
BEGIN_
कारयित्वा महत् कर्म भर्ता भृत्यम् अनर्थकम् |
अधर्मः यो अस्य सो अस्याः तु यस्य आर्यो अनुमते गतः || २-७५-२३_END
BEGIN_
"With whose counsel my elder brother went to exile, to him let that sin incur, as to
a master who imposes the heaviest labour on his servant without remunerating him."_END

B_2_C_75_21
BEGIN_
परिपालयमानस्य राज्ञो भूतानि पुत्रवत् |
ततः तु द्रुह्यताम् पापम् यस्य आर्यो अनुमते गतः || २-७५-२४_END
BEGIN_
"with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile, to him let that sin incur as
to those who seek to harm a king who protects his people as if they are his own children."_END

B_2_C_75_22
BEGIN_
बलि षड् भागम् उद्धृत्य नृपस्य अरक्षतः प्रजाः |
अधर्मः यो अस्य सो अस्य अस्तु यस्य आर्यो अनुमते गतः || २-७५-२५_END
BEGIN_
"May the guilt of a king, who taking the sixth part of the revenue of his people
fails to protect them, be fallen on them with whose counsel my elder brother went to exile."_END

B_2_C_75_23
BEGIN_
संश्रुत्य च तपस्विभ्यः सत्रे वै यज्ञ दक्षिणाम् |
ताम् विप्रलपताम् पापम् यस्य आर्यो अनुमते गतः || २-७५-२६_END
BEGIN_
"May the sin of those having given the promise for certain sacrificial fees to
priests in a sacrifice, breaks that promise, to be his with whose counsel my elder brother went to
exile."_END

B_2_C_75_24
BEGIN_
हस्ति अश्व रथ सम्बाधे युद्धे शस्त्र समाकुले |
मा स्म कार्षीत् सताम् धर्मम् यस्य आर्यो अनुमते गतः || २-७५-२७_END
BEGIN_
"May the sin of him, who fails to observe the code of warfare followed by the
virtuous in a battle abundantly provided with elephants horses chariots weapons and men, be his
with whose counsel my elder brother went to exile."_END

B_2_C_75_25
BEGIN_
उपदिष्टम् सुसूक्ष्म अर्थम् शास्त्रम् यत्नेन धीमता |
स नाशयतु दुष्ट आत्मा यस्य आर्यो अनुमते गतः || २-७५-२८_END
BEGIN_
"May that perverse wretch, with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile,
forget the subtle meanings of the scriptures taught with care by a wise teacher."_END

B_2_C_75_26
BEGIN_
मा च तम् प्यूढबाह्वंसम् चन्द्रार्कसम्तेजनम् |
द्राक्षीद्राज्यस्थमासीनम् यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः || २-७५-२९_END
BEGIN_
"May he with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile, never behold that
Rama having large arms and broad shoulders radiant as the sun and the moon and seated as he will be
on a throne."_END

B_2_C_75_27
BEGIN_
पायसम् कृसरम् चागम् वृथा सो अश्नातु निर्घृणः |
गुरूमः च अपि अवजानातु यस्य आर्यो अनुमते गतः || २-७५-३०_END
BEGIN_
"May that pitiless one with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile, incur
the sin of partaking milk boiled with rice and sugar a cooked mixture of rice and peas with a few
species and a goat flesh without offering them to the gods and be lacking in reverence towards
teachers."_END

B_2_C_75_28
BEGIN_
गाश्च स्पृशतु पादेन गुरून् परिवदेत्स्वयम् |
मित्रे द्रुह्येत सोऽत्यन्तम् यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः || २-७५-३१_END
BEGIN_
"May he with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile, incur the sins of
kicking the cows, of personally abusing the elders and of deceiving a friend too much."_END

B_2_C_75_29
BEGIN_
विश्वासात्कथितम् किंचित्परिवादम् मिथः क्वचित् |
विवृणोतु स दुष्टात्मा यस्यार्योओऽनुमते गतः || २-७५-३२_END
BEGIN_
"May that perverse wretch with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile
incur the sin of divulging a little abusing words about others spoken occasionally in secret and in
confidence, to him."_END

B_2_C_75_30
BEGIN_
अकर्ता ह्यकृतज्ञश्च त्यक्तात्मा निरपत्रपः |
लोके भवतु विद्वेष्यो यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः || २-७५-३३_END
BEGIN_
"May he with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile, become a non doer, an
ungrateful person; a desperate man, the one who has abandoned shame and the one who is worthy of
hate."_END

B_2_C_75_31
BEGIN_
पुत्रैः दारैः च भृत्यैः च स्व गृहे परिवारितः |
स एको मृष्टम् अश्नातु यस्य आर्यो अनुमते गतः || २-७५-३४_END
BEGIN_
"May he with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile, incur the sin of
eating delicious food for himself alone when he is surrounded by his sons , wife and servants in
his house."_END

B_2_C_75_32
BEGIN_
अप्राप्य सदृशान् दाराननपत्यः प्रमीयताम् |
अनवाप्य क्रियाम् धर्म्याम् यश्यार्योऽनुमते गतः || २-७५-३५_END
BEGIN_
"May he with whose counsel my elder brother has departed; die issueless, failing to
secure a wife suitable for him and thus not fulfilling his religious duties."_END

B_2_C_75_33
BEGIN_
मात्मनः सम्ततिम् द्राक्षीत्स्वेषु दारेषु दुःखितः |
आयुः समग्रमप्राप्य यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः || २-७५-३६_END
BEGIN_
"May he with whose counsel my elder brother has departed, not see a child through
his wife and in distress, may not get a full long life."_END

B_2_C_75_34
BEGIN_
राज स्त्री बाल वृद्धानाम् वधे यत् पापम् उच्यते |
भृत्य त्यागे च यत् पापम् तत् पापम् प्रतिपद्यताम् || २-७५-३७_END
BEGIN_
"That sin which was proclaimed in killing a king a woman, a child or an aged person
or in abandoning one's dependents let him (with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile)
obtain the same sin."_END

B_2_C_75_35
BEGIN_
लाक्षया मधुमांसेन लोहेन च विषेण च |
सदैव बिभृयाद्भृत्यान् यस्यार्योऽसुमते गतः || २-७५-३८_END
BEGIN_
"May he with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile, obtain, tat= the sin
of nurturing his wife children and other dependents through sale of lacquer, liquor, flesh, iron or
poison."_END

B_2_C_75_36
BEGIN_
सम्ग्रामे समुपोढे स शत्रुपक्ष्भयम्करे |
पलायामानो वध्येत यस्यार्योऽनुमे गतः || २-७५-३९_END
BEGIN_
"May he with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile, obtain the sin of
being killed while fleeing, at a time when a battle inspiring fear upon enemy's side has
commanded."_END

B_2_C_75_37
BEGIN_
कपालपाणिः पृथिवीमटताम् चीरसम्वृतः |
भिक्समाणो यथोन्मत्तो यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतह् || २-७५-४०_END
BEGIN_
May he with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile, wander about the
world, as a mad man with a wooden bowl in his hand, dressed in rags and begging for alms."_END

B_2_C_75_38
BEGIN_
पाने प्रसक्तो भवतु स्त्रीष्वक्षेषु च नित्यशः |
काम्क्रोधाभिभूतस्तु यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः || २-७५-४१_END
BEGIN_
"May he with whose counsel my elder brother has departed, be given over to
infatuation and anger and be constantly involved in wine women and dice."_END

B_2_C_75_39
BEGIN_
यस्य धर्मे मनो भूयादधर्मम् स निषेवताम् |
अपात्रवर्षी भवतु यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः || २-७५-४२_END
BEGIN_
May the mind of man with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile, never
take delight in righteousness? Let him indulge in un righteousness and become a distributor of
gifts for the undeserving."_END

B_2_C_75_40
BEGIN_
संचितान्यस्य वित्तानि विविधानि सहस्रशः |
दस्युभिर्विप्रलुप्यन्ताम् यश्यार्योऽनुमते गतः || २-७५-४३_END
BEGIN_
"With whose counsel , my elder brother has gone to exile, let his various kinds of
riches got accumulated in thousands , be snatched away by robbers."_END

B_2_C_75_41
BEGIN_
उभे संध्ये शयानस्य यत् पापम् परिकल्प्यते |
तच् च पापम् भवेत् तस्य यस्य आर्यो अनुमते गतः || २-७५-४४_END
BEGIN_
"That sin which was proclaimed on him who sleeps during both the twilights, let that
sin be obtained by him, with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile."_END

B_2_C_75_42
BEGIN_
यद् अग्नि दायके पापम् यत् पापम् गुरु तल्पगे |
मित्र द्रोहे च यत् पापम् तत् पापम् प्रतिपद्यताम् || २-७५-४५_END
BEGIN_
"Let him obtains that sin, which attaches to a man who practices arson, to a man who
violets his teacher's bed and to a man who cheats his friend."_END

B_2_C_75_43
BEGIN_
देवतानाम् पितृऋणाम् च माता पित्रोस् तथैव च |
मा स्म कार्षीत् स शुश्रूषाम् यस्य आर्यो अनुमते गतः || २-७५-४६_END
BEGIN_
"May he, with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile, incur that sin of
not doing service to be god, to the manes and likewise to his mother and father."_END

B_2_C_75_44
BEGIN_
सताम् लोकात् सताम् कीर्त्याः सज् जुष्टात् कर्मणः तथा |
भ्रश्यतु क्षिप्रम् अद्य एव यस्य आर्यो अनुमते गतः || २-७५-४७_END
BEGIN_
"May he with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile, forfeit soon and now
from the region obtained by virtuous man, forfeit the illustriousness enjoyed by good men and the
righteous actions."_END

B_2_C_75_45
BEGIN_
अपास्य मातृशुश्रूषामनर्थे सोऽवतिष्ठताम् |
दीर्घबाहुर्महावक्षा यस्यार्योऽसुमते गतः || २-७५-४८_END
BEGIN_
"May he with whose counsel, that long armed and broad chested elder brother has gone
to exile, fail to give due reverence to his mother and be condemned to idleness."_END

B_2_C_75_46
BEGIN_
बहुपुत्रो दरिद्रश्च ज्वररोगसमन्वितः |
स भूयात्सततक्लेशी यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः || २-७५-४९_END
BEGIN_
"May he with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile, possess many
dependents be without resources, be undermined with fever and disease and be forever in
distress."_END

B_2_C_75_47
BEGIN_
आशामाशम् समानानाम् दीनानामूर्ध्वचक्षुषाम् |
आर्थिनाम् वितथाम् कुर्याद्यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः || २-७५-५०_END
BEGIN_
"May he with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile, incur the sin of
falsifying the hopes of highly miserable destitute, who having their eyes looking up seek for
alms."_END

B_2_C_75_48
BEGIN_
मायया रमताम् नित्यम् परुषः पिशुनोऽशुचिः |
राज्ज़्नो भीत स्त्वधर्मात्मा यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः || २-७५-५१_END
BEGIN_
"May he with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile, incur the sin of
staying in fear of the king forever as a cunning man, a cruel man, a back biter, a dishonest man
and an unrighteous man."_END

B_2_C_75_49
BEGIN_
ऋतुस्नाताम् सतीम् भार्यामृतुकालानुरोधिनीम् |
अतिवर्तेत दुष्टात्मा यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः || २-७५-५२_END
BEGIN_
"May the evil minded man, with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile,
incur the sin of ignoring his chaste wife, who having bathed after her course of menstruation.
approaches him for union having regard for the season favorable for procreation."_END

B_2_C_75_50
BEGIN_
धर्मदारान् परित्यज्य परदारान्नि षेवताम् |
त्यक्तधर्मरतिर्मूढो यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः || २-७५-५३_END
BEGIN_
"May that stupid with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile, incur the
sin of courting the consort of another disdaining his lawful wife and having forsaken his love for
piety."_END

B_2_C_75_51
BEGIN_
विप्रलु प्तप्रजातस्य दुष्कृतम् ब्राह्मणस्य यत् |
तदेव प्रतिपद्येत यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः || २-७५-५४_END
BEGIN_
"May he, with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile, incur that sin,
which is obtained by a Brahmana who is issue less."_END

B_2_C_75_52
BEGIN_
पानीयदूषके पापम् तथैव विषदायके |
यत्तदेकः स लभताम् यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः || २-७५-५५_END
BEGIN_
"May he with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile, incur the sin that is
attached to a person polluting the drinking water and likewise to a person who administers
poison."_END

B_2_C_75_53
BEGIN_
ब्राह्मणायोद्यताम् पूजाम् विहन्तु कलुषेन्द्रियः |
बालवत्साम् च गाम् दोग्दु यस्यर्योऽनुमते गतः || २-७५-५६_END
BEGIN_
"May he with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile, incur the sin
attached to a person disturbing the worship going to be offered to a Brahmana (by another) and to
milking a cow having a young calf. " (of age less than ten days)_END

B_2_C_75_54
BEGIN_
तृष्णार्तम् सति पानीये विप्रलम्भेन योजयेत् |
लभेत तस्य यत्पापम् यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः || २-७५-५७_END
BEGIN_
"To him, with whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile, let that sin be
obtained of disappointing a person oppressed with thirst, even though water was available."_END

B_2_C_75_55
BEGIN_
भक्त्या विवदमानेषु मार्गमाश्रित्य पश्यतः |
तस्य पापेन युज्येत यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः || २-७५-५८_END
BEGIN_
"With whose counsel my elder brother has gone to exile, let the sin be accorded to
him, who while standing on the road, merely witnesses a dispute between two divided groups without
trying to make peace between them."_END

B_2_C_75_56
BEGIN_
विहीनाम् पति पुत्राभ्याम् कौसल्याम् पार्थिव आत्मजः |
एवम् आश्वसयन्न् एव दुह्ख आर्तः निपपात ह || २-७५-५९_END
BEGIN_
"While thus counseling Kausalya, who was bereft of her husband and son, the prince
Bharata fell down, depressed as he was with anguish."_END

B_2_C_75_57
BEGIN_
तथा तु शपथैः कष्टैः शपमानम् अचेतनम् |
भरतम् शोक सम्तप्तम् कौसल्या वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् || २-७५-६०_END
BEGIN_
Kausalya spoke the following words to Bharata who was tormented with grief, was
quite distraught and who just uttered formidable imprecations in the aforesaid manner:_END

B_2_C_75_58
BEGIN_
मम दुह्खम् इदम् पुत्र भूयः समुपजायते |
शपथैः शपमानो हि प्राणान् उपरुणत्सि मे || २-७५-६१_END
BEGIN_
"O, son! My grief is further enhanced. By uttering the curses, you are indeed
racking my spirits."_END

B_2_C_75_59
BEGIN_
दिष्ट्या न चलितः धर्मात् आत्मा ते सह लक्ष्मणः |
वत्स सत्य प्रतिज्ञो मे सताम् लोकान् अवाप्स्यसि || २-७५-६२_END
BEGIN_
"O ,son! Fortunately, your mind as it is endowed with nobility, has not swerved from
righteous path. You will obtain the world of the blessed, along with Lakshmana."_END

B_2_C_75_60
BEGIN_
इत्युक्त्वा चाङ्कमानीय भरतम् भ्रातृवत्सलम् |
परिष्वज्य महाबाहुम् रुरोद भृशदुःखिता || २-७५-६३_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking to Bharata who was devoted to his brother Rama, she took the valiant
Bharata to her lap, embraced him and wept aloud , as she was very much afflicted with grief._END

B_2_C_75_61
BEGIN_
एवम् विलपमानस्य दुह्ख आर्तस्य महात्मनः |
मोहाच् च शोक सम्रोधात् बभूव लुलितम् मनः || २-७५-६४_END
BEGIN_
Lamenting thus, the great soled Bharata distraught on account of grief, felt himself
about to swoon, with his mind crushed by the burden of grief._END

B_2_C_75_62
BEGIN_
लालप्यमानस्य विचेतनस्य |
प्रनष्ट बुद्धेः पतितस्य भूमौ |
मुहुर् मुहुर् निह्श्वसतः च दीर्घम् |
सा तस्य शोकेन जगाम रात्रिः || २-७५-६५_END
BEGIN_
To Bharata that night passed with grief in lamenting thus laying fallen unconscious
on the ground, sighing warmly again and again with his power of discernment having been lost._END

B_2_C_76_0
BEGIN_
तम् एवम् शोक सम्तप्तम् भरतम् केकयी सुतम् |
उवाच वदताम् श्रेष्ठो वसिष्ठः श्रेष्ठ वाग् ऋषिः || २-७६-१_END
BEGIN_
The sage Vasishta, the excellent one among the speakers having eloquence, spoke to
that Bharata, Kaikeyi's son who was thus tormented with grief._END

B_2_C_76_1
BEGIN_
अलम् शोकेन भद्रम् ते राज पुत्र महा यशः |
प्राप्त कालम् नर पतेः कुरु सम्यानम् उत्तरम् || २-७६-२_END
BEGIN_
"O, the greatly illustrious prince! My blessing to you. You have lamented long
enough. Perform in an excellent way, the last rites of the king."_END

B_2_C_76_2
BEGIN_
वसिष्ठस्य वचः श्रुत्वा भरतः धारणाम् गतः |
प्रेत कार्याणि सर्वाणि कारयाम् आस धर्मवित् || २-७६-३_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Vasishta, Bharata conversant with his duty fell prostate and
proceeded with all the arrangements for the obsequies._END

B_2_C_76_3
BEGIN_
उद्धृतम् तैल सम्क्लेदात् स तु भूमौ निवेशितम् |
आपीत वर्ण वदनम् प्रसुप्तम् इव भूमिपम् || २-७६-४
सम्वेश्य शयने च अग्र्ये नाना रत्न परिष्कृते |
ततः दशरथम् पुत्रः विललाप सुदुह्खितः || २-७६-५_END
BEGIN_
Raising the body of king Dasaratha, from the vessel where it had been immersed in
oil, seeming as it were asleep with face in the color of gold, that son Bharata placed it in a
magnificent couch, adorned with every kind of precious stone and in a great grief, lamented.(as
follows):_END

B_2_C_76_4
BEGIN_
किम् ते व्यवसितम् राजन् प्रोषिते मय्य् अनागते |
विवास्य रामम् धर्मज्ञम् लक्ष्मणम् च महा बलम् || २-७६-६_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! Having sent into exile the virtuous Rama and Lakshmana who is possessed of
great strength, while I was away from home and had not yet returned, what did you intend to
do?"_END

B_2_C_76_5
BEGIN_
क्व यास्यसि महा राज हित्वा इमम् दुह्खितम् जनम् |
हीनम् पुरुष सिम्हेन रामेण अक्लिष्ट कर्मणा || २-७६-७_END
BEGIN_
"Where will you go, leaving this person (me) who was distressed and bereft of Rama
the unwearied one in action and the excellent one among men?"_END

B_2_C_76_6
BEGIN_
योग क्षेमम् तु ते राजन् को अस्मिन् कल्पयिता पुरे |
त्वयि प्रयाते स्वः तात रामे च वनम् आश्रिते || २-७६-८_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! O, father! Who is supposed to see the welfare and security of your city of
Ayodhya, while you have departed for heaven and while Rama has gone, taking refuge in a
forest?"_END

B_2_C_76_7
BEGIN_
विधवा पृथिवी राजंस् त्वया हीना न राजते |
हीन चन्द्रा इव रजनी नगरी प्रतिभाति माम् || २-७६-९_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! Bereft of you and deprived of its lord, this earth does not look charming.
To me, this city is looking like a night without a moon."_END

B_2_C_76_8
BEGIN_
एवम् विलपमानम् तम् भरतम् दीन मानसम् |
अब्रवीद् वचनम् भूयो वसिष्ठः तु महान् ऋषिः || २-७६-१०_END
BEGIN_
The great sage Vasishta again spoke the following words to that Bharata who was
distressed in mind and thus lamenting._END

B_2_C_76_9
BEGIN_
प्रेत कार्याणि यानि अस्य कर्तव्यानि विशाम्पतेः |
तानि अव्यग्रम् महा बाहो क्रियताम् अविचारितम् || २-७६-११_END
BEGIN_
"O, mighty armed Bharata! Without hesitation or repining, carry out the funeral
rites of the king that should be done."_END

B_2_C_76_10
BEGIN_
तथा इति भरतः वाक्यम् वसिष्ठस्य अभिपूज्य तत् |
ऋत्विक् पुरोहित आचार्यांस् त्वरयाम् आस सर्वशः || २-७६-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Be it so" answered Bharata and obedient to Vasishta's command, he summoned speedily
the appointed priests who were knowing the rules of the funeral rites."_END

B_2_C_76_11
BEGIN_
ये तु अग्रतः नर इन्द्रस्याग्नि अगारात् बहिष् कृताः |
ऋत्विग्भिर् याजकैः चैव ते ह्रियन्ते यथा विधि || २-७६-१३_END
BEGIN_
The fires of that king were prepared outside the chamber and kindled in accordance
with the rituals by the priests and the sacrificial attendants._END

B_2_C_76_12
BEGIN_
शिबिलायाम् अथ आरोप्य राजानम् गत चेतनम् |
बाष्प कण्ठा विमनसः तम् ऊहुः परिचारकाः || २-७६-१४_END
BEGIN_
The attendants were choked with tears in their throats and disconsolate in their
mind, made the dead king to mount on a small palanquin and carried it away._END

B_2_C_76_13
BEGIN_
हिरण्यम् च सुवर्णम् च वासांसि विविधानि च |
प्रकिरन्तः जना मार्गम् नृपतेर् अग्रतः ययुः || २-७६-१५_END
BEGIN_
The people went along the path, scattering silver, gold and various kinds of clothes
in front of the king._END

B_2_C_76_14
BEGIN_
चन्दन अगुरु निर्यासान् सरलम् पद्मकम् तथा |
देव दारूणि च आहृत्य चिताम् चक्रुस् तथा अपरे || २-७६-१६
गन्धान् उच्च अवचामः च अन्यांस् तत्र दत्त्वा अथ भूमिपम् |
ततः सम्वेशयाम् आसुः चिता मध्ये तम् ऋत्विजः || २-७६-१७_END
BEGIN_
In the same manner, some others brought sandal wood, sweet aloes, different fragrant
essences, with leaps of Sarala Padmaka and Devadaru woods and many other kinds of fragrant
substances, went there and threw them into the funeral pile. Thereafter the appointed priests
caused the king's body to lie down there in the midst of the funeral pyre._END

B_2_C_76_15
BEGIN_
तथा हुत अशनम् हुत्वा जेपुस् तस्य तदा ऋत्विजः |
जगुः च ते यथा शास्त्रम् तत्र सामानि सामगाः || २-७६-१८_END
BEGIN_
Then, those priests engaged for the benefit of the king poured oblations into the
fire and recited sacred texts (relevant to the funeral rites). Those among the priests, who could
recite the hymns of Samaveda, chanted them according to the rules._END

B_2_C_76_16
BEGIN_
शिबिकाभिः च यानैः च यथा अर्हम् तस्य योषितः |
नगरान् निर्ययुस् तत्र वृद्धैः परिवृताः तदा || २-७६-१९_END
BEGIN_
Then, his ladies, encircled by elders mounted palanquins or other vehicles, as
deserving and departed from the city to that place._END

B_2_C_76_17
BEGIN_
प्रसव्यम् च अपि तम् चक्रुर् ऋत्विजो अग्नि चितम् नृपम् |
स्त्रियः च शोक सम्तप्ताः कौसल्या प्रमुखाः तदा || २-७६-२०_END
BEGIN_
Then, the appointed priests as well as Kausalya and other women who were tormented
with grief, circumambulated in anti clockwise direction that king who was lying on a funeral
pile._END

B_2_C_76_18
BEGIN_
क्रौन्चीनाम् इव नारीणाम् निनादः तत्र शुश्रुवे |
आर्तानाम् करुणम् काले क्रोशन्तीनाम् सहस्रशः || २-७६-२१_END
BEGIN_
At that time the crying sounds of thousands of women, pitiably weeping with agony,
were heard like the sounds of female curlew birds._END

B_2_C_76_19
BEGIN_
ततः रुदन्त्यो विवशा विलप्य च पुनः पुनः |
यानेभ्यः सरयू तीरम् अवतेरुर् वर अन्गनाः || २-७६-२२_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, the lamenting ladies deprived of their grit wept again and again and
descended from their vehicles at the bank of Sarayu River._END

B_2_C_76_20
BEGIN_
कृत उदकम् ते भरतेन सार्धम् |
नृप अन्गना मन्त्रि पुरोहिताः च |
पुरम् प्रविश्य अश्रु परीत नेत्रा |
भूमौ दश अहम् व्यनयन्त दुह्खम् || २-७६-२३_END
BEGIN_
Along with Bharata, the royal women, the ministers and family priests offered their
oblations with water and entered the city with their eyes filled in tears and spent ten days with
great difficulty by sleeping on bare floor._END

B_2_C_77_0
BEGIN_
ततः दश अहे अतिगते कृत शौचो नृप आत्मजः |
द्वादशे अहनि सम्प्राप्ते श्राद्ध कर्माणि अकारयत् || २-७७-१_END
BEGIN_
After having passed the tenth day of the death of Dasaratha, Bharata having himself
purified, performed Shraddha* rites on the arrival of the twelfth day._END

B_2_C_77_1
BEGIN_
ब्राह्मणेभ्यो ददौ रत्नम् धनम् अन्नम् च पुष्कलम् |
वासांसि च महार्हाणि रत्नानि विविधानि च || २-७७-२_END
BEGIN_
On the occasion of Shraddha rites, Bharata gave precious stones, money, a lot of
cooked rice, very valuable clothes and various other kinds of presents to Brahmans._END

B_2_C_77_2
BEGIN_
बास्तिकम् बहु शुक्लम् च गाः च अपि शतशः तथा |
दासी दासम् च यानम् च वेश्मानि सुमहान्ति च || २-७७-३
ब्राह्मणेभ्यो ददौ पुत्रः राज्ञः तस्य और्ध्वदैहिकम् |_END
BEGIN_
In that ceremony performed in honor of the dead king, Bharata the son of Dasaratha
gave multitudes of white goats, hundreds of cows, servants and servant maids, vehicles and very big
houses to Brahmans._END

B_2_C_77_3
BEGIN_
ततः प्रभात समये दिवसे अथ त्रयोदशे || २-७७-४
विललाप महा बाहुर् भरतः शोक मूर्चितः |
शब्द अपिहित कण्ठः च शोधन अर्थम् उपागतः || २-७७-५
चिता मूले पितुर् वाक्यम् इदम् आह सुदुह्खितः |_END
BEGIN_
Then, at the time of dawn on the thirteenth day, the mighty armed Bharata who came
for clearing up bones and ashes, wept in grief, his throat being choked of sound (because of
crying) and spoke in great distress the following words, having reached the foot of his father's
funeral pile (to collect the bones and ashes for their immersion in Sarayu River)._END

B_2_C_77_4
BEGIN_
तात यस्मिन् निषृष्टः अहम् त्वया भ्रातरि राघवे || २-७७-६
तस्मिन् वनम् प्रव्रजिते शून्ये त्यक्तः अस्म्य् अहम् त्वया |_END
BEGIN_
"O, father! My brother Rama to whose care I was entrusted by you, having gone on
exile to the forest, I now become abandoned wholly alone, by you."_END

B_2_C_77_5
BEGIN_
यथा गतिर् अनाथायाः पुत्रः प्रव्राजितः वनम् || २-७७-७
ताम् अम्बाम् तात कौसल्याम् त्यक्त्वा त्वम् क्व गतः नृप |_END
BEGIN_
"O, king! O, father! Where have you gone, leaving Kausalya the mother whose son
Rama, her support, has been sent away from home to the forest?"_END

B_2_C_77_6
BEGIN_
दृष्ट्वा भस्म अरुणम् तच् च दग्ध अस्थि स्थान मण्डलम् || २-७७-८
पितुः शरीर निर्वाणम् निष्टनन् विषसाद ह |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that spot of collection (of bones), which became reddish brown in colour
because of ashes, with bones consumed by fire and his father's body having extinguished, Bharata
was depressed and began to cry loudly._END

B_2_C_77_7
BEGIN_
स तु दृष्ट्वा रुदन् दीनः पपात धरणी तले || २-७७-९
उत्थाप्यमानः शक्रस्य यन्त्र ध्वजैव च्युतः |_END
BEGIN_
Miserable as he was to see the spot, Bharata fell weeping on the ground, as a flag
staff fastened by any mechanical contrivance would drop down while being raised in honor of Indra
the god of celestials._END

B_2_C_77_8
BEGIN_
अभिपेतुस् ततः सर्वे तस्य अमात्याः शुचि व्रतम् || २-७७-१०
अन्त काले निपतितम् ययातिम् ऋषयो यथा |_END
BEGIN_
All his ministers hastily approached Bharata who was virtuous in conduct, as sages
once rushed to the fallen Yayati at the time of his death._END

B_2_C_77_9
BEGIN_
शत्रुघ्नः च अपि भरतम् दृष्ट्वा शोक परिप्लुतम् || २-७७-११
विसम्ज्ञो न्यपतत् भूमौ भूमि पालम् अनुस्मरन् |_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Bharata, Shatrughna was also overwhelmed with grief and while recollecting
the king, fell unconscious on the ground._END

B_2_C_77_10
BEGIN_
उन्मत्तैव निश्चेता विललाप सुदुह्खितः || २-७७-१२
स्मृत्वा पितुर् गुण अन्गानि तनि तानि तदा तदा |_END
BEGIN_
Remembering the many gestures of his father resulting from his loving qualities made
from time to time, Shatrughna was lamenting (as follows) like one who has lost his wits, bewildered
as he was._END

B_2_C_77_11
BEGIN_
मन्थरा प्रभवः तीव्रः कैकेयी ग्राह सम्कुलः || २-७७-१३
वर दानमयो अक्षोभ्यो अमज्जयत् शोक सागरः |_END
BEGIN_
"We are immersed in a violent and appalling ocean of sorrow invoked by Mandhara, in
which Kaikeyi in the form of a crocodile swam in its current the irrevocable boons granted to her
by my father."_END

B_2_C_77_12
BEGIN_
सुकुमारम् च बालम् च सततम् लालितम् त्वया || २-७७-१४
क्व तात भरतम् हित्वा विलपन्तम् गतः भवान् |_END
BEGIN_
"O, father! Where have you gone leaving the lamenting Bharata, your boy always being
caressed by you."_END

B_2_C_77_13
BEGIN_
ननु भोज्येषु पानेषु वस्त्रेष्व् आभरणेषु च || २-७७-१५
प्रवारयसि नः सर्वांस् तन् नः को अद्य करिष्यति |_END
BEGIN_
"You used to fulfill the wishes of all of us, in the matter of eatables, drinks,
clothes, and jewels. Who else will do it (now) for us."_END

B_2_C_77_14
BEGIN_
अवदारण काले तु पृथिवी न अवदीर्यते || २-७७-१६
विहीना या त्वया राज्ञा धर्मज्ञेन महात्मना |_END
BEGIN_
"That earth which is deprived of you, the high soled and righteous king, is not
riven even when it is the time to be riven."_END

B_2_C_77_15
BEGIN_
पितरि स्वर्गम् आपन्ने रामे च अरण्यम् आश्रिते || २-७७-१७
किम् मे जीवित सामर्थ्यम् प्रवेक्ष्यामि हुत अशनम् |_END
BEGIN_
"The father having obtained heaven and Rama having taken refuge in a forest, what is
the significance of life for me? I shall enter a fire."_END

B_2_C_77_16
BEGIN_
हीनो भ्रात्रा च पित्रा च शून्याम् इक्ष्वाकु पालिताम् || २-७७-१८
अयोध्याम् न प्रवेक्ष्यामि प्रवेक्ष्यामि तपो वनम् |_END
BEGIN_
"Bereft of my brother and father, I can not return to the deserted city of Ayodhya,
where Ikshvaku used to reign. I shall retire to a hermitage."_END

B_2_C_77_17
BEGIN_
तयोः विलपितम् श्रुत्वा व्यसनम् च अन्ववेक्ष्य तत् || २-७७-१९
भृशम् आर्ततरा भूयः सर्वएव अनुगामिनः |_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the lamentation of both of them and beholding their plight, all their
companions were disturbed very much, once again._END

B_2_C_77_18
BEGIN_
ततः विषण्णौ श्रान्तौ च शत्रुघ्न भरताव् उभौ || २-७७-२०
धरण्याम् सम्व्यचेष्टेताम् भग्न शृन्गाव् इव ऋषभौ |_END
BEGIN_
Both Shatrughna, and Bharata were wearied with grief and began to roll on the
ground, like two bulls whose horns have been broken._END

B_2_C_77_19
BEGIN_
ततः प्रकृतिमान् वैद्यः पितुर् एषाम् पुरोहितः || २-७७-२१
वसिष्ठो भरतम् वाक्यम् उत्थाप्य तम् उवाच ह |_END
BEGIN_
Then, Vasista, a noble man, a learned man and the family priest of their father,
raised up that Bharata from the ground and spoke the following words:_END

B_2_C_77_20
BEGIN_
त्रयोदशोऽयम् दिवसः पितुर्वृत्तस्य ते विभो || २-७७-२२
सावशेषास्थिनिचये किमिह त्वम् विलम्बसे |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Lord Bharata! This is the thirteenth day of the death of your father. Why are
you hanging down here, when the ceremony of collecting the bones is still unfinished?"_END

B_2_C_77_21
BEGIN_
त्रीणि द्वन्द्वानि भूतेषु प्रवृत्तानि अविशेषतः || २-७७-२३
तेषु च अपरिहार्येषु न एवम् भवितुम् अर्हति |_END
BEGIN_
"The three pairs of opposites (namely hunger and thirst, joy and sorrow; birth and
death) occur to all living beings without any distinction. They being inevitable, you ought not to
behave like this."_END

B_2_C_77_22
BEGIN_
सुमन्त्रः च अपि शत्रुघ्नम् उत्थाप्य अभिप्रसाद्य च || २-७७-२४
श्रावयाम् आस तत्त्वज्ञः सर्व भूत भव अभवौ |_END
BEGIN_
Even Sumantra, who knew the Truth, raising up Shatrughna and pacifying him, told him
about the origin and dissolution of all beings._END

B_2_C_77_23
BEGIN_
उत्थितौ तौ नर व्याघ्रौ प्रकाशेते यशस्विनौ || २-७७-२५
वर्ष आतप परिक्लिन्नौ पृथग् इन्द्र ध्वजाव् इव |_END
BEGIN_
The two illustrious tigers among men (Bharata and Satrughna) who had got up,
appeared like two banners severally raised in honor of Indra (the god of celestials) soiled through
rain and the sun._END

B_2_C_77_24
BEGIN_
अश्रूणि परिमृद्नन्तौ रक्त अक्षौ दीन भाषिणौ || २-७७-२६
अमात्याः त्वरयन्ति स्म तनयौ च अपराः क्रियाः |_END
BEGIN_
The ministers hurried up the princes, who were wiping their tears and who were
talking pitiably with their eyes reddened (due to excessive weeping) to expedite the other rites
pertaining to the thirteenth day._END

B_2_C_78_0
BEGIN_
अत्र यात्राम् समीहन्तम् शत्रुघ्नः लक्ष्मण अनुजः |
भरतम् शोक सम्तप्तम् इदम् वचनम् अब्रवीत् || २-७८-१_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, Shatrughna the younger brother of Lakshmana spoke the following words to
Bharata, who was tormented with grief and who desired to undertake an expedition to Rama._END

B_2_C_78_1
BEGIN_
गतिर् यः सर्व भूतानाम् दुह्खे किम् पुनर् आत्मनः |
स रामः सत्त्व सम्पन्नः स्त्रिया प्रव्राजितः वनम् || २-७८-२_END
BEGIN_
"When that even-minded Rama is a refuge for all beings, how much more to tell about
our seeking solace to him in our grief? He has been abandoned to the forest by a woman."_END

B_2_C_78_2
BEGIN_
बलवान् वीर्य सम्पन्नो लक्ष्मणो नाम यो अपि असौ |
किम् न मोचयते रामम् कृत्वा अपि पितृ निग्रहम् || २-७८-३_END
BEGIN_
"Why the so-called Lakshmana, the strong and powerful man, even could not rescue
Rama from distress by making our father to restrain from doing it?"_END

B_2_C_78_3
BEGIN_
पूर्वम् एव तु निग्राह्यः समवेक्ष्य नय अनयौ |
उत्पथम् यः समारूढो नार्या राजा वशम् गतः || २-७८-४_END
BEGIN_
"By perceiving the prudence and imprudence in that wrong course adopted by the king,
who has fallen into the clutches of a woman, Lakshmana should have restrained Dasaratha even at the
beginning itself."_END

B_2_C_78_4
BEGIN_
इति सम्भाषमाणे तु शत्रुघ्ने लक्ष्मण अनुजे |
प्राग् द्वारे अभूत् तदा कुब्जा सर्व आभरण भूषिता || २-७८-५_END
BEGIN_
While Shatrughna the younger brother of Lakshmana was talking thus, the hump-backed
Manthara duly adorned with all types of ornaments, appeared at the eastern gate._END

B_2_C_78_5
BEGIN_
लिप्ता चन्दन सारेण राज वस्त्राणि बिभ्रती |
विविधम् विविधैस्तैस्तैर्भूषणैश्च विभूषिता || २-७८-६_END
BEGIN_
Anointed with a scent of sandal-wood and wearing royal clothes, she was bedecked
with several kinds of ornaments of every description in various ways._END

B_2_C_78_6
BEGIN_
मेखला दामभिः चित्रै रज्जु बद्धा इव वानरी |
बभासे बहुभिर्बद्धा रज्जुबद्देव वानरी || २-७८-७_END
BEGIN_
Studded with bright-coloured girdle-bands and many other excellent ornaments,
Manthara appeared like a female-monkey tied with ropes!_END

B_2_C_78_7
BEGIN_
ताम् समीक्ष्य तदा द्वाह्स्थो भृशम् पापस्य कारिणीम् |
गृहीत्वा अकरुणम् कुब्जाम् शत्रुघ्नाय न्यवेदयत् || २-७८-८_END
BEGIN_
Beholding that hump-backed Manthara, the very much sinful and insensitive woman, the
door-keepers caught her and delivered her to Shatrughna (with the following words:)_END

B_2_C_78_8
BEGIN_
यस्याः कृते वने रामः न्यस्त देहः च वः पिता |
सा इयम् पापा नृशंसा च तस्याः कुरु यथा मति || २-७८-९_END
BEGIN_
"Here is that sinful and cruel woman, by whose act Rama is in the forest and your
father has laid down his body. Do with her, as you consider fitting."_END

B_2_C_78_9
BEGIN_
शत्रुघ्नः च तत् आज्ञाय वचनम् भृश दुह्खितः |
अन्तः पुर चरान् सर्वान् इति उवाच धृत व्रतः || २-७८-१०_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words, Shatrughna who was very much in grief and was firmly resolute,
spoke to all those inmates of that gynaecium, as follows:_END

B_2_C_78_10
BEGIN_
तीव्रम् उत्पादितम् दुह्खम् भ्रातृऋणाम् मे तथा पितुः |
यया सा इयम् नृशंसस्य कर्मणः फलम् अश्नुताम् || २-७८-११_END
BEGIN_
"Let this woman, who created serious misfortune to my brothers and my father,
receive the fruit of her cruel act."_END

B_2_C_78_11
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्ता च तेन आशु सखी जन समावृता |
गृहीता बलवत् कुब्जा सा तत् गृहम् अनादयत् || २-७८-१२_END
BEGIN_
Speaking thus in the midst of her companions, he seized that hunch-backed woman with
his powerful hand soon and she in turn made that mansion resound with her shrieks._END

B_2_C_78_12
BEGIN_
ततः सुभृश सम्तप्तः तस्याः सर्वः सखी जनः |
क्रुद्धम् आज्ञाय शत्रुघ्नम् व्यपलायत सर्वशः || २-७८-१३_END
BEGIN_
Then, her companion, having conceived Shatrughna's anger and extremely agonised as
they were, ran away helter-shelter in all directions._END

B_2_C_78_13
BEGIN_
अमन्त्रयत कृत्स्नः च तस्याः सर्व सखी जनः |
यथा अयम् समुपक्रान्तः निह्शेषम् नः करिष्यति || २-७८-१४_END
BEGIN_
All the company of women there surmised as follows : "The way how he is coming up,
he will surely slay us all"_END

B_2_C_78_14
BEGIN_
सानुक्रोशाम् वदान्याम् च धर्मज्ञाम् च यशस्विनीम् |
कौसल्याम् शरणम् यामः सा हि नो अस्तु ध्रुवा गतिः || २-७८-१५_END
BEGIN_
"We shall take reguge with the compassionate, magnanimous, virtuous and illustrious
Kausalya. Let her be the sure asylum for us."_END

B_2_C_78_15
BEGIN_
स च रोषेण ताम्र अक्षः शत्रुघ्नः शत्रु तापनः |
विचकर्ष तदा कुब्जाम् क्रोशन्तीम् पृथिवी तले || २-७८-१६_END
BEGIN_
That Shatrughna, the tormentor of enemies, with his raging red eyes then violently
dragged the crying hump-back along the floor._END

B_2_C_78_16
BEGIN_
तस्या हि आकृष्यमाणाया मन्थरायाः ततः ततः |
चित्रम् बहु विधम् भाण्डम् पृथिव्याम् तत् व्यशीर्यत || २-७८-१७_END
BEGIN_
While that Manthara was violently dragged, here various colourful ornaments were
scattered asunder here and there on the floor._END

B_2_C_78_17
BEGIN_
तेन भाण्डेन सम्कीर्णम् श्रीमद् राज निवेशनम् |
अशोभत तदा भूयः शारदम् गगनम् यथा || २-७८-१८_END
BEGIN_
Thus, that splendid royal mansion scattered by those ornaments, appeared very much
like an autumnal sky studded with innumerable stars._END

B_2_C_78_18
BEGIN_
स बली बलवत् क्रोधात् गृहीत्वा पुरुष ऋषभः |
कैकेयीम् अभिनिर्भर्त्स्य बभाषे परुषम् वचः || २-७८-१९_END
BEGIN_
Shatrughna, the strong and the eminent man, thus violently seizing her with rage,
sharply rebuked Kaikeyi and spoke harsh words to her._END

B_2_C_78_19
BEGIN_
तैः वाक्यैः परुषैः दुह्खैः कैकेयी भृश दुह्हिता |
शत्रुघ्न भय सम्त्रस्ता पुत्रम् शरणम् आगता || २-७८-२०_END
BEGIN_
Agonised very much by those harsh and painful words, Kiakeyi overwhelmed as she was
with the fear of Shatrughna, took refuge with Bharata._END

B_2_C_78_20
BEGIN_
ताम् प्रेक्ष्य भरतः क्रुद्धम् शत्रुघ्नम् इदम् अब्रवीत् |
अवध्याः सर्व भूतानाम् प्रमदाः क्षम्यताम् इति || २-७८-२१_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that enraged Shatrughna, Bharata said: "Among all beings women are not to be
killed. Hence she is to be pardoned."_END

B_2_C_78_21
BEGIN_
हन्याम् अहम् इमाम् पापाम् कैकेयीम् दुष्ट चारिणीम् |
यदि माम् धार्मिको रामः न असूयेन् मातृ घातकम् || २-७८-२२_END
BEGIN_
"If the pious Rama were not to express his displeasure with me for killing the
mother, I would have killed this Kaikeyi, the ill-mannered and sinful woman."_END

B_2_C_78_22
BEGIN_
इमाम् अपि हताम् कुब्जाम् यदि जानाति राघवः |
त्वाम् च माम् चैव धर्म आत्मा न अभिभाषिष्यते ध्रुवम् || २-७८-२३_END
BEGIN_
"If the virtuous Rama hears that the hunch-backed woman has been killed, it is sure
that he will cease to talk to you or even to me."_END

B_2_C_78_23
BEGIN_
भरतस्य वचः श्रुत्वा शत्रुघ्नः लक्ष्मण अनुजः |
न्यवर्तत ततः रोषात् ताम् मुमोच च मन्थराम् || २-७८-२४_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Bharata, Shatrughna the younger brother of Lakshmana renouncing
his guilty design forthwith released that Manthara._END

B_2_C_78_24
BEGIN_
सा पाद मूले कैकेय्या मन्थरा निपपात ह |
निह्श्वसन्ती सुदुह्ख आर्ता कृपणम् विललाप च || २-७८-२५_END
BEGIN_
Manthara fell at the feet of Kaikeyi, breathless, weeping piteously._END

B_2_C_78_25
BEGIN_
शत्रुघ्न विक्षेप विमूढ सम्ज्ञाम् |
समीक्ष्य कुब्जाम् भरतस्य माता |
शनैः समाश्वासयद् आर्त रूपाम् |
क्रौन्चीम् विलग्नाम् इव वीक्षमाणाम् || २-७८-२६_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the hunch-backed woman, who was distraught on account of shatrughna's
violence, wearing a disturbed appearance and looking like a crane that has been caught in a noose,
Bharata's mother slowly consoled her._END

B_2_C_79_0
BEGIN_
ततः प्रभात समये दिवसे अथ चतुर्दशे |
समेत्य राज कर्तारः भरतम् वाक्यम् अब्रुवन् || २-७९-१_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, early in the morning on the fourteenth day, the king-makers coming
together, spoke to Bharata the following words._END

B_2_C_79_1
BEGIN_
गतः दशरथः स्वर्गम् यो नो गुरुतरः गुरुः |
रामम् प्रव्राज्य वै ज्येष्ठम् लक्ष्मणम् च महा बलम् || २-७९-२_END
BEGIN_
"Dasaratha, who was our highly venerable master, went to heaven after sending his
elder son Rama and the exceedingly strong Lakshmana to forest."_END

B_2_C_79_2
BEGIN_
त्वम् अद्य भव नो राजा राज पुत्र महा यशः |
सम्गत्या न अपराध्नोति राज्यम् एतत् अनायकम् || २-७९-३_END
BEGIN_
"O, the highly illustrious prince! From now on, do you be our king. Fortunately,
this kingdom has not yet missed the mark, even without a king."_END

B_2_C_79_3
BEGIN_
आभिषेचनिकम् सर्वम् इदम् आदाय राघव |
प्रतीक्षते त्वाम् स्व जनः श्रेणयः च नृप आत्मज || २-७९-४_END
BEGIN_
"O, prince Bharata! Taking all the things needed for coronation, your own people
(the counsellers and the ministers) as well as the citizens are awaiting for you."_END

B_2_C_79_4
BEGIN_
राज्यम् गृहाण भरत पितृ पैतामहम् महत् |
अभिषेचय च आत्मानम् पाहि च अस्मान् नर ऋषभ || २-७९-५_END
BEGIN_
"O, Bharata the excellent among men! Take over the stable kingdom, which came in
succession from your ancestors, coronate yourself and rule us."_END

B_2_C_79_5
BEGIN_
आभिषेचनिकम् भाण्डम् कृत्वा सर्वम् प्रदक्षिणम् |
भरतः तम् जनम् सर्वम् प्रत्युवाच धृत व्रतः || २-७९-६_END
BEGIN_
The firmly resolute Bharata performed circumambulation clockwise around all the
things kept ready for consecration and replied to all those people as follows:_END

B_2_C_79_6
BEGIN_
ज्येष्ठस्य राजता नित्यम् उचिता हि कुलस्य नः |
न एवम् भवन्तः माम् वक्तुम् अर्हन्ति कुशला जनाः || २-७९-७_END
BEGIN_
"It is indeed appropriate to bestow kingship always to the eldest of our clan. You,
being the conversant people, ought not to tell in this manner to me."_END

B_2_C_79_7
BEGIN_
रामः पूर्वो हि नो भ्राता भविष्यति मही पतिः |
अहम् तु अरण्ये वत्स्यामि वर्षाणि नव पन्च च || २-७९-८_END
BEGIN_
"Our eldest brother, Rama will become the king. I then will reside in the forest for
fourteen years."_END

B_2_C_79_8
BEGIN_
युज्यताम् महती सेना चतुर् अन्ग महा बला |
आनयिष्याम्य् अहम् ज्येष्ठम् भ्रातरम् राघवम् वनात् || २-७९-९_END
BEGIN_
"Let a great and exceptionally powerful army consisting of all the four limbs be
kept ready. I shall bring Rama our elder brother from the forest."_END

B_2_C_79_9
BEGIN_
आभिषेचनिकम् चैव सर्वम् एतत् उपस्कृतम् |
पुरः कृत्य गमिष्यामि राम हेतोर् वनम् प्रति || २-७९-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Keeping in front, all the assembled requisites needed for consecration, I shall
proceed to the forest for the sake of bringing back Rama."_END

B_2_C_79_10
BEGIN_
तत्र एव तम् नर व्याघ्रम् अभिषिच्य पुरः कृतम् |
आनेष्यामि तु वै रामम् हव्य वाहम् इव अध्वरात् || २-७९-११_END
BEGIN_
"Consecrating him, the tiger among men there itself, I shall surely bring Rama
solemnized in front, as bringing home the sacred fire from a sacrificial rite, after performing it
outside the city."_END

B_2_C_79_11
BEGIN_
न सकामा करिष्यामि स्वम् इमाम् मातृ गन्धिनीम् |
वने वत्स्याम्य् अहम् दुर्गे रामः राजा भविष्यति || २-७९-१२_END
BEGIN_
"I shall not make her, my so-called mother, fulfil her desire. I will reside in the
impassable forest. Rama will become the king."_END

B_2_C_79_12
BEGIN_
क्रियताम् शिल्पिभिः पन्थाः समानि विषमाणि च |
रक्षिणः च अनुसम्यान्तु पथि दुर्ग विचारकाः || २-७९-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Let a path-way be prepared by those skilled in that profession, by leveling the
uneven surfaces. Let guards who can easily move in the inaccessible forests accompany us in the
path."_END

B_2_C_79_13
BEGIN_
एवम् सम्भाषमाणम् तम् राम हेतोर् नृप आत्मजम् |
प्रत्युवाच जनः सर्वः श्रीमद् वाक्यम् अनुत्तमम् || २-७९-१४_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Prince Bharata, talking in consideration of Rama's cause, all the people
replied in the following illustrious and excellent words:_END

B_2_C_79_14
BEGIN_
एवम् ते भाषमाणस्य पद्मा श्रीर् उपतिष्ठताम् |
यः त्वम् ज्येष्ठे नृप सुते पृथिवीम् दातुम् इच्चसि || २-७९-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Let the gracious goddess of prosperity abide with you, who are speaking thus,
desirous of giving kingdom to Rama the eldest son of the king."_END

B_2_C_79_15
BEGIN_
अनुत्तमम् तत् वचनम् नृप आत्मज |
प्रभाषितम् संश्रवणे निशम्य च |
प्रहर्षजाः तम् प्रति बाष्प बिन्दवो |
निपेतुर् आर्य आनन नेत्र सम्भवाः || २-७९-१६_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those excellent words spoken by the prince close to their ears, tears born
of joy fell from the face and eyes of those venerable men._END

B_2_C_79_16
BEGIN_
ऊचुस् ते वचनम् इदम् निशम्य हृष्टाः |
सामात्याः सपरिषदो वियात शोकाः |
पन्थानम् नर वर भक्तिमान् जनः च |
व्यादिष्टः तव वचनाच् च शिल्पि वर्गः || २-७९-१७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing these words, the people there along with council and the ministers felt
cheerful, being relieved of their anxiety and spoke the following words : "As per your command,
devoted men and a group of artisans have been instructed to make the path-way."_END

B_2_C_80_0
BEGIN_
अथ भूमि प्रदेशज्ञाः सूत्र कर्म विशारदाः |
स्व कर्म अभिरताः शूराः खनका यन्त्रकाः तथा || २-८०-१
कर्म अन्तिकाः स्थपतयः पुरुषा यन्त्र कोविदाः |
तथा वर्धकयः चैव मार्गिणो वृक्ष तक्षकाः || २-८०-२
कूप काराः सुधा कारा वंश कर्म कृतः तथा |
समर्था ये च द्रष्टारः पुरतः ते प्रतस्थिरे || २-८०-३_END
BEGIN_
Then, those able to advise on the nature of soils, those skilled in thread-holding
for leveling purposes, those who were energetic courageous and attentive in doing their jobs,
excavators, mechanics, labourers, carpenters, road-menders, wood-cutters, hollow-makers, men
skilled in plastering and white washing, basket makers, tanners and skilled supervisors of work
sallied forth in advance._END

B_2_C_80_1
BEGIN_
स तु हर्षात् तम् उद्देशम् जन ओघो विपुलः प्रयान् |
अशोभत महा वेगः सागरस्य इव पर्वणि || २-८०-४_END
BEGIN_
That mighty assembly of men gladly setting out to that forest was splendid like an
ocean on the day of the full moon having a gigantic commotion._END

B_2_C_80_2
BEGIN_
ते स्व वारम् समास्थाय वर्त्म कर्माणि कोविदाः |
करणैः विविध उपेतैः पुरस्तात् सम्प्रतस्थिरे || २-८०-५_END
BEGIN_
Men skilled in making roads, furnished with tools of every kin, seeking the company
of men of their own proper place, marched ahead._END

B_2_C_80_3
BEGIN_
लता वल्लीः च गुल्मामः च स्थाणून् अश्मनएव च |
जनाः ते चक्रिरे मार्गम् चिन्दन्तः विविधान् द्रुमान् || २-८०-६_END
BEGIN_
Clearing away rows of creepers and shrubs timber and big rocks as well as variours
kinds of trees (which obstructed the way), they carved out a path._END

B_2_C_80_4
BEGIN_
अवृक्षेषु च देशेषु केचित् वृक्षान् अरोपयन् |
केचित् कुठारैअः टन्कैः च दात्रैः चिन्दन् क्वचित् क्वचित् || २-८०-७_END
BEGIN_
Some men planted trees in tree-less areas. Some others chopped the existing trees
here and there by means of axes, hatchets and sickles._END

B_2_C_80_5
BEGIN_
अपरे वीरण स्तम्बान् बलिनो बलवत्तराः |
विधमन्ति स्म दुर्गाणि स्थलानि च ततः ततः || २-८०-८_END
BEGIN_
Some other strong men removed sturdy tufts of Virana grass and leveled the uneven
places here and there._END

B_2_C_80_6
BEGIN_
अपरे अपूरयन् कूपान् पांसुभिः श्वभ्रम् आयतम् |
निम्न भागांस् तथा केचित् समामः चक्रुः समन्ततः || २-८०-९_END
BEGIN_
Some others filled up wells and extensive pits with earth. Some men leveled
low-lying places all around._END

B_2_C_80_7
BEGIN_
बबन्धुर् बन्धनीयामः च क्षोद्यान् संचुक्षुदुस् तदा |
बिभिदुर् भेदनीयामः च तांस् तान् देशान् नराः तदा || २-८०-१०_END
BEGIN_
Then, some men bridged the steams that could be bridged, pulverised the rocks that
could be pulverised and smashed (the impediments that blocked the flow of water) those which could
be smashed._END

B_2_C_80_8
BEGIN_
अचिरेण एव कालेन परिवाहान् बहु उदकान् |
चक्रुर् बहु विध आकारान् सागर प्रतिमान् बहून् || २-८०-११_END
BEGIN_
Many ponds, in various sizes and shapes containing plenty of water resembling seas
were built (by constructing dams on rivulets)._END

B_2_C_80_9
BEGIN_
निर्जलेषु च देशेषु खानयामासुरुत्तमान् |
उदपानान् बहुविधान् वेदिका परिमण्डितान् || २-८०-१२_END
BEGIN_
In water-scarce areas, excellent wells in various shapes were dug duly decorated all
around with platforms (to rest)._END

B_2_C_80_10
BEGIN_
ससुधा कुट्टिम तलः प्रपुष्पित मही रुहः |
मत्त उद्घुष्ट द्विज गणः पताकाभिर् अलम्कृतः || २-८०-१३
चन्दन उदक संसिक्तः नाना कुसुम भूषितः |
बह्व् अशोभत सेनायाः पन्थाः स्वर्ग पथ उपमः || २-८०-१४_END
BEGIN_
That track of the troops, having its surface inlaid with cement, with flowering
trees inlaid with cement, with flowering trees on both sides, inhabited with birds in excitement
making their sounds, adorned with flags on its either side with its surface sprinkled with water of
sandal-wood fragrance, and decorated with various kinds of flowers, looked very much splendid like
the path of celestials._END

B_2_C_80_11
BEGIN_
आज्ञाप्य अथ यथा आज्ञप्ति युक्ताः ते अधिकृता नराः |
रमणीयेषु देशेषु बहु स्वादु फलेषु च || २-८०-१५
यो निवेशः तु अभिप्रेतः भरतस्य महात्मनः |
भूयः तम् शोभयाम् आसुर् भूषाभिर् भूषण उपमम् || २-८०-१६_END
BEGIN_
Those officers appointed for execution of the work, as ordered by Bharata,
skillfully instructed their work-men and erected a tent which was intended for the great-souled
Bharata, in a beautiful place abundant with tasty fruits. They further adorned profusely with
decorations, the tent which itself resembled on ornament._END

B_2_C_80_12
BEGIN_
नक्षत्रेषु प्रशस्तेषु मुहूर्तेषु च तद्विदः |
निवेशम् स्थापयाम् आसुर् भरतस्य महात्मनः || २-८०-१७_END
BEGIN_
The connoisseurs erected the tents of the high-souled Bharata at auspicious hours in
days when the stars were propitious._END

B_2_C_80_13
BEGIN_
बहु पांसु चयाः च अपि परिखा परिवारिताः |
तन्त्र इन्द्र कील प्रतिमाः प्रतोली वर शोभिताः || २-८०-१८
प्रासाद माला सम्युक्ताः सौध प्राकार सम्वृताः |
पताका शोभिताः सर्वे सुनिर्मित महा पथाः || २-८०-१९
विसर्पत्भिर् इव आकाशे विटन्क अग्र विमानकैः |
समुच्च्रितैः निवेशाः ते बभुः शक्र पुर उपमाः || २-८०-२०_END
BEGIN_
Those camps, with many breast works of sand, moats surrounding each of them, streets
as resplendent as sapphires, their crowns of terrets, the ramparts covered with stucco to protect
then, the splendid banners, the skillfully laidout avenues, lofty mansions the tops of which were
provided with dove-cots, which flew about as it were in the air and in splendour, resembled the
capitals of Indra._END

B_2_C_80_14
BEGIN_
जाह्नवीम् तु समासाद्य विविध द्रुम काननाम् |
शीतल अमल पानीयाम् महा मीन समाकुलाम् || २-८०-२१_END
BEGIN_
The route thus prepared, extended upto the Ganga River, whose pure and limpid
waters, abounding in great fish, flowed between woods and forests of every kind._END

B_2_C_80_15
BEGIN_
सचन्द्र तारा गण मण्डितम् यथा |
नभः क्षपायाम् अमलम् विराजते |
नर इन्द्र मार्गः स तथा व्यराजत |
क्रमेण रम्यः शुभ शिल्पि निर्मितः || २-८०-२२_END
BEGIN_
That beautiful royal high way, which was built gradually by efficient engineers,
appeared as resplendent as a night in a clear sky, illumined by the moon with its procession of
stars._END

B_2_C_81_0
BEGIN_
ततः नान्दी मुखीम् रात्रिम् भरतम् सूत मागधाः |
तुष्टुवुर् वाग् विशेषज्ञाः स्तवैः मन्गल सम्हितैः || २-८१-१_END
BEGIN_
Then, bards and pangegyrists, who knew the importance of tidings, eulogized Bharata
with auspicious hymns of praise on the night preceding Naandimukha._END

B_2_C_81_1
BEGIN_
सुवर्ण कोण अभिहतः प्राणदद् याम दुन्दुभिः |
दध्मुः शन्खामः च शतशो वाद्यामः च उच्च अवच स्वरान् || २-८१-२_END
BEGIN_
A drum from the sound of which nigh-hours are identified, struck with a golden
stick, gave its sound. Couches and loud-sounding instruments in hundreds producing various types of
noises were blown._END

B_2_C_81_2
BEGIN_
स तूर्य घोषः सुमहान् दिवम् आपूरयन्न् इव |
भरतम् शोक सम्तप्तम् भूयः शोकैः अरन्ध्रयत् || २-८१-३_END
BEGIN_
That mammoth sound of the musical instruments, as if filling up the whole sky,
created further distress and grief to Bharata who was already tormented with grief._END

B_2_C_81_3
BEGIN_
ततः प्रबुद्धो भरतः तम् घोषम् सम्निवर्त्य च |
न अहम् राजा इति च अपि उक्त्वा शत्रुघ्नम् इदम् अब्रवीत् || २-८१-४_END
BEGIN_
Then, the awakened Bharata proclaiming that "I am not the king", caused to stop that
sound and spoke the following words to shatrughna:_END

B_2_C_81_4
BEGIN_
पश्य शत्रुघ्न कैकेय्या लोकस्य अपकृतम् महत् |
विसृज्य मयि दुह्खानि राजा दशरथो गतः || २-८१-५_END
BEGIN_
"Behold, O, Shatrughna! How much harm was done to the world by Kaikeyi! The king
Dasartha left us, leaving all sorrows to me."_END

B_2_C_81_5
BEGIN_
तस्य एषा धर्म राजस्य धर्म मूला महात्मनः |
परिभ्रमति राज श्रीर् नौर् इव अकर्णिका जले || २-८१-६_END
BEGIN_
"This prosperous kingdom of Ayodhya, a foundation of law and religion of that
high-souled Dasaratha the righteous king is now like boat without a rudder moving hitter and
thither in water._END

B_2_C_81_6
BEGIN_
यो हि नः सुमहान्नाथः सोऽपि प्रव्राजितो वनम् |
अनया धर्ममुत्सृज्य मात्रा मे राघवः स्वयम् || २-८१-७_END
BEGIN_
"Even that Rama, who was a great protector has been sent to the forest by this very
mother of mine, abandoning her righteousness."_END

B_2_C_81_7
BEGIN_
इति एवम् भरतम् प्रेक्ष्य विलपन्तम् विचेतनम् |
कृपणम् रुरुदुः सर्वाः सस्वरम् योषितः तदा || २-८१-८_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Bharata who lost his consciousness by lamenting in that way, all the women
then miserably cried in one voice._END

B_2_C_81_8
BEGIN_
तथा तस्मिन् विलपति वसिष्ठो राज धर्मवित् |
सभाम् इक्ष्वाकु नाथस्य प्रविवेश महा यशाः || २-८१-९_END
BEGIN_
While Bharata was lamenting thus, the great illustrious Vasishta who knew the rules
relating to kings, entered the assembly-hall of Dasaratha the Lord of Ikshvaku dynasty._END

B_2_C_81_9
BEGIN_
शात कुम्भमयीम् रम्याम् मणि रत्न समाकुलाम् |
सुधर्माम् इव धर्म आत्मा सगणः प्रत्यपद्यत || २-८१-१०_END
BEGIN_
The pious minded Vasishta along with his attendants entered that lovely
assembly-hall, made of gold and studded with gems and jewels, resembling Sudharma the celestial
assembly-hall._END

B_2_C_81_10
BEGIN_
स कान्चनमयम् पीठम् पर अर्ध्य आस्तरण आवृतम् |
अध्यास्त सर्व वेदज्ञो दूतान् अनुशशास च || २-८१-११_END
BEGIN_
Vasista, who knew all the scriptures, then sat in a presidential chair made of gold
and wrapped with a comfortable cushion. He ordered the messengers as follows:_END

B_2_C_81_11
BEGIN_
ब्राह्मणान् क्षत्रियान् योधान् अमात्यान् गण बल्लभान् |
क्षिप्रम् आनयत अव्यग्राः कृत्यम् आत्ययिकम् हि नः || २-८१-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Quickly bring Brahmanas (a class of people having divine knowledge), Kshatriyas
(people belonging to warrior-class), Vaisyas (agriculturists and traders), ministers and troop
commanders coolly. There is an urgent duty indeed for us to be done._END

B_2_C_81_12
BEGIN_
सराजभृत्यम् शत्रुघ्नम् भरतम् च यश्स्विनम् |
युधाजितम् सुमन्त्रम् च ये च तत्र हिता जनाः || २-८१-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Bring Shatrughna with his royal attendants, the illustrious Bharata, Yudhaajit
(Bharata's maternal uncle) Sumantra the charioteer and those people who are royal well-wishers
there."_END

B_2_C_81_13
BEGIN_
ततः हलहला शब्दो महान् समुदपद्यत |
रथैः अश्वैः गजैः च अपि जनानाम् उपगच्चताम् || २-८१-१४_END
BEGIN_
There was a huge hallooing sound generated while the people invited were coming on
chariots, horses and elephants._END

B_2_C_81_14
BEGIN_
ततः भरतम् आयान्तम् शत क्रतुम् इव अमराः |
प्रत्यनन्दन् प्रकृतयो यथा दशरथम् तथा || २-८१-१५_END
BEGIN_
People of high position like ministers and other welcomed the approaching Bharata in
every way as they had welcomed Dasaratha and as Indra was welcomed by celestials._END

B_2_C_81_15
BEGIN_
ह्रदैव तिमि नाग सम्वृतः |
स्तिमित जलो मणि शन्ख शर्करः |
दशरथ सुत शोभिता सभा |
सदशरथा इव बभौ यथा पुरा || २-८१-१६_END
BEGIN_
That royal assembly, made splendid by Bharata the son of Dasartha, radiated as
before as with the presence of Dasaratha, like a lake of tranquil waters sown with pearls shells
and sand and filled with great fish and serpents._END

B_2_C_82_0
BEGIN_
ताम् आर्य गण सम्पूर्णाम् भरतः प्रग्रहाम् सभाम् |
ददर्श बुद्धि सम्पन्नः पूर्ण चन्द्राम् निशाम् इव || २-८२-१_END
BEGIN_
Bharata endowed with understanding, saw that assembly, enriched with the whole body
of respectable men, looking like a night in full moon duly enriched with well-known planets._END

B_2_C_82_1
BEGIN_
आसनानि यथा न्यायम् आर्याणाम् विशताम् तदा |
अदृश्यत घन अपाये पूर्ण चन्द्रा इव शर्वरी || २-८२-२_END
BEGIN_
That excellent assembly was aglow with the brilliance of clothes and scented
cosmetics of its respected members occupying their appropriate seats._END

B_2_C_82_2
BEGIN_
सा विद्वज्जनसम्पूर्णा सभा सुरुचिरा तदा |
अदृश्यत घनापाये पूर्णचन्द्रेव शर्वरी || २-८२-३_END
BEGIN_
That beautiful assembly filled with learned men looked like a night with autumn full
moon._END

B_2_C_82_3
BEGIN_
राज्ञः तु प्रकृतीः सर्वाः समग्राः प्रेक्ष्य धर्मवित् |
इदम् पुरोहितः वाक्यम् भरतम् मृदु च अब्रवीत् || २-८२-४_END
BEGIN_
Beholding all the entire body of ministers of the king, Vaishta the knower of
righteousness uttered to Bharata the following soft-spoken words:_END

B_2_C_82_4
BEGIN_
तात राजा दशरथः स्वर् गतः धर्मम् आचरन् |
धन धान्यवतीम् स्फीताम् प्रदाय पृथिवीम् तव || २-८२-५_END
BEGIN_
"O, beloved Bharata! The king Dasaratha, practicing righteousness, gave away to you
this wide earth endowed with grains and riches and went to heaven."_END

B_2_C_82_5
BEGIN_
रामः तथा सत्य धृतिः सताम् धर्मम् अनुस्मरन् |
न अजहात् पितुर् आदेशम् शशी ज्योत्स्नाम् इव उदितः || २-८२-६_END
BEGIN_
"Rama, who was firmly established in truth, remembering the righteousness of good
men, did not abandon the command of his father, as a raising moon does not abandon the
moon-light."_END

B_2_C_82_6
BEGIN_
पित्रा भ्रात्रा च ते दत्तम् राज्यम् निहत कण्टकम् |
तत् भुन्क्ष्व मुदित अमात्यः क्षिप्रम् एव अभिषेचय || २-८२-७_END
BEGIN_
"The kingdom, having its enemies destroy was given to you by your father and
brother. Enjoy it, with its delightful ministers. Get anointed for the kingdom just soon."_END

B_2_C_82_7
BEGIN_
उदीच्याः च प्रतीच्याः च दाक्षिणात्याः च केवलाः |
कोट्या अपर अन्ताः सामुद्रा रत्नानि अभिहरन्तु ते || २-८२-८_END
BEGIN_
"let those living in the north, the Westerners; the southerners the kings of western
borders near the Sahya mountains who are without a throne and the seafaring traders bring crores of
jewels as gifts to you."_END

B_2_C_82_8
BEGIN_
तत् श्रुत्वा भरतः वाक्यम् शोकेन अभिपरिप्लुतः |
जगाम मनसा रामम् धर्मज्ञो धर्म कान्क्षया || २-८२-९_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words, the pious Bharata was filled with distress and thirsting for
justice got his mind fixed on Rama._END

B_2_C_82_9
BEGIN_
स बाष्प कलया वाचा कल हंस स्वरः युवा |
विललाप सभा मध्ये जगर्हे च पुरोहितम् || २-८२-१०_END
BEGIN_
The youthful Bharata, with a voice of a Hamsa bird, in the midst of the assembly,
lamented in a tearful and appealing speech. He even reproached his royal priest as follows:_END

B_2_C_82_10
BEGIN_
चरित ब्रह्मचर्यस्य विद्या स्नातस्य धीमतः |
धर्मे प्रयतमानस्य को राज्यम् मद्विधो हरेत् || २-८२-११_END
BEGIN_
"How can a man such as I, rob the throne from one, who practices Brahmacharya
(continence and chastity), versed in the science of the Vedas (sacred scriptures) and who is
devoted to duty?"_END

B_2_C_82_11
BEGIN_
कथम् दशरथाज् जातः भवेद् राज्य अपहारकः |
राज्यम् च अहम् च रामस्य धर्मम् वक्तुम् इह अर्हसि || २-८२-१२_END
BEGIN_
"How should one born of Dasaratha become the usurper of a crown? Both the kingdom
and I myself belong to Rama. You ought to tell the law and justice in this matter."_END

B_2_C_82_12
BEGIN_
ज्येष्ठः श्रेष्ठः च धर्म आत्मा दिलीप नहुष उपमः |
लब्धुम् अर्हति काकुत्स्थो राज्यम् दशरथो यथा || २-८२-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Rama, the eldest son, an excellent man, a pious souled and who can be compared with
Dilipa* and Nahusha*, is eligible to get the kingdom, as with Dasaratha."_END

B_2_C_82_13
BEGIN_
अनार्य जुष्टम् अस्वर्ग्यम् कुर्याम् पापम् अहम् यदि |
इक्ष्वाकूणाम् अहम् लोके भवेयम् कुल पांसनः || २-८२-१४_END
BEGIN_
"If in this world, I dishonoured the name of Ikshavaku race, I should be guilty of a
sinful act, practiced by disgraceful men, which does not lead to heaven."_END

B_2_C_82_14
BEGIN_
यद्द् हि मात्रा कृतम् पापम् न अहम् तत् अभिरोचये |
इहस्थो वन दुर्गस्थम् नमस्यामि कृत अन्जलिः || २-८२-१५_END
BEGIN_
"I do not indeed like that sinful act done even by my mother. From here itself, I
offer my salutation with my joined palms to Rama who is residing in an impassable forest."_END

B_2_C_82_15
BEGIN_
रामम् एव अनुगच्चामि स राजा द्विपदाम् वरः |
त्रयाणाम् अपि लोकानाम् राघवो राज्यम् अर्हति || २-८२-१६_END
BEGIN_
"I will follow Rama's steps. He, who is supreme among men, is the king. Rama is
eligible even for the kingdom of the three worlds."_END

B_2_C_82_16
BEGIN_
तत् वाक्यम् धर्म सम्युक्तम् श्रुत्वा सर्वे सभासदः |
हर्षान् मुमुचुर् अश्रूणि रामे निहित चेतसः || २-८२-१७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those righteous words of Bharata, all the members of the assembly shed tears
of joy, having their minds obsessed of Rama._END

B_2_C_82_17
BEGIN_
यदि तु आर्यम् न शक्ष्यामि विनिवर्तयितुम् वनात् |
वने तत्र एव वत्स्यामि यथा आर्यो लक्ष्मणः तथा || २-८२-१८_END
BEGIN_
"If I am unable to bring back my elder brother from the forest, I shall stay back in
that forest itself, as how the venerable Lakshmana is staying now."_END

B_2_C_82_18
BEGIN_
सर्व उपायम् तु वर्तिष्ये विनिवर्तयितुम् बलात् |
समक्षम् आर्य मिश्राणाम् साधूनाम् गुण वर्तिनाम् || २-८२-१९_END
BEGIN_
"I shall use every means to bring back compulsorily, that hero before you,
practicing virtues, the honourable and the distinguished men."_END

B_2_C_82_19
BEGIN_
विष्टिकर्मान्तिकाः सर्वे मार्गशोधनरक्षकाः |
प्रस्थापिता मया पूर्वम् यात्रापि मम रोचते || २-८२-२०_END
BEGIN_
"All those who are skilled in clearing paths working on and without wages, have been
sent by me in advance and the journey so planned, pleases me."_END

B_2_C_82_20
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्त्वा तु धर्म आत्मा भरतः भ्रातृ वत्सलः |
समीपस्थम् उवाच इदम् सुमन्त्रम् मन्त्र कोविदम् || २-८२-२१_END
BEGIN_
The pious minded Bharata, who had an affection for his brother spoke as aforesaid
and uttered the following words to Sumantra who was clever in giving counsel and who was sitting
nearby._END

B_2_C_82_21
BEGIN_
तूर्णम् उत्थाय गच्च त्वम् सुमन्त्र मम शासनात् |
यात्राम् आज्ञापय क्षिप्रम् बलम् चैव समानय || २-८२-२२_END
BEGIN_
"O, Sumantra! Rise quickly and go. As per my orders, arrange for the jorney
immediately. Bring the army also."_END

B_2_C_82_22
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्तः सुमन्त्रः तु भरतेन महात्मना |
हृष्टः सो अदिशत् सर्वम् यथा संदिष्टम् इष्टवत् || २-८२-२३_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of the magnanimous Bharata, Sumantra joyfully arranged all that in
accord with Bharata's orders and wishes._END

B_2_C_82_23
BEGIN_
ताः प्रहृष्टाः प्रकृतयो बल अध्यक्षा बलस्य च |
श्रुत्वा यात्राम् समाज्ञप्ताम् राघवस्य निवर्तने || २-८२-२४_END
BEGIN_
Hearing about the expedition of the army too; for arranging of return of Rama, the
ministers and army-commander there were delighted._END

B_2_C_82_24
BEGIN_
ततः योध अन्गनाः सर्वा भर्तृऋन् सर्वान् गृहे गृहे |
यात्रा गमनम् आज्ञाय त्वरयन्ति स्म हर्षिताः || २-८२-२५_END
BEGIN_
All the wives of warriors in every house, knowing about the ensuing expedition, were
jubiliant and hurried up all their respective husband to setoff for the journey._END

B_2_C_82_25
BEGIN_
ते हयैः गो रथैः शीघ्रैः स्यन्दनैः च मनो जवैः |
सह योधैः बल अध्यक्षा बलम् सर्वम् अचोदयन् || २-८२-२६_END
BEGIN_
Those army-generals urged the entire army to march forward quickly, with the fast
moving horses, bullock carts with a good speed and the chariots along with the warriors._END

B_2_C_82_26
BEGIN_
सज्जम् तु तत् बलम् दृष्ट्वा भरतः गुरु सम्निधौ |
रथम् मे त्वरयस्व इति सुमन्त्रम् पार्श्वतः अब्रवीत् || २-८२-२७_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that army ready, Bharata in the presence of Vasishta said as follows to
Sumantra who was standing by his side: "Get ready my chariot quickly."_END

B_2_C_82_27
BEGIN_
भरतस्य तु तस्य आज्ञाम् प्रतिगृह्य प्रहर्षितः |
रथम् गृहीत्वा प्रययौ युक्तम् परम वाजिभिः || २-८२-२८_END
BEGIN_
Bowing to the command of Bharata and taking a chariot yoked with excellent horses,
Sumantra on his part approached him with delight._END

B_2_C_82_28
BEGIN_
स राघवः सत्य धृतिः प्रतापवान् |
ब्रुवन् सुयुक्तम् दृढ सत्य विक्रमः |
गुरुम् महा अरण्य गतम् यशस्विनम् |
प्रसादयिष्यन् भरतः अब्रवीत् तदा || २-८२-२९_END
BEGIN_
Bharata, born in Raghu dynasty who was sincere in his purpose a powerful man having
strong and mighty prowess and whose talk was most appropriate, then spoke as follows: intending (to
undertake a journey) to persuade his illustrious elder brother, staying in dreary woods, to return
to Ayodhya._END

B_2_C_82_29
BEGIN_
तूण समुत्थाय सुमन्त्र गच्च |
बलस्य योगाय बल प्रधानान् |
आनेतुम् इच्चामि हि तम् वनस्थम् |
प्रसाद्य रामम् जगतः हिताय || २-८२-३०_END
BEGIN_
"O, Sumantra! Rise up and proceed quickly to inform the army-chief to arrange for
the troops. After propitiating that Rama staying in the forest, I want to bring him back to Ayodhya
for the welfare of the people."_END

B_2_C_82_30
BEGIN_
स सूत पुत्रः भरतेन सम्यग् |
आज्ञापितः सम्परिपूर्ण कामः |
शशास सर्वान् प्रकृति प्रधानान् |
