विभज्य काले कालज्न सर्वान् भरत सेवसे || २-१००-६३_END
BEGIN_
"I hope your pursue wealth, religion and the delights of the sense dividing them all
according to time, O Jewel among the victorious, the one who is conversant with the proper time and
O, the bestower of boons!"_END

B_2_C_100_58
BEGIN_
कच्चित् ते ब्राह्मणाः शर्म सर्व शास्त्र अर्थ कोविदः |
आशंसन्ते महा प्राज्न पौर जानपदैः सह || २-१००-६४_END
BEGIN_
"O, the one who is endowed with great wisdom! I hope that brahmins versed in the
knowledge of the scriptures, the inhabitants of town and the country pray for your happiness."_END

B_2_C_100_59
BEGIN_
नास्तिक्यम् अनृतम् क्रोधम् प्रमादम् दीर्घ सूत्रताम् |
अदर्शनम् ज्नानवताम् आलस्यम् पन्च वृत्तिताम् || २-१००-६५
एक चिन्तनम् अर्थानाम् अनर्थज्नैः च मन्त्रणम् |
निश्चितानाम् अनारम्भम् मन्त्रस्य अपरिलक्षणम् || २-१००-६६
मन्गलस्य अप्रयोगम् च प्रत्युत्थानम् च सर्वशः |
कच्चित् त्वम् वर्जयस्य् एतान् राज दोषामः चतुर् दश || २-१००-६७_END
BEGIN_
Do you eschew the following fourteen for of kings -viz. atheism, falsehood, anger
carelessness, procrastination, disregard of the wise, sloth, bondage to the five senses, himself
alone devoting thought to the affairs of the state (without consulting the ministers); taking
counsel with those of perverted insight; failure to undertake the projects already decided, failure
to keep secrets, failure to utter auspicious words (at the beginning of an undertaking); and rising
from one's seat (indiscriminately) to receive all._END

B_2_C_100_60
BEGIN_
दशपंचचतुर्वर्गान् सप्तवर्गं च तत्त्वतः |
अष्टवर्गम् त्रिवर्गं च विद्यास्तिस्रश्च राघव २-१००-६८
इन्द्न्द्रियाणां जयं बुद्ध्यं षाड्गुण्यं दैवमानुषम् |
कृत्यं विंशतिवर्गं च तथा प्रकृतिमण्डलं || २-१००-६९
यात्रादण्डविधानं च द्वियोनी संधिविग्रहौ |
कच्छिदेतान् महाप्राज्ञ यथावदनुमन्यसे २-१००-७०_END
BEGIN_
"O, the very wise Bharata! I hope you understand the following and deal them
properly the ten evils(1); the five kinds of fortifications(2); the four expedients(3); the seven
limbs of state(4); the eight evils (born of anger) the three objects of human pursuit(5); the three
branches of learning(6) subjugation of the senses, the six strategic expedients(7); adversity
brought about by divine agencies(8); and by human agencies(9); the twenty types of monarches(10);
and the entire population of the kingdom, setting about an an expedition, drawing up an army in a
battle-array and the two bases viz, peace and war._END

B_2_C_100_61
BEGIN_
मन्त्रिभिस्त्वं यथोद्दिष्टैश्चतुर्भिस्त्रिभिरेव वा |
कच्चित्समस्तैर्व्यस्तैश्च मन्त्रं मन्त्रयसे मिथः || २-१००-७१_END
BEGIN_
"I hope that you consult with three or four ministers as mentioned in scriptures any
proposal collectively and singly with each of them in secret."_END

B_2_C_100_62
BEGIN_
कच्चित्ते सफला वेदाः कच्चित्ते सफलाः क्रियाः |
कच्चित्ते सफला दाराः कच्चित्ते सफलं श्रुतम् || २-१००-७२_END
BEGIN_
"Do you find advantages in your study of Vedas? Are your acts, production of fair
results? Do you benefit from the company of your consorts? Has your learning been fruitful?"_END

B_2_C_100_63
BEGIN_
कच्चिदेषैव ते बुद्धिर्यथोक्ता मम राघा |
आयुष्या च यशस्या च धर्मकामार्थसंहिता || २-१००-७३_END
BEGIN_
"O, Bharata! I hope that your conviction, is the same as mentioned by me in the
foregoing verses, which is conducive to long life, fame, religious merit, enjoyment and
wealth."_END

B_2_C_100_64
BEGIN_
यां वृत्तिं वर्तते रातो यां चनः प्रपितामहाः |
तां वृत्तिं वर्तसे कच्चिद्याच सत्पथगा शुभा २-१००-७४_END
BEGIN_
"Do you follow the common practice, which our fore fathers observed and which is in
accord with the path of the virtuous and which is distinguished in itself."_END

B_2_C_100_65
BEGIN_
कच्चित् स्वादु कृतं भोज्यमेको नाश्नासि राघव |
कच्चिदाशंसमानेभ्यो मित्रेभ्यः सम्प्रयच्छसि २-१००-७५_END
BEGIN_
"I hope you do not eat by yourself nicely made eatable and do you share it with your
friends, who seek it?"_END

B_2_C_100_66
BEGIN_
अवाप्य कृत्स्नां वसुधां यथाव |
दितश्छ्युतः स्वर्गमुपैति विद्वान् || २-१००-७६_END
BEGIN_
"A wise and learned king, having obtained and ruled the entire earth, properly by
righteousness and by administering justice to the people, indeed ascends to heaven when detached
from the mortal body."_END

B_2_C_101_0
BEGIN_
तम् तु रामः समाश्वास्य भ्रातरम् गुरु वत्सलम् |
लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा प्रष्टुम् समुपचक्रमे || २-१०१-१_END
BEGIN_
Rama along with Lakshmana, his younger brother, began to question Bharata, his
brother who was devoted to elders (as follows):_END

B_2_C_101_1
BEGIN_
किम् एतद् इग्च्छेयम् अहम् श्रोतुम् प्रव्याहृतम् त्वया |
यस्मात् त्वम् आगतो देशम् इमम् चीर जटा अजिनी || २-१०१-२_END
BEGIN_
"I desire to hear from you, why you have come tot his place in robes of bark and an
antelope-skin."_END

B_2_C_101_2
BEGIN_
किम् निमित्तम् इमम् देशम् कृष्ण अजिन जटा धरः |
हित्वा राज्यम् प्रविष्टः त्वम् तत् सर्वम् वक्तुम् अर्हसि || २-१०१-३_END
BEGIN_
"You ought to tell me all about the purpose for which you entered this place, clad
in deer-skin and matted hair, relinquishing the kingdom."_END

B_2_C_101_3
BEGIN_
इत्य् उक्तः केकयी पुत्रः काकुत्स्थेन महात्मना |
प्रगृह्य बलवद् भूयः प्रान्जलिर् वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् || २-१०१-४_END
BEGIN_
Thus questioned by the high souled Rama, by closely embracing him again, Bharata
with joined palms answered as follows:_END

B_2_C_101_4
BEGIN_
आर्यम् तातः परित्यज्य कृत्वा कर्म सुदुष्करम् |
गतः स्वर्गम् महा बाहुः पुत्र शोक अभिपीडितः || २-१०१-५_END
BEGIN_
"O, noble brother! Our father the mighty armed, after performing a deed must
difficult to perform, and having abandoned us has gone the divine region; he died of grief on
account of separation from his son."_END

B_2_C_101_5
BEGIN_
स्त्रिया नियुक्तः कैकेय्या मम मात्रा परम् तप |
चकार सुमहत् पापम् इदम् आत्म यशो हरम् || २-१०१-६_END
BEGIN_
"O, tormented of foes! As urged by his wife and my mother Kaikeyi;, our father
committed this great sin that has taken away his own reputation."_END

B_2_C_101_6
BEGIN_
सा राज्य फलम् अप्राप्य विधवा शोक कर्शिता |
पतिष्यति महा घोरे निरये जननी मम || २-१०१-७_END
BEGIN_
"Without having plucked the fruit of kingdom, widowed and emaciated with grief my
mother will fall into the most terrific hell."_END

B_2_C_101_7
BEGIN_
तस्य मे दास भूतस्य प्रसादम् कर्तुम् अर्हसि |
अभिषिन्चस्व च अद्य एव राज्येन मघवान् इव || २-१०१-८_END
BEGIN_
"Grant me, who am your true servant, a favour! This very day, as Indra the Lord of
celestials himself, receive the royal anointing!"_END

B_2_C_101_8
BEGIN_
इमाः प्रकृतयः सर्वा विधवा मातुरः च याः |
त्वत् सकाशम् अनुप्राप्ताः प्रसादम् कर्तुम् अर्हसि || २-१०१-९_END
BEGIN_
"Grant all these people and these widowed Queens, who have come here to see you,
this felicity!"_END

B_2_C_101_9
BEGIN_
तदा आनुपूर्व्या युक्तम् च युक्तम् च आत्मनि मानद |
राज्यम् प्राप्नुहि धर्मेण सकामान् सुहृदः कुरु || २-१०१-१०_END
BEGIN_
"O, Prince! For that reason, accept the throne that is befitting; endowed to you as
per succession and that is yours by right fulfill, as your should, the desires of your
friends."_END

B_2_C_101_10
BEGIN_
भवतु अविधवा भूमिः समग्रा पतिना त्वया |
शशिना विमलेन इव शारदी रजनी यथा || २-१०१-११_END
BEGIN_
"Bring the widowhood of the entire world to an end by becoming her Lord, as does the
immaculate moon to the autumn-night."_END

B_2_C_101_11
BEGIN_
एभिः च सचिवैः सार्धम् शिरसा याचितो मया |
भ्रातुः शिष्यस्य दासस्य प्रसादम् कर्तुम् अर्हसि || २-१०१-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Grant this grace to your brother, who prostrates at your feet along with your
ministers is both your discipline and your slave."_END

B_2_C_101_12
BEGIN_
तद् इदम् शाश्वतम् पित्र्यम् सर्वम् सचिव मण्डलम् |
पूजितम् पुरुष व्याघ्र न अतिक्रमितुम् उत्सहे || २-१०१-१३_END
BEGIN_
"O, Tiger among men! You cannot disregard this unbroken kingdom, which is eternal,
ancestral and honoured."_END

B_2_C_101_13
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्त्वा महा बाहुः सबाष्पः केकयी सुतः |
रामस्य शिरसा पादौ जग्राह भरतः पुनः || २-१०१-१४_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking, the mighty armed Bharata, with tears, once again seized Rama's feet
in great honour, as per precept._END

B_2_C_101_14
BEGIN_
तम् मत्तम् इव मातन्गम् निह्श्वसन्तम् पुनः पुनः |
भ्रातरम् भरतम् रामः परिष्वज्य इदम् अब्रवीत् || २-१०१-१५_END
BEGIN_
Rama embraced his brother Bharata, who sighed again and again like an elephant in
rut, and spoke as follows:-_END

B_2_C_101_15
BEGIN_
कुलीनः सत्त्व सम्पन्नः तेजस्वी चरित व्रतः |
राज्य हेतोः कथम् पापम् आचरेत् त्वद् विधो जनः || २-१०१-१६_END
BEGIN_
"How should a man of noble birth, rich in Sattva (goodness), dignified and who has
observed sacred vows like myself, commit sin for the sake of a mere kingdom?"_END

B_2_C_101_16
BEGIN_
न दोषम् त्वयि पश्यामि सूक्ष्मम् अप्य् अरि सूदन |
न च अपि जननीम् बाल्यात् त्वम् विगर्हितुम् अर्हसि || २-१०१-१७_END
BEGIN_
"O, Bharata the annihilator of enemies! I do not see the slightest fault in you and
you should not reproach your mother for a childish action."_END

B_2_C_101_17
BEGIN_
कामकरो महाप्राअज्ञ गुरूणां सर्वदानघ |
उपपन्नेषु दारेषु पुत्रेषु च विधीयते || २-१०१-१८_END
BEGIN_
"O, Bharata the highly intelligent and the faultless man! It is incumbent always on
the part of the elders to act freely with reference to their wives and progeny."_END

B_2_C_101_18
BEGIN_
वयमस्य यथा लोके संख्याताः सुअम्य साधुभिः |
भार्याः पुत्राश्च शिष्याश्छ त्वमनुज्ञातुमर्हसि || २-१०१-१९_END
BEGIN_
"O, gentle brother! Since it was said thus by virtuous men in this world, we should
all, women children and disciples, obey our Lord; this must be known to you."_END

B_2_C_101_19
BEGIN_
वने वा चीरवसनं सौम्यकृष्णाजिनाम्बरम् |
राज्ये वापि महाराजो मां वासयितुमीश्वरः || २-१०१-२०_END
BEGIN_
"The great king is the master, who has a discretion either to make me reside in the
forest, wearing bark robes and a black antelope skin or to sit on the throne, O gentle
brother!"_END

B_2_C_101_20
BEGIN_
यावत् पितरि धर्मज्न गौरवम् लोक सत्कृते |
तावद् धर्मभृताम् श्रेष्ठ जनन्याम् अपि गौरवम् || २-१०१-२१_END
BEGIN_
"O, excellent among the supporters of law and the virtuous! The same degree of
respect is to be paid to our mother, as is due to our father, who is honoured by all."_END

B_2_C_101_21
BEGIN_
एताभ्याम् धर्म शीलाभ्याम् वनम् गग्च्छ इति राघव |
माता पितृभ्याम् उक्तो अहम् कथम् अन्यत् समाचरे || २-१०१-२२_END
BEGIN_
"How can I do otherwise, while both my parents of virtuous nature ask me to go to
the forest?"_END

B_2_C_101_22
BEGIN_
त्वया राज्यम् अयोध्यायाम् प्राप्तव्यम् लोक सत्कृतम् |
वस्तव्यम् दण्डक अरण्ये मया वल्कल वाससा || २-१०१-२३_END
BEGIN_
"It is for you to occupy the throne in Ayodhya that the world reveres and it is for
me to occupy this Dandaka forest, wearing bark robes."_END

B_2_C_101_23
BEGIN_
एवम् कृत्वा महा राजो विभागम् लोक सम्निधौ |
व्यादिश्य च महा तेजा दिवम् दशरथो गतः || २-१०१-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Having commanded thus, the emperor Dasaratha with a great splendour, made the
division of duties in this manner (for us two) in the presence of the people and then ascended to
heaven."_END

B_2_C_101_24
BEGIN_
स च प्रमाणम् धर्म आत्मा राजा लोक गुरुः तव |
पित्रा दत्तम् यथा भागम् उपभोक्तुम् त्वम् अर्हसि || २-१०१-२५_END
BEGIN_
"That pious souled king, the preceptor of the world is the standard authority for
you and you have to enjoy the share given by our father accordingly."_END

B_2_C_101_25
BEGIN_
चतुर्दश समाः सौम्य दण्डक अरण्यम् आश्रितः |
उपभोक्ष्ये तु अहम् दत्तम् भागम् पित्रा महात्मना || २-१०१-२६_END
BEGIN_
"I, for my part, shall enjoy the share given to me by our high-souled father for
fourteen years, taking my abode in Dandaka forest, O gentle brother!"_END

B_2_C_102_0
BEGIN_
रामस्य वचनम् श्रुत्वा भरतः प्रत्युवाच ह |
किम् मे धर्माद्विहीनस्य राजधर्मः करिष्यति || २-१०२-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Rama's words, Bharata replied as follows: "What will the discharge of royal
duties amount to me, who is outside of that code?"_END

B_2_C_102_1
BEGIN_
शाश्वतोऽयं सदा ध्रमः स्थितोऽस्मासु नरर्षभ |
जेष्ठपुत्रे स्थ्ते राजन् न कनीयान् नृपो भवेत् || २-१०२-२_END
BEGIN_
"O, the foremost of men! O, Majesty! It has been ever the established tradition in
us that while the elder son is there, the younger one cannot become a king."_END

B_2_C_102_2
BEGIN_
स समृद्धां मया सार्धमयोध्यां गच्छ राघव |
अभिषेचय चात्मानं कुलस्यास्य भवाय नः ||२-१०२-३_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! Therefore, come to the prosperous Ayodhya along with me and get anointed
in kingdom for the welfare of our race."_END

B_2_C_102_3
BEGIN_
राजानं मानुषं प्राहुर्देवत्वे सम्मतो मम |
यस्य धर्मार्थसहितं वृत्तमाहुरमानुषम् || २-१०२-४_END
BEGIN_
"The king, whom people speak of as a human being and whose conduct is in conformity
with righteousness and worldly prosperity, they declare as super- human, is conceded by me as a
god-head."_END

B_2_C_102_4
BEGIN_
केकयस्थे च मयि तु त्वयि चारण्यमाश्रिते |
दिवमार्यो गतो राजा यायजूकः सतां मतः || २-१०२-५_END
BEGIN_
"While I was there in Kekaya kingdom and you had proceeded tot he forest, the king
Dasaratha, the revered one who was given to the performance of sacrifices and was honoured by the
virtuous, has gone to heaven."_END

B_2_C_102_5
BEGIN_
निष्क्रान्तमात्रे भवति सहसीते सलक्ष्मणे |
दुःखशोकाभिभूतस्तु राजा त्रिदिवमभ्यगात् || २-१०२-६_END
BEGIN_
"Hardly were you gone with Seetha and Lakshmana, than the king succumbed to
misfortune and grief and ascended to the most sacred heaven."_END

B_2_C_102_6
BEGIN_
उत्तिष्ठ पुरुषव्याघ्र क्रियतामुदकं पितुः |
अहं चायं च शत्रुघ्नः पूर्वमेव कृतोदकौ || २-१०२-७_END
BEGIN_
"Arise, O the Tiger among men! Let the traditional libations of water be offered to
our father. Shatrughna and I have previously done it."_END

B_2_C_102_7
BEGIN_
प्रियेण खलु दत्तं हि पितृलोकेषु राघव |
अक्षय्यं भवतीत्याहुर्भवांश्चैव पितुः प्रियः || २-१०२-८_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! It is said that the one given by an affectionate son becomes measureless
and you undoubtedly are beloved to our father."_END

B_2_C_102_8
BEGIN_
त्वामेव शोचंस्तव दर्शनेप्सुः |
त्वयेव सक्तामनिवर्त्य बुद्धिम् |
त्वया विहीनस्तव शोकमग्न |
स्त्वाम् संस्मरन्नस्तमितः पिता ते || २-१०२-९_END
BEGIN_
"Entirely abandoned by you, lamenting about you, desirous of beholding you, being
not able to turn away his mind absorbed in you alone, immersed in grief of you and recollecting
you, your father died."_END

B_2_C_103_0
BEGIN_
ताम् श्रुत्वा करुणां वाचं पितुर्मरणसंहिताम् |
राघवो भरतेनोक्तां बभूव गतचेतनः || २-१०३-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those mournful words relating to the death of his father, spoken by Bharata,
Rama fainted away._END

B_2_C_103_1
BEGIN_
तं तु वज्रमिवोत्सृष्टमाहवे दानवारिणा |
वाग्वज्रं भरतेनोक्तममनोज्ञं परम्तपः || २-१०३-२
प्रगृह्य रामो बाहूवै पुषिताग्रो यथा द्रुमः |
वने परशुना कृत्तस्तथा भुवि पपात ह || २-१०३-३_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that unpleasant thunder bolt of words spoken by Bharata, like a thunderbolt
released by Indra the Lord of celestials in a battle, Rama the tormentator of his enemies,
stretched forth his hands and fell on the ground, in the same manner as a tree covered at
extremities with blossoms was cut off by an axe in the forest._END

B_2_C_103_2
BEGIN_
तथा निपतितं रामं जगत्यां जगतीपतिम् |
कूलघातपरिश्रान्तं पसुप्तमिव कुञ्जरम् || २-१०३-४
भ्रातरस्ते महेष्वासं सर्वतः शोककर्शितम् |
रुदन्तः सह वैदेह्या सिषिभुः सलिलेन वै || २-१०३-५_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Rama lying on the earth, has the lord of the earth, like an elephant crushed
by a land slide on a bank where he was sleeping, those brother along with Seetha approached him
from all sides and weepingly sprinkled water on him._END

B_2_C_103_3
BEGIN_
स तु संज्ञां पुनर्लब्ध्वा नेत्राभ्यामस्रमुत्सृजन् |
उपाक्रामत काकुत्थ्सः कृपणं बहु भाषितुम् || २-१०३-६_END
BEGIN_
Coming to his senses again and tears falling from his eyes, Rama began to speak much
plaintively._END

B_2_C_103_4
BEGIN_
स रामः स्वर्गतं श्रुत्वा पितरम् पृथिवीपतिम् |
उवाच भरतं वाक्यं धर्मात्मा धर्मसंहितम् || २-१०३-७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that the King and his father had ascended to heaven, the virtuous. Rama
spoke the following words, consistent with righteousness to Bharata._END

B_2_C_103_5
BEGIN_
किं करिष्याम्ययोध्यायां ताते दिष्टां गतिम् गते |
कस्ताम् राजवराद्धीनामयोध्याम् पालयिष्यति || २-१०३-८_END
BEGIN_
"What should I do with Ayodhya, now that my father reached the end of his life? Who
will rule that Ayodhya, which is bereft of that excellent king?_END

B_2_C_103_6
BEGIN_
किम् नु तस्य मया कार्यं दुर्जातेन महात्मनः |
यो मृतो मम शोकेन मया चापि न संस्कृतः || २-१०३-९_END
BEGIN_
"In my misfortune, what can I do for that high-souled one? He died of grief on my
account and I did not perform the last rites for him!"_END

B_2_C_103_7
BEGIN_
अहोः भरत! सिद्धार्थो येन राजा त्वयानुघ!|
शत्रुघ्नेन च सर्वेषु प्रेतकृत्येषु सत्कृतः || २-१०३-१०_END
BEGIN_
"O, Bharata the faultless one! Alas! Happy are you, by whom as well as by Shatrughna
the king was honoured by all obsequial rites!"_END

B_2_C_103_8
BEGIN_
निष्प्रधाना मनेकाग्रां नरेन्द्रेण विना कृताम् |
निवृत्तवनवासोऽपि नायोध्यां गन्तुमुत्सहे || २-१०३-११_END
BEGIN_
'Even after the end of my exile, I do not want to return to Ayodhya which is i a
disarranged state, deprived of a chief and made bereft of a king."_END

B_2_C_103_9
BEGIN_
समाप्तवनवासं मामयोध्यायाम् परम्तप |
कोऽनु शासिष्यति पुनस्तते लोकान्तरं गते || २-१०३-१२_END
BEGIN_
"O, Bharata the tormentator of foes While our father has gone to the other world,
who will counsel me when my exile in the forest is over?"_END

B_2_C_103_10
BEGIN_
पुरा प्रेक्ष्य सुवृत्तं माम् पिता यान्याह सान्त्वयन् |
वाक्यानि तानि श्रोष्यामि कुतः श्रोतसुखान्यहम् || २-१०३-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Formerly, seeing my good conduct, our father used to address me in words of praise;
from whom now shall I hear those words delightful to the ears?"_END

B_2_C_103_11
BEGIN_
एवमुक्त्वा स भरतं भार्यामभ्येत्य राघवः |
उवाच शोकसम्तप्तः पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननाम् || २-१०३-१४_END
BEGIN_
Having spoken thus to Bharata, Rama went to seek out his consort, whose face
resembled the full moon, and overwhelmed with grief, spoke to her as follows:-_END

B_2_C_103_12
BEGIN_
सीते मृतस्ते श्वशुरः पित्रा हीनोऽसि लक्ष्मण |
भरतो कुःखमाचष्टे स्वर्गतं पृथिवीपतिम् || २-१०३-१५_END
BEGIN_
"O, Seetha! your father-in-law is dead. O, Lakshmana! You have become bereft of your
father. Bharata is informing a sorrowful news of the emperor being dead._END

B_2_C_103_13
BEGIN_
ततो बहुगुणम् तेषां बाष्पो नेत्रेष्वजायत |
तथा ब्रुवति काकुत्थ्स कुमाराणां यशस्विनाम् || २-१०३-१६_END
BEGIN_
While Rama was uttering those words, copious tears caused to flow then from the eyes
of those sons of Dasaratha._END

B_2_C_103_14
BEGIN_
ततस्ते भ्रातरस्सर्वे भृशमाश्वास्य राघवम् |
अब्रुवन् जगतीभर्तुः क्रियतामुदकं पितुः || २-१०३-१७_END
BEGIN_
Then, all those brothers consoled Rama very much and said to him, "Let us offer
libations of water for our father, the Lord of the earth."_END

B_2_C_103_15
BEGIN_
सा सीता श्वशुरं श्रुत्वा स्वर्गलोकगतम् नृपम् |
नेत्राभ्यामश्रुपूर्णाभ्यामशकन्नेक्षितुं पतिम् || २-१०३-१८_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that her father-in-law, that great monarch had ascended to heaven, Seetha
was unable to see her husband through eyes filled with tears._END

B_2_C_103_16
BEGIN_
सान्त्वयित्वा तु तां रामो रुदतीं जनकात्मजाम् |
उवाच लक्ष्मणम् तत्र दुःखितो दुःखितम् वचः || २-१०३-१९_END
BEGIN_
Rama consoled that Seetha who was weeping and himself stricken with grief, spoke to
the lamenting Lakshmana as follows:_END

B_2_C_103_17
BEGIN_
आनयेङ्गुदिपिण्याकं चीरमाहर चोत्तरम् |
जलक्रियार्थं तातस्य गमिष्यामि महात्मनः || २-१०३-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Bring the crushed pulp of Ingudi Tree and bring a piece of bark for being wrapped
about my loins and another for being used as my loins and another for being used as an upper
garment, so that we may proceed to offer libations of water for our magnanimous father."_END

B_2_C_103_18
BEGIN_
सीता पुरस्ताद्र्वजतु त्वमेनामभितो व्रज |
अहं पश्चाद्गमिष्यामि गति र्ह्येषा सुदारुणा || २-१०३-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Let Seetha walk in the front and you follow after her nearby. I shall follow in the
rear. This indeed is the most terrible procession._END

B_2_C_103_19
BEGIN_
ततो नित्यानुगस्तेषां विदितात्मा महामतिः |
मृदुर्दान्तस्च शान्तश्च रामे च दृढभक्तिमान् || २-१०३-२२
सुमन्त्रस्तैर्नृपसुतैः सार्धमाश्वास्य रागवम् |
आवातारयदालम्ब्य नदीम् मन्दाकिनीम् शिवाम् || २-१०३-२३_END
BEGIN_
Then, their faithful companion Sumantra versed in the spiritual science, endowed
with great intelligence, kind, self-controlled and glorious, and deeply devoted to Rama, consoling
him and his brothers, took Rama by the hand and helped him descend to the auspicious River
Mandakini._END

B_2_C_103_20
BEGIN_
ते सुतीर्थाम् ततः कृच्छ्रादुपागम्य यशस्विनः |
नदीम् मन्दाकिनीम् रम्याम् सदा पुष्पितकाननाम् || २-१०३-२४
शीघ्रश्रोतसमासाद्य तीर्थम् शिममकर्दमम् |
सिषिचुस्तुदकं राज्ञे तातैतत्ते भवत्विति || २-१०३-२५_END
BEGIN_
The illustrious Rama and others painfully reached the River Mandakini, that stream
of sacred fords, the enchanting one always covered with flowers, coming to a blessed ford, free
from mud and offered the lustrual water to the king, saying "Father! May this prove agreeable to
you."_END

B_2_C_103_21
BEGIN_
प्रगृह्य च महीपालो जलपूरितमञ्जलिम् |
दिशम् याम्यामभिमुखो रुदन्वचनम्ब्रवीत् || २-१०३-२६_END
BEGIN_
Holding together in the form of a hollow his palms full of water and turning his
face turned towards the southern quarter and weeping the great prince pronounced the traditional
words saying:_END

B_2_C_103_22
BEGIN_
एतत्ते राजशार्दूल विमलं तोयमक्षयम् |
पितृलोकगतस्याद्य मद्दत्तमुपतिष्ठतु || २-१०३-२७_END
BEGIN_
O, Tiger among men! May this water without taint and incorruptible at the moment
that I offer it to you, reach you in the region of your ancestors where you are."_END

B_2_C_103_23
BEGIN_
ततो मन्दाकिनीतीरात्र्पत्युत्तीर्य स राघवः |
पितुश्चकार तेजस्वी निवापं ब्रातृभिः सह || २-१०३-२८_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, the glorious Rama, resending the bank of Mandakini River along with his
brothers, offered balls of food to his father._END

B_2_C_103_24
BEGIN_
ऐङ्गुदम् बदरीमिश्रम् पिण्याकम् दर्भसंस्तरे |
न्यस्य रामस्स दुःखार्तो रुदन्वचनमब्रवीत् || २-१०३-२९_END
BEGIN_
Rama placed the pulp of the Ingudi tree mixed with the pulp of plums on a mat of
Kusa grass and overcome with sadness, weeping, spoke the following words:_END

B_2_C_103_25
BEGIN_
इदम्भुङ्क्ष्व महाराज प्रीतो यदशना वयम् |
यदन्नः पुरुषो भवति तदन्ना स्तस्य देवताः || २-१०३-३०_END
BEGIN_
"O, Great King! Be pleased to partake of this, which we eat for, that which man
eats, is also consumed by his gods."_END

B_2_C_103_26
BEGIN_
ततस्तेनैव मार्गेण प्रत्युत्तीर्य नदीतटात् |
आरुरोह नरव्याघ्रो रम्यसानुं महिधरम् || २-१०३-३१_END
BEGIN_
Rama the tiger among men then re-ascending by the same path on the banks of the
river reached the charming summit of Chitrakuta mountain._END

B_2_C_103_27
BEGIN_
ततः पर्णकुटीद्वारमासाद्य जगतीपतिः |
परिजग्राह बाहुभ्यामुभौ भरतलक्ष्मणौ || २-१०३-३२_END
BEGIN_
Gaining the door of his leafy hut, Rama the Lord of the earth then embraced Bharata
and Lakshmana with his arms._END

B_2_C_103_28
BEGIN_
तेषां तु रुदतां शब्दात्प्रतिश्रुत्कोऽभवद्गिरौ |
भ्रात्ऱ्^ऊ सह वैदेह्या सिंहानामिव नर्धताम् || २-१०३-३३_END
BEGIN_
From the sound of the cry of those brothers with Seetha, which resembled like the
roaring of lions rose an echo in the mountain._END

B_2_C_103_29
BEGIN_
महाबलानाम् रुदताअं कुर्वतामुदकं पितुः |
विज्ञाय तुमुलं शब्दम् त्रस्ता भरतसैनिकाः || २-१०३-३४_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the tumultuous clamour by those mighty heroes as, weeping they completed the
libations of water to their father, Bharata's army got alarmed._END

B_2_C_103_30
BEGIN_
आब्रुवंश्चापि रामेण भरतस्संगतो ध्रुवम् |
तेषामेव महाशब्दः शोचतां पितरं मृतम् || २-१०३-३५_END
BEGIN_
Those troops of Bharata also said, "Assuredly, Bharata has joined Rama and this is a
great sound only of their wailing, as they mourn for their dead father."_END

B_2_C_103_31
BEGIN_
अथ वासान्परित्यज्य तं सर्वेऽभिमुखाः स्वनम् |
अ प्येकमनसो जग्मुर्यथास्थानम् प्रधाविताः || २-१०३-३६_END
BEGIN_
Leaving their tents all of them having but one thought, went running in the
direction of that sound instantly._END

B_2_C_103_32
BEGIN_
हयैरन्ये गजैरन्ये रथैरन्ये स्वलम्कृतैः |
सुकुमारास्तथैवान्ये पद्भिरेव नरा ययः || २-१०३-३७_END
BEGIN_
Some went on their horses, some others on their elephants, some in their chariots
covered with ornaments while the youthful people went on foot._END

B_2_C_103_33
BEGIN_
अचिरप्रोषितम् रामम् चिरविप्रोषितं यथा |
द्रष्टुकामो जनस्सर्वो जगाम सहसाश्रमम् || २-१०३-३८_END
BEGIN_
In their longing to see Rama, whose absence though recent, seemed so long a period
for them, the whole people ran towards the hermitage._END

B_2_C_103_34
BEGIN_
भ्रात्ऱूणां त्वरितास्तत्र द्रष्टुकामास्समागमम् |
युयुर्बहुविधैर्यानैः खरनेविस्वनाकुलैः || २-१०३-३९_END
BEGIN_
Eager to see those brothers re-united there, they went hastily by various means of
transport, either by hoofed animals or by wheeled vehicles._END

B_2_C_103_35
BEGIN_
सा भूमिर्बहुभिर्यानै खरनेमिसम्रहता |
मुमोच तुमुलं शब्दं द्यौरिवाभ्रसमागमे || २-१०३-४०_END
BEGIN_
Trodden by many vehicles, beasts and chariots, that land emitted a tumultuous noise,
as a sky during the conjunction of clouds._END

B_2_C_103_36
BEGIN_
तेन वित्रासिता नागाः करेणुपरिवारिताः |
आवासयन्तो गन्धेन जग्मुरन्यद्वनम् ततः || २-१०३-४१_END
BEGIN_
Frightened by that noise, the wild elephants, surrounded by female elephants,
perfuming the quarters with teh scent of their ichor, went to another wood from there._END

B_2_C_103_37
BEGIN_
वराहवृकसम्घाश्च सिंहाश्च महिषाः सर्पवानराः |
व्याघ्रगोकर्णगवयाः वित्रेसुः पृषतैस्सह || २-१०३-४२_END
BEGIN_
Boars, wolves and lions, buffaloes, snakes, monkeys, tigers, Gokarnas and Gavayas
(two distinctive species of deer) along with spotted deer felt frightened._END

B_2_C_103_38
BEGIN_
रथाङ्गसाह्वा नत्यूह हंसाः कारण्डवाः प्लवाः |
तथा पुंस्कोकोलाः क्रौञ्च विसम्ज्ञा भेजिरे दिशः || २-१०३-४३_END
BEGIN_
The ruddy gooses, water-fowls, swans, Karandavas ( a sort of ducks), herons, male
cuckoos and cranes, utterly confused made it to various directions._END

B_2_C_103_39
BEGIN_
तेन शब्देन वित्रस्तैराकासं पक्षिभिर्वऋतम् |
मनुष्यैरावृता भूमिरुभयम् प्रबभौ त दा || २-१०३-४४_END
BEGIN_
The sky filled with birds that had been frightened by that noise and the earth
covered with men, both looked beautiful at that moment._END

B_2_C_103_40
BEGIN_
तत्तस्तं पुरुषव्याघ्रम् यशस्विन मकीलम्षम् |
आसीनं स्थण्डिले रामम् ददर्श सहसा जनः || २-१०३-४५_END
BEGIN_
Suddenly then, the people beheld the illustrious and the sinless Rama, sitting on
the bare earth._END

B_2_C_103_41
BEGIN_
विगर्हमाणः कैकेयीं मन्थरासहितामपि |
अभिगम्य जनो रामम् बाष्पपूर्णमुखोऽभवत् || २-१०३-४६_END
BEGIN_
Abusing Kaikeyi and Manthara, those people turned up with their faces bathed in
tears. while approaching Rama._END

B_2_C_103_42
BEGIN_
तान्नरान् बाष्पपूर्णाक्षान् समीक्ष्यथ सुदुःखितान् |
पर्यष्वजत धर्मज्ञः पितृवन्मातृवच्च नः || २-१०३-४७_END
BEGIN_
Seeing those people thus deeply afflicted their eyes suffused with tears, Rama
knowing what was right, embraced them like their father and mother._END

B_2_C_103_43
BEGIN_
स तत्र कांश्चित् परिषन्वजे नरान् |
नराश्च केचित्तु तमभ्यवादयन् |
चकार सर्वान् सवयस्यबान्धवान् |
यथार्ह मासाद्य तदा नृपात्मजः || २-१०३-४८_END
BEGIN_
Rama embraced some men there, while some others offered salutations to him.
Approaching them on that occasion, the king's son received them all including his friends and
companions._END

B_2_C_103_44
BEGIN_
स तत्र तेषाम् रुदतां महात्मनां |
भुवम् ब खम् चाशुनिनादयन् स्वनः |
गुह गिरीणाम् च दिश्श्च सन्ततं |
मृदङ्गघोषप्रतिमः प्रशुश्रुवे || २-१०३-४९_END
BEGIN_
The tumult of those magnanimous persons lamenting, resounded over the earth and in
the sky, reverberating through the mountain caves and in all quarters like the continuous beating
of drums._END

B_2_C_104_0
BEGIN_
वसिष्ठः पुरतः कृत्वा दारान् दशरथस्य च |
अभिचक्राम तं देशं रामदर्शनतर्षितः || २-१०४-१_END
BEGIN_
Eager to see Rama again, Vasishta approached that place, preceded by Dasaratha's
wives._END

B_2_C_104_1
BEGIN_
राजपत्न्यश्च गच्छन्त्यो मन्दं मन्दाकिनीम् प्रति |
ददृशुस्तत्र तत्तीर्थं रामलक्ष्मणसेवितम् || २-१०४-२_END
BEGIN_
The king's wives, while moving slowly towards River Mandakini, saw the ford there,
being frequented by Rama and Lakshmana._END

B_2_C_104_2
BEGIN_
कौसल्या बाष्पपूर्णेन मुखेन परिशुष्यता |
सुमित्रामब्रवीद्दीना याश्चान्या राजयोषितः || २-१०४-३_END
BEGIN_
With a gloomy and emaciated face, filled with tears, Kausalya spoke to Sumitra and
other royal women (as follows):_END

B_2_C_104_3
BEGIN_
इदम् तेषामनाथानाम् क्लिष्टमक्लिष्टकर्मणाम् |
वने प्राक्कलनम्तीर्थम् ये ते निर्विषयीकृताः || २-१०४-४_END
BEGIN_
"This is the ford, located in the eastern region of the forest, frequented by
Seetha, Rama and Lakshmana, banished from the kingdom; those unfortunate persons of illustrious
exploits who have no country."_END

B_2_C_104_4
BEGIN_
इतस्सुमित्रे पुत्रस्ते सदा जलमतन्द्रितः |
स्वयं हरति सौमित्रिर्मम पुत्रस्य कारणात् || २-१०४-५_END
BEGIN_
"O, Sumitra! Lakshmana, your son always draws water himself from here unwearyingly
for the sake of my son."_END

B_2_C_104_5
BEGIN_
जघन्यमपि ते पुत्रः कृतवान्न तु गर्हितः |
भ्रातुर्यदर्थसहितं सर्वं तद्विहितम् गुणैः || २-१०४-६_END
BEGIN_
"Through engaged in an inferior act (of carrying water), your son is not to be
censured because all that service rendered to his brother is enjoined with virtues."_END

B_2_C_104_6
BEGIN_
अद्यायमपि ते पुत्रः क्लेशानामतथोचितः |
नीचानर्थसमाचारं सज्जं कर्म प्रमुञ्चतु || २-१०४-७_END
BEGIN_
"Your son too, who is not accustomed to such pains, will indeed be relived now of
this mean, wretched and laborious task."_END

B_2_C_104_7
BEGIN_
दक्षिणाग्रेषु दर्भेषु सा ददर्श महीतले |
पितुरिङ्गुदिपिण्याकम् व्यस्तमायतलोचना || २-१०४-८_END
BEGIN_
The large-eyed Kausalya observed a ball made of Ingudi pulp, which was placed by
Rama in honour of his father on the ground, on aheap of Darbha grass, the raised spikes of which
pointed towards the south._END

B_2_C_104_8
BEGIN_
तं भूमौ पितुरार्तेन न्यस्तं रामेण वीक्ष्यसा |
उवाच देवीइ कौसल्या सर्वा दशरथस्त्रियः || २-१०४-९_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that ball of food placed on the ground by the unfortunate Rama for his
father, the Queen Kausalya spoke to all those wives of Dasaratha (as follows):_END

B_2_C_104_9
BEGIN_
इदमिक्ष्वाकुनाथस्य राघवस्य महाअत्मनः |
राघवेण पितुर्दत्तम् पश्यतै तद्यथाविधि || २-१०४-१०_END
BEGIN_
"See this ball of food offered traditionally by Rama in honour of his father, the
high-souled Dasaratha the Lord of Ikshvaku race."_END

B_2_C_104_10
BEGIN_
तस्य देवसमानस्य पार्थिवस्य महात्मनः |
नैतदौपयिकम् मन्ये भुक्तभोगस्य भोजनम् || २-१०४-११_END
BEGIN_
"I do not consider this offering as befitting for that great-souled king, who was
like unto a God and who lived amidst every pleasure."_END

B_2_C_104_11
BEGIN_
चतुर्न्ताम् महीम् भुक्त्वा महेन्द्रसदृशो विभुः |
कथमिङ्गुदिपिण्याकम् स भुङ्त्के वसुधादिपः || २-१०४-१२_END
BEGIN_
"How can that Lord of the earth, Dasartha, equal to the Lord of celestials and a
mighty man, having enjoyed the earth with its four quarters, the boundaries of which are the
oceans, eat a cake of Ingudi pulp?"_END

B_2_C_104_12
BEGIN_
अतो दुःखतरम् लोके न किंञ्चित्प्रतिभाति मा |
यत्र रामः पितुर्दद्यादिङ्गुदिक्षोदमृद्धिमान् || २-१०४-१३_END
BEGIN_
"I do not consider any thing painful to me on earth than when Rama the man of
fortune offering a cake of Ingudi pulp to his father."_END

B_2_C_104_13
BEGIN_
रामेणेङ्गुदिपिण्याकं पित्तुर्दत्तं समीक्ष्य मे |
कथं दुःखेन हृदयम् न स्पोटति सहस्रधा || २-१०४-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing this offering, a cake of Ingudi pulp, of Rama to his father, why does my
heart not break into a thousand pieces with anguish?"_END

B_2_C_104_14
BEGIN_
श्रुतिस्तु खल्वियं सत्य लौकिकी प्रतिभाति मा |
यदन्नः पुरुषो भवति तदन्नास्तस्य देवताः || २-१०४-१५_END
BEGIN_
"It indeed occurs to me that the saying among men that the food eaten by man is also
consumed by his Gods is true."_END

B_2_C_104_15
BEGIN_
एवमार्तां सपत्न्यस्ता जग्मुराश्वास्य तां तदा |
ददृशुश्चश्रमे रामं स्वर्गच्युतमिवामरम् || २-१०४-१६_END
BEGIN_
Consoling Kausalya thus afflicted by grief, Kausalya's companions then proceeded
further and saw Rama in his hermitage, who resembled an Immortal driven out of Paradise._END

B_2_C_104_16
BEGIN_
सर्वभोगैः परित्यक्तं रामं सम्प्रेक्ष्य मातरः |
आर्त मुमुचुरश्रुणि सस्वरं शोककर्शताः || २-१०४-१७_END
BEGIN_
Beholding Rama bereft of all enjoyments, his mothers agonized as they were with
grief, emitted cries and allowed tears to flow._END

B_2_C_104_17
BEGIN_
तासां रामः समुत्थाय जग्रह चरणान् शुभान् |
मातृइणां मनुजव्याघ्रः सर्वासां सत्यसंगरः || २-१०४-१८_END
BEGIN_
Rama, the tiger among men, true to his promise raised up and took hold of the
auspicious feet of all his mothers._END

B_2_C_104_18
BEGIN_
ताह् पाणिभिः सुखस्सर्शैद्वङ्गुलितलैश्शुभैः |
प्रममार्जू रजः पृष्ठाद्रामस्यायतलोचनाः || २-१०४-१९_END
BEGIN_
Those large-eyed Queens, by means of their pleasantly touching soft fingers and
palms as well as charming hands, wiped the dust from Rama's back._END

B_2_C_104_19
BEGIN_
सौमित्रिरपि ताः सर्वा मातृईः सम्प्रेक्ष्य दुःखितः |
आभ्यावादयदासक्तं शनैरामादनन्तरम् || २-१०४-२०_END
BEGIN_
Seeing all those mothers, the wailing Lakshmana too slowly paid obeisance devotedly
to them all by bowing to each in turn, immediately after Rama._END

B_2_C_104_20
BEGIN_
यथा रामे तथा तस्मिन् सर्वा ववृतिरे स्त्रियः |
वृत्तिम् दशरथाज्जाते लक्ष्मणे शुभलक्षणे || २-१०४-२१_END
BEGIN_
All Dasaratha's wives manifested the same affection towards Lakshmana, who was born
of Dasaratha and exceedingly handsome, as they did to Rama._END

B_2_C_104_21
BEGIN_
सीतापि चरणांस्तसामुपसम्गृह्य दुः खिता |
श्वश्रूणामश्रुपूर्णाक्षि सा बभूवाग्रतः स्थिता || २-१०४-२२_END
BEGIN_
Then, the grief-stricken Seetha, her eyes filed with tears, also touched the feet of
her mothers-in-laws and stood before them._END

B_2_C_104_22
BEGIN_
तां परिष्वज्य दुःखार्तां माता दुहितरम् यथा |
वनवासकृशां दीनां कौसल्या वाक्यमब्रवीत् || २-१०४-२३_END
BEGIN_
Kausalya embraced the miserable Seetha as a mother her daughter, she who was
emaciated because of her stay in the forest and afflicted with grief, and spoke the following
words:_END

B_2_C_104_23
BEGIN_
विदेहराजस्य सुता स्नुषा दशरथस्य च |
रामपत्नी कथं दुःखं सम्प्राप्ता निर्जने वने || २-१०४-२४_END
BEGIN_
"How has the daughter of King Janaka, the daughter-in-law of King Dasaratha and
Rama's wife, fallen into such a wretched plight that she is living in a desolate forest?"_END

B_2_C_104_24
BEGIN_
पद्ममातपसन्तप्तं परिक्लिष्टमिवोत्पलम् |
काञ्चनं रजसा ध्वस्तम् क्स्लिष्टं चन्द्रमिवाम्बुदैः || २-१०४-२५
मुखम् ते प्रेक्ष्य माम् शोको दहत्यग्निरिवाश्रयम् |
भृशम् मनसि वैदेहि व्यसनारणिसम्भवः || २-१०४-२६_END
BEGIN_
"O, Seetha! Seeing your face, like a lotus withered with heart or a faded lily or
gold defiled with dust or a moon hidden by the clouds, the fire of grief produced by the firewood
of adversity and existing in my mind burns me severely."_END

B_2_C_104_25
BEGIN_
ब्रुवन्त्यमेवमार्तायां जनन्यां भरताग्रजः |
पादावासाद्य जग्राह वसिष्टस्य च राघवः || २-१०४-२७_END
BEGIN_
While the sorrowful mother was speaking thus, Rama the elder brother of Bharata
approached Vasishta and took hold of his feet in salutation._END

B_2_C_104_26
BEGIN_
पुरोहितस्यग्नि समस्य वै तदा |
बृहस्पतेरिन्द्रमिवामराधिपः |
प्रगृह्य पादौ सुसमृद्धतेजसः |
सहैव तेनोपनिवेश राघवः || २-१०४-२८_END
BEGIN_
Then, Rama holding the feet of that priest, who was equal of Agni the fire and
endowed with very great splendour, even as Indra the Lord of celestials would clasp the feet of
Brihaspati, sat down by his side._END

B_2_C_104_27
BEGIN_
ततो जघन्यं सहितैः समन्त्रिभिः |
पुरप्रधानैश्च सहैव सैनिकैः |
जनेन धर्मज्ञतमेन धर्मवा |
नुपोपविष्टो भरतस्तदाग्रजम् || २-१०४-२९_END
BEGIN_
Then, after Rama and Vasishta sat, Bharata the pious man along with his counsellors,
the leading citizens, warriors and virtuous people seated himself at a lowel level at a proximity
to Rama._END

B_2_C_104_28
BEGIN_
उपोपविष्टस्तु तदा स वीर्यवां |
स्तपस्विवेषेण समीक्ष्य राघवम् |
श्रिया ज्वलन्तं भरतः कृताञ्जलि |
र्यथा महेन्द्रः प्रयतः प्रजापतिम् || २-१०४-३०_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Rama in the garb of an ascetic, radiant in majesty, the extremely powerful
Bharata, paying obeisance to him with joined palms, then took his place in his presence, as the
devoted Indra the Lord of celestials sits before Brahma the Lord of creation._END

B_2_C_104_29
BEGIN_
किमेष वाक्यम् भरतो.द्य राघवं |
प्रणम्य स्त्कृत्य च साधु वक्ष्यति |
इतीव तस्यार्यजनस्य तत्त्वतो |
बभूव कौतूहलमुत्तमम् तदा || २-१०४-३१_END
BEGIN_
A highest curiosity arose in the minds of those worthy men (assembled there) as to
what persuasive words Bharata at that moment would utter, while addressing Rama, having offered
salutation and homage to him._END

B_2_C_104_30
BEGIN_
स राघवः सत्यधृतिश्च लक्ष्मणो |
महानुभावो भरतश्च धार्मिकः |
वृताः सुहृद्भिश्च विरेजुरध्वरे |
यथा सद्स्यः सहितास्त्रयोऽग्नयः || २-१०४-३२_END
BEGIN_
That Rama endowed with truth and forbearance with Lakshmana who was bestowed with
magnanimity and the pious Bharata, surrounded by his companions, were as resplendent as the three
sacrificial Fires (known by the names of Garhapatya, Ahavamiya and Dakshina), accompanied by the
superintending priests._END

B_2_C_105_0
BEGIN_
ततः पुरुष सिम्हानाम् वृतानाम् तैः सुहृद् गणैः |
शोचताम् एव रजनी दुह्खेन व्यत्यवर्तत || २-१०५-१_END
BEGIN_
While those lions among men amidst a host of friends were lamenting, that night
elapsed with a much difficulty._END

B_2_C_105_1
BEGIN_
रजन्याम् सुप्रभातायाम् भ्रातरः ते सुहृद् वृताः |
मन्दाकिन्याम् हुतम् जप्यम् कृत्वा रामम् उपागमन् || २-१०५-२_END
BEGIN_
When the beautiful dawn broke, Rama's brothers along with their companions, having
made their offerings and recited their prayers on the banks of River Madakini, approached Rama._END

B_2_C_105_2
BEGIN_
तूष्णीम् ते समुपासीना न कश्चित् किंचिद् अब्रवीत् |
भरतः तु सुहृन् मध्ये राम वचनम् अब्रवीत् || २-१०५-३_END
BEGIN_
Sitting in silence, no one uttered a word. Bharata, on his part, amidst his
companions, addressed Rama as follows:_END

B_2_C_105_3
BEGIN_
सान्त्विता मामिका माता दत्तम् राज्यम् इदम् मम |
तद् ददामि तव एव अहम् भुन्क्ष्व राज्यम् अकण्टकम् || २-१०५-४_END
BEGIN_
"My mother has been consoled (by you) by giving this kingdom to me. I am giving back
that kingdom to you. Enjoy it without hindrance!"_END

B_2_C_105_4
BEGIN_
महता इव अम्बु वेगेन भिन्नः सेतुर् जल आगमे |
दुरावारम् त्वद् अन्येन राज्य खण्डम् इदम् महत् || २-१०५-५_END
BEGIN_
"As a dam breached by a great on-rush of water during a rainy season cannot be
repaired so easily, this great continent cannot be defended by any one other than you."_END

B_2_C_105_5
BEGIN_
गतिम् खर इव अश्वस्य तार्क्ष्यस्य इव पतत्रिणः |
अनुगन्तुम् न शक्तिर् मे गतिम् तव मही पते || २-१०५-६_END
BEGIN_
"As a donkey cannot emulate the tempo of a horse, or an ordinary bird the movement
of Garuda (a kind of falcon), neither can I follow in your footsteps, O, Lord of the world!"_END

B_2_C_105_6
BEGIN_
सुजीवम् नित्यशः तस्य यः परैर् उपजीव्यते |
राम तेन तु दुर्जीवम् यः परान् उपजीवति || २-१०५-७_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! Know his life to be blessed forever, on whom others depend Life is,
however, difficult for him who depends on others for this life."_END

B_2_C_105_7
BEGIN_
यथा तु रोपितो वृक्षः पुरुषेण विवर्धितः |
ह्रस्वकेन दुरारोहो रूढ स्कन्धो महा द्रुमः || २-१०५-८
स यदा पुष्पितो भूत्वा फलानि न विदर्शयेत् |
स ताम् न अनुभवेत् प्रीतिम् यस्य हेतोः प्रभावितः || २-१०५-९
एषा उपमा महा बाहो त्वम् अर्थम् वेत्तुम् अर्हसि |
यदि त्वम् अस्मान् ऋषभो भर्ता भृत्यान् न शाधि हि || २-१०५-१०_END
BEGIN_
"As a tree planted by a man may grow and with its great branches and immense trunk,
become inaccessible to a dwarf, yet though it may come to flowering, does not bear fruit, it yeilds
no pleasure for him. O, mighty armed! You ought to understand the import of theis simile and being
the distinguished Lord of all, may you guide us, your sevants!"_END

B_2_C_105_8
BEGIN_
श्रेणयः त्वाम् महा राज पश्यन्तु अग्र्याः च सर्वशः |
प्रतपन्तम् इव आदित्यम् राज्ये स्थितम् अरिम् दमम् || २-१०५-११_END
BEGIN_
"O, emperor, the conqueror of foes! May all behold you, shining resplendent on all
sides like the sun, seated on the throne!"_END

B_2_C_105_9
BEGIN_
तव अनुयाने काकुत्ष्थ मत्ता नर्दन्तु कुञ्जराः |
अन्तः पुर गता नार्यो नन्दन्तु सुसमाहिताः || २-१०५-१२_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! May the elephants, intoxicated with ichor be heard trumpeting on the
highway, when you do return and the women of the inner apartments rejoice, all happily joined
together."_END

B_2_C_105_10
BEGIN_
तस्य साधु इत्य् अमन्यन्त नागरा विविधा जनाः |
भरतस्य वचः श्रुत्वा रामम् प्रत्यनुयाचतः || २-१०५-१३_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Bharata, who was thus appealing to Rama, the various people of
the city in approbation, said "Excellent! Well said!"_END

B_2_C_105_11
BEGIN_
तम् एवम् दुह्खितम् प्रेक्ष्य विलपन्तम् यशस्विनम् |
रामः कृत आत्मा भरतम् समाश्वासयद् आत्मवान् || २-१०५-१४_END
BEGIN_
On seeing the illustrious and sorrowful Bharata thus lamenting, the prudent and
self-conposed Rama began to console him as follows:_END

B_2_C_105_12
BEGIN_
न आत्मनः काम कारो अस्ति पुरुषो अयम् अनीश्वरः |
इतः च इतरतः च एनम् कृत अन्तः परिकर्षति || २-१०५-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Man is not able to do what he wills. He is not the Master A fixed form or name
drives him hither and thither."_END

B_2_C_105_13
BEGIN_
सर्वे क्षय अन्ता निचयाः पतन अन्ताः समुग्च्छ्रयाः |
सम्योगा विप्रयोग अन्ता मरण अन्तम् च जीवितम् || २-१०५-१६_END
BEGIN_
"All that is piled up, is finally disbursed. What rises, ends in a fall. Unio ends
in separation. Life ends in death."_END

B_2_C_105_14
BEGIN_
यथा फलानम् पक्वानाम् न अन्यत्र पतनाद् भयम् |
एवम् नरस्य जातस्य न अन्यत्र मरणाद् भयम् || २-१०५-१७_END
BEGIN_
"How a ripe fruit does not fear for anything other than its falling, so also a man
once born, does not fear for anything other than his death."_END

B_2_C_105_15
BEGIN_
यथा अगारम् दृढ स्थूणम् जीर्णम् भूत्वा अवसीदति |
तथा अवसीदन्ति नरा जरा मृत्यु वशम् गताः || २-१०५-१८_END
BEGIN_
"As a house that is solidly contructed ultimately falls into decay, human being too
is subject to age and death."_END

B_2_C_105_16
BEGIN_
अत्येति रजनी या तु सा न प्रतिनिवर्तते |
यात्येव यमुना पूर्णा समुद्रमुदकाकुलम् || २-१०५-१९_END
BEGIN_
"The night that has passed, does not return and the buntiful River Yamuna just
marches on towards the all-sufficient abounding in water."_END

B_2_C_105_17
BEGIN_
अहो रात्राणि गग्च्छन्ति सर्वेषाम् प्राणिनाम् इह |
आयूम्षि क्षपयन्त्य् आशु ग्रीष्मे जलम् इव अंशवः || २-१०५-२०_END
BEGIN_
"The pasing days and nights in this world quickly decrease the life-span of all
living being as in the summer, the rays of the sun dry up the water (in a pool)."_END

B_2_C_105_18
BEGIN_
आत्मानम् अनुशोच त्वम् किम् अन्यम् अनुशोचसि |
आयुः ते हीयते यस्य स्थितस्य च गतस्य च || २-१०५-२१_END
BEGIN_
"You grieve for yourself. Why do you grieve for another? Even while you stay at
home, or departed to another place, your life-span gets shortened."_END

B_2_C_105_19
BEGIN_
सह एव मृत्युर् व्रजति सह मृत्युर् निषीदति |
गत्वा सुदीर्घम् अध्वानम् सह मृत्युर् निवर्तते || २-१०५-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Death walks just with us (as we walk) and sits with us (as we sit). Having
travelled a very long distance (with us), death returns along with us (as we return)."_END

B_2_C_105_20
BEGIN_
गात्रेषु वलयः प्राप्ताः श्वेताः चैव शिरो रुहाः |
जरया पुरुषो जीर्णः किम् हि कृत्वा प्रभावयेत् || २-१०५-२३_END
BEGIN_
"When folds have appeared on limbs and hair have turned grey; on what expedient can
a man having got decayed with age, come back to the original splendour?"_END

B_2_C_105_21
BEGIN_
नन्दन्त्य् उदित आदित्ये नन्दन्त्य् अस्तम् इते रवौ |
आत्मनो न अवबुध्यन्ते मनुष्या जीवित क्षयम् || २-१०५-२४_END
BEGIN_
"People are deligted when the sun has risen and also when the day ends. But they are
not able to perceive the waning in their life-span."_END

B_2_C_105_22
BEGIN_
हृष्यन्त्य् ऋतु मुखम् दृष्ट्वा नवम् नवम् इह आगतम् |
ऋतूनाम् परिवर्तेन प्राणिनाम् प्राण सम्क्षयः || २-१०५-२५_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing the onset of season, people rejoice, as though it has come something newly.
But the succession of the seasons devours the life of being."_END

B_2_C_105_23
BEGIN_
यथा काष्ठम् च काष्ठम् च समेयाताम् महा अर्णवे |
समेत्य च व्यपेयाताम् कालम् आसाद्य कंचन || २-१०५-२६
एवम् भार्याः च पुत्राः च ज्नातयः च वसूनि च |
समेत्य व्यवधावन्ति ध्रुवो ह्य् एषाम् विना भवः || २-१०५-२७_END
BEGIN_
"As pieces of drift-wood floating on the ocean coe toghether for a span, so wives,
children, kinsmen wealth and property come together for a while and part with us. Their parting in
deed inevitable."_END

B_2_C_105_24
BEGIN_
न अत्र कश्चिद् यथा भावम् प्राणी समभिवर्तते |
तेन तस्मिन् न सामर्थ्यम् प्रेतस्य अस्त्य् अनुशोचतः || २-१०५-२८_END
BEGIN_
"Here, no being can escape its destiny ( in the form of birth and death). For that
reason, the power to avert his own death does not ingrain in a man mourning for a dead person."_END

B_2_C_105_25
BEGIN_
यथा हि सार्थम् गग्च्छन्तम् ब्रूयात् कश्चित् पथि स्थितः |
अहम् अप्य् आगमिष्यामि पृष्ठतो भवताम् इति || २-१०५-२९
एवम् पूर्वैर् गतो मार्गः पितृ पैतामहो ध्रुवः |
तम् आपन्नः कथम् शोचेद् यस्य न अस्ति व्यतिक्रमः || २-१०५-३०_END
BEGIN_
"As a caravan is passing on a road, one stationed at the way-side says, I too will
come behind you. In the same manner, we should inevitably follow the path taken by fathers and fire
fathers. Why a man who obtained that path, for which there is no return, distress himself._END

B_2_C_105_26
BEGIN_
वयसः पतमानस्य स्रोतसो वा अनिवर्तिनः |
आत्मा सुखे नियोक्तव्यः सुख भाजः प्रजाः स्मृताः || २-१०५-३१_END
BEGIN_
"While the age reshes on, without any return like a flowing river, one's self should
be emplyoed in a pursuit leading to blessedness. It is said that beings are meant to be happy?"_END

B_2_C_105_27
BEGIN_
धर्म आत्मा स शुभैः कृत्स्नैः क्रतुभिः च आप्त दक्षिणैः |
धूत पापो गतः स्वर्गम् पिता नः पृथिवी पतिः || २-१०५-३२_END
BEGIN_
"The king Dasaratha, our pious minded father performed almost all auspicious
sacrifices and paid plentiful sacrificial fees (to the officitaing preists and Brahmins) and went
to heaven."_END

B_2_C_105_28
BEGIN_
भृत्यानाम् भरणात् सम्यक् प्रजानाम् परिपालनात् |
अर्थ आदानाच् च धार्मेण पिता नः त्रिदिवम् गतः || २-१०५-३३_END
BEGIN_
"Our father reached heaven because he maintained his servants properly, protected
his subjects and realised the taxes in the manner prescribed by scriptures from them."_END

B_2_C_105_29
BEGIN_
कर्मभिस्तु शुभैरिष्टैः क्रतुभिश्चाव्तदक्षिणः |
स्वर्गं दशरथः प्राप्तः पिता नः पृथिवीपतिः || २-१०५-३४_END
BEGIN_
"Our father, the king Dasaratha obtained heaven because of his auspicious acts and
perfoming sacrifices involving heavy sacrificial fees."_END

B_2_C_105_30
BEGIN_
इष्ट्वा बहुविधैर् यज्नैर् भोगामः च अवाप्य पुष्कलान् |
उत्तमम् च आयुर् आसाद्य स्वर् गतः पृथिवी पतिः || २-१०५-३५_END
BEGIN_
"Having perfomed many types of sacrifices, enjoying worldly pleasure abundantly and
having obtained a long and virtuous life, king Dasaratha reached heaven."_END

B_2_C_105_31
BEGIN_
आयुरुत्तममासाद्य भोगानपि च राघवः |
स न शोच्यः पिता तात स्वर्गतः सत्कृतः सताम् || २-१०५-३६_END
BEGIN_
"O, dear brother! King Dasaratha, our father who was treated with respect by all
virtuous men and who secured excellent life-span and enjoyments, is not to be pitied."_END

B_2_C_105_32
BEGIN_
स जीर्णम् मानुषम् देहम् परित्यज्य पिता हि नः |
दैवीम् ऋद्धिम् अनुप्राप्तो ब्रह्म लोक विहारिणीम् || २-१०५-३७_END
BEGIN_
"King Dasaratha, our father, having abandoned his worn-out human body, indeed has
attained the celstial state, by which he can stroll in the realm of Brahma (the highest
heaven)._END

B_2_C_105_33
BEGIN_
तम् तु न एवम् विधः कश्चित् प्राज्नः शोचितुम् अर्हति |
त्वद् विधो यद् विधः च अपि श्रुतवान् बुद्धिमत्तरः || २-१०५-३८_END
BEGIN_
"No wise, learned and exceptionally clever man, would weep in such a manner, such as
I and you, about the emperor._END

B_2_C_105_34
BEGIN_
एते बहु विधाः शोका विलाप रुदिते तथा |
वर्जनीया हि धीरेण सर्व अवस्थासु धीमता || २-१०५-३९_END
BEGIN_
"The wise, who are steadfast, should indeed relinquish these sorrows, lamentatious,
weepings and such other states of misery."_END

B_2_C_105_35
BEGIN_
स स्वस्थो भव मा शोचो यात्वा च आवस ताम् पुरीम् |
तथा पित्रा नियुक्तो असि वशिना वदतामु वर || २-१०५-४०_END
BEGIN_
"Be composed, O Most eloquent of orators! Control your grief, return to the City of
Ayodhya in order to obey the command of our father, the subduer of his senses."_END

B_2_C_105_36
BEGIN_
यत्र अहम् अपि तेन एव नियुक्तः पुण्य कर्मणा |
तत्र एव अहम् करिष्यामि पितुर् आर्यस्य शासनम् || २-१०५-४१_END
BEGIN_
"I also will fulfil the command of our father, the venrable man in that very place,
whre I have been ordered to stay by that king Dasaratha of virtuous deeds."_END

B_2_C_105_37
BEGIN_
न मया शासनम् तस्य त्यक्तुम् न्याय्यम् अरिम् दम |
तत् त्वया अपि सदा मान्यम् स वै बन्धुः स नः पिता || २-१०५-४२_END
BEGIN_
"O Bharata the Vanquisher of Foes! It is not justifiable for me to violate the
command of our father. You also must honour it to the end, for it comes from our father, out own
blood."_END

B_2_C_105_38
BEGIN_
तद्वचः पितुरेवाहं सम्मतम् धर्मचारिणः |
कर्मणा पालयिष्यामि वनवासेन राघव || २-१०५-४३_END
BEGIN_
"O, Bharata! Hence, I shall conform to the honourable word of our father, the
practiser of virtue, by my act of dwelling in the forest."_END

B_2_C_105_39
BEGIN_
धार्मिकेणानृशंसेन नरेण गुरुवर्तिना |
भवितव्यं नरव्याघ्रम् परलोकं जिगीषता २-१०५-४४_END
BEGIN_
O, Tigher among men! Thus should a pious man act, who seeks to harm none, who is
obedient to his elders and who aspires to conquer the higher world."_END

B_2_C_105_40
BEGIN_
आत्मानमनुतिष्ठ त्वं स्वभावेन नरर्षभ |
निशाम्य तु शुभं वृत्तं पितुर्दशरथस्य नः २-१०५-४५_END
BEGIN_
"O, excellent among men! perceiving the virutous conduct of our father, the King
Dasaratha, act in conformity to your own nature."_END

B_2_C_105_41
BEGIN_
इत्येवमुक्त्वा वचनम् महात्मा|
पितुर्निदेशप्रतिपालनार्थम् |
युवीयसम् भ्रातरमर्थवच्च |
प्रभुर्मुहूर्ताद्विरराम रामः || २-१०५-४६_END
BEGIN_
Having uttered in about an hour, these meaningful words in this manner to his
younger brother on the need of abedience to his father's will, the magnamous and the mighty Rama
became silent._END

B_2_C_106_0
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्त्वा तु विरते रामे वचनम् अर्थवत् |
ततो मन्दाकिनीतीरे रामम् प्रकृतिवत्सलम् || २-१०६-१
उवाच भरतः चित्रम् धार्मिको धार्मिकम् वचः |_END
BEGIN_
When Rama thus kept silent after uttering those meaningful words as aforesaid, the
pious Bharata for his part addressed to virtuous Rama who was fond of people conformable to justice
at the banks of that River Mandakini._END

B_2_C_106_1
BEGIN_
को हि स्याद् ईदृशो लोके यादृशः त्वम् अरिम् दम || २-१०६-२
न त्वाम् प्रव्यथयेद् दुह्खम् प्रीतिर् वा न प्रहर्षयेत् |
सम्मतः च असि वृद्धानाम् तामः च पृग्च्छसि संशयान् || २-१०६-३_END
BEGIN_
"Who, in this world, is endowed with such qualities like you, O annihilator of
enemies! Neither does sorrow disturb you nor does joy enrapture you. You are highly honoured by
elders and you clarify your doubts from them._END

B_2_C_106_2
BEGIN_
यथा मृतः तथा जीवन् यथा असति तथा सति |
यस्य एष बुध्दि लाभः स्यात् परितप्येत केन सः || २-१०६-४_END
BEGIN_
"By what should he be moved, who looks on life and death, misfortune or prosperity
with an equal eye?"_END

B_2_C_106_3
BEGIN_
परावरज्ञो यश्च स्यात् यथा त्वं मनुजाधिप |
स एवम् व्यसनम् प्राप्य न विषीदितुम् अर्हति || २-१०६-५_END
BEGIN_
"O, King! He who knows the totality of time as you do, ought not to feel despondent
even on meeting with adversity."_END

B_2_C_106_4
BEGIN_
अमर उपम सत्त्वः त्वम् महात्मा सत्य सम्गरः |
सर्वज्नः सर्व दर्शी च बुद्धिमामः च असि राघव || २-१०६-६_END
BEGIN_
"O, the magnanimous Rama! you are equally strong as celestials. You are true to your
promise, all-knowing, all-viewing and endowed with understanding."_END

B_2_C_106_5
BEGIN_
न त्वाम् एवम् गुणैर् युक्तम् प्रभव अभव कोविदम् |
अविषह्यतमम् दुह्खम् आसादयितुम् अर्हति || २-१०६-७_END
BEGIN_
"Even the most fearful calamity ought not to attack you, endowed as you are, with
such attributes; and recognising the birth and end of all beings."_END

B_2_C_106_6
BEGIN_
प्रोषिते मयि यत् पापम् मात्रा मत् कारणात् कृतम् |
क्षुद्रया तद् अनिष्टम् मे प्रसीदतु भवान् मम || २-१०६-८_END
BEGIN_
"The sinful deed, committed by my mean mother for my sake during my absence, was not
to my liking. (Hence) be gracious to me."_END

B_2_C_106_7
BEGIN_
धर्म बन्धेन बद्धो अस्मि तेन इमाम् न इह मातरम् |
हन्मि तीव्रेण दण्डेन दण्ड अर्हाम् पाप कारिणीम् || २-१०६-९_END
BEGIN_
"I am bound by the chanins of morality. For that reason, I do not kill iwth a severe
punishment, my mother who was of perverse conduct and worthy of retribution."_END

B_2_C_106_8
BEGIN_
कथम् दशरथाज् जातः शुद्ध अभिजन कर्मणः |
जानन् धर्मम् अधर्मिष्ठम् कुर्याम् कर्म जुगुप्सितम् || २-१०६-१०_END
BEGIN_
"How can I, born of Dasaratha of noble birth and deeds and conversant of right and
wrong, do the most wicked and horrible act?"_END

B_2_C_106_9
BEGIN_
गुरुः क्रियावान् वृद्धः च राजा प्रेतः पिता इति च |
तातम् न परिगर्हेयम् दैवतम् च इति संसदि || २-१०६-११_END
BEGIN_
"The King Dasaratha was my preceptor, had several sacrificial performances to his
credit was aged, was my father, equal to a deity and is now dead. Hence, I cannot reproach him in
an open assembly."_END

B_2_C_106_10
BEGIN_
को हि धर्म अर्थयोर् हीनम् ईदृशम् कर्म किल्बिषम् |
स्त्रियाः प्रिय चिकीर्षुः सन् कुर्याद् धर्मज्न धर्मवित् || २-१०६-१२_END
BEGIN_
"O Rama the knower of piety! What man who knows the principles of righteousness,
would commit such an improper act, bereft of one's interest and duty, in order just to please a
woman?"_END

B_2_C_106_11
BEGIN_
अन्त काले हि भूतानि मुह्यन्ति इति पुरा श्रुतिः |
राज्ना एवम् कुर्वता लोके प्रत्यक्षा सा श्रुतिः कृता || २-१०६-१३_END
BEGIN_
"There is an ancient saying that at the time of death, beings lose their judgment.
The king, acting as he did, has made this saying indeed true in the eyes of the world."_END

B_2_C_106_12
BEGIN_
साधु अर्थम् अभिसंधाय क्रोधान् मोहाच् च साहसात् |
तातस्य यद् अतिक्रान्तम् प्रत्याहरतु तद् भवान् || २-१०६-१४_END
BEGIN_
"This transgression of righteousness was done by our father for fear of anger (of
kaikeyi) or through infatuation and over-haste. You do keep in view a noble purpose and reverse
that transgression."_END

B_2_C_106_13
BEGIN_
पितुर् हि समतिक्रान्तम् पुत्रो यः साधु मन्यते |
तद् अपत्यम् मतम् लोके विपरीतम् अतो अन्यथा || २-१०६-१५_END
BEGIN_
"A son who honours only a good deviation (from righteousness) of a father is
accepted as a real son in this world. He who acts otherwise than this would be facing a quite
reverse situation."_END

B_2_C_106_14
BEGIN_
तद् अपत्यम् भवान् अस्तु मा भवान् दुष्कृतम् पितुः |
अभिपत् तत् कृतम् कर्म लोके धीर विगर्हितम् || २-१०६-१६_END
BEGIN_
"You be that real son. Do not lend yourself to the infamous act, committed by our
father, which in this world, confident men freely condemn."_END

B_2_C_106_15
BEGIN_
कैकेयीम् माम् च तातम् च सुहृदो बान्धवामः च नः |
पौर जानपदान् सर्वामः त्रातु सर्वम् इदम् भवान् || २-१०६-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Save Kaikeyi and me, our father, our friends, our relatives, all the urbanites and
the villagers as well as the entire kingdom."_END

B_2_C_106_16
BEGIN_
क्व च अरण्यम् क्व च क्षात्रम् क्व जटाः क्व च पालनम् |
ईदृशम् व्याहतम् कर्म न भवान् कर्तुम् अर्हति || २-१०६-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Where is the forest and where is the princely dignity? Where is the matted hair and
where is the protection of a kingdom? You ought not to do such a contradictory act."_END

B_2_C_106_17
BEGIN_
एष हि प्रथमो धर्मः क्षत्रियस्याभिषेचनम् |
येन शक्यम् महाप्राज्ञ् प्रजानां परिपालनम् २-१०६-१९_END
BEGIN_
"O, the highly enlightened hero! The first duty of a warrior is indeed to get
crowned, so that he may then protect his subjects."_END

B_2_C_106_18
BEGIN_
कश्च प्रत्यक्षमुत्सृज्य संशयस्थमलक्षणम् |
आयतिस्थं चरेद्धर्मम् क्षत्रबन्धुरनिश्चितम् २-१०६-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Which man of warrior-caste would set aside his manifest duty and prctise a virtue
that gives doubtful result, which does not promise happiness, which has a mental restraint and
which is uncertain?"_END

B_2_C_106_19
BEGIN_
अथ क्लेशजम् एव त्वम् धर्मम् चरितुम् इग्च्छसि |
धर्मेण चतुरो वर्णान् पालयन् क्लेशम् आप्नुहि || २-१०६-२१_END
BEGIN_
"If you desire to pursue a virtue alone; although born of pain, then take pains
while protecting the four castes as per tradition, by recourse to righteousness."_END

B_2_C_106_20
BEGIN_
चतुर्णाम् आश्रमाणाम् हि गार्हस्थ्यम् श्रेष्ठम् आश्रमम् |
पाहुर् धर्मज्न धर्मज्नाः तम् कथम् त्यक्तुम् अर्हसि || २-१०६-२२_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama the knower of righteousness! The knower of what is right indeed tell that
the life of a house-holder is the noblest of all the four* stages of life. How can you abandon
it?"_END

B_2_C_106_21
BEGIN_
श्रुतेन बालः स्थानेन जन्मना भवतो ह्य् अहम् |
स कथम् पालयिष्यामि भूमिम् भवति तिष्ठति || २-१०६-२३_END
BEGIN_
"I am indeed junior to you in the point of learning, situation and by birth. How
should I rule the earth, while still you are living?"_END

B_2_C_106_22
BEGIN_
हीन बुद्धि गुणो बालो हीनः स्थानेन च अप्य् अहम् |
भवता च विना भूतो न वर्तयितुम् उत्सहे || २-१०६-२४_END
BEGIN_
"I, a mere child, who am devoted of intelligence and virtues besides placed in an
inferior position, cannot even live without you."_END

B_2_C_106_23
BEGIN_
इदम् निखिलम् अव्यग्रम् पित्र्यम् राज्यम् अकण्टकम् |
अनुशाधि स्वधर्मेण धर्मज्न सह बान्धवैः || २-१०६-२५_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama the knower of righteousness! Rule this entire kingdom belonging to your
father, without distraction, without hindrance and as per the conduct prescribed for you along with
your relatives."_END

B_2_C_106_24
BEGIN_
इह एव त्वा अभिषिन्चन्तु धर्मज्न सह बान्धवैः |
ऋत्विजः सवसिष्ठाः च मन्त्रवन् मन्त्र कोविदाः || २-१०६-२६_END
BEGIN_
"Let all the king's ministers along with Vasishta and other priests well-versed in
sacred formulas, crown you, the knower of sacred texts, here itself."_END

B_2_C_106_25
BEGIN_
अभिषिक्तः त्वम् अस्माभिर् अयोध्याम् पालने व्रज |
विजित्य तरसा लोकान् मरुद्भिर् इव वासवः || २-१०६-२७_END
BEGIN_
"You, having been crowned thus, may proceed to Ayodhya along with us to rule it,
like Indra the Lord of celestials, having conquered all the worlds with his might, proceeds to his
kingdom along with celestials."_END

B_2_C_106_26
BEGIN_
ऋणानि त्रीण्य् अपाकुर्वन् दुर्हृदः साधु निर्दहन् |
सुहृदः तर्पयन् कामैः त्वम् एव अत्र अनुशाधि माम् || २-१०६-२८_END
BEGIN_
"You shall discharge the three obligations subdue all the enemies, gratify the
wishes of all your friends and you alone rule me in Ayodhya."_END

B_2_C_106_27
BEGIN_
अद्य आर्य मुदिताः सन्तु सुहृदः ते अभिषेचने |
अद्य भीताः पालयन्ताम् दुर्हृदः ते दिशो दश || २-१०६-२९_END
BEGIN_
"O, noble brother! May your friends rejoice today at your enthronement. May your
enemies, full of terror, flee today to the ten quarters."_END

B_2_C_106_28
BEGIN_
आक्रोशम् मम मातुः च प्रमृज्य पुरुष ऋषभ |
अद्य तत्र भवन्तम् च पितरम् रक्ष किल्बिषात् || २-१०६-३०_END
BEGIN_
"O, excellent among men! Wipe off my mother's curse today and protect our venerable
father from his sin."_END

B_2_C_106_29
BEGIN_
शिरसा त्वा अभियाचे अहम् कुरुष्व करुणाम् मयि |
बान्धवेषु च सर्वेषु भूतेषु इव महा ईश्वरः || २-१०६-३१_END
BEGIN_
"I request you by bowing my head before you. Show compassion on me and on all our
relatives as Lord Shiva ( the Supreme Deity) on all beings."_END

B_2_C_106_30
BEGIN_
अथ वा पृष्ठतः कृत्वा वनम् एव भवान् इतः |
गमिष्यति गमिष्यामि भवता सार्धम् अप्य् अहम् || २-१०६-३२_END
BEGIN_
"Else if you disregard my entire request and move again into the forest form here, I
too will go along with you."_END

B_2_C_106_31
BEGIN_
तथापि रामो भरतेन ताम्यत |
प्रसाद्यमानः शिरसा मही पतिः |
न चैव चक्रे गमनाय सत्त्ववान् |
मतिम् पितुः तद् वचने प्रतिष्ठितः || २-१०६-३३_END
BEGIN_
Even while being propitiated by Bharata as above, by bowing his head duly sinking in
his spirit, the illustrious Rama, the Lord of the earth was still abiding in the words of his
father and did not feel inclined to return to Ayodhya._END

B_2_C_106_32
BEGIN_
तद् अद्भुतम् स्थैर्यम् अवेक्ष्य राघवे |
समम् जनो हर्षम् अवाप दुह्खितः |
न यात्य् अयोध्याम् इति दुह्खितो अभवत् |
स्थिर प्रतिज्नत्वम् अवेक्ष्य हर्षितः || २-१०६-३४_END
BEGIN_
Seeing that wonderful staunchness in Rama, the people of Ayodhya felt sorrowful and
at the same time, experienced joy. They became distressed that he was not going to Ayodhya and felt
rejoiced to see his firmness of resolve._END

B_2_C_106_33
BEGIN_
तम् ऋत्विजो नैगम यूथ वल्लभाः |
तथा विसम्ज्ना अश्रु कलाः च मातरः |तथा ब्रुवाणम् भरतम् प्रतुष्टुवुः |
प्रणम्य रामम् च ययाचिरे सह || २-१०६-३५_END
BEGIN_
The priests, citizens and elders of that multitude as well as Queens, distracted and
weeping bitterly, acclaimed Bharat who was then speaking thus, duly prostrating himself before Rama
and added theri supplications to Rama._END

B_2_C_107_0
BEGIN_
पुनर् एवम् ब्रुवाणम् तु भरतम् लक्ष्मण अग्रजः |
प्रत्युवच ततः श्रीमान् ज्नाति मध्ये अतिसत्कृतः || २-१०७-१_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, the illustrious Rama, highly respected among his fraternity, (as
follows) to Bharata who was speaking as aforesaid among his relatives._END

B_2_C_107_1
BEGIN_
उपपन्नम् इदम् वाक्यम् यत् त्वम् एवम् अभाषथाः |
जातः पुत्रो दशरथात् कैकेय्याम् राज सत्तमात् || २-१०७-२_END
BEGIN_
"These words, which you have spoken are worthy of you, the son of Dasaratha the
excellent king, born through Kaikeyi."_END

B_2_C_107_2
BEGIN_
पुरा भ्रातः पिता नः स मातरम् ते समुद्वहन् |
मातामहे समाश्रौषीद् राज्य शुल्कम् अनुत्तमम् || २-१०७-३_END
BEGIN_
"O, My brother! Long ago, when our father married your mother, he promised your
maternal grandfather that he would confer his kingdom as an exceptional marriage-dowry"_END

B_2_C_107_3
BEGIN_
देव असुरे च सम्ग्रामे जनन्यै तव पार्थिवः |
सम्प्रहृष्टो ददौ राजा वरम् आराधितः प्रभुः || २-१०७-४_END
BEGIN_
"Thereafter, in a conflict between Gods and demons, your mother received the promise
of two boons from the efficient lord of the earth, King Dasartha, as a token of his joy and
gratitude."_END

B_2_C_107_4
BEGIN_
ततः सा सम्प्रतिश्राव्य तव माता यशस्विनी |
अयाचत नर श्रेष्ठम् द्वौ वरौ वर वर्णिनी || २-१०७-५
तव राज्यम् नर व्याघ्र मम प्रव्राजनम् तथा |
तच् च राजा तथा तस्यै नियुक्तः प्रददौ वरौ || २-१०७-६_END
BEGIN_
"O, Tiger among men! Your illustrious mother of beautiful complexion consequently
demanded these two boons from that cheif of men, for you the throne and for me the exile to the
forest."_END

B_2_C_107_5
BEGIN_
तेन पित्रा अहम् अप्य् अत्र नियुक्तः पुरुष ऋषभ |
चतुर्दश वने वासम् वर्षाणि वरदानिकम् || २-१०७-७_END
BEGIN_
"O, excellent among men! I too, have been enjoined by our aforesaid father to live
here in the forest for fourteen years, in accord iwth granting of boon."_END

B_2_C_107_6
BEGIN_
सो अहम् वनम् इदम् प्राप्तो निर्जनम् लक्ष्मण अन्वितः |
शीतया च अप्रतिद्वन्द्वः सत्य वादे स्थितः पितुः || २-१०७-८_END
BEGIN_
"I as such, without any rival, have come to this lonely forest accompanied by
Lakshmana and Seetha in order to carry out the promise given by our father."_END

B_2_C_107_7
BEGIN_
भवान् अपि तथा इत्य् एव पितरम् सत्य वादिनम् |
कर्तुम् अर्हति राज इन्द्रम् क्षिप्रम् एव अभिषेचनात् || २-१०७-९_END
BEGIN_
"You too ought, likewise, to make our father, as a person having given a true
promise, O Indra (the Lord of Celestials) among kings, by getting yourself anointed to the crown
without any delay._END

B_2_C_107_8
BEGIN_
ऋणान् मोचय राजानम् मत् कृते भरत प्रभुम् |
पितरम् त्राहि धर्मज्न मातरम् च अभिनन्दय || २-१०७-१०_END
BEGIN_
"O, Bharata! For my sake relieve the mighty king from his vow and make both our
mother and fahter happy."_END

B_2_C_107_9
BEGIN_
श्रूयते हि पुरा तात श्रुतिर् गीता यशस्विनी |
गयेन यजमानेन गयेषु एव पितृऋन् प्रति || २-१०७-११_END
BEGIN_
"My dear brother! Formerly, an illustrious king named Gaya, while perfoming a
sacrifice in a place called Gaya in honour of his ancestors, chanted the following verse:_END

B_2_C_107_10
BEGIN_
पुम् नाम्ना नरकाद् यस्मात् पितरम् त्रायते सुतः |
तस्मात् पुत्र इति प्रोक्तः पितृऋन् यत् पाति वा सुतः || २-१०७-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Since a son delivers his father from a place of torment (hell) called 'Put', he is
named as 'Putra'- 'he who delivers his ancestors from all dangers'"_END

B_2_C_107_11
BEGIN_
एष्टव्या बहवः पुत्रा गुणवन्तो बहु श्रुताः |
तेषाम् वै समवेतानाम् अपि कश्चिद् गयाम् व्रजेत् || २-१०७-१३_END
BEGIN_
"To have many virtuous and learned sons is to be desired, since one, atleast among
them, who is intimately connected will ocme to Gaya to perform a sacrifice."_END

B_2_C_107_12
BEGIN_
एवम् राज ऋषयः सर्वे प्रतीता राज नन्दन |
तस्मात् त्राहि नर श्रेष्ठ पितरम् नरकात् प्रभो || २-१०७-१४_END
BEGIN_
"O, prince! This is the conviction of all the royal sages. O, the efficient and the
excellent of men! Therefore, save our father from hell._END

B_2_C_107_13
BEGIN_
अयोध्याम् गग्च्छ भरत प्रकृतीर् अनुरन्जय |
शत्रुघ्न सहितो वीर सह सर्वैर् द्विजातिभिः || २-१०७-१५_END
BEGIN_
"O, the valiant Bharata! Go to Ayodhya along with Shatrughna and all the Brahmanas
and give joy to the people there."_END

B_2_C_107_14
BEGIN_
प्रवेक्ष्ये दण्डक अरण्यम् अहम् अप्य् अविलम्बयन् |
आभ्याम् तु सहितो राजन् वैदेह्या लक्ष्मणेन च || २-१०७-१६_END
BEGIN_
"O, King! I too, without delay, will proceed to Dandaka forest along with Seetha and
Lakshaman."_END

B_2_C_107_15
BEGIN_
त्वम् राजा भव भरत स्वयम् नराणाम् |
वन्यानाम् अहम् अपि राज राण् मृगाणाम् |
गग्च्छ त्वम् पुर वरम् अद्य सम्प्रहृष्टः |
सम्हृष्टः तु अहम् अपि दण्डकान् प्रवेक्ष्ये || २-१०७-१७_END
BEGIN_
"O, Bharata! You become the Lord of men. I will become the emperor of the wild
beasts of the forest! Return now to the excellent city of Ayodhya full of joy and I also full of
joy will enter Dankada Forest!"_END

B_2_C_107_16
BEGIN_
चायाम् ते दिन कर भाः प्रबाधमानम् |
वर्षत्रम् भरत करोतु मूर्ध्नि शीताम् |
एतेषाम् अहम् अपि कानन द्रुमाणाम् |
चायाम् ताम् अतिशयिनीम् सुखम् श्रयिष्ये || २-१०७-१८_END
BEGIN_
"O, Bharata! Let the (royal) white umbrella provide a cool shadow for your head,
repulsing the rays of sunlight. I will take shelter comoftably under the abundant shadow of these
forest-trees."_END

B_2_C_107_17
BEGIN_
शत्रुघ्नः कुशल मतिः तु ते सहायः |
सौमित्रिर् मम विदितः प्रधान मित्रम् |
चत्वारः तनय वरा वयम् नर इन्द्रम् |
सत्यस्थम् भरत चराम मा विषादम् || २-१०७-१९_END
BEGIN_
"O, Bharata! The wise Shatrughna is helpful to you. Lakshmana is known to be an
outstanding friend for me. We, the four excellent sons, will ultimately make the king true to his
promise. Do not get disappointed."_END

B_2_C_108_0
BEGIN_
आश्वासयन्तम् भरतम् जाबालिर् ब्राह्मण उत्तमः |
उवाच रामम् धर्मज्नम् धर्म अपेतम् इदम् वचः || २-१०८-१_END
BEGIN_
A brahmana called Jabali spoke the following unrighteous words to Rama, who knew
righteousness and who was assuaging Bharata as aforesaid_END

B_2_C_108_1
BEGIN_
साधु राघव मा भूत् ते बुद्धिर् एवम् निरर्थका |
प्राकृतस्य नरस्य इव आर्य बुद्धेः तपस्विनः || २-१०८-२_END
BEGIN_
"Enough, O Rama! Let not your wisdom be rendered void like a common man, you who are
distinguished for your intelligence and virtue."_END

B_2_C_108_2
BEGIN_
कः कस्य पुरुषो बन्धुः किम् आप्यम् कस्य केनचित् |
यद् एको जायते जन्तुर् एक एव विनश्यति || २-१०८-३_END
BEGIN_
"Who is related to whom? What is there to be obtained by anything and by whom? Every
creature is born alone and dies alone."_END

B_2_C_108_3
BEGIN_
तस्मान् माता पिता च इति राम सज्जेत यो नरः |
उन्मत्त इव स ज्नेयो न अस्ति काचिद्द् हि कस्यचित् || २-१०८-४_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! He who clings to another, saying, 'This is my father, this is my mother,
he should be known as one who has lost his wits. There is none who belongs to another."_END

B_2_C_108_4
BEGIN_
यथा ग्राम अन्तरम् गग्च्छन् नरः कश्चिद् क्वचिद् वसेत् |
उत्सृज्य च तम् आवासम् प्रतिष्ठेत अपरे अहनि || २-१०८-५
एवम् एव मनुष्याणाम् पिता माता गृहम् वसु |
आवास मात्रम् काकुत्स्थ सज्जन्ते न अत्र सज्जनाः || २-१०८-६_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! As one who passes the a strange village spends the night the and the next
day leaves that place and continues his journey, so are mother, father, home and possessions to a
man; they are but a resting place. The wise do not become attached to them"._END

B_2_C_108_5
BEGIN_
पित्र्यम् राज्यम् समुत्सृज्य स न अर्हति नर उत्तम |
आस्थातुम् कापथम् दुह्खम् विषमम् बहु कण्टकम् || २-१०८-७_END
BEGIN_
"O, chief of men! You as such should not abandon your father's kingdom in order to
dwell in a lonely forest, that is excruciating hard to traverse and full of thorny thickets."_END

B_2_C_108_6
BEGIN_
समृद्धायाम् अयोध्यायाम् आत्मानम् अभिषेचय |
एक वेणी धरा हि त्वाम् नगरी सम्प्रतीक्षते || २-१०८-८_END
BEGIN_
"Get yourself crowned in the prosperous kingdom of Ayodhya. That city is waiting for
you, with your locks duly unfound."_END

B_2_C_108_7
BEGIN_
राज भोगान् अनुभवन् महा अर्हान् पार्थिव आत्मज |
विहर त्वम् अयोध्यायाम् यथा शक्रः त्रिविष्टपे || २-१०८-९_END
BEGIN_
"O, prince! Enjoy the royal luxuries worthy of you. Move around in Ayodhya as Indra
the Lord of celestials does in heaven!"_END

B_2_C_108_8
BEGIN_
न ते कश्चिद् दशरतहः त्वम् च तस्य न कश्चन |
अन्यो राजा त्वम् अन्यः च तस्मात् कुरु यद् उच्यते || २-१०८-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Dasaratha is none to you nor you in anyway to him. That king is another and your
are another. Hence, do what is told by me?"_END

B_2_C_108_9
BEGIN_
बीजमात्रम् पिता जन्तोः शुक्लं रुधिरमेव च |
संयुक्तमृतुमन्मात्रा पुरुषस्येह जन्म तत् || २-१०८-११_END
BEGIN_
"The father is only the seed of a being. The sperm and the ovum blend at the right
time in the mother's womb, so that a human being is born in this world."_END

B_2_C_108_10
BEGIN_
गतः स नृपतिः तत्र गन्तव्यम् यत्र तेन वै |
प्रवृत्तिर् एषा मर्त्यानाम् त्वम् तु मिथ्या विहन्यसे || २-१०८-१२_END
BEGIN_
"The king has gone, where he had to go. This is the fate of all being unnecessarily,
you are still frustrated over the matter."_END

B_2_C_108_11
BEGIN_
अर्थ धर्म परा ये ये तामः तान् शोचामि न इतरान् |
ते हि दुह्खम् इह प्राप्य विनाशम् प्रेत्य भेजिरे || २-१०८-१३_END
BEGIN_
"I pity all those whosoever, devoted to wealth and religious merit, not other (who
are devoted to sense-enjoyment), for, they, having undergone suffering in this life, have met with
extermination after death."_END

B_2_C_108_12
BEGIN_
अष्टका पितृ दैवत्यम् इत्य् अयम् प्रसृतो जनः |
अन्नस्य उपद्रवम् पश्य मृतो हि किम् अशिष्यति || २-१०८-१४_END
BEGIN_
"These people say, 'The eighth day should be given up to sacrifices for the spirits
of our ancestors.' See the waste of food. What will a dead man eat?"_END

B_2_C_108_13
BEGIN_
यदि भुक्तम् इह अन्येन देहम् अन्यस्य गग्च्छति |
दद्यात् प्रवसतः श्राद्धम् न तत् पथ्य् अशनम् भवेत् || २-१०८-१५_END
BEGIN_
"If food eaten by one here, reaches another's body, then let a sacrifice be offered
for those who are setting out on a distant journey. Will it not become a food on their path?"_END

B_2_C_108_14
BEGIN_
दान सम्वनना ह्य् एते ग्रन्था मेधाविभिः कृताः |
यजस्व देहि दीक्षस्व तपः तप्यस्व सम्त्यज || २-१०८-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Perform sacrifices, distribute gifts, consecrate yourselves, practise ansterity and
renunciation' - These writings are composed by learned men for the sake of inducing others to
give."_END

B_2_C_108_15
BEGIN_
स न अस्ति परम् इत्य् एव कुरु बुद्धिम् महा मते |
प्रत्यक्षम् यत् तद् आतिष्ठ परोक्षम् पृष्ठतः कुरु || २-१०८-१७_END
BEGIN_
"O, the highly wise! Arrive at a conclusion, therefore, that there is nothing beyond
this Universe. Give precedence to that which meets the eye and turn your back on what is beyond our
knowledge."_END

B_2_C_108_16
BEGIN_
सताम् बुद्धिम् पुरः कृत्य सर्व लोक निदर्शिनीम् |
राज्यम् त्वम् प्रतिगृह्णीष्व भरतेन प्रसादितः || २-१०८-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Honour the judgment of the wise and regarding that which is approved by all, accept
the kingdom as propitiated by Bharata."_END

B_2_C_109_0
BEGIN_
जाबालेः तु वचः श्रुत्वा रामः सत्य आत्मनाम् वरः |
उवाच परया युक्त्या स्व बुद्ध्या च अविपन्नया || २-१०९-१_END
BEGIN_
After hearing Jabali's words, Rama the best among virtuous and upright men spoke
with a great devotion and with an undisturbed mind of his own (as follows);_END

B_2_C_109_1
BEGIN_
भवान् मे प्रिय काम अर्थम् वचनम् यद् इह उक्तवान् |
अकार्यम् कार्य सम्काशम् अपथ्यम् पथ्य सम्मितम् || २-१०९-२_END
BEGIN_
"That which, in your desire to please me, you have counselled, is impossible though
it appears to be possible. It is like a forbidden food, appearing to be an agreeable one."_END

B_2_C_109_2
BEGIN_
निर्मर्यादः तु पुरुषः पाप आचार समन्वितः |
मानम् न लभते सत्सु भिन्न चारित्र दर्शनः || २-१०९-३_END
BEGIN_
"He who is unruly, fully invested with ill-conduct, having a bad reputation and
seeing differences in everything, does not gain respect from honest men."_END

B_2_C_109_3
BEGIN_
कुलीनम् अकुलीनम् वा वीरम् पुरुष मानिनम् |
चारित्रम् एव व्याख्याति शुचिम् वा यदि वा अशुचिम् || २-१०९-४_END
BEGIN_
"One's conduct itself explains whether one belongs to a good family or a bad family,
valiant or arrogant and chaste or unchaste."_END

B_2_C_109_4
BEGIN_
अनारयः तु आर्य सम्काशः शौचाद्द् हीनः तथा शुचिः |
लक्षण्यवद् अलक्षण्यो दुह्शीलः शीलवान् इव || २-१०९-५
अधर्मम् धर्म वेषेण यदि इमम् लोक सम्करम् |
अभिपत्स्ये शुभम् हित्वा क्रिया विधि विवर्जितम् || २-१०९-६
कः चेतयानः पुरुषः कार्य अकार्य विचक्षणः |
बहु मंस्यति माम् लोके दुर्वृत्तम् लोक दूषणम् || २-१०९-७_END
BEGIN_
"What sensible man, able to discern what is just and what is unjust, in this world,
would respect me, if I am ignoble resembling as noble, bereft of honesty, impure, having no good
qualities but appearing like the one having good qualities, ill-behaved but appearing as
well-behaved abandoning righteousness and getting hold of unrighteousness in the guise of piety,
creating confusion in the world and disregarding rules of conduct."_END

B_2_C_109_5
BEGIN_
कस्य यास्याम्य् अहम् वृत्तम् केन वा स्वर्गम् आप्नुयाम् |
अनया वर्तमानो अहम् वृत्त्या हीन प्रतिज्नया || २-१०९-८_END
BEGIN_
"If I behave in this manner faithlessly, to whom can I advise a prescribed conduct?
How would I attain heaven?"_END

B_2_C_109_6
BEGIN_
काम वृत्तः तु अयम् लोकः कृत्स्नः समुपवर्तते |
यद् वृत्ताः सन्ति राजानः तद् वृत्ताः सन्ति हि प्रजाः || २-१०९-९_END
BEGIN_
"This entire world would follow its own whims, for, whatever the conduct of the
kings may be, such will be the coduct of their subjects."_END

B_2_C_109_7
BEGIN_
सत्यम् एव आनृशंस्यम् च राज वृत्तम् सनातनम् |
तस्मात् सत्य आत्मकम् राज्यम् सत्ये लोकः प्रतिष्ठितः || २-१०९-१०_END
BEGIN_
"The eternal royal governance is indeed an assemble of truth and not cruel. Hence,
the kingship has the Truth as its essence. The world is established in Truth."_END

B_2_C_109_8
BEGIN_
ऋषयः चैव देवाः च सत्यम् एव हि मेनिरे |
सत्य वादी हि लोके अस्मिन् परमम् गग्च्छति क्षयम् || २-१०९-११_END
BEGIN_
"Even sages and divine being have respected truthfulness alone. The one who speaks
truth obtains the highest position in this world."_END

B_2_C_109_9
BEGIN_
उद्विजन्ते यथा सर्पान् नराद् अनृत वादिनः |
धर्मः सत्यम् परो लोके मूलम् स्वर्गस्य च उच्यते || २-१०९-१२_END
BEGIN_
"People fear of a person, who speaks untruth, as one fears a snake. Truth is the
highest virtue and is stated to be the origin of heaven."_END

B_2_C_109_10
BEGIN_
सत्यम् एव ईश्वरो लोके सत्यम् पद्मा समाश्रिता |
सत्य मूलानि सर्वाणि सत्यान् न अस्ति परम् पदम् || २-१०९-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Truth is god and all virtues follow truth. All are rooted in truth there is nothing
higher than truth."_END

B_2_C_109_11
BEGIN_
दत्तम् इष्टम् हुतम् चैव तप्तानि च तपांसि च |
वेदाः सत्य प्रतिष्ठानाः तस्मात् सत्य परो भवेत् || २-१०९-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Gift sacrifice, oblation, austerities performed and the scriptural texts have the
foundation in Truth. Hence, one should thoroughly surrender to truth._END

B_2_C_109_12
BEGIN_
एकः पालयते लोकम् एकः पालयते कुलम् |
मज्जत्य् एको हि निरयः एकः स्वर्गे महीयते || २-१०९-१५_END
BEGIN_
"One rules over the world. One develops a race. One sinks into hell . One rises high
to heaven (according to one's degree of truthfulness practiced)."_END

B_2_C_109_13
BEGIN_
सो अहम् पितुर् निदेशम् तु किम् अर्थम् न अनुपालये |
सत्य प्रतिश्रवः सत्यम् सत्येन समयी कृतः || २-१०९-१६_END
BEGIN_
"I am true to my promise. Why should I not fulfilll the command of my father, who
was a devotee of truth?"_END

B_2_C_109_14
BEGIN_
न एव लोभान् न मोहाद् वा न च अज्नानात् तमो अन्वितः |
सेतुम् सत्यस्य भेत्स्यामि गुरोः सत्य प्रतिश्रवः || २-१०९-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Neither covetousness nor forgetfulness nor pride would cause me to destroy the bond
of morality. I shall honour the vow made to my father."_END

B_2_C_109_15
BEGIN_
असत्य संधस्य सतः चलस्य अस्थिर चेतसः |
न एव देवा न पितरः प्रतीग्च्छन्ति इति नः श्रुतम् || २-१०९-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Neither gods nor the manes will accept the offerings of those who are wanting in
truth, unsteady and unstable in their minds. This is what is taught to us."_END

B_2_C_109_16
BEGIN_
प्रत्यग् आत्मम् इमम् धर्मम् सत्यम् पश्याम्य् अहम् स्वयम् |
भारः सत् पुरुष आचीर्णः तद् अर्थम् अभिनन्द्यते || २-१०९-१९_END
BEGIN_
"I perceive this virtue i the form of truthfulness as a universal permeation of
spirit. That is why, this burden, observed as a vow, has been honoured by good men."_END

B_2_C_109_17
BEGIN_
क्षात्रम् धर्मम् अहम् त्यक्ष्ये ह्य् अधर्मम् धर्म सम्हितम् |
क्षुद्रौर् नृशंसैर् लुब्धैः च सेवितम् पाप कर्मभिः || २-१०९-२०_END
BEGIN_
"I renounce the so-called duty of a warrior, it is injustice under the name of
justice, it is practised by petty cruel and covetous men of evil deeds."_END

B_2_C_109_18
BEGIN_
कायेन कुरुते पापम् मनसा सम्प्रधार्य च |
अनृतम् जिह्वया च आह त्रिविधम् कर्म पातकम् || २-१०९-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Sin is committed by the body after it has been conceived by the mind and falsehood
is spoken with the tongue. Thus, the degrading act is of three types (with body, mind and
tongue)"_END

B_2_C_109_19
BEGIN_
भूमिः कीर्तिर् यशो लक्ष्मीः पुरुषम् प्रार्थयन्ति हि |
स्वर्गस्थम् च अनुबध्नन्ति सत्यम् एव भजेत तत् || २-१०९-२२_END
BEGIN_
"The earth, fame, prosperity and fortune indeed woo a man of truth. They constantly
oblige the truth: truth should therefore be strictly observed!"_END

B_2_C_109_20
BEGIN_
श्रेष्ठम् ह्य् अनार्यम् एव स्याद् यद् भवान् अवधार्य माम् |
आह युक्ति करैर् वाक्यैर् इदम् भद्रम् कुरुष्व ह || २-१०९-२३_END
BEGIN_
"The logical words, you have made it out to be good, saying 'Do this good thing' as
uttered to me, are really unworthy."_END

B_2_C_109_21
BEGIN_
कथम् ह्य् अहम् प्रतिज्नाय वन वासम् इमम् गुरोः |
भरतस्य करिष्यामि वचो हित्वा गुरोर् वचः || २-१०९-२४_END
BEGIN_
"Having promised before my father about my exile to the forest, how can I fulfil
Bharata's words now, abandoning the father's words?"_END

B_2_C_109_22
BEGIN_
स्थिरा मया प्रतिज्नाता प्रतिज्ना गुरु सम्निधौ |
प्रहृष्ट मानसा देवी कैकेयी च अभवत् तदा || २-१०९-२५_END
BEGIN_
"A firm promise has been made by me in the presence of my father, when Queen Kaikeyi
too became rejoiced."_END

B_2_C_109_23
BEGIN_
वन वासम् वसन्न् एवम् शुचिर् नियत भोजनः |
मूलैः पुष्पैः फलैः पुण्यैः पितृऋन् देवामः च तर्पयन् || २-१०९-२६
सम्तुष्ट पन्च वर्गो अहम् लोक यात्राम् प्रवर्तये |
अकुहः श्रद्दधानः सन् कार्य अकार्य विचक्षणः || २-१०९-२७_END
BEGIN_
"I will proceed with life-journey in this manner, by accepting this dwelling in the
forest, by remaining pure in body and mind, having controlled my diet, by feasting the Gods and
Ancestors with pure roots, flowers and fruits, with all my five senses fully sated, without any
deceit, fully devout and discriminative of what ought to be done and what ought not to be
done."_END

B_2_C_109_24
BEGIN_
कर्म भूमिम् इमाम् प्राप्य कर्तव्यम् कर्म यत् शुभम् |
अग्निर् वायुः च सोमः च कर्मणाम् फल भागिनः || २-१०९-२८_END
BEGIN_
"Having reached this terrestrial globe (the realm of action), only a virtuous act is
to be undertaken. The god of fire, the wind-god and the moon-god reap the fruits of their
acts."_END

B_2_C_109_25
BEGIN_
शतम् क्रतूनाम् आहृत्य देव राट् त्रिदिवम् गतः |
तपांस्य् उग्राणि च आस्थाय दिवम् याता महर्षयः || २-१०९-२९_END
BEGIN_
"Having performed ahundred sacrifices, Indra the Lord of celestials went to heaven.
Having practised severe austerities, the great sages went to heaven."_END

B_2_C_109_26
BEGIN_
अमृष्यमाणः पुनरुग्रतेजा |
निशम्य तं नास्तिकवाक्यहेतुम् |
अथाब्रवीत्तं नृपतेस्तनूजो |
विगर्हमाणो वचानानि तस्य || २-१०९-३०_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that argument of atheism inuntiated by Jabali, Rama the prince with a
terrible energy, without tolerating his words, spoke in reproach to him (as follows):_END

B_2_C_109_27
BEGIN_
सत्यं च धर्मं च पराक्रमं च |
भूतानुकम्पां प्रियवादिताम् च |
द्विजातिदेवातिथिपूजनं च |
पन्थानमाहुस्त्रिदिवस्य सन्तः || २-१०९-३१_END
BEGIN_
"The virtuous say that truth, piety, valour, compassion for all beings, polite
speech and worship of Brahmanas, gods and unexpected guests are the paths to heaven."_END

B_2_C_109_28
BEGIN_
तेनैवमाज्ञाय यथावदर्थ |
मेकोदयं सम्प्रतिपद्य विप्राः |
धर्मं चरन्तः सकलं यथाव |
त्काज़्^ख़्षन्ति लोकागममप्रमत्ताः || २-१०९-३२_END
BEGIN_
"Therefore the learned, well-instructed in what is to be their greatest advantage;
