follow their purpose resolutely and fulfill their duty in its entirety properly and attentively,
seeking to attain the highest realms."_END

B_2_C_109_29
BEGIN_
निन्दाम्यहं कर्म पितुः कृतं त |
द्यस्त्वामगृह्णाद्विषमस्थबुद्धिम् |
बुद्ध्यानयैवंविधया चरन्तं |
सुनास्तिकं धर्मपथादपेतम् || २-१०९-३३_END
BEGIN_
"I accuse the act done by my father in taking you into his service, you with your
misleading intelligence, a firm atheist fallen from the true path."_END

B_2_C_109_30
BEGIN_
यथा हि चोरः स तथा हि बुद्ध |
स्तथागतं नास्तिकमत्र विध्हि |
तस्माद्धि यः शङ्क्यतमः प्रजानाम् |
न नास्ति केनाभिमुखो बुधः स्यात् २-१०९-३४_END
BEGIN_
"It is an exact state of the case that a mere *intellection deserves to be punished
as it were a thief and know an atheist to be on par with a mere intellectual. Therefore he is the
most suspectable and should be punished in the interest of the poeple. In no case should a wise man
consort with an atheist."_END

B_2_C_109_31
BEGIN_
त्वत्तो जनाः पूर्वतरे वराश्च |
शुभानि कर्माणि बहूनि चक्रुः |
चित्वा सदेमं च परम् च लौकं |
तस्माद्द्विजाः स्वस्ति हुतं कृतं च २-१०९-३५_END
BEGIN_
"Men that lived before you have performed many auspicious acts, abandoning all hopes
of reward in this world as well as the next. Therefore, Brahmanas offer oblations in the sacred
fire and practise noble deeds."_END

B_2_C_109_32
BEGIN_
धर्मे रताः सत् पुरुषैः समेताः |
तेजस्विनो दान गुण प्रधानाः |
अहिंसका वीत मलाः च लोके |
भवन्ति पूज्या मुनयः प्रधानाः || २-१०९-३६_END
BEGIN_
"The sages who are devoted to righteousness, associating with men of virtue, endowed
with spiritual splendour, practising abundant charity, harm-less and washed free of all taint, are
honoured into the world."_END

B_2_C_109_33
BEGIN_
इति ब्रुवन्तं वचनं सरोषं |
रामं महात्मानमदीनसत्त्वम् |
उवाच पथ्यं पुनरास्तिकं च |
सत्यं वचः सानुनयं च विप्रः || २-१०९-३७_END
BEGIN_
"To the high-souled Rama, who never had self-pity and speaking indignantly as
aforesaid, Jabali (that brahmana) replied in a fitting manner in words that were beneficial and
truthful, which showed his belief in authority of Vedas, the other world and so on."_END

B_2_C_109_34
BEGIN_
न नास्तिकानां वचनम् ब्रवीम्यहं |
न नास्तिकोऽहं न च नास्ति किंचन |
समीक्ष्य कालं पुनरास्तिकोऽभवं |
भवेय काले पुनरेव नास्तिकः || २-१०९-३८_END
BEGIN_
"I am not speaking the words of non- believers. I am not an atheist, nor is it a
fact that nothing exists whatsoever. Perceiving the time, I have become a believer. When the time
comes, I will become again just a non-believer."_END

B_2_C_109_35
BEGIN_
स चापि कालोऽय मुपागतः शनैः |
यथा मया नास्तिकवागुदीरिता |
निवर्तनार्थं तव राम कारणात् |
प्रसादनार्थं च मयैतदीरितम् || || २-१०९-३९_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! That and this time too came gradually. The words of a non-believer were
spoken by me for your sake, to pacify you and to persuade you to return to Ayodhya."_END

B_2_C_110_0
BEGIN_क्रुद्धम् आज्ञाय राम तु वसिष्ठः प्रत्युवाच ह।
जाबालिः अपि जानीते लोकस्य अस्य गत आगतिम्॥ २-११०-१_END
BEGIN_
Recognising that Rama has become angry, Vashishta spoke as follows: "Even Jabali is
aware of the going and coming of this world."_END

B_2_C_110_1
BEGIN_
निवर्तयितु कामः तु त्वाम् एतद् वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् |
इमाम् लोक समुत्पत्तिम् लोक नाथ निबोध मे || २-११०-२_END
BEGIN_
"He apoke in this manner, on account of his desire that you should return. O, Lord
of the poeple! Learn from me of the creation of the world!"_END

B_2_C_110_2
BEGIN_
सर्वम् सलिलम् एव आसीत् पृथिवी यत्र निर्मिता |
ततः समभवद् ब्रह्मा स्वयम्भूर् दैवतैः सह || २-११०-३_END
BEGIN_
"All was water only in the beginning" from which element the earth was formed. After
that, the self-existent Brahma with all the gods came into existence."_END

B_2_C_110_3
BEGIN_
स वराहः ततो भूत्वा प्रोज्जहार वसुंधराम् |
असृजच् च जगत् सर्वम् सह पुत्रैः कृत आत्मभिः || २-११०-४_END
BEGIN_
"Thereafter, that Brahma, assuming the form of boar, caused the earth to rise from
water and with his sons of pure soul, created the entire world."_END

B_2_C_110_4
BEGIN_
आकाश प्रभवो ब्रह्मा शाश्वतो नित्य अव्ययः |
तस्मान् मरीचिः सम्जज्ने मरीचेः कश्यपः सुतः || २-११०-५_END
BEGIN_
"The eternal, changeless and imperishable Brahma was begotten from ether and from
his was born Marichi. Marichi's son was kashyapa."_END

B_2_C_110_5
BEGIN_
विवस्वान् कश्यपाज् जज्ने मनुर् वैवस्तवः स्मृतः |
स तु प्रजापतिः पूर्वम् इक्ष्वाकुः तु मनोः सुतः || २-११०-६_END
BEGIN_
"From Kashyapa, Vivasvan(sun-god) was born. manu was the son of Vivasvan. Manu for
his part, was formerly the lord of creation. Ikshvaku was Manu' s son."_END

B_2_C_110_6
BEGIN_
यस्य इयम् प्रथमम् दत्ता समृद्धा मनुना मही |
तम् इक्ष्वाकुम् अयोध्यायाम् राजानम् विद्धि पूर्वकम् || २-११०-७_END
BEGIN_
"The entire fertile earth was given by Manu to Ikshvaku and know that Ikshvaku was
thus the first king of Ayodhya!"_END

B_2_C_110_7
BEGIN_
इक्ष्वाकोः तु सुतः श्रीमान् कुक्षिर् एव इति विश्रुतः |
कुक्षेर् अथ आत्मजो वीरो विकुक्षिर् उदपद्यत || २-११०-८_END
BEGIN_
"Ikshvaku's son was known as Kukshi, the illustrious king. Then, Kukshi's son was
the valiant Vikukshi."_END

B_2_C_110_8
BEGIN_
विकुक्षेः तु महा तेजा बाणः पुत्रः प्रतापवान् |
बाणस्य तु महा बाहुर् अनरण्यो महा यशाः || २-११०-९_END
BEGIN_
"To Vikukshi was born the most splendid and powerful son, Bana. To Bana was born
Anaranya the mighty armed and the most illustrious son."_END

B_2_C_110_9
BEGIN_
नाना वृष्टिर् बभूव अस्मिन् न दुर्भिक्षम् सताम् वरे |
अनरण्ये महा राजे तस्करो वा अपि कश्चन || २-११०-१०_END
BEGIN_
"While this King Anaranya, the most excellent among beings was reigning, there was
neither dearth of rain nor a drought. No one was a thief."_END

B_2_C_110_10
BEGIN_
अनरण्यान् महा बाहुः पृथू राजा बभूव ह |
तस्मात् पृथोर् महा राजः त्रिशन्कुर् उदपद्यत || २-११०-११
स सत्य वचनाद् वीरः सशरीरो दिवम् गतः |_END
BEGIN_
"From Anaranya was born the mighty armed king Prithu. From Prithu was born the
Emperor Trishanku. That valiant man ascneded to heaven along with his mortal body, because of his
true eloquence."_END

B_2_C_110_11
BEGIN_
त्रिशन्कोर् अभवत् सूनुर् धुन्धुमारो महा यशाः || २-११०-१२
धुन्धुमारान् महा तेजा युवन अश्वो व्यजायत |_END
BEGIN_
"To Trishanku was born a son, the highly illustrious Dundhumara. From Dundhumara was
born the hero, Yuvanasva."_END

B_2_C_110_12
BEGIN_
युवन अश्व सुतः श्रीमान् मान्धाता समपद्यत || २-११०-१३
मान्धातुः तु महा तेजाः सुसंधिर् उदपद्यत |
सुसंधेर् अपि पुत्रौ द्वौ ध्रुव संधिः प्रसेनजित् || २-११०-१४
यशस्वी ध्रुव संधेः तु भरतो रिपु सूदनः |_END
BEGIN_
"The illustrious Mandhata was born as a son to Yuvanasva. To Mandhata was born the
hero, Susandhi. There were two sons Dhruvasandhi and prasenajit to Susandhi. From Dhruvasandhi was
born the illustrious Bharata, the annihilator of enemies."_END

B_2_C_110_13
BEGIN_
भरतात् तु महा बाहोर् असितो नाम जायत || २-११०-१५
यस्य एते प्रतिराजान उदपद्यन्त शत्रवः |
हैहयाः ताल जन्घाः च शूराः च शश बिन्दवः || २-११०-१६_END
BEGIN_
"From the mighty armed Bharata was born a son named Asita, for whom his royal
adversaries, Haihayas, Talajanghas and the valiant Shashibindavas became the enemies."_END

B_2_C_110_14
BEGIN_
तामः तु सर्वान् प्रतिव्यूह्य युद्धे राजा प्रवासितः |
स च शैल वरे रम्ये बभूव अभिरतो मुनिः || २-११०-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Having drawn out his battle-array against all those kings in a combat, the king
Asita was driven away. Asita then became a devoted sage taking asylum in an excellent and charming
mountain."_END

B_2_C_110_15
BEGIN_
द्वे च अस्य भार्ये गर्भिण्यौ बभूवतुर् इति श्रुतिः |
एका गर्भविनाशाय सपत्न्यै गरळं ददौ || २-११०-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Asita's two wives became pregnant. It is a hearsay that one of his wives gave
poison to the other co-wife in order to destroy her foetus."_END

B_2_C_110_16
BEGIN_
भार्गवः च्यवनो नाम हिमवन्तम् उपाश्रितः |
तम् ऋषिम् समुपागम्य कालिन्दी तु अभ्यवादयत् || २-११०-१९
स ताम् अभ्यवदद् विप्रो वर ईप्सुम् पुत्र जन्मनि |_END
BEGIN_
"A sage called Chyavana, belonging to Bhrign race was staying in a Himalayan
mountain. Kalindi (Asita's wife) approached that sage and offered her salutation. That brahmna
spoke the following words to her, who wanted to obtain a boon for the birth of a son."_END

B_2_C_110_17
BEGIN_
पुत्रस्ते भविता देवि महात्मा लोकविश्रुतः || २-११०-२०
धार्मिकश्च सुशीलश्च वंशकर्तारिसूदनः |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Queen! A high-souled son, who will be world-famous, rightous, of a good conduct,
a perpetuator of the race and an annihilator of enemies will be born to you."_END

B_2_C_110_18
BEGIN_
कृत्वाप्रदक्षिणं हृष्टा मुनिं तमनुमान्य च || २-११०-२१
पद्मपत्रसमानाक्षं पद्मगर्भसमप्रभम् |
ततः सा गृहम् आगम्य देवी पुत्रम् व्यजायत || २-११०-२२_END
BEGIN_
"The delighted Queen Kalindi circumambulated that sage, took permission from him to
leave and thereafter on reaching home, had delivered a son, having eyes resembling lotus-leaves and
having a radiance like that of Brahama the Lord of creation."_END

B_2_C_110_19
BEGIN_
सपत्न्या तु गरः तस्यै दत्तो गर्भ जिघांसया |
गरेण सह तेन एव जातः स सगरो अभवत् || २-११०-२३_END
BEGIN_
"Poison was given earlier by her co-wife with an intention to kill her foetus. Born
with that poison itself, he became Sagara (a man with poison)."_END

B_2_C_110_20
BEGIN_
स राजा सगरो नाम यः समुद्रम् अखानयत् |
इष्ट्वा पर्वणि वेगेन त्रासयन्तम् इमाः प्रजाः || २-११०-२४_END
BEGIN_
"It was king SAgara who excavated the ocen and who, by his sacrifice, on the day of
the full moon, by his energy, frightened the people here by the speed of his digging."_END

B_2_C_110_21
BEGIN_
असमन्जः तु पुत्रो अभूत् सगरस्य इति नः श्रुतम् |
जीवन्न् एव स पित्रा तु निरस्तः पाप कर्म कृत् || २-११०-२५_END
BEGIN_
"Asamanja was Sagara's son. There was a hearsay that on account of his wicked deeds,
Asamanja was banished by his father even during his life time."_END

B_2_C_110_22
BEGIN_
अंशुमान् इति पुत्रो अभूद् असमन्जस्य वीर्यवान् |
दिलीपो अंशुमतः पुत्रो दिलीपस्य भगीरथः || २-११०-२६_END
BEGIN_
"A valiant son called amshuman was born to Asamanja. Dilipa was Amshuman's son.
Bhagiratha was Dilipa's son._END

B_2_C_110_23
BEGIN_
भगीरथात् ककुत्स्थः तु काकुत्स्था येन तु स्मृताः |
ककुत्स्थस्य तु पुत्रो अभूद् रघुर् येन तु राघवः || २-११०-२७_END
BEGIN_
"Of Bhagiratha was born kakutstha, from whom the Kakutsthas take their name. To
Kakutsthas was born a son called Raghu, from whence spring Raghavas."_END

B_2_C_110_24
BEGIN_
रघोः तु पुत्रः तेजस्वी प्रवृद्धः पुरुष अदकः |
कल्माष पादः सौदास इत्य् एवम् प्रथितो भुवि || २-११०-२८_END
BEGIN_
"From Raghu was born a renowned son named Pravriddha, known in the world under the
names Purushadaka, Kalmashapada and Soudasa."_END

B_2_C_110_25
BEGIN_
कल्माष पाद पुत्रो अभूत् शन्खणः तु इति विश्रुतः |
यः तु तद् वीर्यम् आसाद्य सह सेनो व्यनीनशत् || २-११०-२९_END
BEGIN_
"Kalmashapada's son was renowned as Shankhana, who, even on attaining his father's
valour, perished (in a battle) along with his army."_END

B_2_C_110_26
BEGIN_
शन्खणस्य तु पुत्रो अभूत् शूरः श्रीमान् सुदर्शनः |
सुदर्शनस्य अग्नि वर्ण अग्नि वर्षस्य शीघ्रगः || २-११०-३०
शीघ्रगस्य मरुः पुत्रो मरोः पुत्रः प्रशुश्रुकः |
प्रशुश्रुकस्य पुत्रो अभूद् अम्बरीषो महा द्युतिः || २-११०-३१
अम्बरीषस्य पुत्रो अभून् नहुषः सत्य विक्रमः |
नहुषस्य च नाभागः पुत्रः परम धार्मिकः || २-११०-३२
अजः च सुव्रतः चैव नाभागस्य सुताउ उभौ |
अजस्य चैव धर्म आत्मा राजा दशरथः सुतः || २-११०-३३_END
BEGIN_
The fortunate Sudarshana was the son of Shankhana. Sudarshana's son was Agnivarna;
and of Agnivarna was born Shighraga. Shighraga begot Maru and Maru's son was Prashushruva from
Prashushruva was born Ambarisha of that great radiance. To Ambarisha was born a son named Nahusha
who was full of valour. Nahusha's son was Nabhaga of outstanding virtue. Aja and Suvrata were the
two sons of Nabhaga and it was Aja who begot the virtuous King Dasartha."_END

B_2_C_110_27
BEGIN_
तस्य ज्येष्ठो असि दायादो राम इत्य् अभिविश्रुतः |
तद् गृहाण स्वकम् राज्यम् अवेक्षस्व जगन् नृप || ३४_END
BEGIN_
"You are the eldest son of that Dasaratha, very well-known as Rama, the heir who can
claim over the inheritance. O, King! Hence, take over your kingdom and look after your people
there."_END

B_2_C_110_28
BEGIN_
इक्ष्वाकूणाम् हि सर्वेषाम् राजा भवति पूर्वजः |
पूर्वजेन अवरः पुत्रो ज्येष्ठो राज्ये अभिषिच्यते || २-११०-३५_END
BEGIN_
"The eldest son only becomes the king in the entire Ikshvaku race. When the eldest
son exists, the younger son will not become a king. The eldest son only is anointed to the
crown._END

B_2_C_110_29
BEGIN_
स राघवाणाम् कुल धर्मम् आत्मनः |
सनातनम् न अद्य विहातुम् अर्हसि |
प्रभूत रत्नाम् अनुशाधि मेदिनीम् |
प्रभूत राष्ट्राम् पितृवन् महा यशाः || २-११०-३६_END
BEGIN_
"O, the celebrated one! This is the eternal tradition of your race, those born in
Raghu dynasty and ought not to be violated by you. Rule over the earth, this vast kingdom abudant
with precious metals, as did your father."_END

B_2_C_111_0
BEGIN_
वसिष्ठः तु तदा रामम् उक्त्वा राज पुरोहितः |
अब्रवीद् धर्म सम्युक्तम् पुनर् एव अपरम् वचः || २-१११-१_END
BEGIN_
Having spoken thus to Rama, Vasishta the royal priest added the following righteous
words:_END

B_2_C_111_1
BEGIN_
पुरुषस्य इह जातस्य भवन्ति गुरवः त्रयः |
आचार्यः चैव काकुत्स्थ पिता माता च राघव || २-१११-२_END
BEGIN_
"O, Kakutstha, O offspring the Raghu dynasty! From birth, the three spiritual
instructors of a man are his teacher, his father and his mother."_END

B_2_C_111_2
BEGIN_
पिता ह्य् एनम् जनयति पुरुषम् पुरुष ऋषभ |
प्रज्नाम् ददाति च आचार्यः तस्मात् स गुरुर् उच्यते || २-१११-३_END
BEGIN_
"O, excellent among men! The father of man his life. The teacher instructs him in
wisdom and therefore instructs the teacher is said to be the superior!"_END

B_2_C_111_3
BEGIN_
से ते अहम् पितुर् आचार्यः तव चैव परम् तप |
मम त्वम् वचनम् कुर्वन् न अतिवर्तेः सताम् गतिम् || २-१११-४_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama the tormentator of the enemies! I am the spiritual Preceptor to your father
and to you too. In obeying my words, you will not transgress the path of the virtuous."_END

B_2_C_111_4
BEGIN_
इमा हि ते परिषदः श्रेणयः च समागताः |
एषु तात चरन् धर्मम् न अतिवर्तेः सताम् गतिम् || २-१११-५_END
BEGIN_
"O, dear prince! These subjects, the traders, the other categories of people and
Brahmana are your people only. In fulfilling your duty to them, you will not be transgressing your
righteous path."_END

B_2_C_111_5
BEGIN_
वृद्धाया धर्म शीलाया मातुर् न अर्हस्य् अवर्तितुम् |
अस्याः तु वचनम् कुर्वन् न अतिवर्तेः सताम् गतिम् || २-१११-६_END
BEGIN_
"You ought not to be lacking in reverence to your mother who is aged and possessing
a noble conduct. By carrying out her words, you will not deviate from the path of the
virtuous."_END

B_2_C_111_6
BEGIN_
भरतस्य वचः कुर्वन् याचमानस्य राघव |
आत्मानम् न अतिवर्तेः त्वम् सत्य धर्म पराक्रम || २-१११-७_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama excelling in truth and virtue. By fulfilling the words of the beseeching
Bharata, you will not be false to yourself."_END

B_2_C_111_7
BEGIN_
एवम् मधुरम् उक्तः तु गुरुणा राघवः स्वयम् |
प्रत्युवाच समासीनम् वसिष्ठम् पुरुष ऋषभः || २-१११-८_END
BEGIN_
Having heard the sweet words spoken by his spiritual preceptro himself, Rama the
excellent among men replied (as follows) to Vasishta who was seated there._END

B_2_C_111_8
BEGIN_
यन् मातापितरौ वृत्तम् तनये कुरुतः सदा |
न सुप्रतिकरम् तत् तु मात्रा पित्रा च यत् कृतम् || २-१११-९
यथा शक्ति प्रदानेन स्नापनाच् चादनेन च |
नित्यम् च प्रिय वादेन तथा सम्वर्धनेन च || २-१११-१०_END
BEGIN_
"The good, which a father and mother do, by giving whatever they can, to their son
constantly, by putting him to sleep, rubbing his body with oil etc, nay, by speaking kindly to him
every moment, and even by nourishing him, can never be wholly requited."_END

B_2_C_111_9
BEGIN_
स हि राजा जनयिता पिता दशरथो मम |
आज्नातम् यन् मया तस्य न तन् मिथ्या भविष्यति || २-१११-११_END
BEGIN_
"The command laid upon me by king Dasaratha, my father, who begot me, cannot
therefore be disregarded."_END

B_2_C_111_10
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्तः तु रामेण भरतः प्रत्यनन्तरम् |
उवाच परम उदारः सूतम् परम दुर्मनाः || २-१११-१२_END
BEGIN_
Hearing Rama's words, the most generous Bharata felt very mcuh anguished and
addressed the following words to Sumantra the charioteer who was standing nearby:_END

B_2_C_111_11
BEGIN_
इह मे स्थण्डिले शीघ्रम् कुशान् आस्तर सारथे |
आर्यम् प्रत्युपवेक्ष्यामि यावन् मे न प्रसीदति || २-१११-१३_END
BEGIN_
"O, charioteer! Spread speedily the Kusha grass on the ground here for me. I shall
remain facing my illustrious brother till he gets propitiated (and grant my request)."_END

B_2_C_111_12
BEGIN_
अनाहारो निरालोको धन हीनो यथा द्विजः |
शेष्ये पुरस्तात् शालाया यावन् न प्रतियास्यति || २-१११-१४_END
BEGIN_
"I shall remain lying down in front of Rama's hut without food or drink and
depriving myself of light until he returns to Ayodhya, like a brahman who is a destitute (lies down
at the door of his crditor)."_END

B_2_C_111_13
BEGIN_
स तु रामम् अवेक्षन्तम् सुमन्त्रम् प्रेक्ष्य दुर्मनाः |
कुश उत्तरम् उपस्थाप्य भूमाउ एव आस्तरत् स्वयम् || २-१११-१५_END
BEGIN_
Seeing Sumantra who was gazing at Rama waiting for his command, the low-spirited
Bharata, on his own, brought a heap of Kusha grass and spread it on the floor._END

B_2_C_111_14
BEGIN_
तम् उवाच महा तेजा रामो राज ऋषि सत्तमाः |
किम् माम् भरत कुर्वाणम् तात प्रत्युपवेक्ष्यसि || २-१११-१६_END
BEGIN_
Rama of great splendour and the best among royal sages spoke to Bharata as follows:
"O Bharata my dear brother! What wrong have I done that you lie down before me?"_END

B_2_C_111_15
BEGIN_
ब्राह्मणो ह्य् एक पार्श्वेन नरान् रोद्धुम् इह अर्हति |
न तु मूर्धा अवसिक्तानाम् विधिः प्रत्युपवेशने || २-१११-१७_END
BEGIN_
"A brahmana may lie down on one side in order to obstruct a willful debtor in this
world. But, it is not befitting for a warrior-class._END

B_2_C_111_16
BEGIN_
उत्तिष्ठ नर शार्दूल हित्वा एतद् दारुणम् व्रतम् |
पुर वर्याम् इतः क्षिप्रम् अयोध्याम् याहि राघव || २-१११-१८_END
BEGIN_
"O Bharata, Tiger among men! Giving up this formidable resolve, rise up proceed
speedily to Ayodhya the best of cities, from here."_END

B_2_C_111_17
BEGIN_
आसीनः तु एव भरतः पौर जानपदम् जनम् |
उवाच सर्वतः प्रेक्ष्य किम् आर्यम् न अनुशासथ || २-१११-१९_END
BEGIN_
Still sitting in the same posture, Bharata looked at the citizens and rural folk
around on all sides and asked them why they were not entreating his venerable brother to
return._END

B_2_C_111_18
BEGIN_
ते तम् ऊचुर् महात्मानम् पौर जानपदा जनाः |
काकुत्स्थम् अभिजानीमः सम्यग् वदति राघवः || २-१११-२०_END
BEGIN_
Those people, the inhabitants of town and country replied to the magnanimous Bharata
as follows: "We know Rama very well. He is speaking rightly."_END

B_2_C_111_19
BEGIN_
एषो अपि हि महा भागः पितुर् वचसि तिष्ठति |
अत एव न शक्ताः स्मो व्यावर्तयितुम् अन्जसा || २-१११-२१_END
BEGIN_
"This Rama of exalted merit is indeed standing on his father's words. Hence, we are
not able to convince him to return to Ayodhya."_END

B_2_C_111_20
BEGIN_
तेषाम् आज्नाय वचनम् रामो वचनम् अब्रवीत् |
एवम् निबोध वचनम् सुहृदाम् धर्म चक्षुषाम् || २-१११-२२_END
BEGIN_
Hearing their words, Rama said to Bharata: "Reflect on the words of your companions,
who see rightly."_END

B_2_C_111_21
BEGIN_
एतच् च एव उभयम् श्रुत्वा सम्यक् सम्पश्य राघव |
उत्तिष्ठ त्वम् महा बाहो माम् च स्पृश तथा उदकम् || २-१११-२३_END
BEGIN_
"O the mighty armed Bharata! Having listened to their testimony and mine, reflect on
the matter carefull. Rise and touch me and drink water."_END

B_2_C_111_22
BEGIN_
अथ उत्थाय जलम् स्पृष्ट्वा भरतो वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् |
शृण्वन्तु मे परिषदो मन्त्रिणः श्रेणयः तथा || २-१११-२४_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, Bharata rose, touched water and spoke as follows: "Let the audience,
including ministers and the guild of traders hear me also."_END

B_2_C_111_23
BEGIN_
न याचे पितरम् राज्यम् न अनुशासामि मातरम् |
आर्यम् परम धर्मज्नम् अभिजानामि राघवम् || २-१११-२५_END
BEGIN_
"I never asked my father for the kingdom, nor did I counsel my mother to enthrone
me. I never gave my approval for the exile of Rama, the venerable hero, who knows his duty very
well."_END

B_2_C_111_24
BEGIN_
यदि तु अवश्यम् वस्तव्यम् कर्तव्यम् च पितुर् वचः |
अहम् एव निवत्स्यामि चतुर्दश वने समाः || २-१११-२६_END
BEGIN_
"If it is absolutely essential that one of us should remain here and the command of
our father be executed, then it is I who will reside in the forest for fourteen years."_END

B_2_C_111_25
BEGIN_
धर्म आत्मा तस्य तथ्येन भ्रातुर् वाक्येन विस्मितः |
उवाच रामः सम्प्रेक्ष्य पौर जानपदम् जनम् || २-१११-२७_END
BEGIN_
The high-souled Rama was surprised by the sincere words of his brother and by
looking at the inhabitants of town and country, spoke (as follows):_END

B_2_C_111_26
BEGIN_
विक्रीतम् आहितम् क्रीतम् यत् पित्रा जीवता मम |
न तल् लोपयितुम् शक्यम् मया वा भरतेन वा || २-१११-२८_END
BEGIN_
"The disposal, the pledge and the come-by which he was alive, cannot be broken
either by me or by Bharata."_END

B_2_C_111_27
BEGIN_
उपधिर् न मया कार्यो वन वासे जुगुप्सितः |
युक्तम् उक्तम् च कैकेय्या पित्रा मे सुकृतम् कृतम् || २-१११-२९_END
BEGIN_
"I cannot accede to the substitute in respect of the sojourn in the forest and it is
distasteful thing. What was advised by Kaikeyi was proper and what was done by my father was a
righteous deed."_END

B_2_C_111_28
BEGIN_
जानामि भरतम् क्षान्तम् गुरु सत्कार कारिणम् |
सर्वम् एव अत्र कल्याणम् सत्य संधे महात्मनि || २-१११-३०_END
BEGIN_
"I am aware that Bharata has necessary patience and due devotion for the elders. All
will be propitious in the case of this magnanimous Bharata, who is true to his promise."_END

B_2_C_111_29
BEGIN_
अनेन धर्म शीलेन वनात् प्रत्यागतः पुनः |
भ्रात्रा सह भविष्यामि पृथिव्याः पतिर् उत्तमः || २-१११-३१_END
BEGIN_
"After returning from the forest, I shall rule the earth, assisted by my virtuous
brother."_END

B_2_C_111_30
BEGIN_
वृतो राजा हि कैकेय्या मया तद् वचनम् कृतम् |
अनृतान् मोचय अनेन पितरम् तम् मही पतिम् || २-१११-३२_END
BEGIN_
"The king Dasaratha was indeed solicited for a boon by Kaikeyi. That word of the
king has been fulfilled by me. Hence, relieve our father, the emperor from the blame."_END

B_2_C_112_0
BEGIN_
तम् अप्रतिम तेजोभ्याम् भ्रातृभ्याम् रोम हर्षणम् |
विस्मिताः सम्गमम् प्रेक्ष्य समवेता महर्षयः || २-११२-१_END
BEGIN_
Witnessing that thrilling converse between those two brothers with incomparable
dignity, the great sages gathered there were astonished._END

B_2_C_112_1
BEGIN_
अन्तर् हिताः तु ऋषि गणाः सिद्धाः च परम ऋषयः |
तौ भ्रातरौ महात्मानौ काकुत्स्थौ प्रशशंसिरे || २-११२-२_END
BEGIN_
The assemblies of ascetics, great saints present there and the distinguished sages
who stood invisible in space, applauded both Rama and Bharata, the magnanimous brothers, saying (as
follows):_END

B_2_C_112_2
BEGIN_
स धन्यो यस्य पुत्रौ द्वौ धर्मज्नौ धर्म विक्रमौ |
श्रुत्वा वयम् हि सम्भाषाम् उभयोः स्पृहयामहे || २-११२-३_END
BEGIN_
"That Dasaratha, who begot these two sons, who know righteousness and whose strength
is justice, was fortunate. By hearing the debate between these two princes, we are indeed
delighted."_END

B_2_C_112_3
BEGIN_
ततः तु ऋषि गणाः क्षिप्रम् दशग्रीव वध एषिणः |
भरतम् राज शार्दूलम् इत्य् ऊचुः सम्गता वचः || २-११२-४_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, that assembly of sages, who wished to see a quick destruction of Ravana,
came together and spoke the following words to Bharata, the excellent king._END

B_2_C_112_4
BEGIN_
कुले जात महा प्राज्न महा वृत्त महा यशः |
ग्राह्यम् रामस्य वाक्यम् ते पितरम् यद्य् अवेक्षसे || २-११२-५_END
BEGIN_
"O Bharata born in a noble race, highly intelligent, having a superior conduct and a
great repute! If you have regard for your father, Rama's words are to be accepted._END

B_2_C_112_5
BEGIN_
सदा अनृणम् इमम् रामम् वयम् इग्च्छामहे पितुः |
अनृणत्वाच् च कैकेय्याः स्वर्गम् दशरथो गतः || २-११२-६_END
BEGIN_
"We wish to see Rama absolved of all obligations forever to his father. Dasaratha,
having honoured his pledge to Kaikeyi, indeed went to heaven."_END

B_2_C_112_6
BEGIN_
एतावद् उक्त्वा वचनम् गन्धर्वाः समहर्षयः |
राज ऋषयः चैव तथा सर्वे स्वाम् स्वाम् गतिम् गताः || २-११२-७_END
BEGIN_
Having uttered that much, all the celestial musicians and the great sages then went
to their respective abodes._END

B_2_C_112_7
BEGIN_
ह्लादितः तेन वाक्येन शुभेन शुभ दर्शनः |
रामः सम्हृष्ट वदनः तान् ऋषीन् अभ्यपूजयत् || २-११२-८_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those auspicious words, the good-looking Rama looked radiant and worshipped
those sages with a joyful countenance._END

B_2_C_112_8
BEGIN_
स्रस्त गात्रः तु भरतः स वाचा सज्जमानया |
कृत अन्जलिर् इदम् वाक्यम् राघवम् पुनर् अब्रवीत् || २-११२-९_END
BEGIN_
Bharata, on his part, with trembled limbs, joined his palms in salutation and again
spoke the following words to Rama in a strangled voice:_END

B_2_C_112_9
BEGIN_
राज धर्मम् अनुप्रेक्ष्य कुल धर्म अनुसम्ततिम् |
कर्तुम् अर्हसि काकुत्स्थ मम मातुः च याचनाम् || २-११२-१०_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! Keep in view the continuance of our royal statue and the statute of the
race. You ought to yield to the entreaties of mine and those of your mother."_END

B_2_C_112_10
BEGIN_
रक्षितुम् सुमहद् राज्यम् अहम् एकः तु न उत्सहे |
पौर जानपदामः च अपि रक्तान् रन्जयितुम् तथा || २-११२-११_END
BEGIN_
"I am not able to rule this vast empire alone to the satisfaction of the beloved
inhabitants of town and country!"_END

B_2_C_112_11
BEGIN_
ज्नातयः च हि योधाः च मित्राणि सुहृदः च नः |
त्वाम् एव प्रतिकान्क्षन्ते पर्जन्यम् इव कर्षकाः || २-११२-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Our kith and king, soldiers, companions and allies are waiting for you indeed, as
farmers wait for the rainy clouds."_END

B_2_C_112_12
BEGIN_
इदम् राज्यम् महा प्राज्न स्थापय प्रतिपद्य हि |
शक्तिमान् असि काकुत्स्थ लोकस्य परिपालने || २-११२-१३_END
BEGIN_
"O, the sagacious Rama! Return to the kingdom and keep it in order. You have the
competence to save the world!"_END

B_2_C_112_13
BEGIN_
इत्य् उक्त्वा न्यपतद् भ्रातुः पादयोर् भरतः तदा |
भृशम् सम्प्रार्थयाम् आस रामम् एवम् प्रियम् वदः || २-११२-१४_END
BEGIN_
That Bharata, who was kind-spoken, thus made a fervent appeal to Rama and fell at
his feet._END

B_2_C_112_14
BEGIN_
तम् अन्के भ्रातरम् कृत्वा रामो वचनम् अब्रवीत् |
श्यामम् नलिन पत्र अक्षम् मत्त हंस स्वरः स्वयम् || २-११२-१५_END
BEGIN_
Placing on his lap, that Bharata of dark hue, with eyes resembling lotus-petals and
having a voice like that of a swan in rut, Rama spoke the following words to him:_END

B_2_C_112_15
BEGIN_
आगता त्वाम् इयम् बुद्धिः स्वजा वैनयिकी च या |
भृशम् उत्सहसे तात रक्षितुम् पृथिवीम् अपि || २-११२-१६_END
BEGIN_
"O, my dear brother! You are very much competent to rule the earth, by the intellect
you obtained both inherently and by training."_END

B_2_C_112_16
BEGIN_
अमात्यैः च सुहृद्भिः च बुद्धिमद्भिः च मन्त्रिभिः |
सर्व कार्याणि सम्मन्त्र्य सुमहान्त्य् अपि कारय || २-११२-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Take counsel with your ministers, companions and intelligent counsellors and get
all activities done, even if they are gigantic."_END

B_2_C_112_17
BEGIN_
लक्ष्मीः चन्द्राद् अपेयाद् वा हिमवान् वा हिमम् त्यजेत् |
अतीयात् सागरो वेलाम् न प्रतिज्नाम् अहम् पितुः || २-११२-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Light may go off from the moon; Himalayan mountain may shake off its snows; the sea
may transgress its shores, but I will never be false to my father's vow!"_END

B_2_C_112_18
BEGIN_
कामाद् वा तात लोभाद् वा मात्रा तुभ्यम् इदम् कृतम् |
न तन् मनसि कर्तव्यम् वर्तितव्यम् च मातृवत् || २-११२-१९_END
BEGIN_
"My dear brother! Your mother acted thus, for your sake, out of her affection or
ambition. It should not be carried out in your mind. You ought to obey her as your mother."_END

B_2_C_112_19
BEGIN_
एवम् ब्रुवाणम् भरतः कौसल्या सुतम् अब्रवीत् |
तेजसा आदित्य सम्काशम् प्रतिपच् चन्द्र दर्शनम् || २-११२-२०_END
BEGIN_
Bharata replied (as follows) to Rama, who was speaking as aforesaid and who was
equal to sun by his splendour or to the moon in its first quarter._END

B_2_C_112_20
BEGIN_
अधिरोह आर्य पादाभ्याम् पादुके हेम भूषिते |
एते हि सर्व लोकस्य योग क्षेमम् विधास्यतः || २-११२-२१_END
BEGIN_
"O, noble brother! Pray mount with your feet on the wooden sandals adorned with
gold! Surely, these will bestow, gain and security to all the people!"_END

B_2_C_112_21
BEGIN_
सो अधिरुह्य नर व्याघ्रः पादुके ह्य् अवरुह्य च |
प्रायग्च्छत् सुमहा तेजा भरताय महात्मने || २-११२-२२_END
BEGIN_
Rama, the tiger among men, possessing exceptional glory, placing his feet on the
sandals and leaving them, gave them to the magnanimous Bharata._END

B_2_C_112_22
BEGIN_
स पादुके सम्प्रणम्य रामं वचनम्ब्रवीत् |
चतुर्दश हि वर्षाणि जटाचीरधरो ह्यहम् || २-११२-२३
फलमूलाशनो वीर भवेयम् रघुनंदन |_END
BEGIN_
Bowing before the sandals, Bharata spoke the following words to Rama: "O, Rama the
hero and the tormentator of enemies! For fourteen years, I shall wear matted locks and robes of
bark, live on fruits and roots O Rama, and live outside the city, offering the ruling of the
kingdom to your sandals."_END

B_2_C_112_23
BEGIN_
तवागमनमाकाङ्क्षन् वसन्वै नगराद्बहिः || २-११२-२४
तव पादुकयोर्न्यस्तराज्यतन्त्रः परंतप |
चतुर्दशे तु सम्पूर्णे वर्षेऽहानि रघूत्तम || २-११२-२५
न द्रक्ष्यामि यदि त्वां तु प्रवेक्ष्यामि हुताशनम् |_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! If I do not see you the following day when the fourteenth year has fully
ended, I shall enter the fire once for all."_END

B_2_C_112_24
BEGIN_
तथेति च प्रतिज्ञाय तं परिष्वज्य सादरम् || २-११२-२६
शत्रुघ्नम् च परिष्वज्य भरतं चेदमब्रवीत् |_END
BEGIN_
"So be it" promised Rama, embraced that Bharata with affection, took Shatrughna also
in his arms and spoke to Bharata as follows:_END

B_2_C_112_25
BEGIN_
मातरम् रक्ष कैकेयीम् मा रोषम् कुरु तां प्रति || २-११२-२७
मया च सीतया चैव शप्तो.सि रघुसत्तम |
इत्युक्त्वाश्रुपरीताक्षो भ्रातरं विससर्ज ह || २-११२-२८_END
BEGIN_
"O Bharata! Protect your mother, Kaikeyi. Do not get angry with her. You are taken
vow thus by me and by Seetha." speaking thus, Rama with his eyes filled iwth tears, bade farewell
to his brother._END

B_2_C_112_26
BEGIN_
स पादुके ते भरतः प्रतापवान् |
स्वलम्कृते सम्परिगृह्य धर्मवित् |
प्रदक्षिणम् चैव चकार राघवम् |
चकार चैव उत्तम नाग मूर्धनि || २-११२-२९_END
BEGIN_
The valiant Bharata, who knew righteousness worshipped those sandals which were
well-decorated made a circumambulation to Rama and kept the sandals on the head of an excellent
elephant._END

B_2_C_112_27
BEGIN_
अथ आनुपूर्व्यात् प्रतिपूज्य तम् जनम् |
गुरूमः च मन्त्रि प्रकृतीः तथा अनुजौ |
व्यसर्जयद् राघव वंश वर्धनः |
स्थितः स्व धर्मे हिमवान् इव अचलः || २-११२-३०_END
BEGIN_
Rama, the augmentator of Raghu dynasty, being firm as a Himalayan rock in abiding in
his own righteousness, greeted those men, in accord with their rank, the host of his preceptors,
ministers, subjects and his brothers and bade farewell to all of them._END

B_2_C_112_28
BEGIN_
तम् मातरो बाष्प गृहीत कण्ठो |
दुह्खेन न आमन्त्रयितुम् हि शेकुः |
स तु एव मातृऋर् अभिवाद्य सर्वा |
रुदन् कुटीम् स्वाम् प्रविवेश रामः || २-११२-३१_END
BEGIN_
His mothers, their voices choked with tears due to sorrow, were unable to bid
farewell verbally to Rama. However, Rama himself offered his salutations to all his mothers and
entered his hermitage, weeping._END

B_2_C_113_0
BEGIN_
ततः शिरसि कृत्वा तु पादुके भरतः तदा |
आरुरोह रथम् हृष्टः शत्रुघ्नेन समन्वितः || २-११३-१_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, keeping the sandals on his head, Bharata delightfully ascended his
chariot along with Shatrughna._END

B_2_C_113_1
BEGIN_
वसिष्ठो वामदेवः च जाबालिः च दृढ व्रतः |
अग्रतः प्रययुः सर्वे मन्त्रिणो मन्त्र पूजिताः || २-११३-२_END
BEGIN_
Before him, Vasishta, Vasudeva of firm vows, Jabali and all the ministers
distinguished for their counsels, went ahead._END

B_2_C_113_2
BEGIN_
मन्दाकिनीम् नदीम् रम्याम् प्रान् मुखाः ते ययुः तदा |
प्रदक्षिणम् च कुर्वाणाः चित्र कूटम् महा गिरिम् || २-११३-३_END
BEGIN_
Them, they advanced eastwards, by the charming Mandakini River, after making a round
of Chitrakuta Mountain._END

B_2_C_113_3
BEGIN_
पश्यन् धातु सहस्राणि रम्याणि विविधानि च |
प्रययौ तस्य पार्श्वेन ससैन्यो भरतः तदा || २-११३-४_END
BEGIN_
Observing various types of thousands of enchanting rocks, Bharata advanced along
with his troops along the side of the mountain._END

B_2_C_113_4
BEGIN_
अदूराच् चित्र कूटस्य ददर्श भरतः तदा |
आश्रमम् यत्र स मुनिर् भरद्वाजः कृत आलयः || २-११३-५_END
BEGIN_
In the vicinity of Chitrakuta Mountain, Bharata saw a hermitage where the sage
Bharadwaja resided._END

B_2_C_113_5
BEGIN_
स तम् आश्रमम् आगम्य भरद्वाजस्य बुद्धिमान् |
अवतीर्य रथात् पादौ ववन्दे कुल नन्दनः || २-११३-६_END
BEGIN_
Then, that Bharata endowed with understanding reached that hermitage of Bharadwaja,
descended from his chariot and bowed down to the feet of Bharadwaja in saluation._END

B_2_C_113_6
BEGIN_
ततो हृष्टो भरद्वाजो भरतम् वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् |
अपि कृत्यम् कृतम् तात रामेण च समागतम् || २-११३-७_END
BEGIN_
The, Bharadvaja full of joy, enquired of Bharata saying, "O, dear prince! Has your
purpose been accomplished? Have you met Rama?"_END

B_2_C_113_7
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्तः तु भरतो भरद्वाजेन धीमता |
प्रत्युवाच भरद्वाजम् भरतो धर्म वत्सलः || २-११३-८_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of the learned sage, Bharadvaja, Bharata who was affectionate
towards his brothers, replied to Bharadvaja (as follows)_END

B_2_C_113_8
BEGIN_
स याच्यमानो गुरुणा मया च दृढ विक्रमः |
राघवः परम प्रीतो वसिष्ठम् वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् || २-११३-९_END
BEGIN_
Despite the entreaties of his preceptor and of mine, Rama is unshakeable in his
resolve and most cheerfully spoke the following words to Vasishta._END

B_2_C_113_9
BEGIN_
पितुः प्रतिज्नाम् ताम् एव पालयिष्यामि तत्त्वतः |
चतुर्दश हि वर्षाणि य प्रतिज्ना पितुर् मम || २-११३-१०_END
BEGIN_
"I shall honour the promise of my father scrupulously and reside in the forest for
fourteen years as I promised him."_END

B_2_C_113_10
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्तो महा प्राज्नो वसिष्ठः प्रत्युवाच ह |
वाक्यज्नो वाक्य कुशलम् राघवम् वचनम् महत् || २-११३-११_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Rama, the highly wise Vasishta, the knower of proper mode of
expression, replied to Rama who is the most skilful of orators, in the following great words:_END

B_2_C_113_11
BEGIN_
एते प्रयग्च्छ सम्हृष्टः पादुके हेम भूषिते |
अयोध्यायाम् महा प्राज्न योग क्षेम करे तव || २-११३-१२_END
BEGIN_
"O, the extremely segacious prince! Bestow joyfully thse gold-encrusted sandals of
yours on us and ensure peace and harmony in Ayodhya."_END

B_2_C_113_12
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्तो वसिष्ठेन राघवः प्रान् मुखः स्थितः |
पादुके हेम विकृते मम राज्याय ते ददौ || २-११३-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Hearing the words of Vasishta, Rama stood up and turning to the East, placed his
feet in those sandals and gave them to me as a sign of regency."_END

B_2_C_113_13
BEGIN_
निवृत्तो अहम् अनुज्नातो रामेण सुमहात्मना |
अयोध्याम् एव गग्च्छामि गृहीत्वा पादुके शुभे || २-११३-१४_END
BEGIN_
"Having taken leave of the very high-souled Rama, I turned back after receiving the
auspicious sandals. Now, I am proceeding to Ayodhya."_END

B_2_C_113_14
BEGIN_
एतत् श्रुत्वा शुभम् वाक्यम् भरतस्य महात्मनः |
भरद्वाजः शुभतरम् मुनिर् वाक्यम् उदाहरत् || २-११३-१५_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those auspicious words of the high-souled Bharata, the sage Bharadvaja spoke
to him the following words._END

B_2_C_113_15
BEGIN_
न एतच् चित्रम् नर व्याघ्र शील वृत्तवताम् वर |
यद् आर्यम् त्वयि तिष्ठेत् तु निम्ने वृष्टिम् इव उदकम् || २-११३-१६_END
BEGIN_
"O Bharata the Tiger among men and excellent among those having virtue and good
conduct! There is no surprise that a noble trait prevails in you, as naturally as the water allowed
to go, always settles downwards."_END

B_2_C_113_16
BEGIN_
अमृतः स महा बाहुः पिता दशरथः तव |
यस्य त्वम् ईदृशः पुत्रो धर्म आत्मा धर्म वत्सलः || २-११३-१७_END
BEGIN_
"Your valiant father, Dasaratha, is immortal in having such a son as you are, the
knower of righteousness and loving peity."_END

B_2_C_113_17
BEGIN_
तम् ऋषिम् तु महात्मानम् उक्त वाक्यम् कृत अन्जलिः |
आमन्त्रयितुम् आरेभे चरणाउ उपगृह्य च || २-११३-१८_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of that sage, Bharata with his joined palms, touched his feet in
salutation and began taking leave from him._END

B_2_C_113_18
BEGIN_
ततः प्रदक्षिणम् कृत्वा भरद्वाजम् पुनः पुनः |
भरतः तु ययौ श्रीमान् अयोध्याम् सह मन्त्रिभिः || २-११३-१९_END
BEGIN_
Then, the glorious Bharata made circumambulation again and again to Bharadwaja and
proceeded to Ayodhya along with hims ministers._END

B_2_C_113_19
BEGIN_
यानैः च शकटैः चैव हयैः नागैः च सा चमूः |
पुनर् निवृत्ता विस्तीर्णा भरतस्य अनुयायिनी || २-११३-२०_END
BEGIN_
Thata extensive army of Bharata, following him with vehicles, carts and elephants,
turned back again towards Ayodhya._END

B_2_C_113_20
BEGIN_
ततः ते यमुनाम् दिव्याम् नदीम् तीर्त्वा ऊर्मि मालिनीम् |
ददृशुः ताम् पुनः सर्वे गन्गाम् शिव जलाम् नदीम् || २-११३-२१_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, all of them crossed the charming River Yamuna wreathed with waves and
moreover saw the River Ganga with its pure water._END

B_2_C_113_21
BEGIN_
ताम् रम्य जल सम्पूर्णाम् सम्तीर्य सह बान्धवः |
शृन्ग वेर पुरम् रम्यम् प्रविवेश ससैनिकः || २-११३-२२
शृन्ग वेर पुराद् भूय अयोध्याम् संददर्श ह |_END
BEGIN_
Bharata accompanied by his relative and his army crossed that River Ganga, full of
charming waters and entered the beautiful town of Shringibhera. From Shringibhera, he saw Ayodhya
again._END

B_2_C_113_22
BEGIN_
अयोध्याम् च ततो दृष्ट्वा पित्रा भ्रात्रा विवर्जिताम् |
भरतो दुह्ख सम्तप्तः सारथिम् च इदम् अब्रवीत् || २-११३-२३_END
BEGIN_
Beholding the City of Ayodhya, which was bereft of his father and brother, Bharata
tormented with grief, spoke the following words to the charioteer:_END

B_2_C_113_23
BEGIN_
सारथे पश्य विध्वस्ता अयोध्या न प्रकाशते |
निराकारा निरानन्दा दीना प्रतिहत स्वना || २-११३-२४_END
BEGIN_
"O, Charioteer! See that Ayodhya city, ruined, with a vacant look, joyless,
miserable, and with an impeded voice."_END

B_2_C_114_0
BEGIN_
स्निग्ध गम्भीर घोषेण स्यन्दनेन उपयान् प्रभुः |
अयोध्याम् भरतः क्षिप्रम् प्रविवेश महा यशाः || २-११४-१_END
BEGIN_
The highly illustrious Lord, Bharata riding on a chariot emanating a gentle and deep
sound entered soon the city of Ayodhya._END

B_2_C_114_1
BEGIN_
बिडाल उलूक चरिताम् आलीन नर वारणाम् |
तिमिर अभ्याहताम् कालीम् अप्रकाशाम् निशाम् इव || २-११४-२_END
BEGIN_
He entered the city, frequented by cats and owls, abiding with crouched men and
elephants and looking like a night enveloped by gloom, indistinctness and darkness._END

B_2_C_114_2
BEGIN_
राहु शत्रोः प्रियाम् पत्नीम् श्रिया प्रज्वलित प्रभाम् |
ग्रहेण अभ्युत्थितेन एकाम् रोहिणीम् इव पीडिताम् || २-११४-३_END
BEGIN_
Ayodhya looked like the planet Rohini, the beloved consort of the moon-god (treated
as the enemy by the demon Rahu), tormented by planet Rahu* in the ascendant though ordinarily
invested with an exceedingly bright splendour by virtue of her glory._END

B_2_C_114_3
BEGIN_
अल्प उष्ण क्षुब्ध सलिलाम् घर्म उत्तप्त विहम्गमाम् |
लीन मीन झष ग्राहाम् कृशाम् गिरि नदीम् इव || २-११४-४_END
BEGIN_
Ayodhya further looked emaciated like a mountain stream, whose scanty waters had
become hot and agitated, birds living in which were scorched by the sun, and whose fish, small and
big and alligators had perished._END

B_2_C_114_4
BEGIN_
विधूमाम् इव हेम आभाम् अध्वर अग्नि समुत्थिताम् |
हविर् अभ्युक्षिताम् पश्चात् शिखाम् विप्रलयम् गताम् || २-११४-५_END
BEGIN_
Ayodhya looked like a flame of sacrificial fire which when oblation is poured into
it, rises like a golden cone without smoke and thereafter sinks into extinction (ash)._END

B_2_C_114_5
BEGIN_
विध्वस्त कवचाम् रुग्ण गज वाजि रथ ध्वजाम् |
हत प्रवीराम् आपन्नाम् चमूम् इव महा आहवे || २-११४-६_END
BEGIN_
Ayodhya looked like an afflicted army, shattered of its armour in a major conflict,
whose ensigns borne on horses, elephants and chariots had been torn, and its heroic warriors
slain._END

B_2_C_114_6
BEGIN_
सफेनाम् सस्वनाम् भूत्वा सागरस्य समुत्थिताम् |
प्रशान्त मारुत उद्धूताम् जल ऊर्मिम् इव निह्स्वनाम् || २-११४-७_END
BEGIN_
Ayodhya appeared like the waves of the sea though tosses very high with foam and a
roar, is rendered noiseless, being shaken up by a silent wind._END

B_2_C_114_7
BEGIN_
त्यक्ताम् यज्न आयुधैः सर्वैर् अभिरूपैः च याजकैः |
सुत्या काले विनिर्वृत्ते वेदिम् गत रवाम् इव || २-११४-८_END
BEGIN_
Ayodhya appeared like a sacred altar, which, when the period of offering oblations
into fire has completely expired, has been cleared of all sacrificial implements and deserted of
recitations by the learned priests._END

B_2_C_114_8
BEGIN_
गोष्ठ मध्ये स्थिताम् आर्ताम् अचरन्तीम् नवम् तृणम् |
गो वृषेण परित्यक्ताम् गवाम् पत्नीम् इव उत्सुकाम् || २-११४-९_END
BEGIN_
Ayodhya appeared like restless kine, deprived of the bull, who cease to graze in new
pastures and stand in the cow-pen, dispirited._END

B_2_C_114_9
BEGIN_
प्रभा करालैः सुस्निग्धैः प्रज्वलद्भिर् इव उत्तमैः |
वियुक्ताम् मणिभिर् जात्यैर् नवाम् मुक्ता आवलीम् इव || २-११४-१०_END
BEGIN_
Ayodhya was resembling a new pearl-necklace, bereft of well- polished dazzling and
excellent gems, rubies and the like, of genuine quality._END

B_2_C_114_10
BEGIN_
सहसा चलिताम् स्थानान् महीम् पुण्य क्षयाद् गताम् |
सम्हृत द्युति विस्ताराम् ताराम् इव दिवः च्युताम् || २-११४-११_END
BEGIN_
Ayodhya appeared like a meteor, which moved from its position with its virtue
exhausted, soon dropped from the sky and fallen to earth, deprived of its splendour._END

B_2_C_114_11
BEGIN_
पुष्प नद्धाम् वसन्त अन्ते मत्त भ्रमर शालिनीम् |
द्रुत दाव अग्नि विप्लुष्टाम् क्लान्ताम् वन लताम् इव || २-११४-१२_END
BEGIN_
Ayodhya appeared like a flowering creeper laden with blossom in the spring-tide,
frequented by a swarm of intoxicated bees, that is suddenly consumed by a forest fire and
withering._END

B_2_C_114_12
BEGIN_
सम्मूढ निगमाम् सर्वाम् सम्क्षिप्त विपण आपणाम् |
प्रग्च्छन्न शशि नक्षत्राम् द्याम् इव अम्बु धरैर् वृताम् || २-११४-१३_END
BEGIN_
With its senseless traffic paralyzed and with its fairs and markets closed, Ayodhya
resembled like a firmament, covered with clouds, with the moon and stars obscured._END

B_2_C_114_13
BEGIN_
क्षीण पान उत्तमैर् भिन्नैः शरावैर् अभिसम्वृताम् |
हत शौण्डाम् इव आकाशे पान भूमिम् असंस्कृताम् || २-११४-१४_END
BEGIN_
Ayodhya appeared splendourless, like a deserted and uncleaned tavern, with its
vendor of spirituous liquors killed, the excellent wine expended, its drinking pots and glasses
broken and the pieces stewn in disorder._END

B_2_C_114_14
BEGIN_
वृक्ण भूमि तलाम् निम्नाम् वृक्ण पात्रैः समावृताम् |
उपयुक्त उदकाम् भग्नाम् प्रपाम् निपतिताम् इव || २-११४-१५_END
BEGIN_
Ayodhya resembled a cistern erected for storage and distribution of water, but now
broken and collapsed with its platform riven and sunk, and covered with broken jars and earthen
vessels, its water having been used up._END

B_2_C_114_15
BEGIN_
विपुलाम् वितताम् चैव युक्त पाशाम् तरस्विनाम् |
भूमौ बाणैर् विनिष्कृत्ताम् पतिताम् ज्याम् इव आयुधात् || २-११४-१६_END
BEGIN_
Ayodhya resembled a bow-string, which was large and bent, with suitable noose at
both ends, but severed from the bow by the arrows of heroes and fallen to the ground._END

B_2_C_114_16
BEGIN_
सहसा युद्ध शौण्डेन हय आरोहेण वाहिताम् |
निहताम् प्रतिसैन्येन वडवामिव पातिताम् || २-११४-१७_END
BEGIN_
Ayodhya appeared like a mare, urged on suddenly by a horse-man, skilled in war-fare
and fallen down when killed by the opposite army._END

B_2_C_114_17
BEGIN_
भरतस्तु रथस्थः सन् श्रीमान् दशरथात्मजः |
वाहयन्तं रथश्रेष्ठं सारथिम् वाक्यमब्रवीत् || २-११४-१८_END
BEGIN_
Sitting in the chariot, the glorious Bharata, the son of Dasaratha, spoke the
following words to the charioteer who was riding his excellent chariot:_END

B_2_C_114_18
BEGIN_
किम् नु खल्वद्य गम्बीरो मूर्चितो न निशम्यते |
यथापुरमयोध्यायाम् गीतवादित्रनिस्वनः || २-११४-१९_END
BEGIN_
"How is it that the deep and intensified sound of vocal and instrumental music is
not heard as before in Ayodhya today?"_END

B_2_C_114_19
BEGIN_
वारुणीमदगन्धश्च माल्यगन्धश्च मूर्चितः |
धूपितागरुगन्धश्च न प्रवाति समन्ततः || २-११४-२०_END
BEGIN_
"The intoxicating odour of spirituous liquor or the fragrance of floral garlands or
the aroma of sandal and aloe-wood fumes, which used to be spread once on all sides, are not being
wafted."_END

B_2_C_114_20
BEGIN_
यानप्र वरघोषश्च स्निग्धश्च हयनिस्वनः |
प्रमत्तगजनादश्च महांश्च रथनिस्वनः || २-११४-२१
नेदानीम् श्रूयते पुर्यामस्याम् रामे विवासिते || २-११४-२२_END
BEGIN_
"O, Sumantra! I do not hear, as before, the sound of the horses, the sound of the
intoxicating elephants and the clattering of the great chariots in this city now."_END

B_2_C_114_21
BEGIN_
चन्दनागारुगन्धांश्च महार्हश्च नवस्रजः || २-११४-२३
गते हि रामे तरुणाः संतप्ता नोपभुञ्जते |_END
BEGIN_
"Rama, having left Ayodhya, the distressful youth are not making use of the perfumes
like sandal-wood, aloe wood as also the most admirable and fresh floral garlands."_END

B_2_C_114_22
BEGIN_
बहिर्यात्रां न गच्छन्ति चित्रमाअल्यधरा नराः || २-११४-२४
नोत्सवाः सम्प्रवर्तन्ते रामशोकार्दिते पुरे |_END
BEGIN_
"In the city afflicted by Rama's desertion, people are not going out for
pleasure-trips, wearing colourful garlands nor festivals are observed by them."_END

B_2_C_114_23
BEGIN_
सह नूनम् मम भ्रात्रा पुरस्यास्य द्युतिर्गता || २-११४-२५
न हि राजत्ययोध्येयं सासारेवार्जुनी क्षपा |_END
BEGIN_
"The lustre of Ayodhya has departed along with my brother. It is certain. This
Ayodhya is not shining indeed, like a rainy night at the time of the waning moon."_END

B_2_C_114_24
BEGIN_
कदा नु खलु मे भ्राता महोत्सव इवागतः || २-११४-२६
जनयिष्यत्ययोध्यायां हर्षम् ग्रीष्म इवाम्बुदः |_END
BEGIN_
"When will my brother return, like a carnival, diffusing joy in Ayodhya, as do the
autumnal rains?"_END

B_2_C_114_25
BEGIN_
तरुणैः चारु वेषैः च नरैर् उन्नत गामिभिः |
सम्पतद्भिर् अयोध्यायाम् न विभान्ति महा पथाः || २-११४-२७_END
BEGIN_
"The highways in Ayodhya are not glittering with youthful people, richly attired,
bearing themselves bravely and roaming about in groups."_END

B_2_C_114_26
BEGIN_
एवम् बहु विधम् जल्पन् विवेश वसतिम् पितुः |
तेन हीनाम् नर इन्द्रेण सिम्ह हीनाम् गुहाम् इव || २-११४-२८_END
BEGIN_
Thus speaking in many ways, Bharata entered his father's house, bereft of that
emperor and which resembled a cave bereft of a lion._END

B_2_C_114_27
BEGIN_
तदा तदन्तःपुरमुज्घितप्रभम् |
सुरैरिवोत्सृष्टमभास्करम् दिनम् |
निरीक्ष्य सर्वम् तु विविक्तमात्मवान् |
मुमोच बाष्पं भरतः सुदुःखितः || २-११४-२९_END
BEGIN_
Bharata, though a composed man himself, shed tears by seeing that entire empty
gynaecium, looking like a day without the sun with its relinquished radiance._END

B_2_C_115_0
BEGIN_
ततो निक्षिप्य मातृऋः स अयोध्यायाम् दृढ व्रतः |
भरतः शोक सम्तप्तो गुरून् इदम् अथ अब्रवीत् || २-११५-१_END
BEGIN_
Having brought his mothers back to Ayodhya; Bharata, fixed in his resolve but sore
stricken with grief, spoke to Vasishta and the elders (as follows)_END

B_2_C_115_1
BEGIN_
नन्दि ग्रामम् गमिष्यामि सर्वान् आमन्त्रये अद्य वः |
तत्र दुह्खम् इदम् सर्वम् सहिष्ये राघवम् विना || २-११५-२_END
BEGIN_
"I am going to Nandigrama village. I take leave of all of you. There, I shall be
able to endure all this woe, occasioned by Rama's absence."_END

B_2_C_115_2
BEGIN_
गतः च हि दिवम् राजा वनस्थः च गुरुर् मम |
रामम् प्रतीक्षे राज्याय स हि राजा महा यशाः || २-११५-३_END
BEGIN_
"The king Dasaratha went to heaven. My elder brother is in the forest. I shall await
for Rama to return to the kingdom; since verily he alone is the celebrated Lord of Ayodhya."_END

B_2_C_115_3
BEGIN_
एतत् श्रुत्वा शुभम् वाक्यम् भरतस्य महात्मनः |
अब्रुवन् मन्त्रिणः सर्वे वसिष्ठः च पुरोहितः || २-११५-४_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those auspicious words of the magnanimous Bharata, Vasishta the preceptor
and all the ministers spoke as follows:_END

B_2_C_115_4
BEGIN_
सदृशम् श्लाघनीयम् च यद् उक्तम् भरत त्वया |
वचनम् भ्रातृ वात्सल्याद् अनुरूपम् तव एव तत् || २-११५-५_END
BEGIN_
"O, Bharata! The words which your have spoken by you in devotion to your brother are
very much appreciable. It is worthy of you alone."_END

B_2_C_115_5
BEGIN_
नित्यम् ते बन्धु लुब्धस्य तिष्ठतो भ्रातृ सौहृदे |
आर्य मार्गम् प्रपन्नस्य न अनुमन्येत कः पुमान् || २-११५-६_END
BEGIN_
"What man would not approve of the proposal of your highness, who are deeply
fascinated of your relative, always affectionate to your brother and devoted to the path of
elders?"_END

B_2_C_115_6
BEGIN_
मन्त्रिणाम् वचनम् श्रुत्वा यथा अभिलषितम् प्रियम् |
अब्रवीत् सारथिम् वाक्यम् रथो मे युज्यताम् इति || २-११५-७_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the affectionate words of his counsellors, who spoke according to his wish,
Bharata said to his charioteer, "Let my chariot be made ready!"_END

B_2_C_115_7
BEGIN_
प्रहृष्ट वदनः सर्वा मातृऋः समभिवाद्य सः |
आरुरोह रथम् श्रीमान् शत्रुघ्नेन समन्वितः || २-११५-८_END
BEGIN_
The illustrious Bharata, looking pleased and having offered salutation to all his
mothers, entered his chariot along with Shatrughna._END

B_2_C_115_8
BEGIN_
आरुह्य तु रथम् शीघ्रम् शत्रुघ्न भरताउ उभौ |
ययतुः परम प्रीतौ वृतौ मन्त्रि पुरोहितैः || २-११५-९_END
BEGIN_
Both Shatrughna and Bharata, having quickly mounted the chariot and exceedingly
rejoiced, set out, accompanied by ministers and family-priests._END

B_2_C_115_9
BEGIN_
अग्रतो पुरवः तत्र वसिष्ठ प्रमुखा द्विजाः |
प्रययुः प्रान् मुखाः सर्वे नन्दि ग्रामो यतो अभवत् || २-११५-१०_END
BEGIN_
All the preceptors there, headed by Vasishta and other brahmanas being in the
forefront, proceeded eastward, in which direction Nandigrama village was situated._END

B_2_C_115_10
BEGIN_
बलम् च तद् अनाहूतम् गज अश्व रथ सम्कुलम् |
प्रययौ भरते याते सर्वे च पुर वासिनः || २-११५-११_END
BEGIN_
When Bharata had left, the army too, abounding in elephants, horses and chariots
marched unbidden. The residents of the city also followed suit._END

B_2_C_115_11
BEGIN_
रथस्थः स तु धर्म आत्मा भरतो भ्रातृ वत्सलः |
नन्दि ग्रामम् ययौ तूर्णम् शिरस्य् आधाय पादुके || २-११५-१२_END
BEGIN_
The magnanimous Bharata, affectionate of his brother, bearing the sandals belong to
Rama on his head, set out for Nandigrama._END

B_2_C_115_12
BEGIN_
ततः तु भरतः क्षिप्रम् नन्दि ग्रामम् प्रविश्य सः |
अवतीर्य रथात् तूर्णम् गुरून् इदम् उवाच ह || २-११५-१३_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, having entered Nandigrama briskly Bharata descended his chariot quickly
and spoke to his preceptors as follows:_END

B_2_C_115_13
BEGIN_
एतद् राज्यम् मम भ्रात्रा दत्तम् सम्न्यासवत् स्वयम् |
योग क्षेम वहे च इमे पादुके हेम भूषिते || २-११५-१४_END
BEGIN_
"My brother, Rama has given to me this kingdom as a trust. These sandals,
embellished with gold diffuse gain and security to the people."_END

B_2_C_115_14
BEGIN_
भरतः शिरसा कृत्वा सन्न्यासम् पादुके ततः |
अब्रवीद्दुःखसम्तप्तः सर्वं प्रकृतिमण्डलम् || २-११५-१५_END
BEGIN_
Having dedicated the sacred trust to the wooden sandals, Bharata sore-stricken with
anguish, spoke to the entire body of his ministers as follows:_END

B_2_C_115_15
BEGIN_
चत्रम् धारयत क्षिप्रमार्यपादाविमौ मतौ |
अभ्याम् राज्ये स्थितो धर्मः पादुकाभ्याम् गुरोर्मम || २-११५-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Hold the state canopy speedily over these wooden sandals, which have been accepted
as symbols of the feet of Rama, my noble brother. By the presence of these wooden sandals of my
brother here, a piety has been established in the kingdom."_END

B_2_C_115_16
BEGIN_
भ्रात्रा हि मयि सम्न्यासो निक्षिप्तः सौहृदादयम् |
तमिमम् पालयिष्यामि राघवागमनम् प्रति २-११५-१७_END
BEGIN_
"As a mark of compassion, this trust has been placed at my disposal, by my brother.
There trust as such will be preserved till his return."_END

B_2_C_115_17
BEGIN_
क्षिप्रम् सम्योजयित्वा तु राघवस्य पुनः स्वयम् |
चरणौ तौ तु रामस्य द्रक्ष्यामि सहपादुकौ || २-११५-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Having restored these wooden sandals personally to Rama's feet immediately after
his return, I shall behold those feet of Rama along with these sandals."_END

B_2_C_115_18
BEGIN_
ततो निक्षिप्तभारोऽहम् राघवेण समागतः |
निवेद्य गुरवे राज्यम् भजिष्ये गुरुवृत्तिताम् २-११५-१९_END
BEGIN_
"Restoring the kingdom to my elder brother, when re-united with him and thereby
laying down the burden, I shall then assume the role of a servant of my elder brother."_END

B_2_C_115_19
BEGIN_
ताघवाय च सम्न्यासम् दत्त्वेमे वरपादुके |
राज्यम् चेदमयोध्याम् च धूतपापोभवामि च २-११५-२०_END
BEGIN_
"By giving away these excellent wooden sandals, the symbols of trust, this kingdom,
as well as the City of Ayodhya to Rama, I shall be washed of all my sins."_END

B_2_C_115_20
BEGIN_
अभिषिक्ते तु काकुत्थ्से प्रहृष्टमुदिते जने |
प्रीतिर्मम यशश्चैव भवेद्राज्याच्चतुर्गुणम् || २-११५-२१_END
BEGIN_
"Rama will be installed and his subjects made happy. It will be a four-fold more
fame and happiness for me than that having obtained from the kingdom."_END

B_2_C_115_21
BEGIN_
एवम् तु विलपन्धीनो भरतः स महायशाः |
नन्दिग्रामेऽकरोद्राज्यम् दुःखितो मन्त्रिभिस्सह || २-११५-२२_END
BEGIN_
The highly illustrious Bharata though a distressed man, thus lamenting and pained,
looked after the state administration along with his ministers from Nandigrama._END

B_2_C_115_22
BEGIN_
स वल्कलजटाधारी मुनिवेषधरः प्रभुः |
नन्दिग्रामेऽवसद्वीरः ससैन्यो भरतस्तदा २-११५-२३_END
BEGIN_
Assuming bark robes and matted locks in the guise of an ascetic, the lord and the
hero Bharata dwelt in Nandigrama, protected by the army._END

B_2_C_115_23
BEGIN_
रामागमनमाकाङ्क्षन् भरतो भ्रातृवत्सलः |
भ्रातुर्वचनकारी च प्रतिज्ञापारगस्तदा || २-११५-२४
पादुके त्वभिषिच्याथ नन्दिग्रामेऽवसत्तथा |_END
BEGIN_
Bharata, obedient to his elder brother, affectionate of his brothers and faithful to
his vow, thus resided in Nandigrama, coronating the wooden sandals on the throne and wishing always
for the return of Rama._END

B_2_C_115_24
BEGIN_
स वालव्यजनम् चत्रम् धारयामास स स्वयम् || २-११५-२५
भरतः शासनम् सर्वम् पादुकाभ्याम् निवेदयन् |_END
BEGIN_
Reporting all the royal orders to the wooden sandals, Bharata was holding the royal
canopy together with the chowrie to those sandals._END

B_2_C_115_25
BEGIN_
ततस्तु भरतः श्रीमानभिषिच्यार्यपादुके || २-११५-२६
तदधीनस्तदा राज्यम् कारयामास सर्वदा |_END
BEGIN_
Coronating the wooden sandals of his elder brother, the illustrious Bharata
thereafter carried out the state administration, always maintaining his subservience to them._END

B_2_C_115_26
BEGIN_
तदा हि यत्कार्यमुपैति किंचि |
दुपायनम् चोपहृतम् महार्हम् |
स पादुकाभ्याम् प्रथमम् निवेद्य |
चकार पश्चाद्भरतो यथावत् || २-११५-२७_END
BEGIN_
Whatever a small affair of the state came up or whenever a high-valued gift was
offered, Bharata used to report that matter to the wooden sandals and then only dealt with it in
the proper way afterwards._END

B_2_C_116_0
BEGIN_
प्रतिप्रयाते भरते वसन् रामः तपो वने |
लक्षयाम् आस स उद्वेगम् अथ औत्सुक्यम् तपस्विनाम् || २-११६-१_END
BEGIN_
Bharata having returned (to Ayodhya), Rama who was dwelling in the woods, observed
anxiety accompanied by perturbation among the sages._END

B_2_C_116_1
BEGIN_
ये तत्र चित्र कूटस्य पुरस्तात् तापस आश्रमे |
रामम् आश्रित्य निरताः तान् अलक्षयद् उत्सुकान् || २-११६-२_END
BEGIN_
He saw there those ascetics-who were formerly quite pleased in that hermitage at
Chitrakuta depending as they did on Rama- anxious._END

B_2_C_116_2
BEGIN_
नयनैर् भृकुटीभिः च रामम् निर्दिश्य शन्किताः |
अन्योन्यम् उपजल्पन्तः शनैः चक्रुर् मिथः कथाः || २-११६-३_END
BEGIN_
Pointing out to Rama through the movements of their eyes and eye-brows manifesting
their anxiety, they whispered among themselves, narrating some legends in secret._END

B_2_C_116_3
BEGIN_
तेषाम् औत्सुक्यम् आलक्ष्य रामः तु आत्मनि शन्कितः |
कृत अन्जलिर् उवाच इदम् ऋषिम् कुल पतिम् ततः || २-११६-४_END
BEGIN_
Perceiving their distress, Rama was filled with apprehension about himself and with
joined palms spoke the following words to a sage, the leader of that community of ascetics:_END

B_2_C_116_4
BEGIN_
न कच्चिद् भगवन् किंचित् पूर्व वृत्तम् इदम् मयि |
दृश्यते विकृतम् येन विक्रियन्ते तपस्विनः || २-११६-५_END
BEGIN_
"O venerable sage! I fear that the conduct of my forefathers is not seen in me or
there is some change for the worse in me, due to which the ascetics feel agitated."_END

B_2_C_116_5
BEGIN_
प्रमादाच् चरितम् कच्चित् किंचिन् न अवरजस्य मे |
लक्ष्मणस्य ऋषिभिर् दृष्टम् न अनुरूपम् इव आत्मनः || २-११६-६_END
BEGIN_
"Has my younger brother, the high-souled Lakshmana, through inadvertence, behaved
unworthy of him while the sages were seeing?"_END

B_2_C_116_6
BEGIN_
कच्चित् शुश्रूषमाणा वः शुश्रूषण परा मयि |
प्रमदा अभ्युचिताम् वृत्तिम् सीता युक्तम् न वर्तते || २-११६-७_END
BEGIN_
"I hope that Seetha, who is serving you and who is keen in serving me, does not, I
am afraid, behaved properly, according to the conduct suitable for women."_END

B_2_C_116_7
BEGIN_
अथ ऋषिर् जरया वृद्धः तपसा च जराम् गतः |
वेपमान इव उवाच रामम् भूत दया परम् || २-११६-८_END
BEGIN_
Then, that grown-up sage, who was elderly both by age and penance, appeared
trembling and spoke to Rama, who was ever compassionate to all beings, as follows:_END

B_2_C_116_8
BEGIN_
कुतः कल्याण सत्त्वायाः कल्याण अभिरतेः तथा |
चलनम् तात वैदेह्याः तपस्विषु विशेषतः || २-११६-९_END
BEGIN_
"O, dear Rama! What is there for us the ascetics to fear above all from Seetha, who
is natural in her disposition and is the follower of virtue?"_END

B_2_C_116_9
BEGIN_
त्वन् निमित्तम् इदम् तावत् तापसान् प्रति वर्तते |
रक्षोभ्यः तेन सम्विग्नाः कथयन्ति मिथः कथाः || २-११६-१०_END
BEGIN_
"It is on account of demons, who, through enmity to you, have begun to oppress the
sages. Alarmed by it, they discuss with each other how they can best defend themselves."_END

B_2_C_116_10
BEGIN_
रावण अवरजः कश्चित् खरो नाम इह राक्षसः |
उत्पाट्य तापसान् सर्वान् जन स्थान निकेतनान् || २-११६-११
धृष्टः च जित काशी च नृशंसः पुरुष अदकः |
अवलिप्तः च पापः च त्वाम् च तात न मृष्यते || २-११६-१२_END
BEGIN_
"O, darling! Here, a demon called Khara, Ravana's younger brother- who is a boaster,
victorious in battle, cruel and eater of human flesh, haughty and sinful-having uprooted all the
ascetics who dwell in Janasthana, is unable to endure you also."_END

B_2_C_116_11
BEGIN_
त्वम् यदा प्रभृति ह्य् अस्मिन्न् आश्रमे तात वर्तसे |
तदा प्रभृति रक्षांसि विप्रकुर्वन्ति तापसान् || २-११६-१३_END
BEGIN_
"My darling! From which time you came to dwell in this hermitage, from that time
inwards, the demons continue to ill-treat the ascetics."_END

B_2_C_116_12
BEGIN_
दर्शयन्ति हि बीभत्सैः क्रूरैर् भीषणकैर् अपि |
नाना रूपैर् विरूपैः च रूपैर् असुख दर्शनैः || २-११६-१४_END
BEGIN_
"They appear in grotesque and harmful forms, filling them with terror, in diverse
forms and possessing ugly and unnatural demeanor."_END

B_2_C_116_13
BEGIN_
अप्रशस्तैर् अशुचिभिः सम्प्रयोज्य च तापसान् |
प्रतिघ्नन्त्य् अपरान् क्षिप्रम् अनार्याः पुरतः स्थितः || २-११६-१५_END
BEGIN_
"Flinging filthy and inauspicious objects on some of the ascetics, the wicked demons
stand in front of them and kill some ascetics too."_END

B_2_C_116_14
BEGIN_
तेषु तेषु आश्रमस्थानेषु अबुद्धम् अवलीय च |
रमन्ते तापसामः तत्र नाशयन्तो अल्प चेतसः || २-११६-१६_END
BEGIN_
"Having themselves in those hermitages unnoticed, those evil-minded demons delight
themselves in destroying the ascetics there."_END

B_2_C_116_15
BEGIN_
अपक्षिपन्ति स्रुग् भाण्डान् अग्नीन् सिन्चन्ति वारिणा |
कलशामः च प्रमृद्नन्ति हवने समुपस्थिते || २-११६-१७_END
BEGIN_
"At the time of pouring oblations into the sacred fire, they scatter the sacrificial
vessels, sprinkle the fires with water and break the water-pots."_END

B_2_C_116_16
BEGIN_
तैर् दुरात्मभिर् आविष्टान् आश्रमान् प्रजिहासवः |
गमनाय अन्य देशस्य चोदयन्त्य् ऋषयो अद्य माम् || २-११६-१८_END
BEGIN_
"Resolved to leave these retreats that have been invaded by evil spirits, the
ascetics today are urging me to go to another area."_END

B_2_C_116_17
BEGIN_
तत् पुरा राम शारीराम् उपहिंसाम् तपस्विषु |
दर्शयति हि दुष्टाः ते त्यक्ष्याम इमम् आश्रमम् || २-११६-१९_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! Before those wicked beings indeed show bodily injury to the ascetics, we
are abandoning this hermitage."_END

B_2_C_116_18
BEGIN_
बहु मूल फलम् चित्रम् अविदूराद् इतो वनम् |
पुराण आश्रमम् एव अहम् श्रयिष्ये सगणः पुनः || २-११६-२०_END
BEGIN_
"Not far from here, there is a colourful grove yielding many roots and fruits. I
will take shelter again in that previous hermitage itself, along with an assembly of sages."_END

B_2_C_116_19
BEGIN_
खरः त्वय्य् अपि च अयुक्तम् पुरा तात प्रवर्तते |
सह अस्माभिर् इतो गग्च्छ यदि बुद्धिः प्रवर्तते || २-११६-२१_END
BEGIN_
"O, darling! Khara, the demon will behave unjustly with you in the same way. If your
mind feels so inclined, come along with us from here."_END

B_2_C_116_20
BEGIN_
सकलत्रस्य संदेहो नित्यम् यत् तस्य राघव |
समर्थस्य अपि हि सतो वासो दुह्ख इह अद्य ते || २-११६-२२_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! To you, who live with your wife, though you are competent and ever
watchful, there is a danger. Your stay here is conduced with misery now."_END

B_2_C_116_21
BEGIN_
इत्य् उक्तवन्तम् रामः तम् राज पुत्रः तपस्विनम् |
न शशाक उत्तरैर् वाक्यैर् अवरोद्धुम् समुत्सुकम् || २-११६-२३_END
BEGIN_
Rama the prince could not with his responsive words desist the said sage when he had
spoken as aforesaid, eager as he was to leave the place._END

B_2_C_116_22
BEGIN_
अभिनन्द्य समापृग्च्छ्य समाधाय च राघवम् |
स जगाम आश्रमम् त्यक्त्वा कुलैः कुल पतिः सह || २-११६-२४_END
BEGIN_
Having greeted, bidding farewell and justifying his statement to Rama, that leader
of the community departed, leaving the hermitage, along with a host of sages._END

B_2_C_116_23
BEGIN_
रामः संसाध्य तु ऋषि गणम् अनुगमना |
देशात् तस्माच्चित् कुल पतिम् अभिवाद्य ऋषिम् |
सम्यक् प्रीतैः तैर् अनुमत उपदिष्ट अर्थः |
पुण्यम् वासाय स्व निलयम् उपसम्पेदे || २-११६-२५_END
BEGIN_
Accompanying them for a distance from that place, bidding farewell to that group of
sages, offering his salutation to that ascetic, the leader of the community and taking leave of
them, who were well-pleased and having received their counsel, Rama returned to his dwelling, which
was sacred to reside._END

B_2_C_116_24
BEGIN_
आश्रमम् तु ऋषि विरहितम् प्रभुः |
क्षणम् अपि न जहौ स राघवः |
राघवम् हि सततम् अनुगताः |
स्तापसाः च ऋषि चरित धृत गुणाः || २-११६-२६_END
BEGIN_
That Rama, the lord, did not leave even for a moment that hermitage that had been
deserted by the sages. But some ascetics among them who had fixed their mind on Rama (who followed
the conduct of the sages) constantly followed Rama._END

B_2_C_117_0
BEGIN_
राघवः तु अपयातेषु तपस्विषु विचिन्तयन् |
न तत्र अरोचयद् वासम् कारणैर् बहुभिः तदा || २-११७-१_END
BEGIN_
Thereafter, when the sages departed, Rama, reflecting again and again, found no
pleasure to remain in that place for many reasons._END

B_2_C_117_1
BEGIN_
इह मे भरतो दृष्टो मातरः च सनागराः |
सा च मे स्मृतिर् अन्वेति तान् नित्यम् अनुशोचतः || २-११७-२_END
BEGIN_
"It is here that Bharata, my mother along with the inhabitants of the city visited
me. That memory haunts me, who lament for them daily."_END

B_2_C_117_2
BEGIN_
स्कन्ध आवार निवेशेन तेन तस्य महात्मनः |
हय हस्ति करीषैः च उपमर्दः कृतो भृशम् || २-११७-३_END
BEGIN_
"The dry dung of horses and elephants of that high souled Bharata's encamped army
caused much spoliation (around here)."_END

B_2_C_117_3
BEGIN_
तस्माद् अन्यत्र गग्च्छाम इति संचिन्त्य राघवः |
प्रातिष्ठत स वैदेह्या लक्ष्मणेन च सम्गतः || २-११७-४_END
BEGIN_
"We shall, therefore, move elsewhere", pondering thus, Rama along with Seetha and
Lakshmana left that place._END

B_2_C_117_4
BEGIN_
सो अत्रेर् आश्रमम् आसाद्य तम् ववन्दे महा यशाः |
तम् च अपि भगवान् अत्रिः पुत्रवत् प्रत्यपद्यत || २-११७-५_END
BEGIN_
On the way, after reaching the hermitage of a sage called Atri, the highly
celebrated Rama offered salutation to that sage. The venerable sage, Atri too received him as his
own son._END

B_2_C_117_5
BEGIN_
स्वयम् आतिथ्यम् आदिश्य सर्वम् अस्य सुसत्कृतम् |
सौमित्रिम् च महा भागाम् सीताम् च समसान्त्वयत् || २-११७-६_END
BEGIN_
Offering personally, abundant hospitality with full honours to Rama, the sage Atri
rendered equal honour to Lakshmana and the highly blessed Seetha too._END

B_2_C_117_6
BEGIN_
पत्नीम् च तम् अनुप्राप्ताम् वृद्धाम् आमन्त्र्य सत्कृताम् |
सान्त्वयाम् आस धर्मज्नः सर्व भूत हिते रतः || २-११७-७_END
BEGIN_
Atri, who knew righteousness and who was interested in the welfare of all beings,
called his aged wife Anasuya who had just come there, she who was revered by all and addressed
gently to her._END

B_2_C_117_7
BEGIN_
अनसूयाम् महा भागाम् तापसीम् धर्म चारिणीम् |
प्रतिगृह्णीष्व वैदेहीम् अब्रवीद् ऋषि सत्तमः || २-११७-८
रामाय च आचचक्षे ताम् तापसीम् धर्म चारिणीम् |_END
BEGIN_
Atri excellent sage spoke to the illustrious Anasuya, rich in asceticism and who
lived a pious life, saying "You welcome Videha's daughter!" and thereafter introduced that virtuous
female ascetic to Rama (as follows):_END

B_2_C_117_8
BEGIN_
दश वर्षाण्य् अनावृष्ट्या दग्धे लोके निरन्तरम् || २-११७-९
यया मूल फले सृष्टे जाह्नवी च प्रवर्तिता |
उग्रेण तपसा युक्ता नियमैः च अप्य् अलम्कृता || २-११७-१०
दश वर्ष सहस्राणि यया तप्तम् महत् तपः |
अनसूया व्रतैः तात प्रत्यूहाः च निबर्हिताः || २-११७-११
देव कार्य निमित्तम् च यया सम्त्वरमाणया |
दश रात्रम् कृत्वा रात्रिः सा इयम् माता इव ते अनघ || २-११७-१२_END
BEGIN_
"O, Irreproachable Rama! When the earth was burnt up by drought without break for
ten years, this virtuous woman produced fruit and roots, caused the River Jahnavi to flow here,
undergoing a rigid mortification enriched by pious observances, by whom the most severe asceticism
was practised for ten thousand years and obstacles were done away with and by whom for the reason
of a divine command, in a great hurry ten nights were reduced to one night.* This Anasuya, who has
bathed after completion of the voes, is like a mother to you."_END

B_2_C_117_9
BEGIN_
ताम् इमाम् सर्व भूतानाम् नमः कार्याम् यशस्विनीम् |
अभिगग्च्छतु वैदेही वृद्धाम् अक्रोधनाम् सदा || २-११७-१३_END
BEGIN_
"Let Seetha find refuge with that ascetic, who is revered by all the beings, famous
as she is and though old is ever free from anger."_END

B_2_C_117_10
BEGIN_
एवम् ब्रुवाणम् तम् ऋषिम् तथा इत्य् उक्त्वा स राघवः |
सीताम् उवाच धर्मज्नाम् इदम् वचनम् उत्तमम् || २-११७-१४_END
BEGIN_
Saying "Be it so" to the aforesaid sage, who was speaking thus, Rama spoke to the
virtuous Seetha, the following excellent words:_END

B_2_C_117_11
BEGIN_
राज पुत्रि श्रुतम् तु एतन् मुनेर् अस्य समीरितम् |
श्रेयो अर्थम् आत्मनः शीघ्रम् अभिगग्च्छ तपस्विनीम् || २-११७-१५_END
BEGIN_
"O, princess! You have heard what the sage has said. For your own good, approach the
saintly Anasuya without delay."_END

B_2_C_117_12
BEGIN_
सीता तु एतद् वचः श्रुत्वा राघवस्य हित एषिणी |
ताम् अत्रि पत्नीम् धर्मज्नाम् अभिचक्राम मैथिली || २-११७-१६_END
BEGIN_
Hearing these words of Rama, who is desirous of her welfare, Seetha the daughter of
Mithila circumambulated around Anasuya, Atri's wife, who knows piety._END

B_2_C_117_13
BEGIN_
शिथिलाम् वलिताम् वृद्धाम् जरा पाण्डुर मूर्धजाम् |
सततम् वेपमान अन्गीम् प्रवाते कदली यथा || २-११७-१७
ताम् तु सीता महा भागाम् अनसूयाम् पति व्रताम् |
अभ्यवादयद् अव्यग्रा स्वम् नाम समुदाहरत् || २-११७-१८_END
BEGIN_
Seetha coolly and reverently paid homage to that fortunate Anasuya, a devoted and
virtuous wife, who was feeble, wrinkled, aged, with her hair turned grey due to old age, and whose
frame constantly shook like a banana tree in a storm. Seetha introduced herself, by announcing her
name to Anasuya._END

B_2_C_117_14
BEGIN_
अभिवाद्य च वैदेही तापसीम् ताम् अनिन्दिताम् |
बद्ध अन्जलि पुटा हृष्टा पर्यपृग्च्छद् अनामयम् || २-११७-१९_END
BEGIN_
Saluting the irreproachable ascetic the rejoiced Seetha with joined palms enquired
about he well-being._END

B_2_C_117_15
BEGIN_
ततः सीताम् महा भागाम् दृष्ट्वा ताम् धर्म चारिणीम् |
सान्त्वयन्त्य् अब्रवीद्द् हृष्टा दिष्ट्या धर्मम् अवेक्षसे || २-११७-२०_END
BEGIN_
Then, comforting that celebrated Seetha, engaged in righteous acts, Anasuya
rejoicingly spoke as follows: "Luckily enough, you are attending to righteousness."_END

B_2_C_117_16
BEGIN_
त्यक्त्वा ज्नाति जनम् सीते मानम् ऋद्धिम् च मानिनि |
अवरुद्धम् वने रामम् दिष्ट्या त्वम् अनुगग्च्छसि || २-११७-२१_END
BEGIN_
"O, Seetha the beautiful lady! Thank heaven! Leaving your relatives, honour and
prosperity, you are accompanying Rama, who is expelled into a forest."_END

B_2_C_117_17
BEGIN_
नगरस्थो वनस्थो वा पापो वा यदि वा अशुभः |
यासाम् स्त्रीणाम् प्रियो भर्ता तासाम् लोका महा उदयाः || २-११७-२२_END
BEGIN_
"Highly fortunate worlds await those women, await those women, to whom their husband
is dear no matter whether he lives in a city or in a forest; whether he is sinful or virtuous."_END

B_2_C_117_18
BEGIN_
दुह्शीलः काम वृत्तो वा धनैर् वा परिवर्जितः |
स्त्रीणाम् आर्य स्वभावानाम् परमम् दैवतम् पतिः || २-११७-२३_END
BEGIN_
"To women of noble nature, the husband is the highest deity no mater whether he is
ill-behaved or licentious or devoid of riches."_END

B_2_C_117_19
BEGIN_
न अतो विशिष्टम् पश्यामि बान्धवम् विमृशन्त्य् अहम् |
सर्वत्र योग्यम् वैदेहि तपः कृतम् इव अव्ययम् || २-११७-२४_END
BEGIN_
"O, Seetha! On a reflection, I perceive none who is a better friend than a husband,
who protects his wife in all circumstances, like the imperishable fruit of one's austerities."_END

B_2_C_117_20
BEGIN_
न तु एवम् अवगग्च्छन्ति गुण दोषम् असत् स्त्रियः |
काम वक्तव्य हृदया भर्तृ नाथाः चरन्ति याः || २-११७-२५_END
BEGIN_
"Those evil women, whose hearts follow their passions and conduct themselves
dominating their husband, having no understanding of virtue and vice, do not follow him in the
aforesaid manner."_END

B_2_C_117_21
BEGIN_
प्राप्नुवन्त्य् अयशः चैव धर्म भ्रंशम् च मैथिलि |
अकार्य वशम् आपन्नाः स्त्रियो याः खलु तद् विधाः || २-११७-२६_END
BEGIN_
"O, Seetha! Surely, those evil women, who get into an improper act of authority over
their husbands reap infamy and decline in righteousness."_END

B_2_C_117_22
BEGIN_
त्वद् विधाः तु गुणैर् युक्ता दृष्ट लोक पर अवराः |
स्त्रियः स्वर्गे चरिष्यन्ति यथा पुण्य कृतः तथा || २-११७-२७_END
BEGIN_
"Women, like you, on the other hand who are endowed with virtues, who look with
detachment on prosperity and adversity in this world, therefore dwell in heaven as those who
performed meritorious deeds."_END

B_2_C_117_23
BEGIN_
तदेवमेनम् त्वमनुच्रता सती |
पतिव्रतानाम् समयानुवर्तिनी |
भव स्वभर्तुः सहधर्मचारिणी |
यश्श्च धर्मम् च ततः समाप्स्यसि || २-११७-२८_END
BEGIN_
"Thus devoted to your lord, loyal to your husband, following established rules, you
become an honest wife to your husband and obtain merit and renown."_END

B_2_C_118_0
BEGIN_
सा तु एवम् उक्ता वैदेही अनसूयान् असूयया |
प्रतिपूज्य वचो मन्दम् प्रवक्तुम् उपचक्रमे || २-११८-१_END
BEGIN_
Anasuya having spoken thus, Seetha without any jealousy, full of reverence for her,
addressed her gently as follows:_END

B_2_C_118_1
BEGIN_
न एतद् आश्चर्यम् आर्याया यन् माम् त्वम् अनुभाषसे |
विदितम् तु मम अप्य् एतद् यथा नार्याः पतिर् गुरुः || २-११८-२_END
BEGIN_
"It is not a surprise that a venerable woman like a you, talk to me like this, for,
I know well that a husband is a respectable person for a woman."_END

B_2_C_118_2
BEGIN_
यद्य् अप्य् एष भवेद् भर्ता मम आर्ये वृत्त वर्जितः |
अद्वैधम् उपवर्तव्यः तथा अप्य् एष मया भवेत् || २-११८-३_END
BEGIN_
"O, venerable woman! Even if my husband be without fortune, he should unhesitatingly
be obeyed by me."_END

B_2_C_118_3
BEGIN_
किम् पुनर् यो गुण श्लाघ्यः सानुक्रोशो जित इन्द्रियः |
स्थिर अनुरागो धर्म आत्मा मातृ वर्ती पितृ प्रियः || २-११८-४_END
BEGIN_
"How much more, if he be renowned for his virtues, compassionate, master of my
heart, who is ever affectionate, a religious person, manifests the tenderness of a mother and a
father to me."_END

B_2_C_118_4
BEGIN_
याम् वृत्तिम् वर्तते रामः कौसल्यायाम् महा बलः |
ताम् एव नृप नारीणाम् अन्यासाम् अपि वर्तते || २-११८-५_END
BEGIN_
The exceedingly strong Rama bears himself to all other Queens, as he exercises his
behaviour towards his mother, Kausalya."_END

B_2_C_118_5
BEGIN_
सकृद् दृष्टासु अपि स्त्रीषु नृपेण नृप वत्सलः |
मातृवद् वर्तते वीरो मानम् उत्सृज्य धर्मवित् || २-११८-६_END
BEGIN_
"The valiant and pious Rama who is devoted to Dasartha and free from all sense of
importance treats all those women as his mothers on whom Dasaratha has even once bestowed a single
glance."_END

B_2_C_118_6
BEGIN_
आगग्च्छन्त्याः च विजनम् वनम् एवम् भय आवहम् |
समाहितम् हि मे श्वश्र्वा हृदये यत् स्थितम् महत् || २-११८-७_END
BEGIN_
"While departing for the lonely and fearful forest, my mother-in-law imparted a
great message to me, which I have inscribed in my heart."_END

B_2_C_118_7
BEGIN_
प्राणि प्रदान काले च यत् पुरा तु अग्नि सम्निधौ |
अनुशिष्टा जनन्या अस्मि वाक्यम् तद् अपि मे धृतम् || २-११८-८_END
BEGIN_
"What my mother taught me when witnessed by the fire, earlier at the time of my
marriage with Rama, I shall always remember them."_END

B_2_C_118_8
BEGIN_
नवी कृतम् तु तत् सर्वम् वाक्यैः ते धर्म चारिणि |
पति शुश्रूषणान् नार्याः तपो न अन्यद् विधीयते || २-११८-९_END
BEGIN_
"O, virtuous woman! By your words, all that is being renewed. No austerity, other
than obedience to one's husband is decreed for a woman."_END

B_2_C_118_9
BEGIN_
सावित्री पति शुश्रूषाम् कृत्वा स्वर्गे महीयते ||
तथा वृत्तिः च याता त्वम् पति शुश्रूषया दिवम् || २-११८-१०_END
BEGIN_
Savitri* is now highly honoured in heaven, for having served her lord faithfully
heaven, You too, having followed this, will proceed to heaven, in showing obedience to your
husband."_END

B_2_C_118_10
BEGIN_
वरिष्ठा सर्व नारीणाम् एषा च दिवि देवता |
रोहिणी च विना चन्द्रम् मुहूर्तम् अपि दृश्यते || २-११८-११_END
BEGIN_
"This goddess Rohini, the excellent among all women, is not seen without the moon
even for a single moment in the sky."_END

B_2_C_118_11
BEGIN_
एवम् विधाः च प्रवराः स्त्रियो भर्तृ दृढ व्रताः |
देव लोके महीयन्ते पुण्येन स्वेन कर्मणा || २-११८-१२_END
BEGIN_
"Such excellent women, devoted to their husbands, and by their meritorious deeds,
are highly honoured in heaven."_END

B_2_C_118_12
BEGIN_
ततो अनसूया सम्हृष्टा श्रुत्वा उक्तम् सीतया वचः |
शिरस्य् आघ्राय च उवाच मैथिलीम् हर्षयन्त्य् उत || २-११८-१३_END
BEGIN_
Hearing the words of Seetha, Anasuya was very much pleased, kissed on Seetha's
forehead and spoke delightfully (as follows)_END

B_2_C_118_13
BEGIN_
नियमैर् विविधैर् आप्तम् तपो हि महद् अस्ति मे |
तत् संश्रित्य बलम् सीते चन्दये त्वाम् शुचि व्रते || २-११८-१४_END
BEGIN_
"O, Seetha with a bright smile! There is a great merit acquired by me in virtue of
my various pious observances. Through that power, I wish to confer a boon on you."_END

B_2_C_118_14
BEGIN_
उपपन्नम् च युक्तम् च वचनम् तव मैथिलि |
प्रीता च अस्म्य् उचितम् किम् ते करवाणि ब्रवीह्यहम् || २-११८-१५_END
BEGIN_
"O, Seetha! Your words are suitable for the occasion and are charming too. I am
satisfied. Tell me what good I may do for you."_END

B_2_C_118_15
BEGIN_
तस्यास्तद्वचनम् श्रुत्वा विस्मिता मन्दविस्मया |
कृतम् इत्य् अब्रवीत् सीता तपो बल समन्विताम् || २-११८-१६_END
BEGIN_
Hearing those words of Anasuya, Seetha was surprised and with a gentle smile spoke
to her, who was richly endowed with the power of askesis, saying; "Everything stands fulfilled (by
your grace)._END

B_2_C_118_16
BEGIN_
सा तु एवम् उक्ता धर्मज्ना तया प्रीततरा अभवत् |
सफलम् च प्रहर्षम् ते हन्त सीते करोम्यहम् || २-११८-१७_END
BEGIN_
Thus spoken by Seetha, the pious-minded Anasuya became more delighted and said: "O,
Seetha! Alas! I will create a great joy for you, which will be to your advantage."_END

B_2_C_118_17
BEGIN_
इदम् दिव्यम् वरम् माल्यम् वस्त्रम् आभरणानि च |
अन्ग रागम् च वैदेहि महा अर्हम् अनुलेपनम् || २-११८-१८
मया दत्तम् इदम् सीते तव गात्राणि शोभयेत् |
अनुरूपम् असम्क्लिष्टम् नित्यम् एव भविष्यति || २-११८-१९_END
BEGIN_
"O, Seetha, the daughter of Videha kingdom! Here are divine gifts: a garland, an
apparel, jewels, a scented cosmetic and rare body-cream. These are all given by me to adorn your
limbs. They will be ever worthy of your and will remain in tact (even after constant use)."_END

B_2_C_118_18
BEGIN_
अन्ग रागेण दिव्येन लिप्त अन्गी जनक आत्मजे |
शोभयिष्यामि भर्तारम् यथा श्रीर् विष्णुम् अव्ययम् || २-११८-२०_END
BEGIN_
"O, Seetha! Your body, anointed with these heavenly cosmetics, will cause your
husband to look beautiful, as Lakshmi (the goddess of fortune and beauty) does the imperishable
Vishnu (the Lord of Preservation)."_END

B_2_C_118_19
BEGIN_
सा वस्त्रम् अन्ग रागम् च भूषणानि स्रजः तथा |
मैथिली प्रतिजग्राह प्रीति दानम् अनुत्तमम् || २-११८-२१_END
BEGIN_
Seetha accepted the apparel, the scented cosmetic, the jewels and the garlands as
unsurpassed gifts of love._END

B_2_C_118_20
BEGIN_
प्रतिगृह्य च तत् सीता प्रीति दानम् यशस्विनी |
श्लिष्ट अन्जलि पुटा धीरा समुपास्त तपो धनाम् || २-११८-२२_END
BEGIN_
Having accepted those gifts of love, the illustrious Seetha with joined palms, sat
near that female ascetic._END

B_2_C_118_21
BEGIN_
तथा सीताम् उपासीनाम् अनसूया दृढ व्रता |
वचनम् प्रष्टुम् आरेभे कांचिद् त्प्रियाम् कथामनु || २-११८-२३_END
BEGIN_
To inquire about a lovely tale of once upon a time, Anasuya who was firm in
austerity, started asking the following words to Seetha who was sitting near her in that
manner._END

B_2_C_118_22
BEGIN_
स्वयम् वरे किल प्राप्ता त्वम् अनेन यशस्विना |
राघवेण इति मे सीते कथा श्रुतिम् उपागता || २-११८-२४_END
BEGIN_
"O, Seetha! It is so said that you were won by the illustrious Rama through a
process of your self-choosing (svayamvara)*. This report has reached my ear."_END

B_2_C_118_23
BEGIN_
ताम् कथाम् श्रोतुम् इग्च्छामि विस्तरेण च मैथिलि |
यथा अनुभूतम् कार्त्स्न्येन तन् मे त्वम् वक्तुम् अर्हसि || २-११८-२५_END
BEGIN_
"O, Seetha! I wish to hear that narrative in detail. Hence, tell me that tale in
full as you experienced it."_END

B_2_C_118_24
BEGIN_
एवम् उक्ता तु सा सीता ताम् ततो धर्म चारिणीम् |
श्रूयताम् इति च उक्त्वा वै कथयाम् आस ताम् कथाम् || २-११८-२६_END
BEGIN_
Then, Seetha obediently answered, saying "Hear me" and began to truly narrate that
tale of Svayamvara to the virtuous woman, Anasuya."_END

B_2_C_118_25
BEGIN_
मिथिला अधिपतिर् वीरो जनको नाम धर्मवित् |
क्षत्र धर्मण्य् अभिरतो न्यायतः शास्ति मेदिनीम् || २-११८-२७_END
BEGIN_
"A king of Mithila kingdom, named Janaka who was valiant and a knower of
righteousness, was devoted to the duty of his warrior class and was ruling the earth in a fitting
manner."_END

B_2_C_118_26
BEGIN_
तस्य लान्गल हस्तस्य कर्षतः क्षेत्र मण्डलम् |
अहम् किल उत्थिता भित्त्वा जगतीम् नृपतेः सुता || २-११८-२८_END
BEGIN_
"While he was furrowing a territory of land, holding a plough in his hand, it is so
said that I came forth, splitting up the land, as a daughter of that king."_END

B_2_C_118_27
BEGIN_
स माम् दृष्ट्वा नर पतिर् मुष्टि विक्षेप तत् परः |
पांशु गुण्ठित सर्व अन्गीम् विस्मितो जनको अभवत् || २-११८-२९_END
BEGIN_
"The king Janaka, who was absorbed in scattering handfuls of seeds was surprised to
see me, with all my limbs covered with dust."_END

B_2_C_118_28
BEGIN_
अनपत्येन च स्नेहाद् अन्कम् आरोप्य च स्वयम् |
मम इयम् तनया इत्य् उक्त्वा स्नेहो मयि निपातितः || २-११८-३०_END
BEGIN_
"Placing me personally in his lap with affection, that childless king Janaka called
one as his daughter, and was very fond of me since then."_END

B_2_C_118_29
BEGIN_
अन्तरिक्षे च वाग् उक्ता अप्रतिमा मानुषी किल |
एवम् एतन् नर पते धर्मेण तनया तव || २-११८-३१_END
BEGIN_
"It is said that voice resembling that of a human being in the air above me rang
out, saying": "O, King! Let it be so. This divine child without a match is a daughter to you,
rightly."_END

B_2_C_118_30
BEGIN_
ततः प्रहृष्टो धर्म आत्मा पिता मे मिथिला अधिपः |
अवाप्तो विपुलाम् ऋद्धिम् माम् अवाप्य नर अधिपः || २-११८-३२_END
BEGIN_
"Thereafter, my father the pious mind the lord of men and the king of Mithila
kingdom was rejoiced in my possession and acquired extensive property."_END

B_2_C_118_31
BEGIN_
दत्त्वा च अस्मि इष्टवद् देव्यै ज्येष्ठायै पुण्य कर्मणा |
तया सम्भाविता च अस्मि स्निग्धया मातृ सौहृदात् || २-११८-३३_END
BEGIN_
"That king performing auspicious acts gave me into the care of the chief Queen. She
nourished me fondly and with maternal affection."_END

B_2_C_118_32
BEGIN_
पति सम्योग सुलभम् वयो दृष्ट्वा तु मे पिता |
चिन्ताम् अभ्यगमद् दीनो वित्त नाशाद् इव अधनः || २-११८-३४_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing my age to be such, when union with a husband can be easily had, my father
fell a prey to anxiety like an indigent man, feeling miserable by the loss of all his
possessions."_END

B_2_C_118_33
BEGIN_
सदृशाच् च अपकृष्टाच् च लोके कन्या पिता जनात् |
प्रधर्षणाम् अवाप्नोति शक्रेण अपि समो भुवि || २-११८-३५_END
BEGIN_
"Eventhough the father of an unmarried girl be like Indra himself on earth, suffers
indignity in the world from the suitor's men, no matter whether they are equal or inferior to
him."_END

B_2_C_118_34
BEGIN_
ताम् धर्षणाम् अदूरस्थाम् संदृश्य आत्मनि पार्थिवः |
चिन्न्ता अर्णव गतः पारम् न आससाद अप्लवो यथ || २-११८-३६_END
BEGIN_
"Perceiving that ill-treatment threatening him at no distant date, the king Janaka
was plunged into an ocean of anxiety and did not reach its end any more than a man without a bark
would reach the end of a sea."_END

B_2_C_118_35
BEGIN_
अयोनिजाम् हि माम् ज्नात्वा न अध्यगग्च्छत् स चिन्तयन् |
सदृशम् च अनुरूपम् च मही पालः पतिम् मम || २-११८-३७_END
BEGIN_
"Knowing me to be the one not emerged from a mother's womb, the king after a deep
reflection, was unable to find a suitable and worthy husband for me."_END

B_2_C_118_36
BEGIN_
तस्य बुद्धिर् इयम् जाता चिन्तयानस्य सम्ततम् |
स्वयम् वरम् तनूजायाः करिष्यामि इति धीमतः || २-११८-३८_END
BEGIN_
"After reflecting thus deeply, the thought came to him, 'I shall inaugurate a
