Svayamvara, a process of self-choosing marriage, for my daughter."_END

B_2_C_118_37
BEGIN_
महा यज्ने तदा तस्य वरुणेन महात्मना |
दत्तम् धनुर् वरम् प्रीत्या तूणी च अक्षय्य सायकौ || २-११८-३९_END
BEGIN_
"In ancient days, Janaka received with affection from Varuna the rain-god, an
excellent bow with two quivers that should never lack arrows."_END

B_2_C_118_38
BEGIN_
असंचाल्यम् मनुष्यैः च यत्नेन अपि च गौरवात् |
तन् न शक्ता नमयितुम् स्वप्नेषु अपि नर अधिपाः || २-११८-४०_END
BEGIN_
"That bow was so heavy in weight that no man could lift it up nor any of the kings
were bale to bend it even in their dreams."_END

B_2_C_118_39
BEGIN_
तद् धनुः प्राप्य मे पित्रा व्याहृतम् सत्य वादिना |
समवाये नर इन्द्राणाम् पूर्वम् आमन्त्र्य पार्थिवान् || २-११८-४१_END
BEGIN_
"My truthful father called all the princes first and informed them in a meeting
about the bow to be lifted."_END

B_2_C_118_40
BEGIN_
इदम् च धनुर् उद्यम्य सज्यम् यः कुरुते नरः |
तस्य मे दुहिता भार्या भविष्यति न संशयः || २-११८-४२_END
BEGIN_
"Whoever is able to lift up and string this bow, I will bestow my daughter in
marriage on him. There is no doubt about it."_END

B_2_C_118_41
BEGIN_
तच् च दृष्ट्वा धनुः श्रेष्ठम् गौरवाद् गिरि सम्निभम् |
अभिवाद्य नृपा जग्मुर् अशक्ताः तस्य तोलने || २-११८-४३_END
BEGIN_
"Seeing that excellent bow, resembling a mountain in weight, and being unable to
lift it up, the princes offered salutation to it and went away."_END

B_2_C_118_42
BEGIN_
सुदीर्घस्य तु कालस्य राघवो अयम् महा द्युतिः |
विश्वामित्रेण सहितो यज्नम् द्रष्टुम् समागतः || २-११८-४४
लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा रामः सत्य पराक्रमः |_END
BEGIN_
"After a very long time, this Rama born in Raghu dynasty with a great splendour
possessing a true valour, along with his brother Lakshmana together with a sage Visvamitra, came to
witness a sacrifice."_END

B_2_C_118_43
BEGIN_
विश्वामित्रः तु धर्म आत्मा मम पित्रा सुपूजितः || २-११८-४५
प्रोवाच पितरम् तत्र राघवो राम लक्ष्मणौ |_END
BEGIN_
"The pious-souled Visvamitra, having been received well by my father said to my
father, (as follows):_END

B_2_C_118_44
BEGIN_
सुतौ दशरथस्य इमौ धनुर् दर्शन कान्क्षिणौ || २-११८-४६
धनुर्दर्शय रामाय राजपुत्राय दैविकम् |_END
BEGIN_
"These two boys, the sons of Dasaratha wish to see that bow. Show that bow, coming
from gods, to Rama the prince."_END

B_2_C_118_45
BEGIN_
इत्य् उक्तः तेन विप्रेण तद् धनुः समुपानयत् || २-११८-४७
निमेष अन्तर मात्रेण तद् आनम्य स वीर्यवान् |
ज्याम् समारोप्य झटिति पूरयाम् आस वीर्यवान् || २-११८-४८_END
BEGIN_
"Hearing the words of Vivamitra, Janaka caused the bow to be brought there. The
mighty and the valiant Rama bent that bow merely within an instant and immediately stringed the bow
with the bow-cord and drew the bow to the full."_END

B_2_C_118_46
BEGIN_
तेन पूरयता वेगान् मध्ये भग्नम् द्विधा धनुः |
तस्य शब्दो अभवद् भीमः पतितस्य अशनेर् इव || २-११८-४९_END
BEGIN_
"While Rama was drawing the bow to the full, the bow was broken into two in the
middle due to the resultant jerk. The terrific sound then created was like that of a falling
thunderbolt."_END

B_2_C_118_47
BEGIN_
ततो अहम् तत्र रामाय पित्रा सत्य अभिसंधिना |
उद्यता दातुम् उद्यम्य जल भाजनम् उत्तमम् || २-११८-५०_END
BEGIN_
"Then and there, my father true to his promise decided to bestow me on Rama,
offering him a jar of pure water."_END

B_2_C_118_48
BEGIN_
दीयमानाम् न तु तदा प्रतिजग्राह राघवः |
अविज्नाय पितुः चन्दम् अयोध्या अधिपतेः प्रभोः || २-११८-५१_END
BEGIN_
"But Rama did not consent to accept my hand till the will of his father, the Lord
and the king of Ayodhya had been made known to him."_END

B_2_C_118_49
BEGIN_
ततः श्वशुरम् आमन्त्र्य वृद्धम् दशरथम् नृपम् |
मम पित्रा अहम् दत्ता रामाय विदित आत्मने || २-११८-५२_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, my father-in-law and the aged Dasaratha was invited to Mithila by my
father and with his approval, I was bestowed on Rama, the knower of the self."_END

B_2_C_118_50
BEGIN_
मम चैव अनुजा साध्वी ऊर्मिला प्रिय दर्शना |
भार्य अर्थे लक्ष्मणस्य अपि दत्ता पित्रा मम स्वयम् || २-११८-५३_END
BEGIN_
"My younger sister Urmila, the virtuous lady of lovely looks was given as a consort
to Lakshmana by my father himself."_END

B_2_C_118_51
BEGIN_
एवम् दत्ता अस्मि रामाय तदा तस्मिन् स्वयम् वरे |
अनुरक्ता च धर्मेण पतिम् वीर्यवताम् वरम् || २-११८-५४_END
BEGIN_
"I was given thus to Rama in that Svayamvara, a process of self-choosing marriage. I
became devoted, by my good works, to my husband who is excellent among men of strength."_END

B_2_C_119_0
BEGIN_
अनसूया तु धर्मज्ना श्रुत्वा ताम् महतीम् कथाम् |
पर्यष्वजत बाहुभ्याम् शिरस्य् आघ्राय मैथिलीम् || २-११९-१_END
BEGIN_
Hearing that great story, Anasuya the knower of piety kissed Seetha's forehead and
hugged her in her arms._END

B_2_C_119_1
BEGIN_
व्यक्त अक्षर पदम् चित्रम् भाषितम् मधुरम् त्वया |
यथा स्वयम् वरम् वृत्तम् तत् सर्वम् हि श्रुतम् मया || २-११९-२
रमे अहम् कथया ते तु दृष्ढम् मधुर भाषिणि |_END
BEGIN_
"It was narrated sweetly and amazingly by you, in clear words and syllables. It has
been indeed heard by me how all that Svayamvara, the process of self-choosing marriage took place.
O, the sweet speaking Seetha! I am overjoyed by hearing your story."_END

B_2_C_119_2
BEGIN_
रविर् अस्तम् गतः श्रीमान् उपोह्य रजनीम् शिवाम् || २-११९-३
दिवसम् प्रति कीर्णानाम् आहार अर्थम् पतत्रिणाम् |
संध्या काले निलीनानाम् निद्रा अर्थम् श्रूयते ध्वनिः ||२-११९-४_END
BEGIN_
"O, Fortunate One! While the auspicious night drawing near, the sun has sunk below
horizon. The twittering of the birds can be heard, who, through the day, have sought their
nourishment far and wide and are seeking their shelter for sleep at the time of
evening-twilight."_END

B_2_C_119_3
BEGIN_
एते च अप्य् अभिषेक आर्द्रा मुनयः फल शोधनाः |
सहिता उपवर्तन्ते सलिल आप्लुत वल्कलाः || २-११९-५_END
BEGIN_
"These ascetics too are returning together, their bark-robes drenched from bathing,
and with uplifted vessels, wet with sprinkled water on them."_END

B_2_C_119_4
BEGIN_
ऋषीणाम् अग्नि होत्रेषु हुतेषु विधि पुर्वकम् |
कपोत अन्ग अरुणो धूमो दृश्यते पवन उद्धतः || २-११९-६_END
BEGIN_
"From the sacred fire kindled by the sages, according to the scriptural ordinance, a
column of smoke with the hue of a Pigeon's neck, raised by the wind, is seen there."_END

B_2_C_119_5
BEGIN_
अल्प पर्णा हि तरवो घनी भूताः समन्ततः |
विप्रकृष्टे अपि ये देशे न प्रकाशन्ति वै दिशः || २-११९-७_END
BEGIN_
"Thought their foliage is sparse, the trees look dense all around. The quarters of
the world, by whom the senses are drawn apart, do not shine brilliantly at this place."_END

B_2_C_119_6
BEGIN_
रजनी रस सत्त्वानि प्रचरन्ति समन्ततः |
तपो वन मृगा ह्य् एते वेदि तीर्थेषु शेरते || २-११९-८_END
BEGIN_
"The animals who wander about at night are ranging everywhere. The deer of the
hermitage are sleeping round the sacred altars."_END

B_2_C_119_7
BEGIN_
सम्प्रवृत्ता निशा सीते नक्षत्र समलम्कृता |
ज्योत्स्ना प्रावरणः चन्द्रो दृश्यते अभ्युदितो अम्बरे || २-११९-९_END
BEGIN_
"O, Seetha! The night richly adorned with stars has set well in motion. The moon
encircled with light is seen rising in the sky."_END

B_2_C_119_8
BEGIN_
गम्यताम् अनुजानामि रामस्य अनुचरी भव |
कथयन्त्या हि मधुरम् त्वया अहम् परितोषिता || २-११९-१०_END
BEGIN_
"Go now. I give you leave. Be a female companion to Rama. Your sweet conversation
has charmed me."_END

B_2_C_119_9
BEGIN_
अलम्कुरु च तावत् त्वम् प्रत्यक्षम् मम मैथिलि |
प्रीतिम् जनय मे वत्स दिव्य अलम्काल शोभिनी || २-११९-११_END
BEGIN_
"O, Seetha! O, Dear child! Adorn (with ornaments and apparel gifted by me_ before my
eyes and cause delight to me in embellishing yourself with heavenly jewels."_END

B_2_C_119_10
BEGIN_
सा तदा समलम्कृत्य सीता सुर सुत उपमा |
प्रणम्य शिरसा तस्यै रामम् तु अभिमुखी ययौ || २-११९-१२_END
BEGIN_
Then Seetha, adorning herself, resembled the daughter of a god, and making obeisance
to the feet of Anasuya, she went forward to meet Rama._END

B_2_C_119_11
BEGIN_
तथा तु भूषिताम् सीताम् ददर्श वदताम् वरः |
राघवः प्रीति दानेन तपस्विन्या जहर्ष च || २-११९-१३_END
BEGIN_
Rama, the most eloquent one, saw Seetha adorned as aforesaid and felt delighted over
the charming gifts of the ascetic._END

B_2_C_119_12
BEGIN_
न्यवेदयत् ततः सर्वम् सीता रामाय मैथिली |
प्रीति दानम् तपस्विन्या वसन आभरण स्रजाम् || २-११९-१४_END
BEGIN_
Seetha, the daughter of Mithila kingdom then showed to Rama all the apparel, jewels
and garlands the affectionate gifts of Anasuya the hermitess._END

B_2_C_119_13
BEGIN_
प्रहृष्टः तु अभवद् रामो लक्ष्मणः च महा रथः |
मैथिल्याः सत्क्रियाम् दृष्ट्वा मानुषेषु सुदुर्लभाम् || २-११९-१५_END
BEGIN_
Seeing the respectful treatment, received by Seetha, which was very rare among human
beings, Rama and Lakshmana the great car-warrior felt highly rejoiced._END

B_2_C_119_14
BEGIN_
ततः ताम् सर्वरीम् प्रीतः पुण्याम् शशि निभ आननः |
अर्चितः तापसैः सिद्धैर् उवास रघु नन्दनः || २-११९-१६_END
BEGIN_
Thereupon, Rama with his face resembling the moon, having been honoured by the holy
ascetics, was delighted and spent that auspicious night there._END

B_2_C_119_15
BEGIN_
तस्याम् रात्र्याम् व्यतीतायाम् अभिषिच्य हुत अग्निकान् |
आपृग्च्छेताम् नर व्याघ्रौ तापसान् वन गोचरान् || २-११९-१७_END
BEGIN_
While that night passed away, Rama and Lakshmana the tigers among men finished their
ablutions and took leave of the ascetics dwelling the forest, who had just poured oblations into
the sacred fire._END

B_2_C_119_16
BEGIN_
ताउ ऊचुः ते वन चराः तापसा धर्म चारिणः |
वनस्य तस्य संचारम् राक्षसैः समभिप्लुतम् || २-११९-१८_END
BEGIN_
Those ascetics dwelling in the forest and practising virtue told Rama and Lakshmana
about the region of that forest, which was infested with demons (as follows):_END

B_2_C_119_17
BEGIN_
रक्षांसि पुरुषादानि नानारूपाणि राघव! |
वसन्त्यस्मिन् महारण्ये व्याळाश्चश्च रुधिराशनाः || २-११९-१९_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! Various forms of man-eating demons and beasts drinking the blood are
living in this great forest."_END

B_2_C_119_18
BEGIN_
उच्चिष्टम् वा प्रमत्तम् वा तापसम् धर्मचारिणम् |
अदन्त्यस्मिन् महारण्ये तान्निवारय राघवः || २-११९-२०_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! They devour an ascetic or a celibate, who has not rinsed his mouth after
finishing his meal or who is inattentive in this great forest. (Pray ward them off!"_END

B_2_C_119_19
BEGIN_
एष पन्था महर्षीणाम् फलान्य् आहरताम् वने |
अनेन तु वनम् दुर्गम् गन्तुम् राघव ते क्षमम् || २-११९-२१_END
BEGIN_
"O, Rama! Here is the path of the great sages, through which they fetch the fruits
in this forest. It is appropriate for you to go by this path in this dangerous forest."_END

B_2_C_119_20
BEGIN_
इति इव तैः प्रान्जलिभिः तपस्विभिर्
र्द्विजैः कृत स्वस्त्ययनः परम् तपः |
वनम् सभार्यः प्रविवेश राघवः |
सलक्ष्मणः सूर्य इव अभ्र मण्डलम् || २-११९-२२_END
BEGIN_
Thus addressed by those Brahmanas having great asceticism, who, with joined palms
paid obedience to him and blessed his journey, Rama the harasser of his foes entered the forest
with his consort along with Lakshmana, as sun enters a mass of clouds._END
